xdxf.ar: a (ad) (general sense) to. indicating that toward which there is movment, tendency, or position, with or without arrival; opposed to from (de, ek); (cf. vers, til); il iris a la kirko he went to (the) church; il venas de Paris a London he is on his way from Paris to London; la hundo jetis su a la kato the dog sprang at the cat; del (de la) esto al (ad la) westo from (the) east to (the) west; de tempo a tempo from time to time; de un dio a l'altra from one day to another, from day to day; de la supro a l'infro from top to bottom; (dative: indirect object) donez a me la bastono give me the stick; il parolis ad el he spoke to her. (object of action, thought, desire) il elevas su a la richeso e a la honori he is rising to weather and honors; atencema a la diskurso, attentive to the discourse; surda a la ditresokrii deaf to the cries of distress; amo a Deo love to God;me deziras a vu omna feliceso I wish you all happiness. (comparison or relation) agreabla a la gusto agreeable to the taste;ca okupo konvenas ad il this occupation suits him; (proportion; total) tri raportas a non quale du a sis three is to nine as two is to six; evaluar lua revenuo a 10.000 franki; taxar ol a 400 franki to estimate his income as (amounting to) 10,000 francs; to tax it at (at the rate of, a total of) 400 francs. Note: Ad is often joined to other prepositions, to verbal roots, adverbs, particularly to add the idea of motion.
abad(ul)o abbot; abadino abbess; abadeyo abbey; abadeso abbotship; abadala, abadeyala abbatial.
abako* (math., arch.) abacus.

abandonar (tr.) to abandon, (wholly) give up, (totally) relinquish, forego, forsake. Ex.: Abandonar navo, domo, projeto, infanto. Abandonar su a desespero, a joyo. Ant.: gardar, retenar. V. exp.: Livar urbo, portuo, domo, persono ... esas simple forirar de ol sen ula sentimental impliko. Abandonar persono, ofico, posteno, esas sive lasar li, nevolunte o kontrevole, sive violacante ula devo (abandonar infanti, parenti). Retretar esas retromarchar: la senco primitiva e propra esas militala; senci figurala e derivta: livar la mondo (religiala retreto), funciono od agado (retreto di oficisto, komercisto, e.c.); II

abasar (tr.) to lower: let down to a lower level; (fig.) to abase (morally), debase; abasez la tirani down with the tyrants; abasez la manui hands off!; abasez la chapeli hats off! Ex.: Abasar la kapo, la brakio, la manuo; abasar levero, standardo, espado, fusilo, velo; omno to signifikas pozar (plu) infre. En la figurala senco, on abasas persono, reduktante lu ad infra rango, kondiciono, e.c.; on abasas su, prenante infra rango, humila posturo, e.c.; IV
abatar (tr., phys. sense) to knock, beat, strike down, fell; abatajaro (fort.) abatis. Ex.: Abatar arboro, domo, muro, persono
abatiso (of fowl, game) refuse parts, as head, feet, wings, skin, etc.; small edible parts, as giblets. Def.: Mikra parti di pultro, anke di leporo; VII
abceso (med.) abscess; abceseskar to become or turn to an a. Def.: Pusoza kavajo en la korpo.
abciso* (geom.) abscissa.

abdikar (tr.) to abdicate. V. exp.: Abdikar dicesas precipue pri la reji o suvereni, qui cesas regnar por transmisar la povo a sucedanto, sive naturala, sive selektata; abdikar ne esas simple demisionar, ma demisionar por ulu, do facante ankore ago di suvereneso; IV-100. Vid. abnegar, renuncar, rezignar.
abdomino abdomen. V. exp.: Abdomino esas ciencala vorto, plu preciza kam ventro IV-512.
abduktar (tr., physiol.) to abduct. Note: Not abduct: to kidnap; cf. raptar.
abelo bee; abeleyo apiary; abeluyo beehive; abelino female or queen-bee; abelulo drone-bee; abeledukado bee-culture; edukisto bee-master.
aberaco (astr., opt.) aberration; aberacar (intr.) to be aberrant.
abieto (bot.) fir-, spruce-tree (genus: Abies).
abismo (also fig.) abyss.
abjekta (morally) abject, mean; abjekteso, abjectness (quality); abjektajo a. act. Def.: Qua esas di extrema grado di etikala abaseso. Ex.: Persono, sentimenti abjekta. Ant.: nobla.
abjurar (tr.) to abjure. Def.: Renuncar publike e solene. Ex.: Abjurar religio, doktrino, opiniono.
ablaciono (surg.) ablation; ablacionar to ablate: to remove by surgical operation. Ex.: Ablaciono di membro, di tumoro.
ablaktar (tr.) to wean; ablakt(ad)o, ablakteso (act, state) weaning, ablactation. Def.: Deskustumigar (infanto) de l'alaktado; IV-512, 600.
ablativo (gram.) ablative (-case).
ablegato* (eccl.) ablegate.
ableto (ich.) ablet, bleak (Alburnus lucidus).
ablucionar (tr., relig., med.) to purify by washing; abluciono ablution. Def.: Lavar parto di la korpo segun medicinal (o religiala) preskripti; IV-515.

abnegar (tr.) to abnegate, deny one-self; abnego, abnegeso abnegation, self-denial. V. exp.: Abnegar esas renuncar omna profito, personal interesto o mem plezuro, por konsakrar su ad altru or ad ula sociala religiala verko. Abnegar esas propre renuncar su ipsa t.e. sua propra feliceso; IV-101; vid. renuncar, abdikar, rezignar.

abolisar (tr.) to abolish; abolisismo abolitionism; abolisismano abolitionist. V. exp.: Abolisar, abrogar, supresar: Supresar esas la generala vorto, la du altra esas specala e teknikal termini. On abrogas lego per altra lego, dekreto per altra dekreto, qua nuligas l'antea. On abolisas institucuro o kustumo (ex. rejeso, privileji, sklaveso); II-649.
abominar (tr.) to abominate, abhor, loathe, detest (cf. odiegar, hororar); abominajo an abominable act or object; abomininda abominable, detestable, execrable.
abonar (tr.) to subscribe for or to (a periodical) igarar to cause (ulu) to subscribe to (ulo); abono subscription (to a journal); abonopreco cost of subscription; abonanto, aboninto subscriber.

abordar (tr.) to land on a (shore, a wharf, etc.); to board (a ship, a vehicle); (fig.) to go alongside, come up close to. Def.: Irar sur ulo o, per extenso, venar flanke ad, bordo an bordo kun ulo (por irar sur ol). L’etimologiala senco esas: irar a (sur) la bordo di ulo. Ex.: La Portugalani esis le unesma qui abordis la literi di India. Abordar la navo dil enemiko. La navo abordas (ad, an) la warfo. La pasajanti abordas sur la warfo.

aborijena, aborijenoaboriginal, autochthon. V.exp.: Aborijeno, indijeno Indijeno signifikas simple la populo (raso) qua habitas la lando «de l’origino» (historiala). Ex. Omna Amerikani qui naskis en Amerika esas indijena, opozite a l’enmigranti ed a l’Europani (mem samlingua e samrasa), ma nur l’Indiani e simila rasi esas aborijena; IV-512-3.

abortar(intr.) to abort, miscarry; (fig.) to come to nothing, fail; aborto miscarriage; abortala abortive; abortigarto cause a. to (ulu); abortigo miscarriage (caused); abortigiva, abortantaabortive (capable of producing and abortion); abortigivo, abortilosomething causing abortion; aborturo an abortive child or thing.
aboyar (int., also fig.) to bark, bay; aboyetar to yelp; aboyachar to give tongue falsely, snarl, bawl.
abreviar (tr.) to abbreviate (words), abridge (a book), curtail (a narrative); (cf. rezumar, kurtigar); abrevi(ad)o, abreviuroabbreviation, abridgment.
abrikoto(fruit) apricot; abrikotieroa. tree.
abrogar(tr.) to abrogate, repeal, annul. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.
abrotano(bot.) abrotanum, southernwood (Artemisia Abrotanum).
abruptaprecipitous, cragged, abrupt; (fig.) rough, broken, unpolished. Ex.: L’abrupta flanko di monto. Stilo, karaktero abrupta. V. exp.: vid. eskarpa.
absinto(bot.) absinth, wormwood; absintoliquoro absinth(e) (the liquor).

absolutaabsolute: unlimited, unrestricted; absolutajo(philos.) something unconditioned; absolutoan absolute being; absoluteabsolutely; absolutismoabsolutism; absolutistoabsolutist; ablativo absolutaablative absolute. Ex.: Povo, rejo absoluta. Absoluta neposiblajo.
absolvar(tr.) to absolve, acquit, exculpate; absolvo (rel.) absolution, (jur.) acquittal; (cf. indulgar). Def.: Deklarar senkulpa (do nepunisebla) ula akuzato; III-699. Ant.: kondamnar.

absorbar(tr.,physical sense) to absorb; (fig.) to engross (attention); absorbo, absorbesoabsorption; absorbiva, absorbanta; absorbivo, absorbilo absorbent; absorbiva paperoblotting paper; absorboputeocesspool. Ex.: Sablo absorbas aquo. Lo nigra absorbas la lumo. Absorb-esar da meditado. Vaskularo absorbiva.

abstenar(tr.) to abstain (voluntarily) from, to refrain from (ulo); absten(ad)oabstention; abstenanta, abstenemaabstemious, sober; abstenanto, absteneroabstainer; abstenemesoabstinence (habitual state); igar ar: to cause (ulu) to abstain from (ulo); absteneskar to begin to abstain; Ex.: Ne esas facila abstenar drinkar, kande on durstas. V. ex.: Abstenar, karear: Karear ne implikas «vole», ol prefere implikas «nevole» o mem «kontrevole». On abstenas kozo, quan on havas o povus havar; on kareas kozo, quan on ne havas o ne povas havar (nun). Ex.: En voyajo on mustas karear multa kozi (pro ke la kozi mankas); ma se on havus li, probable on ne abstenus li, IV-658.
abstersar*(tr., surg.) to absterge, cleanse (wounds).
abstinencar* (intr., relig.) to abstain (from meat), to practise abstinence (from pleasure), to fast (de).

abstraktar (tr.) to abstract: separate in thought, abstraktala abstract (science, question); abstraktema, abstraktata, abstraktita (of mind) preoccupied, absent-minded; abstrakturo, abstraktajo abstract idea, object.
abstruza abstruse, recondite. Del.: Desfacile komprenebla e tedanta; II-706.
absurda absurd, preposterous. Del.: Kontre la komuna raciono. Ant.: saja, racionoza.
abulio* (med.) abulia.
abundar(intr.) to abound, be plentiful (de); abundanta abundant, exuberant, luxuriant; abundeganta superabundant; -okorno horn-of-plenty, cornucopia. Ant.: esar skarsa, mankar.
abutar (intr.) to abut (ad), come out (into), end (in); (abscess) to come to a head. Def.: Tushar per un extremajo. Ex.: Omna radii di cirklo abutas al centro.
abutmento (arch.) abutment (as of a bridge).
acelerar (tr.) to accelerate, hasten, quicken. Ex.: Acelerar la pazi. Ant.: moderar, (plu)lentigar.
acendar (tr.) to light (a lamp), to kindle (a fire), to turn on (electric light); (fig.) to inflame (the passions); acendilo (instr.) lighter; acendoligno kindling. Ant.: extingar.

acensar (tr., intr) to go up, ascend, mount; acensanta ascending, rising; acenseyoplace to mount (as stair, ascent); acensilo lift, elevator, hoist; acensofesto Ascension Day; acenso rekta(astron.) right ascension. Def.: Irar ad-supere; II-136. Ex.: .Acensar (sur) kavalo, eskalero, monto. Ant.: decensar.
acentoaccent: stress of voice (not written accent, cf. supersigno); -izar; to accent, lay stress on; acentizo, acentizuro accentuation; senacenta, neacentizita: unaccented.

aceptar (tr.) to accept (something willingly, as a proposal, condition apology, challenge), to receive (a guest); acepto acception, reception, greeting; aceptebla acceptable, receivable (of guests); aceptantoacceptor (also of bills); aceptinda worth accepting; aceptodio reception-day, levee. Vu esas plezure aceptata you are welcome, Ant.: refuzar. V. exp.: recevar.
acero (bot.) maple-tree (genus: Acer)
acerba (also fig.) acerb: sour, bitter and harsh in taste (as unripe fruit); -eso: acerbity, harshness; severity. Ex.: Frukto acerba. Parolado acerba. V. exp.: vid. aspera.

acesar: (tr.) to have access to (ulu, ulo); (med.) to have an access, an attack; aceso: access, entry; (med.) attack; acesebla accessible, approachable. Ex.: Il acesas loko, persono (o havas aceso a loko, persono). Loko, persono acesebla. Aceso di febro, (fig.) aceso di iraco, furio, desespero.
acesito accesit: honorable mention accorded to a student.
acesora accessory, subsidiary; (cf. helpanta, konfirmanta, surogata); acesoro, acesorajo an accessory; (milit., ledra) accoutrement. Def.: Qua akompanas precipuajo. Ant.: esencala, precipua.
acetat(acido) acetic acid.
acetileno (chem.) acetylene; acetilenlampo a. lamp.
acetometro acetimeter.
aciano (bot.) bluebottle, cornflower, (Centaurea Cyanus).

acida acid; acetous; acideta sour, (cf. acerba, akra); (chem.) acid; acidajoan a. substance; acideso acidity; acidigar to acidify; acideskar to become a., turn sour; acidigo, acidesko acidification; acidoza, acidatra acidulous: acidizar to acidulate.

acidentar (tr.) to cause an accident to; acidento accident (generally in an ill sense), mishap; (philos.) accident; acidenta, acidentala accidental; acidentanto on who or that which causes an a. acidentito vicitim of an a.; acidentoza full of a.s; acidente accidentally, by chance. Def.: Efektigar acidento ad ulu (ulo); IV-105, VI-162. Ex.: Acidento bona o mala. La infirmaji e acidenti di la vivo homala. Kozo acidental. Deskovrar acidente ulo.
acidometro acidimeter.
acipitro (orni.) goshawk (Astur palumbarius).
acizo town or city tax on commodities, excise, octroi.
a(d) see a, ad.
adaptar (tr.) to adapt ulo ad ulo; adaptar su a. oneself; adaptesar to be adapted.
adavan, ade, ada forward (with movement). Ex.: Avane marchar.
adbase (with movement) to the bottom, (cf. ad infre). (cf. II-163.)
addextre (with movement) to the right (hand side).
addope (with movement) backwards.
addukto (anat.) adduction; adanta, adiva adducent, afferent.
aden (with movement) into. Ex.: Irar aden la gardeno. La ucelo flugis aden la kajo.
adepto adept.
adequata adequate. Ex.: Havar ideo adquata pri kozo.
adfluar (int.) to flow or run (to, into, as a river to the sea); (med.) to rush (as blood to the head); ad(ad)o afflux.
adheme (with movement) to or toward home.

adherar (intr.) to adhere (ad) stick close to, be attached; (fig.) to give adhesion (to a party, a principle); adhero adhesion, adherence; adheriva adhesive; adheremeso adherency (tendency); adheranta, adherema adherent, sticking (ad); adheranto adherer, follower; adherigar to cause to adhere, stick. Ex.: La epidermo adheras a la pelo. Donar sua adhero a projeto.
adiar (tr.) to bid adieu to (ulu), say good-bye; adio adieu; adiala vizito farewell visit.
adiabata* (thermodynamics) adiabatic.
adibe (over) there, thither, (with movement). Ex. Omnube vu iros, adibe me iros kun vu.
adicionar (tr., math.) to add: cast up (numbers, cf. adjuntar) adiciono addition. Ant.: sustracionar.
adinfre (with motion) down(ward); (cf. adsube, adbase). Ex.: Irar adinfre sur l'eskalero.
adirar (intr.) to go to, toward; to approach.
adjacar (intr.) to be adjacent; adanta adjacent: bordering upon.
adjektivo (gram.) adjective.

adjudikar (tr.) to adjudicate, adjudge: to award (ulo ad ulo) judicially in a controversy: (at auctions) to knock down to, declare to be the purchaser of; adjudiko awarding (of prizes), granting (of contracts): adjudikario person who receives the award; highest tenderer; adjudikajo what is awarded. Ex.: Adjudikar la domo a la plendanto. Adjudikar premio ad ulu.

adjuntar (tr., physical sense) to add (ulo od ulo); ado adding, subjoining, adjunction; adajo something added, an addition; adita additional. Ex.: Adjuntar plu multa sukro a siropo. Facar adjuntajo a domo. Adjuntaji a domeno. Modesteso adjuntita a merito.
adjurar (tr.) to adjure: command in the name of God, to charge solemnly. Ex.: Me adjuras vu, dicar la verajo.
adjustigar (tr.) to adjust (ulo ad ulo), to fit, to rectify, correct. Ex.: Adjustigo esas la ago igar ulo justa ad ... Talioro adjustigas vesto ad ulu. Adjustigar balanco, mezurilo.
adjutanto (milit. title) adjutant, aide-de-camp.
adlatere (with movement) sideways.
admaxime at (the) most.
adminime at (the) least.

administrar (tr.) to administer: to manage, conduct (a business, an estate, a department of government); administreyo office of a; administrantaro (collect.), administrerio (as institution) board of administration.
admirar (tr.) to admire; admirinda; worthy of admiration, admirable. Ant.: desprizar, desestimar.
admiralo (title) admiral.

admisar (tr.) to admit, to receive (ulu, ulo; cf. agnoskar); admiso, admiseso admission, admittance, affiliation; admisebla, admisinda admisable, allowable. Ex.: Admisar ulu aden domo, ulu en societo.

admonte above (i.e. further up on the same general level; not overhead, cf. super), up stream (toward the mountain, the source of the stream). Aernavo flugas trans la rivero admonte de la urbo the airship flies over (crosses) the river above (i.e. not over the city itself, but up-stream from the city). Ant.: advale.
adolecar (intr.) to be adolescent; adoleco, adoleceso, adolectempo adolescence, period of life between puberty and maturity; adolecanta adolescent; adolecanto an adolescent.

adoptar (tr.) to adopt (an opinion, a system); (jur.) to adopt (a child); (in assemblies) to agree upon, carry (a motion, resolution), to pass (a bill); adoptito an adopted child or person. Ant.: repulsar.
adosar (tr.) to set the back (di ulu, ulo) to (ulu, ulo), to put back to back; adosar su to lean one's back; adostaluso (gard.) sloping bed (backed against a wall). Def.: Apogar la dorso; II-17.
adportar (tr.) to bring: carry (ulo) to a person or place; (cf. venigar, querigar); adajo material brought. Ex.: Adportar ulo de Paris a London. Adportez a me ta libro.
adpozar (tr.) to affix: put (ulo) on (ulo); (cf. surpozar, siglizar); ado affixing; (gram.) apposition.
adraganto* (bot.) gum-tragacanth, gum-adraganth. Def.: Gumo extrakita de tragakanto. IV-644.
adsorbar (tr., tech.) to adsorb: to condense by adsorption.
adsub (with motion) under. Ex.: La kato kuris adsub la tablo.
adsur (with motion) on to. Ex.: Irar adsur agro.
adube (with motion) (toward) where, whither. Ex.: Adube vu iras?
adulta adult; adulto, adultulo, adultino an a.; adulteso a. state.
adurolo* (chem.) adurol.
advale below: further down on the same general level; (not below = under, cf. sub), down stream (toward the valley, the outlet); vid. admonte. Ant.: admonte.
advenar (intr.) to come (towards). V. exp.: vid. arivar.
advento (rel.) Advent.
adventiva* (biol.) adventitious.
adverbo (gram.) adverb; adverba; adverbala adverbial.
advere indeed, in truth, it is true, to be sure. Ex.: Advere il venis, ma il agas nulo. Il venis, advere sen instrumenti.
adversa adverse; adverso, adversulo, adversino: adversary, opponent. Ex.: Fortuno adversa. Ant.: (adverso) partenero, tederito, helpanto, defensanto.
advokar (tr.) to call, call to, hail. Ex.: Advokar la konduktoro, la guardo.
advokat(ul)oadvocate, barrister (who pleads in court); advokateso bar (profession); advokataro the bar (collect.); advokato statala prosecuting attorney; advokato konsilanta: chamber counsel.
adyunto deputy, associate: assistant (in some duty); adyunta adjunct; adyunto-profesoro assistant professor; adyunto di komonestro deputy mayor.

aeroair; aerala aerial; aerizar to air, renew the air, (chem.) aërate; aerigo, -ifo, aerizo aeration, ventilation; aerizita aired, ventilated; aeroza airy, well-ventilated; aerizilo aerator, ventilator; aerflueto draught (of air); aerodinamiko aero-dynamics; aeronavo airship (dirigible balloon; cf. aerostato); aeronavisto aëronaut; aernavig(ad)o aërial navigation, aeronautics; aerostatiko aërostatics; aeroterapio air-therapeutics; aerotimo aërophobia; en libera aero in the open air.
aerobia*(biol.) aërobic: aerobii aërobia, aërobes.
aerolitoaërolite.
aerometro*aërometer.
aerometrioaërometry.
aeroplano* aëroplane. Note Technical terms may be found in IV-330-333. DEFIRS
aeroskopo* aëroscope.
aerostato aërostat, balloon (without motive power); aerostatala aërostatic. Def.; «Balonegi» qui flotacas passive en l'aero (ne la «direktebla baloni» a qui esas rezervita la nomo: aernavo). 11-706.
aes (mus.) A flat.
afabla affable, amiable; afableso affability; -ajo amenity, courteous act. Ant.: des, neafabia, ruda, impertinenta.
atazio (med.) aphasia; ataziiko person suffering from a.

afecionar (tr.) to have an affection for, to delight in, to be fond of (ulu, ulo); afecionema, afecionoza affectionate, fond, loving; afecionata beloved, devoted, Ex.: La Polonani afecionas sua patrio. Afecionoza fratino.El afecionas sua matro.Ant.: antipatiar, odiar, abominar.

afektar (tr., psychol.) to touch (the feelings), to move (emotionally); (med.) to take effect on, to sicken; afektesar (da) to be moved, affected (by). Ex.: Lua desfeliceso afektis me. Afekteso nervala.

afektacar (tr., intr.) to pose, to make an artificial show, to pretend ostentatiously ; afektac(ad)o affectedness, affectation, mannerism; -anta, afektacema affected, pretentious, finical. Ex.; Afectacar la vertuo.Afektacar kom richulo, kom eleganto.
afelio* (astron.) aphelion.

afero (com..) business; (gen. sense) affair: matter, thing, concern, question, etc.; (leg.) cause, legal action; aferi(com.) trade, business; aferisto business-man; -agento business-agent; afero politikala political a.; aferi extera foreign a.s.; afero mala a bad a.; a bad business; afero amorala a love a.; afero honorala a matter of honor; pledar afero to plead a cause. V. exp.: La vorto afero aplikesas ne nur a l'aferi komercala e financala, ma a le judiciala, politikala, mem social e moral entraprezi ed agadi; V-623.
afidio(ent.) aphis, plant-louse. EFIS

afina (chem.) having affinity (ad); (fig.) akin, congenial; -eso: affinity; -esar (ad) to have a. (to). Def.: Qua havas tendenco a kombino, ad uniono. Ex.: Karbono afinesas ad oxo. Afineso spiritala, mentala. Ant.:repulsanta, afiniva.

afirmar (tr.) to affirm, aver (the truth, or that something is true); afirmo affirmation, vouching for, asseveration; afirmajo what is affirmed, the affirmative; defensar la afirmajo to support the affirmative. Ant.: negar, dementiar.

afisho poster, bill: placard posted in a public place; afishigar to publish, gazette (ulo); afishoglutinar to post bill, billstick; afishexpozo, afishoglutino bill posting; afisheyo, afishtabelo place for bill, bill-board; afishoglutinisto bill-sticker.
afixo (gram.) affix: a prefix or a suffix.

afliktar (tr.) to afflict: to cause to suffer mentally, to distress, grieve; aflikto, aflikteso affliction; afliktanta, afliktiva afflicting, distressing; afliktar la karno (fig.) to mortify the flesh.
aforismo aphorism.

afrankar (tr.) to frank: to prepay (postage on letters), carriage on parcels); afranko, afrankuro prepayment; afrankita, afrankite post free (of letters), carriage paid (of parcels); afrankita ye bordo; (f. o. b.) free on board.
afrontar (tr.) to affront: to meet front to front, to face; (fig.) to brave. Def.: Opozar (su) fronto a fronto: figurale on afrontas danjero, tempesto, e.c.; II-136.
afto, afti (med.) aphtha(e), thrush.
afusto (gun-)carriage.
afuzionar (tr.) to affuse. afuziono (med., rel.) affusion; pouring of water, etc., on the body.

agar (tr., intr.) to do, to act; agigar to make, cause (ulu, olu) to do (ulo); ag(ad)o acting, deed, action; aganta, agema, agiva active; agiveso; agemeso activity; ageskar to begin to act, to come into play; aganto, aginto: doer. V. exp.: Agar, facar La difero inter agar e facar esas proxime ta qua existas inter D. tun a machen (E. to do, to make). Ica du verbi esas transitiva, ma kun diversa senci. On facas ula kozo, konkreta objekto; ma ago havas nul objekto extera. Pro to on darfas e devas dicar: Quon vu agas? Me agas nulo (t.e.; me facas nula ago). La sequanta frazi indikas ica difero: "Quon vu agas dum la tota jorno, se on interdiktis a vu facar irga laboro manuala? Ho! me ne restas nul-aganta; me facas argila statueti (V-623, VI-482). Note: Agar is also used as a suffix with the names of instruments to denote the act done with the particular instrument, as: bastonagar to beat (with a stick), martelagar to hammer; fusilagar to shoot, etc.

agacar (tr.) to set on edge (teeth); (fig.) to irritate, annoy, tantalize, agacanta, agaciva irritating, provoking. Def.: Senco propa esas iritar la nervi (specale e prope di la denti, ex. per la froto di kultelo sur plado o vitro); II-136. Ex.: Limar segilo agacas mea denti. (fig.) Agacar hundo.
agamo* (biol., bot.) agamic, asexual.
agapo (rel.) agape: love-feast.
agariko (bot.) agaric.
agato (min.) agate.
agavo (bot.) agave (genus: Agave).
agendo agenda: memorandum of things to be done.
agento (all senses) agent; agenterio agency (establ.) agenteso agency (function); agenteyo agency (office); borsagento stock-broker; agento kemiala chemical a.
agloo (orni.) eagle; (fig.) heraldry, (milit. standard) eagle; (astron.) Aquilo; agloonazo aquiline nose. Ex.: (fig.) Romana agli.
aglomerar (tr.) to agglomerate, conglomerate; aglomerajo agglomeration.
aglosio* (zool.) aglossity: state of being tongueless.
aglutinar (tr.) to agglutinate: stick as with glue; (fig.) to join together.
agnelo (poetical and rel.) lamb; (cf. mutonyuno); agneleto lambkin; agnelino ewe-l.

agnoskar (tr.) to acknowledge, admit, own (something as right, good, true, false); Me agnoskas vua motivi I admit your reasons (i.e. receive them as valid); Me agnoskas la neceseso facar ol I admit the necessity to do it. Agnoskar guvernerio to recognise a government. L
agoniar (intr.) to be in the death agony, in the last death struggle, in death pangs, in extremis. DeFIRS
agorafobio* (med.) agoraphobia; morbid dread of, or giddiness in crossing open spaces.
agosto August; agostomezo the middle of A.

agro field: piece of ground; (cf. feldo); agrala agrarian, rural; agrano, agristo agrarian, country person; agrokultiv(ad)o agriculture; agrkultivala agricultural; agrkultivisto agriculturist; agromezur(ad)o land-surveying. Def.: Plu o min granda parto di sulo; VI-140.
agrafo hook, hook-and-eye (to fasten dresses, etc.); clasp (for book-lids, cloaks, etc.); snap (of a necklace, bracelet, etc.); (ancient) agraffe; agrafagar (tr.) to hook, clasp. DeFIS
agreabla agreeable, pleasant; agreablajo a. act or object; agreableso agreeableness, charm. Ex.: Agreabla muliero, loko, figuro, sento. Ant.: desagreabla, desplezanta; ofensiva.

agregar (tr.) to aggregate, incorporate; to admit (into a society, university); agrego aggregation, admission; agregajo aggregate; agregala grado a special French university degree, lower than doktoro (F. agrégé).
agrimonio (bot.) agrimony.
agronomo agronomist: a scientific agriculturist.
agronomio agronomics: the theory of agriculture; agronomiala agronomic.

agulo needle; (R.R.) switch, (England) point; aguledo needleful; agulagisto needle-worker, seamstress; switch-man; agulifisto needle-maker; agulagar to ply the needle; to switch, shunt; agultruo eye of a n.; agulpinto point of a n. trikotagulo knitting n.; magnetagulo magnetic n.
ah! ah!
ailanto (bot.) ailanthus.
ais (mus.) A sharp.
ajio (finan.) agio: exchange premium.
ajila agile, nimble, quick; ajileso agility; ajile quickly, on the jump! Ant.: lenta.
ajiotar (intr.) to speculate (in public securities, stocks), to be a stock-jobber; ajiot(ad)o agiotage; stock-jobbing; ajiotanto, ajiotero stock-jobber. DeFIRS
ajornar (tr.) to adjourn, put off, defer, (ulo til); ajorno adjournment, postponement, reprieve; ajornema dilatory.

ajuro ajour-work: open-work, fret-work, (of fabric) webbed: carving, metal work, embroidery, etc. where background is pierced or removed, or where it is translucent; izita klozilo lattice; ajuroza kesto crate.
ajustar (tr. tech.) to adjust, regulate, set (cf. adjustigar); Ex.: Finita instrumenti esas ajustebla. On ajustas teleskopo por la disto (ne por la direciono: apuntar); III-219; cf. regular.

ajuto ajutage: nozzle, spout. Def.: Specala tubulo o fino di tubo, destinita ne a juntar du tubi or recipienti (quale tubulo), ma a determinar la formo di la sprico ekiranta (ex. ya la fino di lanco por arozar); VII-197.
akacio (bot.) acacia; (cf. robinio).

akademio academy: learned society, (not "high-school"); akademiala academical; akademiano academician. V. exp.: Akademio esas societo de ciencisti (generale elektita ed en fix nombro) qui ne docas. On devas do evidente rezervar akademiala a ta senco, e ne uzar ol parolante pri universitato (profesori, studenti, kursi, e.c.); III-496
akanto (bot.) acanthus.
akantonar* (tr., milit.) to canton: billet, allot quarters (to troops in a locality); akantoneyo cantonment, quarters DeFIS
akaparar (tr., finan.) to corner (goods, the market); (fig.) to monopolize. Def.: Amasigar komercaji en granda quanto por skarsigar li e cherigar lia preco.
akaro (ent.) acarida; mite, tick.
aklamar (tr.) to acclaim: to shout approval or applause. Ex.: La rejo esis kronizata inter la aklami di la turbo. Li aklamis il kom rejo. Li aklamis la propozajo.
aklimatar (tr.) to acclimate, acclimatize: to season, to inure, accustom to a climate; (fig.) to habituate, make one feel at home.
akneo (med.) acne; akneoza, akneizita pimply, blotched.
akoluto acolyte.
akomodar (tr., tech., opt., etc.) to accomodate: adapt, adjust; akomodo accommodation.
akompanar (tr., also mus.) to accompany: escort; (ad)o accompanying; akompanuro accompaniment; akompanar su per piano to a. oneself on the piano.
akonito (bot.) aconite, wolfsbane, monkshood.
akonto installment, partial payment; akonte pagar to pay on account. Def.: Partal pago di toto debo; II-75.
akoro* (bot.) calamus, sweet flag, (Acorus calamus).

akordar (intr., mus.) to be in tune; (cf. konkordar); (gram.) to agree; akordigar to tune; (gram.) to make agree; akordo, akordeso accord, agreement; akordigo tuning; akordigilo (instr.) tuner; akordigisto (person) tuner; dis, mis ne akordo discord (cf. disonanco).
akordeono (mus. instr.) accordion.
akra acrid (taste, smell); (cf. acerba, acida); harsh (in voice); (fig.) acrimonious; akreso acridity, asperity; akrahumora crabbed, peevish, akradolca bitter-sweet. Ant.: dolca.
akreditar (tr.) to accredit: to give credit or sanction to (ulu, ulo); akreditita accredited; akreditoletro (dipl.) letter of credence, credential.
akrido grasshopper, cricket; (family: Akrididae); (cf. lokusto).
akrobato acrobat: akrobatajo a. act; akrobatala acrobatic.
akrochar (tr.) to hang (on a hook), to hook on (ulo ad ulo), to interlock, grapple (a ship): akrocho hitch, hooking on; akrochar su ad to cling (like grim death) to.
akromata (opt.) achromatic; akromateso achromatism.
akromio* (anat.) acromion.
akropolo acropolis.
akrostiko acrostic.
akroterioo acroterium.
akto (theater; legal document) act.
aktinio actinia: sea-anemone.

aktiva active (opposed to passive; also used in com., fin., gram., mil. senses); (cf. agema, ajila); aktiveso activity; aktivo (gram.) active (voice); adebaji debts which a person has to receive: assets. Ex.: Aktiva puero, homo. Aktiva parto (en afero). Aktiva verbo. La aktivi e pasivi di ban-krotinto. Ant.: pasiva.
aktor(ul)o actor; aktorino actress; aktoracho bad a.

aktulaa actual; aktulaajo, aktulaeso actuality, question of the hour; aktulaigar to actualize. Def.: Qua traktesas od interesas en la nuna instanto (proxime reala); fakte e komplete existanta, opozite a to quo povus esar, ma ne esas, ed a to quo naskas o divenas (ica od ita); IV-495. Ex.: Aktuala energio, opozata a potencial energio. La evento aktuala esas . . . . La jurnali povas vivar nur per aktualaji (E. journals can live on passing events).
akular (tr.) to bring to bay (ulu a ulo) To drive into a place from which there is no escape. Ex.: On povas akular kombatanto a muro, armeo a rivero o monto, bestio chasata a klozilo; IV-135.
akumular (tr.) to accumulate; akumul(ad)o, akumulajo accumulation. Ex.: Akumular richaji, trezori, pruvi. Ant.: disdonar.
akumulatoro (elec.) accumulator.

akurata punctual. Def.: Qua venas (persono) od eventas precize ye la loko, ye la kloko fixigita, konvencionita, IV-102. V. exp.: Persono povas dicesar akurata, ma ne exakta o preciza. Akurateso indikas la ideo di sorgo; IV-102.
akushar (tr., obstet.) to deliver (a woman); (cf. parturar): akusho accouchment: delivery in child-bed; akushistino midwife; akushala obstetrical; akusharto obstetrics.
akustiko acoustics; akustikala acoustical; akustikala tubo hearing-tube; ear trumpet.

akuta (also fig. of sound, pain, sickness, accent) acute, sharp, keep; akutajo a sharp object; edge; akutigar to sharpen, whet, put an edge on; akutigilo sharpening instrument; whetstone; akuteso (pr. and fig.) acuteness, keen-ness; akuta angulo acute angle; akutarista sharp-edged. Ant.: obtuza. DEFIS

akuzar (tr.) to accuse, inculpate, charge with, indict; akuzo, akuzajo accusation: impeachment (for state offenses); charge (before a police magistrate); indictment (for larceny, etc.); akuzala accusatory; akuzato, akuzito the accused, the defendant; akuzanto, akuzero accusor, indicter, prosecutor; akuzebla chargeable, impeachable; akuzmotivo reason for accusation. Def.: Imputar kulpo, delikto, krimino ad ulu. Ant.: justifikar.
akuzativo (gram.) accusative (case).

alo (also fig. of army, aeroplane, building, windmill, etc.) wing; aleto small wing, pinion, aileron; aloza, alizita winged; aloforma aliform, wing-shaped: alostroko wing beat, flap; brandisar la ali to clap, flap the wings.
alabastro alabaster.

alaktar (tr.) to suckle, give suck to; alakt(ad)o lactation, nursing; alaktato nursing; cf. ablaktar; alaktofratulo (fig.) foster-brother; alaktofialo:, alaktvazo nursing bottle; alaktata porkyuno sucking pig.
alambiko still (for distilling); (chem.) alembic.
alantoido* allantois; alantoidala allantoidal.

alarmar (tr.) to alarm: sound the alarm, give signal of danger; alarmo cry or signal of danger; (fig.) sense of danger, fright (cf. pavoro); alarmema, alarmemo, alarmisto alarmist; alarmoklamo shout of alarm; misalarmo false a.; sonigar l'alarmo to sound the a.
alaudo (orni.) lark.
albo alb. Def.: Longa, blanka robo portata da la sacerdoto dum la meso; III-42.
albatroso (orni.) albatross.
albergo inn; albergestro inn-keeper.
albina, albin(ul)o albino.
albumo album: book for photographs, autographs, cards, etc.
albumeno albumen: white of egg; albumenizar (cook.) to glair.
albumino (chem.) albumin; albuminoza albuminous.
albuminoida, albuminoido albuminoid.
albuminoso* (med.) albuminosis.
albuminurio (med.) albuminuria; albuminuriika suffering from a.
alburnoo (bot.) sap-wood, alburnum.
alciono (myth.) halcyon; alcionala dii, h. days.
alcedo (orni., genus.) Alcidae (genus Alcedo).
aldehido* (chem.) aldehyde.
aleo lane, walk, path (in a garden, park, wood, etc., generally between rows of trees); (cf. stradeto).
alegar (tr.) to allege, adduce, advance (arguments, facts, etc. in order to prove or justify something); alego allegation (act); alegajo allegation: what is alleged. V. exp. vid. citar. DEFIS
alegorio allegory; alegoriala allegorical. DEFIRS

alejar (tr., phys. sense) to lighten, relieve (of a load); (fig.) to alleviate, ease, relieve (the mind, etc.). Ex.: Alejar mulo di qua la portajo esas pezoza. Alejar navo. Alejar dento-doloro. Alejar la mento. (vid. lejerigar.
aleno awl (shoemaker's, sailmaker's, etc.; cf. puncilo).
alerta alert: wide-awake, smart, brisk, sprightly; (cf. ajila, agema, aktiva). EF
aleurono* (bot. & chem.) aleurone.
alexandrina, alexandrino alexandrine (verse).
alezar(tr.) to ream, bevel out, bore smooth (inside of a cannon, steam cylinders, etc.); (cf. borar) alezilo reamer; alezala diametro diameter of bore. Def.: Glatigar l'internajo di tubo, truo.
alfabeto alphabet; alfabetala alphabetical; alfabetlibro primer; alphabet book.
alfenido alfenid: silver-nickle alloy.
algo alga(e): sea-weed, kelp, dulse, sea-lettuce, etc.; (cf. fuko).
algebro algebra; algebrala algebraic.
algoritmo* (math.) algorism, algorithm.
alio garlic; aliopano bread rubbed with g.; alisauco g. sauce.

aliancar (tr.) to unite, ally (families by marriage); alianco family alliance (by marriage); aliancito relation by marriage; (cf. misaliancar). V. exp.: Ta verbo ne esas sinonimo di mari-ajar, qua relatas nur la gespozi; aliancar relatas lia familii; II-706. DEFIS
alibio (jur.) alibi; pledar alibio to plead an a.
alidado (tech.) alidade.
alienar (tr.) to alienate: to sell, dispose of (estates, property, rights); ne alienebleso (jur.) mortmain. (cf.enemikigar, igar desfavoroza).Ex.: Alienar sua havaji.
alienacar (intr.) to be in a state of alienation (mental derangement); alienacika, alienacikoderanged, insane (person).
aligatoro alligator.

alimentar (tr.) to supply with what is necessary (as water, fuel to a machine, provisions to a town, food to a family or person); (cf. nutrar); alimento alimentation: supply, maintenance, feeding; -ala, alimentanta; alimental: sustaining.
alineo (print.) a line of which the first word is indented; a new paragraph.
aliteracar (tr., intr.) to alliterate. Def: Komencar (finar) per la sama sono o soni; IV-649.
alizarino(chem.) alizarine.
alizeo trade-wind. Def.: Vento qua suflas konstante dum la tota yaro inter la tropiki; II-641.
alko (zool.) elk, (Cervus alces).
alkado* (Spanish magistrate) alcade, alcalde.
alkalio(gen. sense) alkali; alkalioza, alkaliatra alkaline; alkaliema alkalescent; alkaliigar to alkalize (turn into a.); alkaliizar; to add a. to; alkaliozeso alkalinity.
alkaloida, alkaloido (chem.) alkaloid.
alkemioalchemy; alkemiisto alchemist.

alkoholo alcohol; alkoholoza, alkoholema, alkoholatra alcoholic, spiritous; alkoholigo, alkoholizo alcoholization; alkoholismo alcoholism; alkoholajo spirits; alkoholozeso alcoholicity; alkoholika, alkoholiko (med.) alcoholic (person); alkoholmacerajo a. extract.
alkoholometro* alcoholometer.
alkovo alcove: recess.
almanakoalmanac: yearly calendar with variety of information; (fig.) year-book; adres almanako directory.
almeo alme(h): Egyptian musical entertainer.
almonar (intr.) to give alms (ad ulu); almono alms, alms-giving; almonema, almonoza; charitable (in giving); almonero, almonisto; almonulo, almonino almoner; charitable person; almonkesto poor-box.
alno (bot.) alder(-tree) (Ainus); alnbosko a. grove.
aloo aloe (plant); aloligno a. wood: agalochum; alosuko juice of a.
alodio allodium, freehold estate, fee-simple estate; (opp. to feudo); alodiala;allodial.
alonge along, at the side of; alongirar (tr.) to go along, skirt, coast. Ex.; Ni iris alonge (od, alongiris) la bordo dil lago.

alonjo lengthening piece; leaf (of telescope, table), (jur.) allonge (of bills of exchange); Def.: Tubo quan on adjuntas ad altra por longigar ol o por igar ol komunikar kun altra tubo o vazo (III-134), anke uzata por (la prolonguro di) la tabli e trati; VII-197.
alopatio allopathy.
alopecio (med.) alopecia: loss of hair, baldness; (cf. kalva, sen-hara, senpila).
aloso (ich.) alose: shad (genus: Alosa). DeFSL
alotropa (chem.) allotropic; alotropeso allotropy. - DEFIRS

alloyar (tr.) to alloy; combine metals by fusion; alloyo, alloyuro alloy (of metals); (fig.) any impure mixture; quality (of things in general); bon alloyagood quality, blue-blooded (of per-sons), high standard of quality (of things). Ex.: Bronzo esas aloyuro. (fig.) Esas poka vertui sen kelka aloyeso.
alpo alpine pasture; alpala, alpatra alpine; alpacensisto; a. climber.
«alpari» (fin.) at par; (cf. para).

altahigh, tall, lofty (also used with pressure, sound); altajo a high object, a height; altulo a tall man; alteso highness; altigarto make higher, raise;alteskar to rise, get higher; altareliefo(art.) high relief; alta grada, alto of high degree, high grade; minimalteso (di aquo)low-water mark; ica chambro esas alta de dek e kin pedithis room is 15ft. high. V. exp.: alta, basa; suba, supera; infra, supra; sura; inferiora, superiora: Alta e basaexpresas dimensiono. Ex.: La supra etajo esas basa e la infra etajo esas alta (E. the uppermost story is low and the lowermost story is high). Anke en la tekniko, on parolas pri vaporo ye alta (basa) preso, od en la muziko, pri alta o basa noto, sono. Suba e supera havas senco relativa ed indikas nur situeso o direciono relate determinita punto, t.e. nivelo plu a min alta. Exemple, konsiderante domo kun sis etaji, e parolante de la vidpunto di ta, qua lojas sur la triesma, la supera etaji esas la 4ª, 5ª, 6ª; la suba etaji esas la 2ª, la 1ª e la ter-etajo. Supra ed infra havas senco absoluta, ed indikas loki o parti en determinita objekto. Según la supera exemplo, la supra etajo esas la 6ª, la infra esas la ter-etajo. Sura relatas ulo supera e kontakte kun ulo, do la sura etajo esas nur la 4ª. On uzas prefere lasuprajo, lainfrajopor indikar la materiala parto di l’objekto, e la supro e la infro por indikar la geometrial extremajo o surfaco. Ex.: la supro di la komodo esas horizontal; la suprajo de la komodo esas marmora (od: ek marmoro). En citado, on dicas: Videz supere (E. look (anywhere) above) o videz supre (E. look at the top); videz sube (E. see below) o videz infre (E. see at the bottom). On uzas superiora, inferiora en la sociologiala e ekonomikala senco por indikar ta qua esas rispektive super o sub ulu per la povo ed autoritato; II-163, 664; III-411. Ant.: basa.
altoalto-viola, -violin; altovocoa. voice, counter-tenor; opleisto a. player; saxhornaltoalto-horn.
altaro (rel.) altar.
alteo(bot.) althaea: marsh-mallow (Althaea officinalis).

alterar (tr.) to alter; modify the nature or quality of anything (generally for the worse); altero, altereso alteration; adulteration, deterioration; alterebleso alterability. Kelka veneni alteras la kompozeso di la sango some poisons alter (change) the composition of the blood. Alterar la belesoto spoil beauty. Alterar monetito debase coins; alterar linguoto corrupt a language. Def.: Chanjar la naturo o qualeso di kozo (generale a min bona); VII-203.

alternar(intr.) to alternate, take turns; alternigarto cause to a.; altern(ad)oalternation, succession; alternantaalternating (movement, crop, etc.) alternigar la kultivoto vary, rotate the crops. Ex.: La sezoni alternas.
alternativoalternative, choice, option. Def.: Posibleso di selekto inter plura kozi, hipotezi.
altitudo altitude; ye altitudo deat an a. of. Def.: Alteso di loko relate la mar-nivelo.

altraother, another; altro, altrajoanother thing, something else; altruanother person; altriothers; altreotherwise; altre, altranome(leg.) alias; altrigarto alter; (cf. alterar); altralokeelsewhere; altratempeat another time; altramaniere in another manner or way; altrubeelsewhere, somewhere else; altravorte in other words or terms; l’una, l’altraone another, each other.
altruismo altruism; altruistoaltruist. Ant.: egoismo.
aludar (tr.) to allude to, have reference to, refer to; aludoallusion; aludanta, aludiva allusive, suggestive.
alumeto match (lucifer); alumetuyo m. holder; alumetifistom.-maker.
alumino* (chem.) alumina; aluminoza, atra aluminous.
aluminio* (metal) aluminium.
aluno alum.
aluro gait, pace. Def.: Maniero mar-char; IV-234.
aluviono alluvium; aluvionala alluvial.
alveolo honey-comb cell; alveolus: tooth-socket; alveolala, alveolatra alveolar; alveoloza alveolated.

amar (tr.) to love: to like (very much), care for, have affection for, cherish; (cf. amorar, prizar, afecionar); amo love; amado loving; amanto lover; amata, ato beloved; amegata darling; amanta, amoza, amema loving; aminda worthy of l., loveable; kind;amindeso lovableness; kindness; pro amo a Deo for the love of God, for God's sake.
amalgamo (metal and fig.) amalgam; amalgamigar to amalgamate; amalgamigo amalgamation.

amansar (tr.) to tame, make docile (animals), to make tractable, sociable (persons); amansesar to be t.; amans(ad)o:, amanseso taming (act); docility (state); amansebla tamable. Def.: Igar la animalo min sovaja; (fig.) igar persono plu sociema. Ex.: Amansar leono, urso. Il esas homulo di humoro sovaja; on ne povas amansar il. V. exp. vid. domtar.
amaro mooring-cable, hawser; lashing (as for a gun, etc.); amaragar (tr.) to moor (by cable), to belay, make fast; amarago mooring (act).
amarantoo (bot.) amaranth; amarantoea a. colored.
amaso mass, heap, pile; amasigar to heap up, hoard up, amass; amaseskar to get together, crowd; amasigo piling up or together; amasiganto stacker.
amatoro amateur; kolomb amatoro pigeon fancier; sport amatoro sportsman; amatoroteatro theater run by a.s.
amauroso* (med.) amaurosis.
amazono amazon; (fig.) mannish woman; amazonrobo riding habit
ambajo, ambaji ambage(s): circumlocution, beaing around the bush.
ambasado (function) embassy; ambasaderio (administrative unit) embassy; ambasadeyo (residence) embassy; ambasadisto ambassador.
ambiciar (tr.) to be ambitious of, to aspire to; ambicio ambition; ambicioza, ambiciozo ambitious (person); ambiciar la mastreso to aspire to (aim at) the mastery.
ambidextra ambidextrous.
ambiguo ambiguous, equivocal (cf. dusenca, plursenca); ambigueso ambiguousness; ambiguajo an ambiguity. Ant.: unasenca, klara.
amblar (intr., of horses, etc.) to amble.
ambliopa (med.) amblyopic; ambliopeso amblyopia.
ambono (rel. arch.) ambo.
amboso anvil.
ambro ambergris.
ambrozio (pr. and fig.) ambrosia.
ambulanco ambulance: field hospital following an army; ambulancisto a. attendant; furgon ambulanco ambulance (vehicle).
amebo (biol.) amoeba.
"amen" amen.
amendo (pecuniary) fine, penalty.
amento* (bot.) catkin, ament.
ametisto (min.) amethyst; ametistea a. colored.
amfibia amphibious; amfibio amphibian.
amfioxo* amphioxus, lancelet (Amphioxus lanceolatus).
amfiteatro (all senses) amphitheater.
amforo (antiq.) amphora.
amianto (min.) amianthus.
amido (chem.) amide.
amidolo* (photog.) amidol.

amiko friend; amika, amikala friendly, amicable; amikeso friendship, friendliness, amity; amikalajo friendly act; amikeskar kun ulu to become friendly with some one; Francamanto, amikamiko Francophile. Ant.: enemiko.

amilo starch: (chem.) amylaceous substance in plants; (gen.) fecula used to stiffen linen; (cf. starchivo); amilizar to starch: put starch on (cf. starchar); amiliferio s. works; amilatra amylaceous, starchlike.
amnestiar (tr.) to grant a general pardon; amnestio amnesty.
amneziar* (intr.) to have amnesia; amnezio amnesia: loss of memory; amneziifanta amnestic.
amniono (anat.) amnion.
amono*, amonogaso ammoniacal gas.
amonio* (chem. radical NH4) ammonium.
amoniako (chem.) ammonia; amoniakosala sal-ammoniac; amoniakala, amoniakoza, amoniakatra ammoniacal; amoniakogumo gum-ammoniac.
amonito* ammonite: a fossil shell.

amorar (tr.) to love (as man or woman); amoro love: expresses not merely the sexual relation but also the sentiment between sexes; amoregar to adore; igar amorar to make fall in love, cause to love; amoreskar to become enamored, smitten; amoranta, amoroza, amorema loving amorous, enamoured; amoranto, amoroz(ul)o lover, wooer, sweetheart; amoreto petty love affair, intrigue, amour; amoregata, amorato well-beloved, darling; amoristulo ladies' man, gallant; amoremino flirt; amoremulo woman chaster; amoristino, amorvendistino courtesan; amordeklaro declaration of love; amorletro love letter; amorkurtezado courtship; amordeo (myth.) god of love, Cupid. Def.: Expresas specale l'amo di la sexui, ne kom relato sexuala e pure korpala, ma kom specala sentimento; VI-322.
amorcar (tr.) to start a thing off, set going (an instrument or a force); to prime (a gun); to fetch (a pump); amorcilo (of firearms) primer.
amorfa (biol.) amorphous.

amortisar (tr.) to weaken, deaden, break, (the force of a stream, a blow, a fall or shock); to calm (passions); to abate (inflammation); to blunt the feelings; to tone down, soften (colors); (fin.) to pay, liquidate (a debt), to redeem (an annunity); (jur.) to amortize: to sell in mortmain; (cook.) to make (meat) tender by long-keeping; amortis(ad)o deadening; liquidation, amortization; amortisuro, amortisajo, amortispekunio (fin.) sinking-fund; amortisebla redeemable; amortisita kuglo spent bullet; amortisilo extinguisher (for charcoal, etc.). Def.: Igar ulo min violent-oza; febl-igar; extingar debajo per pagar la kapitalo; igar plu mola.
ampelopso* (bot.) Virginia creeper.

ampla ample: (of space) spacious; (of garments) full, easy; (of supplies) abundant; (of reward) liberal, etc.; ampleso amplitude; ampligar to amplify; ampligo amplification. V. exp.: Expresas relato inter du kozi de diversa speci, maxim ofte la relato di kontenanto e kontenajo. "Ampla" no-mizesas mantelo, qua fitas tre laxe la portanto, chambro od agro ube granda kunveno devas eventar; provizuro qua satisfacas la demandi esas "ampla", stato qua havas granda mar-komerco mustas havar "ampla" floto; IV-596. Ant.: streta.
amplitudo* (astron., physics) amplitude.
ampulo ampulla: a bellied phial, glass bulb; (med.) a blister (on feet as from walking, or on hands from rowing).
amputar (tr., surg. and fig.) to amputate, cut off.
amuleto amulet.

amuzar (tr.) to amuse, entertain; (fig.) to distract, divert (cf.distraktar); amuzar su; amuzesar to a. oneself (per, pri), to be amused (da); amuz(ad)o amusement (act): amuzivo:, ilo that which amuses: plaything, toy; amuzanta, amuziva amusing; amuzanto, amuzero, emoentertainer; amuzachar su to trifle away one's time.

an (prep.) at, on (indicates contiguity, juxtaposition); dorso an dorso back to back. Def.: Expresas relato di kontigueso, di apud-pozeso IV-409. Ex.: Apogar skalo an muro. Pendar pikturi an la parieto. Glutinar afisho an muro. Pendar chapelo an hoko. Sidar, sideskar an tablo. An la bordo (rivo) di la fluvio. Ula urbo jacas an rivero, an maro, an monto. Ta domo esas situita an la strado X . . . La fenestri an la strado esas granda; ma la fenestri an la korto esas mikra; IV-409.
anabaptismo (rel.) anabaptism.
anabaptisto (rel.) anabaptist.
anado (orni.) duck (family: Anatidae); anadulo drake; anadino female d.; anadyuno duckling; anado nigra black d. (Anas nigra); anadlageto d. pond.; anadembuskeyo d. ambuscade; anadfusilo d. gun.
anaerobia* (biol.) anaerobic.
anagalo anagallis: pimpernel.
anagramo anagram.
anakouluto (gram.) anacoluthon.
anakoreto (rel.) anchoret, anchorite.
anakronismo anachronism: error in chronology; something incongruous in time.
analo, anali annal(s).
analgeziar* (tr.) to lull the sensibilities, produce insensibility to pain; analgezio analgesia.
analitiko (math.) analytics; analitikala analytic(al). Ex.: Lingui, geometrio analitikala.
analizar (tr., log., chem.) to analize; analizo analysis; analizala analytical. Ant.: sintezo.
analoga analogous, similar; analogeso (relation, quality) analogy; analogajo something analogous. Es.: Rezonado analoga. La linguo Italiana havas multa analogeso a la linguo Latina. An.: nesimila.
anamorfoso* (opt.) anamorphosis.
ananaso (fruit) pineapple; ananasiero p. plant.
anapesto (pros.) anapest.
anarkio anarchy; anarkiismo anarchism; anarkiista, isto anarchist.
anastigmata* (opt.) anastigmatic.
anastomoso (bio., anat.) anastomosis.
anatemar (tr.) to anathematize; anatemo anathema; anatemita, ito anathematized (person).
anatomio (science) anatomy.
ancestroo ancestor; ancestroala ancestral; ancestroi, ancestroaro ancestors; ancestroino ancestress.
anchovo (ich.) anchovy (Engraulis encrasicholus).

anciena ancient, old; ancieneso oldness, ancientness; ancienajo something old. V. exp.: anciena, nova; yuna, olda; antiqua: anciena, nova relatas prefere la kozi; yuna, olda relatas precipue l'evo, ma on darfas parolar pri homo anciena o nova en lua profesiono, en ofico o funciono. Ex.: Persono qua esas yuna (per evo) ma anciena en ofico (t.e. homo qua havas "ancieneso" en ula ofico, kontraste ad oficisto qua ne tam longe okupas sua ofico quale l'altru. Antiqua koncernas exkluzive l'epoko, t.e. la antea yarcenti, e plu precize la tempi di la Greki e Romani. Domo, moblo, vesto povas esar anciena, e tote ne esar antiqua. O se on qualifikas oli "antiqua," to esas nur per jokoza or ironioza hiperbolo; III-225. Ant.: nova.
andrinoplo* "andrinople" a cotton fabric.
androceo* (bot.) androecium.
androgina, androgino (biol.) androgynous, androngyny.
anekdoto anecdote.
anemio* (med.) anemia, anaemia; anemiala (relating to disease) anemic; anemiika, iko anemic (person); anemiigar to render anemic.
anemometro anemometer: wind-guage.
anemofila* (bot.) anemophilous.
anemono (bot.) anemone (genus: Anemone).
aneroida aneroid: aneroida barometro a. barometer.
anesteziar (tr.) to anesthetize (as by ether or chloroform); anestezio anesthetizing (act); anestezieso anesthesia (state); anesteziiva, ivo anesthetic.
aneto* (bot.) anet: dil (Anethum graveolens).
anevrismo* (med.) aneurism.
anexar (tr.) to annex; anexo, anexeso annexation; anexajo an annex: anexita annexed.
angelo fish-hook; angelagar, angelkaptar (tr.) to hook; angelizar to put a hook on. (cf. peskar).
angeliko (bot.) angelica (Angelica archangelica).
"angelus" (rel.) angelus.
angino (med.) angina, quinsy.
angiospermo, angiosperma (bot.) angiosperm(ous).

Angla English; Angl(ul)o, Anglano English-man; Anglaparolanto one who speaks English; Anglia England; Anglatra, Anglamode in the English fashion: Anglomaniika, iko anglomaniac, Anglago E. idiotism, anglicism; Angloodio anglophobia; Angloodianta, Anglanto anglophobe (person); la Angla the English language.
anglikana, anglikano* Anglican; anglikanismo Anglicanism.
angorar (intr.) to be in anguish; angorigar to cause a. to, to agonize; angoro anguish: pang, agony, violent pain (of body or mind); angoriganta agonizing; angoroza full of a. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.
angora*kapro Angora-goat, angora*kato A.-cat.
anguilo (ich.) eel (order: Apodes); anguilopesko eel-fishing.

angulo angle, corner; anguleto small angle, nook; angulala angular, corner; anguloza many cornered, angulated; angulo akuta acute angled; angulo faciala (anat.) facial a.; ort angula right-angled; angulo obtuza obtuse a.; angulopetro corner-stone; angulopeco corner-piece; angulfaldar (tr.) to fold the corners of (ulo); angulmoblo corner-piece (furniture); angulruptar to break the corners off (ulo).

anhelar (intr.) to pant, gasp for breath; anheligar to put out of breath, to wind; anhel(ad)o panting; (med.) anhelation. Ex.: Ca hundo anhelas. Lu arivis anhelegante, tante rapide lu esis kurinta. Me anheligis me, acensante ta eskalero.
anhidra (chem.) anhydrous.
anilino (chem.) aniline.
animar (tr.) to animate: endow with life; (fig.) to enliven, give animation to; animo, animeso animation; animata, animoza animated. Ex.: La anmo animas la korpo. La konversado esis animoza.
animismo (philos., physiol.) animism.
aniono* anion.
aniversario anniversary; aniversario mortala commemoration.
anizo (bot.) anise (Pimpinella Anisum); anizosemini aniseed; anizliquoro anisette.
anjelo angel; anjelala, anjelatra angelic; gardanjelo guardian a.
anke (adv., conj.) also; me anke ne (od, anka me ne) I neither; ma anke but also, but yet. Ex.: La lakto esas plu salubra kam la biro ol esas anke plu nutriva.
ankilosar (tr., surg.) to anchylose: make stiff; ankilosesar to be to become anchylosed; ankiloso, ankiloseso ankylosis, anchylosis.

ankore (adv., conj.) yet, still, until now, until then (refers to a fact or act already existing); lu ankore ne arivas he has not yet arrived; kad vu ankore hungras? are you still hungry. V.exp.: Ankore ja: Ankore signifikas duro di ago o stando plu longa, e ja komenco di fakto od ago plu frua kam on opinionis; III-335.

ankroo anchor; ankroojetar, ankroagar (tr.) to anchor; ankroago anchoring; ankroesaragita to be at anchor; ankroageyo anchorage; ankrootrabo (nav.) cat-head; ankrooboyo a.-bouy; driftar sur sua ankri to drag one's anchors.

anmo soul (cf. psiko); anmizar to put soul into, to hearten; anmoza soulful, with spirit; sen anma without soul, inanimate; kantar kun anmo to sing with spirit. Def.: L'ento metafizikala, la principo di vivo e di penso; V-32.
anobio (ent.) death-tick, -watch (Anobium); ligno anobio wood-fretter.
anodo* (elec.) anode: positive terminal.
anomala abnormal, anomalous: irregular; anomaleso, anomalajo anomaly, abnormality.
anonima anonymous; anonimeso anonymity; anonim(ul)o a. person.
anso handle: the arc shaped handle of a cup, bucket, etc.
antagonismo antagonism.
antagonisto antagonist; (cf. adverso).
antarktika antarctic.

ante (prep.) before (of time); antea preceding, former, previous, last, prior; antee previously, before, heretofore; anteeso anteriority, priority; anteke before (that); lu arivis ante me he arrived before me; ante du kloki before two o'clock; ante nelonge not long ago; ante nun before now; antediluvia antediluvian; antehiere the day before yesterday; antelasta (the one) before last; antemariaja antenuptial; antemortar to predecease: die first; anteprelasta antepenultimate. Ant.: pos.
antecedento (gram., log., math.) antecedent. Ex.: La antecedenti di individuo, t.e. lua antea historio e konduto.
anteno (zool., elec.) antenna, feeler.
antero (bot.) anther.
anti contra (use generally as a prefix with scientific words) (cf. kontre) antibakteria bactericide.
anticipar(tr.) to anticipate; anticipo, anticipeso anticipation; anticipe in anticipation; anticipala pago advance payment.
antidoto (also fig.) antidote. Def.: Substanco qua neutrigas l'efekti di la veneni; IV-76.
antifono antiphon: anthem; antifonaro antiphonary.
antifrazo antiphrasis. Def.: Figuro di retoriko, qua konsistas en uzar ula vorto o frazo en senco kontrea a lua vera signifiko.
antikristo antichrist.
antilogio* (log.) antilogy; contradiction in ideas.
antilopo antelope.
antimilitarismo antimilitarism; antimilitaristo antimilitarist.
antimonio (min., chem.) antimony.
antinomio (jur., philos.) antinomy.

antipatiar (tr:) to have an antipathy, aversion to (or against); antipatio antipathy; instinctive aversion, natural repugnance; antipatiinda (what is) antipathetical, repugnant; antipatioza (who feels antipathetical, full of aversion. Ant: simpatiar.
antipirino (chem., meet.} antipyrin.
antipatriota antipatriotic.
antipodo, antipodi antipode(s).

antiqua antique, ancient: of a former epoch; antiquajo an antique; antiqueso antiquity; antiquajisto antiquary. Ex.: Antiqua moblo, kustumo; muzeo di antiquaji. V. ex.: vid. anciena. Ant.: moderna, nuntempa, prezenta, nuna,
antisemida anti-Semitic; anti(ul)o anti-Semite; antiismo anti-Semitism.
antisepsiar (tr.) to antisepticize; antisepsiesar to be antiseptic; antisepsieso antiseptic state; antisepsiiva, antisepsiivo antiseptic. Def.: Kombatar kontre la mikrobi per antisepsiivo.
antitezo(log., rhet.) antithesis; antiteza, antitezala, antitezatra antithetic(al). DEFIRS
antitoxino* antitoxin.
antivermo vermifuge.
antologioanthology.
antonimo* antonym; antonimeso antonimity. Ant.: sinonimo.
antonomazio (rhet.} antonomasia. Def: Remplasigo di propra nomo per komuna nomo equivaianta, o reciproke; V-483. Ex.: L'anjelo di la skolo (vice Santa Thomas).
antracito anthracite, hard-coal.
antraxo (med.) anthrax: carbuncle.
antropoida, antropoido anthropoid.
antropologio anthropology.
antropomorio* anthropometry.
antropomorfa* anthropomorphic; antropomorfismo antropomorphism.
anuso (anat.) anus; anusala floso anal fin.
anxiar* (intr.) to be anxious, anxio anxiety; -oza anxious.
aoristo* (gram.) aorist.
aorto (anat.) aorta.
aortito* (med) aortitis.
apanajo appanage: royal grant of domain or allowance; apanajizar to endow with an a.

aparar (intr.) to appear (to or before: aparo, aparajo appearance (act); ad, avan ulu); to become visible, be in sight, come to light; aparigar to cause to a. to; apparition (thing visible); to put in an appearance, aparanta apparent, plain, obvious, ostensible, specious; aparar por la formo show oneself; fantom aparo apparition (ghost) Ant: Desaparar.
aparato (tech., surg.) apparatus; machine, instrument or appliance used to perform a certain operation.

aparta apart: separately, aside, alone; aparta paroli words spoken aside. Def.: Signifikas quaze separita, izolita, sola; VII-154. Ex.: Aparta parolo (en teatro od en vivo); aparta lernado (lernar aparte, t.e. sole e sen docanto); prenar ulu aparte (por parolar a lu specale, exter e for la ceteri). Lu dormas en aparta chambro (ne en la komuna dormeyo). Lu manjas an aparta tablo (ne an la komuna tablo).
apartamento apartments: suite of rooms; flat.
apartenar (intr.) to appertain, pertain; belong to by right, nature or custom; apartenajo appurtenance. Ex.: Algeria apartenas a Francia. Il apar tenas a bona familio. Domo e lua apartenaji.
apatio apathy: want of feeling, indifference: (cf. indiferenteso); apatioza apathetic, impassive. Ant.: animozeso, vivemeso.

apelar (intr.) to appeal (in law); (fig.) to call for aid or sympathy (ad ulu, pri ulo); facar apelo to lodge an a.; asignar apelo To give notice of a. (pri). Ex.: Me apelas a vu por regulo di ca questiono; apelar pri un judicio o tribunalo ad altra.
apendico (lit., anat., zool., bot.) appendix; apendico vermatra, apendicoforma vermiform a. Def.: Parto qua servas kom prolonguro di parto precipua.
apendicito* (med.) appendicitis.
apene (adv.) hardly, scarcely, barely. Ex.: Il apene arivis. Il apene eskapis la morto.

apertar (tr.) to open, unclose (also fig. with heart, soul, etc.); apert(ad)o (act) opening; aperturo aperture, hole, gap; aperte openly, plainly, frankly; (cf. kandida); apertiva, apertivo aperient, laxative; mi apertar to half open (a door, etc.). An.: klozar.

apetitar (tr., pr. and fig.) to have an appetite for; crave or desire (instinctively); apetito appetite, longing; apetitigiva, apetitivo appetizing, appetizer; apetitigar to give or cause an a. for; apetitiganta appetizing, relishing. Ex.: La stomako apetitas la nutrivi. Apetito sensual, karnal, perversa. Il havas nesaturebla apetito por richaji. Ant.: saturar.
apipomo ‹‹api››: a small red apple (Malum Appianum).
apio (bot.) smallage, wild celery (Apium).
aplanata* (opt.) aplanatic.

aplastar (tr.) to crush, squeeze, squash (soft objects); (fig.) to overwhelm, overburnden, oppress; rul aplastilo (a steam or other) roller (as on streets). Ex.: Aplastar insekto per la pedo, vit-beri per presilo. Aplastita per laborego. Aplastar adverso en diskuto. V. exp.: On povas presegar stala bulo sen aplastar ol, kontre ke on aplastas argilo sen presegar; III-198.
aplaudar (tr.) to applaud, clap; (fig.) to express approbation, aplaud(ad)o applauding; aplaudi plaudits; aplaudanto, aplaudero applauder; aplaudistaro claque (paid clappers at theater).

aplikar (tr.) to apply, lay on, impose; aplikar su (fig.) to apply oneself (the mind, attention); apliko application: applying; aplikajo thing applied; aplikebla applicable, apposite, suitable. Def.: Pozar ulo sur ulo.

aplombo (fig.) assurance, self-confidence, self-possession (cf. audaco); (inst.) plummet, plumb-line; aplomba upright, plumb, self-assured, confident; stacar aplombe to stand upright, plumb. Def.: Signifikas propre: vertikala pozeso, vertikaleso, e nur metafore: fido en su ipsa, audaco (t.e. sentimento, ke on stacas vertikale, solide sur sua pedi). IV-528.
apodiktika* (log.) apodictical.
apofizo* (anat.) apophysis.

apogar (tr.) to prop (up), stay, support; to lean, to rest; to base, found, ground (assertions, reasons, etc.) apogo propping, supporting: apogilo, apogtrabo prop, stay, support, pillar, strut, stanchion, brace; apogarko (arch.) flying buttress; (fig.) mainstay; shultr apogar to press to the shoulder (firearms, etc.); apogpunto point of support, fulcrum; dors apogilo a support for the back; kap apogilo head-support; apogar skalo an la muro to prop (or set) a ladder against a wall; apogar edifico per apogarki to support a building by buttresses; me apogis me an la muro I leaned against the wall: apogar sua manui sur tablo to lean one's hands on a table;sur quo vu apogas vua asertion what do you base your assertions? Def.: Suportar (o, igar suportar) per lateral od obliqua forco; III-102. Suportar, sustenar per la moyeno di apogilo.
apogeo (astr.) apogee. Ant.: perigeo.
apokalipso apocalypse.
apokrifaapocryphal.
«Apollon»(myth.) Apollo.
apologo apologue: moral fable.

apologiar(tr.) to vindicate (in writing or speech); apologio apology: written or spoken discourse to justify a person, a thing; apologiala, apologiatraapologetical, exculpatory; apologiartoapologetics; apologiisto apologist. Ant.: blamar, denigrar, difamar.Note: For the translation of apologize in the sense of «to beg pardon» cf. exkuzar.
aponevroso*(anat.) aponeurosis.
apostata, apostato apostate; apostateso, apostatesko apostacy; apostateskar to become an a., to apostatize.
aposteriorie, aposterioriala* a posteriori.
apostolo apostle; apostolalaappostolic; apostolesoapostleship.
apostrofo(gram.) apostrophe; apostrofizarto mark with an a.
apoteko (Eng.) chemist’s shop; (U.S.) drug-store, pharmacy; apotekisto chemist, apothecary, druggist.
apotemo(geom.) apothegm.
apoteosoapotheosis, deification.
apoziciono(gram.) apposition; apozicionala appositive (word).
apr(ul)owild-boar; aprokusheyolair of w. b.
apretar(tr., tech.) to dress: put a finish on calicoes, leather, etc. by applying a glaze dressing or varnish. - DFIR
apriloApril.
apriorie, ala*a priori, presumptive.
aprobar (tr.) to approve, give approbation to. Ant.: des, neaprobar.
aprocho, aprochi (milit., fortif.) approaches: the works, trenches, etc. made by besiegers.
apsido (arch.) apse; (astron.) apsis; apsidalaapsidal.

apta apt, fit, appropriate, good for, suitable (ad); apteso aptitude, aptness, qualification; aptigar to make fit or suitable; apta a militofit for war (service); apta por nulofit for nothing. Ant.: Des, neapta, aptjusta, aptkapabla, aptkonvenanta.

apud(prep.) close by, next to, beside, apudanear, neighboring, adjacent; apudesarto be near or close; apudaleoside-lane; apudpozar(tr.) to juxtapose; apudaji ed abutaji(fig.) the ins and outs (of an affair). Ex.: Apud la domo esas puteo. Apud la generalo stacis lua adjutanto.
apuntar(tr.) to point (a fire-arm); take aim at; level at; apuntilosight.

aquo water, aqualaaquatic; aquoza, atraaqueous, watery; aquozesoaquosity; aquizarto water (streets, etc.); aquespruva w. proof; aquofosatow. trench, moat; aquofalo w. fall; aquokontilow. meter; aquomelonow. melon; aquopento w. shed; aquorezervuyoreservoir; aquoturmo w. tower; aquovazo, aqukrucho ewer; aquo santaholy-w.; reze di l’aquo on a lavel with the w.; pluv aquo rain w.; rejala aquo(chem.) aqua regia; salosalt w., brine, pickle; sod aquo soda-w; aquoboko water nozzle, hydrant; aqupikturo washed drawing; aquosprico jet of w.; aquospricilo w. nozzle. aquespruva mantelo w. proof cloak, aquespruveso w. proofness.
aquaforto (chem.) aqua fortis: nitric acid; aquafortajo a.f. etching.
aquamarinoo (min.) aquamarine. Def.: Varietato de berilo.
aquarela, aquarelo (painting) water-color; aquarelpiktar to paint in w.c.
aquario aquarium.
aquatinto (engraving) aquatint.
aquedukto aqueduct.
aquilegio (bot.) columbine (genus: Aquilegia).
aquilono (poet., lit.) Aquilon: the north wind personified.

aquirar (tr.) to get (through one's own exertions), to become the possessor of (by purchase, by labor, etc.), to acquire, win; to contract (a habit, a sickness); to gain (affection favor), to incur (dislike, hatred); aquiro (act) acquisition, attainment; aquirajo what is acquired.
aro (metric sys.) area: 119.6 sq. yds.
Araba Arab-ic, -ian; Arabo an Arab; Arabia Arabia; Araba linguo A. language.
arabesko arabesque.

arachar (tr.) to pull or drag out (a nail, etc.); to tear out (the hair, the eyes); to grub up (roots); to tear away (a child from its mother); to snatch, wrest, extort, wring (ulo de ulu); Ex.: arachar afisho, konfeso, krii, lakrimi. Arachar ulu de la morta.
arako (spirits) arrack,
araknoido* (anat.) arachnoid.
araneo spider; araneatra s.-like, araneous; aranereto, aranetelo spider-, cob-web; aranepedo s. leg.

aranjar (tr.) to arrange: make orderly disposition of, dispose of in a proper manner; (cf. ordinar) aranjo, aranjeso, aranjuro (act, state, result) arranging, disposition; Ex.: Aranjar libri sur tablo. Aranjar afero, mariajo, kofro, lito Aranjar por facar ulo.
arbalesto arbalist; cross-bow; arbalestiero cross-bowman.
arbitrar (tr.) to arbitrate: award as an arbitrator, decide, judge, settle (ulo); arbitro arbitration; arbitranto, arbitrero, arbitristo arbitrator; umpire; referee; arbitrala arbitral.
arbitrajar (tr., com.) to carry on arbitrage: to buy and sell on the market.
arbitrio free-will; arbitriala arbitrary, discretionary; arbitriajo arbitrary act, caprice: arbitrie ad libitum, at will; segun la arbitrio at the discretion or will (di ulu).

arboro tree; arborala arboreal; arboratra arborescent; arboroza woody; arboraro clump of t.s.; arborizar to afforest, plant with t.s.; arborkultiv(ad)o arboriculture; arborgluo bird-lime; arboro genealogialagenealogical t.; arborstumpo t. stump; arbortrunko t. trunk; arborspeco specie of t.; arborrano t. -frog (Hyla aborea); arboredukeyo (hort.) nursery; sen arborigar, des arborizar to clear of t.s.; dorn arboro thorn-t. eben arboro ebony-t.; Kristonaskala arboro Christmas t.; ax arboro (tech.) axle-t., -shaft; movo, transmis arboro main-, transmission shaft.
arbusto shrub, bush (not over three feet in height); sub arbusto underbrush; arbustaro thicket.
arbuto arbute berry; arbutiero (European) arbutus (genus: Arbutus).
archo (Noah's) ark; archo di kontrato ark of the covenant (Bibl.).

ardeza, ardezo slate; ardezea, ardezatra, ardezoza slaty; ardeza krayono s. pencil; ardeza tabelo slate (for writing); ardezkolorizarto cover, with s. color: ardezkovrar to cover, roof with s.: ardezmineyo s. quarry.

ardorar (intr.) to be aglow, glowing, hot, fiery (cf. brular, kombustar); (fig.) (of passion, zeal) to be ardent, fervent; (of animals) to be in heat, rut; ardoroheat; ardor, eagerness; rut; ardoranta, ardoroza fiery, burning, full of ardor, passionate; ardorigarto make burn, set on fire, make ardent.
ardua* arduous: (of mountains, etc.) steep, rugged: hard to climb (cf. eskarpa); (of tasks, etc.} difficult to perform.
areo area; extent of surface: (geom.) superfices.
areko areca-, betel-nut (cf. betelajo);arekiero areca-palm (Areca).

areno arena, ring. V. Exp.: Areno esas spaco rondatra od elipsoiorma e klozita, por la ludi e kombati cirklala. Lico esas longa kureyo, generale duopia (por iro e riveno) por kuri o por turniri, II-646.
areolo (anal., med.) areola.
areometro areometer.
areometrio* (phys.) areometry.
areopago (also fig.) Areopagus; -ano Areopagite.
arestar (tr., legal) to arrest: make a prisoner of, put under a.; arestesar to be a.ed; -o, aresteso a.; custody; arestanto, arestero person a.ing; -ato, arestito person a ed; -impero order for a.
argalo (orni.) marabou-stork (Leptoptilus Argala).
argano (lifting-) gin, sheer-leg (ci. krano).
argilo argil; clay, potter's earth; -a, argiloza, argilatra argillaceous, clayish; -izar to marl (land).
argono*(chem.) argon-
argonauto (myth.) Argonaut.
argumentaar;(intr.) to argue: hold an argument. Def.: Rezonar por pruvar ulo.
«argus» (myth.) Argus; (fig.) spy.
ario (mus.) tune, air.
arida arid: dry and barren; (cf. sterila); arideso aridity, Ant: humida, fruktoza, fertila.
arieto (instr. of war and tech.) battering-ram; Aries, sign of the Zodiac; hidraulikala arietohydraulic ram.

aristo (geom.) edge, projecting angle; (arch. and carp.) arris; (bot.) awn, beard (of barley, wheat, etc.); ridge (of nose, of mountain, of a bayonet, etc.); aristotrabo ridge-piece, hip-rafter; (angular) fish-bone

aristokrata, aristokratata aristocratic; aristokrat(ul)o aristocrat; -aro: (collect) aristocracy ; aristokrateso;aristocracy, nobility (quality); aristokratismo aristocracy (political system); -igar to make a.; aristokrateskar to become a.
aristolokio (bot.) aristolochia, birth-wort.
Aristotelana, Aristotelala*Aristotelian.
aritmetiko arithmetic; aritmetikala probiemo,operaco arithmetical problem, operation; aritmetikero, aritmetikistoarithmetician.
aritmografo* arithmometer: calculating machine.
aritmologio* theory of numbers.
aritmomancio* arithmomancy: divination by numbers.
aritmonietro* arithmometer: calculating machine.

arivar (intr.) to arrive (at destination, at a certain place). V. exp.; Se ulu venas de Berlin ad Paris, lu advenas dum la tota voyajo; nia lu arivas nur ye la tino (lasta momento) di la voyajo; e lu povas advenarsen anvar (se lu esus haltigata daacidento); VI-322- Ant.: departar.

arjenta, arjentosilver; arjentizar to silver over, plate; arjentoza, arjentatra, arjentea argentiferous, silvery; arjentaji, arjentajaro, arjenta vazaro silver-ware; arjenta moneto, peco silver coin; lingota arjento bar silver; arjentonitrato silver nitrate, lunar caustic.
arjentano* (alloy) argentan.

arko (geom., arch., elec.) arch (as of bridge), arc; arkizuro archway, vault; arkigar to arch: bend, curve, in form of a.; apog arko arch-boutant: flying buttress; arm arko bow; ciel, pluv arko rainbow; (arm)arkero, arkisto, iero archer, bow-man; elektrala arko electrical a.; klozar arko (geom.) subtend; micirkla arko semi-circular a.; sel arkosaddle-bow; triumf arko triumphal a. vult arko covering of an a.; arkopetro a.-stone; arkapogar to buttress; arklampo arc-lamp, -light.
arkabuzo arquebuse.
arkado (arch.) arcade.
arkaika, arkaikema archaic: old, antiquated; arkaikajo a. object.
arkaismo archaism: antiquated form of speech; arkaismema archaic (tendency in speech).

arkana arcane: hidden, secret; arkano arcanum: great secret of nature. V. exp.: Sekreta, arkana, okulta: Sekreta esas la maxim generala vorto. Arkano esas sekreto ciencala (o, pseudo-ciencala), quan on revelas o docas nur ad iniciati (ex.: l'arkani di l'alkemio). Ol esas analoga a misterio, ma misterio apartenas a religio, ed arkano a cienco o tekniko. Okulta dicesas omno quo koncernas la mondo di la spiriti e nia (asertita) relati kun li (ex. magio, astrologio, spiritismo, e.c.). La ‹‹okulta cienci›› ne esas simple sekreta cienci ma la cienci qui pretendas revelar a ni l'altra mondo o komunikigar ni kun olu; (kp. IV-237).
arkeologo archeologist.
arkeologio archeology; arkeologiala archeological.
arkianjelo archangel.
arkichambelano archchamberlain.
arkidiakono archdeacon.
arkiduko archduke; arkiala archducal; arkiino archduchess; arkiio archduchy (estate); arkieyo a. palace; arkieso archduchy (dignity, office).
arkiepiskopo archbishop.
arkikancelero arch-, high-chancellor.
arkimandritoo* (Greek Ch.) archimandrite.
arkipelago archipelago.
arkisacerdoto archpriest.
arkitekto architect.
arkitekturo architecture; arkitekturala architectural.
arkitravo (arch.) architrave.
arkivo, arkivi archive(s): record(s), state-paper(s); arkivisto archivist: keeper of the records.
arkivulto (arch.) archivolt.
arkonto (hist.) archon.
arktika, arktiko arctic; arktika ganso wild goose (Anser hyperboreus).
arlekino harlequin, merry-andrew; arlekinajo a piece of buffoonery; arlekinvesto h.-dress; (fig.) patch-work, medley.

armo arm: weapon; armaro weapons (collect.); armeyo armory (depot); armifar to manufacture a.s; armifisto gun-smith; armizar to a.; armarko long-bow; paf armo fire-arm; armfrato brother-in-arms; (hom) armaro armor (for persons; cf. kuraso); gamb armo leg-armor; abasez la armi down, ground arms! depozar armi to lay down arms; armizita de kapo a pedi Armed from head to feet; trupo armizita armed force; armohakilobattle-axe; portez armi shoulder arms!
armadilo (zool.) armadillo (Dasypus).
armatoro shipowner. Def.: Posedanto ed equipanto di navo; III-75.
armaturo (elec.) armature; (tech.) iron braces, stays (to strengthen masonry, etc.); kabl armaturo wire covering about a cable; armaturizita cemento reinforced cement.
armeo army; armeo de triadek mil viri a. of 30,000 men; armechefo, armeestro head of the a., general; armekorpo a. corps; (fig.) cielal arme o celestial a.; reserv armeo a. in reserve.
armistico armistice, truce.

armoro cupboard; armoreto cabinet; fer armoro iron chest, strong-box; glaci armoro ice-box; linj armoro linen press; mur armoro c. in a wall; nutriv, paramush armoro pantry; screened c.; vest armoro wardrobe; plad armoro dish-closet.
armoracio* horse-radish (Cochlearia Armoracia).
arniko (bot. and med.) arnica (Arnica montana).
arogar (tr.) to arrogate (ulo a su) to make undue claims; arogema, aroganta arrogant, overbearing, supercilious, haughty. Ex.: Il arogas a su autoritato sen havar la yuro.
aromo aroma: spicy flavor or smell.
aromato aromatic: fragrant vegetable substance.
aroruto arrowroot: starchy flour of Maranta arundinatea and other plants.

arozar (tr.) to moisten, wet, water (with any liquid); arozilo watering-pot; arozventuro sprinkling cart; V. exp.: aquizar, aspersar, irgacar On povas arozar materiale o figurale, per mult altra liquidi kam aquo. La biblo dicas, ke Noa ‹‹arozis›› la vito sucedante per sango di pavono, per sango di simio, per sango di leono e per sango di porko. Do on ne povas uzar ‹‹aquizar››. On aspersas planti ed arbori por preventar ula morbo. Asperso relatas saneso. Irigaco esas brancho di agrokultivado. Ol aquizas tota farmi, distrikti per fluigar aquo de riveri, lagi, e.c., en artificala kanali a la kultivo-loki; IV-353, 459.
arpejar (intr.) to play arpeggios; arpejo arpeggio.
arseno (chem.) arsenic.
arsenalo arsenal.

arto art: practical skill guided by rules; occupation requiring such skill; artisto artist (in fine arts), adept (at anything); artala artistic: (relating to arts); artistala relating to the artist; artaleso artistic quality or character (of a thing); arte, artoze artfully, skillfully, cunningly; artema artistic (person); artistino female artist; arti bela (the) fine arts; artoverko work of art; arti societala social accomplishments; arti liberal, mekanikal the liberal, mechanical arts or professions; poezi arto the poetic art; akush arto abstetrics (as a profession); arti utila useful arts; skribarto the art of writing. Def.: Aplik(ad)o di konoci por realigar koncepto.
artemizio (bot.) mugwort (genus: Artemisia); artemiziabsinta common worm-wood.
arterio (anat.) artery; arteriala arterial.
arteriito* arteritis: inflammation of the arteries; (cf. flebito).
arteriologio* arteriology.
arteriotomio* (surg.) arteriotomy.
arteza Artesian; arteza puteo A.-well.
artichoko (bot.) artichoke (Cynara Scolymus).

artifico artifice: artful or ingenious expedient; artificala artificial; (cf. falsa): artificacho (in a bad sense) cunning, craft, wile, trick; artific(ach)oza artful, crafty, factitious; sen artifica frank. Ex.: Artificala dentaro, gambo, rido. La artifico qua movigas automato.

artiko (anat., bot.) articulation: joint; artikala articular; artikizar to articulate: supply with a.s; artikoza, artikizita articulated, jointed; bul artiko arthrodia; artiko inter la kruro e la hancho the a. of the thigh with the hip: the hip-joint; des artikizar to unjoint.
artikular (tr.) to articulate: pronounce, utter words; ne artikulita inarticulate.
artilrio artillery: body of troops; (cf. kanonaro); artilriano a. man, gunner; ped artilrio foot a.
artro (anat.) part or segment of a limb or body; movable articulation. Ex.: La korpi di kelka insekti havas multa artri.
artrito (med.) arthritis; artritika, artritiko (person) suffering with a.
artrodio* (anat.) arthrodia.
artropodo (zool.) arthropod, articulata.
arufar (tr.) to ruffle up, turn back (feathers, hair); karezar kato arufe to stroke a cat the wrong way.
arumo (bot.) arum: cuckoo-pint, wake-robin (genus: Arum).
aruspico (Rom. antiq.) (h)aruspex.
Aryana, Aryano Aryan (race, language).
aso ace (cards, dice); kordi aso ace of hearts.
asafetido asafetida: gum resin of Ferula Asafoetida.

asaltar (tr.) to assault, storm (a fortified place); to assault, charge (the enemy); asaltanto, asaltero assailant aggressor; ek asaltar to make a sally, sortie; ri asaltar to charge again; asaltar quik l'obstaklo (fig.) to take the bull by the horns; sonigar por asalto to sound the charge; asaltoskalo scaling-ladder; ne asaltebla unassailable, impregnable; asalte kaptar, konquestar to carry by assault, (cf. atakar, asomar, atentar).
asasinar (tr.) to assassinate. Def.: Mortigar kun preintenco ed embuske o surprize; III-698.
asbesto (min.) asbestos.

asekurar (tr., finan.) to insure, underwrite (against loss); asekurar su to insure oneself; asekurito insured person; asekuristo insurer, underwriter; asekurar pluse, pose to take out additional i.; asekuroakto, asekurkontrato i. policy; asekurokontoro i. office; asekurotaxo premium (paid by insured to insurer).
aselo (ent.) woodlouse (Oniscus Asellus).

asemblar (tr., gen.) to assemble: collect, bring together (people, materials, etc.); asemblo, asembluro, asemblajo assembl-y, -age; asemblo publika, politikala public, political meeting. V. exp.: vid. muntar.
