asentar (tr.) to give assent to: agree to, aquiesce in. Ex.: Me asentas vua judiko (t.e. me opinionas same, me judikas to kom vera. V. exp.: Asento koncernas opinioni pure teoriala; konsentar relatas prefere opinioni praktikala, t.e. propozi e rezolvi; VII-98.
asepta aseptic; asepteso asepticism (state); aseptigar to asepticize; aseptig(ad)o asepsis (act). Def.: Qua ne havas mikrobi; IV-175.

asertar (tr.) to assert, allege, set forth, protest (declare); asertita pretended, asserted, so-called; asertar la falseso di to deny in toto; asertar per sua honoro to a. upon his honor, give his word of honor; aserto pri fideleso protestation of fidelity; asertita inventuro so-called invention; esar asertita absenta to be reputed (regarded, considered) as absent.
asesoro assessor: an assistant judge.
asfalto asphalt(um); asfaltisar to asphalt; asfalta, asfaltizita choseo asphalted road.

asfixiar (tr.) to asphyxiate; asfixiesar (da) to be a.ed (by); asfixio, asfixieso asphyxiation (act, state); asfixiita a.ed. V. exp.: Sufokar esas la vulgara, asfixiar la ciencala vorto. Asfixiar esas la halto dil arterio-pulsado. Ol esas stando sucedanta al neperfekta oxigenizo dil sango, finanta per la morto, kande lu tro duras. Sufoko esas speco de asfixio, per obstaklo al adveno dil areo til pulmoni, obstruktado di naztrui, di boko, kompreso di kolo, e.c.; II
asfodelo (bot.) asphodel (genus: Asphodelus).
asidua assiduous: constant, regular (in attendance or work). V. exp.: Diligenta relatas la fervoro od agemeso, ed asidua la akurata e reguloza prezenteso, la kontinueso di laboro; II

asignar (tr.) to assign, to appropriate, allot, set apart (a sum), to fix, appoint (a day, place, rank), (fig., legal) to summons, cite, subpoena; (cf.atribuar, cedar); asignoletro (jur.) subpoena, writ, summons. Ex.: La ministraro asignas sumo por pagar salarii. Asignar dio por pagar debajo, la limiti (di ulo), a singlu lua rango, lua tasko.
asimilar (tr.) to assimilate (physiol. and fig.). Ex.: La animali povas asimilar nur animala o vejetala substanci. Usa asimilas multa populi.
asimptoto (geom.) asymptote.

asistar (tr.) to be present at, attend; asisto attendance, presence; asistanto, asistero person present, onlooker, bystander (not helper; cf. helpanto); asistantaro audience, congregation; Ex.: On asistas spektaklo, acidento, disputo. Il ne nur asistis, ma parto-prenis ta diskuto. La diskurso esis asistata da multa personi, qui ofte aplaudis ol.
askarido (zool.) ascarid (Askaridae; genus: Ascaris).
asketo, asketala ascetic; asketeso, asketismo (state, doctrine) asceticism; asketaji a. acts, austerities.

askoltar (tr.) to listen to, hearken to, give ear to; askoltanto, askoltero listener. V. exp.: Askoltar implikas sempre intenco e volo. Audar esas perceptar per l'orelo, vole o nevole. Ex.: Me askoltas vu ma me ne audas pro la bruiso; V

asno donkey, ass; asnulo jackass; asnino she-ass; asnalajo asinity; stupidity, silly blunder; asnacho stupid ass; asnetyuno ass's colt; asnoreli ass's ears; asnokargajo load of an ass; asnoduktisto donkey driver; asnobramo bray of an ass; pedfrapo di asno kick of an ass.

asociar (tr.) to make (a person) one's associate, partner, colleague, companion, accomplice (in an ill sense); to make (ulu) participate or share in (ulo); asocio, asociuro association, partnership; asociito associate, fellow, companion; asociitaro an association, society (persons) asociema sociable; asociemeso sociability; asociado di idei a. of ideas.
asomar (tr.) to fell, to knock down: to knock on the head; asomisto, asomero feller (of oxen); asomilo loaded bludgeon. V. exp.: On povas asomar per mazo o sen instrumento (ex. per pugnobato); II

asortar (tr.) to assort, match, suit, sort out, classify things alike, or somewhat alike, or suited to each other; asort(ad)o, asortajo assortment; asorturo (di dimanti, di pladi, di kulieri, e.c.) a set of diamonds, plates, spoons); butil asortajo stock (of a shop).
asparago (bot.) asparagus; asparagopinto the tip (or top) of a. shoots; asparageyo a. bed.
asparagino* (chem.) asparagine.

aspektar (intr.) to look (like, as if: quale), to seem (to be), appear; aspekto aspect, view, sight, look, phase; aspektar felica to look happy; aspektar quale fola, folo to look like, seem to be a fool; aspekto yun(es)ala youthful look; la kozi chanjis sua aspekto the aspect of things changed.
aspera (of touch) rough, uneven. V. exp.: Acerba koncernas la gusto, aspera la takto; II-707. Ant.: glata.
aspersar (tr.) to sprinkle (to prevent disease); (rel.) to asperse; aspersilo sprinkler; (rel.) aspergillum. V. exp.: vid. arozar.
asperulo* (bot., genus) asperula; asperulo odoroza woodruff.
aspiko (zool.) asp (Naja Haje).

aspirar (tr.) to inhale, draw in (air, smoke, etc.); to suck in or up (liquids); (gram.) to aspirate (a sound); to aspire: desire eagerly, long for, aim at; aspir(ad)o inhaling, inbreathing, suction, aspiration: ardent wish; aspirilo (chem) aspirator; aspirajo (gram.) aspirate; aspirsigno (gram.) sign of aspiration; aspirar la honori, ofici aspire to honors, office; aspirar la krono, rejeso aspire to the crown, to kingship; (cf. ambiciar); aspirar la venjo to long for vengeance; aspiro di aero en la pulmoni inhaling of air into the lungs; aspirotubo suction pipe; pumpilo aspiras l'aquo a pump sucks (draws) up the water; la feliceso quan me aspiras the happiness which I long for. V. exp.: vid. sugar. Ant. expirar.
astatika (magnetism) astatic.
astenopa* (bot.) asthenopic.
astero (bot.) aster; Chiniana astero China a.
asterio (zool.) asterid, star-fish (genus: Asterias).
asterismo (astron., opt. of crystals) asterism. Def.: Optikal fenomeno; reflekto radianta di la lumo sur ula lapidi; III-135.
asteroido (astron.) asteroid.
astigmata* astigmatic: astigmateso astigmatism.
astmo (med.) asthma; astmika, iko asthmatic (person).
astonar (tr.) to astonish, surprise, amaze: astonegar to astound, aghast; (fig.) to stupify; (cf. stuporigar); astonesar to be a.ed (da).

astro star: any heavenly body; astrala astral, sidereal; astraro constellation; fixa astro fixed s.; astrofiziko astrophysics. V. exp.: Stelo, astro La astri esas omna cielala korpi, qui kontenas ne nur las steli (dicita fixa), ma la planeti, lia sateliti (exemple la luno), la nebulosi, la kometi, e.c. VI-191.
astragalo (anat., arch.) astragal.
astrakano astrakhan (pelt).

astriktar (tr.) to have an astringent effect on; astrikt(ad)o, astrikteso (med.) astriction; astriktiva, ivo astringent. Def.: Astrikto esas densigo di ula organika texuri: ex. ‹‹aluno esas astriktiva›› II-645.
astrolabo (astron. instr.) astrolabe.
astrologo astrologer.
astrologio astrology.
astronomo astronomer.
astronomio astronomy; astronomiala astronomical.

asumar (tr.) to assume, take on oneself, undertake; (cf. entraprezar); asumajo assumption: something taken for granted; asumar afero take a hand in an affair; asumar debi a. debts; asumar devo, la responso to a. a duty, the responsibility; asumar la spensi to undertake the expense; asumar la instrukto di la infanto to undertake the instruction of the child (cf. supozar).
asunciono (rel.) Assumption (of the Virgin Mary).

atakar (tr.) to attack; (milit.) to take the offensive; (cf. asaltar, asomar, atentar); atako (alo med.) attack(ing); atakanto, atakinto, atakero attacker, assailant, aggressor; atakebla assailable; atakanta, atakema aggressive, attacking, offensive (attack); atakemeso aggressiveness; cirkum atakar to a. on all sides; flanke atakar to a. on flank; atakar dorse, surprize to a. at the rear, to make a surprise a.; kontre atako counter a.; noktal atako night a.; atakiva federo offensive alliance.
ataraxio (philos.) ataraxy: perfect piece of mind.
atasheo (diplo.) attaché.
atavismo atavism.
ataxio* ataxia (med.) ataxiika, iko ataxic (person); ataxio lokomocala locomotor a.
ateismo atheism; ateismala atheistic (doctrine, teaching).
ateista, ateisto atheist; ateistala atheistic (of persons); ateistaro a.s (collect.).

atencar (tr.) to pay attention to (ulu, ulo); to apply the mind to, heed; atenco attention, care, heed; atencema attentive, mindful; atencez attention! mind! look out! ne atencoza, atencema inattentive, heedless; sen atencajo inadvertence, oversight (act).
ateneo* Athenaeum (temple and literary institution).

atentar (tr.) to make a criminal attempt on (ulu, ulo); atento attempt (to commit an offense or crime); attack, assault (on persons or property), outrage; atenta, atentanta, atentema assailing, unlawful, hostile; atentar la honoro di ulu to assail the honor of some one; atentar la vivo (di ulu) to make an attempt on a person's life; atentar su ipsa to attempt suicide; atento kontre la majesto crime of lese-majeste; atento kontre la pudoro criminal (or indecent) assult.
ateromo* (med.) atheroma.

atestar (tr.) to attest: certify, bear witness, give proof of; atest(ad)o attestation, testimony, deposition, certification; atesturo certificate, voucher; deb atesto acknowledgement of debt; demandar atesto (di ulu) to call for witness: donar atesto (jur.) to depose; examen atesto brevet, certificate, diploma; facar atesto (pri ulo, ulu) to bear witness; falsa, menti atesto false testimony; mariaj atest o certification of marriage; atesto di slaubreso health certificate; atestala testimonial: relating to testimony; la dei atestas to the gods are witness to it, as the gods are our witnesses.
atiko* (arch.) attic, a. story; (cf. mansardo).
atikismo Atticism; atikisto Atticist.

atingar (tr.) to attain, reach; ta infanto ruptas irgo quon il povas atingar that child breaks everything he can reach; la vito atingas le triesma etajo the vine reaches to the 3rd story; atingar sua skopo to hit one's mark, attain one's aim; ta kalumnii ne povas atingar ni those calumnies cannot reach (hurt) us; atingar la simileso to hit off the resemblance; ye fusil atingo at (within) gun shot; atingodisto hand's reach; ne atingebla beyond reach.
atlanto (arch.) atlas; (pl.) atlantes; (cf. kariatido). Def.: Virala figuro, qua servas kom suportilo.
Atlantiko, Atlantika oceano Atlantic (ocean); trans Atlantika transatlantic.
atlaso (anat., geog.) atlas.
atleto athlete; atletala, atletatra athletic; atletismo, atletexercado athletics.
atmosfero atmosphere; atmosferala atmospheric; atmosferopreso a. pressure.
atomo atom; atomala pezo atomic weight; atomismo atomism (theory); atomisto atomist (philos.).
atonio (med.) atony; atonioza atonic.

atraktar (tr. also fig.) to attrack, draw; atrakt(ad)eso attract -ing, -ion; atraktiva, atraktivo attractive, inviting, engaging, winning (object); atraktilo di desfortuno something which brings bad luck. Ex.: La magneto atraktas la fero. Atraktar l'atenco di ulu. Atraktar la odio di la publiko. Un desfortuno atraktas (E. brings on) un altra. Atrakto-forco, -povo. Mieno atraktiva. Ant.: repulsar, antipatiar.
atrapar (tr.) to entrap: take in, trick, hoax, dupe; April atrapo, atrapilo April hoax; atrapita da fripono taken in by a rogue.

atribuar to assign, give, bestow, vest, allocate, invest with (something as due and appropriate); atribuar a ta ofico la konoco di ica od ita aferi to assign to that office the cognizance of such and such affairs; la funcioni atribuita a policestro esas tre multa the functions assigned (or vested in) the chief of police are very numerous; on atribuis bela honorarii a ta ofico handsome emoluments have been assigned (attached, annexed) to that office; atribuar la kulpo ad ulu to throw the fault on some one; atribuar a su la honori di to take the credit, claim the honors of. (cf. imputar). DeFIS
atributo (log., gram.) attribute, attributive.
atricar* (intr., theol.) to feel attrition; atrico (theol.) attrition: grief for sin arising from fear of punishment.
atrofiar (tr., med.) to atrophy; atrofiesar to be atrophied, waste away.
atropino atropin(e).
atuno (ich.) tunny (-fish) (Scomber thynus).
aturdar (tr.) to stun. V. exp.: Aturdar ne esas sempre vertijigar, nek ebriigar; en sua propra senco, ol indikas nekoncio o preska nekoncio produktita exemple da frapo, granda shoko, e.c. IV-1102.

aucionar (tr.) to bid for, offer a higher price; aucion(ad)o bidding, bid; aucionanto bidder; aucione vendar to auction off, to sell at auction; auciono, aucionvendo auction; aucionvenisto auctioneer; aucionar domo to bid for a house. Def.: Ofrar preco plu alta kam altru. VI-417.

audar (tr.) to hear: receive sensations by the ear; aud(ad)o, audeso hearing, audition; audala, audiva auditory, auricular; audanta audient, listening, hearing; audanto, audero hearer, auditor; audantaro audience, auditors, congregation; per audo by hearsay. V. exp.: vid. askoltar, kp. auskultar.

audacar (tr.) to dare, venture, be so bold as; audaco audacity, hardihood; audacoza, audacanta bold, daring, intrepid; audacego temerity; audacanto, audacozo audacious person; audacigar to embolden; audaceskar to grow bold; audacar ekasalto to venture (dare) a sortie; me ne audacas informar il pri la mala novajo I do not dare to inform him of the bad news; simular audaco to bluster. V. exp.: vid. riskar.

audienco audience, sitting, hearing (granted by person in authority); not audience as in theaters, etc; cf. audantaro; audienceyo a. chamber; Sro. X havis audienco kun la rejo Mr. X had an a. with the king; hori di audienco (fixed) hours for hearing, times for cosultation (physicians, barristers).
auditoro auditor: judicial-hearer, assessor (functionary).

augmentar (tr., intr.) to augment: to increase, enlarge, to make larger or more numerous; to raise (rents, prices, wages, etc. (cf. plucherigar); augment(ad)o, augmenteso, augmenturo augmentation, increase, aggravation; rise (in price); (gram.) augment; augmentiva, augmentivo augmentative; pluse augmentar to raise higher. Ex.: Augmentar sua fortuno; augmentar la preco di nutrivi; augmentar sua domo, sua domeno. Augmentar la salarii. La desfacilaji augmentis cirkum lu. Ant.: diminutar, reduktar.

augurar (tr.) to augur (de ulo); auguro augury, omen, presage; auguristo augur, soothsayer; mal augura ominous; augurar bone pri kozo to augur well (have a favorable opinion) of a thing; Ex.: Ta evento esas bona auguro. To bone auguras.
augusta august: imposing awe or veneration, majestic. Ex.: Il esas persono di august aspekto.
‹‹aula›› aula: hall in universities, colleges, etc.; ‹‹aula››ala konsilistaro aulic council.
aureolo (pr. and fig.) aureole, halo, nimbus; aureolizar to put a halo around (as in painting); (fig.) to crown with glory.
aurikulo (anat.) auricle.
auroro aurora, dawn; auroro polala a. borealis.
auskultar (tr., med.) to auscultate.
auspico, auspici (lit. and fig) auspice(s); me entraprezas ica afero kun auspici favoroza I undertake this business under favorable a.s.
austera austere: (in a moral sense) strict, rigid. Def.: Tre severa por su pri la mori, kun nuanco di rigoro ed asketeso; II-707.
austro (poet.) a south wind; australa austral: southern; australa latitudo southern latitude.
autentika authentic, genuine, properly attested; autentikigar to authenticate; garantiar la autentikeso di to guarantee the authenticity of - - -
auto (prefix for scientific and technical words) auto-, self-; automovanta self-moving, -acting.
autobiografio autobiography.
‹‹autodafe›› auto-da-fe.
autodidakta, autodidakto autodidact: self-taught (person)
autografa autographic: written by one's own hand; autografo autograph: original signature or writing.
autokalvo autoclave: (French) steaming vessel; autokalvo da Papin Papin's digester.
autokrato autocrat; autokrata rejido autocratic prince; autokratala guvernado a. government; autokrataro autocracy (coll.); autokrateso autocracy (quality); autokratismo autocracy (regime).
automato automaton; automata automatic: self-acting; automatala automatic (relating to an automaton); automateso automatism.
automobilo automobile: motor-car; automobilero, automobilisto automobilist; automobilduktisto chauffeur; automobilismo automobilism; automobilkorno a. horn.
automorfa (math.) automorphic.
autonoma autonomous: self-governing, independent; autonomeso autonomy.
autopsiar (tr.) to hold an autopsy on (ulu); autopsio autopsy, post-mortem.
autoro (lit.) author; (fig.) creator, originator; autoracho scribbler; autoryuro copyright.
autoritato authority: legal or rightful power; autoritatozo, autoritatozi authorit-y, -ies; autoritatoza, autoritatema authoritative.
autuno autumn: fall of the year; autunala autumnal.

avo grand-parent; avulo grandfather; avino grandmother; ge avi grand-parents (both sexes); pre avo great grandparent; forefather; triesma avulo great-great-grandfather; prim avo (our) first parent; avala nomo patronymic.
avalo aval: guaranty, surety: a signature at bottom of a bill to guarantee payment; avalizar to guarantee (a bill by endorsement).
avalanchar (intr.) to fall in an avalanch; avalancho avalanch.

avan (prep.) in front of, ahead of; before (in space, cf. ante); avane (adv.) in front; avana advance, forward, front; avano the front; avanajo thing, object in front, forepart; (fig.) forequarters (as of a horse); avanirar (intr.) to advance, go forward; kun la avano dope with the front behind, or hindpart foremost; la akuzato sidas avan la jurio the defendant sits before the jury; avanbrakio fore-arm; avanceno front of the stage, proscenium; avanchambro front-room, anteroom; avanguardo vanguard; avanholdo forward hold (of a ship); avankastelo (mar.) fore-castle, avankorpo, avanparto forepart; avanpedo front foot (of an animal); avanportuo outer harbor; avanposteno (milit.) outpost; avantekto fore-roof, projecting roof, eaves; avanviro front man; (milit.) chief of file. Ant.: dop.

avancar (tr. intr.) to advance: to go forward, move, put forward, (in space and time); avancinta frukti, flori forward fruits, flowers; avancinta posteno (milit.) advanced post; avance forward, onward, in advance; avancez forward! Ex.: Avancar la manuo, la pedo. La armeo avancas en la lando. Avancar sua departo. Avancigar la laboro. Ant.: retro avancirar; regresar, tardigar.

avantajo advantage; avantajoza advantageous; avantajizar to advantage, bestow an a. on, to favor; publika, statala avantajo public, state utility. Ex.: Ula persono povas havar avantajo relate altra. La avantaji dil paco. Ant.: desavantajo.
avantalo apron (for persons or vehicles), pinafore.
avara, avaracha avaricious, miserly, greedy, covetous; avareso avarice; avaracho sordid miser, skinflint; avaregeso, avaracheso niggardliness, stinginess. Ant.: prodiganta, spensema, disipanta.
avariar (tr.) to damage (in conveying goods); avario damage, loss, (com.) average. Def.: Avario indikas omna domajo, ne nur di navo, ma di kozi transportita per navo, fervoyo, veturo; II-138.
avelano filbert, hazel-nut; avelaniero filbert-tree (Corylus Avellana); avelanea hazel colored.
aveno oats; avenala, avenatra avenaceous; avengrani: oat-grains; avenporciono a feed of oats; avengruelo porridge.
aventurar (intr.) to seek adventures, go on adventures, lead an adventurous (or roving) life; aventuro adventure; aventurema, aventuroza adventurous, venturesome. (cf. riskar).
avenuo avenue. Def.: Larja voyo arborizita, duktanta ad ula loko, kastelo, monumento (forsan placo), III-16.

avertar (tr.) to give notice, apprise, caution, advertise, warn (N.B. not necessarily to warn of danger); averto warning, hint; avertanto, avertero cautioner; avertanta admonitory, premonitory; avertilo warning instrument; avertar ulu pri ulo to inform or apprise a person of something; avertar la patrulo pri la konduto di lua filiulo to apprise the father of his son's conduct; mea infirmeso avertas me pensar pri morto my infirmities warn me to think of death; avertilo di incendio fire alarm. Def.: Informar ulu pri ulo futura, bona o mala.
aviacar (intr.) to practice aviation, to fly; aviac(ad)o aviation; aviacisto, aviacero aviator; aviacilo flying machine (heavier than air). Note: for technical terms see IV-330-333.
avida avid, greedy, rapacious, craving, eager; venj avida vindictive; pekuni avideso cupidity; avide askoltar ulu to drink in the words of someone. Ant. jeneroza.

avizar (tr.) to apprise, advise, give notice of (pri ulo); avizo notice, notification (generally an order or prohibition); avizonavo advice-, dispatch-boat. Def.: donar ula praktikal informo, konsilo od impero; II-646. V. exp.: Avizo, notico: Avizo koncernas generale preskripto od interdikto; (III-204). Notico esas texto instruktiva teoriale, sive en etiketo, sive en mikra libro o broshuro. Exemple, se on eniras muzeo, on trovas ye la pordo tala avizi ››La muzeo esas apertita de 10 til 16 kloki; ol esas klozita omna lundio; on ne darfas enirar kun parapluvi, bastoni, hundi‹‹ e.c. Ma enirinte, on vidas notici sub la objekti expozata, qui indikas lia autoro, tempo, origino, e.c.; on povas komprar libreti titulizita notico pri ula objekto or serio di objekti (N.B.: ne katalogo, qua implikas numeral ordino) V-32-33.
››avoué‹‹ (French) attorney-at-law.

axo (all senses) axis, axle; axala axial; (rot)axo axle (tree); manivel axo cranked axle; rotac axo axis of rotation: the line round which a body revolves; axoboxo a. case; axometro (nav.) tell-tale (of a tiller); axostifto a. bolt, pin; axarboro horizontal shaft.
axelo (anat.) axilla: arm-pit; (bot.) axil(la).
axiomo axiom; axiomala axiomatic.
axoido (anat.) axis: second vertebra of neck; axoidala axoidal.
axonometrio (math.) axonometry.
azaleo (bot.) azalea (genus: Azalea).
Aziana, Aziano Asiatic.
azilo asylum: place of refuge for poor, sick, or helpless; (fig.) any place of retreat or security; infant azilo infant a.; azilyuro right of sanctuary; blind azilo a. for blind.
azima unleavened; azimo, azima pano azym: unleavened bread; (cf. oblato).
azimuto* (astron. and. geodesy) azimuth; azimutala busolo a. compass.
azoto azote: nitrogen.
b (mus.) ti: seventh note diatonic scale.
ba (interj.) bah! poof! pshaw!
››baba‹‹ baba: French bun, plum-cake.
‹‹Babel›› (lit. and. fig.) Babel; ‹‹Babel››turmo tower of B.

babilar (intr.) to babble, prattle (as infants); to chatter (as a magpie); to gossip, gabble, prate (of grown persons); babil(ad)o chit-chat, gossiping, trifling talk; babilero, babilemo babbler, tattler, chatter-box; babilera, babilema talkative, loquacious; babilajo a matter of gossip; babilacho busy-body.
babucho babouche: Turkish heel-less slipper.
babuino baboon (Cynocephalus Babuin).

bachelero bachelor (of a university); bachelereso bachelorship, b. degree; bachelero pre cienco b. of science: bachelerokandidato aspirant, candidate for the b. degree; (cf. celibulo). Def.: l'unesma (minim alta) universitatala grado; III-72.
bacilo bacillus; bacilala, bacilatra, bacilforma bacillary, bacilliform.
baderno (nav.) paunch-matting, chafing-mat, thrummed mat.
badlano, badlani (bot.) star or Chinese aniseed; badlaniero badian: aniseed tree (Illicium anisatum).
badijonar (tr.) to badigeon; badijonivo badigeon: a cement or distemper paste of powdered stone and plaster.

bagajo baggage, luggage; bagajvagono b. car; bilieto di bagajo ticket for b.; depozeyo di bagajo b. room; manu bagajo hand b.; bagajuyo holder, boot (of a carriage); enskribeyo di bagajo b. check-room; portisto di bagaji b. porter.
bagatelo bagatelle, trifle, trash, bauble; bagatelverko literary trifle. DeFIS
bagno bagnio: convict hulk or prison; bagnano galley-slave, -convict.
bakar (tr.) to bake (dry heat); freshe, nove, heme bakita fresh, newly, home baked; bakoforno b. oven.
Bako Bacchus; Bakala Bacchic; Bakanino bacchante; Bakano a follower of B.
bakanalo (lit. and fig.) bacchanalia: a drunken feast or revel.
bakterio bacterium; bakteriala, bakteriatra bacterial; bakteriocidivo bactericide.
bakteriologio bacteriology; bakteriologiisto bacteriologist.
balo ball (dance); mask baloo masked b.; puer baloo children's dance; travesti baloo fancy (dressed) ball; balochambro ball-room; baloshui pumps; baloacho public-house dance, shindy.
balado ballad, ballade: epic dance and song.
balanco balance: scales; balanco Romana steelyard; letro balanco letter-scale; tordo balanco torsion b.; ponderar per balanco to weigh by a b.
balasrubino a balas ruby.
balasto ballast (for railways, ships); balasteyo b. space; balastizar to b.; sen balastigar; des balastizar to unb.
balayar (tr.) to sweep; balayilo a broom; balayileto brush; balayaji sweepings; mancho, shafto di balayilo broom handle; facisto di balayili b. maker; strado balayisto street-sweeper (vehicle).
balbutar (tr., intr.) to stutter, stammer (from emotion); to lisp (as an infant); to boggle; hem and haw, to hesitate in reading and reciting; (cf. barbuliar). V. exp.: vid. stoterar.

balde soon, ere long, shortly; balda which will soon take place; til balde (fig.) goodbye for the moment; tam balde kam as soon as; esos balde du kloki it is near two o'clock. Ex.: Ni venis maxim balde posible. Ni departos balde.
baldakino baldachin: tester (of a bed); canopy (of a throne, altar, etc.); lito kun baldakino bed with canopy.
baldrio baldric, shoulder belt (for sword, etc.).
baleno whale; balenyuno young w.; balenpeskisto whaler; balenonavo w.-ship; balenkanoto w. boat; balenoleo w. oil.
baleto ballet; baletistino b. dancer.
balifo bailiff: a judicial functionary.
balisto ballista: a war machine.
balistiko ballistics.
balkono (arch.) balcony; (nav.) stern gallery (of a ship); fenestro kun balkono window with b.

balnar (tr.) to bath, bathe, lave; balnuyo bath (receptacle); balnala bathing; balneyo bathing place; balnanto, balnero, balnisto bather, bath-keeper; balnokuvo b. tub; balnomantelo b. robe; balnoaquo bath water; balnokalsono bathing-drawers; pedoo foot-b.; sedo balno hip-b.; mar balno sea-bathing; maria balno (chem.) water-bath; balnochambro b. room; balnoterapio b. therapeutics; termala balni thermal b.s.
balono ball or sphere filled with air; baloneto small ball (as for tennis, etc.); balono, balonego air-balloon (For technical terms cf. IV-330-1).
balotar (tr.) to elect (ulu) by second ballot, baloto second-ballot (in Europe; necessary when no candidate has obtained an absolute majority). balotvoto vote by ballot.

balotear (intr., med. and gen.) to wabble, shake, tremble, quiver (pro). Def.: La vulgara senco di ica vorto expresas la movo ocilanta o tremanta di maso solida, ma elastika o viskoza (quale gelatino). IV-516. Ex.: Lua karno baloteas pro la shoko.
balustro baluster: upright support for railing. Def.: Mikra pilastro faasonita.
balustrado balustrade, railing, (cf. pasamano). Def.: Rango formacita ek balustri, generale horizontala.

balzamo balsam: fragrant resin used as medicine; (fig.) balm, consolation; balzamala, balzamoza balsamic; balmy (odour, air, etc.); balzamiero (genus) balsamodendron; balzamizar to embalm (a body); balzamizero, balzamisto embalmer; pektoral balzamo pectoral b.; balzamo di Gilead balm of Gilead.
balzamino (bot) garden balsam (Impatiens balsamina).
bambuo (bot.) bamboo.
banano (fruit) banana; bananiero b. tree (Musa sapientum).
bando band (group), company, crew; (of fish) shoal; bandacho gang, clique; bando de furtisti b. of robbers; rapt bando b. of brigands; haringo bando shoal of herrings.
bandajo (surg.) bandage; truss; (of a wheel) tire; bandajizar to bandage; put a tire on; herniala bandajo truss for rupture; menton bandajo chin-b.
bandear (intr. nav.) to have a list, be lopsided; bandeigar to cause to list; bandeo listing.
bandito bandit; banditeso, banditismo (state, system) banditism.
bandoliero bandolier: cross-, shoulder-belt. Def.: Rimeno o sharpo pozita sur un shultro e suportanta ula kozo (ex. espado) sur l'altra latero, do pasanta oblique sur la korpo; II-708.

banero banner (as used by societies, orders); banerala fronto (fig.) front line of battle, in battle array. Def.: Speco di rektangula insigno (en stofo) fixigita per horizontal latero a stango di sama longeso, qua pendas per du kordi de la stango per qua on portas la insigno; III-31.
banko (fin.) bank; bankisto banker; bankobilieto b. note; bankoaciono bank share, -stock; emiso banko b. of issue; banko di diskonto discount bank.

bankrotar (intr.) to be (or become) bankrupt; bankrotigar to bankrupt: cause bankruptcy to: bankroto bankruptcy; bankrotinto, bankrotero a bankrupt; (cf. nesolventa). Note: this word implies something disgraceful or criminal; cf. faliar.
baobobo (bot.) baobab (Adansonia digitata).

baptar (tr.) to baptize; baptofili(ul)o godson, godchild; baptomatro, baptopatrino godmother; baptopatrulo godfather; baptonomo Christian name, first name; baptala vasko, kuvo baptismal font, tank; bapteyo baptistery, place for baptism.

barar (tr.) to bar to stop up (a way, a door, etc.); barostango, barotrabo a bar (of wood or metal as for doors, windows); barilo barrier (in general); baril(o) bargardisto gate-keeper; strado barilo street barrier; (fig.) toll-gate; barilo kontreepidemia sanitary cordon; turn barilo turnstile, (surg.) tourniquet.
barofluxo bore, eger, eddy-tide. Def.: Granda mar-ondo avane precipitanta, qua avancas ad-monte en ula estuarii; IV-452.
barako shed, hut; temporary wooden building to shelter soldiers, fishermen, etc.; booth, covered stall (in a fair); barako di jonglisto juggler's booth.
barakano barracan: a camel's hair fabric.

baraktar (intr.) to struggle: strive to get away, writhe, strive (kontre); (cf. luktar). Ex.: La kaptata fisho baraktas en l'aquo. Baraktar per manui e pedi. (fig.) La sovaji ne forte baraktas kontre la morto.
baratrio (nav.) barratry. Def.: Fraudo da la kapitano o navestro kontre armatori od asekuristi; II-75.

barbo beard: hair on the chin, lips and cheeks of men and animals; barboza bearded; barbisto barber; barbo barbpinselo shaving brush; vango barbo whiskers; menton barbo chin -b.; labio barbo mustache; blonda barbo blond b.; barbo dudia a two-day b.; griz barb(ul)o grey b.; kapro barbo billy-goat b.; portar barbo to wear a b.; lanug barbo down (on the face); barbo nivatra, nivea a snow-white b.; sen barba beardless.
barbakano (arch.) barbican; loop-hole; escape-hole (in retaining wall for water).
barbara, barbar(ul)o barbarian; barbaratra barbarous; in a b. manner; barbareso (state) barbarism; barbarismo (linguistic) barbarism; barbarigar to barbarize.
barbelo (ich.) barbel (Barbus).
barbotar (intr.) to dabble, paddle, splash, flounder about (in mud or water).
barbuliar (tr.) to sputter, splutter, mumble;(cf. balbutar). Def.: Parolar iro rapide e konseque neklare e konfuze, nekompreneble; III-6.
bardo bard (poet).
bardano (bot.) burdock (Lappa).
barejo (fabrik) barege; silka barejo grenadine (fabric).

barelo barrel, cask; bareleto small keg; barelego hogshead, tun; barelifar to cooper; en bareligar to barrel (ulo); vendar barelope to sell by the b.; cherpar de la barelo to draw off from the b.; fish barelo fish-b.; bareloboko bung (-hole); barelorobineto faucet, tap of a b.; vin barelo barrel for wine; barelo de vino b. of wine.
bario* (chem.) barium.
baricentro* center of gravity.
barikado barricade; inkluzar su per barikado to b. oneself; obstruktar per barikado, barikade klozar, barikadizar to b.
barito* (chem.) baryta.
baritono baritone; baritonvoco b. voice.
barko bark: small boat as wherry, punt, skiff. Def.: Mikra kanoto senmasta, movanta per remili, e ne generale uzata in maral aqui; (mitol.) la paromo di C(h)aron en la rivero Styx.
barkarolo barcarolle: (Venetian) boat song.
barkaso long-boat, launch (of a war-ship).
barografo barograph.
baroka odd, queer-looking, uncouth, baroque, bizarre; ill-shped, distorted (of pearls); barokeso oddness; barokajo an oddity. Def.: Qua havas aspekto nereguloza o stranja (ex. perlo, stilo); IV-2.
barometro barometer.
baron(ul)o baron; baronino baroness; baroneso (rank, dignity) barony; baronaro (collect.) baronage; baronio (domain) barony.
baroskopo baroscope.
barsho (ich.) umbrina.
barto whalebone; bartizar to stiffen, fit with w.
basamento (arch.) basement. V. exp.: Ne konfunenda kun fundamento: basamento esas l'infra parto (bazo) videbla di edifico, qua jacas sur la fundamento; III-670.
baseno (dock, river, water-works) basin; (geog.) valley, hollow; (dish) deep, wide pan; balno baseno wash-b.; fish baseno fish-pond; pulver baseno pan (of a flint-lock).
basko flap, skirt, tail (of a garment); baskorobo (garment) basquine.

baskular (intr.) to see-saw: sway up and down; baskuligar to make s.s., to rock back and forward; baskulilo a see-saw; swing (for play); rocker (of a chiar); sweep (of a well); (tech.) rocking lever; baskulcharioto, baskulveturo dump-cart; tumbril-cart (for the condemned); baskulstulo rocking chair; levponto kun baskulilo draw-bridge with plyer, bascule bridge. Def.: Baskulilo en teknikal mekaniko esas levero, qua ne ocilas spontane (pro sua propra pezo), ma falas de un pozeso ad altra, sub influo di pezo o forco e ne rivenas a l'antea pozeso se altra (kontrea) pezo o forco ne agas; III-72.
basono (mus. instr.) bassoon.
basoto dachshund, basset-hound. Def.: Hundo karakterizata da gambi tre kurta e tordita; VI-604.
basto (bot.) bast, fiber: inner fibrous bark.
bastarda, bastardo bastard, illegitimate (of children); mongrel (of animals); hybrid (of animals, plants, etc.).
bastingo (nav.) quarter-netting, waist-cloth; bastingizar to rig the boarding-nettings.
bastiono (fort.) bastion.

bastono stick, staff, cane, cudgel; bastoneto baton; bastonagar, bastonbatar to cudgel, cane; bastonago, bastonbato beating, bastinade; bastonskermisto cudgel-player; biliard bastono billiard cue; espad bastono sword-cane; komando bastono staff, baton of command; pesko bastono fishing pole; tambur bastono drum-stick; bastonifar to make sticks, canes.

batar (tr.) to beat: strike repeatedly (ulu, ulo); bat(ad)o beating, striking, drubbing; batanto, batero, batemo beater (person); batilo beater (instr.); batita beaten; (dispute) interbatar, batar reciproke fight, quarrel, exchange of blows; batar la pedo to beat (the soles of) the feet; batar per vergo to strike with a ferule; batar sur la glutei to beat on the buttocks; batar per l'ali to beat the wings; pulso bato beat of the pulse. V, exp. Frapar, batar: Frapar esas la plu general termino: ol aplikesas ad omna shoko, korpala o mentala: »Me frapas me kontre la muro; on frapis la pordo; to frapis mea okuli, mea atenco, mea spirito«. Batar esas donar ad ulu od ulo plura frapi sucedante, generale per utensilo: ad ulu, por dolorigar lu; ad ulo por netigar ol (batar sidili, tapisi). Bato esas do esnce volata e duranta ago, sempre korpala; III-349.
bataliar* (intr.) to (give) battle; -o: battle (between armies); bataliagro battlefield; (cf. kombatar, militar).
bataliono (milit.) battalion,

batelo launch, barge, lighter; boat(s) (in general); bateleto small boat, skiff; bateledo boatful; batelisto boatman; batelestro boat-captain; batelponto bridge of b.s; drag batelo dredger; exkurs batelo excursion b.; fish batelo fishing b.; kanal batelo canal-b.; karbon batelo coal-b.; batelo de karbono boat filled with coal; pilot batelo pilot-b.; rem batelo row-boat; seglo batelo sail-b. Def.: General nomo donita ad omnaspeca naveti, ma precipue a naveti di pasable granda dimensioni, quale gabari, e.c.
baterio (milit., elec.) battery.
batisto battiste: cambric; batista naztuko c. pocket-handkerchief.
batrako (zool.) batrachian.
bavar (intr.) to slobber, drool, slaver; bavotuko bib. V. exp.: Bavar esas lasar fluar la salivo ek la boko. Do bavajo esas nur salivo ekfluanta (on povas anke bavar snago, e.c.).
bayo bay (cf. golfo).
bayoneto bayonet; espado bayoneto sword-b.; prizentar la bayoneto to bring the b. to a charge; bayonetagar to b. (ulu), to use the b.; skermar per la bayoneto to fence with the b.

bazo base: lowest part of anything, foundation, bottom, foot; (fig.) basis, foundation, grounds; (chem.) base; bazala, bazatra basal, basic; bazajo something which is basic; basement; bazlineo (math.) base-line; arko bazo springing (of an arch); sen baza baseless; bazokrusto (cook.) under crust; Ex.: La bazo di monto, di piedestalo, di triangulo, di sistemo, di yusteso, di metalo.
bazalto (geol.) basalt.
bazaro baza(a)r.
bazilo (bot.) sweet-basil (Ocimum basilicum).
baziliko (arch.) basilica.
bazilikveino (anat.) basilic vein.
bazilisko (myth., zool.) basilisk.
bear (intr.) to open the mouth, to gape (fig.) to yawn; spektadar beante to look gapingly. Def.: Apertar la boko, anke en figurala senco »beanta truo«; III-386.
beata blissful, blessed; (iron.) sanctimonious; beateso (state) bliss; (rel.) beatitude.
beatifikar* (tr., Cath., rel.) to beatify.
bechika (med.) bechic, pectoral: cough relieving.
bedo (agri., hort.) bed; floro bedo flower-b.; sterko bedo hot bed, forcing-bed; gazon bedo grass--plot.
bedelo beadle: apparitor; usher. Def.: La nomo di ta qua preiras o sequas la procesioni (generale religiala); VII-43.
Beduin(ul)o a Bedouin.
begino beguine: a kind of nun in the Netherlands; beginkofio b. cap.
begonio (bot.) begonia.

beko beak: bill of a bird; (tech.) beak, spout (of a vessel); bekedo a beakful; bekagar, bekpikar to peck (at); bekagado pecking; bekagar reciproke to peck at each other; bekforma beak formed; en bekigar, beknutrar to feed (young birds, etc.).
bekafiko (orni.) beccafico, garden warbler, fig-eater (Sylvia hortensis).
bekaso (orni.) woodcock (Scolopax rusticola); bekaseto snipe (Scolopax gallinula).

bela beautiful, fine, handsome; beleta, belata pretty, rather handsome; bel(ul)o a handsome person; belete prettily; belino a belle; belajo a b. object; beleso (quality) beauty; belet beleso prettiness; belacho fop, cox-comb, insipid beauty; beligar to beautify, embellish; beleskar to become, grow b.; bela stroko a lucky, fine stroke, hit or happening; lo bela The Beautiful. Ant.: leda
beladono (bot., med.) belladonna (Atropa belladona).
belemnito (fossil.) belemnite.
belvedero (arch.) belvedere. DEFIR
bemolo* (mus.) flat.

bendo bank: long, narrow piece of cloth, paper, metal, etc., strip, stripe, streak; fillet (for head), (hat) band; bendizar to bind up, place a band on; sen bendigar to take off the band, unband; agro bendo a strip of field; bordo bendo piping, welt (of cloth); ledro bendo strip, slip, band of leather; plat bendo (arch.) platband; bendosegilo b. saw; (cf. strio). Def.: Surfaco limitizita per du linei paralela; IV - 463. Ex. La standardo di Usa kontenas bendi (alterne reda, blanka), ne strii.
»benedicite« grace (before meals).
benedikar (tr.) to bless, pronounce a benediction on.
benediktano* Benedictine (monk or nun); kuvento di benediktani B. convent.

benefico (eccl.) benefice, living; reprezento benefico (theat.) benefit performance (where the proceeds are given to some particular person or purpose); beneficiero beneficiary: holder of a benfice; recipient of the profits from a benefit performance.
Bengalucelo* (orni.) Bengal finch.
benigna benign: kind, morally good; mild (of medicines, diseases).
benko bench, long seat, settle, form; (in boats) thwart; benkoveturo wagonette: wagon with long sets. Def.: Sidilo longa (ligna ex.) kun o sen dors-apogilo; II-647.
benzino benzine, benzene; benzinmotoro b. motor.
benzoo (bot.) benzoin; resin from the tree Styrax benzoin.
benzoato* benzoate (a salt); benzoatacido aenzoic acid.
benzolo* benzol(e).
bequadro* (mus.) natural.
bero berry; beratra bacciform, berry-like; berportanta, berifanta bacciferous, berry producing; vit bero grape; sika vit bero raisin; frangul bero alder-berry; muskat bero muscatel grapes.
Berberia, Berberiala of, relating to Barbary; Berbero a Berber.
berberiso (bot.) barberry, berberry, (fruit); berberisiero b. bush (Berberis vulgaris).
beredo* beret: round, flat cap such as worn by Basque peasants.
berenjeno (bot.) aubergine, mad-apple, egg-plant (Solanum Melongene).
bergamoto, bergamotoranjo bergamot pear, -orange; bergamotiero b. tree; (Citrus Bargamia, Bergamota); bergamotesenco essence of b.
berilo (min) beryl.
berjero cushioned arm-chair.
berlino berlin: a kind of coach.
berloko trinket, charm (such as attached to watch chains).
bermo (fort. and gen.) berme: narrow shelf. Def.: Parto horizontal en taluso.
bernaklo (orni.) bernicle-goose (Branta bernicla).
bersar (tr.) to rock (a child); bers(ant)e dormigar to lull to sleep; bersilo cradle; bersokanto lullaby, cradle-song.
bes (mus.) B flat.

bestio beast, any animal except man, (cf. animalo, bruto) bestiala, bestiatra bestial; bestialeso bestiality (cf. brutaleso); bestiaro fauna, beasts (collect.); bestiala debocho bestial debauchery; kargo bestio b. of burden; tir bestio draught animal; bestioedukado rearing of animals; bestiokaptisto trapper; bestiokulto zoolatry, animal worship; bestiotrupo herd, drove, flock.
bestiario* (rom. antiq.) bestiarius: person doomed to fight with wild beasts.
beto (bot.) beet (genus: Beta); (cf. betravo).
betelo betel (Piper betle); betelajo betel: a masticatory.
betono beton: concrete; betonizar to cover with c.; beton(iz)ajo object covered with c.; betono ferizita reinforced c.; betona masonuro c. masonry.
betonio* (bot.) betony (Betonica officinalis).
betravo beetroot, beet (edible: Beta Rapa); (cf. beto).
bezigo bezique; a card game.
bezoaro bezoar.

bezonar (tr.) to need; be in want of something necessary; bezono need; bezonata needed, wanted; ne plus bezonar to have no further need of, use for; bezonar dormar to need to sleep; en kazo di bezono in case of n.: if n. be, if needful; ocito, rido bezono to have an inclination to yawn, laugh; sen bezona unneeded; bezonar pekunio to n. money; la bezoni publika the public necessities (or requirements); la bezoni korpala the bodily needs; la bezoni di la anmo the needs of the soul; (cf. indijar, mankar).
biblo Bible; biblala Biblical; biblocitajo passage from the B.; biblexperta versed in the B.
bibliofilo bibliophile: book-lover.
bibliografio bibliography; bibliografiisto bibliographer.
bibliomanio bibliomania; bibliomaniiko bibliomaniac.
bicepso* (anat.) biceps.
biciklo bicycle; biciklego a large b.; the old-fashioned, high b.; biciklisto, biciklero cyclist; viral, mulieral biciklo a man's. a woman's b.; biciklirar to bicycle.
bidenta (anat.) bidentate; two-toothed.
bideto (furniture) bidet; a kind of Sitz bath.
bidono can (for oil etc.) (milit.) canteen. Def.: Ladovazo klozita por oleo, petrolo, benzino, e.c. qua kontenas de un til 10 litri; gurdatra kontenilo ek lado, quan la soldato portas. (III

bielo (mach.) connecting-, side-rod; kuplo bielo coupling-rod; bielkapo cross-head. Def.: Stango qua ligas un peco ad altra, generale, stango di pistono a manivelo, e transformas movo rektolinea a movo rotaca. II
bifsteko beefsteak.

bifurkar (tr. intr.) to bifurcate, branch off (from), fork (ek, kun) bifurko, bifurkeyo bifurcation, crotch (of a tree); bifurkilo (R.R.) point, switch; bifurkostationo R. R. junction; bifurkeyo, bifurkovoyo junction of two roads; bifurkanta forked.
bigama bigamous; bigameso bigamy; bigam(ul)o bigamist.
bigota bigoted; bigot(ul)o a b.; bigoteso bigotry; bigotesar to be b.
bikapa bicephalous; two-headed.
bikolora bi-colored.
bikonkava bi-concave.
bikorna bi-cornous: two horned; bia chapelo bicornered hat.
bikotiledono, bia dicotyledon(ous).
bikursala* (math.) bicursal.
bikuspida (dento) bicuspid.
bilo bile, gall (fluid); bilala vaskuli b. ducts; biloveziko gall-bladder; biloza bilious; bilkalkolo gallstone.
bilanco (com. fin.) balance, balance-sheet; facar bilanco di to b., draw a b. of (an account).
bilatera bi-lateral.
bilkoketo cup and ball (used in a game).
bilgo (nav.) bilge, lower part of a hold, well.
biliardo (game) billiards; biliardeyo b. hall or room; biliardobastono b. cue; biliardotablo b. table; biliardobulo b. ball.

bilieto a written order or ticket; banko bilieto bank-note; teatro bilieto theater ticket; fervoyala bilieto railway-ticket; bilieto kun retroveno return trip ticket; komercala bilieti commercial paper: notes in hand, promissory notes, bills of exchange; lojo bilieto (milit.) official requisition on a person for lodging; lojio bilieto box ticket (theater); gratuita bilieto free-pass; kontrol bilieto check (theater).
bilingua bilingual.
biliono billion: a million millions: (1,000,000,000,000) N. B. not as in U.S.: a thousand millions.
biloba (bot.) bilobate.
bilorneto opera-glass, (double) field-glass.
bimanua (zool.) bimanous; bimanual.
bimetalismo bimetalism; bia, biala bimetallic.
binara (math., mus., chem.) binary.
bindar (tr.) to bind (books); bind(ad)o binding (act); binduro binding (result); bindisto book-binder; ne bindita unbound; karton bindar to bind in boards; ledro binduro leather binding.
bineto (garden-) hoe; binetagar to hoe.

binoklo double eye-glass; binokl(if)isto eye-glass maker, optician; naz binoklo nose-glasses; orel binoklo spectacles; manu binoklo glasses with handle; etuyo di binoklo case for eye-glasses. Def.: Du okulvitri solidara. V
binokulara (opt.) binocular.
binomio, binomiala (math.) binomial.
biodinamiko* biodynamics.
biogenezo* biogenesis.
biografio biography; biografiala biographical; biografiero, biografiisto biographer.
biokemio* biochemistry.
biologio biology; biologiisto biologist.
bipeda, bio biped.
biplano (aeron.) biplane.
bipunto (print.) colon.
biquadrata (math.) biquadratic.
biro beer; birifar to brew; biriferio brewery; birifisto brewer; bir(vend)erio beer selling establ.; biroglaso beer glass; glaso de biro a glass of beer.
birefraktar (intr.) to be birefracting, birefringent.
biremo bireme.
bireto biretta: R. C. ecclesiastic square cap; kardinal bireto cardinal's b.
birko birch-tree (genus: Betula); birkoligno b. wood.
bis twice, (in theaters) encore! repeat! klamar bis to encore; (repetition of numbers); No. 3 bis No. 3 twice or again; bis (mus.) B sharp.
biso (fabric, zool., bot.) byssus.
bisako (beggar's) double-wallet, -pouch.
bisekar (tr.) to bisect (geom.)
bisextila bisextile; bisextila yaro leap-year.
bisexua bisexual.
bisidilo seat for two persons, small sofa.
bisilaba dissyllabic.
bisko bisk (soup).
biskoto rusk, zwieback. Def.: Loncho de pano rostita o grilita; III
bismuto bismuth.
bisquito (U. S.) cracker; (England) biscuit; bisquitiferio cracker bakery; bisquito navala hardtack.
bistra, bistro bistre: a dark-brown pigment.
bisturio (surg.) bistoury.
bito (nav.) bitt.

bitra (lit. and fig.) bitter: hot and acid; sharp, poignant; biting; acrimonious; bitreso bitterness; bitrajo a b. thing; bitrigar to make (ulo) bitter; (fig.) to embitter; absinto esas bitra absinth (wormwood) is bitter; bitre plorar to cry bitterly; reprocho bitra sharp, severe reproach; bitra mandeli bitter almonds; bitra quale bilo a b. as gall. Ant. sukra, dolcega.
bitumo bitumen; (cf. asfalto).
bivakar (intr.) to bivouac; bivakeyo a b. (place). V. exp.: Bivakar esas kampar sen tendi, sub la cielo (generale cirkum fairi), nun por un nokto; II
bivalva, bio bivalve.
bizancala, bizancatra, bizancana diletante (in discussion); bizancano quibbler. Def.:Qua prizas perdar sua tempo en diskutar subtilaji neutila; IV
bizantina (fig.) Byzantine.
bizelo (carp.) beveled-edge, feather-edge, chamfer; bizelizar to bevel; bizelizita beveled; bizelizo, bizeluro beveling; bizelizilo a bevel. Def.: Bordo (di planko, cizelilo, e.c.) tranchita oblique.
bizono (zool.) bison (Bos americanus).
blamar (tr.) to blame, find fault with, reprobate, disapprove the actions or conduct of (ulo, pri, pro). V. exp.: vid. reprochar Ant.: laudar.

blanka white; (fig.) blank: not written or printed on (page, etc.), blanko, blankulo, blankino a white person; blankeso whiteness; blankajo a white object; blankatra whitish; blankigar to whiten, to bleach (clothes): blankeskar to become or turn white; blanke vestizita dressed in white; blanka signaturo signature in blank; blankahara white haired; Ant.: nigra.
blastemo* (biol.) blastema.
blato cockroach (Blatta.)

blazar (tr.) to blunt, pall, cloy, sicken (ulu, pri ulo); blazesar to be palled, surfeited; ecesi blazas la gusto excesses pall the taste; forta liquori blazas la palato strong liquors blunt the sensibilities of the palate; il blazesis da la kustumo di indulgo habitual indulgence made him blase.

blazono blazon: coat of arms, armorial bearing; blazonarto heraldry; blazonala heraldic; blazonlibro book of hearaldry; blazonizar to put armorial bearings on; interpretar blazono to explain a blazon.
blendo (min.) blende: sulphuret of zinc.
blezar (tr.) to lisp. Def.: Pronuncar s quale th angla o c hispana (t. e. kun la lango-pinto inter la denti); III

blinda blind, sightless; (fig.) deluded; ignorant; blindo, blindulo, blindino a b. person; blindeso, blindigo, blindesko blindness; blinde, blindatre blindly; blindigar to cause blindness to; blindesar to be b.; blindeskar to become b.; blinda entuziasmo b. enthusiasm; blinda obediemeso implicit obedience; blindoludo blindman's buff.

bloko block, lump (of wood, stone, iron, etc.); bloke in bulk, in the lump; blokala exkluzo (sociol.) lock-out; ligna bloko wooden block; komprar, vendar bloke to buy, sell in the lump; blokoventuro truck (for heavy loads). Def.: La toto di korpo; una amaso granda e pezoza.
blokhauso* (milit.) blockhouse.
blokusar (tr.) to blockade (a port), to invest (a town); blokuseso, blokusstando state of b.; des blokusar to raise a b. of
blonda blond, fair-colored; blondacha »peroxide blond«.
blotisar (intr.) to lie close to the ground, crouch, cower; (cf. squatar). Ex.: Blotisar en angulo; blotisar dop hego o pordo.

blua blue; bluo b. (the color); blueso blueness (quality); bluema, bluatra bluish; bluajo something b.; bluigar, blueskar, bluesar to make, become, be b.; bluetigar to b. (linen); azur blua azure b.; bluciel blua sky-b.
blutar (tr.) to bolt, sift (flour, meal); blutilo sifter.
bluzo blouse (as worn by workers, painters); smock (peasant's).
boao (zool.) boa constrictor.
boafuro boa: a fur comforter.
bobino bobbin (for winding thread), spool; (cf. spulilo).
bodrucho goad-beater's skin.
bofiliino daughter-in-law; boulo son-in-law.
bofratulo brother-in-law.
bogio bogie-frame, -truck. Def.: Ensemblo di quar (o du) roti qui formacas vagoneto e surportas l'extremajo di vagono o di lokomotivo; III
boikotar (tr.) to boycott.

boko (anat.) mouth; orifice, opening, entrance (of a utensil, implement, volcano, harbor, etc.); bokedo mouthful; boko sentema a tender m.; bokopeko m. piece (of musical instruments, etc.); bokostopar to gag; bokostopilo a gag; dopa boko back of m.; bokotuko napkin; bokobruiso mouth noise (in eating); bokotukoringo napkin-ring; boko di fusilo the m. of a gun.
bokalo glass-jar. Def.: Vazo cilindra o cilindratra, ek vitro, sen pedo, kun plato fundo el larja boko, uzata precipue en kemio, farmacio (e por konfituri); II
bolo bowl; boledo b. full.
»bolero« bolero: a Spanish dance.
boleto (bot.) boletus; boleto manjebla esculent b.

boliar (intr.) to boil: be in a state of ebullition (cf. ebuliar); boliigar to boil (ulo); boliokarno boiling-beef; boliopoto kettle; boliotubo boiler-tube: boliovarma boiling hot; ante boliar l'aquo murmuras the water sings before boiling; boliopunto boiling point.
bolido (astr.) bolide: brilliant meteor.
bolto bolt: long iron-pin; boltagar (tr.) to bolt (ulo); boltifar to make b.s.; boltizar to put a b. on.
bomatro mother-in-law.
bombo bomb (-shell); bombifisto b. maker; bombespruva b.-proof.
bombinatoro* orange-speckled toad (Bombinator igneus).

bona good; bone well; bonega exquisite, excellent; bono, bonulo, bonino a g. person; boneso goodness; bonacha silly, simple; bonajo a g. thing; bonigar to make (ulu, ulo) g.; plu bonigar to better; boneskar to become, grow g. or better; bonigo, bonesko betterment, improvement; bona stando (state of) well-being; lo bona The Good (abstract); maxim bona posible as g. as possible; bonanma g. souled, g. natured, gentle; bona Deo good God; bonfacar (intr.) to do g., be a benefactor; (tr.) to do good to (ulu); bonfaco benefaction, good-office, benefit, favor; bonfacanto, bonero benefactor; bonfacemeso beneficence; bonfacanta, bonera, bonema beneficient, beneficial; bonhumora genial, good-tempered (fig.) jolly, playful, sprightly; dicar o dezirar bonjorno to wish good-day, good-morning (ad ulu); bonodorar (intr.) to smell sweet or nice; bonodorizar to perfume, scent; bonsemblanta well seeming, specious; bonveno, bonanta, bonoza welcome; bonvivanto bon-vivant, high-liver; bonvolar (intr.) to be kindly disposed, (tr.) to wish well to (ulu); bonvolo benevolence, good-will. Ant.: mala.
bonbono bonbon: confection, sweet-meat.

bonimentar (intr.) to make a mountebank's speech, claptrap speech. Def.: Bonimento: diskurso fanfaronema, quan facas la sharlatani e feriala aktori por laudar sua vari od aktraktar la publiko. Bonimentar: facar bonimento; IV
bonzo bonze: Buddhist priest.
boparento wife's or husband's relative; boeso relationship by marriage.
bopatrulo father-in-law.
borar (tr.) to bore, pierce (with a turning instrument); bor(ad)o boring (act); boruro bore (result); borilo borer, drill; borileto gimlet. Def.: Truifar kun rotaco (vid. perforar); III
boro* (chem.) boron.
boracho (bot.) borage (Borago).
boraxo (chem.) borax.
borborigmo (med.) borborygm: rumbling of water or wind in the stomach.

bordo border, margin, brink, edge, brim, (ship's) side; bordizar to edge, hem, border (ulo); bordumo trimming, edging, piping, selvedge, (of clothing); bordizuro (of ships) planking, sheathing; bordo an bordo alongside, edge to edge; reze la bordo full to the brim; super la bordo over the edge; bordopetro curb stone.
boreo (poet.) boreas, north-wind; boreala boreal. Def.: Mitologiala nomo di la nordvento, de qua venas boreala; III
borso bourse: stock-exchange; borsagento stock-broker; borsokurso b. quotations, market-price; borsokrako b. panic.
bosajo (arch.) bossage, boss-work.
boselar (tr., tech.) to emboss, chase (plate, leather). Def.: Formacar reliefi en metalo per martelago (de interne); VI-382.
bosko a small wood; bosketo grove, coppice, bosk; boskala, boskoza woody, bosky; boskobat(ad)o battue; hunt, beat; querk bosko a wood of oaks.
bostono (card-game, dance) boston.

boto boot (long, as for riding); boteto shoe; half-b. (cf. shuo); botizar to put, pull on boots; botifar to make b.s; botvenderio b.-selling establ.; botformizilo b. tree, -last; botdesmetilo, bottirilo b.jack; laco boteto laced shoe; laco di boto boot-lace; paro de boti a pair of b.s. Def.: Boto kontenas la gambo, e boteto kontenas l'infra gambo. IV-101.
botaniko botany; botanikala gardeno botanical garden; botanikisto botanist.
botanizar (intr.) to botanize, herborize. Def.: Kolektar por la botanikal studio (ne praktikar o studiar la botaniko); III-169.

botelo bottle; boteleto small b. (for drugs, etc.); botelego (grosa): carboy; botelfakaro bottle-rack; (fg.) wine-bin. V. exp.: Flakono esas mikra botelo, kun stopilo generale vitra o metala. Fialo esas mem min granda, kun streta kolo (boko), quale on uzas precipue por farmacial liquidi; II-645.

bovo a beef; bull, cow, ox; bovulo bull, ox; bovino cow; bovyuno calf; bovyunino heifer; bovkarno beef, meat; boveyo, bovstablo cattle stall or stable; bovgardisto, bovduktisto cowherd, drover; bovala bovine; bovofeko cow-dung; bovolumbo sirloin; laktifanta, lakto bovino milch-cow.
boxar (tr.) to box; boxanto, boxero boxer; boxisto pugilist; boxuro boxing-blow; boxogant(eg)o boxing-glove; boxokombato boxing-match.
boyo (nav.) buoy; boyego large buoy; bollard; salv boyo life buoy.
boyaro (title) boyar(d).
braco (nav.) brace of a yard; bracagar to brace (a rope of a yard).
braceleto bracelet.
bracho (knee-) breeches, knickerbockers (cf. pantalono); brachizar to but b. on; sen brachigar, des brachizar to take b. off; brachifisto b. maker; brachjunturo flat of b.
bradipo (zool.) bradypus: the sloth.
brako brach-hound; Def.: Speco di chas-hundo, rezapila e oreli pendanta.

brakio arm (anat. and fig. as a. of sea); brakiala brachial; brakiedo armful; brakiumo brassard, armlet (to show function or office); brakiotruo a.hole; ye brakiodisto at arm's length; kun brakii interplektita a. in a.
brakicefala brachycephalous.
brakiopodo brachiopod.
brakistokrono* (math.) brachistrochrone.
brakteo (bot.) bract(ea).
bramano Brahman; bramanismo Brahmanism.
brano bran; branopano b.bread.
brando (fire-)brand; a piece of wood partly burnt; brandoagitar to stir up, poke the fire.
brandio brandy.
brandisar (tr.) to brandish, flourish (a sword, etc.).
brankardo; i shaft(s) (of a cart, wagon, etc.) V. exp.: Brankardo ne esas timono: veturo havas, od un timono (por du kavali) o du brankardi (por un kavalo, o tri kavali); IV-136.
brankio (zool.) branchia: gill.
brankiopodo (zool.) branchiopod.
brasar (tr.) to stir: mix up ingredients; (fig.) to concoct, contrive, polot, (schemes, plots, etc.); afer brasisto company promoter, etc. Ex.: Brasar oro ed arjento en la kruzelo.
brava brave, valiant, valorous, bold; brav(ul)o a b. person; braveso (quality) bravery; bravajo a b. act; bravacho swaggerer, blusterer; brave bravely; (interj.) bravo!
bravurario (mus.) bravura (-air).
brazar to braze: join with spelter (hard solder). V. exp.: vid. weldar.
brecho breach, break, gap, opening (in a wall, etc.) dentobrechoza gap-toothed; brechizar to make a breach, gap in (ulo).
breko break; light wagonette.
brelano brelan: a card game.
bremo (ich.) bream (Abramis Brama).
bretelo strap (to carry a knapsack, pack, etc.) strap, sling (for a musket, rifle); brace, suspender (to hold up trousers); breteli, paro a pair of suspenders, braces.
brevo (pope's) brief.
breviaro (rel.) breviary.

brezo embers, live coals; brezkoquar to broil, braise (in e.); brezuyo, brezkoquilo broiler, braiser; brezbaseno brazier, warming-pan. Def.: Ligno konvertita en karbono per komusto, sive ardoranta, sive extingita; II-708.
brido bridle (of a horse) (fig.) check, curb; brideto snaffle-b.; bridizar to a b. on; bridagar (fig.) to check.
brigo (nav.) brig; brigseglo spanker.
brigado (milit.) brigade; brigadgeneralo brigadier-general.
brigantino (nav.) brigantine.

briko brick; briketo, karbon briko briquette, patent fuel; brikea b. colored; brikizar to b. up; brikifar to make b.s; brikiferio b.-kiln, -yard; briko polisanta bathbrick; brikomasonisto brickmason; brikimituro b. imitation; brikkonstruktado, brikmasonado brick-laying.

brilar (intr.) to shine: emit or reflect light; be luminous, bright, brilliant, radiant; to glitter, glisten (cf. cintilifar); brilaro, brilareso sheen, shining, brilliancy; brilaregar to be resplendent, to glare; brilaranta stilo brilliant style; Ex.: La suno, steli, oro, okuli brilas.
brilianto (gem.) brilliant, diamond.
brino short end or bit (of a cord, rope); Def.: Parto (seciono o segmento) di kordo; V-157.
briocho brioche; a buttered cake or roll.
briska brisk, lively, sprightly.
brizo breeze (of wind); brizoza breezy.
brizanto sunken-reef, -rock. V. exp.: Rifo salias super l'aquo, ma brizanto esas rokajo reze l'aquo, sur qua la ondi ruptesas; V
brocho brooch; brochopinglo breast-pin, scarf-pin; safety-pin.
brodar (tr.) to embroider: ornament with figures, needle-work.
brokantar (intr.) to deal in second-hand goods; brokantisto, brokantero broker: second-hand dealer.
brokato (fabric) brocade.
brokatelo (fabric and min.) brocatel.
brokolikaulo* broccoli: a hardy variety of cauliflower (Brassica oleracea botrytis).
bromo (chem.) bromine.
bronkio (anat.) bronchus; bronkiala bronchial; bronkii bronchia.
bronkito (med.) bronchitis.
bronzo bronze; bronzea b. colored; bronzizar to bronze; bronzo gisita cast in b.
brosar (tr.) to brush (the hair, etc.); brosilo a b.
brovo eye-brow, brow; brovala superciliary; brovoza thick-browed; brovagar, brovmovar, brovkontraktar to knit one's b.s to frown, flinch.
bruo husk, shell (of nuts). Def.: Verda shelo (generale, di nuco); III
brueto wheelbarrow; bruetagar, bruetportar to wheel in a b.

bruisar (intr.) to make a noise: rustle, rattle, rumble, clatter, hum; bruis(ad)o noise of any kind, but chiefly when loud or disagreeable; rattle, rumbling, roaring, whistling (of wind); report (of a gun); bang, slam (of a door), etc; bruisego a loud noise; crash, din, tumult, uproar; bruisetar to rustle, murmur; bruisigar to cause (ulo) to make a noise, to rattle.

brular (tr., intr.) to burn: consume with fire (wood, coal, oil); to wound or injure with fire; to scorch, parch, dry up; (fig.) to be inflamed (with passion), to be ardent; brul(ad)o burning (act); bruleso burning (taste, smell); blight; brulbruloleo lamp oil, coal oil, kerosene; brulspegulo burning glass; brulajo a burnt object; brulita burnt; bruluro, brulvunduro a burn; brulebla combustible, inflammable; brulodoro smell of burning; Ex.: La Romani brulis Carthage. La suno brulas la planti. V. exp.:Brular esas la vulgara, kombustar esas la ciencala vorto. On uzas brular ne nur por kombusti videbla, kun flamo, ma anke por la vundi facita da bolianta aquo. Altraparte, on uzas kombustar por omna oxidigo, mem nerapida e nevidebla: ex: la respirado esas kombusto; explozo esas anke kombusto. Nur la vulgara vorta uzesas metafore; on dicas »Me kordio brulas de amo.« On povas dicar, ke ulo kombustar sen brular, se ol nek flamifas nek ardoras (t.e. divenas fairoreda); IV

bruna brown; dusky, swarthy (complexioned), dark (haired); brunino a dark (dark-haired, dark-complexioned) woman; brunetino brunette; brunatra brownish; brunigar to make b., darken; (fig.) to sunburn; brunreda red-brown, baycolored; brunora, brunea golden b.; bruneskar to turn b.
bruska brusque: gruff, abrupt, blunt (in address or manners); bruska departo abrupt departure; bruska repliko a gruff reply; bruskeso abruptness, rudeness; bruskajo offensive language, act or manner.

bruto brute (animal; fig. of man); brutala brutal; brutaleso brutality (cf. bestialeso); brutalajo an act of brutality; brutigar to brutalize; bruteskar to become brutalized; brutatra, brutema brutish; brutiganta brutalizing; brutale traktar to treat (ulu) brutally.
bub(ul)o a street Arab, gamin; bubino gypsy-like girl; hoyden; bubacho young scamp, blackguard. Def.: Mizeroza o malicoza puero vaganta en la stradi; IV-101.
bubalo (zool.) bubalis: African antelope (Bubalis
bubono (med.) bubo; bubonala, bubonoza pesto bubonic plague.
buchar (tr.) to butcher, slaughter (animals); bucherio abattoir.

budar (intr.) to be sulky, sullen, look sour (cf. facar muzelo); bud(ad)o sulking; budera, budero, budema, budemo sulky (person). Def.: Manifestar nekontenteso, mala humoro per silenco, agado, expreso di la fizionomio. Ex.: La puero budas, nam ilua patrino ne permisas ke il ludas.
budjeto (fin.) budget.
buduaro boudoir: lady's private room.

bufar (intr.) to swell, puff out; to distend (as cheeks by blowing); to stand out (as stout silks, starched muslin, etc.); bufigar to cause to puff, swell out; stofo bufanta stuff that stands out well (does not cling to the figure).
bufalo (zool.) buffalo; bufalledro b. leather, hide.
bufeto buffet: refreshment foom (at balls, R.R. stations, etc.).

bufono buffoon, jester, clown, merry-andrew; bufonala, bufonatra buffoonlike, facetious; bufonaji buffoonery; bufonesar to be a b.; (fig.) to be jocose; bufonopera opera bouffe; bufonkantisto comic singer; facar bufonaji to play the b.; make jests.
bufro buffer (as on R.R.).
buglo key-bugle. Def.: Trumpeto kun klavi.
bugrano buckram. Def.: Tolo forta e rigida (gumizita); III-73.
buho* great-owl, eagle-owl (Bubo maximus); (cf. IV-296).
bujio candle (made from wax, etc.); (surg.) bougie.
buketo bouquet, nosegay; buketuyo, buketvaso b.holder.
buklo buckle (of girdle, shoe, etc.); buklopinto tongue of b.; buklagar to b.
bukoliko bucolic (poem).
bulletro (papal) bull. bulbo (bot. anat.) bulb; buloza, bulatra bulbous.
buldogo bulldog.
buletino bulletin. Def.: Mikra jurnalo, revuo, o periodala raporto; III-199.
bulimio (med.) boulimia. Def.: Nenaturala, nesaturebla apetito.
bulino (nav.) bowline. Def.: Kordo qua tensas la seglo per l'infra angulo; VI-530.
buliono broth, bouillon (clear beef soup).
bulvardo boulevard.
bumerango* boomerang.
bunta many-colored; motley, streaked, checkered, piebald, dappled; buntigar, buntizar to varigate (with colors), to streak (with many colors).

buro short-hair or other materials used in stuffing saddle-pads, making mortar, etc.; wad, wadding (for guns); burizar to wad, tamp, pad, stuff; burizilo tamping-bar; ramrod. Def.: Amaso de pili, sive di animali, sive di ula lana o silka stolo; to quon on pozas sur la kargajo di la pafili; III-8.
burasko (nav.) squall; (fig.) outburst of passion. Def.: To ne esas ventego, nek tempesto, ma subita e neduranta ventobato; III-8.
burbiliono core (of boil or abcess).
burdono humble-, bumble-bee. (Bombus)
burelo frieze, baize: a coarse woollen fabric.
bureto (tech.) burette: graduated measuring glass.
burgo borough, market-town.
burgravo (title) burgrave.
burjono burgeon, bud; burjonoza budded, full of buds; burjonifar to bud.
burleska burlesque; ludicrous; burleskajo, la burleska a b.
burnuso bernouse, Arab cloak.
burokrat(ul)o bureaucrat; burokratala bureaucraatic; burokrataro, burokratismo bureaucracy; (fig.) burokratachismo red-tapism.
burso purse, wallet, pocket-book; bursofurtisto, bursero cut-purse, pick-picket. Def.: Saketo por portar moneti en la posho; IV-690.
buso (bot.) box(-wood) tree (genus Buxus); busligna, buso box-wood.
busho thicket, spinney (cf. arbusto); busheyo, bushagro, bushbosko, bushlando bush-land.
bushelo bushel.
busko busk: corset stays.
busolo (mariner's) compass; busolbuxo binnacle.
busprito bowsprit.
busto bust: head and shoulders of body, or as represented in sculpture and painting.
bustrofedono boustrophedon; an ancient mode of writing.

butar (intr.) to stumble, butt, knock, run, strike (sur, kontre ulo); butilo, butbufro buffer: anything so placed as to act as a stop; butstono, butigilo stumbling-block; butjuntar, butpozar to butt-joint; adjust two boards side by side or end for end so as not to overlap (opp. to clinker-build); (cf. klinar and IV-354); kapo, pedo butar to strike with the head or foot (cf. mispazar). Ex.: Ca kavalo butas ye singla pazo.
butiko (Eng.) shop; (U.S.) store; butikisto tradesman, shopkeeper; butikservisto shop-boy, -assistant; butikkomizo (shop-) clerk.
butoro (orni.) bittern (genus Botaurus).
butro butter; butrifar to b. (ulo); butrifeyo b. dairy; butruyo b. dish, b. holder; butrifilo churn; butrolakto b. milk; butrizita pano (a slice of bread and b.).
buvrelo (orni.) bullfinch (Pyrrhula vulgaris, P. rubicilla).
buxo box; letro buxo letter-b.; buxokovrilo b. cover.

ca (abbr. if ica) this (cf. (i)ta); cao this; cai these; cadie today; cahore at this hour; camaniere in this manner; camatine this morning; camonate (during, in this month); canokte tonight; catempe at this time; cayare in this year. Note »This« in Ido is often translated by (i)ta, but when it is necessary to point out a near object or emphasize a particular object ica is used: Kad vu preferas ica od ita kavalo? When ica comes after two nouns, it refers to the latter, ita to the first. When necessary or desirable to indicate the gender of the object referred to, ica is preceded by the proper personal pronoun: ilca, ilci, elca, elci, olca, etc. Ex.: La Yuni e la oldi tre deziras lo: iti (la yuni), pro ke li pensas, ke ol amuzos li, ed ici (la oldi), pro ke li pensas, ke ol esos utila por li. Quon drinkas blanka vino ed elti drinkas nigra kafeo.
car(ul)o czar, tsar; carino czarina; carido child of c.; czarevitch; carala relating to the c.
c.e. (=co esas) i.e. (that is to say).
cedar (tr.) to cede, yield (up); give (up); to assign (property);(cf. alienar); cedo yielding, relinquishment; cedema conciliatory; cedebla transferable, assignable; cedario grantee, assignee.
cedilio (gram.) cedilla.
cedro (bot.) cedar (-tree).
cedrato (fruit) cedrate: a kind of citron (cf. citrono); cedratiero c. tree; cedratkonfitajo candied c.
cedulo cedula, private memorandum, note
cefalopodo (zool.) cephalopod.
ceko (anat.) caecum.

celar (tr.) to hide, secrete, conceal, keep secret; -ita: hidden, clandestine; cele, celeme secretly, by stealth; celetar, celachar (intr.) to be sly, affect mystery; celachem(ul)o a sly or mysterious person; cele pafar to shoot from cover; celotrovo (game) hide and seek; ludar ye celotrovo to play at hide-and seek. Ant.: revelar, montrar, divulgar.
celebrar (tr.) to celebrate, commemorate. Ex.: Celebrar mariajo, funero, jubileo, aniversario, meso; (III-199).
celerio (bot.) celery.
celulo cell: small room in convent, prison, etc.; small cavity (as in a honey-comb); celulala, celuloza cellular, cellulous.
celuloido celluloid.
celuloso cellulose.
cemento cement: kind of mortar for building, as Portland c.; cementizar to c.; (of teeth) to fill a cavity with c.
cementacar (tr., metall.) to cement: to convert iron into steel, to case-harden; cementaco cementation.

ceno scene, scenery (theat.); cenala scenic: theatrical, dramatic; ceneyo stage; cenoplano, cenaro scenario; en cenigar to put (ulo) on the stage; la ceno chanjas the s. changes; la ceno esas en Roma the s. is in Rome.
cenobito a cenobite.
cenotafio cenotaph.

censo »cense«: amount of taxes, income, which entitles a person to vote; censo elektala electoral qualification. Def.: La revenuo evaluata da la statal autoritati, sive por taxo, sive por ula yuro (elektiveso); III-137.
censoro (Roman magistrate) censor.
censurar (tr.) to censure (mail, books, plays); censuranto, censuristo censor.
»cent« (money) cent (pl. centi).

cento one hundred; (in reckoning interest or fractional parts) cent.; centopla, cento centuple, a hundredfold; centimo a hundredth part (for other derivatives cf. duo); centesma aniversario centenary; centyara centennial; centyarulo, centino, centiero centenarian; yarcento a century; miyar cento a half-century; tri po cento three per cent.
centauro (aston., myth.) centaur.
centaureo (bot.) centaury (Chlora perfoliata Centaurea).
centezimala centesimal (fraction, division).
centiaro centiare: 1.196 sq. yd.
centifolio (bot.) cabbage-rose, centifolious rose (Rosa centifolia).
centigrada centigrade.
centigramo centigram.
centilitro centiliter (0.61028 cu.in.).
centimo (money) centime; centimserchisto pinch-penney, curmudgeon.
centimetro centimeter (0.3937 in.).
centono (mus., litr.) cento.
centro (also fig.) center; centrala central; centraligar to centralise; centralig(ad)o centralization; centraliganta, centrema centralizing.
centrifugar (tr.) to act on something by centrifugal force; centrifugala centrifugal. Def.: Agar, traktar per centrifugala forco; IV
centripetala centripetal.
centurio (Rom. hist.) century: division of 100 men.
centuriono (hist.) centurion.
cepo (bot.) boletus edulis, esculent boletus.
ceptro scepter.
cero wax-taper, church candle.
ceramiko ceramics.
cerato (pharm.) cerate (ointment).
cerbero (pr. and fig.) Cerberus.
cereala, cerealo cereal.
cerebelo (anat.) cerebellum.
cerebro brain; cerebrala cerebral; cerebrago cerebration.

ceremonio ceremony, formalities prescribed by authority or etiquette; ceremoniala ceremonial; ceremoniema, ceremonioza ceremonious, formal; ceremoniaro, i ceremonial, etiquette; facar ceremonii to stand upon ceremonies.
cerfolio (bot.) chervil.
cerizo cherry; ceriziero c. tree; cerizea cerise, c. colored; ceriziereyoc. orchard.
cerizlauro cherry-laurel, laurel-cherry; laurel bay, (Cerasus (prunus) laurocerasus).

cernar (tr., milit., and fig.) to make a circle or ring around, encircle, to beset on all sides, besiege, beleaguer, blockade, invest, hem in; to cut or dig around (a tree); okuli blucernita eyes with dark circles. V.exp: Cernar ne esas simple cirkondar, ma enemike cirkondar ed enklozar, por kaptar. Vorto necesa, ne nur en milital arto, ma metefore en la komuna linguo; IV

certa certain, sure, indubitable, positive; certe certainly, surely, assuredly (cf. sendube); certajo a certainty; certeso certitude, assurance; certigar to certify: make certain, assure, guarantee; certigo certification; certigajo, certuro certificate, testimonal; certiganto certifier, guarantee.
cerumeno cerumen; ear-wax.
ceruzo ceruse: white-lead. Def.: Sub-karbato di plombo, uzata kom farbo blanka; IV
cervo deer; cervino hind, roe; cervulo stag, hart; cervyuno young d.
ces (mus.) C flat.
cesar (tr., intr.) to cease; to come to an end, leave off, stop; cesigar to put a stop or an end to, discontinue; ceso cessation; cesigo discontinuation; sen cesa unceasing.
cesio* (chem. elem.) caesium.
cesto (Rom. antiq.) cestus.
cetaceo (zool.) cetacean animal.
cetero, ceteri rest, remainder; cetere besides, moreover, for that matter, in other respects; e ceteri, cetere (e.c.) et cetera (etc.)
Cezarala Caesarean; Cezarismo Caesarism; Cezarala operaco C. operation.
cezuro (verse) caesura.

chagrenar (intr.) to grieve, to have sorrow; chagrenigar to grieve, render gloomy, sadden; chagreno grief, sorrow: mental suffering (cf. doloro); chagrenanta sorrowful, sad. Ant. chagreno: joyo, gayeso.
chako* (milit. headdress) shako.
chaketo »jacquet«; a kind of backgammon.
chalazo* (bot., embryol.) chalaza.

chalenjo challenge-cup (N.B. not the E. »challenge« (cf. defio). Def.: (Premio en) konkurso en qua la premio ne donesas, ma prestesas dum tempo a la vinkinto, til ke altra partiso vinkas ica e konquestas la premio; VII-198.
chamo (zool.) chamois (Rupicapra tragus); chamopelo shammy-skin, chamois-leather; chamea shammy color, buff.
chamado chamade: trumpet or drum signal for parley.
chamaro (coat) polonaise. Def.: Speco di redingoto kun transversa kordoni avane, polona vesto de revolucional epoko dil XIX yarcento; V-222.
chambelano chamberlain.

chambro chamber, room; (fig.) a house of parliament; chambreto small room; chambraro rooms (collect.), a suite; chambro moblizita a furnished room; chambro di komerco c. of commerce; chambro di deputati c. of deputies; chambrorobo dressing-gown; chambroservisto valet; chambro(serv)istino chambermaid; manjo chambro dining room; balno chambro bath-room.
champanio champagne (wine).
championo champion; championeso championship; championo per libereso c. of liberty; lukto championo c.wrestler.
chanfreno face of a horse (or other animal, from ears to nostrils). Def.: Avana parto di kapo di kavalo; VII-198.

chanjar (tr., intr.) to change, shift; (cf. kambiar, permutar, alterar); chanjebla, chanjema changeable, mutable, fickle. Def.: Substitucar ula kozo ad altra en un sama loko o funciono, anke prenar un kozo vice altra, o pos altra; VII-203. Ulo chanjas, kande, restante la sama esence, ol recevas altra stando, figuro, o qulaeso; III-37. Ex.: Me chanjas mea vesti. Me chanjas la tapiso. El chanjas sua kofio. On chanjas sua fako, vagono, treno, lojeyo (co nule signifikas ke on alteras ta kozi o transformas li; on livas li generale nealterita). Ant.: mantenar, restar, konservar.
chankro (med.) chancre.
chanto the small side or edge of a large flat body; libro pozita sur chanto a book placed on end or edge. Def.: Laterala, streta edro di korpo larja e plata; III-420.
chapo ferrule, cap; (ch. vest) cope; (arch.) coping.

chapelo hat (with brim all around, for man or woman); chapeluyo, chapelbuxo hat-holder, -box; chapelifisto hat-maker; chapelvendisto hat-seller; chapellevo, chapelsaluto a lifting of hat; deprenar la chapelo to take off, remove the hat; chapelo trikorna a three-cornered hat; klerik chapelo clerical hat.
chapitro chapter (of a book).
chapleto chaplet, rosary.

charo (antiq.) chariot; (modern) a two wheeled cart or a four wheeled ornamented car; chareto any light two wheeled cart, jaunting-car, cariole; charedo cart-load; duktisto carter; char(et)agar to cart (ulo); bovo charo ox-cart; funerala charo hearse; triumfala charo triumphal car.
charioto good van, truck: four-wheeled sided wagon for carrying goods; chariotagar to cart, truck. Def.: Kargo-veturo kun quar roti; IV

charjar (tr.) to load, burden (somebody or something with something), to load (a gun), lade (a vehicle); charjobestio beast of burden; charjegita overloaded; super charjar to overload. V. exp.: On kargas vari sur veturo e charjas veturo per vari; (V

charmar (tr.) to charm: delight, captivate, enchant; (cf. ravisar, facinar, sorcar);charmo, charmeso charm, enchantment; charmanto, charmero charmer; charmanta, charmiva charming, delightful, pleasing; charmegar to ravish, greatly enchant.
charniro hinge (of a door, a box, etc.); (mechan.) joint (as compasses); universal charniro (mechan.) universal joint (cf. gondo).
charto charter: document granting special rights or privileges.
chasar (tr., intr.) to chase: hunt; chasajo game; chasantaro hunting party; chaserino huntress; chasfusilo fowling-piece; chasgardisto gamekeeper; chashundo hunting-dog.
chasta chaste: untainted by lewdness; (fig.) refined, pure (in taste, style); chasteso chastity.
chazublo (eccl.) chasuble.

che (prep) at, to, in (somebody's house, home, or place), with (to indicate customs); che la bakisto at the baker's; venez che me come to my house; hiere me esis che mea onklulo yesterday I was at my uncle's; che la Spartani esis kustumo expozar febla infanti it was customary with the Spartans to expose weakly infants.

chefo chief, leader, head; chefa chief (of things; cf. precipua); chefala chief's, relating to the leader; chief; chefeso (position, authority) leadership; chefesar to be chief, be in command; chefinjerioro chief engineer; chefa klefo master-key; chefkontrolisto superintendent, comptroller, overseer; chefministro prime minister, premier; chefsacerdoto chief priest; chefurbo chief town, capital (cf. metropolo).
cheko (bank-) check, cheque; chekokayero c. book.
Cheko Czech.
chera dear (in price), costly; chereso dearness, high price; (plu) cherigar to cause (ulo) to raise in price; chereskar to become, grow dearer. Def.: Multe kustanta; IV
cherpar (tr.) to draw liquids; (cf. rakar); (fig.) to take, borrow. Ex.: Cherpar aquo de fonto, de rivero. Cherpar vino de barelo. La autoro cherpas peco de altra autoro.
chevrono (arch.) chevron (fig.) any inverted V-shaped object, as a rafter.

chifrar (tr.) to write in secret cipher (cf. kriptografar); chifro cipher: secret mode of writing; des chifrar to translate from cipher; (cf. dechifrar). V. exp.: Chifrar expresas l'ago kompozar kriptografuro, t.e. sekreta texto, qua tradukas la vera texto per ula moyeno o regulo nomita klefo. Dechifrado ne esas l'inversa ago di chifrar, ma la deskrovo di la klefo e la traduko di la kriptografuro; V
chigo (ent.) chigoe, jigger (Sarcopsylla penetrans).
chika chic, stylish and original, natty, smart; chikeso chic, knack, skill, address (in doing anything); originality and taste (as in dress).
chilo (physiol.) chyle.
chimo (physiol.) chyme.
chimpanzeo (zool.) chimpanzee.
Chiniana Chinese; Chiniano Chinaman.
Chiniinko Indian-ink.
chiniono chignon: back hair of a woman.
chipa cheap, low (in price). Def.: Poke kustanta; IV-690. Ant.: chera.
chitino (biol.) chitin.
choano choana, posterior nares.

chomar (tr., intr.) to be out of work, to suspend work on, to rest from work; chom(ad)o remaining idle from want of work; chomeso (state) cessation or want of work. Ex.: On chomas la sundii. La laboristi chomas pro blokal exkluzo.
chopino a beer glass (containing about a pint); (fig.) a pint; chopinedo a pintful.
choseo roadway, causeway, travelling part (for horses, carriages, etc.).
chuvo (orni.) jackdaw ((Corvus monedula).
ciano (chem.) cyanogen; ciana acido cyanic acid.
cianhidra cianhydric, hydrocyanic, prussic.
ciatika sciatic; ciatiknevralgio sciatica.
cibolo (bot.) cibol, a kind of onion. (Allium fistulosum).
ciborio (eccl.) pyx, ciborium.
cicisbeo: cicisbeo. Def.: Amoranto di siorino, qua esas quaze oficale agnoskata e servas el publike; V-621.
cidro cider.
cielo (pr. and fig.) sky, heaven; cielala celestial, heavenly; danko a la cielo thanks to heaven, to God! cielblua sky-blue; cielskrapero sky-scraper; cielvulto the celestial vault.

cienco science; ciencoala scientific; ciencooz(ul)o, isto scientist, savant; learned or erudite person in any branch of knowledge; ciencoistacho pedant; ciencoozega most learned. Def.: Savo exakta e sistemigita pri ula temo o grupo di temi, qua relatas la arti libera (gramatiko, logiko, muziko, e.c.).
