cifro digit (1, 2, 3, 4; I, II, III, etc.); cifroplako dial-plate (with numbers; cf. skaloplato); cifreto small number at side of a larger number, as 32. Def.: Tipo o signo qua reprezentas nombro (Araba o Romana).
cigano gipsy.
cigno swan; cigneto, cignyuno cygnet; cignokanto s.song; cignokolo s.neck.
cikado (ent.) cicada.
cikatro scar, cicatrice: mark remaining from wound or ulcer; cikatrigar, cikatreskar to cicatrize.
ciklo cycle: time period; velocipede.
ciklameno (bot.) cyclamen.
ciklito cyclitis.
cikloido (geom.) cycloid.
ciklometrio* (math.) cyclometry.
ciklono cyclone, tornado, typhoon; a violent rotary wind.
ciklopo (myth. and fig.) Cyclops.
cikonio (orni.) stork (genus: Cyconia).
cikorio (bot.) chicory (Cichorium).
cikuto (bot. tree or poison) hemlock (Conium maculatum and species of Cicuta).
cilio* eyelash; (biol.) cilium; ciliala ciliary; ciliizita ciliated.
ciliara* (anat.) ciliary.
cilico cilice: haircloth (worn in mortification).
cilindro (geom., tech.) cylinder; cilindra, cilindrala, cilindratra cylindrical.
cimo (ent.) (bed-)bug (Cimex lectularius).
cimaso (arch.) cyma, ogee.
cimbalo (mus. instr.) cymbal.
cimitaro scimitar, Oriental saber.
cinabro cinnabar, (in the Fine Arts) vermilion; cinabrea, cinabroreda vermilion colored.
cinamo cinnamon (bark); cinamiero c. tree; cinamvino hippocras.

cindro ash(es), cinders (of coal); embers (of wood); dust: remains of the dead; (cf. eskarbilo; cindrea ash colored; cindroblonda pale ashburn; cindroza, cindratra ashy; cindruyo ash-holder, -pan, -box; cindrigar to reduce (ulo) to ashes, incinerate (cf. kremacar; cindrigo incineration; cindrizar to cover with ashes; cindromerkurdio Ash-Wednesday.
cinemo popular abbr. for cinematografilo or, more especially a moving-picture theater, cinema, picture-house.
cinematiko (physics) kinematics.
cinematografar (tr., intr.) to show moving pictures; cinematografuro moving picture; cinematografilo kinetoscope, bioscope, cinematograph.
cinerario (bot.) cineraria (Cineraria).
cinetika kinetic (energy).
ciniko cynic; cinika, cinikala, cinikatra cynical; cinikeso cynicism.
cinocefalo (zool.) cynocephalus: dog-faced baboon (family: Cynocephalus).
cintilo spark (of fire); sparkle (of anything shining or vivid); cintilifar to emit sparks, to shine brightly, glitter, glisten, sparkle, flash, twinkle, scintillate.
cipo (arch.) cippus: small pillar or column.
cipreso (bot.) cypress(-tree) (genus: Cupressus).
ciprino (ich.) cyprinoid, scientific name for the carp: genus: Cyprinus.
circinata circinate, rolled up like a young fern leaf.
cirko circus; cirkokavalo c. horse.
cirklo circle (cf. rondo); cirkla, cirklala, cirklatra circular, round; cirklokurvo, periferio circumference of a c.; quadratigo di la cirklo squaring of c.; jirar cirkle to turn in a c.
cirkoncizar (tr.) to circumcise; cirkoncizo circumcision; cirkoncizita, cirkoncizito circumcised (person).

cirkondar (tr.) to surround, embrace, encompass (cf. cernar); cirkondanta surrounding; cirkondata, cirkondita surrounded, enclosed; cirkondanti (fig.) confidants, friends, relations; Ex.: Me vidas oldi cirkondita da infanti.
cirkonflexa, cirkonflexo circumflex (accent).

cirkonspekta circumspect, wary, cautious; cirkonspekte cautiously. V. exp.:Cirkonspekta ne esas simple prudenta, ma predenteso desfidema, qua »regardas cirkum su«, konsideras omna lateri od elementi ante decidar od agar; III
cirkonstanco circumstance: a fact, occurence, or condition attending something else; cirkonstancala circumstantial; cirkonstanci tenuiganta extenuating circumstances.
cirkonvalaciono* (fort.) circumvallation.
cirkonvoluciono* cirkumvolution; that which is rolled around something (cf. parafrazo).

cirkular (intr.) to circulate: to move around, to flow in a circuitous channel; (of money, etc.) to pass from hand to hand; cirkuligar to cause to c., move around; (money) put into circulation, issue. Ex.: La sango cirkulas en la korpo. La tero cirkulas cirkum la suno. Cirkulado di idei.
cirkulero circular (letter, notice).

cirkum, cirkume (prep., adv.) around, about, roundabout (place, time, quantity); (cf. proxim); cirkumajo, cirkumaji surroundings, environment, frame, setting; (cf. medio) cirkumirar (tr., intr.) to go or wind around (as an obstacle); cirkumiro, cirkumturno circuitous way, detour; cirkumklozar (tr.) to fence around, inclose; cirkumlekar to lick around (one's chops), (fig). to gloat over; cirkummuro inclosure-wall; cirkumnavig(ad)o circumnavigation; cirkumpola circumpolar; cirkumskribar (tr., geom.) to circumscribe; cirkumvicina, cirkumjacanta circumjacent. Ex.: Vu mustas vartar cirkume un horo. Vi departos cirkum tri kloki. El spensis cirkume duadek dollar-i. Me promenis en la tre interesant cirkumajo.
cis (prep.) on this side of (anything); cise this side; cisa hither; cisalpa cisalpine; cis la ponto on this side of the bridge
cis (mus.) C sharp. Ant.: trans.
cisoido (math.) cissoid.
cisterciano* (monk) Cistercian.
cisterno cistern, tank (for storing rain-fall).

citar (tr.) to cite, quote; cit(ad)o citing, citation (act); citajo text cited, citation; citato author cited; citohoketo quotation mark. V. exp.: On citas autoro repetante lua paroli o texto; on mencionas autoro o libro, kande on nomas li sen citar li. On referas ad autoro, libro, e.c. kande on indikas la loko, en qua trovos ulo aludata o benzonata. On alegas fakti, argumenti, atesti, motivi, por pruvar o por justifikar ulo; II
citadelo (also fig.) citadel.
citaro (antiq. music) cithara, cithern.
citizo (bot.) cytisus.
citodierezo* (biol.) cytodieresis, mitosis.
citrono (fruit) citron, lime; (cf. limono, cedrato); citron iero citron-tree, lime-tree (Citrus); citronsuko lime-juice; citronliquoro citron-water (cf. limonado).
civeto (zool.) civet-cat: (Viverra zibetha).

civila civil: pertaining to a citizen and his rights (not milit., or criminal) lay (opposed to ecclesiastical); civil(ul)o civilian; civila kodexo c. code; civila mariajo c. marriage; civila stando civil condition: social state of persons, whether married or single, living or dead, etc. Def.: Civila stando: Ensemblo di la docukumenti, relativa a la sociala stando di singla civitani. IV
civilizar (tr.) to civilize; civilizeso civilization: state of advancement in the arts and sciences (cf. kulturo).
civismo civism: civic spirit; civismala civic. V. exp.: Civismo esas devoteso di homo a sua sam-civitani o sam-statani; patriotismo esas devoteso, amo a patrio.

civito city: the older, most ancient part of a town (cf. urbo); civitano citizen; civitaneso citizenship; civitanigar to confer the rights of a citizen, (cf. nacionaligar): civitanigo naturalization; civitanala milito civil war; civitanala yuro common law.
cizo scissors; cizego shears; cizagar (tr.) to scissor, shear.
cizelar (tr.) to chisel, chase; cizelilo chisel; kava cizelilo gouge (cf. skultar).
co cf. ca.
«conquistador» conquistador: conqueror of Spanish America.
«corpus juris» (jur.) corpus juris: body of the law.

da (indicating agent after passive verb) la patri esas amata da sua filii the parents are loved by their children; sendita da Deo sent by God; trapikita da kuglo pierced by a bullet; (agent) l'ocido di Caesar da Brutus the murder of Caesar by Brutus; (authorship) dramati da Shakespeare dramas by Shakespeare; Da qua esas ta libro? Ol esas da Petro By whom is that book? It is by Peter. (object of a transitive verb compounded with -igar) me manjigas l'aveno manjesas da la kavalo = l'aveno manjesas da la kavalo I make my horse eat oats; lu kredigis ita rakonto da l'dupohe palmed this tale off on the dupe (la dupo kredis la rakonto); me sendigas mea letri da mea spozino = igar la spozino sendar mea letri I make my wife send my letters. Def.: Montras individuo, objekto, kozo o kauzo qua igas, facas od efektigas ulo, II-731. V. exp.: vid de.
dago dirk: a short shord or kind of poniard.
«dahlia» (bot.) dahlia (genus: Dahlia).
daimo, daimulo, daimino fallow-deer (Cervus dama).
daktilo (poet.) dactyl.
dalmatiko (vestment) dalmatic.
daltonismo Daltonism: color-blindness; daltonismika, daltonismiko color-blind (peron).

damo married or widowed woman; dame; (in cards, chess, checkers) a queen; damoi (game) draughts, checkers; ludar per damoi to play checkers; damooplanko checker-, draught-board; damoigar (chess, checkers) to crown; damoifar (checkers) to go to king, (at chess) to go to queen.
damasko (fabric) damask.
damaskinar (tr.) to damascene, damaskeen (iron, steel).
damijano demijohn; (cf. korbobotelo).
damnar (tr., theol., fig.) to damn; damnito person damned, a lost soul. (cf. maledikar, blasfemar) Ex.: Deo damnas la maligni. Doktrino damninda.

damzelo young lady, miss, maid, damsel; unmarried woman, spinster; (before a proper name) Miss; damzelacho wench; honor damzelo maid of honor; kontor damzelo office-girl, -woman; du damzeli di kinadek yari two maiden ladies of fifty.
dandio dandy: fop; coxcomb. Def.: Homulo eleganta, segun la modo.
danjero danger, peril, jeopardy; danjerigar, pozar en danjero to endanger, jeopardize; danjeroza dangerous.
dankar (tr.) to thank (ulu, pri, pro ulo); (cf. gratitudar).
dansar (tr., intr.) to dance.
dardo dart (pointed missile); sting (weapon of insects).

darfar may, to have a right to, be permitted; me darfas I have the (legal) right or permission, or, it is not forbidden to me; on devas ne mentiar (o, on ne darfas mentiar) one should not (or, ought not to) lie. Def.: Havar la yuro o permiso; ol havas la senco legala, kontrea a l'ideo di interdikto; VI-487. Ex.: On darfas uzar darfar nur pri la kozi, qui dependas de lego o regulo, do de la volo, altravorte, nur kande on povas imaginar permiso od interkikto. On povas ya facar multa agi, quin on ne darfas facar. V. exp.: darfar = permisebleso, posibleso; devar = obligo morala; povar = povo; mustar = obligo fizikal, absoluta; expresas kurte l'ideo «oportas ke» o «necesa esas ke» (vid. oportar); II-166.
darnar (tr.) to darn (garments). Def.: Specala modo di rapecar stofi, vesti, ne pozante peco, ma imitante la texuro; III
Darwinismo Darwinism; Darwinala Darwinian.
dato (time) date; datizar to date (a letter, etc.).
datelo (fruit) date; dateliero d. tree (Phoenix dactylifera).
dativo (gram.) dative (-case).
daturo (bot.) datura (genus: Datura); thorn-apple, Jimson weed (Datura stramonium).
daxo (zool.) badger (genus: Meles Taxus).

dazlar (tr.) to dazzle: to overpower by bright or moving lights; (fig.) to blind; (fig.) to excite to admiration by brilliancy, display (of beauty, money, honors, etc.) (cf. facinar). Def.: Trublar instantale la vid-povo per tro brilanta lumo, o per tro rapida movado, agitado, e.c. VI

de (prep) (starting point, origin, derivation) la treno de Lyon the train from Lyons: blinda de nasko blind from birth; de omna lateri from all sides; de supre ad infre; from top to bottom; de ta vidpunto from that viewpoint; komprar de ulu to buy of someone; arachar de la morto to snatch from death;malada de febro sick with (from) fever; (measure, quantity) unu de li one of them; un horo de marcho an hour's walk; dekeduo de ovi a dozen eggs; tri metri de rubando three meters of ribbon; glaso de aquo a glass of water; peco de pano a piece of bread; el esas la maxim bela de la fratini she is the most beautiful of the sisters; duo de rejini a pair of queens; (after adjectives denoting dimenions, size, contents): ponto longa de du Angla milii a bridge two English miles long; barelo plena de vino a barrel full of wine; konstrukturo alta de duadek etaji a building twenty stories high; («since», duration of time). N. B. in this sense depos is preferable to de alone: me savas lo de(pos) quar dii I have known it these (since, from) four days; me esas hike de du monati I have been here for two months; de(pos) la morto di sua spozino since the death of his wife; de kande vu lojas hike? me lojas hike de un monato How long (from when) have you lived here? I have lived here one month (I am living here from one month). de pos since, after; de longe for a long time past; de kande since when, how long since; de lore from that time, since then; de pose from that time, afterwards; de pos ke (conj.) since (that); de nun from now, henceforth, hereafter; de sub from under; de dop from behind. V. exp.: da, de, di Praktikal regulo por selektar inter ta tri prepozicioni esas la sequanta: Se la senco postulas klare l'ideo di l'agento od autoro, uzez da; se ol postulas klare l'ideo di deveno, o di konteno o di quanto, uzez de; en cetera kazi (do en omna dubebla) uzez audace di; nam olca esas la maxim generala de la tri, korespondanta a la genitivo; II

deo God, a god; deino goddess; dea, deala divine: of or relating to God; deajo a divinity: divine object; deeso godhead; deigar to deify; deismo deism; deatra godlike; deo bona! ho Deo good God! oh God! danko a Deo thank God; Deo pardonezmay God pardon; Se plezos a Deo, se Deo volos if God wills.

debar (tr.) to owe (ulo, ad ulu); (intr.) to be under obligation (ad ulu, por ulo); debajo a debt; debizar to get (ulu) into debt; debo honorala (honor debo) a debt of honor; charjar su per debi to run into debt; debrestajo balance due. Ex.: Pagez to quon vu debas. Me debas a lu mea vivo. Donar deb-atesto.
debatar (tr.) to debate. Def.: Diskutar kun un o plura konversanti en ordinoza ed atencoza maniero, singlu prizentante l'argumenti servanta sua propra interesto o prefero; V
debeto (com.) debit (after the balance of an account), debit-balance; debetigar to d. (a sum to somebody's account); debetkonto d. account.
debila (of persons) weak, feeble; (cf. frajila), debiligar to debilitate, enfeeble; debiliganta, debiligiva debilitating; debilach(ul)o a puny person. Def.: Febla per naturo, temperamento; III

debitar (tr.) to sell (goods, supplies, ordinarily at retail); debito, debitajo sale, supply, retail; debitar engrose, endetale to sell wholesale, by retail; vari di bona debito goods that have a ready sale.

debochar (intr.) to go to excess in sensual pleasures, to live dissolutely, to revel, carouse; debochigar to debauch: entice to debauchery, to corrupt with lewdness; debocheskar to become profligate; debochanta, debochema dissolute, profligate (cf. laciva); debochistino harlot; debochanto, debochero debauchee, rake: debochiganto debaucher. V. exp.: Krapulo esas nur maxim desnobla e vulgara debocho. Debochanto povas esar (restar) eleganta. Pro to debocho koncernas prefere la sexuala ne-etikaleso, krapulo la trouzo di manjado e drinkado, l'ebrieso kustumal, e.c. On povas parolar pri debaucho krapuloza; III
debushar (intr., milit.) to debouch.
debutar (intr., theat.) to make one's debut, first appearance; (fig.) to start, set out: take one's first steps; debutanto, debutantino debutant, debutante; (fig.) a beginner.

decar (intr.) to be decent, suitable, correct, proper; (cf. esar justa); deco decency, propriety; decanta, decoza decent, becoming, decorous; decante decently, with decency; decas (imper.s) it is proper.
decembroo December.
decendar (intr.) to descend (de, of race); decend(ad)o descent, lineage, pedigree; decendanto descendant, offspring; decendantaro progeny, posterity (collect.).

decensar (tr., intr.) to go down, descend: to move or pass from a higher to a lower plane; decenseyo descent (place). Ex.: Decensar (de) monto en valo. Decensar (de) arboro. Decensar eskalero. La mareo, la temperaturo decensas. Ant.: acensar.
deceptar (tr.) to disappoint, to defeat (the hopes, expectations of someone); deceptanta, deceptiva disappointing.
dechifrar (tr.) to decipher: to discover the key to a secret writing. V. exp.: vid. chifrar.

decidar (tr., intr.) to decide, settle, determine; decidoza, decidema (of persons) strong-minded, determined; decidita (of things) decided; decidite, decideme decidedly, positively; decidemeso determination (of character); decidiganta, decidiva decisive, conclusive; facar decido to make a decision; agar decidoze, decideme to act with decision. Ex.: Decidar afero, problemo, debato. Judicial decido. Ad il mankas decidemeso (di karaktero). Il esas homulo decidema. Il uzas decidoza tono. La kozo esas decidita. Kauzo, motivo decidiganta. Bataliodecidiva. V. exp.: On decidas teoriala questioni, on rezolvas agi facenda. Ni decidas, ke l'akuzato esas la sola autoro dil krimino. Ni rezolvas facar turo en la urbo; VII-98.
deciduo (physiol.) deciduous membrane.
decigramo decigram: 1.5432 grains.
decilitro deciliter: tenth part of a liter: 6.1 cu. in.
decimo decime. Def.: Dekimo di franko, o 10 centimi; III-324.
decimacar (tr.) to decimate.
decimala, decimalo (arith.) decimal.
decimetro decimeter: tenth of a meter: 3.937 in.
dedikar (tr.) to dedicate: consecrate to a Divine Being; to devote to a sacred use; to inscribe or address to a patron or friend; (cf. konsakrar).
deduktar (tr., log.) to deduce, infer; dedukt(ad)o, deduktajo, dedukturo deduction, inference; deduktala, deduktiva, deduktema deductive; deduktebla deducible.
defekto defect, imperfection, flaw, fault, blemish.
defektiva (gram.) defective.

defensar (tr.) to defend, protect (ulu, ulo, su, kontre); defensebla defensible, tenable; defensilo a means, instrument of defense; defensiva defensive. Ex.: Defensar sua patrio, sua honoro, sua opiniono.

deferencar (tr.) to defer to, show deference to; deferenco deference, regard, respect. Def.: Deferenco Respekto qun on manifestas ad ulu exekutante lua volo o deziro. Nociono komplexa, qua ne esas simpla respekto. III-323. Ex.: On devas deferencar sua patri. Kun omna deferenceo qua esas debata a vu. Ant.: (deferenco) desprizo, aarogemeso.
deferenta (tubo) (physiol.) deferent.
defervecar (intr., med.) to cool down (fever).
defiar (tr.) to defy, challenge, dare (ulu, pri ulo, o facar ulo); defio challenge, defying, defiance.
deficito (com.) deficit.
defilar (intr.) to defile, file off, march past (avan ulu).
defileo defile: narrow mountain pass.

definar (tr.) to define: give the definition of; defino definition; definita defined; definite (article); sen defina, ne definita indefinite. V. exp.: Definar esas indikar, enunciar la senco di vorto. Determinar esas fixigar o precizigar ula konocajo: on determinas la alteso di la suno, la disto di du loki, per astronomial o geografial operaci (mezuri e kalkuli). Kozo povas esar tre determinita, e nule definita o definebla: ex.: ula partikulara koloro. On definas vorto; on deklaras sua opiniono; on explikas fakto, libro, frazo; IV-464, 465.
definitiva definitive: final, ending; definitive definitely. Ex.: Aranjo, judiko definitiva.
deflexar (tr.) to deflect, bend from; (fig.) to swerve, deviate.
deformar (tr.) to deform, put out of shape; -it(ul)o: a deformed person; deformesar to be deformed.
degenerar (intr.) to denegrate, deteriorate; degeneranto, degenerinto a d.
degnar (intr.) to deign: condescend, vouchsafe.
degradar (tr.) to degrade: reduce in rank, remove from office.
dejetar (tr.) to throw from (horse, etc.).
dejunar (intr.) to breakfast: (the first repast of the day); have b., dejuneto a light b., frua dejuno early b. Def.: Dejuno esas repasto di dimezo, VI-162.

dek ten; dekimo a tenth part; dekesma, dekesmo (ordinal) tenth; dekopla, dekoplo tenfold; dekopligar to increase tenfold; dekope by tens; du deki two tens; dekfoye ten times; yar deko decade; dekedu twelve, a dozen; dekeduesma twelfth; dekeduimo; (fraction) one twelfth.

dekadar (intr.) to be decadent, be in state of decay, decline (physical or moral); dekado decadence: decline to a worse or less perfect state, tendency towards dissolution or extinction. Ex.: La dekado di l'imperio Romana. La dekado di arti. Ni vivas en dekandanta epoko.
dekaedro* decahedron.
dekagono* decagon
dekagramo decagram: 0.3527 oz.
dekalitro decaliter: 2.64 gals.
dekalogo Decalogue: the Ten Commandents.
dekametro decameter: 32.809 ft.
dekano (eccl., university, collegiate) dean; dekaneso deanship.
dekantar (tr.) to decant (liquids); dekantilo decanter.
dekapar (tr.) to scale, scrape, scour (metals).
dekastero decastere: 13.08 cu. yds.
dekeduo dozen (de); (cf. dek).
dekalmar (tr.) to declaim; to speak or deliver rhetorically; dekalmacha bombastic; dekalmach(er)o haranguer, stump-orator, ranter.
deklarar (tr.) to declare (ulo, ad ulu). Ex.: Deklarar sua intenci, sua opinioni, Deklaro di milito.
deklinar (tr., gram.) to decline, inflect; (intr., phys.) to deviate from the true north, as magnetic needle; (astron.) to remove from the equator, as a heavenly body.
dekoktar (tr., pharm.) to decoct; dekokto, dekokturo decoction, extract from a body boiled in water.
dekorar (tr.) to decorate (a house, etc.).
dekretar (tr.) to decree, enact.
deksilaba decasyllabic.
dekubitar (med.) to like down in bed, decubation.
dekyara decennial: continuing for ten years; (cf. yardekala).
del de la.
delegar (tr.) to delegate (someone as agent); delegato, delegito delegate; delegitaro delegation; (cf. prokuraco).
delektar (tr.) to delight (ulu); delektesar to be delighted; delekt(ad)o, eso delight(ing); delektanta, delektiva, delektoza delightful, delectable.
delfino (ich.) dolphin (genus: Delphinus); delfin(ul)o (Fr. history) dauphin; delfinala delphine (classics).
deliberar (intr.) to deliberate. Def.: Ponderar en su ipsa o kun altri, pri questiono solvenda o rezolvo facenda, la motivi por e la motivi kontre la decido; V
delico delight; high degree of pleasure or enjoyment; the cause of the pleasure; la delici di Paris the delights, the charms of Paris; delicoza delicious, delightful.
delikata delicate, refined; delikat(ul)o a d. person; delikatajo, delikateso delicacy; delikatega exquisite, superfine. Ex.:Delikata infanto, organi. La delikateso di la pelo, di linguo, di gusto.

deliktar (intr.) to commit an offence (against law and order); (cf. kontravencar); delikto offense; (jur.) misdemeanor: offense punishable by fine or imprisonment; (cf. krimino); delikt(al)a unlawful, felonious, punishable; deliktanta, deliktatra delinquent; deliktanto, deliktinto offender, malefactor; en flagranta delikto in the very act; materio di la delikto corpus delicti: substance of the offence.
deliqucar (intr., chem.) to deliquesce: become liquid.
delirar (intr.) to be delirious, to rave; deliro, delireso delirium; (fig.) nightmare; deliranta, delirema, deliratra delirious, frenzied, frantic; deliranto d. person.
delto (geog.) delta.
demagogo demagogue.
demagogio demagogy, demagogism.

demandar (tr.) to ask for (ulo); (N.B. Not the E. «demand», (cf. postular); demando request, asking; (polit., econ.) demand (cf. ofro); demandanto asker, applicant; me demandas pardono I beg (ask) your pardon; quon vu demandas pro facar l'operaco What do you ask to perform the operation; ni ne recevos la permiso demandita we shall not receive the permit asked for. V. exp.: On demandas de ni la difero di la sequanta vorti. On demandas e postulas nur kozi; on pregas e solicitas nur personi. Demandar ulo de ulu, esas pregar ta «ulu», ke lu donez ta «ulo». Postular ulo esas demandar ulo, a qua on havas yuro; tala demando esas do insistanta, obliganta e kelke imperema. Solicitar esas pregar ulu autoritoza o potenta per obtenar ulo, qua havas plu o min karaktero di favoro; III-224. On demandas kozo quan on deziras havar; on questionas persono pri ulo, quon on deziras savar; II-78. En la ekonomiko, on traktas pri la lego di l'ofro e di la demando, qua determinas la preco di la vari sur ula merkato; II-167.

demarshar (intr.) to take steps, measures (to obtain something); demarsho step, proceeding; act, measure taken in business; Def.: Demarshar implikas sempre l'ideo di «pazi» facata extere, en la socio, port atingar ula skopo, por obtener irga helpo, favoro, e.c.; IV-100. V. exp.: Esforco esas propre ago muskulala, o generale, mekanikala; demarsho esas social ago, per qua un persono volas influaar altra por obtener ulo; IV-204.
dementiar (tr.) to give the lie to (ulu, pri ulo); to deny (flatly, publicly); dementio flat contradiction, denial.
demisionar (intr.) to resign: give in one's rsignation; (milit.) to throw up one's commission; (parl.) to vacate one's seat. V. exp. vid. abdikar.
demiurgo demiurge.
demokrata, demokratala democratic; demokrat(ul)o a democrat. Def.: Demokraato esas partisano di la demokratio, e plu generale, ta qua havas la mento demokratiala o demokratiema; VII-154.

demokratio democracy; demokratiala relating to a d.; demokratiigar to democratize. Def.: La rejimo en qua la populo guvernesas da su ipsa (t.e. da sua elektiti); lua principo esas la suvereneso dil populo; VII-154.

demolisar (tr.) to demolish, pull down, break up (a house, a fortification, an old ship); demoliso demolition; demolisar bona reputeso to ruin a reputation; demolisar doktrino to overthrow a doctrine.
demono (myth. and fig.) demon, evil spirit, genius; demonala, demonatra, demonoza, demonika; demonozo, demoniko demoniac(al).

demonstrar (tr.) to demonstrate: prove by arguments; to make evident; demonstro (lig., polit., milit., naval) demonstration. Ex.: Demonstrar propoziciono. Lua redesko demonstas lua shamo. Demonstri enemikala.
demonstrativaa, demonstrativao (gram.) demonstrative.
demotika* (antiq.) demotic (writing, characters).
denaro (antiq. coin) denarius.
denaturar (tr., chem.) to denature (alcohol, etc.).

denigrar (tr.) to disparage (ulu, ulo): run down, decry, depreciate, vilify, blacken the record of; (cf. difamar, kalumniar, maldicensar). Def.: Inspirar mala opiniono pri ulu (o ulo) per severa o nejusta aserti e judiki; IV
denominatoro (arith.) denominator.

densa dense: having its parts crowded together; compact, close: (cf. dika); densigar to thicken (liquids); (cf. pludikigar). Ex.: Densa turbo, vaporo. Platino havas la maxim granda denso de omna metali. Ant.: skarsa, dissemita, ne, desdensa.
densimetro densimeter.

dento (also fig.) tooth; dentala dental; dentosono (gram.) dental; dentoza, dentizita toothed, notched, denticulated; dentizar to furnish with teeth; (fig.) to cog; indent; to put scallops in; dentifar to make teeth; to cut teeth; dentaro set of teeth; dentisto, dentifisto dentist; dentego tusk; dentostumpo stump of a t.; dentextirpisto tooth puller; dento di sajeso wisdom tooth; dentoroto cog-wheel; dentopikilo t. pick; dentotenalio dentist's forceps; dentetroto pinion, small gear wheel; dentokolo neck of a t.; dentifuro (result) dentition; sen denta toothless; sen dentigar to break, knock out the teeth of (ulu); sen denteskar to lose one's teeth.
dentelo lace (-work); dentelifistino female l. maker; dentela naztuko lace handkerchief.
dentifrica, dentifrico dentifrice, tooth-cleaning (powder, etc.).
denuncar (tr.) to inform against, denounce (a guilty person).

departar (intr., also fig.) to depart (ek, de); departopunto point of departure; esar departonta to be on the eve of setting out, be about to start; departopreparo preparations for a start; (nav.) getting underway. Ant.: arivar.
departmento (territorial) department, province, (cf. ministerio); departmentala departmental. Def.: Teritoriala dividuro or resortiso; VI

dependar (intr.) to depend: be conditioned or contingent (de); to rely on for support; to be a dependency (di); ne dependo independence; ne dependante, sen depende independently. Ex.: L'efekto dependas de la kauzo. Omno dependas de la maniero segun qua on komencas. Ca teritorio ne dependas de Francia, o, ca teritorio esas nedependanta de Francia.
deperisar (intr.) to pine away, gradually lose strength; wither; slowly decline or perish. Def.: Debilesko duktanta ad (se ne til) la morto; III
depesho dispatch: urgent message; (cf. telegramo).
deplorar to deplore: to feel or express deep grief; deplorinda deplorable, lamentable, wretched. Ex.: Deplorar la desfortunaji di ulu, la morto di ulu.
deponenta, deponento (gram.) deponent.
deportar (tr.) to depart: to transport into banishment; to convey to a penal colony. V. exp.: vid exilar.
depos cf. de.

depozar (tr.) to depost: to lay, set or put down; to lodge for safekeeping; to bond (in warehouses); depoz(ad)o depositing (act); depozite on deposit; depozanto, depozero depositor; depozajo deposit; depozeyo place of deposit, as a depot, depository, warehouse; depozario trustee, depositary, guardian, warehouse-keeper. Ex.: Depozar portajo. Nil(e) depozas omnayare slamo fekunda. Depozanto di pekunio en panko.
deprenar (tr.) to take from (ulo de ulu).
depresar (tr., phys. and moral) to depress: to press down; to deject; depres(ad)o, depreseso, depresuro depression.
deputar (tr.) to depute, deputize, send (ulu) as a deputy; deputataro deputation (delegation); chambro di deputati (parl.) chamber of deputies (cf. suplear).
dermo (anat.) derma.
derodar (tr.) to gnaw away, erode.

derogar (intr., jur.) to derogate: to act contrary, invalidate, annul (in part), to depart from (a custom); deroganta, derogiva derogatory. Def.: Teknikala termino di yuro-cienco: facar ecepto, violaco instantala di ula lego, regulo; III-329. Ex.: Ica du partisi derogis de lia kontrato (E. both parties have invalidated some part of (or, have departed from) their contract). Derogar de la lego, de kustumo establisita.
dervisho dervish.
des: (mus.) D Flat.
desabonar (su) to withdraw one's subscription (from a periodical).
desafabla crabbed, cross, churlish, surly, ungracious, uncivil.
desagnoskar (tr.) to disown, disavow, disclaim.
desagrafagar (tr.) to unclasp, unhook.
desagreabla disagreeable, unpleasaant (ad); desajo a d. thing or experience.
desagregar (tr.) to disaggregate, to disintegrate.
desajustar (tr.) to to put out of adjustment, to derange.
desakordar (intr., mus.) to be out of tune; (gram.) not to agree; deso discord; desanta discordant.
desakrochar (tr.) to unhook (ulo de).
desamaragar (tr., nav.) to unmoor.
desamorcar (tr.) to uncap, unprime (fire-arms).
desankragar (tr., intr.) to weigh anchor, get up a. on.
desaparar (intr.) to disappear, vanish.
desaprobar (tr.) to disapprove of.
desaranjar (tr.) to disarrange, derange, unsettle.
desarmizar to unarm, disarm.
desartikizar to disarticulate, unjoint; desizo (surg.) disarticulation: amputation, excision of a joint.
desasemblar (tr.) to disassemble, take to pieces, separate.
desasimilar (tr., phys. and fig.) not to assimilate (ulo).
desasociar (tr.) to disassociate, dissociate; to dissolve (a partnership).
desasortar (tr.) to unmaatch, break the set of, spoil a collection of (ulo).
desavantajo disadvantage.
desbalastizar (o, senbalastigar) to unballast: discharge or unload a ship from ballast.
desbarar (tr.) to unbar, remove barriers.
desbeligar (tr.) to disfigure, take away the beauty of.
desblindigar (tr.) to open the eyes of, make to see; (fig.) undeceive.
desblokusar (tr.) to raise the blockade of.
desboltagar (tr.) to unbolt.
desbotizar (tr.) to pull or take off the boots.
desbriligar (tr.) to tarnish, dull.
desbuklagar (tr.) to unbuckle.
desbutonagar (tr.) to unbutton; desizar to remove the buttons from.
descentrizar, desaligar to decentralize.

descharjar (tr.) to discharge: unload, take away the burden of (ulu, ulo, de); (fig.) to ease, free, throw off the care of (a thing): deseyo unloading place; quanta deso good riddance; desar sua koncienco to clear one's conscience.
descharmar (tr.) to disenchant.
descivilizar (tr.) to uncivilize (ulu).
desdensigar to loosen, make less compact, rarefy, to open up (ranks, a crowd).
desebriigar to sober; deseskar to sober down; (fig.) to come to one's senses.

desegnar (tr.) to draw, design, delineate, sketch, (cf. esbosar, skisar); desegn(ad)o, desegnuro drawing; desegnarto art of drawing; desegnanto, desegnero, desegnisto drawer, draughtsman; desegnoplanko drawing-board. Def.: Riproduktar, per krayono o plumo, la formo di objekti.
desembarasar (tr.) to disencumber, rid of, disembarras.
desembarkar (tr., intr.) to disembark, land.
desembragar (tr.) to throw out of gear, disengage (tech.).
desengajar (tr.) to disengage: discharge, free from service.
desenkorpigar to disincorporate.
desenoyigar to cheer up, divert, bring out of the dumps.
desentravar (tr., lit. and fig.) to unshackle, unfetter.
desenvelopar (tr.) to unwrap, unshroud.
desequilibrigar to upset the equilibrium of, unpoise, unbalance.
desequipar to dismantle; lay up (ships).
desero dessert; deserdisho d. dish.
desertar (tr., intr., milit. and gen.) to desert, abandon, quit, forsake.
deservar* (tr., intr., eccl.) to serve (a living), have the parochial duties of (a chapel, hamlet); (cf. oficiar).

desesperar (intr.) to despair, to be in d.; desigar to drive to d.; to dishearten; desanta despairing, desperate; desanto one who despairs; desato one of whom one d.; kom desala remedio as a last resource, shift.
desestalar (tr.) to take in goods (exposed for sale); (fig.) to shut up shop, stop the display.
desestimar (tr.) to contemn, despise (ulu); desigar to bring into disrepute, discredit, contempt; desanta, desema contemptuous, scornful; desinda contemptible, despicable.
desfacar (tr.) to unmake, undo.
desfacila difficult; desajo a d. thing; deseso (state, condition) difficulty; desigar to render d. (ulo).
desfaldar (tr.) to unfold.
desfangizar to rub off the dirt, clean, scavenge; desizilo scraper (as for shoes).
desfatigar (tr.) to refresh, relax.
desfavorar (tr.) to disfavor, withhold favor from, to put out of favor; to disadvantage; desoza unfavorable, disadvantageous; desizar to disgrace; desizita disgraced.
desfelica miserable, unhappy; des(ul)o an u. person; desajo u. event, mischance.
desferizar to take the iron from, to unshoe (a horse).
desfiancar to disengage (from a betrothal).
desfidar (tr.) to distrust, mistrust.
desfilizar to unstring, unthread, unravel.
desflorizar to strip of blossoms; (cf. senfloreskar).
desforestizar to clear, denude of forest, disafforest.
desfortifikar (tr.) to unfortify.
desfortuno misfortune, reverses, run of ill-luck; desoza unfortunate; desajo calamity, mischance (the event); dese unluckily.
desfrenagar (tr.) to unlock or take off the brake.
desfreshigar to destroy the freshness of.
desfrizar (tr.) to uncurl.
desfrokizar to unfrock (a monk).
desfrostar (intr.), desigar (tr.) to thaw.
desfrunsar (tr.) to unwrinkle, unpucker.
desfuterizar to remove the lining of.
desgajigar to take out of pawn.
desgantizar to pull off the gloves from.
desgarnisar (tr.) to untrim.
desgibizar to take out the bumps; the humps from; to smooth out.
desgipsizar to unplaster.
desglatigar to roughen, ruffle.
desgluizar to remove the paste, glue from.
desglutineskar to become unglued, unpasted.
desgrasizar to remove the grease or fat; (fig.) to scour.
desgrosigar to thin, reduce; remove the grosser parts.
desgumizar to ungum (silk, etc.).
desgurtizar to ungirth, unstrap, unband.
deshardigar to soften.
deshelpar (tr.) to disoblige, to hinder.
desheredigar to disinherit.
deshonesta dishonest; (fig.) indecent.
deshonoro dishonor, opprobium, disgrace; desizar to dishonor, bring d. upon; desiziva dishonorable.
deshumanigar to dehumanize, imbrute.
desikatoro desiccator.
desiluzionigar to disabuse, disillusion.
desimbastar (tr.) to unbaste, untack (garments).
desinfektar (tr.) to disinfect; desiva, desivo disinfectant.
desinflar (tr.) to deflate; reduce the swelling of.
desingranar (tr.) to throw out of gear.
desinkombrar (tr.) to deobstruct, disencumber, clear from impediments.
desintrikar (tr.) to disentangle, unravel; (fig.) to extricate, free.
desjungar (tr.) to unyoke (oxen); take out horses from (a carriage).
desjuntar (tr.) to disjoin, take to pieces, separate; desiva (gram.) disjunctive.
deskampar (tr.) to break camp.
deskargar (tr.) to unload (things; cf. charjar).
deskatenizar to unchain.
deskestizar to uncase.
desklefagar (tr.) to unlock.
desklozar (tr.) to unclose, throw open.
deskolorizar to lose color, fade, come off (of colors).
deskomandar (tr.) to countermand.
deskomforto discomfort.
deskompozar (tr.) to decompose.
deskonfesar (tr.) to recant; unsay: take back what one has said.
deskonkordigar to cause disagreement, set at variance.
deskonsilar (tr.) to dissuade.
deskontentigar to discontent, cause d. to.
deskorpizar to disembody.
deskorticizar to bark, peel.

deskovrar (tr.) to uncover: take the cover off; to discover, disclose, detect (what was not known before); desar disho, korbo to uncover a dish, a basket; desar trezoro, fonto to discover a treasure, a spring.
deskrasizar to remove the (surface) dirt from, to clean.
deskreditizar to discredit: to deprive of credit, bring into disrepute.
deskreskar (intr.) to cease to grow, to wane, fall off.
deskriptar (tr.) to describe (by words); deskripto, deskripturo description; deskriptiva (also geom.) descriptive.
deskronizar to uncrown.
deskrucigar to uncross.
deskuafar (tr.) to dishevel, undress the hair of.
deskkuplar (tr., mechan.) to uncouple, disconnect.
deskurajoza cowardly.
deskurvigar to unbend, straighten.
deskustumigar to break the habit of (ulu, pri ulo); deseskar to break oneself of, lose the habit of; desinta unaccustomed.
deslacigar to unlace.
deslauta soft (to hearing).
deslernar (tr.) to unlearn.
desligar (tr.) to untie.
deslokizar to delocalize.
deslokacar to vacate (a lodging).
desloklizar to uncurl (hair).
desloyala disloyal.
desmagnetigar to demagnetize.
desmagnetizar to unmesmerize (ulu).
desmakulizar to clean spots from, remove the stains from.
desmanchizar to take off the handle of.
desmariajar (tr.) to unmarry, annul the marriage of.
desmaskar (tr.) to unmask.
desmaskuligar to emasculate.
desmastizar to dismast.
desmeritar (intr.) to be undeserving; to forfeit the esteem (de ulu, per ulo).
desmetar (tr.) to take off (a garmet, etc.).
desmixar (tr.) to separate.
desmoblizar to unfurnish, strip of furniture.
desmonetigar to demonetize (cf. senvalorigar).
desmuntar (tr.) to dismount, take apart (a machine).
desmuzelligar (tr.) to unmuzzle.
desnacionaligar to denationalize; desanigar to denaturalize.
desnaivigar to sharpen the wits of.
desneta dirty, unclean, untidy; desigar to dirty; desiganta soiling; (cf. sordida).
desnobligar to debase, deseso ignominy, meanness; desigo debasing; desiganta debasing, ignominious.
desnodigar to untie a knot in.
desobediar to disobey.
desobstruktar to deobstruct, clear; desiva, desivo (med.) deobstruent.
desoportuna inopportune; desajo something i.
desordinar (tr.) to disorder, derange, disturb; desogo hurly-burly.
desorganizar to disorganize.
desorientizar (lit.) to turn from the east; (fig.) to put out of one's element; to put on the wrong scent, to lose one's bearings.
desostizar to bone, to fillet (fish); desizita dindo boned turkey.
desoxizo disoxygenation.
desoxidigar, desizar to disoxidate, deoxidize.
despakigar to unpack, unbundle.
despavizar to unpave, take up the pavement.
despektar (tr.) to uncomb.
despendar (tr.) to take down, unhang (a chandelier, etc.).
despenso pantry, larder, buttery, steward's office; despensisto steward.
despersuadar (tr.) to dissuade, persuade to the contrary of (ulu pri ulo, ulu per ulo).
despia impious, ungodly, undevout.

despitar (intr.) to be vexed; to fret. Def.: Despito chagreno mixita kun iraco. Ex.: Ilua agi despitigas me (E. his acts vex me); Quo importas, sive il esas joyoza sive il esas despitoza (E. what do you care whether he is joyous or vexed). Lasar eruptar sua despito; (E. to vent one's ill humor).
desplanigar to put out of true, (of wood) to warp.
desplasizar to displace (ulu, ulo).
desplenigar to diminish the contents of, to empty; deseskar to get low.
desplezar (intr.) to be displeasing (ad ulu); (tr.) to displease (ulu).
desplezuro displeasure, grief, sorrow.
desplumizar to pluck (feathers).
despolarigar to depolarize.
despolisar to remove the polish, to rough.
despopulizar to depopulate.
despopularigar to render unpopular.
desposedigar to dispossess, oust.
despoto despot; despota, despotala, despotatra despotic.
desprizar (tr.) to disdain, scorn, despise; desigar to bring into disrepute, discredit (ulu).
desprofundajo shoal, shallow.
desproprigar to renounce (property in something).
despura impure; deseso, desajo impurity.
desqualifikar to disqualify.
desquieta (mentally) uneasy, anxious; deseso inquietude, disquietude; desiganta disquieting.
desraciono, deseso unreasonableness, senselessness.
desrigizar to unrig (a ship).
desrigidigar to make pliant, unstiffen.
desriglagar (tr.) to unbolt.
desrugizar to unwrinkle, smooth (the face).
dessaja unwise, foolish.
dessalizar to remove the salt from.
desselizar to unsaddle.
dessepultar (tr.) to exhume.
desservar (tr.) to disoblige, not to serve.
dessiglar (tr.) to unseal.
desskrubagar (tr.) to unscrew (ulo); (cf. desvisar).
dessoldar (tr.) to unsolder.
desspular (tr.) to unwind (from a bobbin or spool).
desstopar (tr.) to unstop, uncork; desilo corkscrew.
desstrandigar to get afloat, refloat.
desstultigar to sharpen the wits of.
dessuolizar to take soles from; (fig.) to wear off the soles of.
dessutar (tr.) to unsew, unstitch.
destensar to slacken, relax.
destexar to unweave.
destinar to destine (ulo, ulu, ad ulo). Ex.: Destinar sua filiulo esar advokato. Esar kontenta pri sua destino (E. to be content with one's lot).
destordar (tr.) to untwist.
destorporigar to remove the numbness from, to quicken.
destrompar (tr.) to undeceive.
destronizar to dethrone (a king).
destruktar (tr.) to destroy.
destrusar (tr.) to untuck, let down (a garment).
desunionar to disunite.
desvalidigar to invalidate.
desvarmigar to cool or make cold (a hot body).
desvelizar to unveil; (fig.) to disclose.
desvestizar to take the clothing from, undress, divest.
desvirgigar to deflower (a virgin).
desvisar (tr.) to unscrew (a screw); (cf. desskrubagar).
desvolvar (tr.) to unroll, unwrap.
deszonizar to ungird, loosen a girdle.
detachar* (tr., milit., nav.) to draft: to send away, to send off for a particular service (from the main body).
detachmento (milit.) detachment, draft.

detalo detail, particular: a minute or distinct part; detala, detaloza detailed; detale in, with d.s, minutely, piece-meal, bit by bit; detaligar to particularlize, state circumstantially, give the d.s of; sen detale briefly, in a few words. Ex.: La detali di afero, di listo. Detaloza kalkulo. Il detale naracis sua historio. Il detaligas sua historio.
detektivo detective: secret policeman.

determinar (tr.) to determine: to fix the limits of; to ascertain or settle the exact truth about (ulo); (gram.) to fix the extent, the meaning of a word or sentence; determino determination (not resolution, cf. rezolvo). Ex.: Lavoisier determinis la kompozuro di l'aero. Determinar disto de la tero a la suno. La determino di la volo. Determinita nombro. La doktrino di determinismo. V. exp.: vid. definar.
detersar (tr.) to deterge: to cleanse, purge away (as foul matter); detersanta, detersiva, detersivo detergent. Ex.: Detersar la intestini.
detonar (intr.); detonigar (tr.) to detonate; detono, detonuro detonation, report.
detranchar (tr.) to cut off, excise.

detrimentar (tr.) to prove detrimental to, be prejudicial to; Ex.: Ica fakto detrimentis mea reputeso. Ica aranjo esas facita a mea detrimento, lo detrimentas me. V. exp.: Detrimentar e domajar esas diversa speci di nocar. Domajar (ulo) esas facar material altero, qua minbonigas kozo (o la korpo di persono). Detrimentar (ulu) esas efektigar a lu ula perdo, mem nerekte e nevole; IV-237-8.
deturnar (tr.) to turn away, aside (ulu, ulo, de).

devar (tr.) to have the obligation of, have the duty of, ought, should; devo duty, obligation. Def.: «Devar» konvenas ad omna ed omnaspeca obligesi (moral od altra), do devas uzesar en omna imperi, preskripti e konsili. Ex.: Se vu volas bone standar, vu devas esar sobra. Vu devas ne adulterar, furtar. V. exp.: vid. darfar; kp. mustar.
devancar (tr.) to out-run, out-strip, out-do, to distance. V. exp.: On preteriras kozo senmova, ma devancar implikas ke la objekto movas, e movas en sama sinco kam la subjekto; IV-137.
devastar (tr.) to devastate, lay waste, ravage, desolate. Ex.: Ula uragano, ula pesto devastis la lando, la urbo.

developar (tr.) to develop: make larger, fuller; to unfold (a plot, etc.); develop(ad)o, developeso development; growth, increase, progress. Ex.: Gimnastiko developas la korpo. Developar la mento di infanto. Developo di arboro. V. exp.: Developar indikas generale la kreskado gradoza e reguloza, sive di l'organismi, sive di omna kozi simila od analoga ad organismi. Evolucionar expresas la preciza ciencala (e filozofiala) ideo di evoluciono, enduktita la Lamarck, Darwin, e.c.; ol karakterizas ula speco di developo, ed implikas transformo (ol opozesas a la dissolvo, qua esas l'inversa fenomeno). Singla organismo, ento «developas su»; nur spci «evolcionas» tra la longa serio de yarcenti, chanjante sua formo, adaptante su ad altra kondicion ai di vivo, e.c.; III-221.
deviacar (tr., intr.) to deviate, swerve (de). Ex.: La deviaco di magneta agulo.
devizo device: emblematic design; blazon devizo heraldic bearing.
devono* (geol.) Devonian strata.
devorar (tr.) to devour, eat greedily; devoranta, devorema devouring, ravenous, voracious; devoremeso voracity.
devota devoted; devoteso devotedness, devotion; devotesar, devotigar su to be d., to devote oneself. Ex.: Esar tote devota ad ulu, ad ulo. Devoteso a sua patrio. Devotigar su ad ula skopo.

dextra right (handside); dextre on the r.; dextra manuo r. hand; dextruzeroa r. handed person; dextrano (parl.) member of party on right (a conservative); turnar addextre to turn to the r. Ant. sinistra.
dextrino (chem.) dextrine.

dezerta desert, deserted; dezerto a desert, wilderness; dezertigar to make a d. of (ulo). Def.: Qua esas sovaja (od arida) e ne habitata. Ex.: Insulo dezerta. Sahara esas dezerto. Lando dezerta e nehabitata (E. a wild and uninhabited country).
dezinenco desinence: formative suffix, word-ending. Def.: Finalo di vorto, precipue por indikar la flexiono.

dezirar (tr.) to desire: to wish for earnestly, long for, hanker for, covet; deziregar to greatly covet, lust after; dezirinda desirable; dezirajo a desirable object, a desideratum; il ardoroze deziris richaji he ardently desired wealth; me deziras ke vu parolez I wish you to speak; me desiras a vu omna feliceso I wish to you all happiness.
dezolar (tr.) to make disconsolate, distress, grieve (ulu); dezoleso affliction, desolation (mental); dezolanta, dezoliva grievious, disheartening. Ex.: La morto di mea amiko dezolas me.

di (marks the genitive, possession, belonging to) la domo di mea patrulo my father's house; en la tempi di la Romani in the time of the Romans; la rejo di Anglia the king of England; la fenestri di la domo the windows of the house; di qua, di qui whose, of which; la puero di qua me vidis la libro the boy whose book I saw; la libri di qui vu prizis la binduro the books, the binding of which you liked; di qua esas ica granda fabrikerio whose is this great factory? V. exp.: vid. de
dio day (of 24 hours; cf. jorno); diala daily; de un dio a l'altra from one day to another; la dii dil semano the days of the week.
diabaso* (petrog.) diabase: trap, greenstone.
diabeto (med.) diabetes; diabetika, iko diabetic (person).

diabl(ul)o (theol. and fig.) devil, fiend; diablala, diablatra diabolic, devilish; diableto little d., imp; diablino she d.; diablajo act of devil(t)ry; per la diablo what the devil; diablatra infanto a little demon (child); facar diablatra tumulto to make a devlish uproar.
diachilono* diachylon: a kind of a plaster for wounds.
diademo diadem.

diafana diaphaneous, transparent, pellucid; (cf. translucida); diafana marko watermark (on paper). Def.: Qua lasas pasar la lum-radii, tale ke on povas klare dicernar objekti tra ol. Ex.: Aquo, polisita vitro, esas diafana. Ant. opaka.
diafizo* (anat.) diaphysis: the shaft or main part of a long bone.
diafragmo (anat., elec., opt.) diaphragm.
diagnozar (tr., med.) to diagnose.
diagonala, diagonalo (geom.) diagonal.
diagramo (geom.) diagram.
diakono (eccl.) deacon.
diakoniso (eccl.) deaconess.
diakritika, diakritiko diacritic. Def.: Teknikala termino por omna signi adjuntita a literi (supersigni, subsigni, e.c.); III
dialekto dialect. Def. Vario regionala di linguo.
dialektiko (log.) dialectics.
dializo (chem.) dialysis.
dialogar (intr.) to dialogue: take part in a dialogue (kun); dialogizar to put in form of a d. (ulo).

diamanto (stone) diamond; diamantatra d. like, diamantoforma d. shaped; diamantizar to cover with d.s (ulu, ulo); diamanto taliita cut-d.; diamanto kruda rough d.; diamantogarnituro set of d.s; diamanto(frot)polvo d. dust; muntar diamanto to set a d.
diametro (geom.) diameter; diametro (interna) caliber, bore (of guns, etc.)
dianto (bot.) pink (genus: Dianthus).
diapazono tuning-fork.
diarear (intr.) to have a diarrhoea.
diaso* (geol.) dyas: the Permian formation.
diastazo (chem.) diastase.
diastolo (physiol.) diastole. Ant.: sistolo.
diatezo (med.) diathesis.
diatomeo (zool.) diatom.
diatonika (mus.) diatonic.
diatribo diatribe.

dicar (tr.) to say, tell, (ulo, ad ulu): dico, dicajo saying, what one says; sudicanta so-called, self-styled. V. exp.: Gramatikale, dicar esas transitiva, parolar netransitivia: co konstitucas granda, esencala difero. Dicar sempre relatas ula objekto, t.e. la kozi (frazi) quin on dicas; parolar expresas la pura ago di la voco. «On devas parolar por dicar ulo; ma existas multa homi, qui parolas por dicar nulo»; V

dicernar (tr.) to discern: to see and identify by noting differences; dicern(ad)o, dicernuro discernment, discrimination; dicerniveso discernment (faculty); dicernebla distinguishable. Def.: Vidar o komprenar la difero di du kozi (t.e. ke li diferas); III
diciplinar (tr.) to discipline (children, soldiers, etc.); sen diciplina, n diciplinita undisciplined.
dicipulo, dicipululo, dicipulino disciple
didaktiko didactics.
didelfo (zool.) opossum (Didelphis).
diedra*, diedro* (geom.) dihedral.

dieto (med., also legislative) diet; dietala dietary; dietigar to d. (ulu); impozar dieto ad ulu to place someone on a d.; esar en dieto to be on a d. Def. (Nutranta) rejimo sequenda; parlamentatra kunveno. VI
dietetiko* (med.) dietetics.
diezo (mus.) a sharp (#).

difamar (tr., jur.) to defame, traduce, libel, asperse; difamanta, difamiva, difamema defamatory; (cf. maldicensar, kalumniar, denigrar). Def.: Dicar ulo vera o nevera qua atakas la honoro or reputeso; ago, punisebla da la civila lego; II

diferar (intr.) to differ: be different, be unlike; (of opinion) to disagree; difero (math.) difference; diferanta different. Ex.: La sentimenti, la interesti di homi diferas. Diferar opinione de ulu. La difero inter tri e un esas du. V. exp.: Diferanta esence des-simila (per speco); diversa plu multa kam un. Ex.: La diversa dezinenci di vorto havas senci diferanta: (E. the various terminations of a word have different meanings).

diferenciar (tr., intr., biol., sociol.) to differentiate, to acquire or give a distinct or separate character (cf. diferencialigar); diferenci(ad)o differentiation, the modification or specialization of parts or organs.
diferencialo (math.) differential; (tech.) d. gear; diferencialigar (math). to differentiate; diferencialig(ad)o differentiation.
difraktar (tr., opt.) to defract.
difterio (med.) diptheria; difteriika, difterio diphtheritic (person).
diftongo (gram.) diphthong.
difuzar (tr.) to diffuse: to spread, disperse widely.
digo dike, dam, coffer-dam; digizar to dike, dam. Def.: Konstrukturo por preventar indundado.
digestar (tr., physiol.) to digest; digestigivo (med.) a digestive.
digitalo (bot.) digitalis.
digitalino* (med.) digitalin, digitalis.
digitigrada, digitigrado (zool.) digitigrade. Ant. plantigrada.
digna worthy; meriting, deserving; having merit, worth, virtue; digneso worthiness; (cf. respektindeso). Ex.: Digna de rekompenso, de laudo, de puniso.
digramo digraph; a combination of two or more letters to represent one sound, as ch, sh.

dika (dimension) thick; (plu) dikigar to thicken (cf. pludensigar); vitro dika de un centimetro glass one centimeter thick. Def.: Relatas nur un dimensiono (di geometriala solido), la 3a (pos longeso e larjeso); III
diklina (bot.) diclinous.
dikotiledono* (bot.) dicotyledon.
dikotoma* (bot.) dichotomous.
dikotomio (log.) dichotomy.
diktar (tr.) to dictate; utter sentences to be written down; (cf. imperar, impozar).
diktamo (bot.) dittany (genus: Dictamnus).
diktatoro dictator.
dilatar (tr.) to dilate. Ex. Kaloro dilatas korpi.
dilemo dilemma.
diletar (tr.) to have a great liking for, be partial to, be an amateur in (music, etc.); diletanta, diletanto diletante.
diligenta diligent. Def.: Qua agas kun zelo e rapideso. V. exp.: vid. asidua. Ant. lenta, indolenta, neagema.
dilijenco diligence, stage-coach.
dilutar (tr.) to dilute; thin by admixture of a liquid; dilutanta, dilutema (of style, etc.) diffuse.
diluvio deluge, flood; diluvialo, diluviala formacuro (geol.) diluvium.
dimensiono dimension.
diminutar (tr., intr.) to diminish, lessen, diminutiva, ivo dimunutive; (cf. mingrandigar, mingrosigar). Ant. Augmentar, kreskar, ampligar; developar.
dimitio (fabric) dimity.
dina thin; on dimension of a paper, plank, etc.; (plu)dinigar to make t.; dine taliar to mince, cut thin (meat, etc.) V. exp.: vid. dika. Ant.: dika.
dinamo (mashino) dynamo.
dinamiko dynamics.
dinamismo dynamism; the doctrine that all substance involves force.
dinamito dynamite; dinamitagar to d.
dinamometro dynamometer.
dinastio dynasty.
dindo turkey.
dinear (intr.) to dine, to be at dinner; dineohoro d. time; frua dineo early d. Def.: Dineo esas la repasto dil vespero; VI
dinosaurio* (paleon.) dinosaur(ian).
dinoterio* (paleon.) dinothere.
diocezo diocese (of a bishop).
dioptro (opt.) diopter: sight-vane. Def.: La fesnestreto tra qua on regardas por vizar punto per l'instrumento nomata alidado; IV
dioptriko dioptrics. Def.: Teorio di la optikala vitri (kp. katoptriko); IV
dioramo diorama:
diorito (min.) diorite.

diplasar (tr.) to displace; to change the place of (ulo); to misplace; put out of place (ulo); diplasar su to change one's place or residence; diplasopezo (nav.) displacement (of a ship); il diplasas omno en sua chambro he puts everything out of place in his room; diplasar libro to misplace a book; (cf. egarar).
diplomo diploma; diplomizar to confer a d. upon (ulu).
diplomaco diplomacy, diplomatics; (fig.) tact, shrewdness; skill in conducting any kind of negotiation or social matter; diplomacema, diplomacatra diplomatic; diplomacisto diplomat.
diplomatiko diplomatics: science of ancient writings.
diporto (stock exchange) backwardation. Def.: Ajorno til proxima borsal liquidaco di la livro di valori vendita, pagante premio; la premio pagata por ta ajorno; II
diptera, diptero (ent.) dipteral (insect).
diptiko diptych: ancient tablet of two leaves.
direciono (line of) direction, bearing (both ways). Ex.: Du paraleli havas la sama direciono; IV

direktar (tr.) to direct; manage, conduct; put in a direction, (ulu, ulo, ad); direkt(ad)o direction, management; direkteyo, direkterio manager's house or office; direktanta, iva directive, managing; direktanto, direktero, direktisto director, manager; direktisteso, direktereso directorship; direktistala, direkterala directorial direktebla dirigible; mis direktar to mismanage. Ex.: Direktar veturo, navo, armeo, teatro. Direktisto di fabrikerio. Direktar sua regardi vers objekto. Direktar la studiado di ulu. Direktebla balono esas aer-navo. V. exp.: vid. guidar.
direktorio* (Fr. hist.) Directoire.

direta direct (opposite to indirect, as: direct way, discourse, method); direta treno through train. Ex.: La Suez-kanalo esas la voyo maxim direta de Europa a la extrema oriento. V. exp.: La voyo direta de A a B povas ne esar rekta (E. straight). Ant.: nedireta.
dis (mus.) D. sharp.
disdonar (tr.) to distribute promiscuously, deal out; dis(ad)o distribution, giving (gifts, etc.), deal (at cards); (cf. distributar, repartisar). Def.: Donar hike ed ibe (ordinare hazarde); VI
disenterio (med.) dysentery; disenteriala, ika (persons) dysenteric.
disertar (intr.) to dissertate; diserto, uro dissertation; oral or written examination on a question; disquisition; (college) theme.
disho dish (of food), viand, mess; disho frianda a toothsome d.; karno disho meat dish, dish of meat.

disidenta (rel.) dissident, dissenting; disident(ul)o dissenter; disidenteso dissent. Def.: (Teknikala termino di religiala historio): qua ne konsentas kun la maxim multa samreligiani pri ula punto, dogmato; III
disimular (tr.) to dissimulate, dissemble; hide under a false appearance; disimulanta two-, double-faced, artful, sly. Def.: Celar sua pensi, opinioni, sentimeni, o fingar altri; III

disipar (tr.) to waste, squander; (cf. extravagar, prodigar); disip(ad)o, disipeso dissipation, waste; disipanto, disipero, disipemo squanderer, spendthrift, prodigal, waster. Def.: Spensar abunde ed ecese sua havaji en multa frivola o sterila spensi, e havas prefere blamanta senco. Figurale, on disipas sua forteso, sua atenco inter multa objekti e skopi; IV
disko disc, disk; (games) quoit, discus; disko di luno d. of the moon; signal disko signal d. (as on R.R.).
diskontar (tr., com.) to discount: advance money on a bill, deducting the interest; diskontisto bill-broker.

diskreta discreet, diskreteso discretion. Ex. Il esas saja e diskreta persono. Atingar la evo di diskreteso. Fidar a la diskreteso di ulu. V. exp.: Modesta esas ta qua havas pri su opiniono moderata, ne exajerata, e ne havas ecesa pretendi; humila esas ta, qua havas pri su basa opiniono, e qua pozas su base, sub la ceteri; diskreta esas ta qua evitas jenar or tedar la ceteri per sua demandi, o nocar li per ne-prudenta agi, exemple revelanta la sekretaji; IV
diskriminanto* (math.) discriminant.
diskursiva* (phil.) discursive: proceeding regularly from premises to conclusion.

diskutar (tr.) to discuss (a questoin, project, point of law, etc); diskutachar to wrangle, dispute, cavil; diskutebla, diskutinda: discussable, debatable. Def.: Examenar questiono ponderante la «por» el la «kontre». Parolante pri personi ne havanta la sama opiniono, kambiar argumenti pri ula temo; V

dislokar (tr.) to dislocate: disarrange, put out of order or place; (milit.) to break up (an army); to dismember (a state). Ex.: On dislokas, sive mobili, utensili, mashini, sive armeo od armeo-korpo; III
dismo tithe; impozar la dismo to t., levy t.s.
disociar (tr., chem.) to dissociate; break up into consitutents.
disonancar (intr., mus.) to make a dissonance, discord; (cf. des, mis, neakordar).
dispacho (mar. insur.) adjustment of averages; dispachisto nautical assessor.

disparata (log.) disparate; (fig.) incongruous; disparatajo, disparateso disparity. Def.: Teknike e precize, aplikesas a du nocioni, qui ne apartenas a la sama genero, nek esas genero l'una di l'altra. Vulgare e laxe, dicenas pri omno quo esas tre nesimila, nekoheranta, neharmonianta; III
dispartigar to dismember; take part from part, take limb from limb.
dispecigar to dismember; take piece from piece, carve up.

dispensar (tr.) to dispense (ulu de ulo) to exempt, excuse from, give leave not to do or observe (ulo); dispenso dispensation; (cf. permisar). Ex.: Dispensar de la fasto. La granda evo dispensas la oldi militar. Ant.: obligar, koaktar.
dispensario dispensatory, dispensary (med.) Def.: Loko en qua la povri povas konsultar medicinisti e recevar flegi o medikamenti (sen lojar en ol); III
dispepsio (med.) dyspspsia; dispepsiika, dispepsiiko dyspeptic.

dispersar (tr.) to disperse, scatter. Ex.: La vento dispersas la nubi, la folii. Armeo vinkinta dispersas l'enemiki. Disperso di la Judi. V. exp.: Dispersar esas preske sinonima di dissemar, ma kun ideo plu agema, ideo di lanso, pulso ad fore; IV

disponar (tr.) to have the disposal of, have (ulo) at one's disposal; to dispose of (ulo); disponebla disposable, available; (milit.) unattached; disponebleso disposability: (milit.) state of being unattached; Ex.: Ca homo disponas sua domo, sua havaji. (power of disposal). La libri esas en vua dispono. Me havas cento de franki disponebla por komprar. Oficiro, trupi disponebla. Me donas a vu la disponebleso di mea havaji. Esar sub la dispono di ulu. (E. to be at a person's beck and call).
dispozar (tr.) to dispose, lay out, parcel out; dis(ad)o, diseso disposition, arrangement.

disputar (intr.) to have a dispute, to quarrel, wrangle, bicker; disputo quarrel, altercation; disputachar to squabble, brawl, wrangle about trifles; disputebla disputable, contentable; disputema disputatious, quarrelsome; inter disputar to mutally quarrel. Def.: Diskutar senordine e grosiere; V
disruptar (tr.) to disrupt, break asunder.
dissekar (tr.) to dissect.
dissemar (tr.) to disseminate: sow, scatter (seed); to strew, (things); spread abroad (ideas, error, truth, etc.).
dissendar (tr.) to spread, send in different directions.

dissolvar (tr., lit. and fig.) to dissolve, liquify; (fin.) liquidate, wind up; diso, diseso, disuro dissolution, solution; disema, disiva, disivo solvent, dissolvent. Ex.: Aquo dissolvas sukro. Dissolvar societo. Dissolvo di parlamento, di mariajo.
distar (intr.) to be distant, be remote; disto distance; distanta de Paris per 5 km. to be 5 km distant from Paris.
distensar (tr.) to distend.
distiko (verse) distich.
distilar (tr.) to distil.

distingar (tr.) to distinguish; set apart; to characterize; to make distinct or different by sign, mark or characteristic; distingo distinction: making different; distingeso distinctness, characteristicness; distinganta, distingebla distinct, characteristic; distingita distinguished (person, object); distingiva distinctive. Def.: Facar ulo por ke altru povez discernar; III
distordar (tr.) to distort.

distraktar (tr.) to distract, divert; distrakt(ad)o, distrakteso distraction, diversion, recreation; (fig.) absence of mind; distraktita diverted; (fig.) absent-minded; distraktanta:, distraktiva diverting entertaining. Def.: Deturnar la mento, l'atenco de sua objekto per amuzivo, sive per irg altra moyeno. Existas menti naturale distrakata o distraktebla, qui distraktesas da irga extera kauzo, o mem da nula; IV
distranchar (tr.) to cut up (into pieces), carve (off).

distributar (tr., gen. and tech.) to distribute; to deal out, apportion, dispense; (cf. disdonar, repartisar). V. exp.: Distributar esas donar (o sendar) a siversa personi o loki, ma kun dicerno, ne hazarde. Exemple, on distributas premii a la skolani. Teknikale, on distributas la vaporo a la du parti di cilindro en oportuna tempo; VI
distrikto district. Def.: Limitizita teritorio sub un judicial resortiso.

ditenar (tr.) to detain; withhold, keep back (what belongs to another); diteno detention: withholding; ditenanto, ditenero holder, possessor (of public property); one who withholds from another. (N.B. not used in sense of imprison, cf. enkarcerigar). Def.: Konservar til ula evento; II
ditirambo dithyramb.
distreso distress; distreskrio cry of d.; distresala signalo signal of d.

divagar (intr., lit. and fig) to ramble, wander, rove, stray, divagate. Ex.: Bestii divigas. La divagi di aquofluo. Alkoholiko divagas en sua parolado, t.e. vagas en sua parolado o mem sua pensado, sen ordino nek raciono; III

divano divan. V. exp.: Divano ne havas dors-apogilo, ma nur movebla kuseni. Sofao havas dors-apogilo (esas quaze repozlito). Kanapeo esas quaze larja stulego por plura personi, kun dors-apogilo e brakio-apogili; II

divenar (intr., tr.) to become; to get, grow, pass into some new state or condition; to become of; be the final condition of; quo il divenos? what will he become? or what will become of him? (cf. divenesk). Ex.: Divenar malada, povro, richa, grasa. La homo, diveninta plu saja, agas plu bone.
divergar (tr.) to diverge (de, ek). Def.: Deviacar, dispersar di un punto a diferanta direcion-o, -i; (fig.) esar ne-konkordanta. Ex.: Lumradii divergas. Divergo di opinioni. Ant.: konvergar.

diversa sundry, diverse, several, various; diversaji sundry articles: distinct things, not necessarily different in kind; diverseso diversity; variety, multiplicity. Def.: Qua esas plu multa kam un, ma ne granda nombro. Ex.: Diversa personi. La diversa interesti di la nacioni. La diversa senci di vorto.

diversiono (milit.) diversion; turning aside; diversionar (intr.) to make, cause a d. Def.: Atako (en kombato) por deturnar l'atenco e la fortaji di la enemiko; simila taktiko en la konversado, por deturnar ol de temo jenanta, desagreabla, nekonvenanta, e.c. (Ne konfundenda kun digreso); III
dividar (tr., math. and gen.) to divide (ulo, per ulo); maxim granda komuna dividanto greatest common divisor; dividebla divisible (per); dividendo (math., fin.) dividend.

divinar (tr.) to divine: guess (by any means); divinajo, divinendo puzzle, poser, riddle; (cf. konjektar, predicar). Ex.: Divinar la intenci di ulu. Divinar engimato. Me donas a vu di foyi divinar ol. Divino di la futuro.
diviziono (milit.) division.
divulgar (tr.) to divulge; reveal, make known (a secret, news, etc.).
dizastro disaster. Def.: Desfortuno tre granda e subita, generale koncernanta multa homi o tota socio, ex. grava vinkeso, granda incendio, naufrajo; III
«djin» djinn, jinni.
do (mus.) do: first tone of diatonic scale.
do (prep.) therefore, then, so, consequently, (introduces a conclusion). Ex.: Me pensas, do me existas. Il esas vua patro, do vu devas respektar il. L'alkoholo foligas, do ol esas veneno.
docar (tr.) to teach; (cf. instruktar, lernar); docajo something taught; docantaro teachers (collect.).
docento private docent; private teacher or lecturer (university).
docila docile, tractable. Def.: Facile docebla e duktebla; II-19. Ex.: Skolano docila. Docila kavalo.
dodekaedro* (geom.) dodecahedron.
dodekagina* (bot.) dodecagynian: having twelve styles.
dodekagono* (geom.) dodecagon.
dogo mastiff.
dogano (institution) customs; doganeyo custom-house, place; doganpago, dogantaxo custom-duty; doganuniono c. union.
dogmato dogma; dogmatifar to dogmatize.
dogmatiko dogmatics.
dogro (boat.) dogger.
dojo (title) doge.
doko dock. Def.: Mar-baseno por konstruktar o reparar navi; baseno cirkondita da kayi o warfi por charjar o descharjar navi.
doktoro doctor; holder of a doctorate; doktoreso doctorate; doktoro pri yurcienco d. of laws; doktoro pri literaturo d. of letters.
doktrino doctrine.
dokumento document; dokumentizar to document; supply with d.s.

dolo (jur.) fraud, deception, malice; evil or criminal intent; doloza trompo fraudulent deception; doloza krimino malicious crime. Def.: En la kriminal yuro, ol signifikas la kontrelega volo vizanta l'exekuto di krimino (doloza krimino); en la civila yuro: l' ago intence kontrelega, ex. pri kontrati; VI

dolca pleasing to the taste: dolca oranjo, vino sweet orange, wine; dolca odoro, (ek)sufluro a sweet smell, breath; pleasing to the ear: dolca voco, murmuro a sweet voice, a gentle murmur; pleasing to the mind; dolca influeso a gentle influence; dolca memoro a pleasant remembrance; dolca koloro, lumo a soft (or pleasing) color, light; (miscel.) dolca vetero mild weather; dolca dormo a soft slumber; dolca humoro a gentle humour; dolca kiso a sweet kiss; (cf. sukroza).

dolio (tech.) dolly-end; doliiero dolly, holding-on-tool. Def.: Doliiero esas specala instrumento, qua uzesas en la rivetago pro impedar la riveto ekbatesar per la martelagi. Dolio esas la kavajo, qua esas ye l'extremajo di la doliiero; III
dolikocefala, dolikocefalo dolichocephal(ous).
«dollar» (pl.«dollar»i) dollar.
dolmano hussar's pelisse.
dolmeno domen, cromlech: table-stone. Def.: Speco di megalita monumento; VI
dolomito (min.) dolomite.

dolorar (intr.) to feel a pain, to suffer (physically; cf. chagrenar); doloro physical suffering: pain, ache; dolori throes, pangs; doloranta, doloroza painful, sore; dolorigar to cause pain to (ulu), to make sore, make suffer; doloriganta which causes pain, painful; havar reumatismala dolori to have rheumatic pains.
domo house; domala domestic; relating to a house; dometo small h., cottage; domestro, dommastro head of h.; domochefo major-domo; domoguvernistino house-keeper; domkorpo main building.

domajar (tr., phys. sense) to damage; to injure, harm, impair, spoil; domajiva injurious, hurtful; ye lua domajo to his injury, cost; sen domaja, ne domajata undamaged. Ex.: La pluvo domajas la rekoltajo. La kanono domajis ta edifico. V. exp.: vid. detrimentar.
domeno domain; estate (cf. terhavajo); domenodomo manor-house.
domestika (of animals) domesticated; domestikigar to domesticate (cf. domtar, amansar).
domicilo domicile; residence, place of abode; domicilala domiciliary; domicilizar to d., settle (ulu).
dominanto* (mus.) dominant; fifth note of scale.
domino (game) dominoes; (mantle) domino; dominostono domino (single-piece).

dominacar (tr.) to have dominion over, sovereign authority, sway over; (fig.) tower, rise above, command, control; dominaco domination, dominion; dominacanta, dominacema dominant, predominant, prevailing; dominacachanta domineering. Ex.: Napoleon deziris dominacar Europa. Dominacar la pasioni. Monto dominacanta la maro. Fuorto dominacas la urbo. Religio dominacanta.
dominikano* Dominican (friar).
domtar (tr.) to subdue, subjugate, quell. V. exp.: On domtas propre la sovaja bestii (sen vere amansar oli, nek igar oli domestika). On domtas figurale la pasioni, la furioza amaso (turbo), e.c.; III

donar (tr.) to give; dono giving; donajo what is given; (fig.) gift (cf. donacajo); donema generous; don(at)ajo, donaji datum, data. Ex.: Donar manjajo. Donar donacajo. Donar sua filiino en mariajo. Donar signo di vivo. Donar la manuo. Donar puniso, apetito, letro ad ulo. V. exp.: Me donas manjajo ad ulu, ma me ne donacas la manjajo, nam me postulas pekunio por ol. Ant.: aceptar, recevar.

donacar (tr.) to give: make a donation, a gift, a present of (ulo, ad ulu), to give away, bestow; donacajo gift; donacariodonee; donacanto, donacinto, donacero donor. Ex. Donacar almono. Donacar (senrekompense) manjaji a la povri. V. exp.: vid donar.

dop (prep., in space) behind, back of, after, posterior; (cf. pos); dope from behind, in back; dopa rear, back, hinder; dopajo object or part behind; dop la domo behind the house; dopa butiko back-shop; dopa korto back-yard; dopa masto after mast; mizzenmast; dopirar to come after (not necessarily «to follow»); doplando hinterland; dopremar to scull; dopremilo sculling oar. Ant. avan.
dorado (ich.) dorado: a species of dolphin (Coryphaena hippurus).
Doriana Dorian (race, dialect).
dorika (arch.) Doric.
dorlotar (tr.) to coddle, pet; (fig. to nurse); dorlotachar to pamper (a child, a person); me prizas dorlotar me I love to take my ease, to coddle myself. Def.: Traktar delikat-ege, -ache.

dormar (intr., tr.) to sleep, be asleep, slumber; dormanta sleeping, dormant; dormetar to doze; dormema (momentarily) sleepy (cf. somnolar); dormemo sleepyhead; dormeyo sleeping place, dormitory; dormeskar to fall asleep; dormigar to lull, send (ulu) to sleep; dormigiva, dormo soporific; dormetigar to make drowsy; la infanto dormas dolce the child sleeps a sweet sleep; dormochambro sleeping chamber, cubicle.
dorno (bot.) thorn, prickle.
dornoginesto (bot.) furze, thorn-broom, gorse (Ulex).
dornoperko (ich.) stickleback (Gasterosteus aculeatus).

dorso (anat. and of knife, book, hand, etc.) back; dorsala relating to the back; dorsal; dorso an dorso back to back; dorsapogilo back of a seat; dorsokorbo basket (carried on b.); dorsokurva round-shouldered; dorsosako knapsack.
doselo dais; raised, canopied seat, fixed or portable.

dotar (tr.) to endow: furnish a dowry, dower, marriage-portion to (ulu); supply (some public institution with a permanent fund); doto, doturo dowry (provided by father or family of the bride), (cf. doario) endowment; (fig.) gift, talent; sen dota puerino a portionless girl; la talento esas la maxim bona doturo quan on povas donar a sua filii talent is the best dowry one can give his children; havar la doto plezar to have the gift of pleasing.
dozo (med., pharm.) dose; dozigar (tr.) to put up a doze of, to apportion a dose of (ulo).
draceno (bot.) dragon-tree (Dracaena).
dragar (tr.) to dredge (out) (a river, etc.), to explore with a drag; dragilo, dragmashino, dragbatelo, dragnavo dredge.
dragomano dragoman. Def.: Interpretisto en Oriento; IV
dragono (milit.) dragoon.
drajeo sugar-plum. Def.: Mandelo od altra kozo kovrita per harda sukrajo; V
drako (myth.) dragon; (astron.) Draco.
drakmo (Gr. money) drachma; (weight) dram: eighth part of a troy ounce.
drakonala Draconian; severe, cruel.
dramato drama: dramatala, dramatatra, dramatoza dramatic; dramatigar, dramatifar (tr., intr.) to dramatize.
drapo (woolen) cloth; drapokomerco c. trade.
drapirar (tr.) to drape: to cover with drapery, hang in folds.
drashar (tr.) to thresh, thrash (grain); drashilo, drashmashino flail; thresher.
drastika (med. and fig.) drastic.
drenar (tr.) to drain (a field, a wound, etc.); drentubo drainage pipe.

dresar (tr.) to train, break in (animals). V. exp.: On dresas l'animali por igar li exekutar ula determinita (ofte ne naturala) movi, sive por servar la homo (ex. kavalkado), sive por facar irga prodaji. Omna domestika animalo esas edukata da sua mastro; ma ne omni esas dresita. Me povas edukar chasokundo (t.e. hundo de chasala raso) sen ule dresar lu (por la chaso o por irga altra agado); VI
driado (myth.) dryad, wood-nymph.
driftar (intr., nav.) to drift. Def.: Esar pulsata da vento o mar-fluo exter sua voyo; II

drinkar (tr.) to drink; drinkeyo, drinkerio bar, public house; drinkopekunio drink-money, tip; drinkkansono drinking song; drinkofumeyo tap-room (lit. drink and smoke place); ne drinkebla undrinkable.
drogo drug; drogerio druggist's establ.; drogizar to physic, give a d. to (ulu, su).
drola droll, funny, humorous.
dromedaro (zool.) dromedary.

dronar (tr.) to drown; (of ships) to founder, go to the bottom; dronito a d.ed person. Def.: Mortigar ulu, su per asfixio en liquido. V. exp.: La navisti ne dronesis, nam la navo ne dronesis, ma nur sinkis til la bordo; (cf. II
dronto (orni.) dodo, dronte (Didus ineptus).
drugeto (fabric) drugget.
druido druid.
drupo (bot.) drupe.
druzo (min.) druse.

du two; duo a couple, pair, dyad; duima, duimo half (N.B. but «half» in composition is translated by mi as, mihoro, micirklo); duimigar to divide in half; duopla, duoplo double; duopligar to double, to duplicate; dufoye two times, twice; duala dual; dualo dual; number in gram.; dualismo dualism; dekedu twelve; duadek e tri twenty-three; dekeduo a dozen; duadeko a score; duacenteun two hundred and one; duacenteokadekesis 286; dekeduamil 12,000; duople kin esas dek twice five is ten; duima litro half a liter; duime aquo, duime vino half water, half wine; duime fola half foolish; ye duima voyo (at) half way, midway; dividar duime (kun ulu) to go halves; la soldati marchis duope the soldiers marched by twos; omna duesma dio every second day, every other day; la du both (adjectively); due both (adverbially); li du iris a la staciono they both went to the station; ni du konkordis we were both agreed; omna du esis ebria both men were drunk; dumasta navo two-masted ship; plu kam duime more than half; il arivis ye du kloki he arrived at two o'clock; dumanua two-handed; dupartigo bipartition; dupartisana, duala bipartisan; dusenca double meaning; equivocal; duajo equivocation; duyarala biennial (cf. miyarala). DEFIRS

dubar (intr.) to doubt; waver in opinion, hesitate to believe; dubala, dubanta dubative; dubema, dubinda, dubebla doubtful, dubious, ambiguous, questionable; dubanto, dubemo doubter; dubemeso distrustfulness; sen dube without doubt, undoubtedly. Ex.: Me ne dubas, ke il venos. Dubar pri ulo. Solvar dubo.
duelar (intr.) to fight a duel (kun, kontre ulu).
dueno duenna, chaperon.
dueto (mus.) duet, duo.
duk(ul)o duke (de); dukino duchess; dukala ducal; dukeso (rank, dignity) dukedom; dukio duchy.
dukato (coin) ducat.
duktar (tr.) to lead, conduct, bring along (ulu, ulo). V. exp.: vid. guidar.
duktila ductile.
dulkamaro (bot.) woody night-shade, bitter-sweet (Solanum dulcamara).

dum (prep.) during (the whole period spoken of); marks interval of time an event has taken place in; dume meanwhile, in the mean time, yet, still; dum ke (conj.) while, whilst, during the time when. Ex.: Dum la nokto. Il habitis dum plura yari en mikra vilajo. La mesajo arivis dum lua absenteso. Dum ke vu repozos, me skribos. Dume la vetero esis varma.
duno dune, down, sand-hill.

dungo manure, compost (artificial manure); dungizar to m.; dungotero vegetable mold; (cf. sterko). Def. Omno quon on mixas a la tero por igar ol plu fertila. On uzas multa minerala dungi, qui ne esas sterko; VI
duodenumo (anat.) duodenum.
dup(ul)o dupe; dupigar to dupe, take in, make a person believe a falsehood; dupiganto, dupero cheat, trickster; dupospozulo cuckold. Ex. Il lasis su dupigesar (da ulu) quale stultulo.
dupliko* (jur.) rejoinder.
duplikato duplicate, identical copy.

durar (intr.) to last, endure, remain, continue, hold out; (cf. permanar, kontinua); duronta to be continued (cf. pluso sequos). Ex.: La piramidi di Egiptia ankore duras. La skribado duras. Durigar diskurso, letro. Spaco e duro. Dur-iva stofi, instrumenti. Duranta joyi, chagreni.
duramatro* (anat.) dura mater.
dushar (tr.) to douche: give a shower bath to.
duvo (barrel-) stave. Def. Duvi esas planki di specala formo, ek qui on kompozas la bareli; III
duyongo dugong (Halicore dugong). Def.: Mar-hundo di la Malayal insularo (India-oceano, e.c.); III
e(d) (conj.) and.
ebeno, ebenligno ebony; ebeniero, ebenarboro e. tree; ebenisto a worker in ebony: (fig.) an inlayer (of wood), cabinet maker (vid.: V. exp. karpentisto).
ebonito ebonite.
ebria, ebriega, ebriema, ebrieta drunken, intoxicated; ebrieso, ebriemeso inebrity, drunkenness, intoxication; ebriigar to intoxicate; par ebriigar to make dead drunk.

ebuliar (intr.) to form bubbles, to bubble up or froth (as water from a spring, blood from a vein; (fig.) to be boiling from anger or passion); (cf. efervecar, boliar); ebulio, ebulieso bubbling, ebulition.
e. c. (ed ceteri, e) et cetera (etc.).
ecelar (intr.) to excel; be excellent, be eminent, be superior (en, pri). Ex.: Ca homulo ecelas en omno quon il entraprezas. Ecelar pri natado; ecelanta libro, homo. Ecelo di frukto.
ecelenco (title) excellency. Ex.: Lua ecelenco, la ambasadisto di …
ecentrika (geom., mechan.) eccentric (wheel, rod, etc.).

eceptar (tr.) to except; leave out, exempt, exclude; ecept(ad)o, eceptajo (act, object) exception; ecepte save, unless, except; ecepte ke (conj.) except (that), with the exception that; ecepta, eceptala exceptional; eceptale by way of exception. Def.: Ne inkluzar en, exkluzar de ula nombro. Ex.: Eceptar ula kondamniti de amnestio. Existas nula regulo sen eceptajo. Ecepte ica personi, omni iros. Me ne permisos ke vu iros, ecepte ke vu pagos la domaji.

ecesar (tr., intr.) to exceed; go beyond the proper limits; be guilty of excesses (in eating, drinking, etc.); eceso, ecesajo (math.) difference by which one number exceeds another; transgression of due limits; abuse, waste; ecesanta, ecesiva excessive; (fig.) exorbitant; ecese to excess, immoderately. Ex.: La debajo ecesas mil franki. Mea spensi ne ecesas mea recevaji. Ecesar pri manjado. Eceso en laborado. Koldeso ecesanta. Ecesanta superbeso. Preco ecesiva. DEFIS
echopo small wooden booth, stall.

ecitar (tr.) to excite: arouse, impel, incite, urge, provoke, prompt. Ex.: Ecitar ulu laborar, revoltar. Ecitar l'iraco, la jaluzeso. La novaji efektigas granda eciteso. Ecito di la nervi. Vivo ecitanta. Ecitiva medikamento. Ecitema homo.
ed and.
«edelweiss»edelweiss (Gnaphalium leontopodium)
edemo* (med.) oedema.
edeno Eden.
edero (zool.) eider (genus: Somateria).
ederduno eider-down; ederduna kovrilo e. quilt.
edifico edifice; large building. Def.: Expresas ulo plu general kam domo, kastelo; palaco; edifico esas quaze meza inter ta tri vorti; III-200.
edifikar (tr.) to edify: instruct, improve morally. Ex.: Edifikar ulu per prediko, per exemplo. Konduto, paroli edifik-anta, -ema, -iva.
edilo (Rom. hist.) edile.
«Edipus» Oedipus; (fig.) riddle-solver.
