editar (tr.) to publish (a book, a paper) (not E. «edit» cf. redaktar): edit(ad)o publishing; edituro, editajo edition, publication; editanto, editero, editisto publisher. Def.: Imprimar (libro, jurnalo, e.c. por vendar); imprimar la texto di ula autoro; V-405.

edukar (tr.) to educate (children, people); to develop and cultivate the physical, intellectual and moral faculties; to form the manners of; to rear, raise, breed (cattle and other animals); to train, rear (plants); il esas yunulo male edukita he is an ill-bred young man. V. exp.: La general ideo kovrata da "edukar" esas multe plu larja kam la intelektala edukado (di homi, infanti), qua koincidas preske kun l'instruktado; (kp. VI-383, anke dresar).

efacar (tr., lit. and fig.) to efface: erase, rub out, expunge; efacesar to be effaced, obliterated. (cf. obliterar), efacilo eraser. rubber. Ex.: Efacar la skriburo qua esas sur tabelo. Esas neposibla efacar la impreso de mea mento.
efebo (hist.) ephebus: virile youth.
efektivo (milit.) effective force, strength. Def.: Vorto militala por expresar la fakte existanta nombro di la trupi de homi, kavali, kanoni e vehili; V-420.
efemera ephemeral, short-lived; efemero, efemera insekto (ent.) ephemerid, dayfly. Ex.: Efemera floro, febro, feliceso.
efemerido ephemeris: astronomical almanac.
efervecar (intr., pr. and fig.) to effervesce, be effervescent. Def.: Ebuliado di gaso tra liquido; (fig.) emocar vivace, ma nedurante (ex. la eferveco dil pasioni).

efikar (intr.) to be efficient, be effectual, be efficacious; efikeskar to come into play, begin to take effect; efiko efficacy (action); efikanta, efikema, efikiva efficient, efficacious, effectual, effective; efikiveso, efikemeso efficiency; ne efikanta, efikiva; sen efika inefficient. Ex.: La moyeni efikas por la skopo. Efikiva remedio, kauzo.

eflorecar (intr., chem.) to effloresce; (cf. florifar); (med.) to come out in a rash, break out in pimples. Def.: Indikas fenomeno kemiala (formaco di kristali ye surfaco di solido o liquido), e fenomeno fiziologiala (mikra influro di la pelo); III-74.
efluvio effluvium.

egala equal; egalesar to be equal to (ulu, ulo); egaligar to equalize (ulo ad ulo); egal(ul)o an equal; egaleso equality; egalesala, egalema seeking or fond of equality, levelling: ne egala unequal; Ex.: Egala pezaji, korpi, yuri. Egalesar ulu en merito. La morto egaligas omni. Egaleso di preco, di evo, di forteso.

egarar (tr.) to mislay: lose for the moment; egaresar to be mislaid, missing. V. exp.: One ofte egaras kozi sen perdar oli. «Me mispozis mea plumiero sur la tablo; ol falis en la paperkorbo, e tale egaresis: ma ol ne esis perdita».

egardar (tr.) to pay regard to, take (ulu, ulo) into account; egardo regard, consideration, respect; egarde regard being had to; egarde sua yuneso in consideration of his youth. Ex.: L'autoro di ta pikturo ne egardis la neceseso di la perspektivo. Bona judiciisto judicias sen egardo ad la persono, il nur egardas lo bona di la stato.
egido aegis; (fig.) protection. DeFIS
ego ego; the self; «das Ich»; egismo egoism; egisto egotist; egista egoistic; selfish; mea altra ego my other self; mea propra ego my own self.
eglefino* (ich.) haddock (genus: Aeglefinus).
egorjar (tr.) to cut the throat of (ulu). Def.: Ocidar per kultel-frapo en la kolo (fauco); III-698.
egotismo egotism.
eis (mus.) E sharp.
ejektar (tr., tech.) to eject, cast out, expel, discharge, void.

ek (prep.) (general sense) out; (indicating motion) adportez stulo ek ta chambro bring a chair out of that room; lu prenis ca folio ek la tirkesto he took this leaf from the drawer (N.B. not to be confounded with de where point of departure is to be indicated: letro de Boston, letter from Boston); (indicating the material a thing is made of, extracted from) vazo ek oro a gold vase; ek quo esas ta tasi? li esas ek porcelano what are the cups made of? they are made of china; (indicating fractional parts) nonadek ek cent 90 out of 100 (90%); en ca armeo, 5 ek 100 esas ocidita, 10 ek 100 vundita in this army, five out of (every) 100 were killed, and ten per cent were wounded.
eko echo; ekigar to echo. Ex.: La vakua chambri ekigis nia pedopazi. (fig.) Kelki ekigas stultaji di altri.
"ekarte" (card game) ecarte.
ekfluar (intr.) to flow out; ekeyo outlet; ekanta effluent.
ekidno (zool.) echidna (genus: Echidna, sp. Hystrix). Def.: Australiana mamifero sendenta, qui ovifas, nutras su per insekti; V-484.
ekimoso (med.) ecchymosis; black and blue spot.
ekino (zool.) echinus, -oid; sea-urchin.
ekinodermo (zool.) echinoderm.
ekirar (intr.) to go out, get out, walk out; ekigar to make (ulu) go out from; to remove (ulu) from one place to another.
eklampsio (med.) eclampsia. Def.: Specala konvulso dum infanteso, uremio o parturo-stando; VI-480.
eklansar (tr.) to fling out, send forth.
eklektika eclectic.
eklezio church (as an institution; cf. kirko); ekleziano church-member.
eklipsar (tr., astron. and fig.) to eclipse.
ekliptiko (astron.) ecliptic.
eklogo eclogue.
ekmigrar (intr.) to emigrate. Ant.: enmigrar.
ekmodigar (tr.) to cause to go out of fashion; ekeskar to become out of fashion; eka old-fashioned.
ekonom(ul)o steward.

ekonomio economy; pecuniary management, administration; (not saving, cf. sparo). Def.: La administrado financala di domo, societo o stato; metafore on parolas pri l'ekonomio di organismo, konsiderante lua gani (nutrado) e spensi (perdi di materio e di energio); VII-399. Ex.: On parolas pri ekonomio hemala (menajala), urbala, rurala, nacionala.

ekonomiko* economics (science of); ekonomikala economic (theory); ekonomikisto (political) economist; nacionala ekonomiko political economy. Def.: La cienco o teorio dil ekonomio. La ciencisti qui okupas su pri la teorio nomesas "ekonomisti"; VII-398.
ekosmoso (phys.) exosmosis
ekprenar (tr.) to take out, withdraw (money, etc.)
ekpresar (tr.) to squeeze out, press out
ekpulsar to expel, thrust out, turn out; ekala, ekanta expulsive, expelling; ekar de la patrio to expatriate; (cf. expirar)
ekreligar to derail; ekirar to go off the track
eksekrecar (tr.) to excrete
ekspricar (intr.) to spurt out, ejaculate
eksuflar (tr.) to blow out
ekterigar to exhume, dig out, disinter, unearth
ekteritoria exter-, extraterritorial
ektirar (tr.) to draw out
ektranchar to cut off, amputate, cut off, excise (cf. amputar)
ekumenika* (rel.) ecumenical.
ekvarsar (tr.) to empty out, pour off, spill.
ekvokar (tr.) to call out or up (ulu)
ekzemo (med.) eczema.
elastika elastic, springy, rebounding; elastikeso elasticity; elastiko, elastikajo an elastic object.
elefanto elephant.
elefantiazo (med.) elephantiasis.
elegio elegy.

elektar (tr.) to elect (ulu, ek, inter); elekt(ad)o election, polling; elektiva elective; elektanto, elektero elector, constituent; elektala, elekterala electoral; elekteraro electorate; elektito person elected; elektoyuro right to or of election.

elektro electricity; elektrala, elektroza electric; elektrizar to electrify; elektristo electrician; elektrala baterio e. battery; elektrala klosh(et)o e. bell; mortigar (ulu) per elektroskoko (od, elektromortigar): to electrocute; elektrolumo e. light; elektromagnetala e.magnetic.
elektrodo elektrode.
elektrodinamiko electro-dynamics
elektroforo (phys.) electrophorus.
elektrokemio electro-chemistry
elektrolito electrolyte.
elektrolizar (tr., chem.) to electrolize.
elektrologio* electrology.
elektrometro* electrometer.
elektromobilo an electric automobile.
elektrono electron.
elektroskopo* electroscope. DEFIRS
elektrostatiko electrostatics.
elektrotekniko electrical engineering
elektroterapio electro-therapeutics
elektuario (pharm.) electuary.
elemento (all senses) element; -a, -ala: elemental.

elevar (tr.) to elevate, raise on high; (not to make higher in dimension; cf. plualtigar); elev(ad)o elevation (act; cf. altajo; elevaciono); elevanta (phys. sense) elevating; elevilo elevator. V. exp.: Elevar adjuntas a levar ideo di alteso, di supera nivelo. On levas de tero (til su) ulo falinta; on elevas aquo, stoni a la supro di domo konstruktata; II-648. EFIRS
elevaciono (design) elevation, raised-plan, side-view. Def.: Desegno di l'extera formi di ula korpo vidata en horizontal direciono; III-81.
elevatoro* (mechan., anat.) elevator. DEFIRS
elfo elf; elfala, elfatra elfin.
eliminar (tr.) to eliminate. Ex.: Eliminar nomo de la listo di kandidati. Eliminar toxikaji de la korpo. Eliminar de equaciono.
elipso (geom., gram.) ellipse, ellipsis. DEFIRS
elipsoido* (geom.) ellipsoid.
elito (milit. and fig.) the elite (of any army); choice troops, best men, flower (of army); (cf. eminentaro).
elitro (ent.) elytrum: wing sheath of beetles.
elixiro elexir.
Elizeo* (myth. and fig.) Elysium; Elizeala agri Elysian fields.
elizionar (tr., gram.) to elide.
eloquenta eloquent; (fig.) which produces the same effect as an eloquent speech. Ex.: Eloquenta parolanto, stilo. Lakrimi, silenco eloquenta.

eludar (tr.) to elude, evade; eludema, eludiva elusive, evasive. Def.: Evitar habile, rapide, ruzoze: III-324. Ex.: On eludas la frapo di espado; on eludas vizito, invito, obligo, tasko, questiono. Eludema respondo.
emalio enamel; emaliizar to e.; emalio parietoza cloisonné.
emanar (intr.) to emanate (de, ek). Ex.: Lumo emanas de la suno. Odori esas emani.
emancipar (tr.) to emancipate (ulu, de). Ex. Emancipar sklavo, populo, (fig.) emancipar la mento.

embarasar (tr.) to embarrass; to obstruct, clog up; to encumber, hamper, hinder; (in gen.) to hinder movement (physical, mental); ca veturi embarasas la voyothese vehicles block up the street; mea mantelo embarasas memy cloak encumbers me; mea aferi esas en embarasita standomy affairs (business) are in an embarrassed state; questiono embarasantaembarrassing question; bagajo embarasantacumbersome baggage; (kp. intrikar).

embargar (tr., naut. and fig.) to embargo, lay an e. on: prohibit to leave port; (jur.) to distrain, to levy a distress or execution, to garnishee or attack (for debt); pago embargo lien. Def.: Embargo: (1) interdikto a stranjera navo en-irar od ek-irar portuo; (2) legal sequestro di mobli od imobli di debanto por garantiar pago di debo; (3) pag-embargo: legal sequestro, di un kreditanto A., di sumo debata da un debanto B., ad altra persono C. por pagar debo di C. ad A.; II-75.
emberizo (orni.) bunting (Emberizo). L
emblemo emblem. Ex.: La hanulo esas emblemo (E. symbol) di vigilemeso. Emblemi di rejeso.

embotar (tr., tech.) to cold-roll, to stamp, bend or beat out (sheet metal); embotar kasrolo ek kupro to cold-roll or beat out a copper saucepan. Def.: Kurvigar duktila metali, en kolda stando, por konvexigar un latero e konkavigar l'altra.
embracar (tr.) to embrace, clasp, hug (in arms); to bracket; embracilo (typog.) brace ( { } )

embragar (tr., intr., tech.) to clutch, put in gear; establish contact between the motive power and that which starts the movement. Def.: Solidigar (en un instanto, e por irga duro) du axi per diversa mediata instrumenti ed organi; III-87. Ex.: Rimen-transmiso "embragas", kande on igas la rimeno pasar de libera pulio sur fixa pulio sam-axa e sam-periferia; (kp. ingranar, kuplar).
embrazuro (arch., fort.) embrasure.
embriogenio (physiol.) embryogeny.
embriologio embryology.
embriono embryo.
embrokar (tr., med.) to embrocate; rub with a lotion.
embuskar (tr.) to ambush; lie in concealment for; embuskar su to hide oneself; embusko, embuskeyo ambuscade.

emendar (tr.) to emend (a fault), rectify, free from error; (leg.) to amend (a law). V. exp.: On plubonigaso korektigaskozo, verko, ma ne defekto; on ne povas igar defekto "bona" o korekta, on simple supresas ol. Konseque on devas dicar: emendardefekto. On korektigasla kozo, emendantelua defekti; V-282.
emerita emeritus; retired. Ex.: Profesoro emerita.
emersar (intr.) to emerge (from a liquid); (fig.) to rise into view. Ant.: imersar, submersar.
emetiko* (pharm.) emetic.
emetropa* (opt.) emmetropic.
emfazar (tr., rhet.) to emphasize, stress; emfazala, emfazoza, emfazatra, emfazema emphatic.
eminenco (title) Eminence. Ex.: Lua eminenco, la kardinalo.

eminenta (quality) eminent, superior; (of place) conspicuous; (cf. remarkinda); eminent(ul)o e. person, notability; eminenteso eminence: superiority, excellence (cf. ecelo, altajo); eminentaro the elite, pick of a group; eminentega most e. Ex.: Eminenta homulo, ofico, rango. Vertuo, servo eminenta.
emiro (title) Ameer, Emir.
emisar (tr.) to emit: send forth, give out; (finan.) to issue (for circulation). Ex.: La kalor-radii quin la suno emisas. Emiso di monet-papero.
emocar, emoceskar (intr.) to feel emotion, be agitated, moved; emocigar to cause e. to. Ex.: El parolis tote sen emoco. Lua aspekto emocigis me. Quik kande me vidis il, me emocis.
empalar (tr.) to impale (ulu).
emperialo top, roof, outside (of a coach with seats).
empireo empyrean. Def.: Maxim alta cielo di antiqua mitologio e kosmologio; (poet.) la cielo.
empiriko empiricism (method); empirikismo empiricism (doctrine); empirikala empirical.
employar (tr.) to employ (ulu); (cf. uzar); employato employee, employanto, employero, employisto employer; employokontoro employment-office. Def.: Expresas la relato di patrono a salariato; III-468.
emposto (arch.) impost.
emula emulous. Def.: Qua penas egalesar od superesar la ceteri en laudinda kozi o loyala konkurso; III-468. Ex.: On kurajigas la emuleso inter la lernanti.
emulsar (tr.) to emulsify.

emundar (tr., hort.) to lop, prune, trim; (fig.) to remove anything useless, noxious or inferior. Def.: Branchotaliar; (vulgarasenco) netigar, beligar o preparar kozo per depreno di omna parti o peci neutila, nebona o nebela; (IV-106). Ex.: Emundar arboro. Emundar legumi, salado, ucelo, fisho (por koquar oli). Metafore, on emundas kalkulo, la konduto di ulu, verko literatural od artal, e.c.

en (prep.) in, of time and place; when really necessary to indicate motion into a place (into) ad should be prefixed: la ucelo flugis aden la kajo the bird flew into the cage. (En la kajo may mean that the bird was flying about the cage); en la vintro in the winter; en la urbo in the city: il venis aden la laboratorio he came into the laboratory.
enabismigar to cast into the abyss, swallow up, ingulf.
enanguligar to drive or put into a corner.
enartroso (anat.) enarthrosis.
enbareligar to barrel, put into casks.
enbekigar to put (ulo) into the beak of; to feed (a bird).
enboteligar to bottle.
enbrigadigar to form into a brigade.
enbursigar to put into one's purse, to pocket (money).
encefalo (anat.) encephalon.
encefalito (med.) encephalitis: inflammation of the brain.
enceluligar to put into a cell, into cells.
encenigar to put on the stage.
enciklika encyclical: circular; encikliko e. letter: papal letter.
enciklopedio encyclopedia.
encirkligar to encircle.
endemio (med.) endemic disease.
endetala (com.) retail; endetale by retail; endetal(vend)isto retailer. Ant.: engrosa.
endivio (bot.) endive (Cichorium endivia).
endokardo (anat.) endocardium.
endokarpo (bot.) endocarp.
enduktar (tr.) to lead (ulu) into (ulo), to introduce; (fig.) to involve (in a plot, etc.).
eneagono (geom.) enneagon.

enemik(ul)o an enemy, foe; enemik(ul)ala hostile, inimical; enemik(ul)alajo: hostile act or object; enemik(ul)eso enmity, hostility; enemik(ul)igar to render hostile; Def.: Persono qua havas des-amikala sentimento. Ant.: amiko.
energetiko energetics : theory or science of energy.
energio energy; energiala, energioza energetic.
enfakturigar to invoice, bill.
enfangigar to bemire, to sink (ulo) in the mud.
enfilar (tr., milit.) to enfilade; enfilopaf(ad)o e. fire.
enfiltrar (tr., intr., also fig.) to infiltrate.
enfluar (tr. intr.) to flow in; eneyo place of inflow; enanto affluent, tributary (stream).
enfokigar to put in focus.
enfornigar to put into an oven or a kiln.
engainigar to sheath (a sword, etc.).
engajar (tr.) to engage: to hire (ulu); (milit.) to enlist (ulu, su).
engrosa wholesale; engros(vend)isto wholesaler. Ant.: endetala.
enigmato enigma, riddle, puzzle.
enirar (tr., intr.) to enter, come in; eno entering, entree; eneyo entrance, enigar to cause to enter.
enkadrigar to frame.
enkajigar to cage.
enkarcerigar to incarcerate, lock-up, confine, imprison; (cf. inkluzar).
enkasigar to collect or put away (money, etc. in a treasury).
enkaustika, enkaustiko (paint.) encaustic.
enkazernigar to quarter in barracks.
enkestigar to incase; box up.
enklitika, enklitiko (gram.) enclitic.
enklostrigar to cloister (ulu).
enkofrigar to put (ulo) in a coffer, trunk.
enkorpigar to incorporate: mix into one substance or mass (also fig.) Ex.: Enkorpigar oro e arjento. Enkorpigar legi en kodexo. Enkorpigar teritorio stranjera. Enkorpigo di komercal societo.
enlanjigar to wrap in swaddling clothes.
enlitigar to confine (ulu) to bed; enar su to take to one's bed.
enluminar (tr.) to illuminate (a book); (cf. ascendar, lum-izar, iluminar); to color (an engraving, map).
enmagazinigar to warehouse, store.
enmigrar (intr.) to immigrate. Ant.: ekmigrar.
enmixar (tr.) to mix in, mingle.
enorma enormous. Def. grandega, grosega, kolos(atr)a, monstr(atr)a.
enosmoso (phys.) endosmose.

enoyar (intr.) to feel dull, be bored, be weary (because of inaction or monotony); enoyiganta, enoyiva: boring, irksome; enoyigar: to bore (ulu); me enoyas pro la manko di amuzo I am dull for lack of amusement; la monotoneso enoyigas me the monotony wearies me; la longa vartado esas enoyiganta the long wait is wearisome; (cf. tedar, iritar).
enpakigar to pack up, make into a bundle.
enposhigar to pocket, put in pocket (ulo).
enpotigar to pot.
ensakigar to sack, bag.

ensemblo the whole, ensemble; all parts taken together; general effect, collectivity, aggregate, totality; (cf. kune, entote); omna parti kune efektigas bela ensemblo all parts taken together produce a fine general effect; kantar ensemble to sing all together, ensembla movi mass movements.
enskribar (tr.) to inscribe; enuro inscription.
ento (philos. and fig.) entity, being.
entablamento (arch.) entablement, entablature.
entaliar (tr.) to cut into (so as to produce a certain form); (carp.) enartrabo to mortise a beam. Ex.: On entalias roko, tero por facar trancheo, tunelo, min-truo, e.c.; (IV-102).

entamar (tr.) to cut the first piece of, make a first cut, incision; (fig.) to encroach upon, begin upon, open up. Def.: Facar l'unesma trancho, l'unesma frapo, brecho, nocho, e figurale komencar; iniciar od inaugurar ulo; IV-102. Ex.: Entamar pano, botelo, pasteto, poto de konfituri; frapo (stroko di kultelo, o spado). Entamar (E. incise, cut) la pelo, la muskuli, la osto. Prodigemo entamas sua kapitalo.
enterigar to inter, bury (in the ground); (cf. sepultar).
enterito (med.) enteritis.
enternar (tr.) to intern: confine in a place or country.
entimemo* (log.) enthymeme.
entomologio entomology; entomologiisto entomologist.
entote on the whole, in all, altogether.

entraprezar (tr.) to undertake, engage to perform, take in hand, contract for; (cf. asumar); entraprez(ad)o undertaking (act); entraprezajo what is u.; the enterprise, contract; entraprezisto contractor, undertaker, masterbuilder; entraprezema enterprising. Ex.: Columbus entraprezis la deskovro di la kontinento ocidental. Entraprezar voyajo, konquesto. Me entraprezis la feliceso di mil homi desfortunoza: (E. I undertook to make a thousand unfortunate beings happy.) Ta firmo entrapezis la furniso di liti ad la armeo. La entraprezo di la kanalo di Suez esis laboro kolosala. Homulo entraprezema.
entratenar (tr.) to support, keep (with the needs of life) (ulu); entrateno maintenance, livelihood.
entravar (tr.) to shackle, fetter, trammel (a horse); (fig.) to clog, impede, embarrass. Def.: Impedar o jenar la marcho di animalo per irga moyeno; III-468.
entreo (cook.) entrée, side-dish. Def.: Disho qua venas pos la fisho ed ante la rostajo; V-621.
entrechato (dancing.) “entrechat”: a cross-caper.
entremeso (cook.) entremets, side dish. Def.: Disho inter la repasto propre dicita e la desero; V-621.
entrenar (tr.) to train (horses for racing); entrenero, entrenisto horsetrainer, pacemaker.
entresolo mezzanine, entresol.
entronigar to enthrone.

entuziasmar, entuziasmeskar (intr.) to be, become enthusiastic(por, pri); entuziasmigar to enthuse (ulu). V.exp.: Onentuziasmas pri granda ideo o pri bela verko, quan on admiras; entuziasmo implikas nula specala kapableso, quankam ol incitas ad agado. On esas inspirata (tacite e metafore: da la dei, la Muzi, e.c.) kande on trovas bona idei ed expresi, en literatural od artal kompozado. On havas vervo, kande on parolas kun facileso, inventemeso ed agreabla vivaceso; II-648.
enumerar (tr.) to enumerate; reckon up singly, count or tell off.
enuncar (tr.) to enunciate: express by speech or by writing: enuncuro, enuncajo enunciation, statement. Ex.: Enuncar sua idei, opinioni, problemo.
envarsar (tr.) to pour in, infuse.

envelopar (tr., pr. and fig.) to envelop; cover up (ulu, ulo, su); envelopilo covering, wrap, casing (not of letter-envelope; cf. kuverto). V. exp.: Envelopar signifikas nur: tegar omna parti di l’objekto, enklozar ol en tegilo. Envolvar implikas la ideo di volvar, qua ipsa implikas ideo analoga a rular volvar esas pozar ula objekto sur altra, turnante ol cirkum ica; envolvar esas envelopar la duesma per l’unesma, volvante; III-221. DEFI
enverguro span, extent of wing or sail spread. Def.: Dimensiono di ucelo, o di flugilo (o di seglo) inter la extremaji di la ali extensita.

envidiar (tr.) to envy, (be)grudge, be envious of (ulu, pri ulo; ulo, ad ulu). Ex.: Il sempre envidias la suceso di sua frato. Envidio esas kompozita de jaluzeso e de odio. Il havas envidi-ema, -oza mento.
envolvar (tr.) to wrap, fold up in; enar varme to muffle, wrap warmly. V. exp. vid. envelopar.
eoceno(geol.) eocene.
Eolala harpo Eolian harp.
Eoliana Eolian (race, dialect).
eolipilo eolipile.
eozino* (chem.) eosin.
epakto(astron.) epact.
eparko (antiq.) eparch: governer of a province.
eperlano (ich.) smelt (Osmerus eperlanus).
epicena* (gram.) epicene; common to both sexes.
epiciklo*(astron.) epicycle. DEFIRS
epicikloido* (geom.) epicycloid.
epidemia, -o: epidemic (disease).
epidermo (anat.) epidermis, cuticle.
epifanio (rel.) Epiphany.
epifito* (bot.) epiphyte.
epifizo* (anat., zool.) epiphysis.
epigastro* (anat.) epigastrium.
epigloto* (anat.) epiglottis.
epigono* epigone; a successor, ordinarily an inferior one.
epigrafo epigraph, inscription. Def.: La skriburo quan on trovas o pozas sur la monumenti; VII-155.
epigrafio* epigraphy. Def.: La cienco dil epigrafi; VII-155.
epigramo epigram.
epika, epikala, epikatra epic; epikajo e.poem; epikisto e.poet.
Epikurismo Epicurism; Epikurana, Epikurano Epicurean.
epilepsio (med.) epilepsy; epilepsiala epileptic: relating to the disease; epilepsiika, epilepsiiko epileptic (person).
epilogo epilogue. Ant.: prologue.
episkopo bishop (also in chess); episkoparo episcopate (collect.); episkopala episcopal; episkopio bishopric (jurisdiction); episkopeso episcopacy (office, dignity); episkopeyo b. palace.
epistemologio epistemology.
epistolo (rel., lit.) epistle; epistolala epistolary.
epitafo epitaph: inscription on a tomb.
epitalamio epithalamium; nuptial song.
epitelio (anat.) epithelium.
epiteto epithet. Def. Vorto adjuntata a substantivo por qualifikar ol.
epitomo epitomy, compendium, abridgment (of a book); epitomigar to epitomize.
epizodo episode; an incidental narrative or digression; an event.
epizootia, epizootio epizootic disease (among animals).
epodo epode; lyric poem.
epoko epoch; epokifanta e.making; epokala epochal.
epoleto (milit.) epaulet.
epruveto test-tube.
equaciono (math.) equation.
equatoro equator; equatoralo, equatorala teleskopo equatorial, e. telescope.
equi*angula (geom.) equiangular.
equi*distanta equidistant.
equi*latera (geom.) equilateral.

equilibrar (intr., tr.) to be in state of equilibrium, balance, counterpoise; equilibrigar to equilibrate; to put in balance equilibrium (ulo); equilibro equilibrium, equipoise, balance; equilibroza well-balanced; equilibristo equilibrist, juggler. Ex.: "A equilibras B", o: "A e B equilibras" = "Existas relato di equilibro inter A e B". "X (aganto) equilibrigas A e B", o "A per B". On uzas equilibrigar nur por l'extera aganto, qua pozas la forci (pezi, e.c.) en equilibro, qua efektigas l'equilibro sen partoprenar ol; IV-171.
equimultopla, equio equimultiple.
equinoxo equinox. DEFIS.
equipar (tr.) to equip, fit out (a ship, an expedition, a soldier); (cf. provizar).
equipolo* (log., math.) equipollence: equivalence.
equiseto (bot.) horsetails (genus equisetum).
equitato equity; natural justice. Def.: Yusteso natural, segun la komuna raciono, quan on opozas a la yusteso legal, a la yuro; IV-9.
equivalar (tr.) to be equivalent to (ulo).
ero era. Ex.: La ero Kristanala.
eratika (geol.) transported from its original location or bed (stones, etc.); (fig.) erratic; deviating from the common course.
erco (min.) ore; fer erco iron ore.

erektar (tr.) to erect; stand (ulu, ulo) straight up, set up (u1o). V. exp.: On erektas monumento, statuo, kolono, masto. Persona anke erektas su, mem kande lu ja stacas. "Il levis su, stacas senmova dum kelka instanti, e pose erektas su sur la pedo-pinti (por regardar super la muro)". On ne povas dicar rektigar, nam on ne rektigas masto ja rekta; pluse on rekt-igas en omna direcioni, ma on erektas nur vertikale, ad-supre; VI-383.
eremito eremite, hermit.
ergoto ergot, fungus disease of grains.
ergotino (chem.) ergotine, extract of ergot.
ergotismo (med.) ergotism, state of health caused by eating ergot.
eriko (bot.) heather (genus: Erica); erikeyo heath.
eritrozino* erythrosin; a red coloring matter.
erizipelo (med.) erysipelas.
ermino (zool.) ermine (Mustela or Putorius ermineus); erminielo ermine (fur.)
ermit(ul)o hermit; (fig.) recluse.
ermitkrabo hermit-crab (Pagarus Bernhardus).
erodar (tr., geol., med. etc.) to erode, corrode, eat away.

erorar (intr.) to err, be mistaken; erorego, eroracho blunder, egregious mistake; erora, eroroza erroneous, mistaken; eroriva fallible; erorigar to cause (ulu) to err, lead astray, deceive (without bad intention; cf. trompar); eroriganta improper; causing to err. – EFIS
erotika erotic.

erste (of time) not before, not until (then), only (not earlier than), for the first time; erste hiere not before yesterday, yesterday for the first time. Def.: Tam tarde kam (referas preciza instanto, adjuntante la penso: ne plu frue); IV-525. Ex.: Me venos erste morge = me venos morge, ne ante. La proxima numero di ca jurnalo aparos erste komence di agosto. Ja en la printempo me suspektis il, ma erste dum lua somervakanco me recevis certeso. Il remarkis l'eroro erste ye la sequanta matino.
erudar (tr.) to make erudite (ulu, su); erudesar to be e.; erudita learned; erudito e. person; eruditeso erudition, scholarship.

eruptar (intr. geol. and gen.) to erupt: to break forth from an inclosure, to make an outburst; (med.) to break out in pimples, pustules, rash; eruptigar to cause an e. in (ulo, ulu); eruptar per insulti to burst forth into abuse; la erupto di volkano the eruption of a volcano.
ervo* (bot.) bitter-vetch (Ervum).
es (mus.) E flat.
esar (intr.) to be; eso being (fact of; cf. ento).
esamo swarm (of bees, etc.); esamifar to swarm: collect in a s.
esayo (lit.) essay.

esbosar (tr., of plastic arts and fig.) to rough-hew, cut, to boast (in order to make the outline of a figure); esbosuro rude outline; (fig.) first draft (of a plan, etc.), esbosilo (sculp.) boasting tool; mortise chisel. V. exp.: Skisar relatas la desegnal arti; esbosar la plastikal arti (la modlado); III-469.

esenco (phys. and metaphys.) essence; esenca, esencala essential. Ex.: La esenco deala. Esenco di citrono. Inerteso esas la esenco di materio. Esenco di rozi (E. attar of roses). Esencala principi, reguli. La homo esas esence sociema. Ant. acesorajo.

esforcar (intr.) to make an effort, strive, strain, exert oneself; esforco endeavor, effort, exertion; esforcovunduro lesion, strain, (cf. penar, demarshar) Ex. Esforcar levar pezajo. Esforcar kurar, kombatar, obtenar employeso. Konsumar la forteso per nepovanta esforci. V. exp.: vid. demarshar.
eskadro (nav.) squadron; eskadreto small s., flotilla.
eskadrono (milit.) squadron (of horse).
eskalar (tr., nav.) to touch (or call) at (a port); eskaleyo port of call. Def.: Haltar en portuo dum voyajo por embarkar o desembarkar pasajanti o vari; II-75.
eskaldar (tr.) to scald; injure the skin with hot liquid; to expose to the action of boiling water (a jug, etc).
eskalero staircase, stairs.
eskamotar (tr.) to perform conjuring tricks, cause (ulo) disappear by legerdemain. Def.: Habile desaparigar objekto, por ludo; II-647. V. exp. vid. furtar.

eskapar (intr.) to escape, find a way out (ek, de) (tr.) to e. from, get away from, slip away from, avoid (ulu, ulo); (cf. fugar); eskapilo escapement (of a clock or watch); eskapmoyeno any means of e.; (fig.) shift, subterfuge, means of evasion; eskapema evasive; eskapotubo delivery or escape pipe. Ex.: Eskapar (de) karcero, danjero, malajo, de la furio di la tempesto, la morto, e.c. Eskapo di vaporo.
eskaro (med.) eschar: a dry slough, crust, or scab.
eskarbilo* coal-cinder, clinker. FS
eskarolo (bot.) prickly lettuce (Lactuca scariola).

eskarpa steep (of slopes); eskarpigar to make slope sharply. V. exp.: Eskarpa indikas granda inklineso (o prefere rampo); abrupta indikas formo preske vertikal. On povas ankore acensar sur eskarpajo; on ne povas (o nur per granda peno) acensar abruptajo. Eskalero povas esar eskarpa, ne abrupta; II-645.

eskartar (gen. sense, tr.) to put aside, apart (ulo, ulu); to go aside, apart, swerve, turn aside (de); eskartar ulu de la justa voyo to lead a person astray; eskartar infanto de la rivo to keep a child from the bank; eskartar velo to put aside a veil; eskartar suspekto to remove suspicion; eskartar frapo to ward off a blow; eskartar la brakii, la gambi to spread the arms, the legs; eskarto putting aside, digression; eskarteso being aside, isolation, aloofness, loneliness; pavorema kavalo facas eskarto a frightened horse makes a step aside; eskarteso di persono the aloofness of a person; stacar eskarte to stand apart, aside, by oneself.
eskombro rubbish, refuse; useless fragments.
eskopeto blunderbuss. Def.: Speco di karabino (anciena); V-219.
eskorto escort, guard; (nav.) convoy; eskortesar ad ulu to be escorted to someone; (cf. akompanar).
eskoto (nav.) sheet (rope).
eskudelo porringer; bowl for porridge, soup.
eskupar (tr.) to bail (water out of a boat, etc.); eskupilo scoop (for bailing).
esmerilio (orni.) merlin (Falco aesalon).
esotera esoteric (doctrine, etc.). Ant.: exotera.

espado sword; espadagar (tr., intr.) to use, wield the s.; to put (ulu) to the sword; espadostroko s. stroke; espadpinto s. point; espadzono s. belt; dumanua espado two handed s.; bayonet espado s. bayonet; espadagar pinte e tranche to cut and thrust; (cf. pinte frapar); espadego broad-s.
espadofisho (ich.) sword-fish (Xiphias gladius).
espalero (hort.) espalier; a row of fruit-trees trained up to a lattice or wall; the trellis or wall on which trained.
esparo (nav.) spar: a timber used for masts, yards, booms etc.
esparseto (bot.) esparcet; sanfoin (Onobrychis sativa).
esparto (bot.) esparto (grass); a Spanish grass (Stipa tenacissima) used in making cordage, papar, shoes, baskets, etc.; espartajo an article made from e.; espartoshuo grass-shoe, -sandle.
espelar (tr.) to spell (words); espellibro spelling-book. Def.: Lektar la vorti literope e formacante la silabi; II-582.

esperar (tr.) to hope for, to expect with desire (ulo); (intr.) to hope: have confidence, trust (de, en); esperajo thing hoped for;esperema, esperoza hopeful. Ex.: Esperar suceso. Esperar de od en Deo. Espero esas granda konsolaco.
espino thorn-bush, -tree; espino blanka whitethorn, hawthorn; espino nigra blackthorn. Def.: Arbor(et)o dornoza.
espineto (mus.) spinet. Def.: Speco di klavikordo.
esplanado esplanade.
espreso, esprestreno (R. R.) express (train); esprese by e.
esprito wit, cleverness; espritoza witty; espritajo witticism; afektacar –o to play the wit; espritoludo play of w. DF
espruva proof (kontre) –igar (tr.) to make (water-, lire-, etc.) proof (ulo); aquespruva water-proof, -tight.
esquado (milit.) (corporal’s) squad; gang (of workmen); esquadano member of a squad, of a gang.
esto east; este eastward; ad este to the east (with motion); estala longitudo e. longitude; de esto from the e.

establisarto establish; to settle or fix firmly; place on a permanent footing; make firm, stable or constant; (cf. instalar, pruvar). Ex.: Establisar la fundamento di edifico. Establisar komercal societo, fabrikerio, kolonio. Establisar su en urbo. La establiso di banko. Note “Establishment in the sense of “institution” is translated by the suffix–erio; educational establishment: edukerio).
estafeto courier: (esp. a mounted messenger).
estakado boom, chain or row of piles across a harbor for defense; (cf. palisado).
estalar (tr.) to display, show (goods, etc.); estalajo display-goods; estaleyo show-place; estalar mapo to spread out a map; estalar robo to lay out a gown; estalar ludkarti; to show one’s hand.

estampar (tr. tech.) to make an impress, imprint, in relief of a mark or figure; estampuro stamp (on a coin, etc.); estampilo stamp, die. Def. Estampilo esas utensilo uzata ye la forjo. Ol esas facita ek harda materio ed havas la negativa formo di la forjenda peco, tale ke per simpla preso la dezirata formo obtenesas; III-81.
estayo (nav.) stay (of a mast)
estetiko esthetics.

estimar (tr.) to esteem, have e. for; hold (ulu) in high regard; estimo e., consideration; estiminda estimable, honorable; estimindeso respectability; (cf. evaluar, prizar). Ex.: Estimar la vertuo di ulu, Il perdis sua estimeso e bona reputeso.
estivar(intr.) to be torpid (in summer); estiv(ad)o torpidity, estivation; (cf. hivernar). Def.: Indikas la stando di torporo, en qua ula animali pasas la somero; IV-173.
estompar (tr., draw.) to stump; shade, shadow with a stump; estompilo stump: artist’s soft pencil or rubber.
estrado estrade; raised platform; (cf. platformo).
estragono (bot.) tarragon (Artemisia Dracunculus).
estribo (saddle-) stirrup; (anat.) stirrup-bone, stapes (of ear); estriborimeno, estribotrusilo s.-leather, -strap.
estuario estuary.
estublo stubble; estublagro s. land.
esturjuno (ich.) (great) sturgeon (Acipenser Huso; cf. sturgo).
esvanar (intr.) to faint, swoon away; esvaninto a swooned person.
etajo story, floor (of a house, etc.); tier; trietaja domo three story house; dispozar etajope, etajatre to taper, put in tiers.
etajero what-not, set of selves. Def. Tabuli dispozita erajatre.
etamino tammy-cloth; filtro etamino bolting-. straining cloth.
etapar (intr.) to halt at a stage (in travel); etapeyo halting place; station, stage; transirar etapo to pass through without stopping.
etero (all senses) ether; eterala, eteroza, eteratra etherial; eterigar, eterifar to etherialize (ulo); eterizar (med.) to etherize (ulu).
eterna eternal, everlasting; eterno eternity: (duration); la eterno (fig.) Eternal God; eterneso eternity; quality of being e.; eternigar to eternalize.

etiko (bon-) morality; ethics; moral science; etika, etikala, etikoza moral, ethical; etikaleso, etikozeso morality; sena immoral; sen etikeso immorality; kontreetikajo immoral act. (N.B. The adj. form translates the E. "moral" Morala refers to the mori of a country, cf. moro.
etiketo (on bottles, etc.) label; (on goods, parcels) ticket; etiketizar to label, ticket.
etimologio etymology; etimologiisto etymologist.
etiolar (tr.) to etiolate; blanch. Def.: Privicar vivanti (precipue planti) de lumo ed aero, de quo lia feblesko, palesko o senkoloresko; III-603.
etiologio (philos., med.) etiology.
etmoida, etmoido* (anat.) ethmoid.
etnografio ethnnography.
etnologio ethnology; etnologiisto ethnologist.
etologio ethology.
Etruriana Etruscan, relating to Etruria.

etuyo case: flat box, opening sideways or from the top; violin etuyo violin c.; ciz, agul etuyo scissors-, needle-case; chapel etuyo hat-box. V. exp.: Gaino esas etuyo tre longa e streta, en qua l'objekto eniras tra l'extremajo (kontre ke etuyo apertesas laterale): on ofras ex. espado (luxoza, honorala) kun lua gaino (E. sheath), en etuyo (box, case); IV-11, V-722.
eudiometro eudiometer.
eudiometrio eudiometry.
eufemismo (rhet.) euphamism.
eufonio euphony. Def.: Agreabla e facila kombinado di la soni en linguo; III-138.
euforbio (bot. genus) euphorbia, spurge.
eukalipto eucalyptus (tree).
eukaristio (rel.) Eucharist.
eunuka, eunuko eunuch.
Europa Europe; Europana, Europaano European.

evar (tr., intr.) to be so many years old; to be aged (so many years); evo age, years; evanta aged (so many years); evoza, grandeva aged, elderly; grandeveso longevity, agedness; quante vu evas? how old are you? sat evar por to be old enough to; il esas granda relate sua evo he is large for his years; evanta 40 yari forty years old; muliero mezeva a middle-aged woman

evakuar (tr., milit., med., tech.) to evacuate, empty (N. B. not to empty a vessel, etc., cf. vakuigarevacuation; (med.) discharge of matter by natural passage or artificial opening. Ex.: Evakuar ); evaku(ad)o (milit.) trupi, puso.

evaluar (tr.) to evaluate, value; to estimate the worth of, to rate at a certain price; to reckon the amount of; to appraise; (cf. expertisar); evalu(ad)o valuation, estimate; evaluebla ratable; appreciable: that may be estimated, appreciated. V. exp.: Evaluar esas determinar valoro o quanto, per kalkulo o per konjekto (se on uzas mezurilo, on dicus mezurar). Taxar esas fixigar la quanto de imposto o kontributo, quan on debas pri ulo. Exemple (en la hipotezo di imposto pri revenuo): "on evaluas la revenuo di ta sioro a 10000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki, segun la proporciono di 4 po 100;" V-221.
evangelio gospel, evangel; evangeliala, evangeliatra evangelical; evangeliisto evangelist; evangeliizar to evangelize (ulu); evangeliolibro Book of the Gospel; predikar la evangelio to preach the g.

eventar (intr.) to happen, occur, come about, befall; evento, eventajo occurrence, event; irgo quo eventos whatever may happen; to povas eventar ad irgu that may befall anyone; neexpektata evento unexpected event;

eventuala eventual: dependent upon events, contingent; eventualo contingency; eventuali (fig.) perquisites, extra fees; eventualeso fortuitousness; eventuale eventually, in that case; eventuala profiti casual profits, perquisites; ni esas pronta por irga eventualaji we are prepared for contingencies. Def.: Qua dependas de ula evento necerta. Ant.: certa, necesa.

evidenta evident, obvious, plain, manifest, patent; evidento, evidentajo evidence: obvious fact; (cf. atesto, pruvo) evidenteso obviousness; per su evidenta self-evident; igar evidenta to make clear; evidenta verajo an e. truth; la evidenteso di propoziciono the clearness of a proposition. Ant.: dubebla, evidentinda; necerta, neprobabla.
eviero (kitchen-) sink. Def.: Speco di tablo kava, o kuvo ek lapido o ceramikajo, sur qua on lavas (generale en koqueyo); IV-9.
eviktar (jur.) to evict.
evitar (tr.) to avoid, shun, evade, obviate, (cf. eludar). Ex.: El evitas (E. shuns) me. Evitar frapo, danjero, disputo. Evitar (E. obviate; prevent) skandalo. Ant.: serchar.
evolucionar (intr., philos.) to evolve; (milit.) to perform evolutions; evoluciona, evolucionala evolutional; evolucionismo evolutionism; evolucionisto evolutionist. V. exp. vid. developar.
exajerar (tr., intr.) to exaggerate. Ex.: Exajerar vinko, la meriti di amiko.

exakta exact, accurate (not used of persons; cf. akurata, preciza); exakteso exactness, fidelity (of a copy); exakte exactly. Def.: Qua esas konforma a la verajo, a la realajo, a la normo; IV-101. Ex.: Kalkulo exakta. Sequar exakta dieto. Matematiko esas exakta cienco. Verifikar la exakteso di kalkulo. V. exp.: Mezuro preciza povas ne esar exakta (se l'instrumento, quankam subtila, esas nejusta).
exaltar (tr.) to exalt: raise the spirits of (ulu), to carry (the senses) to a high degree: (not to praise, cf. laudegar). Def.: Ecitar sentimento (precipue nobla, religiala) til extrema grado; IV-9.
examenar (tr.) to examine (ulu) (not used with things, cf. explorar); examenato person examined; exameno skribita written examination; examenoquestioni e. questions; subisar exameno to undergo e.
exantemo (med) exanthema.
exarko* exarch.
exaucar (tr.) to hear and grant (a prayer, a request); to hearken favorably or willingly to (ulu). Ant.: repulsar, refuzar.
exegezo exegesis; exegezar to critically explain (the Scriptures).

exemplo example; exempla, exemplatra exemplary; exemple for example, for instance; (abbr.: ex.); segun la exemplo following the e. (di ulu); punisar ulu kom exemplo to make an e. of someone; exempla puniso exemplary punishment.
exemplero copy (of a book, paper, engraving, etc.).
«exequatur» exequator.

exercar (tr.) to exercise (the legs, the body, one's senses), to exert (strength, one's memory, eloquence); (milit.) to drill; exerceyo drilling place; exercolibro e. book.; (cf. praktikar and III-225).
exergo (numis.) exergue. Def.: Infra feldo di medalio; III-672.
exhalar (tr.) to exhale, send forth, emit (odors, etc.; cf. expirar). Ex.: Ca marshi exhalas vapori pestizanta. La exhalo di rozo.

exhaustar (tr., also fig.) to exhaust: drain, spend; exhaustilo, exhausttubo, exhaustrobineto an e.; exhaustar cisterno to drain a cistern. Ex.: Exhaustar mineyo, sulo, forteso, Il falis en (pro) exhausteso, kp.: fatigar). Ne exhaustebla furnisaji. Ant.: restaurar.
exhortar (tr.) to exhort. Ex.: Exhortar ulu reformar sua konduto. Ant.: deskonsilar, despersuadar.

exilar (tr.) to exile, banish (ulu, su de); (fig.) to expatriate; exilito an exile, V. exp.: On exilas ulu, interdiktante a lu restar en la lando: lu esas tote libera extere; e se lu rieniras sen permiso, on simple ekpulsas lu. Proskriptar esas serchar la kondamnito (mem po premio por la denuncanti) e punisar lu severe (generale per morto), se on povas trovar e kaptar lu en la lando (ex. la proskripti da Marius e Sylla). Relegar esas enkarcerigar en fora lando (kolonio); Deportar esas transportar la kondamito en fora lando (kolonio), ube lu restas plu o min libera, en ula distrikto; II-648; (cf. extradar).
existar (intr.) to exist, be in existence; existanta, existanto existing, existent, extant (being); Ex. Traci ankore existas. Existanta homi.
exkavar (tr.) to excavate (by digging; cf. kavigar); exkavuro excavation (artificial

exkluzar (tr.) to exclude, drive or shut out, debar, deny admission; exkluzite to the exclusion of; exkluzemeso exclusiveness; exkluzive exclusively. Ex.: Exkluzar ulu de la Akademio. La bonfacemeso exkluzas la avareso. La exkluzo di homini. Exkluzite altra yuri, devi. Exkluziva yuro. La spirito di exkluzemeso. Ant.: admisar, inkluzar, recevar.
exkomunikar (tr.) to excommunicate.
exkoriar (tr.) to excoriate, to rub off, abrade, scratch, gall (the skin) Def.: Lacerar la polo (ne sen-pel-igar), deprenar peco de la pelo; IV-136
exkremento excrement; exkrementi excreta.
exkursar (intr.) to make an excursion, take a trip; exkursobatelo e. boat; exkursanto, exkursero excursionist.

exkuzar (refl.) to apologize, make excuses, beg pardon (su pri ulo); exkuzo apology, excuse; exkuzebla excusable (of persons, cf. pardonebla). V. exp.: Se vu facis kulpo relate ulu, vu exkuzas vu avan lu, e lu povas pardonar ol a vu. La persono ofensinta facas exkuzo, e la persono ofensita facas pardono; IV-100.
«exlibris» (L.) ex libris.
exodo (Bibl.) Exodus.
exorcisar (tr.) to exorcise, cast out evil spirits.
exordio exordium; exordiar to make an e. Def.: Unesma parto di diskurso. Ant.: peroraciono.
exostoso* (med.) exostosis.
exotera exoteric. Ant.: esotera.
exotika exotic. Def. Qua venas de fora landi, e konseque havas karaktero di rareso o stranjeso; III-603. Ex.: Flori exotika.

expansar (tr., intr., also fig.) to expand, to develop in volume or surface, spread, widen; expansema expansive; (fig.) unreserved (of persons). Ex.: Expansar aero per kaloro. Expanso di autoritato. Forco expansiva. Naturo expansema. Ant.: kontraktar.

expediar (tr., com.) to despatch, send off, forward (goods); expediajo shipment; expedianto, expediero sender; (nav.) shipper; expediisto shipping agent; expediar komercaji per fervoyo to forward goods by railroad. Def.: Sendar ulo (ordinare komercaji) a destineyo.
expediciono (milit., nav.) expedition. Def.: Sendo di homi por militar, o por explorar regiono; IV-706. Ex.: Naval, ciencala expediciono a la suda polo.

expektar (tr.) to expect, be in expectation of, look forward to; expekto expectation, presumption (cf. konjekto); expekteso expectancy; ne expektita unexpected. Def.: Mente anticipar ula evento. Ex.: Me expektos nulo de ilu. Il vivas en expekteso. V. exp.: Varto esas ago prefere fizikal, expekto esas pure mental; (III-423) Me expektas vizito camatine ma, pro ke me nun devas ekirar, me neplus vartos.

expektorar (tr., med.) to expectorate, discharge phlegm, mucus from the lungs, to cough up. V. exp.: Expektorar ne esas sputar; l'expektorajo venas de la pektoro, t.e. de la pulmono, quale indikas l'etimologio.

experiencar (tr.) to experience (ulo): to have the lot or fortune of, to undergo; experiencoza experienced; sen experienca inexperienced (cf. neexperta). Ex.: Experiencar plezuro, desfortuno. Per experienco on sajeskas.
experimentar (intr.) to experiment (per); (tr.) to test, try (ulo, pri ulo); experimentala experimental.
experta expert: skilful (in trade), well-versed (in knowledge).
expertizar (tr.) to survey (professionally); expertizero, expertizisto surveyor, person officially appointed to examine an affair and report on it.
expiacar (tr.) to expiate, to atone for; expiacanta, expiacala. Ex.: Expiacar krimino, kulpo.

expirar (intr.) to expire: to breath out (cf. respirar); (fig.) to come to an end (of time), terminate; expiro expiration; (fig.) falling due; expirinta expiring (breath); expired (account); expirodato date of expiration, maturity. Def.: Indikas l'ekiro di l'aero ek la pulmoni; figurale, la «lasta expiro», la morto; e per extenso: fino di ula temp-intervalo, di kontrato, di puniso, e.c.; III-34. V. exp.: La teknikal senco di l'ago inversa dil aspiro nomesas simple ekpulso. Ant.: aspirar.
explicita explicit: clear, not obscure; explicitigar to make (ulo) e.
explikar (tr.) to explain, make plain what is obscure, elucidate, expound; (cf. klarigar). Ex.: Explikar signifiko, sua desfacilaji, doktrino, sua intenco. V. exp. vid. definar.

explorar (tr.) to explore (a country); to investigate, examine, search into (things, cf. examenar, inquestar); (milit.) to reconnoiter, scout; Ex.: Explorar lando nekonocata. Explorar (E. examine) libro. Exploro, exploranto di subjekto, objekto.

explotar (tr.) to exploit, to get the value out of, as to e. a mine; to work, cultivate (a farm, estate with intent of profit); explotachar to exploit, to draw an illegitimate profit from, as to e. workers (by underpayment); explot(ad)o exploiting: utilization for profit, working (of mines, farms), execution of work: explotacho profiteering, sweating; explotajo what is exploited; explotebla workable.
explozar (intr.) explozigar (tr.) to explode; exploziva, explozivo explosive; exploziva gaso explosive gas; (mine) fire-damp.
exponento (math.) exponent.
exportacar (tr.) to export; exportacajo goods exported. Ant.: importacar.

expozar (tr., lit. and fig.) to expose, set in public view; (of houses, etc.) to turn toward, present a side to; to set forth (a situation); explain (a doctrine); expozar pikturo to exhibit a painting; domo expozita a sudo a house having a southerly prospect; vivo expozesis a danjero a life was e. to danger; expozar sistemo to set forth, explain a system; expozo di komercajo exhibition of merchandise; expozo di fotografala plako exposure of photographic plate; expozeyo di la mortinti the morgue.
expresar (tr.) to express (by symbols, gestures, words, etc.); Ex.: Vorti expresas la penso. Lakrimi esas la expreso di doloro. Aspekto expres-oza, -iva, -ema.
expropriar (tr., jur.) to expropriate, (the property), dispossess (ulu).
extazar (intr.) to be in ecstacies, be enraptured; (med.) to be in a trance (cf. katalepsio).

extensar to extend, stretch, draw out, spread; extensebla extensible, tensile; extensanto, extensivo (anat.) extensor. Ex. Extensar brakio, tapiso, mantelo. Extensar povo, autoritato, domeno. Kauchuko esas tre extensebla.
extenuar (tr.) to extenuate, palliate. Def. Igar min grava (kulpo, krimino, aserto, e. c.) II-707.

exter (prep.) without, outside (without motion; cf. ek); except, besides; li stacis exter la domo they stood outside the house; exter la dicita decidi besides the decisions named; extere (adv.) outside, externally; il uzas extere la oleo he uses the oil externally; extera outside, external; extera apliko external application; la exterajo di domo the outside of a house (considered objectively); extereso exterior (geom. sense); de extere from without (with movement); ad extere outwardly (with movement); il kuris adextere he ran outside. Ant.: en, interne.
exterdota (jur.) paraphernal.
exterfluar (tr., intr.) to flow, run over
exterjudicia extrajudicial.
exterklaso an outside, a separate class.
exterlanda foreign.
exterlimita beyond limit, excessive, exorbitant, extravagant.
exterminar (tr.) to exterminate: destroy utterly.
externo day-scholar; externerio day-school. Def. Skolano (lernanto) qua ne habitas la lerneyo; III-672.

extingar (tr., intr.) to extinguish, put out, quench (a fire, a light; also used fig.); extingar kandelo to put out a candle; extingar dursto (fig.) to quench the thirst; la fairo extingeskas the fire is going out; extingar la kalko (fig.) to slack lime; extingar debo (fig.) to cancel a debt; extingo di raso (fig.) the extinction, the extermination of a race. Ant.: Acendar.
extirpar (tr.) to extirpate, uproot; (surg.) to cut out, remove totally; (fig.) to destroy wholly, eradicate, weed out; (cf. arachar). Ex.: Extirpar la mala herbi, kancero, dento, raso.

extorsar (tr.) to extort, wrest; to blackmail (ulu) extors(ad)o, extorsajo extortion, exaction; extorsanto, extorsero extortioner; extorsoprobo attempt at e. V. exp.: To ne esas raptar, t. e. furtar per materiala violento, ma koaktar ulu cedar ulo (generale pekunio) per minaco, per morala violento; III-200.
extra (adv.) extra; extradisho an extra dish; extraspenso extra (additional) expense; extraajo something extra: extraedituro extra edition; extra bona extra good.
extradoso* (arch.) extrados.

extraktar (tr.) to extract: to draw from, out. Ex.: Extraktar frazo de libro, dento, kugleto de la korpo. Extraktar radiko dua (math.: to extract the square root). Extraktado di sukro de betravi. Extrakt-uri opiumo.
extraordinara extraordinary (event, person, etc.; cf. remarkinda).

extravagar (intr.) to talk extravagantly, wildly, to rave; (in fever) to be delirious; to act extravagantly, wildly, unreasonably, eccentricly; la febro igas il extravagar the fever makes him delirious; extravago, extravagemeso di konduto, di parolado wildness of conduct, talk; esas extravaganta spensar pekunio ante recevar ol it is extravagant to spend money before receiving it. Def.: Pensar, parolar, agar sen raciono nek bonsenco.

extrema extreme, utmost, outermost; extremajo extremity, butt-end; extreme extremely; extrema unciono e. unction; extrema frontiero e. boundary; extrema plezuro e. pleasure; la extremi esas la unesma e lasta termino en ula proporciono the extremes are the first and last terms in a proportion; il esas extreme richa he is extremely rich.
extrinseka extrinsic. Ant.: intrinseka.
exudar (tr., intr.) to exude, ooze out. Def.: Ekiro di liquido ek korpo, analoga (e tam lenta) kam sudorifo (N.B. sen gutifar); III-672.
exultar (intr.) to exult. Def.: Esar kaptata da profunda joyo o sentimento (amo), qua expresas su per movi, kanti, e.c.: III-324.
exutorio (med.) issue (of blood, pus, etc.)
fa (mus.) fa: fourth note of the diatonic scale.
fabo (bot.) bean.
fablo fable; fablatra, fabloza fabulous, fictitious.

facar (tr., lit. and fig.) to make (a concrete object); to do, perform (a certain act); facigar to cause (ulu) to make (ulo); to have (ulo) done (da ulu); (cf. igar); facesar to be made, performed; faco making, doing; facanto, ero maker, doer; facebla practicable, feasible; facar shui to make shoes; facar bona komercado to do a good business. V. exp.: vid. agar.
faceto facet (as of a diamond); facetizar to put f.s on, cut with f.s; facetizita, facetoza faceted.
«facies» (anat., geol., biol.) facies: general aspect or appearance of anything.

facila easy (to do), facile, not difficult; facileso facility (quality); facilajo an e. thing; faciligar to facilitate (ulo, ad ulu); facile laborar to work easily; facile komprenebla e. to understand; facilmora muliero a woman of e. virtue.
facinar (tr.) to fascinate. Ex.: L'amoro facinas la okuli. On dicas ke la serpento facinas sua viktimi.
faetono (carriage) phaeton; (myth.) Phaethon.
fago (bot.) beech(-tree) (genus: Fagus); fagofrukto b. nut; fageyo b. grove.

fairo (also fig.) fire; fairoza, fairatra fiery, igneous; faireyo f. place, hearth (cf. herdo); fairea f. colored; fairifar to produce f. (as by friction); fairifilo f. producer; fairespruva briko fireproof brick; fairextingilo f. extinguisher; fairoglutero fire-eater; fairogreto f. grate; fairohoko f. rake, (bent) poker; fairokulto f. worship; fairomusho f. fly (cf. luciolo, lampiro); fairopincego f. tongs; fairoligno f. wood; pikar, suflar la fairo to poke, to blow the f.; fairpikilo poker; firing-bar; fairoskreno f. screen; faireyaltapiso hearth rug; fairostalo steel for striking fire; para fairo fender, fire-guard; palio fairo fire of straw; (cf. incendio).

fako anything portioned off, as a compartment, division (in a desk), stall (in a stable); branch, proper office, province, department, speciality (in a business, profession, government, field of knowledge); faketo pigeon-hole; small specialty of duty, in research; fakaro set or nest of drawers; fakestro department head; to ne esas en mea fako that is out of my province; that's not in my line; komprenar sua fako to understand one's business.
fakiro fakir: Mahometan monk.
faksimilo facsimile, exact copy.
fakto fact; fakta, faktala real, relating to f.; fakte in fact; faktala questiono a question of f.
faktoro (math., metaph.) factor.
faktorio (com.) factory: trading agency. Def.: Kontoro di agenti di kompanio komercala en lando stranjera.
faktoriala, faktorialo* (math.) factorial.
«faktotum» factotum: a doer of all kinds of work.
fakturo (com.) invoice, bill; fakturo pagenda bill payable.

fakultato faculty, power of doing anything; (of a university) faculty; grantar fakultato ad ulu to grant a person the faculty (or power);la fakultati natural the natural faculties; la fakultato di medicino the f. of medicine.
fakultativa* facultative, optional.

falar (intr.) to fall (down), tumble; faletar to stumble (cf. mispazar, pedbutar); falanta falling; falinta fallen, faligar to cause to fall, to fell, (ulo, ulu); lasar falar to let (ulo) fall, drop (ulo).
falango (anat., milit.) phalanx.
falansterio (sociol.) phalanstery.
falbalo furbelow, flounce; falbalizar to cover with f.s.
falco (carp.) check, rebate, ledge (of a door or shutter). Def.: Speco de kanelo en la kadro di pordo, por recevar la bordo di ca pordo; V-621.
falchar (tr.) to mow down (with a scythe); (fig.) to cut down, destroy; falchajo what is mowed, the crop; falchedo swath, wind-row; falchilo scythe.
faleno (ent.) moth: genus Phalaena; (cf. tineo).

faliar (tr., intr.) to fail, miscarry, miss (an aim), not to succeed; (com.) to fail, to become insolvent without implication of disgrace; (cf. bankrotar); falio failure, insolvency; faliigar to cause to miss, to fail; to frustrate; faliinto insolvent person; faliego debacle, break up, down-fall; faliar renkontrar fail to meet (ulu); faliar ocidar su fail to kill oneself; me iros sen faliar I will go without fail.
falko (nav.) wash-board, weather- board.
falkono (orni.) falcon, hawk; falkonarto falconry.

falsa false, imitating in order to deceive as, f. hair, teeth, windows, signatures, money, jewels, drugs, etc.; not genuine, spurious; falseso falsity; falsajo falsehood; falsigar to falsify, pervert, adulterate (drugs) debase (coin); falsamonetifisto, falsigero di moneti forger, coiner; (cf. artificala).
falseto falsetto (voice).
falva fallow, fawn-colored, tawny, of a yellowish-brown color, pale red; falva bestio fallow deer, stag, etc. (cf. daimo).
famo fame, renown; (cf. reputo); famoza famous, celebrated; famoz(ul)o a celebrity; famizar to cover with fame, render illustrious.
familio (also zool., bot.) family, kin(dred); familiala konsilantaro f. counsel; familiala simileso family likeness; vorto familio (gram.) collection of words of the same root.

familiara familiar, intimate; familiareso familiarity (state), close acquaintance; familiarajo familiarity (act); familiaraji produktas desestimo familiarities breed contempt; familiarigar persono pri lua tasko to familiarize a person with his job; ne familiareskez kun male edukita personi do not get familiar with ill-bred people; familiara amiko an intimate friend. Ex.: Lua vizajo esas familiara a me. Lua konduto esas tro familiara.
fanar (tr., agri.) to winnow (grain).
fanatika fanatical, fanatik(ul)o a fanatic, bigot; fanatikeso fanaticism; fanatikigar to fanaticize (ulu); fanatikeskar to become a f., infatuated (cf. foleskar). Ex.: Fanatika zelo, doktrini, homi.
fanerogama, fanerogamo* (bot.) phanerogamous (plant).
fanfaro (mus.) fanfare: flourish of trumpets.

fanfaronar (intr.) to bluster, boast, brag, swagger, bluff. V. exp.: Fanfaronar esas exajerar sua avantaji, sua forteso, e.c., per paroli od altra signi, por trompar la ceteri. Ostentar esas montrar ed expozar kun afektaco e superbeso sua avantaji, precipue la luxo, richaji, belaji, por ecitar l'admiro di la ceteri; II

fango mud, mire, watery dirt as on streets, etc.; fangoza, fangatra muddy; fangeyo mud-puddle; fangizar to muddy, bedraggle; fangizita bespattered (with mud); fangoza anmo (fig.) base, mean soul; sen fangigar, des fangizar to clean (off mud); para fangomud-guard; fangobalno m.bath.
fantastika fantastical, fanciful. Def.: Qua relatas kozi od enti nereala o neposibla; IV

fantaziar (tr.) to have a fancy for (ulu, ulo), to have an idea an inclination (facar ulo); agar segun sua fantazio to act according to one's fancy; fantazieto whim, crochet; fantaziajo a f. article; fantaziala, fantaziema fanciful; fantaziemo a fanciful person, a crank; fantaziala kostumof. dress. Ex.: Me fantazias voyajar, ludar. Havar fantazii fantastika. V. exp.: L'imaginado (od imaginiveso) esas la psikala fakultato, formacar, imaji, t.e. reprezenti di objekti nereala; ol agas example en la revi, anke en l'artistala produktado; ol povas esar regulizita e racionoza. La fantazio esas l'imaginado senregula e kapricoza, ofte arbitriala. Pluse, ta vorto ne aplikesas propre a fakultato (qua esas nulo altra kam l'imaginado ipsa), ma a l'agi di ta fakultato; on parolas pri un fantazio. Tale on nomizas fantazi(aj)i ula artistala verki, qui manifestas precipue libereso, spontaneso e mem kaprico; V
fantomo phantom, shade, ghost, specter, apparition; (fig.) something unreal; Roma esis nur la fantomo di republiko Rome was only the shadow of a republic.
faro lighthouse; (fig.) guide; fargardisto l.keeper.
faradizar* (tr., med.) to faradize, to stimulate with faradic electric currents.
farandolo farandole, a dance of Provence.
faraono (hist.) Pharaoh; (card game) faro.

farbo paint, artificial coloring matter (cf. fardo, pigmento); farbizar to paint (buildings, objects; cf. piktar); farbizuro the paint (put on); oleo farbi oil paints; aquo farbiwater-colors. Def.: Preparita materio por kolorizar objekti; V
farcino (vet.) farcin, farcy, a form of glanders.
fardo paint (for face or body); (theat.) make-up; reda fardo rouge; fardizar to paint (ulu, su).

farino flour, farina, (grosa) meal; farinozafloury, mealy, farinacious; farinvendisto f.dealer; farinigar, farinifar to make, produce f.; farinizar to cover, sprinkle with f.; farinspricilo f.dredger; farinmueleyo, farinerio f.mill.
faringo (anat.) pharynx.
faringito* (med.) pharyngitis.
farizeo (lit. and fig.) Pharisee; farizeala pharisaical.

farmar (tr.) to farm (land taken on lease); farmo farm lokacar, farmprenar to take (land, etc.) on lease (cf. kultivar ); farmodonar, lugar to farm out, lease to, rent out to (someone for a fixed sum); farmluganto lessor (of a farm); farmlokacanto lessee: tenant-farmer; farmo farming (on lease); farmajo what is farmed; a farm; farmodomo, odomeno homestead (rented); farmopreco rent of a farm; farmisto tenant farmer, husbandman; farmisto di imposto (fig.) farmer of the revenue; mi farmisto metayer: farmer on half shares; farmolaborero a farm-hand.
farmacio (art) pharmacy, pharmaceutics; farmaciisto pharmacist (cf. apotekisto).
farmakopeo pharmacopoeia.
farso (cook.) farce: stuffing, forcemeat; (theat. and fig.) farce.
fasado facade, the front or chief face of a building.
fashino (fort.) fascine.
fasiaco* (bot.) fasciation.

fasko bundle, a number of things of a certain length, put together; sheath; stack; bunch; (opt.) pencil (of luminous rays); (antiq.) fasces; vergo fasko faggot, bundle of sticks, rods; flecho fasko sheaf of arrows; faskigar, faskifar to bundle up, stack, put in sheaves.
fasonar (tr.) to fashion, shape, form (ulo); fasono, fasonuro the build, fashion, make, cut, workmanship. Def.: Laborar ula materio por fabrikar objekto definita (fasono di vesto, di juvelo); IV-165.
fastar (intr.) to fast.
fato fate, lot, (cf. destino); fatala fatal; fatalismo fatalism; fatalisto, fatista fatalist(ic). Ex.: Vua fato esas kompatinda. La fatal horo.
fatua foppish (in dress); self-conceited, fatuous (in mind); fatu(ul)o snob, coxcomb; fatuacho puppy (person); fatueso snobbishness, fatuity, self-conceit.

fauco (anat. and fig.) (exterior) throat, gullet, fore part of neck (cf. guturo); (geog.) space from which something has been gouged, defile, ravine, deep glen; faucala (anat.) jugular. Def.: Indikas l'extera ed avana parto di la kolo (do anke la laringo, ma extere vidata); e, pro ke ta parto formacas kava profilo (inter la mandibulo o mentono e la pektoro), la vorto fauco uzesas per metaforo internaciona por expresar multa formi kava, en tekniko, en geografio (montala fauco), e.c.; III-165. IL
fauno (myth.) faun; faunino wood goddess.
favo (med.) favus, ringworm (of scalp); favoza scurvy.

favorar (tr.) to favor, treat or regard with kindness, befriend; favoroza (of persons) favorable (cf. oportuna); favorat(ul)o, favorat(in)o a favourite; favorismo favoritism; favorigar to propitiate, appease; favoriganta propitiatory; favordii days of grace; la princo e la tempo favoras nia projeti the prince and the time are favorable to our projects; omni qui konocas il esas favoroza ad il all who know him are favorably disposed toward him.
fayo (fabric) faille, a corded silk.
fayenco faience, crockery ware.
fazo (astron. and gen.) phase.
fazano (orni.) pheasant (genus: Phasianus).
fazeolo kidney-bean; fazeolo multaflora (bot.) scarlet-runner (Phaseolus multiflorus).
feo, feino fairy.

febla (lit. and fig.) feeble, weak, faint; (cf. debila, frajila); feblajo a weak object or spot, foible; febl(ul)o a weak person; febleso weakness; febligar to enfeeble, weaken; febleskar to grow weak; febligo, feblesko enfeebling, weakening, impairment; feblanma pusillanimous. Ant.: forta.
febrar (intr.) to have a fever; febro fever; febrozeso feverishness; febrala febrile; febroza, febrema, febrika feverish, fevered; febreto a slight f.; febrigar, febrizar to infect with f.
februaro February.

federar (tr.) to (con-)federate, federalize, ally, form an alliance (of states, nations; cf. aliancar); federuro (con-)federation, league, alliance; federalismo federalism; federalista, federisto federalist; (kun)federito ally, confederate (state, nation).
feko feces, excrement (of man or animal); fekala fecal; fekifar to void the bowels, defecate (cf. kakar); fekizar to befoul (with f.); fekopulvero dried night-soil.
fekulo (chem.) fecula (starch).
felo hide, pelt, fell, skin detached from body and dressed; (cf. furo).

feldo (electric, magnetic, optical, scientific) field; feldo di ago field of action; (cf. agro). Def.: Spaco en qua existas ula distributo di forci (elektrala, magnetala, e.c.); VI-140. V. exp.: On parolas pri elektrala, magnetala feldo, mem (identigante la feldo kun la forco existanta en singla punto) pri l'intenseso di feldo en ula punto. Kompreneble, on povas anke parolar metafore pri la feldo di ago o di influo di ula povo o potento. Ma en omna altra kazi on devas uzar agro, exemple, pri plu o min granda parto dil sulo. Do on devas dicar kombatagro, nam to esas vere agro, en qua on kombatas, o agro di kombato: VI-140.
felgo felly, outer rim of wheel; felgfreno (wheel) rim brake.
felica (of persons) happy (cf. fortunoza); felic(ul)o a h. person; feliceso happiness, felicity; des felica miserable; aspektar felica to look happy.
felino: a, ala, atra feline.
felpo (fabric) a kind of plush, shag, velveteen.
felto (fabric) felt; felta chapelo a f. hat.

femina, feminala she, feminine (N.B. applied chiefly to animals to distinguish sex); (cf. homina, feminala); femino a female (animal); feminismo feminism; femineso femininity; feminacho a vile woman; feminatra effeminate; femin(atr)igar to render, make effeminate; feminalo (gram.) the feminine.
femuro (anat.) femur, thigh-bone.
feno hay; feneyo place for h., h.loft; fenifar to grow h.; fenigar to h. make.
fenacetino* (pharm.) phenacetin(e).
fenco fence, enclosing barrier; muro, palis, greto, latofenco wall-, plank-, paling-, grate-, lath-fence.

fendar (tr.) to split (lengthwise), slit, cleave; (cf. krevisar); (fig.) to rend (the heart); fendetar to crack; fendeturo a chink, flaw, crack; fenduro fissure, cleft, interstice; fendilo cleaver, chopper.
fenestro window; fenestraro windows (collect.), fenestration.
fenikulo (bot.) fennel.
fenixo (also astron.) Phoenix.
fenolo (chem.) phenol, carbolic acid.
fenomeno phenomenon; fenomenala phenomenal.
fenomenologio* phenomenology, description, history, or explanation of phenomena.

fero iron; fera, ferala, feroza, feratra of, relating to iron; ferrous, ferruginous; ferizar to put iron on (ulo), to bind, fit, hoop (with iron); ferolaboristoi. worker; fererio i. foundry; feroraboturi, ferspani i. filings, chips: ferajo, fergarnituro i. fitting; ferizita ironed, metalled; (of horses) shod; olda fero scrap i.; fertolo, ferlameno sheet i.; forjita fero wrought iron; ferskorio slag, scoria, dross; ferocianato potassium ferrocyanide; fervoyo railway, railroad.
ferdeko (nav.) deck (of a ship); ferdekizar to d.; navo tri ferdeka a three-decker, ship with three decks.
ferio fair (market); ferioplaco, feriloko fairground.

ferma firm: solid, stable, fixed, compact, stout; (cf. solida, stabila); (fig.) which does not tremble, steady, steadfast, bold, resolute; fermeso firmness, stability; fermigar to make firm, (ulo) (cf. sekurigar); fermeskarto become firm, strong, established, settled. ferme firmly, steadily; (interj.) hold fast; do not flinch! Ex.: Ferma tero. Stacar ferme. Karno ferma. Parolar en tono ferma. Fermigar sua rezolvo. Ant.: mola, shancelanta, vacilanta, febla.
fermento a ferment (as yeast, leaven); (fig.) which excites or gives rise to.
fermentacar (intr.; also fig.) to ferment; (of dough) to rise.
feroca ferocious. Def.: Sovaja, kruela e violentoza; III

fertila fertile (ground, also fig.); fertileso fertility, fruitfulness; fertiligar to fertilize. V. exp.: Fertila ne esas la sama ideo kam fekunda: ento fekunda genitas ento simila a su; fertila esas simple produktema, qua produktas multo (ex.: agro); fekunda dicesas pri la vivanta enti, fertila pri la tero; IV
fervorar (intr.) to be fervent, be earnest, eager, zealous; (cf. ardorar, zelar); fervoroza prego fervent prayer; fervorar pri ulo to be eager about something, take a thing to heart.
fervoyo railroad, railway; feristoR. R. employee.
fes (mus.) F flat.

festar (intr.) to observe a holiday; (rel.) to keep a feast; festo, festodio festival, celebration, holiday, saint's day; festala festal, festive (of holidays); Pasko festo Easter; muzik festo music festival; garden festogarden fête.
festinar (tr., intr.) to feast, eat sumptuously, banquet; festinala festal: of a f.
festono festoon; festonizar to f.; (fig.) to scallop.
festuko a blade of straw.
feto foetus.
fetida fetid, rank, stinking; (cf. malodoranta).
fetisho fetish.
fezo fez: (Turkish) red cap.
fi! fie! shame! faugh! ugh! pish! phew!
fiakro hackney-coach, cab, four-wheeled public carraige; fiakrokavalo cab-horse.
fialo vial. V. exp.: vid. botelo.

fiancar (tr.) to betroth, affiance, pledge in marriage; (ulu kun); fianceskar to become engaged; fianco, fianceso betrothal, engagement; fiancito, fianculo, fiancino fiance; ge fianciti the two affianced.
fiasko fiasco, complete failure.
fibro fiber; fibreto fibril; fibrala, fibroza, fibreskema, fibratra fibrous, thready; fibrigar to thread out (ulo); fibreskar to become fibrous.
fibrino (chem.) fibrin.
fibroino* (chem.) fibroin.
fibulo (antiq.) fibula, a buckle or clasp (cf. peroneo); fibulizar (surg.) to infibulate.
ficho (play-) counter, token, check; asisto ficho token of presence. Def.: Lud-, konto – marko. Asisto – ficho pagesas a la membri di ula konsilantari, qui asistis singla kunveno; V

fidar (intr.) to trust, put one’s trust (in); rely (upon); put confidence (ad ulu, ulo);(cf. konfidar); o confidence, reliance, faith; fidema trusting, confiding; fidinda faithful, trustworthy;fidala (jur.) fiduciary; su fidego great self-confidence; sufideganta overweening; me fidas a lua paroloI rely on his word.
fideikomiso (jur.) a trust (of an estate or property);fideikomisario trustee.

fidela (of persons) faithful, true, trusty; fidel(ul)oa f. person; fideleso fidelity, fealty, allegiance (cf. vasaleso, devoteso, loyaleso); fidelojuro oath of allegiance; fidela a sua obligi faithful to one’s engagements; fidela amiko a faithful friend.

fiera proud, proper sense of self-respect or self-esteem; il esas fiera e superba he is proud and haughty. V. exp.: Fiera esas ta qua havas alta (ma generale justa) opiniono pri sua valoro, merito, povo, e qua manifestas ol extere. Superba esas ta qua havas ecesa opiniono pri sua valoro e merito, e konseque manifestas exajerata pretendi; IV
fifro fife; fifristo fifer.
figo (bot.) fig; figiero f. tree; figiereyo f. orchard.

figuro (also geom. rhet.) figure, outside form, shape of a body; appearance, representation; figurala expresuro, senco, stilo a figurative expression, sense, style; figuro vortala figure of speech; figurizar to figure, form into a determinate shape, represent (in picture) or statuary; figurizar kombato to figure, to represent a fight; figurizo figuration; figurizanta, figuriva figurative, typical; figurizeblarepresentable. Def.: Formo di tota korpo, homala o ne; V
figuranto, figurantulo, figurantino (theat.) figurant, accessory dancer or character.
fikario* (bot.) figwort (Ficaria verna. Ranunculus ficaria).
fiktiva fictitious, imaginary, not real. Ex. Fiktiva persono, valoro.

filo thread; (lina, lana, kotona, e.c.) (flax, wool, cotton, etc.) yarn; (metal) filo wire; filala, filoza thready; filifar (intr.) to spin; filigar (tr.) to spin(ulo), to make into threads; filiferio spinning mill; filifroto spinning-wheel; metalfiligar to wire draw, draw into wire; filizar to thread (a needle); filmarioneto, filpupeo dancing Jack.
filamento* filament (of plants, of nerves, etc.)
filandro, filandri air-thread(s), gossamer(s) (from spiders); (cf. araneotelo).
filantropo philanthropist; filantropeso philanthropy.
filatelio philately, stamp collecting; filateliar (intr.) to collect stamps; filateliero philatelist.
fileto fillet, chine (of beef, fish); thread (of a screw, worm); filetino female thread (tech.); filetizar to cut a thread on. Ex.: Fileto de soleo. Skrub-fileto.
filharmonio philharmony; filharmoniala philharmonic (society, etc.). Def. Amo pasionoza por muziko.
filhelena, filheleno philhellen -ic, -ist.

filio child (of), son or daughter; filiulo son; filiino daughter; filiala filial; filieso filiation, relations of children to parents; filialigar (fig.) to affiliate (cf. adoptar); filialo (fig.) branch establishment; filiino di la karitato sister of charity.
filigrano filigree (work), filigrane.
filiko (bot.) fern (order: Filices).
filipiko philippic.
filistra, filistrala; filistro (fig.) philistine.
filmo (photog.) film.
filogenezo* phylogeny, phylogenesis.
filologo philologist.
filologio philology; filologiala philological; filologiisto philologist.
filoxero (ent. genus) phylloxera, plant lice (cf. afidio).
filozofo philosopher; filozofala relating to a p.
filozofiar (intr.) to philosophize; filozofio philosophy; filozofiala philosophical.
filtrar (tr., intr.) to filter, strain, percolate; filtrilo filter.

finar (tr., intr.) to finish, to end, leave off, to have done, come to an end; finigar to finish (ulo), to cause to end, put an end to, terminate; fino end, finish; fina, finala final; finalo (gram.) final syllable; (mus.) finale; fine finally, at last, lastly; fineskar to draw to, to approach the end; par finita entirely completed, finished; sen fina endless, interminable; sen fine indefinitely; finevento denouement, final event, outcome; la muro finas ye ca loko the wall finishes at this place; finigez vua parolado put an end to your talk; ye la fino di ca monato at the end of this month; finala kauzo final cause.
financo finance, pecuniary resources; financala financial; financisto financier.

fingro (anat.) finger, digit; fingrala digital; ped fingro toe (cf. haluxo); fingruyo, fingrchapo, fingrshirmilo thimble; f. stall; fingragar, fingrordinar (tr., mus.) to finger; fingrofrapeto fillip; indik fingro forefinger, index f.; (cf. polexo); meza fingro middle f.; ringo fingro ring finger, third f.; mikra, orel fingro little f.

finisar (tr., tech.) to finish off (an article), to put the finishing touches to (ulo); finislimar (tr.) to finish off (ulo) with a file. Def.: Finisado esas la lasta laboro, quan on facas pri ula material produkturo, por ke ol havez sua definitiva forma ed aspekto; VI-383.
finita (math., philos.) finite; finitajo a f. object.
finko (orni.) chaffinch (Fringilla coelebs).
finto (milit., boxing, fencing) feint; fintar (intr.) to (make a) f. Def.: Simulita atako. Termino teknikal di la skerm-arto, uzata anke metafore; V-484, 676.
fiorituro (mus.) grace note, flourish.
firmo (com.) firm; firmestro head of f.
firmamento (lit. and fig.) firmament. Def.: L'antiqua nociono di la cielo (kom solida vulto); V-484.
fis (mus.) F sharp.

fisho (also astron.) fish; fishetaro small f., fry (collect.); fishoza abounding in f.; fishizar to stock with f.; fishatra, fishforma f. like, f. shaped; fishkaptar to catch a f. (cf. peskar); fishvendar to sell f.; fishkoquar to cook f.; fishvendeyo f. market; fishkoquilo f. kettle; fishosto f. bone; fishmanjanta f. eating, ichthyophagous; fishedukado pisciculture: raising of f; populizar per fishyuni to stock with fry.
fisko fisc: state or royal treasury; an exchequer; fiskala fiscal; fiskala bilieto treasury note; fiskala administrado fiscal administration.
fistulo fistula.

fitar (intr.) fitigar (tr.): (mechan., also of garments) to fit: suit as to shape, size; fiteganta tight-fitting. Def.: Tale adjustigar mashinal peci, ke li ne plus movas en ula direciono exter l'axala (anke uzata por la vesti); (VII-99). Ex. Ica fitas quale ganto.

fixa fixed (day, star, look, idea); fixe fixedly, steadfastly; fixigar to fix, fasten (ulo), to appoint (a day); fixeso fixity, fixedness; fixigo fixation; fixigiva, fixivo (photog.) fixing (agent). Ex.: Stelo fixa. Regardar fixe. Fixigar ulo per pinglo. Fixigar preco. Fixigar la atenco.
fiziko physics; fizikala physical, fizikisto physicist; fizikomatematikala physico-mathematical.
fiziognomonio* physiognomics: art of reading character.
fiziokratio physiocracy: economic doctrine of Quesnay; fiziokratiisto physiocrat.
fiziologio physiology; fiziologiisto physiologist.
fizionomio physiognomy, countenance, facial appearance; fizionomiisto physiognomist.
flado flawn, a sort of flat custard cake.

flago (especially nav.) flag; (cf. standardo, banero); flageto pennant; flagizar to dress with f.s. Def.: Flago esas insigno (generale min granda kam standardo), qua indikas la lojeyo, navo o loko di ula chefo o di ula establisuro: ex. la Reda Kruco; III-31.

flagrar (intr., chem.) to deflagrate: to blaze suddenly, flare up; (fig.) to be flagrant, flame into notice, be notorious; flagranta delikto (jur.) flagrante delicto, in the very act. Def.: Kombusto rapida kun granda e subita flami (anke uzata metafore); III-469. Ex.: La flagro di nitrokotono esas instantala. Flagranta ne-egaleso.
flajoleto (mus.) flageolet.
flako small pool, puddle (of water, blood, etc.)
flakono flask, cruet; vinagro flakono vinegar cruet. V. exp.: vid. botelo.

flamo flame, blaze, flash, flare; (fig.) flame (of passion), ardour, warmth (of affection); flamoza flaming; flamifar to blaze up, produce flame; flamagar (tr.) to pass (ulo) over a fire, to singe; flamif(ad)o flaming, blazing.
flamingo (orni.) flamingo (family: Phoenicopteridae).
flanar (intr.) to lounge, saunter, loiter, stroll; flan(ad)o an idle and leisurely walk; flananto, flanero, flanemo lounger, stroller, idler.
flanelo flannel; flanela of f.

flanko side (of body); flank (of enemy); breast (of ship); flanke at or from the side, flank; flankala lateral; flankala atako flank attack; flankumar (tr.) to be on the f. of (ulo); flankumo flanking; flankumanto(milit.) flanker; flankapogar (tr.) to prop up (ulo) on one side; flankizar (milit., arch.) to f., cover the f. of (ulo, per); flankirar (intr.) to go aside.
flarar (tr.) to smell, scent (an odour, an object; cf. odorar); flarar rozo to smell a rose; flarar danjero (fig.) to smell a rat, scent danger; flar(ad)o smelling; flaranta, flarala olfactory.
flatar (tr.) to flatter; flatachar to f. servilely, fawn upon, toady to (ulu); flatanta, flatema, flatoza flattering, adulatory; flatachanto, flatero sycophant, toady.
flatuar (intr.) to break wind, flatu(ad)o breaking wind, flatus, poop; flatuoza, flatuema flatulent, flatuozeso flatulence.
flava yellow; flaveso (color) yellow, yellowness; flavajo y. object; flavigar to render, make y.; flaveskar to become, turn, grow y.
flebito (med.) phlebitis.
flecho (weapon) arrow; (arch.) spire; (fort.) bonnet, fleche, simple redan; (geom.) absciss (of a curve); (trig.) versed sine; flechuyo quiver.
flegar (tr) to nurse, care for (sick person, child; cf. sorgar); fleg(ad)o nursing; flegist(ul)o, flegino; nurse; flegeyo sick-ward, place for nursing. V. exp.: vid. suciar.
flegmo (med.) phlegm; (fig.) coldness, sluggishness (of character); flegmoza (med. and mental) phlegmatic.
flegmono (med.) phlegmon.

flexar (tr., intr.) to bend (out of the straight), bow, flex; flexo, flexeso, flexuro bend(ing), flexion; flexanta (anat.) flexor; flexebla flexible, pliant, supple; flexoza (bot.) flexuous; flexigar to cause to b.
flexiono (gram.) flexion.
flintglaso flint-glass.
flirtar (intr.) to flirt, coquet, make love in a trifling manner;
flogar to flog, whip, lash, flagellate, scourge (cf. vergagar): flogilo whip, lash.
floko flake (as of snow); flock: lock of wool or hair; tuft; flokoza, flokatraflaky; nivo floko snow-f.
