floro flower, bloom, blossom; (fig.) flower (of speech), prime (of life), bloom (of innocence), etc.; floreto flowerlet; florala floral; florifar to bloom, blossom, be in flower; florif(ad)o blooming, efflorescence; florifanta (bot.) floriferous; florizar to cover, deck (with flowers); floroza, florizita flowery; flor(vend)isto florist; floristino flower girl; florkultiv(ad)o floriculture; floreyo, florbedof. bed; floruyo, florvazo f. holder, -vase; floruno (bot.) floret; sen florigar, des florizar to deflower; en la floro di l'evo(fig.) in the prime of life.
florino (money) florin.
florkaulo cauliflower (Brassica oleracea botrytis).
floso (ich.) fin.

floto (nav.) fleet; floteto a small f. V. exp.: Floto indikas «ensemblo de navi» naviganta kune e komandata da un chefo; navaro restus por indikar l'ensemblo di la navi di un naciono, kompanio, e.c.; IV
flotacar: (intr.) to float, to be afloat on the surface of a liquid; flotacigar to (cause to) float, waft, raft (wood, etc.); flotaclineo, flotacnivelo load, water line.
flotilio (nav.) flotilla. Def.: Floto (ne flot-eto) de mikra navi; VI
floxo* (bot.) phlox (genus: Phlox).
flozelo floss-silk.

fluar (intr.) to flow, run, glide (of liquids, elec.); flu(ad)o flow, current, stream(ing); fluanta flowing, running; fluanto (math.) fluent, variable quantity; fluanta stilo (fig.) flowing style; segun la fluo with the current; lavafluajo lava flow; elektrala fluo f. of electricity.

flugar (intr.) to fly (in air), fly about, be wafted (by wind); flugetar to flutter, hover; flugeskar to take wing, flight; flugbalono (fig.) a shuttlecock; fluganta fisho flying-fish (genus: Exocoetus and allied species); flugfolio loose or detached sheet of paper; flugroto flywheel (of machinery).
fluida fluid, having parts freely mobile, separate and penetrable, as water, vapor, and air; fluido a fluid; fluideso fluidity. V. exp.: Fluido esas gaso o liquido; IV-162; (cf. liquida).

fluktuar (intr.) to fluctuate, waver, float, move to and fro; (fig.) to be irresolute; fluktu(ad)o fluctuation, a motion like that of waves; wavering, unsteadiness; la flukti di opiniono publika the fluctuations of public opinion. Flago fluktuas en la vento a flag floats in the wind; Aquo fluktuanta moving water.
fluoro (chem.) fluorine.
fluorecar (intr., physics) to be fluorescent.
fluro staircase landing.
fluto (mus.) flute; fluto rurala reed-pipe; fluteto child's whistle; fluto transversa German f., traverse f.; flutatra flutelike, fluty; flut(ple)ero, flutisto flute player, flutist.

fluvio (large) river, a large stream of water flowing into the sea; (fig.) copious flow, torrent; irar admonte la fluivo to go up the river; (fig.) fluvio di sango: torrent of blood; fluvio di fairo, di eloquenteso stream of fire, of eloquence; fluviala fluvial.
fluxo rise of tide, high, flood-tide; fluxo e refluxo flood and ebb of tide; fluxar (intr.) to rise (of tide).
fluxiono (math., med.) fluxion.
foko (geom., opt.) focus.

fola mad, crazy, mentally deranged; (fig.) foolish, nonsensical, senseless; foleta (fam.) cracked, touched (in the head); mad after, infatuated, doting on; (cf. dementa); fol(ul)o madman, fool; foleso madness, folly; folajo mad, foolish act, prank; fola stroko a foolish play, act; fole amorar to love to distraction, be madly in love with (ulu); foligar to make (ulu) crazy, to make some one foolish; foleskar to go mad, become infatuated; foligita maddened, distracted, infatuated; fole ludar to sport, romp, frolic, play pranks; folfolludema playful, sportive, frolicsome; foloceptro fool's bauble; kortfol(ul)o court-fool, -jester. Def.: Vulgara termino, qua aplikesas precipue a la formi maxim videbla e shokanta di alienaco, a ti qui manifestas su per sensenca parolado, agiteso e violento; VI
folado (bivalve) pholas, stoneborer, piddocks (family: Pholadidae).

folio (bot.) leaf; thin sheet of something; folio: page number (folio 12 = pagino 12 of a sheet of which the reverse side is blank); foliaro foliage, leaves (collect.); folieto leaflet; (bot.) foliole; foliala relating to leaves; folioza leafy; (bot.) foliated; foliifar, folieskar to produce l.s, break forth in l.; foliigar to make into l.form; foliif(ad), foliiz(ad)o foliation, leafing; foliizita foliated, flaky; folioshirmo bower (of leaves); foliorekolto leaf-harvest; sen foliigar to strip of leaves; foliajo (arch.) foliaceous ornament, leaf-work; (cf. florono); foliumar to turn over the leaves of a book.
folietono feuilleton, literary part of a F. newspaper; folietonisto a writer of f.s.
folikulo (bot., anat.) follicle.

folkloro folklore. Def.: Ico esas nek populala literaturo, nek populala tradicionaro, ma l'ensemblo di la verki, rakonti, kanti, kustumi qui naskis de la populo e karakterizas ol, e lua studiado: VII-279.
fomentar (tr., med.) to foment, apply warm lotions to; (fig.) to encourage, stir up.

fondar (tr.) to found, establish (ulo, sur ulo); (cf. establisar); fondajo, fonduro that which is founded, establishment, foundation (cf. fundamento). Ex.: Il fondis sua sistemo sur fakti nekontestebla. Fondar komercala firmo, imperio, religio.
fonetiko phonetics.
fonografar (tr.) to record (ulo) on a phonograph; fonografilo phonograph; fonografuro phonograph-record; plear fonografilo to play a phonograph
fonolito* (min.) phonolite.
fonometro phonometer.

fonto (pr. and fig.) font, spring: natural source (cf. fonteno); fontaquo spring-water. Ex.: La fonti di Nil. Acensar rivero til la fonto. La fonto di lo bona e di lo mala. Laboro esas la fonto di richaji. Recevar novaji de bona fonto.
fontanelo (anat.) fontanel.
fonteno (artificial) fountain; fontenplumo f. pen.

for (prep.) far from, away from; fore (far) away; fora distant, remote, far distant (de); forajo a distant object; distance (prospect); de fore from a, at a, distance; foresar to be away; forigar to remove, send away; for de hike a great way off (from here); foreso remoteness; forirar to go away; fora komerco, navigado foreign trade, navigation. (In composition with verbs «away» as in: forduktar, forportar, fortirar, fortranar, etc.); il esas for sua patrio he is away from his fatherland; il vidis il de fore he saw him from a distance; kad vu volas forirar? do you wish to go away? la soldato forkuris the soldier ran away.
forco (mechan.) force. Ex.: La forci natural esas l'aero, l'aquo, e.c. Forco centripetala.
forcato galley-slave, convict (condemned to hard labor).
forcepso (surg.) forceps, an instrument used in midwifery (cf. pinceto).
forejo forage, fodder, food for beasts; forejifar to forage (for fodder); forejoplanti plants fit for fodder.
foresto forest; forestala pertaining to f.s, silvan; forestisto forester; forestokultivado forestry; forestizar to cover with f.

forfeto contract, tender (at a stipulated price, whether the contractor lose or gain); forfetale by contract, by the job, at a lump sum; kontratar per forfeto to engage to do (ulo) by contract. Def.: Kontrato per qua on engajas su exekutar ula laboro po totala sumo fixigita antee; IV-454.
forfikulo (ent.) earwig (family: Forficulidae).
forjar (tr.) to forge (metals); forjebla forgeable; forjisto blacksmith, forger (of iron); forjeyo, forjerio smithy, blacksmith's shop, iron works.
forjetar (tr.) to throw away (cf. repulsar, retrojetar); (of cards) to discard; forajo refuse, waste; forinda worthy of rejection.
forko (agri.) pitchfork, hayfork, dungfork; (fig.) any two or three-pronged instrument; forketo tablefork; forkatra forklike, cloven; forkodento prong of a f.; forkopikar to pierce with a f.
forlasar (tr.) to leave, quit; (cf. livar).
formo form, shape, conformation; formala formal; formalajo formality; formalismo formalism; sen forma shapeless.
formacar (tr.) to form, shape; formac(ad)o, formacuro formation; formacanta, formaciva formative. Ex.: Formacar literi, nubi, triangulo, karaktero. Geologiala formacuro.
formalino* (chem.) formalin.
formato format, shape, size of a book.
formulo formula; formularo, formullibro formulary; formuligar, formulizar to formulate, draw up in due form; formuligo, formulizo formulation.

forno (bake-)oven; (tech.) kiln; (cf. furnelo); fornego furnace, blast f.; fornedo a baking, ovenful, batch; forneyo baking place, bake-house; fornopago charge for baking. Def.: Kesto klozita, en qua on pozas kozi koquenda o varmigenda; IV-135.
fornikar (intr.) to fornicate.
foronomio* phoronomics: geometry of kinematics. Def.: Geometrio di la movo, o cinematiko geometriala; III-263.
forportar (tr.) to carry away, bear off.
forsar (tr.) to force, break open (a door, a lock), to compel (by mechanical means or power) ; (cf. koaktar).
forsan (adv.) perhaps, may be, perchance. Ex.: Forsan il kredas lo. Forsan il venos, forsan no. Me ne savas precize quanta komizi laboras en ica kontoro; forsan tri o quar.

forta (also fig.) strong, stout; forte strongly; (mus.) forte; fortulo a s. man; forteso strength; fortigar to strengthen; forteskar to get s.; (of wind) to freshen; fortiganta, fortiva strengthening, invigorating; fortigivo strengthener, tonic. Ant.: febla, debila, frajila.
fortifikar (tr., milit.) to fortify; fortifik(ad)o fortification, (act); fortifikuro fortification (object).
fortreso fortress, a large fort holding a garrison.; (fig.) a stronghold.
fortranar (tr.) to draw, drag away; (fig.) to sweep away, carry off (by passion).
forumo forum.
foso hole, pit, cavity; foseto small hole; (of face or body) dimple; fosifar to dig or make a pit. Def.: Kavajo o exkavajo plu o min larja e profunda (en tero).
fosato ditch, trench; (milit.) moat. Def.: Foso longa o plu juste linea, qua formacas limito od obstaklo; IV
fosfo* (chem.) phosphorus; fosfala, fosfozaphosphoric.
fosfato* (chem.) phosphate; fosfatacido phosphoric acid.
fosfeno* (phsysiol.) phosphene.
fosforecar (intr.) to be phosphores-cent; fosforec(ad)o phosphorescence
fosila, fosilo fossil; fosiligar to fossilize; fosileskar to become fossilized.
fosto post, a piece or timber set upright; stake (cf. paliso); jamb (of a door); indiko fosto way-post, guide-post, signpost.
fotofobio* (med.) photophobia, aversion to light.
fotofono photophone, radiophone.
fotograbar* (tr.) to photo-engrave; fotograburo photogravure.
fotokemio* photochemistry.
fotolitografar* (tr.) to photo-lithograph.
fotometro (phys.) photometer.
fotometrio photometry.
fotosfero (astron.) photosphere.
fototerapio* (med.) phototherapy.
fototipio* phototypy.
foxo fox; foxeyo f.hole, -burrow; foxchasisto, foxero f.hunter.

foyo time (in counting); occasion (repetition); turn (in series); singlafoye, omnafoye evey time (that), all the time, whenever; multafoye many times, often (when), repeatedly; quantafoye how many times; kelkafoye sometimes; esas mea foyo it is my turn; a singlu lua foyo to each a turn, every one in turn; me vidas il dufoye en la monato I see him twice a month. F
foyero (theat.) foyer, lobby; (of the actors) greenroom.
fraciono (arith.) fraction; fracionigar to divide into f.s.
frago strawberry; fragiero s.plant (genus: Fragaria); fragiereyo, fragierbedo s. bed.
fragmento fragment, broken piece, scrap; fragmentigar to make into or reduce to f.s.

frajila (also fig.) fragile, brittle, easily broken or destroyed, not durable; hom frajil ala frajileso (fig.) man's frailty; la frajileso dil fortuno (fig.) the instability of fortune. V. exp.: Ne omna objekto ruptebla esas frajila; bastono esas ruptebla, vitro dina esas frajila; III
frako (evening) dress coat, swallow-tailed coat.
frakasar (tr.) to break to pieces, shatter, smash; frakasbruiso crash (sound). (cf. ruptar). Ex.: Frakasar porcelana taso. Omna osti en lua korpo esis frakasata.
framo (tech.) frame (work) (of a machine, wagon, etc.); chassis (of autom.); sash (of a window, etc.) N.B. not frame of picture; cf. kadro.
framasono a freemason; framasonala masonic.
frambo rasberry; frambiero: r. bush (genus: Rubus); frambizar to cover with r.s; (fig.) to give a r. flavor to.

Franca French; Franco, Franculo, Francino; Franciano a F. person; Francia France; Francigar to frenchify, gallicize; Franceskar to become F.; Francig(ad)o gallicizing; Francamanta; Francamiko francophil; Francodianto; Francenemiko enemy of the F.; francophobe; la Franca (linguo): the French (language); Francatre, segun la Franca modo in the F. fashion.
francisko (French) battle-axe. Def.: Armo di l'antiqua Franki: hakilo kun du tranchivi; V
franciskano* a Franciscan monk, gray friar.
frangulo (bot.) black alder tree, alder buckthorn Frangula (Rhamnus).
franjo fringe, border of loose threads; franjizar to f. (ulo): adorn, trim with a f.; franjigar; franjeskar to fray out, become f.ed.
franjipano frangipane, jasmine perfume, also a liquor.
franko franc: F.coin; $0.193; 9.52 pence.
Franko member of a former German people.
frankolino (orni.) francolin: a species of partridge (genus: Pternistes).

frapar (tr.) to strike, knock, hit, slap, rap; (fig.) to make an impression on (ulu); frapetar to pat, tap lightly, strum; frap(ad)o strike, clapping (of hands, rapping); (cf. stroko);frapanta verajo a striking truth; vento frapo gust of wind; pugno frapo blow of the fist; manu frapo clap (of hand); pedo ar to knick (cf. kikar); ondo frapo beat of wave; frapar pike e tranche to cut and thrust. V. exp.: vid. batar.

frato (also relig.) brother or sister; fratulo brother; fratino sister; ge frati brothers and sisters; frataro, frateso brother- or -sisterhood; fratala, atra fraternal, sisterly, brotherly; frateskar to fraternize (kun); armo fratulo: brother-in-arms; lakto fratulo foster brother; fratocido fratricide (act.)

fraudar (tr., intr.) to defraud; cheat (in play); frauda, fraudoza fraudulent; fraudanto, fraudero defrauder, cheat; fraude sustraktar to embezzle; fraudar parole to equivocate; fraudar sua kreditanti to defraud one's creditors; fraudar en exameno to cheat in an examination. V. exp. furtar.
fraxino (bot.) ash-tree (genus: Fraxinus).
frayo spawn, eggs of fish and also of frogs; frayifar to s.

frazar (gram., mus.) phrase, sentence; frazarifar to phrase, form sentences; frazaroformo a form of sentence; a ready-made sentence, commonplace; idiotismala frazo idiomatic sentence; membro de frazaro clause (cf. klauzo).
frazeologio phraseology.
fregato (nav.) frigate.
fregatucelo (orni.) frigate-bird (genus: Techypetes)
fremisar (intr.) to shudder, quiver, tremble (from passion; cf. tremar); fremisigar to cause to shudder. Ex.: On fremisas de (pro) hororo, iraco, de multa pasioni.
frenezio frenzy, madness; frenezioza, freneziika furious, frantic, frenzied, raving; aceso de frenezio a fit of f.; frenezioza homo frantic person. Def.: Furioza deliro; (fig.) eceso en ula pasiono.
frenologio phrenology; frenologiisto phrenologist.
frequa frequent; frequala (gram.) frequentative. V. exp.vid. ofta. Ant. rara, ecepta, frequala, unika.

frequentar (tr.) to frequent, visit often, haunt; attend (a school); frequentata frequented (road, etc.); nur la Angli frequentas ta regioni only the English frequent these parts. V. exp.: Frequentar implikas (etimologie) l'ideo di frequeso, do di plura o multa asisti. On frequentas skolo, kurso, ma on ne frequentas diskurso (unfoye facita): on asistas ol; V.

fresha fresh, recently made, gathered, done, obtained; not stale; sound, not impaired by time; freshigar to freshen, refresh; freshiganta refreshing. Ex.: Fresha ovo (jus pozita). Fresha aquo, karno, linjo. Freshe bakita, razita. La fresheso di la rozo. La pluvo freshigas l'aero, la vejetantaro. Drinkajo freshiganta.
freskofresco; freske piktarto paint in f.
fretar (tr., nav.) to charter (a vessel); fretanto, fretero charterer; fretopago, fretpreco freight-, charter-cost; fretokontrato charter-party. Def.: Lokacar navo por transporto di vari; II
friabla friable. Def.: Qua esas facile reduktebla a pulvero.
frianda (of objects) dainty, nice, toothsome, savory; friandajo titbit, dainty morsel, sweetmeat, table delicacy; frianda disho; a dainty dish. F
fricionar (tr., mechan., med.) to rub; friciono rubbing, friction. V. exp. vid. frotar.
frikasar (tr., cook.) to fricassee; frikasajo, frikasuro: a f.
fripo, fripi worn-out, old clothes or apparel, frippery, trumpery; fripeyo old clothes place, rag-fair; fripisto old clothes dealer; second hand dealer.
fripona knavish, rascally; fripon(ul)o knave, rogue, rascal; (cf. raskalo); friponajo, friponeso rascality, knavishness. F
friso (arch.) frieze.

friskar (intr.) to frisk, w(r)iggle, fidget; friskema frisky, nimble, fidgety; ca fisho ankore friskas this fish is still wriggling; ta puero esas friskema that child is fricky (or, fidgety); el esas sempre friskanta per sua pedi she is always fidgeting with her feet. Def.: Agitar (su) per movi vivaca e kurta.
fristo (jur.) fixed space of time; (legal) term; respite, delay, postponement. Def.: Tempo - quanto grantenda o grantita por efektigar ulo; VI
fritar (tr., intr.) to fry; fritajp thing fried, a fritter, fry; fritita buio (de) croquette; frito fritgraso fat for frying.

frivola (of persons) frivolous, light-minded; (of things, acts) trifling, futile, petty; frivol(ul)o f. person; frivolajo frivolity (act); a futility; frivola yuno a gay young person; dicar frivolaji to talk nonsense, fiddle-faddle. Ant.: serioza, grava.

frizar (tr., intr.) to curl, frizzle (the hair of the head, beard, mustache, etc.);frizeso curliness; frizajo, frizloklo a curl; frizisto hair-curler, -dresser; frizfero curling iron; papero curl-paper.
frogo frog: coarse braid or gallon crossing the breasts of a coat. (Not amphib. cf. rano).
froko (monk's) cowl, hood (cf. kapuco); (in an extensive sense) (monk's) frock, gown; frokizar to enfrock; abandonar la froko (fig.) to cease to be a monk.
frolar to graze, touch slightly in passing, brush past. Ex.: La kuglo frolis mea kapo.
fromajo cheese.
frondo a sling ( as for throwing stones); (surg.) a sling (as used for arm) (cf. sharpo); frondagar (tr.) to throw (ulo) with a s.

fronto (anat.) forehead; (fig.) the fore part of anything; frontala frontal (anat.); front (fig.); frontalo frontal-bone; sam fronte abreast; frontolineo (milit.) front-line; fronto larja a wide forehead; a broad front; atakar la enemiko sur la fronto to attack the enemy on its front; frontal atako a front attack;la fronto di vesto the front of a garment.
frontiero frontier. Def.: Limito inter du landi; II
frontono (arch.) fronton, pediment; -eto: a little pediment over a door or window. Def.: Arkitektural ornivo triangula o mi-cirkla super la enireyo di edifico.

frostar (intr.) to freeze (cf. glacieskar); frostigar to f. (ulo); (cf. frigorizar; konjelar; pruinar); frostetar to chill, benumb; forta frosto a hard freeze; frostopluvo a freezing rain; frostofendita split, cracked by frost; des frostar to thaw.

frotar (tr., household term) to rub, scrub, shine up; polish (ulo) by rubbing; wax and polish (a floor, furniture) (cf. polisar). V. exp.: Frotar esas ekonomiala ago: on frotas parqueto, mobli, etc. Fricionar havas teknikala senco, sive en medicino, sive en mekaniko; II
frua, frue (adj. adv.) early; frulevanta, fruanto rising early; early riser; tro frue too early; plu frue earlier; maxim frue posible as early as possible.
frugala frugal; (cf. sparema) Ex.: Frugala homo. Frugaleso di repasto.
frugilego(orni.) rook (Corvus frugilegus); frugilegeyo rookery.

frukto (pr. and fig.) fruit; fruktifar to fructify, bear fruit; fruktoza, fruktifanta fruitful, prolific; fruktarboro f. tree; fruktogardeno, fruktarboreyo f. garden; fruktovendisto f. seller; fruktomanjanta frugivorous.
frumento wheat; frumenta, frumentala, frumentatra frumentaceous; frumentizar to sow (ulo) with w., cover with w.

frusta worn out, defaced, corroded (of coins), weather-beaten (of statues); frusta medalio a defaced medal; konko frusta a worn shell. V. exp.: Frusta esas vorto mi-teknikala, utila in mikra faki, ex. pri arto (skulptado, numismatiko); IV
frustrar (tr.) to deprive unjustly (ulu, de ulo), to defraud; (N.B. not E. frustrate; cf. deceptar, faliigar, vanigar). Def.: Privacar neyuste o neloyale; III
ftizio (med.) phthisis, consumption; ftiziika, ftiziiko consumptive.
fudro ton, large cask. Def.: Tre granda barelo (de 800 litri e plu multo); V

fugar (tr., intr.) to flee (from), run away; fugeskar to take flight; fugigar to put (ulu) to flight, drive away, rout; fugo running away, flight, rout; (mus.) fugue; fuganta, fuginta, fugema fugitive, fleeting, transient; fuganto, fugero fugitive, runaway. Ex.: Ni fugas de la enemiko. Ni fugigas la enemiko. Tempo fugas. La fugo ad Egiptia. Fuganta sklavo. Ca vivo esas fuganta (E. transient).
fuino (zool.) common (or beech-) marten (Mustela Foina).
fuko (bot.) fucus, sea-weed, kelp. Def.: Ordinara genero di algo.

fular (tr.) to tread (grapes), trample on (ulo); to full (cloth) (cf. tramplar). Def.: Pedo-presar (ulo) o marchar sur (ulo); (fig.) specala maniero traktar drapi; VI-114. Ex.: Fular la vitberi. La kavali fulis la gazono e la flori.
fulardo (fabric) foulard; (fig.) a silk handkerchief.
fulgurar (intr.) to fulgurate, flash as or like lightning (cf. fulminar); fulgurpulvero (photog.) flash-light powder.
fulgurito (geol.) fulgurite.
fuligino soot; fuliginoza, fuliginatra sooty, fuliginous; fuliginea s. colored.
fulko (orni.) (bald) coot (genus: Fulica).

fulminar (tr., intr.) to fulminate, to lighten; to thunder and lighten; to flash; to blast (ulu); (fig.) to thunder forth (menaces, excommunication, etc. kontre ulu); fulmin(ad)o lightning, flash, fulmination; fulminstroko thunderbolt, lightning stroke; fulminosilencoza heat-lightning; fulminanta fulminating; para fulmino lightning-rod.
fumario (bot.) fumitory (genus: Fumaria).
fumarolo (volcanic) fumarole, smoke fissure (cf. fumfenduro).

funcionar (intr.) to function (all senses): to function, act (kom), to perform the duties, fill an office, to work properly (of machinery, etc.); (cf. agar, laborar); funcionigar to make work, set going, put in play; funcion(ad)o function(ing): execution, performance; discharge (of duty); office, duty; (physiol., math.) function; funcionala functional; funcionero functionary; funcionerismo officalism, administrative system, founded on the existence of a great number of functionaries.

fundo bottom, lowest part of something hollow, as b. of a vase, a well; that which stands at the bottom, as a liquid at the bottom of bottles; ground, solid substance under water, as of sandy b.; (fig.) basis, essential part; funde at bottom, in the main, in reality; fundizar to bottom (a chair, etc.); sen funda bottomless; en la fundo di la holdo in the b. of the hold; fundo di lito b. of a bed; fundo di la maro b. of the ocean; tushar fundo to touch b.; (fig.) la fundo di pikturo the background of a painting; veluro kun oratra fundo velvet with a gold(like) background; de l'fundo til la tekto from the bottom to the roof; (fig.) wholly, from top to bottom; fundo di spegulo back of a mirror.

fundamento (pr. and fig.) that on which anything rests; foundation, groundwork, underpinning; (fig.) basis, ground; (cf. fonduro, basamento); fundamentala fundamental; fundamentizar to lay the f.s of (ulo). Ex.: La fundamento di edifico. La fundamenti di la universo, di la homala vivo, di la arti; Lua sistemo esas fundamentale nejusta.
funelo funnel; funelagar (tr.) to pour (ulo) through a f.; funelego (mill-)hopper; funelfusilo (firearm) blunderbuss.
funero (ceremony) funeral, obsequies; funerala funeral, funereal, mortuary; funeristo undertaker.

funesta baleful, disastrous, distressing, pernicious, malign. Def.: Expresas ideo plu forta kam nociva, ma ne esas exakte nek sempre mortigiva; signifikas kauzo od okaziono di nefeliceso; IV-267. Ex.: Funesta evento, novajo, pasiono, milito. Ant.: favoroza.

fungo (also med.) (bot.) fungus, mushroom, (edible or poisonous as toadstool); fungo manjebla edible (or common) m.; fungajo (med., bot.) f. growth; fungoza fungous; fungatra, fungoforma f. like; f. shaped; fungokultiveyo f. bed.
funikulara funicular, dependent upon the tension of a cord, cable; funikulara fervoyo f. railroad.
fuorto fort, fortified point, stronghold; (cf. fortreso).
furo fur (of animals; cf. felo); furoza, furizita furry, lined with fur; furizar to line, cover with fur; furisto furrier; furvesto, furajo fur garment, fur object.
fureto (zool.) ferret; (Putorius Furo); (fig.) ferret(er), inquisitive person; furetagar (intr.) to hunt with a f.; furetumar (tr.) to ferret out, pry into (ulo); furetumanto a Paul Pry, searcher.
furgono closed van or goods wagon (cf. kamiono); (milit.) baggage cart, ammunition wagon. Def.: Kargoveturo qua esas konstitucita ek kestego klozita en qua on inkluzas la vari; IV-291.
furiar (intr.) to be in a state of extreme anger, momentary madness, immoderate passion; furiigar to infuriate (ulu); furio rage; (myth.) Fury; furioza furious, enraged.
furiero (milit.) quartermaster (sergeant) (cf. quartermastro). - DFIS
furnazo* (also fig.) furnace; ardorozao fiery furnace.

furnelo stove (for heating or cooking); kitchen-range; furnelego furnace; furnelifisto stove-maker; fuzo furnelo smelting-furnace. Def.: Aparato en qua on facas fairo; ol povas kontenar forno; IV-135.

furnisar (tr.) to furnish, supply (ulo ad ulu); furnisajo thing supplied; furnisanto, furnisero, furnisisto furnisher, purveyor; (theat.) property-man. Ex.: Furnisar pano, mobli, informo. V. exp.: On provizas ulu per ulo; on furnisas ulo ad ulu; kp. livrar.

furtar (tr.) to steal, rob, purloin; furtetar to pilfer; furto theft, larceny; furtajo thing stolen; furtomanio, furtiko kleptomani-a, -ac; enirar furteme; to steal in, sneak in. V. exp.: Furtar esas prenar per ruzo la proprajo di altru (generale kun nesavo di ica); raptar esas prenar ol per violento sen celo; fraudar korespondas a furtar (implikas deshonesta ruzo); II-647.
furtechasar (intr.) to poach, steal game.
furtocelo the hiding or receiving of stolen goods: furtoero, furtoisto receiver of stolen goods; (colloq.) fence.
furunklo (med.) furuncle, boil.
fushar (tr.) to bungle, botch, scamp (work); fush(ad)o botching; (fig.) sabotage; fushajo botch-work, shoddy; fushfabrikar to make worthless merchandise, shoddy goods.

fusilo musket, gun, rifle; fusiliero fusilier; fusilagar (tr.) to shoot (down) (ulu); fusilpafar (intr.) to shoot (ad ulo); fusilagado firing, fusillade; fusilpafo musket-shot; chas fusilo hunting gun, fowling-piece; duopla fusilo double-barreled gun; glata fusilo shotgun; iteranta fusilo a repeating or magazine rifle.
fusto (arch.) fust: shaft of a column; (of a cannon) chase.
fusteno (fabric) fustian.
futero lining (of clothes, etc.); futerizar to line (ulo).
futura, futuro (also gram.) future; predicar la futuro to foretell the f. - DEF
fuxio (bot.) fuchsia (genus: Fuchsia).
fuxino (chem.) fuchsine.

fuzar (tr.) to melt, fuze, smelt; fuzo, fuzeso melting, fusion, blend; fuzanta, fuziva, fuzema melting, dissolving; fuzerio foundry, smelting establ.; fuzkaldrono melting-pot; fuzarto art of smelting; fuztemperaturo melting point; fuzebla fusible; kun fuz ar to melt together, amalgamate, blend.
fuzeo rocket (as in fireworks); fuse (to a bomb, etc.); signal fuzeo sky-, signal-rocket.
fuzelo (geom.) spindle: a solid generated by the revolution of a curved line about its base; a fusiform figure;
fuzeno (bot.) prickwood, spindle tree, (genus: Evonymus); fuzenkarbono, fuzenkrayono charcoal pencil; fuzendesegnuro, fuzenuro charcoal sketch.
fyordo fiord, rocky bay.
gabano water proof cloak with hood and sleeves; (naut.) pilot-coat.
gabaro lighter, barge (for loading and unloading ships).
gabiono: (fort.) gabion.
glado (ich.) codfish (Gadus).
gafo boat-hook; (fig.) gaff (as used to secure heavy fish).
gagato jet (mineral); gagatajo object made of j.
gaino a long narrow vertical holder, sheath, scabbard (as for a sword, bayonet, etc.: en gainigar to sheath) a sword, etc. V. exp: vid. etuyo.

gajo pledge, pawn, deposit, gage; something given as security for repayment of money borrowed; gajopekunio earnest money; gajohomo hostage; gajizar to give as a pledge, secure; depozar (ulo) gaje o kom gajo to pawn; prenar kom gajo to hold as pledge; pagar (o donar) gajo (pekunio) to pay a deposit.
galo gallnut, nutgall; galvespo gallfly (Cynips).

gala (adj.) gala; galadineo gala dinner; galafesto gala festival; galarobo a gala robe, festive dress. V. exp.: Ica vorto uzesas precipue adjektive, por qualifikar festo, dineo, reprezento, e.c. On uzos do ol kom unesma elemento di kompozita vorti; IV-11.
galanta gallant; polite and attentive to ladies; galantajo act of gallantry, courteous act (to ladies).
galanteno (cook.) galantine; collared turkey or veal.
galbano galbanum, a resinous gum.
galeno (min.) - galena.
galero (antiq. vessel) galley; galerano one of the crew of the g.; (fig.) g.slave (cf. bagnano).

galerio gallery, a long narrow room, hall or passageway; highest balcony (in theaters, churches); balcony on stern of ship; drift tunnel, (in mining or fortification) galerispektanti, galeriantaro the gallery, people seated in g.
galeto «gallette»: a thin cake.
galio* (chem.) gallium.
galicismo Gallicism, a French idiom.
galikana Gallican, Gallic; galikanismo Gallicanism.
galimatiaso galimatias, jargon, gibberish. V. exp.: Galimatiaso ne estas linguo, ma diskurso o parolado qua estas gramatikale korekta ma konfuza ed obskura per la stilo; VII-158.
galinelo (orni.) gallinule: water-hen, moor-hen (genus: Gallinula).
galiono (nav.) galleon.
galioto (nav.) gal(l)liot.
galono galoon, a narrow trimming, lace of gold, silver, silk, etc.; galonizita galooned.
galosho galosh: a shoe with a wooden sole.
galvanala galvanic, related to galvanism; galvanismo galvanism, galvanic (or voltaic) electricity.
galvanizar (tr. elec., and fig.) to galvanize, electrify; (cf. galvanoplastar).
galvanometro galvanometer.
galvanoplastar (tr.) to electrotype; galvanoplast(ad)o galvanoplasty, electrotyping, electro-metallurgy.
gamo (mus.) gamut, scale. Def.: Sequo di la soni di ula tono en l'ordino di alteso (ex.: c, d, e, f, g, a, b esas la gamo di la tono di C); IV-467.
gambo leg, shank; gamboza, gambizita legged; bon, belgambozawell made about the legs; gambo ligna o artificala wooden, artificial leg; gambalo boot-leg; gambarmo leg-guard; sen gamba legless.
gambitar (tr.) to trip up (ulu); (fig.) (in chess) to play a gambit.
gambolar (intr.) to gambol, skip about in frolic, romp.
gamelo (milit., nav.) mess-bowl, -platter; (fig.) mess; gamelokamarado messmate; manjar gamele to mess to-gether.

ganar (tr.) to gain, to earn, to win; ganajo what is gained; ganiganta lucrative, profitable; ganema covetous, greedy (cf. avida); ganemeso cupidity; ganar sua nutrivi to make one's living; ganar sua proceso to win one's case; ganar dek franki to earn (or make) ten francs; ganar premio to win a prize; ganar batalio gain a battle; ganar l'amo gain the love.
gango (min.) gangue.
gangliono (anat.) ganglion.
gangrenar (intr. med.) to be affected with gangrene; gangrenigar, gangrenifar(tr., intr.) to g., to produce mortification; gangreno g., (fig.) corruption.

ganso (orni.) goose; gansulo gander; gansoyuno gosling; gansoplumo quill pen; gansopedo foot of a g.; gansopelogooseflesh, creeping of the flesh; gansomarcho Indian file, single file; gansopazo goose-step (milit.)
ganto glove; gantizar to g., fit with g.; armo ganto, fera gantogantlet, gauntlet.
gapar (intr.) to gape with wonder or curiosity (like a simpleton).

garar (tr.) to put or place to one side of a road or way (temporarily for protective purposes); to shunt, switch, (trains on a siding); garar su to turn aside (as to allow another to pass), to give way (as a fencer to protect himself); garvoyo (R.R.) siding, shunt-line; gareyo a side place; (fig.) a garage (for autos). Def.: Pozar latere ad ula voyo, en halto o rezervo, quaze depozita o shirmata; IV-103. Ex.: On garas treni sur gar-voyi (N.B. gareyo ne esas staciono). On garas bateli en la protui o gareyi (larjigita parti) di kanalo. La pasanti en la stradi garas su de la veturi o por lasar altru pasar. La skermanto garas su por «kovrar» (protektar) sua korpo ed evitar la stroki di espado.

garantiar (tr.) to guarantee, warrant; (cf. certigar, responsar, kaucionigar). Ex.: Garantiar la pago di debajo. Me garantias ca posh-horlojo pur un yaro. Me ne povas garantiar la vereso di ta aserto.
garbo sheaf (of wheat, etc.); aquo garbo sheaf-like cluster of jets; fairo garbo fireworks resembling a sheaf; garbamaso cock, stack, rick.
garbanzo (bot.) chick-pea (Cicer).

gardar (tr.) to gaurd (persons); to tend (beasts); gardar su to beware, take heed; gardisto a guard; gardar per la okuli not to lose sight of; gardohundo watch-dog; gardonavo g. ship; gardez vu por ke on ne videz vu beware that no one sees you; gardar la karcerani to guard prisoners; gardar la mutoni to take care of the sheep.
gardeno garden; gardenkultivar to g.; gardenkultiv(ad)o horticulture; gardenfesto, gardenpartio g. party.
gardenio (bot. genus) gardenia.
gardio (ich.) roach (Leuciscus rutilus).
gareno warren; garenkuniklo rabbit of a w.; kuniklo gareno rabbit w.
gargarar (tr.) to gargarize, to gargle (the throat) (ulu, su); gargarivo a gargle, gargative.
garito sentry-box.

garnisar (tr.) to furnish with things necessary to complete or embellish; garnisar biblioteko, butiko to stock a library, a shop; garnisar fortreso to supply a fortress with provisions, ordnance, ammunition and stores; elua bela denti garnisas lua boko her beautiful teeth set off her mouth; garnisar disho to garnish a dish; garnisar chapelo per flori to trim a hat with flowers.
garnituro garniture, ornamental appendages, embellishment, furniture, dress.
garnizono garrison; garnizonano member of a g.

garoto short piece of wood used to tighten anything, especially cords by twisting around; packing-stick; garotagar to garrote, strangle (as in Spain); garotligar to make fast, with or in a garrote; (fig.) to pinion, strangle.
garsono (man) waiter; office porter.
gartero garter(band); (cf. kalzoligilo); garterizar to g. (ulu).

gaso gas; gasa gaseous, which is g.; gasala, gasatra gaseous, relating to g., gasiform ; gasoza gaseous: full of g.; gasifar to produce, make g.; gasiferio g. works; gasbrutilo g. burner; gaskontilo gas-meter; gasigar to gasify.
gasometro gasometer, gas-holder: gas-reservoir. (cf. gaskontilo).
gasto guest; gastesar to be a g., to stay, lodge (che ulu); gastigar to receive (ulu) as a g.; to lodge (ulu); gastigo lodging, putting up (a g.); gastigema hospitable; gasteyo g. place. - DER
gastropodo (zool.) gastropod.- DEF
gastralgio* (med.) gastralgia: gastric neuralgia, pain in the abdomen; belly-ache.
gastrito (med.) gastritis.
gastronomo gastronome, epicure. Def.: Homo qua havas subtila gusto e savas dicernar la qualesi di la manjaji e drinkaji; VII-155. V. exp.: vid. gurmando.
gastronomio gastronomy. Def.: Quaza arto di la gastronomo.
gaujar (tr.) to gauge, measure (the capacity of), to take the g. of. Def.: Mezurar la konteno (interna volumino) di navo, barelo. e.c.; III-75.
gavar (tr.) to cram, gorge (with food), (artificially) to fatten (animals).
gavoto gavot(te): a kind of lively dance or tune (French).

gaya gay, lively, merry, cheerful; gayeso gaiety, merriment, hilarity, mirth, glee; gayesar to be g.; gayigar to make (ulu) merry, cheer, enliven, gladden; gayiganta, gayiva exhilarating; (cf. joyo). Ant.: trista.
gayako guaicum-wood, lignum-vitae; gayakiero g. tree (genus: Guaiacum).
gazo gauze.
gazelo (zool.) gazelle (genus: Gazella dorcus).
gazolino gasoline, gasolene.
gazono grass-sod, turf; gazonizar to turf, sod; gazoneyo, gazonagro, gazonbedo lawn, greensward, grass plot.
geblo gable (of a house).
geheno Gehenna; (fig.) hell.
«geisha» geisha, Japanese singing or dancing girl.
gelatino gelatine.
gemo gem, precious stone.
genciano (bot.) gentian (genus: Gentiana).
genealogio genealogy, pedigree; genealogiisto genealogist.

genero genus; generala general, generic; generale generally, in general; generaleso (character) generality; generalajo (la) (objective) generality; generaligar to generalize; generalig(ad)o, generuro generaliz-ing, -ation.
generaciono generation, people of same period.
generalo (milit.) general.
generalisimo generalissimo, commander-in-chief.
generatoro* (tech.) generator.
genezo (also Biblical) genesis; (geom.) genesis, generation; genezala genetic.

genio genius, particular natural talent, uncommon intellectual power; (fig) attendant spirit; genioza full of g.; havar genio por aferi, por muziko to have a g. for business, for music; il havas la doto di granda genio he has the gift (natural endowment) of great g.; la genio di la Franca esas klareso the g. of the French language is clearness; il esas mea mala genio he is my evil g.; 1a genio di Roma the g. of Rome.

genitar (tr.) to beget, breed, generate, procreate (living beings); cf. produktar (ulo); (geom.) to generate; genit(ad)o begetting, reproduction (di ulu); genitala, genitanta, genitiva genital, generating, reproductive; genituro offspring, a progeny; (of animals) a litter; -ema prolific; V. exp.: On genitas filio; luxo produktas vicio.
genitivo (gram.) genitive.
genro (gram.) gender. Def.: Gramatikala sexuo; IV-692.
gento (Roman) gens.

genuo, genuala knee; genupozar (intr.) to kneel (down); genupozinte on bended knee(s); genuflexar to bend the k.; genuflexo genuflexion; genushirmilo any screen for k., as knee-piece (armor), top of boot, etc.
geocentrala* (astron.) geocentric.
geodezio geodesy.
geognozio geognosy.
geografo geographer.
geografio geography.
geologo geologist.
geologio geology.
geomanciar* (intr.) to practise geomancy.
geometro geometer, geometrician.
geometrio geometry. - DEFIRS
gepardo (zool.) cheetah (Cynailurus).
geranio (bot.) geranium (genus: Geranium).
gerfalko (orni.) gerfalcon, gyrfalcon (subgenus: Hierofalco).

Germania Germany; Germana, Germanala German, Germanic; Germano a German; Germanismo, Germanajo Germanism; Germanigar to Germanize; Germanamanta, Germano Germanophil; Germanodianta, Germano German-hating, -hater; la Germana (linguo) German language.
germanio* (chem.) germanium.
gerundio (gram.) gerund.
ges (mus.) G flat.
gestar (intr.) to gesticulate (as in speaking); gesto gesticulation, gesture, deaf and dumb sign; gestadema gesticulative; geste by gesticulating.
getro gaiter, leggings; getreti spats; getrizar to put leggings on (su, ulu).
«geyser» geyser. - DEF
«ghetto» ghetto. - DEF
gibo; ozeso rounded protuberance: bump, hump, knob, hunch, boss, gibbosity; oza gibbous, hunched, humpbacked: ier(ul, in)o hunch-back; izar to put a bump, boss on (sulu, ulo).
gibbon gibbon, ape.
gibelina, gibelino (Ital., hist.) Ghibelline.
gicheto wicket, small gatelike window in ticket-offices, etc.; also as in game or cricket.
giganta gigantic; giganto, gigantulo, gigantino giant.
gildo guild, gild. Def.: Ensemblo di samspeca mestieristi. M.-X.132.
gilochar (tr., arch.) to furnish or decorate with a guilloche; gilochuro ornament of interlaced curved lines.
gilotino guillotine; gilotinager to g. (ulu).
gimnastikar (intr.) to do gymnastics; gimnastikeyo gymnasium.
gimnazio gymnasium, classical preparatory school (esp. in Germany); (cf.kolegio; liceo).
gimnospermo(bot.) gymnosperm.
gimnoto (ich.) gymnotus, electric eel (Gymnotus electricus).
gineceo (antig.) gynecium, women's apartment; (bot.) gynoecium.
ginesto (bot.) broom (Genista).
gipaeto (orni.) gypaetus, lammergeier, bearded vulture (Gypaetos barbatus).

gipso gypsum, plaster-of-paris; ordinary plaster (as used for house interiors); (cf. mortero); gipsizar to plaster; (cf. krepisar); gipsoza gypseous, chalky; gipsomineyo plaster-mine, chalk-pit; gipsajo plaster cast (cf. stuko); gipseskombri, gipsorezidui pieces of old plaster work.
gipuro guipure (lace).
girlando garland: wreath of flowers, leaves, etc.
girometro gyrometer, rotary speed indicator.
giroskopo gyroscope.
gis (mus.) G sharp.
gisar (tr.) to cast: found molten metal; (cf. muldar); gisfero c. iron; gisfera lingoto pig-iron; gisdefekto defect in casting, blow-hole. Ex.: Gisar kanono en mulduro. III-82.
gitaro (mus.) guitar.
gizardo (anat.) gizzard. Def.: Triesma stomako di l'uceli; V-87.
glacar (tr., tech.) to gloss, glaze (paper, leather, etc.) (cf. glezar); to calender (fabrics).
glaciero glacier: glacierala glacial: relating to g.s (cf. glaciala).
glacizo (fort.) glacis.
gladiatoro gladiator.
gladiolo (bot. genus) gladiolus.
glano(bot.) acorn; (anat.) glans; glanrekolto crop of acorns; penisglano extremity of penis, glans penis.
glando (anat.) gland; glandeto glandule.

glaso a drinking glass; glasedo de vino a glass(ful) of wine; glasshokar (kun ulu) to touch, or clink glasses as in drinking; (fig.) to hobnob. Def.: L'ordinara vazo, en qua on drinkas vino od aquo: II-645.
glata smooth, sleek; glatigar to s.; (fig.) to iron (clothes); glatigilo a smoothing instr., an iron (for ironing) (cf. repasar); Ant.: aspera.
glaukomo* (med.) glaucoma.
glaukonito (min.) glauconite.
glavo (also fig.) sword; -di yusteso: (fig.) the s. of justice. Def.: Espado tranchanta.
glebo clod, lump of earth.
glezar (tr.) to glaze, apply a vitreous coating to pottery. Def: Aplikar vitra strato sur ceramikajo; IV-579.
glicerio* (bot.) glyceria, panicularia, manna-grass (Glyceria).
glicerino glycerine.
glicino (bot) glycine; (chem.) glucina, oxide of glucinum.
glikokolo (chem.) glycocoll, amidoacetic acid, glycin.
glikoso (chem.) glucose.

glinar (tr.) to glean (ears of grain); (fig.) to gather (things thinly scattered). Ex.: Glinar la spiki pos la rekolto. Li studiabis ta epoko tante komplete, ke nun ni povas nur glinar poka fakti nova.
gliptar (tr.) to carve, engrave, grave (precious stones); gliptarto glyptography. Def.: Skultar medali e lapidi; IV-291.
gliro (zool.) dormouse (Myoxus glis).

glitar (intr.), glitigar (tr.): to glide, slide, slip, slur (over); gliteyo, glitvoyo a slide; glitiganta, glitiva slippery; glitnodo slip-knot, running knot, noose (cf. slingo); glitveturo sleigh, sledge, sled; glitflugar (aviation) to plane; -shuo: snow-shoe. Ex.: On glitas sur voyi kovrita per frosto-pluvo. Il sizis la kordo e glitis til la tero. La batelo glitas sur la kalma maro. La taso glitis de mea manuo. Glitigar sua manuo en la posho di ulu. Vua remonstri glitas de lua mento.
globo globe, orb, ball; okul globo eye-ball; globatra, globforma globular. V.exp.: vid. balono.
globulo (anat.) globule, corpuscle (of blood).
glorio glory; gloriachoza vainglorious; gloriizar to glorify; gloriizar su: (per o pri ulo) to g. in anything, pride oneself upon; sen gloria inglorious.
gloso (lexicol.) gloss, running commentary.
glosario glossary: partial dictionary explaining the harder words.
gloto (anat.) glottis.
gluo glue; gelatin gluo glue made from clippings of hoofs, hides, etc.; pasto gluo paste (made with flour and water); gluizar to put g. on, glue (ulo) (cf. gumizar).
gluglar (intr.) to gurgle (cf. gorgolar, klukar). Def.: Bruiso di liquido ekiranta botelo; IV-11.
glumo* (bot.) glume.

glutar (tr.) to swallow, gulp, gobble up (food, etc.); to quaff, swill (liquids); (fig.) to take in, to look at, with eagerness, avidity; glutajo a draught, a gulp; glutedo mouthful, gulp; glutema gluttonouse, greedy; englutado deglutination. Ex.: Glutar tasedo de kafeo, pinglo, ostro. (fig.) Il glutas el per la okuli.
gluteo (of persons): buttock, breech, bottom; gluteala gluteal; glutealo, gluteala muskulo gluteal muscle; glutee batar (tr.) to spank, flog (on the backsides). V.exp. vid. sedo.
gluteno (chem.) gluten.

glutinar (tr., intr.) to stick, fasten or be fastened by adhesion; adhere, paste, glue, agglutinate; (cf. adherar) kun glutinar du kozi to stick two things together; glutinar papero sur maro to paste paper on a wall; glutiniva, glutinema agglutinative, glutinous (cf. viskoza); glutinisto paster, sizer, paper-hanger, bill-sticker. (cf. gluizar, gumizar).
gneiso (min.) gneiss.
gnomo (myth.) gnome.
gnomiko* gnome, aphorism, brief maxim; gnomikala gnomical, sententious.
gnomono gnomon, index of a sun-dial.
gnomoniko* gnomonics, the art of dialling.
gnoso (theol., philos.) gnosis.
gnostika, gnostik(ul)o gnostic; gnostikismo Gnosticism.
gnuo (zool.) gnu (Catoblepas gnu).
gobio (ich.) gudgeon (Gobio).
godrono (arch. and ornamental) godroon, a kind of edge molding or fluting.
goeleto (nav.) schooner (two-masted).
golfo (geog.) gulf, a large bay; (game) golf; (cf. bayo).
golpo smut, blight (of grain) (Ustilago carbo). Def.: Fungo parazita dil frumento; VI-540
gonagro* (med.) gonagra, gout in the knee.

gondo door-, gate-, rudder-pintle; gondbendo pintle-brace, iron-work clamped on a door to sustain the pintle. V.exp.: Charniro kompozesas ek du metal peci ocilanta sur un axo komuna, e quan on skrubagas sur pordo, kesto, e.c. por apertar o klozar. Gondo esas axala fer-peco kudatra e pivotoza, sustenanta la gondobendo, sur qua rotacas la pordo, e.c.
gondolo (boat) gondola; (of air-ship) g. car; gondolisto gondolier. Def.: Vehilo suspendita ad aerostato (direktebla o ne); speco di batelo uzata en la laguni, aparte en Venezia (E. Venice); VI-26.
gonfalono* gonfalon, medieval banner.
goniometrio goniometry.
gonokoko (med.) gonococcus.
gonoreo (med.) gonorrhea.
Gordiala nodo Gordian knot.
gorgear (intr.) to chirp, twitter; gorgeetar to cheep, peep. Def.: La specala kanto di mikra uceli; VI-27.
gorgolar (intr.) to gurgle, to fall with a purling, splashing noise (as noise of brooks); to rattle, rumble (of water in stomach); cf. gluglar).
gorilo (zool.) gorilla.
gorjereto (surg.) gorget, a cutting instrument used in lithotomy.
goto (med.) gout; gotoza, gotika; gotoz(ul)o, gotiko gouty (person).
gotika Gothic (architecture, etc.).
grabar to engrave (lines), to etch; nigra graburo mezzotint; (cf. gliptar, xilografar). Def.: Trasar linei kava sur metal plako; VII-413. Ex.: On grabas figuro sur plako (per linei, per aquaforto).
graco (theol.) grace; per la graco di Deo by the g. of God.
gracila gracile, slender and graceful, svelte, lithe. Def.: Gracioze tenua ed alta; VI-569.

grado step (of stairs); degree (as of temperature); degree (in university); grade, rank (in order of dignity); step (in progress); size (of shoes, gloves, etc.); gradego tier, high step; gradizar to put steps into (ulo); to graduate (an instrument); (university) to confer a degree on (ulu); gradizo, graduro graduating, gradation, scale; gradoza, gradopa gradual: proceeding by steps or degrees; gradoze, gradope gradually; gradaro degrees, steps (collect.); gradizita graded, graduated; gradope by degrees; gradizito (university) graduate; universitatala grado university degree; me obtenis mea grado ye Oxford I graduated at Oxford.
grafika graphic; grafiko a graph; grafikarti g. arts (as opposed to plastic arts); (N.B. «a g. account» = pitoreska deskripto).
grafito (min.) graphite, plumbago.
grafologio graphology; grafologiisto handwriting expert (judge).
grafometro* graphometer.
gramo gram(me): 15.432 grains Troy .
gramatiko grammar.
gramino a gramineous plant; grass.

grano: eto any very small, hard mass; as, a grain of seed (cf. semino), of sand, of sugar, etc., kernel (of corn); the composite particles of any substance; rough exterior texture, as grain in leather, in metals, in wood; pellet; (bot.) granule; seminoala, seminoatra, seminooforma granular; semino(et)igar (tr.), semino(et)eskar (intr.) to granulate, to form or collect into grains or granules (N.B. not med. sense, cf. granuligar); seminoifar to produce grains; seminoizar to grain (leather), put a grain on (ulo); seminooza full of grains, seedy; seminoizita grained; seminovendisto seedsman, g. seller; seminoeyo granary; seminoifanta g. bearing; seminoachi refuse grains; kafe seminoo coffee-berry; lin seminoo linseed; seminoomanjanta, seminoo granivorous (animal; cf. granivora).
granario loft, attic (in country houses for grains, hay).
granato (min.) garnet; granatea g. colored.

granda a term of comparison denoting more magnitude than something else, or beyond what is usual; as great, large, big; also used fig. in the sense of the E. «grand» apart from material dimensions: granda vazo, domo a large vase, house; granda urbo a great city; granda bruiso, forteso a great noise, strength; granda festo a great holiday; granda duk(ul)o grand-duke; Alexandro la granda Alexander the Great; grandanma magnanimous, noble-minded; grandeveso longevity; grandeta biggish; grandulo a large man; a great man (in power, dignity), grandee (Spain); grande greatly, grandly; grandeso (quality) magnitude, largeness of bulk or dimensions, bigness, bulk; (fig.) high degree, grandness; grandajo a large object; grandeso di urbo extent of a city; greatness of a city; grandeso di krimino greatness of a crime; grandega enormous, immense, bulky; (plu) grandigar to enlarge, magnify, make big.
grandioza grandiose, imposing.
granita, granito (min.) granite.
granivora, granivoro granivorous (animal); cf. granomanjanta).

grantar (tr.) to grant, allow, concede, confer (demands, favors, privileges, etc.); to award (damages); granto, grantajo grant, concession, award. (cf. exaucar). Def.: Donar o koncesar ulo kom favoro, konseque ulo demandita o dezirata; II-709.
granulo (med.) granule (of a granulation, as from wounds, ulcers); granularo, granuligo, granulesko granulation; granulala, granuloza granular, granulated.
grapo cluster, bunch, a number of fruits or flowers growing along a common stalk.
grapino (nav.) grapnel, grappling-iron, -hook.
graso fat, grease; grasa, grasoza, grasatra fat, greasy, adipose; grasizar to grease (ulo); grasigar to fatten (ulu); grasmakulo grease spot. Ant.: (adj.) magra.
gratar (tr.) to scratch (so as to allay itching); (of animals) to claw; (of noise) to scrape, grate. (cf. skrachar).

gratifikar (tr.) to bestow (money) on; to tip (ulu per ulo); gratifikuro bounty, gratuity, tip. Def.: Donar pekuniala rekompenso exter la salario o preco debata; IV-12. Ex.: La rejo gratifikas il per pensiono. Ni donis drink-moneto a la garsono kom gratifikuro.

gratino (cook.) gratin, brown crust, burnt crumbs; gratinizar (tr.), gratinifar (intr.): to gratinate, to cook, as with a covering of buttered crumbs, until a crust or crisp surface forms; gratinizita gratinated, «au gratin.»
gratitudar (tr.) to be grateful, thankful to (ulu, pro, pri ulo); gratitudo gratitude. (cf. dankar).
gratuita gratuitous, free, gratis (cf. senpaga); gratuite gratis, for nothing. Def.: (adj.) recevata sen pago; (adv.) sen demander pago; II-75, III-322.
gratular (tr.) to congratulate, felicitate. Ex.: Gratular ulu pri lua vinko.

grava (phys.) heavy, ponderous; (fig.) weighty, momentous, not frivolous, grave, (cf. importanta, serioza); (mus.) low (note), deep (tone); (gram.) grave (accent); graveso gravity; (plu)gravigar to make (more) heavy, serious; gravigo, gravesko aggravation; graveskar to become weighed down, serious; mingravigar to make less heavy, serious; to extenuate, mitigate. V. exp.: Grava equivalas ne-frivola; serioza equivalas ne-vivaca, ne-gaya. On parolas pri grava afero, serioza mieno. Ant.: lejera.
gravelo (med.) gravel, stone in the kidneys or bladder; gravelika, graveliko (person) afflicted with g.
gravio gravel, small stones or pebbles intermixed with sand; graviatra gritty.
gravida pregnant, with child; gravideso pregnancy, gestation (state); gravidigar to make pregnant, get with child; gravideskar to become pregnant, conceive a child; gravideso (physiol.) conception.
gravitar (intr., phys. and fig.) to gravitate, be attracted, tend to a center; la lego di gravitado the law of gravitation.
greftar (tr., hort.) to graft (plants, trees); greftajo, grefturo, greftosproso graft, portion of a plant to be grafted on another.
Gregoriala Gregorian (calendar, chant, etc.).
Greka Greek, Grecian; la Greka the Greek language; GrekoLatina Greco-Latin.

grelar (intr., impersonal) to hail; greletar to sleet; grelas it hails; greleto sleet; grelo hail(-storm); greluno a hail-stone; grelfrapar, grelagar to devastate, ravage (ulo) by hail; stono grelo a hail of stones; flecho grelo a shower of arrows.
gremio lap (of a sitting person); (fig.) gremio di l'eklezio bosom, pale of the church; gremialo gremial, lap cloth worn by a bishop. Ex.: El tenis sua infanto sur sua gremio.
grenado (fruit) pomegranate; (milit.) (hand-) grenade; grenadiero p. tree (punica granatum); grenadisto a soldier who throws g.s; (fig.) grenadier: a foot soldier of a special corps.
greso (min.) sandstone.
greto grating, a partition of iron or wood bars; grate (of a stove), (metal or wood) railing or fence (used to partition off); gretizar to inclose or cover with railing, to rail in
grifono (myth.) griffon; griffon, a kind of European water-dog.
grilar (tr.) to grill, broil (ulo) on gridiron; grililo grill, gridiron; grilita kotleto broiled chop.
grilio (ent.) cricket (genus: Gryllus).
griliotalpo mole-cricket (Gryllotalpa).
grimar (tr., theat.) to make up (su), by painting wrinkles, etc., the appearance of an old person; to make up (ulu) as an old person.
grimasar, grimasadar to grimace, contort the face, make a wry face.
grincar (intr.) to gnash, grind (per la denti); to grate (as a door, etc.).

grindar (tr.) to grind, rough down as on a grindstone, or as with emery, etc.; grindopetro whetstone; grindopetrego grindstone. V. exp.: On ne nur akutigas o polisas kozi, ma on anke tornas (grindas) li per la grind opetr-(eg)o. Materii por la grindo esas karborundo*, smerilo, diamant-polvo, e.c.; III-82.
gripo (med.) grip(pe), influenza; gripika, gripiko (person) sick with g.
grogo grog.
grondar (intr.) to roar, rumble (of thunder, storm, wind, waves); to growl, snarl (of animals). Def.: Audigar bruiso duranta e nelauta, quale la tondro fora, od ula animali iraceskanta; IV-12.
gropo croup, rump (of a horse and some other animals); (arch.) hip-roof; groprimeno crupper (of harness).

grosa thick and long; (fig.) large, great, gross, thick, bulky; (cf. granda), grosa arboro a large tree; skribar grosa literi to write in large, heavy letters; grosa e kurta squat, dumpy, stubby. Def.: Relatas du dimensioni, specale en korpo di qua la longeso esas granda o nedefinita; III-544. Ex.: Grosa homo, filo, kordo, kolono. V. exp.: vid. dika. Ant.: tenua.
grosdekeduo gross, 12 dozen.

grosiera (of persons, acts or objects) without delicacy, coarse, rude, blunt, boorish, low; grosiereso grossness: coarseness; grosierajo coarse language or word; vulgarity, rude act; grosier(ul)o a rude man, a boor; grosiereg(ul)o blackguard. V. exp.: To ne esas simple ne- (o des-) polita, ma ne-edukita, preske ne-civilizita; IV-12.
groto grotto.
groteska grotesque (object, antic, dance, idea, etc.).
grozelo a gooseberry; grozeliero g. bush (Ribes grossularia).
gruo (orni, also astron.) crane (family: Gruidæ).
grucho crutch; gruchiero one who carries c.s; (fig.) a cripple; gruchirar to go on c.s.
gruelo grits, groats, oatmeal.
grumo groom, a manservant, esp. one in charge of horses.
grumelo grume, a clot (in the blood, in milk, etc.); grumeloizita, grumelooza clotted; grumeloigar (tr.), grumeloifar (intr.): to clot; (cf. koagular).
grunar, grunachar (intr.) to grunt (as a pig); (of persons) to grumble, growl.
grupo group (of persons or objects), clump (of trees), flock (of sheep); grupigar, grupe dispozar to group; grupifar (intr.) to group, form into g.s; grupano member of a g.
gruzo* (orni.) grouse, ptarmigan, white, black, red (Lagopus scoticus) M. XI. 348.
guachpiktado, guachuro gouache-painting; a style of water-color painting. DeFI
guano guano.
guardo (milit.) guard, body of troops; guardano soldier or member of g.

guatar (tr.) to watch, be on w. for; to lie in wait for; guatigar to place (ulu) on w.; guatanto, guatero, guatisto watcher, look-out-man; guatoturmeto w. tower. Ex.: Guatar l'enemiko, l'okaziono. La kato guatas la muso.
gubernio government (district; e.g., as in Russia); guberniestro governor (of a certain district, province).
gudro tar; gudrizar to t.; gudrotelo tarpaulin.
guelfa, guelfo (Ital. hist.) Guelph.
gufo eagle-owl (Strix bubo).

guidar (tr.) to guide, to lead, to conduct in a way; guidanto, guidero, guidisto (person) guide; guidilo (mechan.) guide; guidoflago (milit.) guidon; guidlibro g. book. V. exp.: Guidar esas esence montrar la justa voyo ad ulu, qua ne konocas ol, qua povas hezitar od erorar. Duktar e guidar esas direktar ulu od ulo akompanante lu: ex. Kapitano duktas sua kompanio, ma generalo nur direktas armeo, restante en sua quartero. On duktas o direktas navo, aer-navo, kande on esas «ye bordo» (en oli); ma per Hertzala radii on povas direktar torpedo sen duktar ol; IV-162.
guindo heart cherry. Def.: Frukto simila a cerizo; IV-136
gulo ghoul.
gumo gum, vegetable substance which exudes from certain trees; (cf. kauchuko); gumoza, gumatra gummy; gumizar to smear, cover with g.; gumarboro g. tree; gumrezino g. resin; gumtafto court plaster.
gumiguto gamboge; gumigutiero g. tree (Garcinia).
gumlako gum-lac, shellac.
gurdo gourd, calabash.
gurmo milk-scall, -crust, scabs on an infant’s head (crusta lactea).

gurmando gourmand, one fond of good living; gurmandacho glutton. Def.: Homo qua prizas la bona (bon-saporoza) dishi e manjas multo de li; VII-155. V. exp.: Manj-eg-ero (gurmandacho) esas homo qua manjas multo, sen dicerno, kun apetito brutal; gurmando preferas ne manjar kam manjar ulo qua ne plezas lu; gastronomo prizas la bona dishi, la bona vivi, e.c., tamen lu ne manjas o drinkas tro multo, lu esas nur «experto» pri la tablo; VII-155.

gurto broad strap, band; girth (of saddle); gurtizar, gurtligar, gurtagar (tr.) to strap, band, girth (a horse); gurtfrapar, gurtflogar to strike, flog with a strap. Def.: Bendo larja e plata (de ledro, tolo, e.c.) por ligar o kun-ligar. (To ne esas bendo, rimeno, nek zono); III-469.

gustar (tr.) to taste; (cf. saporar). –ala gustatory; gustexperto expert taster (as of tea), connoisseur (of wines, etc.); bona –o a nice t. (used also in psychological sense); gustagreabla, gust ecitanta relishing, tempting, savory; malgusta joko a bad joke, a vulgar joke; gustar la vino to t. the wine, il esas autoro sen bona –o (fig.) he is an author deficient in t.; kontentigar omna gusti (physiol. and psychol.) to satisfy (please) all tastes.
guto drop (of liquid); gutifar to drop, drip, trickle, run down; gutope d. by d.
gutaperko gutta-percha.

guturo (internal) throat, gullet; (cf. fauco); guturala relating to the gullet; gutteral; guturalo (gram.) a gutteral. Def.: L’interna kavajo supre en la kolo (ciencale: la faringo, la laringo e la supra ezofago): ex. on parolas pri soni guturala (ciencale, li esas velala od uvulala); III-165

guvernar (tr. general sense) to rule with authority, to have physical power over, to direct: guvernar navo to steer a ship; to rule over a ship; guvernilo (tech.) governor; a rudder, helm; guvernar aferi to manage a business; guvernar sua pasioni to control one’s passions; ca muliero –as sua spozo this woman rules her husband; guvernar infanti to manage children; la rejo di Anglia regnas ma ne –as; la parlamento –as the king of England reigns but does not govern; the parliament governs; la verbo aktiva –as l’akuzativo; the active verb governs the accusative; la navo guvernesas bone the ship answers her helm; guvernala sistemo governmental system; la –isto di provinco, di banco the governor of a province, of a bank; guvernanto, guvernisto di navo helmsman of a ship; guvernantino, guvernistino di puero governess of a child; la guvernado
guyavo (bot.) guava (fruit); guyaviero g. tree (Psidium Guayaba).
ha! (interj.) ha! ah!

habila (physical, intellectual) able, clever, skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy; habila horlogifisto a clever clock-maker; il esas habila en sua arto he is clever in his art; habila fripono a sharp rogue. V. exp.: On povas divenar "habila" ne nur per studiado ma per aktual experienco; on povas divenar kapabla per lernado sen praktike aplikar sua savado. Ant.: nehabila, neapta.

habilitar (tr.; esp. juris.) to habilitate, to qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.

habitar (tr., intr.) to inhabit, to live (in) (permanently); (cf. rezidar); habit(ad)o habitation, residing; habiteyo (place) habitation, abode, dwelling-place; (zool.) haunt, habitat; habitanto, habitero inhabitant, denizen; habitebla (in)habitable. V. exp.: Habitar esas rezidar permanante en propra o fixa domo; lojar esas rezidar tempe (kurte) che altra persono od en gasteyo. La soldati lojas che la habitanti dil urbo. On habitas urbo, lando, dum ke on lojas en hotelo, che amiko, parento, en apartamento, en chambro, e.c.; I-410.
habitaklo (nav.) binnacle, compass-box.

hachar (tr.) to hatch, shade by lines cut or drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts; hachajo, hachita karno mince-meat; hachuro hatching; hachilo (cook.) chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.
hagiografo hagiographer.
hagiografio hagiography.

hakar (tr.) to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. hachar); hakachar to hack; hak(ad)o, hakuro chopping,hewing; a chop, cut; hakisto chopper, hewer; hakilo a chopping instr. (as an axe); hakileto a small cutting instr.; hatchet; hakilostroko stroke of an axe; hakiluyo axe-holder, -case; hakokultelo cleaver, chopping-knife.

halo a large room of considerable size; (merkato) market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is carried on; halvendisto market-, stall-keeper; halotaxo market-dues; linguo di la hali (fig.) Billingsgate (language).
halbardo halbard.
halofito* (bot.) halophyte.
halogeno* (chem.) halogen.
halono* halo (as around moon, head, etc.).
haltar (intr.) to (make a) halt, stop; haltigar to cause (ulu) to halt; to stop (ulo); haltigilo a stopping instr., a catch; haltez (command.) halt! stop there! that will do!
haltero dumb-bell; halteragar, exercar su per halteri to do d. b. exercises.
halucinar (intr.) to have hallucinations, to delude (su); halucinigar to cause h.s in (ulu); to affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.
haluxo* hallux, great toe of foot.
hamadriado* (myth.) hamadryad, woodnymph.
hamako hammock.
hamstro (zool.) hamaster (Cricetus).
hano a fowl, hen or cock; (fusil) cock (of a gun or pistol); hanulo cock, rooster (cf. pultro); hanino hen; hanyuno pullet; hanyuneto chicken; hanulokresto comb of a cock.
hanolakto mulled-egg, egg-flip. Def.: Drinkajo ek vitelo quirlita en varma aquo sukrizita; V-621.
hancho hip (of persons), haunch, hind-quarter (of animals); hanchoflexar to bend at the hips.
handikapar (tr., in sports and fig.) to handicap.
hangaro shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; (aviation) hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.
hanso Hanse-town; hansala Hanseatic.

haro a hair (of a person's head; cf. pilo); hararo hair (collect.); haroza hairy; hartreso hair-plait, pigtail, queue; haropelo scalp; hararacho mop, shock of hair; hardikeso a hair's breadth; longhara; long haired.

harda (also fig.) hard, tough, indurate; hardigar to harden (ulu, ulo); to temper (iron, etc.); (fig.) to indurate, toughen, inure; hardiguro temper (of metals); hardeso hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita. Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio (fig.). Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: mola.
haremo harem; haremanino woman of h.
haringo (ich.) herring; haringo fumizita smoked h.; haringobando shoal of h.
harmoniar (intr., lit. and fig.) to be in harmony (kun); harmoniigar to harmonize (ulo); harmoniala, harmonialo harmonic (sound).
harmonika* (math.) harmonic(al) (proportion, division).
harmoniko (mus. instr.) harmonica.
harmoniumo (mus. instr.) harmonium.
harneso harness (as of a horse); harnesizar to harness; harnesaro (horse-) trappings, sen harnesigar to unharness.
harpo (mus. instr.) harp.
harpio (myth.) harpy.
harpuno harpoon; harpunagar (tr.) to. h.
hashisho hashish.

hastar (intr.) to hasten, make haste; hastigar to hurry (ulu, ulo, su); to press, push forward expedite; (cf. acelerar, plurapidigar, avancar); hastozege precipitously. Ex.: hastigar la pazo, la progreso di ulo. Il departis hastoze. Il ekiris, ma sen hasto.

hauo (agri.) hoe; hauagar (tr.) to h.; haueto, plata hauo mattock. Def.: Instrumento fera kun ligna mancho, por exkavar la tero; la fera parto esas larja, plata e tranchanta, kun aristo en plano perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.

haular (tr., nav.) to haul, heave in (cf. tirar); to tow; haulvoyo tow-path; haular la kanoto ye bordo haul the boat on board; haular sur kord(eg)o to haul, pull upon a rope; haular navo to tow a ship; haular kord(eg)o ad su, ad ulu to haul in a rope.
havar (tr.) to have (ulo money, occasion, motive, time, etc.; N.B. not to be used as verbal auxiliary); havajo, havi property, possessions, what one is worth.

hazardo (hap-)hazard, luck, chance, something uncertain and unplanned; hazarde by chance, casually, accidentally, perchance; hazardala accidental, fortuitous; hazardoludo game of chance; hazarde trovar to find or meet unexpectedly; ye la hazardo di la menuo pot-luck; ne fidez a hazardo do not trust to chance; se vu hazarde trovos il bonhumora if perchance you find him in good humour.
he! (interj.) hey! eh!
(la) Hebrea (linguo): the Hebrew (language); a, ala Hebrew, Hebraic; ismo, ajo Hebraism; isto Hebraist; (cf. Izraelido, Judo).
hedero (bot.) ivy (Hedera).
hederaceo* (bot.) ground-ivy (Glechoma hederacea).
hefo yeast, leaven.
hego hedge, hedgerow. Def.: Barilo o klozilo (cirkum agro) formacita ek arbusti; IV-204.
hegrozo (bot.) dog-rose (Rosa canina); hegiero sweet-brier, eglantine.
hejiro hegira (Mohammedan).
hekatombo (lit. and fig.) hecatomb.
hektaro hectare, 2.47 acres.
hektika (med.) hectic.
hektografar (tr.) to hectograph, to mimeograph.
hektogramo hectogram: 3.527 oz., avdp.
hektolitro hectoliter: 22.01 imperial galls; 26.417 U.S. galls.
hektometro hectometer: about 328 ft.
heleboro (bot.) hellebore (genus: Helleborus); heleboro verda, fetida, nigra green, stinking, black (species of) h.
Helena*, Helenala Hellenic; Helenismo, Helenajo Hellenism; Helenisto Hellenist.
helio* (chem.) helium.
helianto (bot.) helianthus, sun-flower (genus: Helianthus).
helico (arch., geom.) helix; (of a ship) propeller; (bot.) tendril; heliconavo screw-ship; helicatra helicoid, winding, spiral; (cf. helicoida); helicoresorto spiral spring, coiled spring.
helicoida* helicoid, spiral (cf. helicatra).
heliko snail (family: Helicidæ).
helikoptero (aeron.) helicopter.
heliocentrala* heliocentric.
heliograbar (tr., photo, engr.) to make heliogravures.
heliometro* (astr. instr.) heliometer.
helioskopo (astr. instr.) helioscope.
heliostato* heliostat.
heliotropo (bot.) heliotrope (genus: Heliotropium).
helixo (anat.) helix.
"heiler" (pl. "heiler"i): heller, Austrian coin; 0.2 cent.
helmo (ancient) helmet. Def.: Specala formo di kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.

helpar (tr.) to help, aid, assist (ulu, pri, por, ulo); helpo help, assistance (cf. sokursar); helpanto, helpero, helpisto assistant, helper; (in composition) assistant-, under-; (on ships) mate; aide; helpokirurgiisto assistant surgeon; helpilo, helpivo (instrument, object which aids) aid, help, relief, assistance, auxiliary; helpoverbo auxiliary verb; helpar ulu levar su (staceskar) to help someone to lift himself (to rise); kun la helpo di Deo with the help of God.

hemo home; esar heme to be at home; hemodei lares, home-gods; hemrestema persono domesticated, home-loving person; hemfacita, hembakita home-made, -baked. V. exp.: La hemo povas esar ne kompleta domo, ma apartamento mikra e mem nur un chambro; lo esencala esas, ke on sentas ke ol esas personala "eseyo" (rezideyo), tote diferanta de chambri di hotelo o di lojeyo; I-411.
hematito (min.) hematite, bloodstone.
hemerokalo (bot.) day-lily (genus: Hemerocallis).
hemiopa* (med.) hemianoptic; hemiopeso hemianopsia, hemiopsy.
hemiplegio* (med.) hemiplegia.
hemiptero (ent.) hemipter.
hemistiko (verse) hemistich.
hemoglobino* hemglobin, haemoglobin.
hemoptizio* (med.) haemoptysis, blood expectoration.
hemoragio* (med.) hemorrhage.
hemoroido, hemoroidi (med.) hemorrhoid(s), pile(s).
hepato (anat.) liver; hepatala hepatic; pasteto de grasa hepati pate de foie gras, potted goose livers.
hepatiko (bot.) liverleaf, hepatica (Hepatica).
hepatito* (med.) hepatitis, inflammation of the liver; (min.) hepatite, liver stone.
heptaedro* (geom.) heptahedron.
heptagono* (geom.) heptagon.
heraldo herald.

herbo herb, a plant which does not have a woody stem (cf. herboro); herbaji herbage; (fig.) grass (cf. gazono); herbala, herbatra, herboza herbaceous, herby, grassy; herbostipeto a blade of grass; mala herbo weed.
herbario herbarium, classified collection of dried plants.
herbivora, herbivoro herbivorous (animal). Def.: Herbo-manj-anta, -anto.
herboro (medicinal) herb; herboristo herbalist. Def.: Medicinala planto sikigita o preparita (en la formo en qua ol vendesas da herboristo); VI-213.
herdo hearth, fireplace, hearthstone; floor or bottom of an oven.

heredar (tr.) to inherit, be the heir to (ulo, de ulu); heredo (act) inheriting; heredajo heritage (estate), inheritance, heirloom, legacy; heredanto, heredinto inheritor; heir; heredala, heredita hereditary; sen heredanteso escheat (cf. reversionar). Ex.: Heredar havajo de gepatri; Lua sola heredajo esis nobla nomo.
herezio heresy; hereziano heretic; hereziala, hereziana heretical.

herisar (tr.) to bristle (up) (of hair, feathers, etc.); heriso bristling; (med.) horripilation; herisita bristled, bristly; (fig.) hirsute, prickly; herisigar la hari to make one's hair stand on end.
herisono (zool.) hedgehog (genus: Erinaceus).
Herkulo (pr. and fig.) Hercules; Herkulala, Herkulatra Herculean.
hermafrodita, hermafrodito hermaphrodite.
hermetika hermetic(al).
hernio (surg.) hernia.
hero(ul)o hero; heroajo act of heroism; herokomika mock-heroic.
herono (orni.) heron (Ardea).
heronfonteno Hero's fountain.
herpeto (med.) herpes, tetter, shingles.
herso (agri.) harrow; (fort.) portcullis (set with spikes); hersagar (tr.) to h.
heterodoxa heterodox. Ant.: ortodoxa.
heterogena heterogeneous.
heterosexuala heterosexual.
hexaedro (geom.) hexahedron.
hexagono* (geom.) hexagon.
hexagramo (geom.) hexagram.
hexametro (verse) hexameter.

hezitar (intr.) to hesitate, falter, be doubtful; hezitigar to cause (ulu) to h.; hezitanta, hezitema hesitant, irresolute, faltering. Ex.: Il hezitas inter deziro e shamo. Hezitar avan danjero. Karaktero hezitema. Hezitanta voco, respondo.
hiacinto (bot., min.) hyacinth.
hiato (gram. and fig.) hiatus.

hibrida, hibrido hybrid, mongrel (cf. mestica, mulata); hibridifar to produce h. offspring; hibridigo hybridization. Def.: Animali e planti qui venas de mixo di du speci; V-33. Ex.: Mulo esas hibrido de kavalino ed asnulo.
hido* (chem. nomenclature) hydrogen (cf. hidrogeno); hidoperoxo hydrogendioxide, peroxide.
"hidalgo" hidalgo: Spanish nobleman of lower class.
hidro (myth., astron.) Hydra; (zool.) hydrophis, a genus of fresh water polyps.
hidrato* (chem.) hydrate.
hidrauliko hydraulics.
hidrocefaleso (med.) hydrocephalus, water on the brain; hidrocefalo (person) afflicted with h.
hidrodinamiko hydrodynamics.
hidrofobio (med.) hydrophobia.
hidrogeno (cheem., common term) hydrogen (cf. hido).
hidrografo hydrographer.
hidrografio hydrography.
hidrolizo (chem.) hydrolysis.
hidrologio hydrology.
hidromancio hydromancy.
hidromekaniko* hydromechanics.
hidrometro hydrometer.
hidrometrio hydrometry.
hidropatio hydropathy.
hidropso (med.) dropsy; hidropsika, hidropsiko dropsical (person).
hidroquinono* (chem.) hydroquinone.
hidroskopo bletonist, finder of springs.
hidroskopio bletonism, art of finding under-water sources.
hidrostatiko hydrostatics.
hidroterapio hydrotherapeutics.
hieno (zool.) hyena; hieno strioza striped h. (Hyaena striata).
hiere (adv.) yesterday; hiera of y.; hiere matine yesterday (in the) morning; la hiera dio yesterday; prehiere (on the) day before yesterday; sep dii pos hiere in a week.
hierarkio hierarchy.
hieratika hieratic (writing, etc.).
hieroglifo hieroglyph.
"high life"* high life, life among the aristocracy or the rich.
higieno hygiene. V. exp.: vid. salubra.
higrometro hygrometer.
higrometrio hygrometry.
higroskopo hygroscope.

hike here, in this place; hika, hikala here, this; hike ube here where; ad exter hike! out of here! away with you! for hike far distant from here; tra hike through here, this way; venez adhike come here, hither; til hike (un)to here; hike apude near here; hike interne here within.
hilo (bot.) hilum, hile.
hiloto (Spartan) helot.
himeno* (anat., bot.) hymen.
himeneo* hymeneal, a marriage song.
himenoptera, himenoptero (entom.) hymenopter(al).
himno hymn; himnaro, himnolibro hymnal, h. book.
hioido* (anat.) hyoid (bone).
hipar (intr.) to have the hiccoughs, to hiccup.
hipalago (gram., rhet.) hypallage.
hiperbato (gram.) hyperbaton. Def.: Figuro di retoriko konsistanta en renverso di l'ordino dil vorti; VI-135.
hiperbolo (rhet.) hyperbole; (math.) hyperbola.
hiperboloido* (geom.) hyperboloid.
hiperboreo a Hyperborean.
hipermetropa* hypermetropic; far sighted; hipermetropeso hypermetropia.
hipertrofiar (tr.) to cause hypertrophy to; to develop to an unusual or abnormal degree; hipertrofio, hipertrofieso hypertrophy. Ant.: atrofiar.
hipnotar (intr.) to be in a hypnotic state; hipnoto (state) hypnosis; hipnotigar to hypnotize (ulu); hipnotigo hypnotization; hipnotismo hypnotism (doctrine); hipnotigato person hypnotized.
hipocikloido* (geom.) hypocycloid.
hipodromo hippodrome.
hipofizo* (anat.) hypophysis, pituitary gland.
hipogastro* (anat.) hypogastrium.
hipogeo (anc. arch.) hypogeum.
hipogrifo (myth.) hippogriff, winged horse.
hipokampo (ich. genus) hippocampus.
hipokondro (anat.) hypochondrium.
hipokondrio (med.) hypochondria; hipokondriika, hipokondriiko hypochondriac.
hipokrita hypocritical; hipokrit(ul)o hypocrite, dissembler; hipokriteso hypocrisy; hipokritajo act of h., imposture; hipokritesar to be a h.; hipokritagar to act the h.; (dolce) to wheedle.
hipopotamo (zool.) hippopotamus.
hipostazo (theol.) hypostasis.
hipoteko mortgage, hypothec; hipotekizar to m. (ulo), to hypothecate.
hipotenuzo (geom.) hypotenuse.
hipotezo hypothesis.
hipsometro* hypsometer.
hipsometrio hypsometry, measurement of heights.
hirundo (orni.) swallow (family: Hirundinidæ'); hirundokaudatra swallow-tailed; (carp.) dove-tailed.
hisar (tr., nav.) to hoist, raise, haul up (sails), to run up (a signal, a flag); hisar su (fig.) to raise oneself, hoist oneself, get up.
hiskiamo (bot.) henbane (genus: Hyoscyamus).
hisopo (bot.) hyssop.
Hispanala Hispanic.
histerio (med.) hysteria, hysterics; histeriika, histeriiko hysteric (person).
histerotomio* (surg.) dissection of the womb; Caesarian operation.
histologio histology.
historio history; historiisto, historiero historian; pre historiala immemorial.
historiografo* historiographer: official historian of a prince or state.
histriono (antiq.) histrion, stage player.
hivernar (intr. of animals and persons) to hibernate, to winter (cf. estivar); (milit.) to go into winter quarters.
ho! Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there! holla! (nav.) ahoy; ho! ho! heyday! dear me! bless my soul! ho la rejino desfortunoza! oh, unfortunate queen!
hoboyo (mus., instr.) hautboy, oboe.
hodometro (vehicle) hodometer, speedometer; (for persons) pedometer; (pazokontilo). Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la disti paririta da (1) rotvehilo, (2) marchanto.
hoko hook; hokoza, hokatra curved, crooked, hooked, bent; portohoko porter's h., cargo-handler's h.; labiobarbo hokoza curling mustache; hoke forsar (tr.) to pick (a lock).
hokoido* (anat.) unciform (bone).
holdo (nav.) hold (of a ship).
hola* holla! hallo!
holografa holographic: holografa testamento will written in testators own hand.
holokausto (also fig.) holocaust, burnt offering. Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79
holoturio (zool.) holothurian: a kind of water polyp (genus: Holothuria), trepang, beche de mer.

homo (species, inclusive of both sexes) man, a human being, person; homi people, men and women; homaro mankind, humanity (collect.); homulo a male (cf. viro, maskulo); homino woman (cf. muliero); homa, homala human; homeso humanity, quality or condition of being human (cf. humaneso); homale humanely (possible, etc.); homigar to humanize, to make human; homachulo a sorry fellow, wretch, a nobody; homocidar to murder; hominodianto misogynist.
homardo lobster (genus: Homarus).
homeopatio homeopathy; homeopatiisto homeopathist.
homeosexuala (med.) homosexual.
Homerala, Homeratra (rido, e.c.): Homeric.
homilio homily, sermon (cf. prediko).
homogena homogeneous; homogeneso homogeneity.
homologa (geom., biol., chem.) homologous.
homonima homonymous.
honesta honest, fair and straightforward in conduct, thought, etc., free from deceit or fraud, upright, worthy; honesteso honesty, probity, integrity, uprightness.

honoro honor; honorala honorary (guard, etc.); honorinda worthy of h.; honoroza honorable, full of h.; honorizanta, honoriva honorary, honorific; honorizar to h., pay h. to (ulu, per ulo); honorizar su to do oneself the h., esteem it an h., take pride in; honorpromiso, honorparolo, honorjuro word of h.; (milit.) parole; honorlegiono Legion of Honor; honorkazo, honorskrupulo a point of honor; honorafero an affair of h.; honormenciono honorable mention; honorumala honorary: intended merely to confer h.; possessing a title or place without performing the duties of the position, IV-163; as honorumala profesoro honorary (titular) professor; senhonorigar to dishonor, deprive of h.
hop! hop! jump! go!
hoplito (antiq.) hoplite.
Hori (Gr. rel.) Horæ, the three goddesses of the seasons.
hordo horde, a nomadic group; (fig.) crowd, band, pack.
hordeo (bot.) barley (Hordeum); hordegrano a grain of b.; (fig., med.) stye; hordesukro b. sugar.
horizonto (also fig.) horizon; horizontala horizontal; horizontalo (geom.) horizontal line.
horlojo clock, time-piece; horlojala horologic; horlojeto, poshhorlojo a watch; (ri) tensar horlojo to wind the c.; kontrehorloje backwards (on a dial); against the clock.
hornblendo (min.) hornblende, amphibole.
horniso (ent.) hornet (Vespa crabro).

hororar (intr.) to feel dread mixed with detestation, to abhor, detest, loath, dread, have a horror of (pri, pro, ulu, ulo); hororigar to horrify, cause aversion to; hororinda horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.
horoskopo horoscope; facar la horoskopo to cast a person's nativity.
hortensio (bot.) hydrangea (Hydrangea Hortensia).

hospico asylum, convalescent hospital, refuge (for the infirm, poor, aged, etc.); (as in the Alps) hospice, inn for travelers (kept by religious order). V. exp.: En hospitalo on kuracas maladi; en hospico on mantenas (longe, o mem por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado konvalecanta povas ekirar hospitalo por enirar hospico; IV-136.
hospitalo hospital (cf. ambulanco). V. exp. vid. hospico.
hosto host, one who receives or entertains a guest.
hostio (C. rel.) host, consecrated wafer.
hotelo hotel (cf. albergo); hotelmastro hotel-manager, -owner.
"hozana" hosanna.

huo (orni.) owl, particularly the white owl (Athene noctua); hueto owlet; tawny owl, brown owl (Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco); huo nivea snowy owl (Nyctea nivea); paserhuo little owl (Glaucidium passerinum); sparvierhuo hawk owl (Surnia ulula). (cf. IV-296).
hufo hoof; hufforjisto farrier; hufoza, hufozo hoofed, ungulate.
hugenoto Huguenot.
hum! hem! hum!

humana humane, kind, compassionate, merciful; human(ul)o a h. person, humanitarian; humaneso humaneness, humanity; humanisto humanist, a student of the humanities; humanala, humanema humanitarian; humanismo humanism; humane humanely; humanigar to humanize, render humane (cf. homigar).
humero (anat.) humerus.
humida humid, wet, damp, moist; humideso (condition) humidity; humidajo (object) the damp; humidigar to damp, moisten, wet.
