humila humble, meek, lowly; humiligar to humble, humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta; III-226. V. exp. vid. diskreta. Ant.: superba.

humoro (bona, mala) humor, temper, mood, disposition; (old physiol.) one of the four bodily fluids determining the temperament; nekonkordo di humori incompatibility of temper(s); havar dolca humoro to have a sweet temper; esar en humoro laborar to be in a working h. V. Exp.: Humoro signifikas propre e primitive la liquidi di l'organismo, qui pleis tanta rolo en l'antiqua medicino; konseque e metafore la (bona o mala) mentala stando o tendenco (instantala, per qua ol distingesas de karaktero). Humuro esas speco di esprito, di ironio, qua expresas su en konversado ed en la rakonti; III-416.
humuro humor, humour, jocose imagination (less intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. humoro.
humuso humus, vegetable mould.
hundo, hundulo, hundino dog; hundala canine; hundyunaro litter of pups; parturar hundyuni to whelp, to pup.
hundoherbo dog-grass, couch-grass (Triticum repens).

hungrar, hungreskar (intr.) to be hungry (cf. apetitar); (fig.) to be eager, greedy; hungroza hungry; hungregoza famished; hungrigar to make hungry, cause hunger; hungregigar to starve (ulu); hungranta la glorio greedy or eager of glory.
hura! hurrah! hurray! hurao a hurrah, huzza.
hurdo hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be leaped.
husaro (milit.) hussar.
ha! (interj.) ha! ah!

habila (physical, intellectual) able, clever, skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy; habila horlogifisto a clever clock-maker; il esas habila en sua arto he is clever in his art; habila fripono a sharp rogue. V. exp.: On povas divenar "habila" ne nur per studiado ma per aktual experienco; on povas divenar kapabla per lernado sen praktike aplikar sua savado. Ant.: nehabila, neapta.

habilitar (tr.; esp. juris.) to habilitate, to qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.

habitar (tr., intr.) to inhabit, to live (in) (permanently); (cf. rezidar); habit(ad)o habitation, residing; habiteyo (place) habitation, abode, dwelling-place; (zool.) haunt, habitat; habitanto, habitero inhabitant, denizen; habitebla (in)habitable. V. exp.: Habitar esas rezidar permanante en propra o fixa domo; lojar esas rezidar tempe (kurte) che altra persono od en gasteyo. La soldati lojas che la habitanti dil urbo. On habitas urbo, lando, dum ke on lojas en hotelo, che amiko, parento, en apartamento, en chambro, e.c.; I-410.
habitaklo (nav.) binnacle, compass-box.

hachar (tr.) to hatch, shade by lines cut or drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts; hachajo, hachita karno mince-meat; hachuro hatching; hachilo (cook.) chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.
hagiografo hagiographer.
hagiografio hagiography.

hakar (tr.) to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. hachar); hakachar to hack; hak(ad)o, hakuro chopping,hewing; a chop, cut; hakisto chopper, hewer; hakilo a chopping instr. (as an axe); hakileto a small cutting instr.; hatchet; hakilostroko stroke of an axe; hakiluyo axe-holder, -case; hakokultelo cleaver, chopping-knife.

halo a large room of considerable size; (merkato) market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is carried on; halvendisto market-, stall-keeper; halotaxo market-dues; linguo di la hali (fig.) Billingsgate (language).
halbardo halbard.
halofito* (bot.) halophyte.
halogeno* (chem.) halogen.
halono* halo (as around moon, head, etc.).
haltar (intr.) to (make a) halt, stop; haltigar to cause (ulu) to halt; to stop (ulo); haltigilo a stopping instr., a catch; haltez (command.) halt! stop there! that will do!
haltero dumb-bell; halteragar, exercar su per halteri to do d. b. exercises.
halucinar (intr.) to have hallucinations, to delude (su); halucinigar to cause h.s in (ulu); to affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.
haluxo* hallux, great toe of foot.
hamadriado* (myth.) hamadryad, woodnymph.
hamako hammock.
hamstro (zool.) hamaster (Cricetus).
hano a fowl, hen or cock; (fusil) cock (of a gun or pistol); hanulo cock, rooster (cf. pultro); hanino hen; hanyuno pullet; hanyuneto chicken; hanulokresto comb of a cock.
hanolakto mulled-egg, egg-flip. Def.: Drinkajo ek vitelo quirlita en varma aquo sukrizita; V-621.
hancho hip (of persons), haunch, hind-quarter (of animals); hanchoflexar to bend at the hips.
handikapar (tr., in sports and fig.) to handicap.
hangaro shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; (aviation) hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.
hanso Hanse-town; hansala Hanseatic.

haro a hair (of a person's head; cf. pilo); hararo hair (collect.); haroza hairy; hartreso hair-plait, pigtail, queue; haropelo scalp; hararacho mop, shock of hair; hardikeso a hair's breadth; longhara; long haired.

harda (also fig.) hard, tough, indurate; hardigar to harden (ulu, ulo); to temper (iron, etc.); (fig.) to indurate, toughen, inure; hardiguro temper (of metals); hardeso hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita. Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio (fig.). Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: mola.
haremo harem; haremanino woman of h.
haringo (ich.) herring; haringo fumizita smoked h.; haringobando shoal of h.
harmoniar (intr., lit. and fig.) to be in harmony (kun); harmoniigar to harmonize (ulo); harmoniala, harmonialo harmonic (sound).
harmonika* (math.) harmonic(al) (proportion, division).
harmoniko (mus. instr.) harmonica.
harmoniumo (mus. instr.) harmonium.
harneso harness (as of a horse); harnesizar to harness; harnesaro (horse-) trappings, sen harnesigar to unharness.
harpo (mus. instr.) harp.
harpio (myth.) harpy.
harpuno harpoon; harpunagar (tr.) to. h.
hashisho hashish.

hastar (intr.) to hasten, make haste; hastigar to hurry (ulu, ulo, su); to press, push forward expedite; (cf. acelerar, plurapidigar, avancar); hastozege precipitously. Ex.: hastigar la pazo, la progreso di ulo. Il departis hastoze. Il ekiris, ma sen hasto.

hauo (agri.) hoe; hauagar (tr.) to h.; haueto, plata hauo mattock. Def.: Instrumento fera kun ligna mancho, por exkavar la tero; la fera parto esas larja, plata e tranchanta, kun aristo en plano perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.

haular (tr., nav.) to haul, heave in (cf. tirar); to tow; haulvoyo tow-path; haular la kanoto ye bordo haul the boat on board; haular sur kord(eg)o to haul, pull upon a rope; haular navo to tow a ship; haular kord(eg)o ad su, ad ulu to haul in a rope.
havar (tr.) to have (ulo money, occasion, motive, time, etc.; N.B. not to be used as verbal auxiliary); havajo, havi property, possessions, what one is worth.

hazardo (hap-)hazard, luck, chance, something uncertain and unplanned; hazarde by chance, casually, accidentally, perchance; hazardala accidental, fortuitous; hazardoludo game of chance; hazarde trovar to find or meet unexpectedly; ye la hazardo di la menuo pot-luck; ne fidez a hazardo do not trust to chance; se vu hazarde trovos il bonhumora if perchance you find him in good humour.
he! (interj.) hey! eh!
(la) Hebrea (linguo): the Hebrew (language); a, ala Hebrew, Hebraic; ismo, ajo Hebraism; isto Hebraist; (cf. Izraelido, Judo).
hedero (bot.) ivy (Hedera).
hederaceo* (bot.) ground-ivy (Glechoma hederacea).
hefo yeast, leaven.
hego hedge, hedgerow. Def.: Barilo o klozilo (cirkum agro) formacita ek arbusti; IV-204.
hegrozo (bot.) dog-rose (Rosa canina); hegiero sweet-brier, eglantine.
hejiro hegira (Mohammedan).
hekatombo (lit. and fig.) hecatomb.
hektaro hectare, 2.47 acres.
hektika (med.) hectic.
hektografar (tr.) to hectograph, to mimeograph.
hektogramo hectogram: 3.527 oz., avdp.
hektolitro hectoliter: 22.01 imperial galls; 26.417 U.S. galls.
hektometro hectometer: about 328 ft.
heleboro (bot.) hellebore (genus: Helleborus); heleboro verda, fetida, nigra green, stinking, black (species of) h.
Helena*, Helenala Hellenic; Helenismo, Helenajo Hellenism; Helenisto Hellenist.
helio* (chem.) helium.
helianto (bot.) helianthus, sun-flower (genus: Helianthus).
helico (arch., geom.) helix; (of a ship) propeller; (bot.) tendril; heliconavo screw-ship; helicatra helicoid, winding, spiral; (cf. helicoida); helicoresorto spiral spring, coiled spring.
helicoida* helicoid, spiral (cf. helicatra).
heliko snail (family: Helicidæ).
helikoptero (aeron.) helicopter.
heliocentrala* heliocentric.
heliograbar (tr., photo, engr.) to make heliogravures.
heliometro* (astr. instr.) heliometer.
helioskopo (astr. instr.) helioscope.
heliostato* heliostat.
heliotropo (bot.) heliotrope (genus: Heliotropium).
helixo (anat.) helix.
"heiler" (pl. "heiler"i): heller, Austrian coin; 0.2 cent.
helmo (ancient) helmet. Def.: Specala formo di kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.

helpar (tr.) to help, aid, assist (ulu, pri, por, ulo); helpo help, assistance (cf. sokursar); helpanto, helpero, helpisto assistant, helper; (in composition) assistant-, under-; (on ships) mate; aide; helpokirurgiisto assistant surgeon; helpilo, helpivo (instrument, object which aids) aid, help, relief, assistance, auxiliary; helpoverbo auxiliary verb; helpar ulu levar su (staceskar) to help someone to lift himself (to rise); kun la helpo di Deo with the help of God.

hemo home; esar heme to be at home; hemodei lares, home-gods; hemrestema persono domesticated, home-loving person; hemfacita, hembakita home-made, -baked. V. exp.: La hemo povas esar ne kompleta domo, ma apartamento mikra e mem nur un chambro; lo esencala esas, ke on sentas ke ol esas personala "eseyo" (rezideyo), tote diferanta de chambri di hotelo o di lojeyo; I-411.
hematito (min.) hematite, bloodstone.
hemerokalo (bot.) day-lily (genus: Hemerocallis).
hemiopa* (med.) hemianoptic; hemiopeso hemianopsia, hemiopsy.
hemiplegio* (med.) hemiplegia.
hemiptero (ent.) hemipter.
hemistiko (verse) hemistich.
hemoglobino* hemglobin, haemoglobin.
hemoptizio* (med.) haemoptysis, blood expectoration.
hemoragio* (med.) hemorrhage.
hemoroido, hemoroidi (med.) hemorrhoid(s), pile(s).
hepato (anat.) liver; hepatala hepatic; pasteto de grasa hepati pate de foie gras, potted goose livers.
hepatiko (bot.) liverleaf, hepatica (Hepatica).
hepatito* (med.) hepatitis, inflammation of the liver; (min.) hepatite, liver stone.
heptaedro* (geom.) heptahedron.
heptagono* (geom.) heptagon.
heraldo herald.

herbo herb, a plant which does not have a woody stem (cf. herboro); herbaji herbage; (fig.) grass (cf. gazono); herbala, herbatra, herboza herbaceous, herby, grassy; herbostipeto a blade of grass; mala herbo weed.
herbario herbarium, classified collection of dried plants.
herbivora, herbivoro herbivorous (animal). Def.: Herbo-manj-anta, -anto.
herboro (medicinal) herb; herboristo herbalist. Def.: Medicinala planto sikigita o preparita (en la formo en qua ol vendesas da herboristo); VI-213.
herdo hearth, fireplace, hearthstone; floor or bottom of an oven.

heredar (tr.) to inherit, be the heir to (ulo, de ulu); heredo (act) inheriting; heredajo heritage (estate), inheritance, heirloom, legacy; heredanto, heredinto inheritor; heir; heredala, heredita hereditary; sen heredanteso escheat (cf. reversionar). Ex.: Heredar havajo de gepatri; Lua sola heredajo esis nobla nomo.
herezio heresy; hereziano heretic; hereziala, hereziana heretical.

herisar (tr.) to bristle (up) (of hair, feathers, etc.); heriso bristling; (med.) horripilation; herisita bristled, bristly; (fig.) hirsute, prickly; herisigar la hari to make one's hair stand on end.
herisono (zool.) hedgehog (genus: Erinaceus).
Herkulo (pr. and fig.) Hercules; Herkulala, Herkulatra Herculean.
hermafrodita, hermafrodito hermaphrodite.
hermetika hermetic(al).
hernio (surg.) hernia.
hero(ul)o hero; heroajo act of heroism; herokomika mock-heroic.
herono (orni.) heron (Ardea).
heronfonteno Hero's fountain.
herpeto (med.) herpes, tetter, shingles.
herso (agri.) harrow; (fort.) portcullis (set with spikes); hersagar (tr.) to h.
heterodoxa heterodox. Ant.: ortodoxa.
heterogena heterogeneous.
heterosexuala heterosexual.
hexaedro (geom.) hexahedron.
hexagono* (geom.) hexagon.
hexagramo (geom.) hexagram.
hexametro (verse) hexameter.

hezitar (intr.) to hesitate, falter, be doubtful; hezitigar to cause (ulu) to h.; hezitanta, hezitema hesitant, irresolute, faltering. Ex.: Il hezitas inter deziro e shamo. Hezitar avan danjero. Karaktero hezitema. Hezitanta voco, respondo.
hiacinto (bot., min.) hyacinth.
hiato (gram. and fig.) hiatus.

hibrida, hibrido hybrid, mongrel (cf. mestica, mulata); hibridifar to produce h. offspring; hibridigo hybridization. Def.: Animali e planti qui venas de mixo di du speci; V-33. Ex.: Mulo esas hibrido de kavalino ed asnulo.
hido* (chem. nomenclature) hydrogen (cf. hidrogeno); hidoperoxo hydrogendioxide, peroxide.
"hidalgo" hidalgo: Spanish nobleman of lower class.
hidro (myth., astron.) Hydra; (zool.) hydrophis, a genus of fresh water polyps.
hidrato* (chem.) hydrate.
hidrauliko hydraulics.
hidrocefaleso (med.) hydrocephalus, water on the brain; hidrocefalo (person) afflicted with h.
hidrodinamiko hydrodynamics.
hidrofobio (med.) hydrophobia.
hidrogeno (cheem., common term) hydrogen (cf. hido).
hidrografo hydrographer.
hidrografio hydrography.
hidrolizo (chem.) hydrolysis.
hidrologio hydrology.
hidromancio hydromancy.
hidromekaniko* hydromechanics.
hidrometro hydrometer.
hidrometrio hydrometry.
hidropatio hydropathy.
hidropso (med.) dropsy; hidropsika, hidropsiko dropsical (person).
hidroquinono* (chem.) hydroquinone.
hidroskopo bletonist, finder of springs.
hidroskopio bletonism, art of finding under-water sources.
hidrostatiko hydrostatics.
hidroterapio hydrotherapeutics.
hieno (zool.) hyena; hieno strioza striped h. (Hyaena striata).
hiere (adv.) yesterday; hiera of y.; hiere matine yesterday (in the) morning; la hiera dio yesterday; prehiere (on the) day before yesterday; sep dii pos hiere in a week.
hierarkio hierarchy.
hieratika hieratic (writing, etc.).
hieroglifo hieroglyph.
"high life"* high life, life among the aristocracy or the rich.
higieno hygiene. V. exp.: vid. salubra.
higrometro hygrometer.
higrometrio hygrometry.
higroskopo hygroscope.

hike here, in this place; hika, hikala here, this; hike ube here where; ad exter hike! out of here! away with you! for hike far distant from here; tra hike through here, this way; venez adhike come here, hither; til hike (un)to here; hike apude near here; hike interne here within.
hilo (bot.) hilum, hile.
hiloto (Spartan) helot.
himeno* (anat., bot.) hymen.
himeneo* hymeneal, a marriage song.
himenoptera, himenoptero (entom.) hymenopter(al).
himno hymn; himnaro, himnolibro hymnal, h. book.
hioido* (anat.) hyoid (bone).
hipar (intr.) to have the hiccoughs, to hiccup.
hipalago (gram., rhet.) hypallage.
hiperbato (gram.) hyperbaton. Def.: Figuro di retoriko konsistanta en renverso di l'ordino dil vorti; VI-135.
hiperbolo (rhet.) hyperbole; (math.) hyperbola.
hiperboloido* (geom.) hyperboloid.
hiperboreo a Hyperborean.
hipermetropa* hypermetropic; far sighted; hipermetropeso hypermetropia.
hipertrofiar (tr.) to cause hypertrophy to; to develop to an unusual or abnormal degree; hipertrofio, hipertrofieso hypertrophy. Ant.: atrofiar.
hipnotar (intr.) to be in a hypnotic state; hipnoto (state) hypnosis; hipnotigar to hypnotize (ulu); hipnotigo hypnotization; hipnotismo hypnotism (doctrine); hipnotigato person hypnotized.
hipocikloido* (geom.) hypocycloid.
hipodromo hippodrome.
hipofizo* (anat.) hypophysis, pituitary gland.
hipogastro* (anat.) hypogastrium.
hipogeo (anc. arch.) hypogeum.
hipogrifo (myth.) hippogriff, winged horse.
hipokampo (ich. genus) hippocampus.
hipokondro (anat.) hypochondrium.
hipokondrio (med.) hypochondria; hipokondriika, hipokondriiko hypochondriac.
hipokrita hypocritical; hipokrit(ul)o hypocrite, dissembler; hipokriteso hypocrisy; hipokritajo act of h., imposture; hipokritesar to be a h.; hipokritagar to act the h.; (dolce) to wheedle.
hipopotamo (zool.) hippopotamus.
hipostazo (theol.) hypostasis.
hipoteko mortgage, hypothec; hipotekizar to m. (ulo), to hypothecate.
hipotenuzo (geom.) hypotenuse.
hipotezo hypothesis.
hipsometro* hypsometer.
hipsometrio hypsometry, measurement of heights.
hirundo (orni.) swallow (family: Hirundinidæ'); hirundokaudatra swallow-tailed; (carp.) dove-tailed.
hisar (tr., nav.) to hoist, raise, haul up (sails), to run up (a signal, a flag); hisar su (fig.) to raise oneself, hoist oneself, get up.
hiskiamo (bot.) henbane (genus: Hyoscyamus).
hisopo (bot.) hyssop.
Hispanala Hispanic.
histerio (med.) hysteria, hysterics; histeriika, histeriiko hysteric (person).
histerotomio* (surg.) dissection of the womb; Caesarian operation.
histologio histology.
historio history; historiisto, historiero historian; pre historiala immemorial.
historiografo* historiographer: official historian of a prince or state.
histriono (antiq.) histrion, stage player.
hivernar (intr. of animals and persons) to hibernate, to winter (cf. estivar); (milit.) to go into winter quarters.
ho! Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there! holla! (nav.) ahoy; ho! ho! heyday! dear me! bless my soul! ho la rejino desfortunoza! oh, unfortunate queen!
hoboyo (mus., instr.) hautboy, oboe.
hodometro (vehicle) hodometer, speedometer; (for persons) pedometer; (pazokontilo). Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la disti paririta da (1) rotvehilo, (2) marchanto.
hoko hook; hokoza, hokatra curved, crooked, hooked, bent; portohoko porter's h., cargo-handler's h.; labiobarbo hokoza curling mustache; hoke forsar (tr.) to pick (a lock).
hokoido* (anat.) unciform (bone).
holdo (nav.) hold (of a ship).
hola* holla! hallo!
holografa holographic: holografa testamento will written in testators own hand.
holokausto (also fig.) holocaust, burnt offering. Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79
holoturio (zool.) holothurian: a kind of water polyp (genus: Holothuria), trepang, beche de mer.

homo (species, inclusive of both sexes) man, a human being, person; homi people, men and women; homaro mankind, humanity (collect.); homulo a male (cf. viro, maskulo); homino woman (cf. muliero); homa, homala human; homeso humanity, quality or condition of being human (cf. humaneso); homale humanely (possible, etc.); homigar to humanize, to make human; homachulo a sorry fellow, wretch, a nobody; homocidar to murder; hominodianto misogynist.
homardo lobster (genus: Homarus).
homeopatio homeopathy; homeopatiisto homeopathist.
homeosexuala (med.) homosexual.
Homerala, Homeratra (rido, e.c.): Homeric.
homilio homily, sermon (cf. prediko).
homogena homogeneous; homogeneso homogeneity.
homologa (geom., biol., chem.) homologous.
homonima homonymous.
honesta honest, fair and straightforward in conduct, thought, etc., free from deceit or fraud, upright, worthy; honesteso honesty, probity, integrity, uprightness.

honoro honor; honorala honorary (guard, etc.); honorinda worthy of h.; honoroza honorable, full of h.; honorizanta, honoriva honorary, honorific; honorizar to h., pay h. to (ulu, per ulo); honorizar su to do oneself the h., esteem it an h., take pride in; honorpromiso, honorparolo, honorjuro word of h.; (milit.) parole; honorlegiono Legion of Honor; honorkazo, honorskrupulo a point of honor; honorafero an affair of h.; honormenciono honorable mention; honorumala honorary: intended merely to confer h.; possessing a title or place without performing the duties of the position, IV-163; as honorumala profesoro honorary (titular) professor; senhonorigar to dishonor, deprive of h.
hop! hop! jump! go!
hoplito (antiq.) hoplite.
Hori (Gr. rel.) Horæ, the three goddesses of the seasons.
hordo horde, a nomadic group; (fig.) crowd, band, pack.
hordeo (bot.) barley (Hordeum); hordegrano a grain of b.; (fig., med.) stye; hordesukro b. sugar.
horizonto (also fig.) horizon; horizontala horizontal; horizontalo (geom.) horizontal line.
horlojo clock, time-piece; horlojala horologic; horlojeto, poshhorlojo a watch; (ri) tensar horlojo to wind the c.; kontrehorloje backwards (on a dial); against the clock.
hornblendo (min.) hornblende, amphibole.
horniso (ent.) hornet (Vespa crabro).

hororar (intr.) to feel dread mixed with detestation, to abhor, detest, loath, dread, have a horror of (pri, pro, ulu, ulo); hororigar to horrify, cause aversion to; hororinda horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.
horoskopo horoscope; facar la horoskopo to cast a person's nativity.
hortensio (bot.) hydrangea (Hydrangea Hortensia).

hospico asylum, convalescent hospital, refuge (for the infirm, poor, aged, etc.); (as in the Alps) hospice, inn for travelers (kept by religious order). V. exp.: En hospitalo on kuracas maladi; en hospico on mantenas (longe, o mem por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado konvalecanta povas ekirar hospitalo por enirar hospico; IV-136.
hospitalo hospital (cf. ambulanco). V. exp. vid. hospico.
hosto host, one who receives or entertains a guest.
hostio (C. rel.) host, consecrated wafer.
hotelo hotel (cf. albergo); hotelmastro hotel-manager, -owner.
"hozana" hosanna.

huo (orni.) owl, particularly the white owl (Athene noctua); hueto owlet; tawny owl, brown owl (Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco); huo nivea snowy owl (Nyctea nivea); paserhuo little owl (Glaucidium passerinum); sparvierhuo hawk owl (Surnia ulula). (cf. IV-296).
hufo hoof; hufforjisto farrier; hufoza, hufozo hoofed, ungulate.
hugenoto Huguenot.
hum! hem! hum!

humana humane, kind, compassionate, merciful; human(ul)o a h. person, humanitarian; humaneso humaneness, humanity; humanisto humanist, a student of the humanities; humanala, humanema humanitarian; humanismo humanism; humane humanely; humanigar to humanize, render humane (cf. homigar).
humero (anat.) humerus.
humida humid, wet, damp, moist; humideso (condition) humidity; humidajo (object) the damp; humidigar to damp, moisten, wet.

humila humble, meek, lowly; humiligar to humble, humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta; III-226. V. exp. vid. diskreta. Ant.: superba.

humoro (bona, mala) humor, temper, mood, disposition; (old physiol.) one of the four bodily fluids determining the temperament; nekonkordo di humori incompatibility of temper(s); havar dolca humoro to have a sweet temper; esar en humoro laborar to be in a working h. V. Exp.: Humoro signifikas propre e primitive la liquidi di l'organismo, qui pleis tanta rolo en l'antiqua medicino; konseque e metafore la (bona o mala) mentala stando o tendenco (instantala, per qua ol distingesas de karaktero). Humuro esas speco di esprito, di ironio, qua expresas su en konversado ed en la rakonti; III-416.
humuro humor, humour, jocose imagination (less intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. humoro.
humuso humus, vegetable mould.
hundo, hundulo, hundino dog; hundala canine; hundyunaro litter of pups; parturar hundyuni to whelp, to pup.
hundoherbo dog-grass, couch-grass (Triticum repens).

hungrar, hungreskar (intr.) to be hungry (cf. apetitar); (fig.) to be eager, greedy; hungroza hungry; hungregoza famished; hungrigar to make hungry, cause hunger; hungregigar to starve (ulu); hungranta la glorio greedy or eager of glory.
hura! hurrah! hurray! hurao a hurrah, huzza.
hurdo hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be leaped.
iambo iambic, iambus.
ibe (adv.) there; adibe (with motion) thence; tra ibe through there, that way; hike ed ibe here and there; ibe fore there at a distance; ibe infre down there. Ex.: Ibe esas ube me lojas. Haltez ibe.
ibiso (orni.) ibis (subfamily: Ibidinæ).
ica see ca.
ideo idea; ideala ideal; idealo an ideal; idealismo idealism; idealigar to idealize; idealista, ideo idealistic (person).

identa identical, the (self-) same; identeso identity, sameness; identigar to identify, to make identical (N.B. not used for persons: rikonocar ulu kom ulu). Ex.: Me prestis a B. la sama libro kam ad A. (t.e. libro tote identa, un libro). La du propozicioni esas identa l'una a l'altra.
ideografio ideography; ideografiajo idiom-graph, idiogram.
ideologio ideology.
idilio (also fig.) idyl; idiliala, idiliatra idyllic.

idiomo idiom, language of a people, tribe, etc.; (cf. idiotismo); idiomala idiomatic, vernacular, relative to a particular language; provincala (o lokala, o rurala) idiomo patois (cf. dialekto, jargono, slango); la Franca idiomo the French language. Def.: La linguo propra di ula naciono o regiono.
idiota idiotic, devoid of understanding; idiot(ul)o idiot, natural fool; (for scientific discussion of meaning, cf. VI-243); idiotajo an idiotic act.

idiotismo idiotism, idiom, an expression peculiar to itself in grammatical construction; an expression the meaning of which as a whole cannot be derived from the conjoined meanings of its elements; (cf. idiomo); idiotismala idiomatic, relating to the grammatical construction of a sentence; (cf. idiomala). Dei.: Frazo ne komprenebla per logikal analizo; VI-192. Ex.: "How do you do" esas Angla idiotismo.
idolo (also fig.) idol; idolisto idolater; idoligar to idolize; idolkulto, idolismo idolatry; idolista, idolkultala idolatrous.

igar (tr.) to make, cause, render (= suffix igig used as an independent verb). Ex.: Igar B. dicar ulo ad A. Igar ulu savar ulo = savigar ulo da ulu. Igar ulu facar ulo = facigar ulo da ulu. Lu igis sua flechi (esar) venenoza. La rejo igis la generalo arestar la policestro.

ignorar (tr.) to ignore, to refuse to notice; disregard wilfully; to overlook (ulu, ulo) intentionally. Def.: Ne volar savar; simular nesavar; VI-165. Ex.: Me savas ke altra faktori existas en la problemo, ma me ignoras li. Ignorar la prczenteso di ulu.
iguano (zool.) iguana (genus: Iguana).
ikneumono (ent.) ichneumon fly.
ikono (rel.) icon.
ikonogeno* (photog.) eikonogen.
ikonografio iconography.
ikonoklasto iconoclast, image breaker; (fig.) one who attacks cherished beliefs as shams; a determined enemy of image worship.
ikonometro* (photog.) iconometer.
ikosaedro* (geom.) icosahedron.
iktero (med.) icterus: jaundice; ikterika, ikteriko (person) suffering from j.
iktiokolo ichthyocol(la), fish-glue, isinglass, a glue prepared from the sounds of fish.
iktiosauro (paleon.) ichthyosaur.

il (abbr. of ilu; accus. ilun) he; ili they (masc.); ilua his; ilia their (masc.).Note In order to show gender, il is sometimes prefixed to demonstrative and interrogative pronouns: ilca, ilta, ilqua, ilci, ilti, ilqui. Ex.: il veis kun ilua kuzi. Ili venis kun ilia kuzi. Pro quo vu prenas ilua libri? Lektez la vui e lasez la ilui (plu.)
ileono (anat.) ileum.
ilexo holly; ilexiero: h. tree (Ilex aquifolium).
iliako* hip-bone, pelvic-bone, coxa; iliaka, iliakala iliac(al).
iliono* (anat.) ilium.
iliterata, iliterato illiterate, unlettered (person). Def.: Qua savas nek lektar, nek skribar; VI-486.

iluminar (tr.) to illuminate, decorate with festal lights or bonfires (cf. lumizar); (fig.) to enlighten the mind of (ulu); pregar Deo iluminar vu to pray to God to illuminate your mind; ilumin(ad)o: illumination (as at a festival); iluminismo the principles of the illuminati; la iluminati the illuminati.
ilustrar (tr.) to illustrate, to provide or adorn (as a book with pictures); (cf. enluminar, klarigar, explikar); ilustruro: illustration (in a book, paper).

iluzionar (intr.) (cf. trompar), to be laboring under an illusion, delusion; iluzionoza full of delusions; iluziona illusory (truly so); iluzioniganta, iluzioniva delusive, illusive: which makes a delusion; iluzionigar to delude, deceive (ulu, su, pri ulo); bastono en aquo aspektas quale ruptita; co esas iluziono a stick in water looks as if it were broken: it is an illusion. Def.: (iluziono) Eroro di la sensi o di la mento, qua igas konfundar la versimilajo por la realajo.

imaginar (tr.) to imagine, to form a notion, a mental image; imaginajo that which one imagines, fancy, conceit; imaginiva, imaginema imaginative. Ex.: On ne povas imaginar ulo plu extraordinara. Il havas vivaca imaginado. Mento imaginema. V. Exp.: vid. fantaziar.
imaginara* (math.) imaginary, impossible (quantity or expression).

imajo image, a visible representation of something; statue, effigy, picture, idol, etc.; a picture produced by reflection, refraction, etc.; a natural resemblance, likeness; a mental or printed picture. Ex.: La ikonoklasti kombatis kontre la kulto di imaji. Vidar sua imajo en l’aquo. Deo kreis la homo segun sua imajo (E. likeness); Esas bela imaji (E. pictures) en ca libro.
imanar (intr., philos.) to be immanent, to indwell; imananta: immanent, inherent. Ant.: (imananta) trancendanta.
imbastar (tr., of tailors, seamstresses) to baste, to run or tack together (the different parts of a garment, cloth). Def.: Sutar per longa steburi e (ordinare) blanka filo, por pose probar; IV-167.
imbecila imbecile, weak-minded. (For discussion of scientific meaning of this and related word, cf. VI-243.

imbibar (tr.) to imbue, to permeate, soak in, drench (speaking of liquids); La pluvo imbibas la tero the rain has soaked the ground; imbibar sponjo per aquo to soak a sponge (with water); (fig.) –ar la mento per opinioni eroroza to imbue the mind with erroneous opinions.
imbrikar (tr.) to imbricate, to overlap (ulo, per ulo); imbriko, imbrikuro: imbricating, overlapping (as scales, tiles, shingles).
imensa immense, immeasureable, vast.

imersar (tr.) to immerge, immerse, to dip, plunge (ulo) into (a liquid); imersoquanto (nav.) (ship’s) draught. V. exp.: Submersar esas plunjigar komlete en (sub) l’aquo; diferas do de imersar, qua esas plunjigar nur parte; on imersas omna navi kande on lansas oli, ma nur poka e specala navi esas submersebla; altri (salvo-bateli) esas kontree nesubmersebla; IV-231.

imitar (tr.) to imitate, endeavor to copy or resemble (ulu, ulo); imit(ad)o, imituro imitating, imitation; imitajo the model or object which is imitated; imitachar to ape, mimic. Ex.: Imitar la signaturo, la manieri, la agi di ulu. Juveli imitita (E. imitation jewels) (cf. kontrafaktar).
imoblo, imobli (jur.) immovables, realty, real estate, chattels real, (permanent) fixtures. Def. : Nemovebla havaji (domi, agri, e.c.); II-75.
imolar* (tr.) to immolaite, offer or kill as a sacrificial victim. Ex.: Agamemmon imolis sua filiino por la interesto generala di la Greki.
imortelo (plant, flower) immortelle, everlasting flower.

impedar (tr.) to impede, hinder, prevent; impedo, impedivo hindrance, hitch, impediment; (elec.) impedance; impedili, impedivi impedimenta; sen impeda unimpeded. Ex. Impedar ulu faca ulo. Impedar l'enemiko transirar la rivero. Impedo a l'exekuto du ula projecto. Impedivo en sua parolado.

imperaar (tr.) to order, direct, enjoin, bid, command (N.B. not military); (fig.) to rule, have sway (cf. dominacar, guvernar, regnar); imperaema imperious; imperavorto word of command; Ex.: La patrulo imperis a sua filio departar. Devos imperas a me. V. exp.: vid. komandar.
imperativo (gram. philos.) imperative.
imperatoro (Rom. hist.) imperator. Def. : Komandanto di antiqua Romana armeo; VI-213.
imperfekto (gram.) imperfect (tense).

imperio empire, slate ruled by an emperor; imperiala imperial, relating to an e.; imperialismo imperialism; imperialista, imperio imperialist(ic); imperiestro emperor; imperiestrino empress; imperiestrata imperial, relating to an emperor.
impertinenta impertinent, saucy, pert. V. exp.: Impertinenta esas nepolita o senrespekta. Insolenta esas, pluse, insulentema od ofensema. kun nuanco du superbeso; II-647.

impetuo (of things) violence, fury; impetuemeso (of persons) impetuous, vehemence, boisterousness; impetuoza, impetuema impetuous, headlong, violent; la impetuo di la tempesto the violence of the tempest; impetuemeso di yuneso impetuosness of youth; impetuoza deziri vehement desires: iraco impetuoza violent anger.

implicita implicit, implied, tacitly comprised; to esas kontenata en la kontrato en maniero implicita this is implied in the contract; libera volo esas la kondiciono implicita di responsiveso elikala free-will is an implicit condition of moral reponsibility.

implikar (tr. log..) to imply, to involve by inference; impliko, implikajo implication, inference; implikar kontredico to imply or involve a contradiction: l'ideo di la homo implikas l'idei di inteligenteso ed arbitrio the idea of a man implies ideas of intelligence and free will..
imploraar (tr.) to implore. V. exp. : Suplikar esas pregegar humile. Imploraradjuntas a suplikar l'ideo di emociganta moyeni, aparte (segun l'etimologio) di la ploro; II-646.

importar (intr.) to have import, be of importance or consequence; to matter, signify, concern; importas (impersonal) it is necessary; importo import, importance, consequence; importanta important; importanto person of importance; importajo important thing or matter; to nemulte (o poke) importas a me that is of little consequence; sen importa insignificant; importas irar it is necessary to go; ne importas ube me esas no matter where i am; l'importo di l'afero the importance of an affair; importanta okaziono, persono important occasion, person.
importacar (tr., com.) to import (goods). Ant.: exportacar.

impostar (tr.) to tax (ulu, ulo); impost(ad)o, imposturo taxation; impost, excise, duty; impostokolektisto t.-gatherer, -collector; imposto personala personal t., poll-tax; sal imposto duty on salt. V. exp.: Taxar esas kalkular quanto de imposto pagenda; impostar esas igar taxito pagar ica sumo. Taxuro ed imposturo havas la sama senco. Ex.: La guvernerio taxas ula importacajo ye procento di 20 po cento, la dogan-kolektisto direte impostas ica 20 po cento.
impotenta (med. and fig.) impotent.

impozar (tr.) to impose (ulo ad ulu); impozar su to obtrude oneself; impozesar to be incumbent (ad);impozar ulo a su to impose something on one self; impozanta, impoziva imposing, commanding, striking. Ex.: La vinkinto impozas severa kondicioni a la vinkiti. Impozar puniso, taco, respekto. Ceremonio impozanta.
impregnar (tr.) to impregnate, to fecundate; (fig.) to imbue.
imprekar (intr.) to imprecate, to invoke evil on a person, to curse (kontre ulu); (cf. maledikar). EFIS
impresar (tr., materially and morally) to impress, make an impression on (ulo), to move, affect (ulu); (cf.imprimar);impreso, impresuro impression, imprint; impresata: (bone, male) impressed.
impresario (theat.) impresario.

impresiono (paint., lit.) an impressionist work; impresionismo impressionism; impresionisto impressionist. Def.: Artala verko, qua tendencas expresar o reprezentar l'impresi recevita da l'artisto de la naturo o de la temo; VI-323.

imprimar (tr.) to print (a book, paper, etc.); imprimo, imprimuro printing; (im)print: imprimala typographical; imprimerio printing establ.; imprimeyo printing office; imprimmashino printing press; imprimproburo proof (-sheet).
improvizar (tr.) to improvise, to compose, recite, sing, etc., extemporaneously; to extemporize; to make, do, or provide offhand; improvize; improvizata, improvizita extemporized, impromptu.

impulsar (tr., phys. and moral) to give impetus to, to impel; impulso impetus, impulse; impulsanta, impulsiva impelling, impulsive; kuglo impulsita da pulvero bullet impelled by powder; cedar a l'impulso dil volo di stranjero to yield to the influence of a stranger's will.

imputar (tr.) to impute, ascribe; (cf.akuzar, atributar);ne imputez mea taco ad ulo ecepte a manko di tempo do not impute (attribute) my silence to anything except lack of time; me ne imputas mea desfortuno a vu I do not impute my misfortunes to you; imputo kalumnioza a caluminous imputation.
imuna immune (de); imunigar to render i.
inaniciono inanition. Del.: Febleso efektigita da manko de nutrivi. DEFIS
inata innate, inborn, inbred; inata idei innate ideas.
inaugurar (tr., all senses) to inaugurate. DEFIRS
incenso incense, frankincense; incensizilo: censer.
incestar (intr.) to commit incest.
«inch» inch: 2.54 cm.
incidar (tr. phys. and gen.) to impinge upon, fall upon or affect; incidala angulo angle of incidence. Ex. Radio incidanta. L'incido di l'imposto.
incidenta incidental, causal; incidento: incident, occurence; incidenta frazeto a sub-ordinate, a parenthetic clause.

incitar (tr) to incite, to spur or urge on (ulu, ad ulo); (cf.instigar); incitetar to plague, pester; incito incitement, incentive; (med.) stimulus. Ex.: Incitar la populo revoltar. Ica pensi incitis il a la venjo.
incizar (tr.) to incise, to cut in or into (cf.tranchar); incizo, incizuro: incision, gash, cut, slash; inciziva (also fig.) incisive; incizivo, inciziva dento: incisor (tooth).
indemno: indemnity, recompense; indemnizar: to indemnify, compensate, recoup. Def.: Kompensal pekunio donita pro domajo, e.c.; II-75
indexo index, table of contents of a book; hand of a dial, etc.: (R.C. church) forbidden books; (of Bible) concordance; (cf. indikfingro).

indico indication, sign, token, mark, clue; -i trompanta deceitful tokens; maligna parolado esas indico di mala kordio an evil tongue is a sign of a bad heart; (math.) indico di radikalo index of a root; indico di refrakto (opt.) index of refraction. Del. Fakto donanta la certeso o probableso di altra fakto.
indiciono* indiction, cycle of 15 years.
indieno (fabric) cotton print, printed calico, chintz.

indiferenta indifferent, unconcerned, immaterial; (of persons) cold, unmindful, insensible. Ex.: Sive ni selektas ca voyo sive l'altra, to esas indiferent a me. Il esas indiferent a la laudo ed a la kritiko. Indiferenteso pri temi religiala.
indigo (dye and color) indigo; indigiero, indigoplanto i.plant.

indignar (intr.) to be indignant; indignigar to rouse the indignation of; indigniganta revolting, shoking; indignoklamo out-cry, hue and cry. Ex.: Il indignas pro la deyusteso di homi. Desyusteso indignigas il. Eruptar pro indigno.

indijar (tr) to be destitute and in need of (ulo); indijo, indijeso, indijego; indigence, poverty, penury, want, indijanto necessitous, person; pauper. Def.: Indijo esas la stando di homo indiganta la maxim necesa kozi. (fig.) Indijo di idei. (cf.karear). Ant. : (indijanta) richa.
indikativo (gram.) indicative (mood).
indikatoro (tech. chem.) indicator, gauge.

individuo individual, single person, animal or thing; individuala individual; individueso individuality, character peculiar to an individual; individualeso individuality, sum of characteristic traits; individuale individually, in an i. or distinct manner, (cf. single); individualigar to individualize, render i.; individualismo individualism; individuisto individualist.

indolenta indolent, slothful, sluggish, lazy, nonchalant; indolentigar to render i. Def.: Expresas nelaboremeso qua venas de la mental karaktero, de speco di moleso o deskurajo, II-19. Ant. : agiva, indolentema; vivaca, impetuoza, diligenta.

induktar (tr., log.) to induce, to reach (a general conclusion) by inference from a number of individual cases; (phys.) to induce, to influence without direct contact; (phys. log.) induction, inference.
induktoro* (elec.) inductor.

indulgar (tr.) to be indulgent to, make allowance for, forbear to inflict, spare; (cf. komplezar, absolvar);indulganta, indulgema indulgent, lenient. Def.: Dispenar de puniso meritita; IV-562. Ant.: (esar) severa.
induljenco* (eccl.) indulgence
indulto* (eccl.) indult, dispensation granted by the Pope.
industrio industry: business employing much capital and labor.

indutar (tr.) to coat, to over with, (be)daub, smear, to paint (with one color); induto, induturo coat(ing), a soft or liquid covering; indutar muro per gipsajo to coat a wall with plaster; indutar per gudro to tar (cf. gudrizar); la puero indutis sua kayero per inko the child blotted (bedaubed) his blank book with ink.
inerta (phys., mental) inert, sluggish; inerteso inertia; inerta maso an i. mass; inerta mento a dull mind.

infalibla infallible, not liable to fail, decieve, or disappoint, unfailing, certain; (cf. ne faliiva, neeroriva); lua ruino esas infalibla: his ruin is certain; remediilo infalibla i remedy; infalibla evidentajo, suceso i. evidence. success. (N.B. not to be used for «infallible»: not capabable of erring).
infama: infamous; -ig-anta: degrating. Ant.: honor-iz-anta, glori-oza.

infanto infant; young child up to seven years of age; infanteto baby; infantacho brat; infantala, infantatra infantile, childlike; infanteso infancy, childhood; infanteskar to become childish; infantalajo childish act: infanteso duesma dotage (cf. radotar); infantocido infanticide.
«infallible» infanta, infante. Def.: Rej-ido en Hispania e Portugal.
infantrio (milit.) infantry; infantriano infantryman.
infarkto (med.) infract.
infektar (tr. med. and fig.) to infect, taint; infektiva infectious.
inferar (tr.) to infer, deduce, conclude (ulo de).

inferiora (sociol., econ.) inferior; lower in station or rank in life (ex.: inferiorklaso di socio); lower in excellence and value; less good (ex.: komercaji di qualeso inferiora); subordonate, secondary; of less importance (ex. tribunalo inferiora; ofico inferiora). V. exp. vid. alta. Ant.: superiora.
inferno (lit. and fig.) hell; infernala, infernaltra; infernal (regions,noise, etc.).
infiltrar (tr. intr.) to infiltrate, percolate: to enter by penetrating the interstices of a substance; (fig.) to creep in, insinuate, penetrate.
infinita (philos., math., and fig.) infinite.
infinitezima infinitesimal, inmmeasurably small; infinitezimala infinitesimal, relative to an i. quantity; infinitezima kalkulo i. calculus, transcendental analysis
infinitivo (gram.) infinitive (mood).
infirma infirm, lacking full use of a limb, having disablement of body; infirmajo infirmily; Def.: Qua ne povas uzar (libere, normale) irga membro od organo: V-95. V. exp. vid kripla.
infixo (gram.) infix.
inflar (tr.) to inflate, pull up or out, swell, bloat; (cf. bufar). Ex.: Inflar balono. Lua korpo esas inflita (E. swollen). (fig.) Esar inflita da superbeso. Stilo inflita (E. turgid style).

inflamar (tr., med.) to inflame; (tech. sense) to set fire to (ulo); inflamala, inflamaltra inflammatory; inflamebla inflammable, combustible; inflamopunto burning-point. Def.: Igar tre varmega; bruligar kun flamo; V-492. Ex.: Organo inflamesas, t.e. ol esas en la morbala stando nomizita inflameso. On havas instrumento por determinar l'inflamo-punto (temperaturo) di diversa liquidi.
inflexar (tr., gram.) to inflect; -o (gram., geom.) inflection, inflexion; (cl. flexiono, modulacar).
infloresenco (bot.) inflorescence.
influar (tr., mental., phys.) to influence, sway ,bias; influanta, influiva influential(person, force, etc.).
infleunzo (med.) influenza.
influxo (biol.) influx act of flowing in; influxo nervala (physial.) innervation.

informar (tr.) to inform, apprise, (ulu, pri ulo); informo informing, news, information (given); informeso information (received); informesar to be informed (pri); serchar informi, informigar su to make inquiries, (cf. Inquestar). V. exp.: vid. savigar.

infre down (as opp. to supre); below, at the bottom (point in space; cl. sube); infra lowermost, bottom; inferior lower in space, degree of importance. quality (cl. suba, inferiora); -ajo lowermost part, bottom part;infrega, maxim infra lowermost, most inferior; adinfre (with motion) downmard; -e di at the bottom or foot of; -a labiobarbo tuft of hair on lower lip, an imperial; videz infre look below. V. exp.: videz alta. Ant.: supre.
infuzar (tr.) to infuse to steep (without boiling); (surg.) to introduce a liquid into veins; (fig.) to instil, inculcate (principles, etc.).
infuzorio, infuzorii (nat, hist., zool.) infusoria.
ingestar (tr. physiol.) to ingest.

inglobar (tr., chiefly medic., pharm.) to bland together, put together, (in spherical form). Def.: Ne simple unionar, ma mixar en un sola substanco (globo, quale indikas l'etimologio); anke inkluzar ula substanco (farmaciala) en altra (di altra naturo e saporo), qua envelopas e celas olu; VI-244

ingranar (tr., intr., mechan.) to put in (or throw into) gear, to engage; (cf. embragar, kuplar). Ex. Un roto ingranas (kun) altra, kande ol movas (turnigas) ica per sua propra movo, per denti qui pulsas la denti di l'altra; III-87.
ingrediento ingredient.
inguino (anat.) groin; inguinala inguinal.
inhalar (tr.) to inhale.
inhibar (tr.) to inhibit to check, restran (the activity of); (jur.) to phohibit, interdict.

iniciar (tr.) to initiate to introduce by a first act, take the initiative in; to instruct in the rudiments or pronciples; to introduce into a society, club, etc. by formal rites; inici(ad)o initiating (ac); iniciemeso initiative (tendency); iniciala initial beginning; inicianto, iniciinto, iniciero initiator, promotor; inicialo person initiated; iniciar a la misterii to initiate into the mysterios. Def.: Igar komencar, igar departar, igar debutar; III-696. Ex.: On inicias homo a doktrino. On inicias afero, entraprezo.

injektar (tr.) to inject (a fluid or other substance into something); injektizar to inject (a person or thing with an injection); injektajo (liquid) injection; okuli injektizita (fig.) bloodshot eyes.

injeniar (tr.) to exercise one's wits, to set one's wits to work; to contrive (tax one's ingenuity); injenioza, injeniema (of persons) ingenious, clever; injeniita (of things) ingenious; showing ingenuity; la justa konstrukto di ca mashino injeniesis da me the right construction of this machine was constrived by me.
injenioro engineer (civil, military, mining, etc.); (cf. mashinisto).
inko ink; inkuyo ink-holder, -stand, -pot; inkizar to (cover with) ink; inkizilo ink-pad; any inking instrument; inkomakulo ink blog.
inkandecar (intr.) to be incandescent.
inkarnacar, eskar* (intr., theol.) to be, become incarnate; inkarnaco incarnation.

inkasar (tr., fin. and fig.) to collect, call in, receive something which is due, chiefly commercial sense of money but lig. of applause, compliments, flowers, etc; (kp. IV-527) inkasero, inkasisto collector; inkasar checko to cash a check.

inklinar (tr., intr., phys., mental) to incline, lean, slope; to be disposed; inklino inclination, incline, gradient, bow; inklineso inclination, favorable, disposition, proclivity (for); inklinita kapo bowed head; inklinanta, inklinita inclined, sloped; prone, disposed (cf. tendencanta). Ex.: Ca muro inklinas. La vinko inklinas a lia favoro. Il inklinesas a severeso. Inklino vicioza.

inkluzar (tr.) to include, inclose, shut up (in), insert, pen in or up; inkluzo, inkluzeso, inkluzajo including, inclosure; inkluzanta, inkluziva inclosing, inclusive; inkluze, inkluzite, inkluzive inclusively; hike inkluzita herewith inclosed, sent herewith; inkluzito a person shut in, recluse.
inkoativa (gram.) inchoate. Def.: Qualifikas la vorti (generale verbi), qui signifikas ula komenco; V-279. Ex.: La sufixo -esk- esas inkoativa.
inkognita, inkognito incognito; inkognitino ingognita.

inkombrar (tr) to encumber, obstruct, block, crowd, hinder in passing. Def. : Embarasar, impedar per l'amaso de objekti. Ex.: La multa veturi inkombras la strado. V. exp.: Tablo, chambro, inkombrita, ne povas dicesar obstruktita. III-326.
inkrustar (tr.) to incrust: cover with a crust; to inlay (thin slices of fine wood, marble, etc.).
inkubo nightmare; (imaginary demon) incubus.
inkubacar (intr. med.) to be in a state of incubation (speaking of a disease). (N.B. not used for «to hatch»; cf. kovar).

inkulkar (tr.) to inculcate; impress on the mind by frequent repetitions, to instil, implant (a truth, a doctrine). V. exp.: Inkulkar kredo, bona mori, esas penetrigar li profunde e dureme en la mento e kustumo; IV-136.
inkunablo, inkunabli incunabula.
inkursar (tr.) to make a incursion: enter into a territory with hostile intent, to raid.
inocenta innocent, guileless, artless(cf senkulpa). Def.: Qua tote ne konocas la malajo; IV-79.
inokular (tr., med) to inoculate (virus); (fig.) to propagate.

inquestar (tr., adminis., parl., jur.) to make inquiry (into), make inquest, inquisition, investigate; inquestanta judiciisto examining magistrate; komitato di inquesto commitee of inquiry. V. exp.: On devas ne uzar (Quale la ??? tentesas facar) inquesto vice questiono, kande on parolas pri simpla questiono, Inquesto esas ensemblo de questioni, de explori, de serchi, qua facesas exemple (e precipue) da policisto o judikisto (qua en ta kazo nomizesas inquestito). Pro to ta vorto havas impliko judiciala, qua riskas esar neagreabla o nepolita, kande on parolas pri questiono, quan privato directas a privato; V-223.
inquiziciono (hist.) inquisition.
inquizitoro (hist.) inquisitor: an officier of the inquisition; (cf. inquestanto, inquizitorero).
insekto insect; insektaro insects (collect.), vermin; insektoocidivo, insektilo insecticide; insektomanjanta insectivorous.
insertar (tr.) to insert, put in, set in; insertajo what is inserted; inserturo (result.) insertion.
insidiar (tr., lit. and fig.) to set a trap for, to lay snare for (ulu); insidiema (of persons) insidious, sly, crafty, wily; insidioza (of things) full of snares.
insigno badge; (of a shop) sign (-board); insigni, insignaro insignia.

insinuar (tr.) to insinuate; to introduce gently, wind into, worm into; to hint, intimate, suggested indirectly; insinuajo insinuation, innuendo; insinuar la fingro aden vunduro to insinuate a finger in a wound; insinuar bona sentimenti to instil good sentiments; l'aquo insinuas su tra la pori the water insinuates itself into the pores; perfida insinuo a ferfidious insinuation.
insipida (lit. and fig.) insipid, tasteless (cf. sensapora); insipidajo a tasteless thing; (saying) platitude; III 604.

insistar (intr.) to insist: to urge or press earnestly, to lay stress (en, pri, sur); (N.B. Not "to demand", cf postular); insistanta, insistema insistant, urgent, earnest; insiste insistently, earnestly. Def. : Perservar demandar. V. exp. On insistas en demando prego. On persistas en stando (mem pure materiala). On obstinas en volo, deziro od opiniono; II-648.
insolenta insolent. V. exp.: vid impertinenta.
inspektar (tr.) to inspect: examine, oversee, survey.
inspirar (tr.) to inspire (by devine instruction, poetic spirit, ideas); inspirajo that which inspires; inspireso inspiration (received). V. Exp. vid. entuziasmo.
instalar (tr.) to instal; induct a person into an office; (mechan.) to setup or lix in position for use or service. Ex.: Instalar episkopo. Instalo di mashino.
instanco (jur.) instance: process of a suit; korto di unesma instanco court of first instance.

instanto instant, moment; instantala instantaneous: instantale instantly, momentarily; instantaleso instantaneousness; instantalajo an instantaneous object (as in photog.), omnainstante every instant; ca instante this instant.
instilar* (tr.) to instil: (pharm. med.) to infuse by drops; (fig.) to infuse slowly into the mind.
instinto instinct; instintala, instintatra instinctive; instinte instinctively. Def.: Impulso naturala.

institucar (tr.) to institute: to establish or set up, to found; to appoint to office; institucar su to appoint oneself; institucuro institution. Ex.: Jesu Kristo dicesas institucir la sep sakramenti Instituco (E. appointment) di judiciisto.
instituto institute: a literary, scientific or philosophical society.
instruciono (practical) instruction(s), direction(s) (how to do or use someting). V. exp.:vid. sav-igar.

instruktar (tr.) to instruct: to impart knowledge to; to teach, educate; instrukt(ad) o instruction (given); instrukteso instruction (received); instruktiva instructive; instruktar rejido guvernar to teach a prince how to govern; instruktar per exempli to teach by examples. V. exp.:vid.sav-igar, edukar.

instrumento instrument, tool, implement; instrumentala instrumental: relating to i.s. (as in. i. music); conducive to some end, helpful; instrumentalo (Anglo-Saxon and Russian grammar) instrumental case; instrumentizar (music) le set (ulo) to instrumental music; instrumentizo (music) instrumentation; (cf. orkestrizar).
insulo isle, island; insulano islander.
insultar (tr.) to insult: treat with abuse, insolence or contempt, by word or action, to affront, taunt, call names, abuse rail at.
intalio (engr.) intaglio. Def.: Gemo grabita kave (inverse di kameo); VI-528.

integra all parts properly united and present, whole, entire, complete, intact, integral; integra nombro, (od, integro): (arith.) integer; integreso integrity (entirely); integre in full, bodily. Def.: Ne-tushita, ne-lezita, havanta omna sua parti e membri; V-744.
integralo (math.), integral; integralkalkulo i. calculus; integraligar to integrate.

intelektar (tr., philos. and general) to understand, comprehend, or know (ulo) by the intellect alone (opposite of to know by sensation, feeling); intelekto intellection, cognition, comprehension, intellect, intelligence (cf. kompreno, inteligenteso); intelektala intellectual: relating to process of thought; intelektoza intellectual: gifted with reasoning power; intelektebla intelligible: that can be known by intellection, opp. to sensible. Ex.: On parolas pri la mondo «intelektebla» opozata a la mondo "sentebla". Do on devas dicar «intelektebla» (qua povas esar objecto dil intelekto). intelekto esas l'ago intelektar; IV-231-2. V.exp.: Me intelektas problemo. Me komprenas vua sentivesopri la morto di vua patro.
inteligenta intelligent: mentally acute; inteligenteso intelligence (cf. intelekto, konoco, savo). Ex.: Il esas tre inteligenta employato. Puero di mikra inteligenteso.

intencar (tr.) to intend, purpose; have in view, in mind (cf projectar); intenco intent(ion), purpose; intencala intentional; intencata, intencita intended; intencanta intentioned, disposed (bone o male); intence, kun intenco intentionally, on purpose. Ex.: Me facis lo kun bona intenco. Il esas homo bone intencanta. me intencas irar morge.
intendanco* (milit.) commissariat.

intendanto intendant: one who has charge of some public business: a superintendent (of public building), colonial or district administrator or treasurer, or the like; as intendant of marine; intendant of finance; intendanteso, intendantevo, intendantio intendancy.
intensa intense; intenseso intensity; intensigar to intensify; intensiganta, intensiva inttensifying, intensive. Ant.: febla.

inter (prep.) between, betwixt (of time and space); among (of persons and things; cf. meze); inter nokto e matino between night and morning; inter la nacioni among the nations; Sirius esas la maxim lumoza inter la fixa steli Sirius is the brightest among the fixed stars; (denoting reciprocity, exchange, division among): la pueri ludas inter su the children play with each other: li kambiis sua redingoti inter su they exchanged coats (between themselves); la havajo esis dividata inter la parenti the property was divided among the relations; (cf. Talmey's Text Book, p.87, 110).
interakto interlude, act between acts; interval between acts.
interceptar (tr.) to intercept. V. exp.: On interceptas letri, telegrafaji, telefonaji. Per to on ne necese haltigas oli nek impedas atingar la skopo; III-604.
intercesar (intr.) to intercede, plead (with or for); put in a good word (for).
interdiktar (tr.) to interdict, prohibit, forbid; interdiktata, interdiktita; forbidden, illicit.

interesar (tr.) to interest (ulu, pri, ad): (indicates excitement of feeling accompanying special attention to some object); interesar su, havar intereso to i. one-self, have an i. in, be concerned; intereso en (o, pri) botaniko i. in botany; questioni di intereso questions of interest; interesanta, interesoza, interesiva interesting (book, news, person, etc.); ca libro esas neinteresanta this book is without interest; (cf. interesto).

interesto interest (objective interest, pecuniary, financial); interestoza advantageaous, profitable; interesto kompozita compound interest; interestifar to bear i.; sen interesta disinterested; (cf. interesar) (Note: It is necessary to distinguish clearly between interesar and interesto. Intereso indicates, loosely, lively sympathy or curiosity; a book or a subject interesas. Interesto relates to proprietary right or share; it is used in such sentences as: «it is to my interest to do it»; «to promote one's interest»; «money bears interest»; etc.

intereventar (intr., of things, events) to happen, occur (in between); (cf. intervenar); plura decidi (inter)eventis en la proceso serveral judgments were pronounced in the course of the lawsuit; multa kozi (inter)eventis dum la negociado many things happened during the negotiations.
interferar (intr., physical), to interfere (kun). (N.B. for «to interfere», when speaking of persons; cf. mixar su, intervenar).
interferdeko a deck between, lower deck, space between decks.
interfoliizar to interleave.
interimo interim: time intervening; interime for the time being, ad interim, in the mean time; interimala presidentato provisional, temporary president.
interjacar (intr.) te lie in between; interanta interjacent.
interjeciono (gram.) interjection.
interkomuna party: belonging in common to several persons; as, havajo intera common property.
interkonsento mutual agreement, understanding (F. entente); intero kordiala entente coardiale.
interkonsultar (it. intr.) to hold a consultation, deliberate together.
interkosta (anat.) intercostal.
interkuranta (venanta) intercurrent: intervening, coming in between.
interlineo a line between; space between (lines); interizar to interline; (print.) to lead; intera interlinear; interajo, interizo, interizuro interlineation.
intermezo (theat.) intermezzo, interlude.
intermilitanta, intero belligerent.
intermitar (intr.) to be intermittent: cease at intervals.

interna internal, inward, interior; internajo the interior, inside; interne inwardly, internally, interneso inwardness; intern(ul)o (fig.) boarder (in school); interne (in hospital); internerio (fig.) boarding or private school; ministro di l'interna aferi Minister of the Interior, Home Secretary; il esas en l'internajo di la domo he is inside the house; de interne ad extere form within outwards, inside out.
internaciona international; intereso, interismo internationality, internationalism (doctrine); interigar to internationalize.
internuncio (papal) internucio.
interogativa, interogativo* (gram.) interrogative. Def.: La questionala partikli (adjectivi, pronomi ed adverbi); V-279.
interosta (anat.) interosseal, interosseous.
interparloar (intr.) to converse.
interpelar (tr., parlm.) to interpellate: to question formally for explanation, put a question to.
interpolar (tr.) to interpolate: to insert, as a spurious of foreign word or passage); (math.) to interpolate; interpolajo interpolation (word, passage), spurious passage.

interpozar (tr.) to place (ulo) between, insert interpose, intercalate (a day); (cf. intervenar, mediacar). interpretar (tr.) to interpret; to explain what is obscure and ambiguous in a writing, construe (cf. tradukar); misar: to misinterpret, misconstrue.
interprima (nombri) prime to one another: numbers without any common divisor.
interregno interregnum.
interrimilar to rhyme together.
interruptar (tr.) to interrupt: destroy the continuity of, break off, stop.
intersekar (tr.) to intersect.
intersequar (su) to follow, succeed each other; o sequence; e consecutively, in succession; anta consecutive, successive.
intershokar to strike against one another, to run foul of each other.
interspaco interspace, a space between places, intermediate distance.
interstico interstice.
intertempo meantime, interval, lapse (of time); intere: meanwhile (cf. dume).
intertropika intertropical: situated between the tropics.
intervalo (esp. mus.) interval; (cf. intertempo, interspaco).

intervenar (intr., of persons) to intervene, interpose, interfere; (cf. intereventar); intero intervention, interference, interposition; des, neinterveno non-intervention. Ex.: Intervenar en konflikto, en disputo. Armizita interveno.
intervido mutual sight or view; (fig.) interview: meeting for conference; (cf. interviuvo).
interviuvar (tr.) to interview (ulu)
intestata intestate; intestata heredanto (jur.) abintestate heir(ess). Def.: Ta qua heredis sen testamento. V-279.
intestino intestine, gut; intestinala: intestinal; intestini: intestines, entrails, bowels: intestino tenua small intestine.

intima intimate: inmost, inward; near, close; close in friendship, familiar, bosom; intim(ul)o: i. person, close friend; intimeso intimacy, intimajo: inward part, heart (of a subject); la naturo intima di kozi the inward nature of things; la sentimenti maxim intima the most secret sentiments; relati intima close relations: amiko intima intimate friend.
intonar (tr., mus.) to intone; inton(ad)o (mus. and voice expression) intonation (cf. modulaco).

intoxikar (tr.) to poison, drug, envenom; (N.B. not E. to intoxicate with liquor; cf. ebriigar); V. exp.: Intoxikar expresas ido plu general kam venenizar. On povas drinkar veneno sen esar intoxikita; IV-517.
intradoso (arch.) intrados: interior curve of an arch.
intrigar (intr.)to intrigue: to contrive by secret artifice; make plots; scheme; intrigizar to complicate, entangle by intrigues.
intrikar (tr.) to tangle, entangle, embroil, implicate (ulu, en ulo); to make (ulo) intricate.
intrinseka intrinsic. Ant.: extrinseka.

introduktar (tr.) to introduce (ulu), to bring (ulo) into notice; to preface; (cf. enduktar, prizentar); introdukto, introdukturo introducing, introduction, preamble (cf. prefaco); introduktala preliminary. Ex.: Me volas introduktar il che vu. Donar introdukto-letro ad ulu. Ca libro servos kom introdukto a la temo. III-71.
«introitus»: (R. C. Church) introit.
intruzar (tr.) to intrude, obtrude, (su en ulo); to interfere, meddle; (geol.) to enter, or cause to enter, by force.
intumecar (intr.) to intumesce: to swell.
intusucepciono (med., biol.) intussusception.
inulo* (bot.) elecampane (Inula).
inundar (tr., pr. and fig.) to inundate, overflow, flood, swamp. Ex.: Nil inundas la planajo. La inundo di la Romana imperio da la barbari.
invadar (tr.) to invade. Ex.: La armeo invadis la teritorio di sua enemiki. Mala herbi invadas la gardeno.
invaginar (tr.) to invaginate.
invalida invalid: infirm, disabled; of no legal force, void, null; invalid(ul)o an i.; (milit.) a soldier disabled for active service; invaliderio establ. for disabled persons.

invektivar (tr.) to inveigh against; invektivo invective. V.exp.: Invektivo esas nek reprimando, nek insulto, ma atako per parolo ; ol povas esar decanta ed eloquenta. La Quousque tandem esas invektivo da Cicero a Catilina; IV-513-514.
inventar (tr.) to invent: find out something new (a process, a machine); inventuro an invention.
inventariar (tr.) to take an inventory of : to inventory; (com.) to take stock (of).

inversa inverse, inverted; inverso, inversajo the reverse, the contrary, opposite; (cf. reverso); inversigar to invert, reverse, to put upside down; inversigo, inversigeso inversion; inverse vice-versa; raporto inversa inverse ratio; inversigar la natural ordino dil vorti en frazo; to invert the natural order of words in a sentence.
investar (tr.) to invest (with authority, office; cf kolokar). Def.: Provizar per ofico o titulo; IV-167.
invitar (tr.) to invite; ask to go to some place or to do something; V. exp.: Invito esas polita prego por asistar kunveno, repasto, balo, festo, e.c.; III-417.
involuciono (math.) involution; (bot.) state of being rolled spirally inward.
involukro (bot.) involucre.
inyamo (plant and rhizome) yam (genus: Dioscorea).
iodo (chem.) iodine; iodido iodide.
iono (phys.) ion.
ionio* (chem.) ionium.
Ioniala Ionic: relating to Ionia; Ioniano an Ionian.
ionika (arch.) ionic.
«iota» (Gr. alphabet) iota; (fig.) jot, little.

ipsa self (-same); ipse (by) self; ipso the same thing. Note: Ispa is ordinarily used in connection with a personal pronoun; as: me ipsa I myself; li ipsa they themselves; but can be used with substantives; as: la rejo ipsa the king himself; la kozo ipsa the thing itself; de la botelo ipsa from the selfsame bottle; it sould always be placed next to the word it modifies. Ex: La mastro inspektis ipse la domo. La mastro ipsa inspektis la domo. Il ipsa volas parolar kun me. Il pozas su ipsa avan la pordo.

irar (intr., tr.) to go, be going; iro going; passage. Note: Irar is often compounded, as: ekirar, misirar, pedirar, etc. It sometimes takes a direct object, as: li iris penigiva voyo they went a wearisome way. Def.: Diplasar su de un loko ad altra per irga moyeno; IV-464. Ex.: On iras de Paris a London, parte per fervoyo, parte per navo.

iracar (intr.) to be angry, cross (kontre); iraco anger, irritation, ire, wraith; iracanta, iracema, iracoza angry, irascible, choleric, testy, cross, peevish; iracigar to anger, incense, exasperate, irritate (ulu); iraceskar to become angry, get in a temper; iracemeso irascibility; iracigania, iraciva exasperating, vexing.
«irade» irade: decree of Sultan.
iradiar (tr.) to irradiate. Def.: Optikal fenomeno per qua la parti plu lumoza o lumizita invadas la parti min lumoza e restriktas oli; IV-200.

irga any (whatever): relating to something or someone indefinite (cf. ula); irgo anything (whatever); irgu anyone (no matter who); irgu qua (od, igre qua): whoever, whosoever; irge quale, irge maniere anyhow, at any rate, no matter how; irgaloke, irgube anywhere (whatever), wherever; irgekande no matter when, whenever; irgatempe at any time; irgequanta, irge in any quantity; irga qua motivin vu havas por plendar whatever reasons you may have to complain; igre quanto kurajon il manifestis however much courage he manifested; irege quala esos la vetero no matter what the weather is; irge quanta pekunion il havas no matter how much money he has; irge quan lu renkontris whomsover he met: irge quante mikra la donacajo however small the gift.
irido (bot.) iris, orris, (genus: Iris).
iridio* (chem.) iridium.

irigacar (tr., agri.) to irrigate. V. exp.: Irigaco esas brancho di agrokultivado. Ol aquizas tota agri, formayi, distrikti per fluigar aquo de riveri, lagi, e.c. en artivicala kanali a la kultivoloko: IV-459-460.
iriso (anat.) iris; (fig.) colors of the rainbow (cf cielarko); irisizar to give the hues of the rainbow, become iridescent; irisoza, irisizita iridescent.
irisito (med.) iritis.
iritar (tr. physiol.) to irritate, inflame, fret; (fig.) to annoy, exasperate.
ironio irony; ironia, ironiala, ironioza, ironiema ironic(al).

iruptar (intr.) to invade (with great power, with large numbers); to burst (in), rush in (as enemies, or like enemies). Ex. : La barbari iruptis en la Romana imperio. Ta turbo iruptis (E. burst) en la chambro.
islamo Islam: the Mohammedan world, (cf Mohamedismo).
istmo (geog.) isthmus.

(i)ta that, those (or "this, these" where the nearness or remoteness of an object pointed out is irrelevant; (i)to (obj. ton): that (thing); (i)ti those; ta soldato e lua kamarado tre konkordas pri omno that (or this) soldier and his comrade much agree about everything; ta qua he, she, who; to quo that which; ti qui those who: ta qua volas vivar felice, devas esar vertuoza who whould live (he, she, who will live) happily should be virtuous; to quo plezas a vu maxim ofte plezaz a me what (that which) pleases you generally (most often) pleases me; after two mouns already used in pointing out objects, ita refers to the first (cf. ca); ka tu preferas ica od ita kavalo ? Ita esas plu forta, ma ica plu bela; do you prefer this or that horse ? that (one) is (the) stronger, but this (one) is (the) more handsome; nek ica ita flori plezas a me neither these nor those flowers please me; when it is desirable to indicate the gender of the object pointed at, the forms: ilta, ilti; elta, elti; olta, olti are used; ilti qui konocas me those (masc.) who are acquainted with me; elta quan me amas ne amas me she whom i love does not love me; kande olca (ol) esis trovita when it had been found; where euphony permits the «i» is omitted; as: ta, to, ti.

iterar (tr.) to iterate, reiterate, repeat; to do two or more times what one has arleady done before; (N.B. refers to all acts, not merely words); iterala (manner) iterative, repetitious; itere again anew, once more, over again. V. exp. vid. repetar.
itinerario itinerary, route. Def. Voyo sequanta, sequita o sequota da ula voyajero; V-280..
ivoro, ivora, ivorala ivory.
izabela isabel(la) colored: a brownish yellow or light buff color; (of horses) light-bay.
izocela* (geom.) isosceles (triangle, etc.).
izodinama isodiynamic.
izogama (biol.) isogamous.
izogona* (geom.) isogonic.
izografiko* isography: the imititation of handwriting.
izoklina* (geol. magnetism) isoclin-al, -ic.
izokrona isochron-al, -ous.

izolar (tr.) to isolate: place apart from its environment; (elec., etc.) to insulate; izolilo, izolivo (phys.) insulator; izolita isolated, alone; insulated. Ex.: La domo esas en izolita loko en foresto. Egoismo izolas homo. Metal-filo izolila.
izomera (chem.) isomeric.
izometra* (geom.) isometric.
izomorfa isomorphic.
izoperimetra* isoperimetrical.
izoplero isoplere.
izotermo isotherm.
izotropa* isotropic.

ja (adv.) already; before or by this time or the time mentioned, even now; ja ne not yet; (fig.) not even; lu ja arivis he has already arrived; il ne ja arivis he has not yet arrived; lu ja dormeskis he has already fallen asleep; kad vu ja asistis kunsido? No, me ne ja asistis have you as yet attended a meeting? No, I have not yet been present; Ka vu ja lektis ta libro? No, me ne ja lektis ol, me ne ja trovis la necesa tempo Have you read that book yet (already)? No, I have not read it yet, I have not found the necessary time. Il ja ne esas kontenta he is not yet content; Kad il ja finabis la laboro kande lua patrulo vizitas il? Had he already finished the work when his father visited him? V. exp.: vid. ankore.
jaboto jabot ruffle on shirt bosom; lace frill worn on woman’s bodice.
jacar (intr.) to lie (position of persons or things living or dead); jacanta lying (ill, dead), stretched out; jaceyo layer, bed; hike jacas here lies (ulu, ulo).
jado (min.) jade.
jaguaro (zool.) jaguar (Felis onca).
jaketo (woman’s) jacket.
jakobino a Jacobin; jakobineso, jakobinismo Jacobinism.
jakoneto (fabric) jaconet.
jalapo (bot.) jalap (esp. the Ipomoea purga).
jaluza jealous; jaluz(ul)o a j. person; jaluzeso jealousy.
janicharo Janizary Turkish infantryman.
Jansenismo Jansenism; Jansenisto Jansenist; Jansenista, Jansenala Jansenistic.
januaro January.
jaro jar large earthen jug for water, etc.
jardiniero jardinière; flower stand or receptacle for plants; a dish of mixed vegetables. – V. exp.: Ne vazo, ma mobl(et)o por suportar flori o buketo; VI-528.

jargonar (intr.) to talk jargon, gibberish, to jabber, to use unintelligible language; (cf. slango, galimatiaso). Def.: Linguo o dialekto nekorekta, ma ne esencale od intence diferanta de la ordinara linguo; VII-158. Ex.: La stranjeri ne parolas la Franca, li nur jargonas. La jargono di la infanti, di la rurano.
jasmino (bot.) jasmine, jassamine, (genus Jasminum).
jaspo (min.) jasper; jaspumar (tr.) to marble, vein (books, etc.).
javelino (weapon.) javelin. Def.: Speco di dardolonga e dina.
jeo (orni.) jay (Garrulus gandarius).
jeleo jelly; jeleo de ribi, ribojeleo currant j.

jelozio Jalousie Venetian blind, curtain blind. Def.: Klozilo kompozita ed multa lati (lameni) superpozita, quin on povas generale inlinar per rotaco cirkum lua longesal axo, e quin on povas levar o deslevar quale kurteno, per kordo o kordono. Kande ol esas tote levita, la lati esas aplikita uni sur altri; III-290.
jemar (intr.) to groan, moan, to give forth a dull, low sound of grief or pain; jemar pro doloro to groan with pain; jemar pri sua mortinta kompano to bemoan his dead companion,
jemela, jemelo twin; jemeli (astron.) Gemini; jemela frati t. brothers; jemela liti t. beds; tri jemeli triplets.

jenar (tr.) to hinder the movments of the body, (of clothing, etc.) to pinch, be too tight; (fig.) to hold in constraint, prevent, hinder from doing something; jeno inconvenience, annoyance, trouble; ca shui jenas me these shoes pinch me; alta dogantaxi jenas l’industrio high custom dues hinder industry; lua prezenteso jenas me his presence disturbs me (he is in the way).
jendarmo gendarme one of a body of military police, esp. in France.
jeneroza generous, open-handed, munificent, liberal (in gifts).
jenio (milit.) corps of engineers; jeniano e. soldier, a sapper and miner; (cf. injenioro).
jenjivo gum (of teeth).
jenjivito* (med.) gingivitis.
jenro (art.) genre; jenropikt(ad)o, jenruro «genre» painting representing scenes in common life, in opposition to history and landscape.

jentila (of character) nice, well-bred, courteous, civi; jentil(ul)o gentleman (in character) a man of fine feeling. V. exp.: Jentila relatas la karaktero e la mori di persono agreabla e plezanta. Polita relatas nur l’extera formi di la sociala relati, la paroli, gesti, agad-manieri (maxim ofte konvencionala o simbolatra); II-646.

jerar (tr.) to manage, administer, conduct (a hotel, business (for an owner)); jeranteso managership. Def.: Administrar por la profito di la proprietero, esante salariata oficisto. V. exp.: On bezonas ofte distingar tre klare l’administranto (who owns) de la jer-anto, -isto (manager), exp.: jeranto di domeno, kastelo, hotelo, teatro, lugata domi, e.c.

jermo (pr. and fig.) germ; jermifar (intr.) to germinate, spring up, sprout; jermifigar (tr.) to cause to germinate, sprout; jermifeyo (brewing) malt-house; jermifanta plasmo g. plasm; la jermi di vertui, di idei the g. of virtues, of ideas.
jerzeo jersey, sweater.
Jesu Jesus; JesuKristo Jesus Christ.
jetar (tr.) to throw; for jetar to throw at a distance, throw away; (cf. lansar, spricar); jetar ombro to t. a shadow.
jezuito Jesuit.
jigo (dance, tune) jig.
jileto vest; waistcoat.
jilfloro (bot.) gillyflower (Cheiranthus cheiri).
jino (liquor) gin.
jineto (zool.) genet(te) species of civets (Viverra Genetta); a Turkish ringcurb, -bit.
jinjero ginger.

jirar (intr.) to turn about, gyrate; (nav.) veer around, tack about, put about; jirachar to prowl around. V. exp.: Turnar, rotacar, jirar La verbo turnar esas la maxim generala e suficas por l’ordinara uzado. La du altri esas teknikala. Korpo rotacas kande ol turnas cirkum axo qua trairas lu (ex. roto cirkum sua axo to esas l’etimologiala origino di la verbo L. rota, rotare). Korpo jiras, kande ol turnas cirkum axo o punto situita exter lu, plu o min fore (ex. veturo, navo jiras deskriptante arko di cirklo o di altra kurvo; II-644.
jirafo (zool.) giraffe, camelopard.
jiravolto (horsemanship) volt right and left, quick turning.

jokar (tr.. intr.) to joke, banter (ulu); to joke, jest (kun ulu, pri ulo); jokema, jokoza jocular, waggish, facetious; jokante, per jokar by way of a joke, in jest; jokajo a joke jest (objective); jokmentio hoax; laciva joko broad jest, coarse joke.
jokeo jockey.
jonglar (intr.) to juggle (per) to play tricks by sleight of hand.
jonko (Chinese) junk.
jonquilo (bot.) jonquil (Narcissus Jonquilla).

jorno (opp. to night) day, daylight, daytime; (cf. dio); jornar to be daylight, daytime; jorneskar it begine to be light, day is coming; jornala diurnal, daytime; daily; jornomezo midday, noon; en plena jorno in broad day (light); jorno jornlaboro a day’s work, day-labor; jorno di ok hori an eight-hour day; jornala laboristo a day worker; jornope laborar to work by the day; jornopago a day’s pay. Ant.: nokto.
jovdio Thursday; santa jovdio Maundy T.

joyar (intr.) to be joyous, be delighted, be glad; joyigar to cause (ulu) to rejoice, to fill with joy; (cf. gayigar); joyegar to jubilate, exult; joyoza joyful, joyous; joyema jovial, jolly; joyotrublanto, joyero (fig.) spoil-sport, damper, wet-blanket.

juar (tr.) to enjoy to have a satisfaction in, feel with pleasure, revel in; juar bona reputo to enoy (have) a good reputation; ca homo juas la tempo prezenta sen pensar pri la futuro this man enjoys the present without troubling himself about the future; juar l’embaraseso di ulu to enjoy the embarrassment of someone.
jubeo jube a gallery in a church containing the rood.
jubilear (tr.) to celebrate the jubilee of; jubileo (R. C. Church and Jewish) jubilee; 50th anniversary, golden wedding; jubileata, jubileato (person) of 50 years standing.
Judo, Judulo, Judino a Jew; Juda, Judala Jewish; Judismo Judaism; la migranta judo the wandering Jew; Judeyo, Judaro Ghetto, jewry; (cf. Izraelido, Hebreo) Judo.

judiciar (tr., jur.) to judge judicially (ulu, ulo); (cf. judiko); judicio trial, judgment; judicieyo court of justice; judicianto, judiciero, judiciisto judge, justice, magistrate; judiciala judicial relative to the court; judiciistala judiciary relative to the judges;judiciisto, judiciaro judiciary; judiciisteso judicature, magistracy; judiciebla justiciable; judiciopovo judicial power; judiciisto inquestanta examining magistrate; havar judiciala resortiso o domeno to have jurisdiction; judiciantaro (fig.) bench of judges; jury; judicianto, judiciano juryman; (cf. juriano, jurinto); enuncar la judicio to pass sentence. Def.: Facar legala, yurala «judiki»; IV-167.

judikar (tr., intr.) to judge to conclude or determine by the exercise of judgment (not legal; cf. judiciar); to exteem, deem, think; judiko judgment; logical opinion; judikopovo faculty or power of judgment; me judikas il kom honesta I judge hime to be honest; judikar segun la semblo to judge by appearances.
jugulara* (anat.) jugular.
jujubo (fruit) jujube; jujubiero j. tree (genus Zizyphus).
julepo (pharm.) julep a sweet demulcent mixture, used as a vehicle.
julio July.
julieno julienne a clear vegetable soup.
jungar (tr.) to put to, «inspan» (as horses to a carriage), to yoke up (oxen); jungo yoking, putting in; (cf. yugo); jungitaro, jungajo (animal, object yoked) team, yoke, pair of horses, oxen.
junglo jungle.
junio June.
juniora, junioro junior, younger.
junipero (bot.) juniper-tree, (genus Juniperus); juniperbero j. berry.
junko (bot.) rush, cane, (genus Juncus); junkizar to cover with rushes; to cane (chairs, etc.).

juntar (tr., material sense) to join place one thing in contiguity to another; (of hands) to clasp; (cf. unionar) junturo, junteyo joint, junction; juntita pedi with feet together; juntita manui clasped hands; juntostreketo (print.) hyphen; juntar du planki per gluo to glue two planks together; juntar alo ad la domo to add a wing to the house; juntar du gardeni to join two gardens.

jurar (tr., intr.) to swear make solemn declaration, to give one’s oath; jurigar to swear in (ulu), administer the oath to (ulu); jurinta sworn; jurinto person sworn (cf. juriano). Ex.: Jurar dicar la verajo. Jurar fideleso ad ulu. Jurar amikeso ad ulu.
juraso, jurasala* (geol.) Jurassic (period or system).
jurio jury; juriano juror, juryman (cf. judikantano, jurinto).
juriskonsulto jurisconsult a man learned in law, esp. Civil law; a jurist; counsellor at law.
jurnalo journal, newspaper, gazette; jurnalisto journalist, newspaperman; jurnalisteso (profession) journalism; -ista journalistic; jurnalaro the press.
jus (adv.) just just now, this last minute, the moment just passed; jusa of a moment ago. Ex.: Vu venas tro tarde, lu jus mortis. Me jus arivis.
