justa conforming to some proper standard (N.B. not legal sense; cf. yusta); right, correct, well grounded, exact, proper (of measure, time, balance, word, thought, etc.); justeso rightness, exactness, appositeness, propriety; esar justa to be right (in opinion, or deed, or fact); justatempe at the right time, in the nick of time, precise; ta horlojo esas justa that clock is right; donar justa mezuro to give the right measure; to esas tre justa dicajo that is a very proper saying; havar ideo justa pri ulo to have a just idea of the thing; havar justa suspekti pri ulu to have justifiable suspicions.
juto jute.
juvelo jewel; juveluyo, juvelbuxo j.-holder, -box; juvelvendeyo, juvelerio j. shop.

ka(d) Question word, not always translated; in indirect questions: whether if; ka la vetero ne esas bela cadie? is the weather not beautiful to-day? kad il esas hike? is he here? me prizas savar kad il retrovenos? I would like to know whether he will come back? (N.B. whehter . . whether is translated by sive .. sive); vu esas fatigita, ka ne? you are tired, aren't you? vu ne esas fatigita, ka yes? you aren't tired, are you? (cf. Complete Manual, p. 26) il komencis dubar kad il devas promulgar sua doktrino he commenced to doubt whether he should promulgate his doctrine.
kabo (geog.) cape; preterirar kabo (naut.) to double a cape.
kabalo (rabbinical) cabala.
kabano cabin, hut; kabaneto (as for rabbits) hutch; kabano montala chalet.
kabino (nav.) cabin; kabineto small cabin, closed-like room, (nav.) state-room; (fig., furniture) cabinet (as for curiosities).

kablo (of rope) cable, hawser (cf. kordego); (of wire, also elec.) cable, kableto small cable, mooring-rope, painter; kabligar, kablifar (tr., intr.) to make a c. (out of) (ulo); kable telegrafar to c.; kablotelegramo cablegram.
kabrar (intr., of animals) to rear, prance; (cf. kurbetar); kabrigar to make (a horse, etc.) rear; kabretar to stand on the hind legs. Kabretar = Sideskar sur la dopa gambi, elevante la avana; VI-76.
kabrioleto cabriolet: two-wheeled, one horse cab.
kachuo catechu, cashoo.
kad see ka(d).
kadastro cadastre: register of real estate for taxing purposes; kadastrizar to make a c. of: to survey and value (lands).
kadavro cadaver, corpse, dead body; kadavratra cadaverous; kadavro marchanta (fig.) a walking ghost; bestio kadavro carcass, carrion (of animals).
kadencar (tr.) to cadence; (cf ritmizar).
kadeto (milit.) cadet.
kadmio* (chem.) cadmium.

kadro frame (of a picture, looking-glass, etc.; cf. framo); (milit.) cadre: sekeleton, staff (of a regiment), complement or list of officers (commissioned and non-commissioned); (fig.) outline, plan, arrangement of work, -izar: to frame (a picture, etc.).
kaduceo caduceus, Mercury's staff or wand.

kaduka caducous: decaying, falling, crumbling tumble-down (of houses, etc.); decrepit, frail, worn-out (of persons, animals, health, etc.); (bot.) falling off early. Ant.: forta, yuna, robusta, vigor-oza, en bona stando.
kafeo coffee; kafeiero c. tree; kafetaso c. cup; kafekuliero teaspoon; kafekultivisto c. planter; kafeplantacerio c. plantation; tas(ed)o (de) kafeo cup of c.
kafeino* (chem., pharm.) caffeine.
Kafra, Kafro* Kafir, Kaffir, Caffre.
kaftano caftan: a Turkish garment..
kagulo a kind of monk's cloak with cowl. Def.: Sen-manika mantelo di monakulo kun kapuco. Kapuco perforita per okulo-trui.
kaito kite.
kajo cage.
kakar (intr.) to defecate, void excrement, empty the bowels, shite.
kakao (beans and drink) cocoa; kakaiero cacao-tree (Theobroma cacao); kakabutro c. butter.
kakatuo (orni.) cockatoo (subfamily: Plictolophus).
kakexio* (med.) cachexy.
kakofonio cacophony. Def.: Desagreabla kunligo di soni, sive en parolo, sive en muziko; III
kaktuso (bot.) cactus.
kalo, kalajo (also bot.) callus, callosity; (on foot) corn; kaloza, kalatra callous.
kalamo* (ant.) a reed pen used in the East.
kalamino (min.) calamine.
kalamito calamite: a gum-resin; a fossil plant. Def.: Speco de gumo (Styrax calamita); fosila planto.
kalamitato calamity. Ex.: La famino, la milito esas kalamitati.
kalandrar (tr.) to calender (paper, cloth); to mangle (household linen).
kalcedono (min.) chalcedony.
kalcio* (chem.) calcium.
kalcinar (tr.) to calcine: to oxidize (as by heat); to roast (ores).

kaldiero boiler (steam generator); copper: large boiler for brewing, washing, etc. Def.: Klozita vazo (apartenanta generale a vapor-mashino), en qua on boliigas aquo e konservas la vaporo sub preso; III
kaldrono caldron: kettle for cooking. Def.: Apertita vazo uzata en koqueyo; III
kalefakt(ad)o (tech.) calefaction: warming.
kalemburo pun, play on words; kalemburisto punster. Def.: Speco di vortoludo, en qua vorto o serio de vorti prizentas du senci; III
kalendi kalends, calends.
kalendario calendar.
kalendulo (bot.) marigold (Calendula).
kalenturo (med.) calenture: a tropical fever attributed to heat

kalesho calash, open barouche, open buggy. V. exp.: Kalesho, karoso La du esas veturi kun quar roli e quar plasi, ma kalesho esas apertita, karoso esas klozita (kun plafono). Pluse, karoso esas generale suspendita per specala modo (per rimeni); II
kalfatar (tr., nav.) to calk (a deck, etc.).
kalio* (chem.) potassium; kalibromo bromide of p.; kalipermanganato permanganate of p.; kalinitrato niter, p. nitrate (cf. salpetro).
kalidoskopo kaleidoscope.
kalifo calif, caliph.
kaligrafar (tr.) to put (ulo) into fine handwriting; kaligraf(ad)o caligraphy.
kaliko (fabric) calico
kalko lime; (chem.) calx; kalkoza: calcareus; kalkigar to calcify; kalkizar to cover with l.; kalkforno lime kiln; kalkfornisto l. burner; kalko kaustika quicklime.
kalkaneo* (anat.) calcaneum: the great bone of the heel.
kalkolo (med.) calculus: stone in bladder, kidneys, gall-ducts.
kalkular (tr., math.) to calculate, reckon, compute; kalkulo calculation; (higher math.) calculus; kalkuleroro error in c.; kalkullibro ready reckoner (book).

kalma (of objects, fig. or persons) calm, unagitated, quiet, still, placid; serene (of the elements, passions, etc.); unruffled, composed, sedate (in manner and deportment); kalmigar to calm; kalmigiva, kalmivo anodyne, sedative; kalmesko, kalma intervalo lull. V. exp.: Kalma signifikas tote pasiva e materiala stando di kozi, qua ne movas: aero, aquo, maro kalma (t.e. ne agitata da la vento). Tranquila havas senco samtempe material e mentala, ma prefere aktiva: qui ne agitas su, ne movas su sen utileso o skopo; on dicas ad infanto: restez tranquila! on parolas pri vicini tranquila (qui ne lacas bruiso). Quieta expresas stando mentala, qua plu klare definesas per lua kontreajo, desquieta; I-713.
kalmaro calamar, calamary, cuttlefish, squid, (genus: Loligo vulgaris). Def.: Genero di molusko cefalopoda kun dek brakii; V-420.
kalomelo (med.) calomel.

kalora (tech., physical quantity) heat; kalorala, kaloriziva, kaloranta, kalorifanta caloric, thermic, calorific; kalorizar to heat (by an apparatus); (cf. varmigar); kalorizilo heat producer; (fig.) hot-air stove or pipe); kalorareo heating surface.
kalorio (thermal unit) calory. Def.: Unajo di kalor-quanto. On distingas la granda kalorio, qua korespondas ad un kilogramo de aquo, e la mikra kalorio, qua korespondas ad un gramo; V-420.
kaloriko (hist.) caloric. Def.: Historiala koncepto di la kaloro, kom material substanco.
kalorimetro* calorimeter.
kalorimetrio* calorimetry.
kaloto callotte; (soldier's) rimless cap; (eccl.) skull-cap; (math.) segment of a sphere divided by a plane.
kalpako* calpac(k), busby.
kalquar (tr.) to counter-draw: to trace (a design through transparent paper); kalquopapero tracing-paper. Def.: Kopiar desegno tra diafana papero per kontinua streki; VI-116.
kalsono (pair of) drawers.
kalumniar (tr.) to calumniate; (cf. difamar, maldicensar, denigrar). Def.: Dicar mala neveraji pri ulu.
kalva bald: having but little hair. V. exp.: Kalveso ne esas kompleta senhareso; III-201.
kalvario Mount Calvary; a calvary: hill with a cross on top; (fig.) punishment, expiation.
Kalvinana Calvinistic; Kalvinano Calvinist; Kalvinanismo Calvinism.

kalzo stocking, hose; kalzeto sock; kalzego tights (as of a ballet girl); kalzifar to make s.; kalzumo a socklike shoe (without heels); kalzoligilo stocking suspender; lengthwise garter (cf. gartero).

kam (adv.) than, as, to (in comparison, degree); (cf. tam); plu . . kam more . . than; tam . . kam as . . as; min . kam less . . than; ne tam . . kam not so . . as; me preferas ico kam ito I prefer this to that; same . . kam same as, in the same manner as. Ex.: El esas plu afabla kam vu. Altru kam me. Me donos a vi la sama rekompenso kam a li. Venez tam rapide kam posible.
kamo (tech.) cam; kamarboro camshaft.
kamalio* (ancient armor) camail: chain mail guard for neck; a hooded cloak or mantle (esp. worn by bishops).
kamarado comrade, mate; kamaradeso comradeship.
kamarilio* camarilla (clique).

kambiar (tr.) to exchange (money, goods), to barter (ulo por ulo); kambio, kambieyo, kambierio money or goods exchange; kambiisto (money) exchanger; kambiebla exchangeable, convertible; kambie in exchange; kambioletro letter of e.; kambio libera od, liberkambio free-trade. V. exp.: Kambiar esas esence komercal ago, per qua on donas ulo por recevar altro. Omna kompro e vendo esas definitiva kambio di la kozo komprata o vendata po ula sumo de pekunio. Kambio sempre implikas du kozi e du personi; VII
kambrar (tr.) to camber: make slightly convex (a piece of wood, a road, a ship's deck, etc.); to throw out one's chest.
kameo cameo.
kamelo camel.
kameleono (zool. and fig.) chameleon.
kamelio (bot.) camelia (Camellia).
kameno chimney; kamentubo c. flue; korpo di kameno c. stack; kamenmantelo c. piece; kamensharpero: kamenisto c. sweep.
kamero (photog., tech.) camera; kamerobsckura camera obscura..
karmerlingo camerlingo (papal officer).
kamforo camphor; -iz-ita: camphorated; -iero: c.tree.
kamilo litter, stretchyer, hand-barrow; kamilisto stretcher-bearer.
kamiono dray, truck, lorry: long sideless four-wheeled, goods vehicle; kamioneto small dray; two wheeled hand truck. Def.: Kargo-veturo konstitucita ek platformo sur qua on pozas la vari; IV
kamizo (for men) shirt; (for women) chemise; kamizifisto s. maker;nokto kamizo night s.
kamizolo camisole: (woman's) negligee jacket; koakto kamizolo straight-jacket.
kamloto (fabric) camlet.
kamomilo (bot.) camomile (Matricaria chamomilla).
kampar (intr.) to camp out, encamp; kampeyo camping place; kampolito c. bed; kamputensili c. utensils. V. exp.: vid. bivakar.

kampaniar (intr.) to make a campaign; kampani(ad)o campaign(ing). V. exp.: En la milital senco, la vorto signifikas periodo di milital operaci. Ma ol havas anke altra senci, derivata o figurala: on parolas anke pri la (tote pacoza) kampanii di navigado di maristo o di navo, kampanii di explorado, di peskado, di laborado, di propagado; kampanii «elektala» di la kandidati ad elektala funcioni; kampanii di jurnali por o contre ulu od ulo, e.c.; I
kampanulo (bot.) campanula, bellflower, (genus: Campanula).
kampeshligno Campeachy wood, logwood.
kano (bot.) cane, reed; kanfluto reed-pipe.
kanabo hemp; kanabosemino hemp seed.
kanabino (orni.) linnet (Acanthis cannabina).
kanalo canal; kanaleto channel, gutter, small trench; kanaligar to canalize: make like a c.; kanalizar to canalize: to provide with c.s (a field); kanalbatelo c. boat.
kanalia, kanaliala of the lowest class of people, rascally; kanali(ul)o rascal, scoundrel, scamp; kanaliaro rabble, canaille, riff-raff, roughs; kanalieso, kanaliajo blackgardism, rascality.
kanapeo sofa; lit kanapeo sofa-couch. V. exp.: vid. divano.
kanario (orni.) canary(-bird).
kancelero chancellor. (N.B. not a secretary); granda kancelero High C.
kancero (med.) cancer (cf. karcinomo).

kande (adv., conj.) when; de kande since when? how long since? quik kande immediately when, as soon as; kande until when? igrekande no matter when. Ex.: Kande vu pagos vua debaji? Irge kande me audas la uceli kantar. De kande vu lojas hike? Quik kande il envenis, ni omna levis ni polite.
kandelo candle; -iero: candlestick; kandelfesto Candlemas.
kandelabro candelabrum.
kandio (sugar-) candy.
kandida candid, frank, ingenuous; kandideso candor. Def.: (kandideso) Sincereso e naiveso di persono senkulpa, bonvoloza, qua ne konocas la vicio; III
kandidato candidate; kandidatesar to be a c. (por, pri).
kanelo, kanelaro, kanelizuro channel(ing), slot, fluting, groove (usually in form of half-circle: cf. ranuroand VI
kanetilio purl: a spiral of gold or silver wire used in lace work; silver wire (to cover violin strings, etc.); (milin.) wire-ribbon.
kanguruo (zool.) kangaroo.
kanibala, kanibal(ul)o cannibal, man-eater; kanibaleso, kanibalismo cannibalism, anthropophagy.
kanikulo the dog days (22nd July to 23rd Aug.); (astron.) Canicula: the Dog Star; kanikulala canicular.
kanina (dento) canine (tooth).
kankro crawfish, crayfish (family Astacidae); (astron.) Cancer, The Crab.
kankroido cancroid.
kanoo (wooden) canoe: light and shallow boat shart at both ends (as used for pleasure). Def. : Pirogatra kanoto kun pintatra extremaji, facita ek dina ligno, movanta ordinare per pagayi.

kanono (milit.) cannon; (eccl.) canon, rules; kanonaro (milit.) artillery; kanonagar, kanonpafar (tr.) to cannonade; kanonpafo c. shot; kanonobuso c. ball, shell; kanonisto gunner; kanonyuristo (eccl.) canonist; kanonaleso canonicity; kanonbatelo gun-boat, kanonvishilo (artil.) sponge, wiper; kanonacendilo quick-match.
kanonik(ul)o canon, prebend (of a cathedral); kanonikaro chapter.
kanonizar* (tr.) to canonize (as a saint).

kanoto punt, skiff, yawl, wherry; kanoto granda long-boat, barge, cutter; (cf. barko, kanoo, pirogo); kanotagar to go boating. Def.: Mikra batelo senlerdeka, movata per remili, segli, motori, e ordinare uzata en maral aqui.
kansono song: ballad, ditly, carol, glee; (cf. kanto).
kantar (tr.) to sing, carol, (of birds) to warble, (of a cock) to crow; (as in churches) to chant; kantetar to hum (a tune); kantera ucelo: songster (of birds).
kantabilo* cantabile: an easy, flowing melody.
kantarelo (bot.) chanterelle: an edible mushroom (Cantharellus cibarius)..
kantarido (ent.) cantharis, Spanish-fly, blister-beetle (Cantharis vesicatoria); kantaridi (also pharm.) cantharides.
kantato (mus.) cantata.
kantiko (mus.) canticle.
kantileno cantilena: a simple sentimental melody. Def. Speco di kansono, anciena o lamentema; V
kantino canteen: refreshment place for soldiers, workers, etc.
kantono canton: a district, as in Switzerland.
kantoro cantor: a chorister, chanter, singer; esp. the leader of a church choir; a porcentor.
kanulo (surg.) canula, drainage tube (for wounds), enema-pipe; (in gen.) pipe or nozzle (of a syringe).
kanvaso canvas.
kaolino kaolin: porcelain clay.
kaoso (pr. and fig.) chaos.

kapo (anat. and fig.) head; kapala relating to h., cephalic; kapo avane headlong, headforemost; kapnuda bareheaded; kapdoloro headache; kapkuseno pillow; kapturn(ad)o giddiness; kaplejera, kapo light-headed (person); kaprupto headbreaking; kapvesto head-gear; kapo sencerebra a brainless head; sen kapa head-less; kapkaulo headed cabbage (Brassica oleracea capitata); kaptuko kerchief; kaptranchar (tr.) to behead.
kapabla able (to do, to execute), capable; (cf. kompetenta, apta, suffix kapabliv); V. exp.: vid. habila. Ant.: nepovanta, nepotenta, nekapabla.

kapaca able (to contain, to hold); kapac(esoz)a: capacious, spacious; kapaceso: capacity; krugo kapaca de lu litri (o, krugo kun kapaceso de du litri) a mug of two litres capacity; tre kapac(esoz)a navo a very capacious ship.
kapear (intr., nav.) to lie to.
kapelo chapel; kapelisto, kapelestro: chaplain.
kapelino sun-bonnet: hood to shade head and neck from sun.
kapero (bud) caper; kaperiero caper (-shrub) (genus: Capparis); kapersauco c. sauce.
kapilara (phys.) capillary; kapilareso capillarity; kapilarag(ad)o c. action; kapilara tubo, vaskulo a c.
kapistro (surg.) head bandage for fracture of lower jaw.
kapitano (milit., naval) captain; kapitaneso: (dignity, position) captaincy, captainship.
kapitelo (arch.) capital.
kapitulo* (anat., bot.) capitulum; (rel.) «capitule:» a short prayer.
kapitulacar (intr., milit.) to capitulate.
kapono capon.
kaponiero (fort.) caponiere, caponiere.
kaporalo (milit.) corporal: squad leader.
kapoto overcoat: storm or heavy coat (as worn by soldiers: cf. gabano, surtuto) (nav.) hood: a cover for a companion hatch, engine, etc.; (engine) bonnet; (auto.) hood.
kapro, kaprulo, kaprino goat; kaprogardisto g. herd; yun kaprala ganti kid gloves; kaprosalto leap-frog. Def.: (Kaprosalto) Salto per qua unu saltas super la dorso di altru plu o min inklinita; VII
kapreolo, kapreolulo, kapreolino roe-deer (Cervus capreolus).
kaprico caprice, whim; kapricoza, kapricema capricious; me havis kaprico por ta muliero I had a fancy, a caprice for that woman; la kaprici di la modo the caprices of fashion.
kaprifolio (bot.) honeysuckle (genus: Lonicera).
kaprikorno (astron.) Capricorn.
kaprimulgo (orni.) goatsucker (Caprimulgus europaeus).
kapriolar (intr.) to caper, cut capers; (cf. kabrar); kapriolo capriole: a leap, caper (as in dancing), a leap that a horse makes with all fours without advancing.
kapstano (tech.) capstan.
kapsulo (bot., anat., pharm., tech.) capsule; (fire-arms) percussion-cap.

kaptar (tr.) to capture: catch hold of, gripe, snatch; (cf. sizar, prenar); kaptajo prize, prey, booty; kaptat(ul)o captive, prisoner; kaptiteso captivity, bondage; -ilo: trap, snare; -ar ye la kolumo; to collar (ulu).

kaptacar (tr.) to inveigle: to obtain by underhand manoeuvers or bribery or ruse, to captivate (in an ill sense); testamento obtenita per kaptaco will obtained by intrigue or undue influence; -o-laco, -slingo:snare. Ex.: Kaptaca la fido, la heredajo di ulu.
kapuco (person's) hood, cowl; -izar: to hood, put cowl on.
kapucin(ul)o a Capuchin (friar monk); kapucinalajo (fig.) a dull sermon.
kara, karo, karulo, karino dear (affection: cf. chera).
karabo (ent.) carabus, carabid (genus: Carabidae).
karabino carbine: short rifle; karabiniero carbineer; karabinhoko c. hook, snap-hook, swivel-hook.
karafo carafe, decanter (for wine, water, etc. at table).
karakalo (zool.) caracal (Lynx caracal).
karakolar (intr.) to caracole.

karaktero (distinctive quality of a person or thing) character; karakterizar to characterize; karakteriziva, karakterizivo, karakteruro characteristic, specification. Ex.: il esas homo di alte etikal karaktero. Ol havas la karaktero distingiva di la vereso (E. it has the distinctive character (characteristic or stamp) of truth; Tala ago bone karakterizas mea amiko. La karakterizivi di morbo. Karakteriziva signo.
karakteristiko* (math., logarithms) characteristic.
karambolar (intr.) to make a cannon (at billiards).
karamelo caramel, burnt sugar (confection).
karasino* crucian, a carplike fish (Carassius vulgaris); karasinorea goldfish (Carassius auratus).
karato carat: part or weight of precious stones or gold.
karavano caravan.
karavanserayo caravansary, inn.
karavelo (naut. hist.) caravel.

karbo (chem.) carbon; karbala, karboza carbonaceous, carbonic; karbido carbide; karbato carbonate; karbobioxo, karbatacido carbondioxide, carbonic acid. V. exp.: L'Akademio adoptis karbono en la vulgara senco e karbo por la kemial elemento; IV

karbono coal (cf. karbo); karbonoza full of c., carboniferous; karbonigar to make into or change to coal; karbonizar to cover with c.; (fig.) to besmut; ter, min karbono pit-coal; ligno karbono charcoal; karbonfairo c. fire; karbonfumo c. smoke: karbongaso c. gas; karbonmineyo, karbonerio c. mine; karbonpulvero c. dust; karbonvendisto c. dealer; karbonifar, karboneskar to be charred, smolder (of wicks).
karbonaro* (Ital. hist.) carbonaro.
karbonario (ich.) coal-fish, pollack, (Gadus, carbonarius, Pollachius carbonarius).
karbunklo (gem and ulcer) carbuncle.
karburar* (tr.) to carburet, carburize, carbonize.
karburatoro* (autom.) carburetor.
karcero prison, gaol, jail; karcerano prisoner; karcergardisto prison guard, warden; karcero statala state's p.; karcerocelulo (subtera) dungeon; (milit.) black-hole.
karcinomo (med.) carcinoma, cancer (cf. kancero).
kardar (tr.) to card (wool).
karkamino (bot.) cardamine: bittercress, land-cress; karkamino pratala lady's smock, cuckoo flower: the common buttercress.
kardamomo (bot.) cardamon (Eletaria cardamomum, an species of Amomum).
kradano Cardan joint, universal joint.
kardelo (orni.) goldfinch (Carduelis elegans, C. fringella).
kardinala (math. and fig.) cardinal; kardinala nombro c. number; kardinala punto c. point; kardinalvertuo c. virtue.
kardinalo (prelate) cardinal; kardinalea c. colored; kardinaleso cardinalate; kardinalbireto cardinal's cap; kardinalchapelo c. hat.
kardioido* (math.) cardioid.
kardono (bot.) thistle; sen kardonigar to clear of thistles.

karear (tr.) to do without (involuntarily), to dispense with (from necessity); to make shift without; kareebla dispensible: wanted but not needed; kareajo something wanted but which one has not or cannot have now. V. exp.: Me indijas ulo = to mankas a me, e me bezonas ol; me kareas ulo = to mankas a me, e me ne bezonas ol: me povas esar (agar, vivar) sen ol. Me facile kareas krinkar kande me kelke durstas. Me ne povas karear fairo en vintro. Me ne povas karear dormo. En voyajo on devas karear multa kozi III
karelo (square) slab, tile, plaque, plate; (in cards) diamond; karelizar to pave (a surface with tiles, bricks, etc.); karelatra, kareloza tesselated.
kareno lower hull, ship's bottom (part under water). V. exp.: Kareno signifikas ne nur la kilio, ma la tota surfaco di navo, qua esas imersita; IV
karesmo Lent; mez karesmo Mid-Lent; praktikar la karesmo to keep L.
karezar to caress: fondle with affection; karezachar to fawn upon, cajole, wheedle. Ex.: Karezar infanto. La zefiro karezas la flori. Karezachar oldulo por igar il facar sua testamento.

kragar (tr.) to load (goods; N.B. not to load a vehicle): kragajo load, cargo, freight, burden; kragobatelo ligher, barge; kragokavalo parck-horse; kragoletro way-bill, bill of lading; kragoselo pack-saddle; kragoverturisto drayman. Ex.: Kargar vari sur veturo. Kargajo di navo. V. exp.: vid. chargar.
kariar (intr., med.) to have caries, to have decay or rot of teeth; (of wheat) to be smutly; kariinta dento a decayed tooth; kariinta arboro rotten tree.
kariatido (arch.) caryatide. Def.: Hominala figuro, qua servas kom suportilo: (cf. atlanto).
karibuo* (zool.) caribou; (cf. rentiro).
karico (bot.) carex (carices): sedge.
kariero (profession, trade) career; la kariero di militisto the military c., profession of arms; legala kariero legal c. or profession.
kariko box-coat; coat with long cape or serveral short ones.
karikatar (tr.) to caricature; karikaturo a c.
kariofilo (bot.) clove.
karitato charity: spiritual benevolence (N.B. not alms; cf. almono).
karlino (bot.) carline thistle (genus Carlina).
karmelit(ul)o* Carmelite friar.
karmezina, karmezino crimson.
karmenino carmine; karmeninea, karmeninreda, karmeninatra c. colored.

karno flesh, meat; karnea f. colored, rosy; karnajo a fleshy object, a piece of meat; karnala of the flesh; carnal; karnvendeyo butcher's establ.; karnoza fleshy, brawny; karnomanjanta, karno; karnoavida flesh-eat-ing; -er; fond of meat; (cf. karnivora); karnifar, karnigar (intr., tr.) to produce, to make flesh (on); karneskar to become fleshy; karnofumizado smoke-drying beef; karnoreda blood-red, carnation (color); karnovermo maggot.
karnaciono carnation: flesh-tint, complexion. Ex.: Ica koloro ne konvenas a mea karnaciono. La karnacioni en ica pikturo (protreto) esas tre natural.
karnavalocarnival.
karnivora, karnivoro carnivorous (animal).
karonado (artil.) carronade. Def.: Speco di navala kanono (anciena); VI
karoso coach: a large closed carriage; ornamental coach (for state occasions). V. exp.: vid. kalesho.
karoto (bot.) carrot (plant and root).
karotida, karotido carotid (artery).
karpo (anat.) carpus: wrist; (ich.) carp (Cyprinus carpio); karpala (anat.) carpal.

karpentar (tr.) to work timber, do carpenter work. V. exp.: La karpentisto facas nur grosa laboruri ek ligno, generale por domi e konstrukturi. La menuzisto facas plu mikra laboruri, konseque plu preciza e delikata, exemple por mobli, parqueti, eskaleri, e.c. La ebenisto juste plakizas ebono(-plaki) sur mobli, tabli, e.c., ma per extenso on povas uzar ica vorto por plak-laboristo en altra ligno kam ebeno, en senco simila a menuzisto; IV
krapino (bot.) hornbeam(-tree), (genus: Carpinus).
karto a card; kartuyo c. case: intermixar la karti to shuffle the c.s; pozar la karti to lay down the c.s.
kartamo (bot.) safflower (Carthamus tinctorius).
kartamino:* (chem.) carthamin(e): red-coloring matter from safflower.
kartavar (intr.) to pronounce one's r's gutterally; kartavo (Northumbrian) burr.
kartelo cartel: letter of defiance or challenge, as to a duel.
kartero (autom.) crank-case, motorcover; (bicycle) chain-case.
karteziana* Cartesian; karteziandiablo, plunjanto (phys.) C. Devil or diver, bottle-imp; (cf. ludiono).
kartilago (anat.) cartilage, gristle.
kartocho cartridge; kartochuyo c. holder, -box: kartochiferio c. making establ.
kartografio cartography.
kartono cardboard, pasteboard; kartonbuxo, kartonkesto carton (box); kartonizar, kartonbindar, kartonkovrar to put up in cartons (ulo), to bind in boards (books).
kartusho (arch.) cartouch(e): a scroll shaped ornament.
kartuzio Carthusian convent, kartuziliquoro chartreuse; kartuziano C. Friar.
karubo (bot.) carob-bean; karubiero c. tree (Ceratonia siliqua).
karunkto (med., bot.) caruncle.
karuselo carrousel: tilting tournament.
kaso coffer, till, cash-box, treasury; kasisto, kasero cashier, paymaster, treasurer; kaserio treasury (establ.); kontar sua kaso to make up the cash account.: kasostando, enkasa sumo cash in hand.

kasacar (tr.) to quash, annul, reverse, to declare null and void, to invalidate; korto di kasaco (in France) court of cassation (the supreme court of appeal); kasacar testamento to quash a will; kasacar mariajo to annul a marriage.
kashaloto cachalot: sperm whale.
kashmiro (fabric) cashmere; kashmirshalo c. shawl.
kasio (fruit) cassia; -iero: c. tree.
kasiso (fruit) black currant; kasisiero b.c. bush or tree; -liquoro: b.c. cordial.
kasko helmet, casque.
kaskado (pr. and fig.) cascade.
kasono caisson: under-water cofferdam; cradle to lift ships from the water; (cf. municionofurgono).
kasqueto (for men or boys) cap with visor (as golf-cap, naval officer's cap, etc.).
kasrolo saucepan, stewpan, skillet; (chem.) casserole.
kasto caste: class of society.
kastano chestnut (edible nut); kastaniero c. tree (genus: Castanea); kaval kastaniero horse-c. (Aesculus hippocastanum); kastanea, kastanbruna c. colored cf. marono).
kastanyeto, kastanyeti (mus.) castanet(s).
kastelo castle; avana kastelo (nav.) forecaste; dopa kastelo (nav.) poop.
kastono bezel (of a ring).
kastoro (zool.) castor: a beaver (genus: Castor); kastorchapelo a beaver-hat; kastordrapo beaver-cloth.
kastrar (tr.) to castrate, geld.
kato, katulo, katino cat, kateto, katyuno small cat, kitten; genituro di katino litter of kittens.
katafalko catafalque.
katakombo catacomb.
katakrezo*: (rhet.) catachresis.
katalepsio catalepsy; katalepsiika, katalepsiiko cataleptic (person).
katalizar* (tr., chem.) to catalyse; katalizo catalysis; katalizivo catalytic.
katalogo catalogue; katalogizar to c. V. exp.: vid. avizo.
katalpo (bot.) catalpa(-tree) (genus: Catalpa).
kataplasmo (med.) cataplasm: a poultice.
katapulto catapult.
kataro (med.) catarrh; katareto a cold; katarala, kataroza, katarika, katariko catarrhal; donar katar(et)o ad (ulu) to give a cold to; kaptesar da katar(et)o to catch cold.
katarakto cataract (blindness and waterfall).
katastrofo catastrophy (cf. kalamitato, kataklismo). Ex. L'erupto di Vesuvius esis granda katastrofo.
katedro desk (of a professor); pulpit (in a church); ek (la) katedro (fig.) ex cathedra (L.), openly; avowedly, professedly.
katedralo cathedral.
kategorio category.
kategorika categorical.
katekismo (book) catechism; katekismero catechist (cf. katekizero).
katekizar (tr.) to catechize; katekizero catechist. Def.: Docar la katekismo; instruktar ulu per questioni et respondi pri la precipua punti di (Kristana) religio.
katekumeno catechumen.

kateno (pr. and fig.) chain; katenizar to c. up (ulu, ulo); katenigar to link together, connect; katenifisto c.maker; katenkurvo (arch.) catenary arch; katenringo c. link; katenmasho c. mesh; kateno di la eventi c. of events; katenigo concatenation.
kateto* (geom.) cathetus.
katetero* (surg.) catheter.
katguto (surg.) catgut.
kationo* (chem.) cation.
katisar (tr.) to give a gloss, a luster to (cloth, by hot or cold pressing).
katodo* (elec.) cathode.
katolika, katolik(ul)o Catholic; katolikaro Catholics (collect.); katolikeso Catholicity; katolikismo Catholicism.
katoptriko (opt.) catoptrics; (cf. dioptriko). Def.: Teorio di la speguli (omnaspeca) ed optikal instrumenti kompozita ek speguli; IV
kauchuka, kauchuko caoutchouc: India-rubber.
kauciono (jur.) surety, bail, security, caution; kaucionsumo s. money; kaucionizar to stand bail or go surety for (ulu); (cf. garantiar); liberigar ulu per kauciono to liberate on bail.
kaudo (also fig.) tail; train (of a gown); kaudala caudal; kaudagar, kaudagitar to wag or switch the tail; sen kauda tailless; kaudportero train-bearer.
kaulo cabbage (Brassica oleracea); kaulrapo kohlrabi (B. o. caulorapa); kaulosupo c. soup.
kaustika* caustic; (chem.) burning, corrosive; (fig.) biting, stinging, satirical (language, etc.); kaustika kalko c. lime, quick-lime; kaustiko (math.) caustic curve; kaustikajo a c. substance.
kautero (surg.) cautery; kauterizar to cauterize.

kauzo cause: that which produces an effect; kauzala, kauziganta causal, causative; kauzeso causality; nula efekto sen kauzo no effect without a c.; prima kauzo primary c. Ant.: efekto rezultajo, konsequant(aj)o.

kava hollow, sunken; kavo, kavajo (natural) hollow, cavity, kavigar to h. out, scoop out (by natural causes cf. exkavar); arboro kava a h. tree, dento kava h. tooth; kava okuli, vangi h. eyes; sunken cheeks; la pluvi kavigis la tero the rains hollowed out the ground.

kavalo horse, steed; (at chess) knight; kavalala equine; kavalulo stallion; kavalino mare; kavalacho hack; kavalisto horse-man; kavaleyo, kavalstablo stable; kaval(eduk)erio stud; kavalfako h.stall, box; kavalfeko h.dung; kavalferisto farrrier, h.shoer; kavalkarno h. meat; kavalkrino h. hair; kavalo bankardala wheeler; kavalpedo foot of a h.; kavalpovo (mechan.) h. power; kavalraso h. family; kavalservisto, kavalsorgisto groom, ostler; kavalstulo pannier kavallegilo, kavalreto covering for a h.: kavalvendisto h. dealer.
kavaliero knight; kavalierala, kavalieratra chivalrous, knighthly; kavaliereso, kavalieraro knighthood, chivalry.

kavalkar (tr.) to ride (as on a horse); kavalkantaro cavalcade; kavalkero, kavalkisto horseman, equerry; kavalkala equestrian; kavalkodocisto riding master; kavalke astride; kavalkbloko h. block. Ex.: Kavalkar kavalo, asno. La sorcistini kavalkas bastoni. Sidar kavalke (E. astride) sur benko.
kavalrio (milit.) cavalry; kavalriano cavalryman.
kavatino (mus.) cavatina.
kaviaro caviare.

kayo quay; (R.R.) platform. Def.: Rivo masonita et vertikal (alonge rivero, lago et metafore la senco fervoyala), qua posibligas l'embarko o desembarko di personi, vari, o por charjar e descharjar navi; VI
kayero blank-book: a few sheets of paper stiched together and covered with a wrapper.

kazo (jur., gram., med. and general) case (N.B. not casing); kaze ke (conj.) in case (that); kazo (o, questiono) di koncienco a case of conscience; kazo di pendigo a hanging matter; segun la kazo according to the case; omnakaze (o, kazsupoze): in any case; takaze in that case; nulkaze in no case; en omna kazo in any case, in any event; ni prenos nia parapluvi, kaze ke pluvo rikomencus we will take our umbrellas in case it may rain; preparez la chambro por la kazo ke il venus prepare a room in case he should come; en la kazo ke il venoz, enduktez il in case he comes, show him in.
kazako cassock: a large sleeved coat formely worn by soldiers; (woman's) long jacket (for outdoor wear); kazaketo (woman's) short jacket; (cf. sutano).
kazeo (o, kremkazeo): cream cheese (cf. fromajo); kazealtra caseous; kazeifar to make c..
kazeino casein.
kazemato (fort.) casemate.
kazerno barrack (for soldiers); enkazernigar to quater troops in b.s.
kazimiro (fabric) cassimere, kerseymere.
kazino casino: assembly room for cardplaying, etc.

kazuala contingent, casual, fortuitous, precarious; kazualo a contingent thing (as, a prequisite, extra salary, etc.); kazuala ofico office held during pleasure; kazuala revenui incidental revenues; la kazuali di la paroko the casual income or fees of the vicar. Def.: Hazardala, acidentala acesora.
kazuaro (orni.) cassowary (genus: Casuaris).
kazuisto casuist (in case of conscience).
kazuistiko casuistry: science or doctrine of right and wrong; kazuistikacha sophistical.

ke (conj.) that (where it unites a clause with the principal sentence; it is often united with prepositions to form subordinating conjunctions): pro ke because; por ke in order that (followed by imperative); dum ke while, during the time that; pos ke after; til ke until; de ke because, from (with participle); depos ke, de kande ke since; kontre ke while (contrast); malgre ke notwithstanding that; per ke thru the fact that; segun ke accoding to whether; sen ke without (with participle); ultre ke besides that; vice ke instead that: (ke is likewise joinded with adverbs); tale ke so that, in such a way that; tante ke so much that; tante longe ke so long that; tante ofte ke so often that; tante plu...ke all the more so as; kase ke in case (that); kondicione ke on condition (that); unfoye ke once (that).; omnafoye ke everytime that; supoze ke supposing that; time ke for fear that; (cf. Talmey's Text Book, p. 92).
keglo skittle; ninepin; keglaro a set of skittles or ninepins; kegleyo, keglsulo bowling-alley, s. ground; ludar per kegli to play s.s.
kelo (tech.) (wedge-) key, peg, cotter-pin, linch-pin, gib; kelagar, kelizar to fasten with a pin.
kelero cellar.

kelka, kelki some, a few, a little: indicates an indeterminate but not large number, quantity or degree; (cf poka); kelko someting; kelku somebody, someone; kelketo a little bit; kelkafoye sometime; kelkatempe sometimes; kelkaloke somewhere, in some parts or, or some place; me esas kelke fatigita I am somewhat tired; donez a me kelka pano give me some bread; lu esas kelke maladeta he is somewhat sick; me vartis ilu dom kelka tempo I waited some time for him. Def: Nedeterminita (tamen negranda) nombro, o quanto, o grado. V. exp.: Kelka, poka: On povas uzar kelka por indikar plu granda nombro (o, quanteso) kam poka. Ex.: La mediko dicas a sua kuracato: «Vu drinkas tro multa biro. (1) Vu darfas drinkar kelka (t.e. negranda quanto, forasn tri o quar glasi singladie). (2) Vu darfas drinkar poka (t.e. mikra quanto, forsan nur un glaso de biro).» La signifiki di la sama radiki kelkafoye (pokafoye) tote diferas en la Angla de la Franca (en ca frazo, kelkafoye signifikas preske ofte, relative ofte; pokafoye signifikus preske nultempe, relative des-ofte (E. rarely).
kemio chemistry; kemiala chemical; kemiisto chemist (N.B. not a druggist).
kenelo (cook.) quenelle: a forcemeat ball.
kepio kepi: milit. cap worn by French soldiers.
keratino* ceratin(e), keratin.
kermeso, kermesi (ent.) kermes; (genus: Kermes).
kerno kernel, stone (of fruits); core (of statutes, etc.); kerneto pip; kernoza full of kernels.
keroseno* kerosene (cf. nafto, petrolo).
kerubo cherub.
kesto packing-case, box, chest (of tea, soap, etc.); case (of wine, etc.); (cf. kofro, buxo); kesteto small case; (fig.) (small) casket.
«khan» khan: (title and caravansary).
«khedive» khedive.
kikar (intr.) to kick (out behind, of horses, and other animals); (cf. pedofrapar); kikema, kikera kicker (tendency).
kilio (ship's, boat's) keel.
kilogramo kilogram (2.2 lbs).
kilogramometro kilogrammeter (unit of energy or work).
kilolitro kiloliter (220 galls).
kilometro kilometer (0.62 mile).
kilsono (nav.) keelson.
kimero (pr. and fig.) chimera; kimera, kimerala, kimeratra, kimerema chimerical, fanciful, visionary.
«kimono»: (garment) kimono.

kin five (for derivations, cf. du); kinadekyara, kino (person) 50 years old; kinyarala quinquennial: which takes place every five years; kinyara, kinopa quinquennial: which lasts five years; kinfranka peco a five-franc piece.
kiosko kiosk; (fig.) news stand.
kiragro chiragra. Def.: Goto en la manui.
kirko (building) church; (cf. eklezio).
kiromanciar (tr.) to read the hand of; kiromancio chiromancy, palmistry.
kiroptero chiropter: bat (order: Chiroptera).
kirsho kirsh (-wasser).
kirurgio chirurgery; surgery; kirurgiala surgical, kirurgiisto surgeon.
kisar (tr.) to kiss; kisegar to give a hearty kiss to.
«kismet»: kismet.
kisto (med.) cyst.
kizelguro*: kieselguhr.
klado first (or rough) draft (of a writing); kladifar to make a rough draft.

klakar (intr.) to clap (per) (as with the hands), to clack, smack (as the lips, the tongue against the palate), to chatter (as teeth from cold); klakigar to clap, to crack (the fingers, a whip, etc.); klakoplanko: clapper; klak! smack! pop! V. exp.: Ta vorto indikas altra bruiso kam karkar; klako esas bruiso di shoko (momentala) di du surfaci plu or min plata; krako esas bruiso (qua povas durar) di ulo qua ruptesas frakasesas; III

klamar (tr.) to shout, exclaim, vociferate, cry aloud (words); klam(ad)o shout(ing), clamor: outcry; klamala exclamative; klamisto public crier; klamachar to bawl, squall; klamopunto exclamation point. V. exp.: On vokas sempre ulu: on klamas olu. On povas sempre ulu; on klamas ulo. On povas vokar sen klamar (per signalo, sonilo); on povas klamar sen vokar; IV
klamido chlamys: ancient mantle.
klano clan.

klapo any flat piece turning on a axis; as: flapvalve; leaf (of a folding door); flap (of a pocket or envelope or table); klapsidilo flap-seat, folding-seat; kamenoklapo damper. Def.: Omna plana peco, qua povas turnar cirkum axo en sua plano; V

klara clear: free from all dims, blurs, obscures, obstructs; (fig.) plain, evident; klareso clearness, light, plainness; klarigar to clarify, make clear, elucidate; klareskar to become clear; klarobskuro chiaroscuro; klarvid(ad)o clear sightedness, clairvoyance; klara aquo clear water; klara koloro light color; klarblua okuli clear (or light) blue eyes; klara mento clear mind; klara voco clear voice; la defino ne esas klara the definition is not clear; klarigar la signifiko to elucidate the meaning; klarigar la voyo to clear the road; klarirgar afero to clear up a business. Ant.: obskura, nelimpida, konfuza.
klarineto (mus.) clarinet.
klariono clarion: military bugle; (cf. buglo, trumpeto). Def.: Speco di trumpeto kun sono akuta e penetranta, uzata da soldati e milit-navisti.

klaso (all senses) class; klaso laboristala laboring cl.; klasolukto c. struggle; ca verko ne konvenas ad omna klasi di lektanti this work does not suit all classes (all kinds) of readers; artisto di la unesma klaso a first class artist; bilieto di la duesma kalso a second class ticket; dividar la lernanti en du klasi to divide the learners into two classes; klaso di maniferi class of mammals.
klasifikar (tr.) to classify.
klasika classical; klasiko a classic; klasikano a classicist.
klaudikar (intr.) to be lame, to hall, limp, hobble, (in walking); klaudikigar to cause (ulu) to limp, to make lame (in legs): klaudikar en la du pedi to be lame, to limp with both feet.
kauwno clown.
klauzo clause, stipulation, article (in a contract, will, etc.; N.B. not in sentence; cf. membro di frazo).
klavo key (of a key-board); (cf. klefo); klavaro keys (collect.), key-board. Def. La extramjo di levero quan on presas por produktar ula efekto (en piano, orgeno, telegrafilo, tiposkribilo, e.c.); VI
kalvikordo harpsichord, klavichord.
klavikulo (antat.) clavicle, collarbone.

klefo key (to locks, also fig.); klefagar, klefeklosar (tr.) to lock (ulu); klefisto (karcerala) turnkey; klefringo k. ring; chefa klefo master-key; -o di cienci k. to the sciences. Def.: Utensilo usata por apelar seruri, generale per rotaco cirkum lua axo: VI-28.

klemar (tr.) to press closely together, squeeze, tighten, clench; klemar la ligili to tighten the bonds; klemar la ligili di amikeso (fig.) to tighten the bonds of friendship. Ex.: Klemar skrubo, freno, nodo, junturo, manuo.
klematido (bot.) clematis (genus: Clematis).
klementa clement, merciful, lenient. Def.: Indulgema e pardonema (anke teologiala senco); III593. Ant. severa, nepardonema.
klepsidro clepsydra: water-clock.

klerik(ul)o cleric, clergyman; klerikala clerical; klerikaro clergy (collect.); klerikana; ano, klerikisto clericalist, partisan of clericalism; klerikeso ministry, holy orders; klerikismo clericalism.
klerko (office) clerk (of a notary, lawyer); klerkeso clerkship; chef klerko chief c.; (cf. komizo).
klifo cliff.
kliko pawl, (spring-)catch; klikizar to cog with a catch; klikoroto ratchet-wheel. Def.: Movebla levero-brakio qua, ingranante roto-denti, povas impedar la movo dil rotoen movo en sinso kontrea.

kliktar (intr.) to clank, click, clack, clash, clatter: to make a sudden, sharp noise by striking; klikt(ad)o clang(ing), clank (of armour, of chains); klikteto click, jingle (as of classes); kliktili snappers, bones.
klimar (tr., intr.) to climb (up), clamber (over), mount, ascend (by hand or foot or tendrils). Ex.: Klimar (sur) arboro, monto. La planto klimas til la duesma etajo.
klimato climate.
klimatologio* climatology.
klinar (tr., intr.) to overlap, to cover partially, to clinkerbuild. Def.: Superpozar la bordi di la folii di tolo o la planki qui kompozas la kareno di batelo, e.c.; IV
kliniko (med.) clinic.
klinko latch (of doors, etc.).
klinometro clinometer.
klipero (nav.) clipper(-ship): fast sailing ship.
klishar (tr.) to take a stereotype of something to be printed; klishuro stereotype; (photog.) negative, cliche; (cf. stereotipar).
klitorido (anat.) clitoris.
klivar (tr.) to cleave (crystal, a diamond).
kloako (antiq.) cloaca; (gen.) a sewer; (anat.) cloaca.

kloko o'clock; of (by) the clock; esas un kloko it is one o'clock; esas du kloki it is two o'clock; tri kloki dek (minuti) ten minutes past three; quar kloki e quarimo quarter past four; kin kloki e duimo half past five; sis kloki e tri quarimi a quater to seven; sep kloki kinadek (minuti) ten minutes to eight; ok kloki kinadek e kin (minuti) five minutes to nine; ante tri kloki matine before three o'clock in the morning; pos ok kloki e duimo verspere after half past eight in the evening. (Note: «What time is it?» is translated «Qua tempo esas?». In some countries in Europe the hours are counted continuously from midnight to midnight, therfore: duadek kloki (twenty o'clock) eight o'clock in the evening. kloklibro (di la fervoyo) railway guide.
klonuso (med.) clonic spasm.
kloro chlorine (gas); kloracido hydro-chloric (or,, muriatic) acid; klorato chlorate; kloratacido chloric acid.
klorofilo* chlorophyll.
kloroformo chloroform; kloroformagar, kloroformizar to c. (ulu).
kloroso (med.) chlorosis, green sickness; klorosika, iko chlorotic (person).

klosho a bell; anything in the form of a b.: klosheto little b., hand b.; klosharo collections of b.s; chimes: kloshturmo b. steeple, belfry; kloshario, muziko (the music of) chimes; klosh(aro)plear (intr.); kloshsonigar (tr.) to play chimes, to ring the bells; kloshpleisto, kloshero chimer; kloshsonigisto, kloshero b. ringer.
klostro cloiter: coverered arcade, especially around a monastic building.

klozar (tr.) to close, shut (up) (a door, a window, a room, a way, the eyes, a wound, etc.); klozeyo inclosed place, close; klozajo someting inclosed, an inclosure; klozilo fence barrier; klozagrafo, klozobuklo clasp, buckle, snap; klefklozar to lock; klozetar la okuli to blink the eyes; miklozita half-closed; klozopetro keystone; klozpunisar to keep in (for punishment), to restrict liberty (mililt.).
klubo (social) club; klubano clubman.
klukar (intr.) to cluck, cackle (of poultry).
kluzo (nav.) hawse-hole.

knikar (tr.) to bend a thing so as to occasion a flaw in it (yet no entirely to break it), to crack, flaw; (cf. krakar, flexar, fendar). Def.: Strenar korpo relative longa, ex. stango, per preso en la longesal directiono sur la du extremaji .
knuto knout.
koadjutoro coadjutor.
koagular (tr., intr.) to coagulate, curdle, clot, curd.

koaktar (tr.) to constrain, coerce, oblige, compel, force (N.B. this refers espacially to moral; social, intellectual compulsion, rather than physical force; cf. forco, forsar); respekto, gratitudo, autoritato koaktas me silencar respect, gratitude, authority compel me to be silent; ne koatkez il do not use compulsion with him; vivo esas perpeuta koakto life is a perpetual constraint; koaktanta, koaktiva povo coactive, coercive power; koaktokamizolo strait-jacket.
koalisar (intr.) to form a coalition (kun); koaliso, koalisuro coalition: union of persons, parties or states.
koaltaro* coal tar: tar made from coal.
kobalto (min.) cobalt.
kobayo (zool.) guinea-pig (Cavia cobaya).
kobeo (bot.) cobaea (Cobaea).
koboldo koblod: imp, hobglobin, familiar spirit or brownie, puck, sprite.
kochenilo (insect and dye) cochineal.
kocigo* (anat.) coccyx.
kocinelo (ent.) coccinella: ladybird, ladybug.
kodexo (legal, signal, etc.) code, codex; kodexo farmaciala pharmacopoeia, dispensatory; kodexigar to codify.
kodicilo (jur.) codicil.
koeficiento (alg.) coefficient.
kofio bonnet, cap, coil (such as worn only by country women).
kofro trunk, coffer, chest; (cf. kesto); kofreto small trunk, portemanteau.
koherar (intr.) to cohere, be coherent; koheranta, koherema, koheriva coherent, cohesive, consistent; koherero coherer (radio).
kohorto (hist.) cohort.
koincidar (intr.) to coincide (kun) (in form, in time).
koitar* (tr.) to perform the sexual act (cf. kopulacar).
koko coke.
kokao (bot.) coca (Erythroxylum coca).
kokaino cocaine.
kokardo cockade.
koketa coquettish; koketino coquette; koketulo coxcomb, beau; koketesar to be c.; koketigar to coquet with, flirt with.
kokleo (anat.) cochlea.
koklusho (med.) whooping-cough.
kokono cocoon; kokonifar to spin, form c.s.
kokoso cocoa-nut; kokosiero c.n. tree; kokoslakto c.n. milk.

kolo (anat. and fig.) neck; kolala relating to n., cervical; kolumo collar of shirt or garment); kolumo rigida stiff c.; kolumo stacanta standing c.; kolumo jacantaturn-down collar; kolopeco neck-piece (butchery); koloparto neck part (of clothes); kolligilo tie; kolluko neck-cloth, neckerchief; kolo di veziko n. of the bladder; kolo di botelo n. of a bootle.
kolacionar (tr.) to collate: compare two writings; to assemble and verify the sheets of a book for binding.
kolanuco kola nut; kolaiero k. tree (Cola acuminata).
kolareto collarret (of cambric, lace, etc, for women and children).
kolaterala, kolateralo (geneal., jur.) colateral; -a parenti: c. relations.
kolchiko (bot.) colchicum (genus: Colchicum).

kolda (pr. and fig.) cold, frigid, cool: koldeso coldness; koldigar to make cold, to cool; kolda balno c. bath; la supo koldeskas the soup is becoming c.; homo di kolda karaktero (fig.) a man of phlegmatic, or cold character; kolda mento a cool mind; traktar amiko kolde to treat a friend coldly. Ant.: varma
koldkremo coldcream.
kolego colleague.
koleglo (all senses) college; -ano: collegian.
kolektar (tr.) to collect (books, plants, etc.); to gather (of persons, objects, matter, into a mass); kolektala, kolektiva collective.
kolektivismo (sociol.) collectivism; kolektivisto collectivist.
koleoptero (ent. genus) coleopter, beetle.
kolero (med.) cholera; kolerika, koleriko c. (patient).
kolerino* (med.) cholerine.
koliar (tr.) to gather, cull, pluck, pick off (fruits, flowers, etc.).; koliajo crop (of fruit), object picked.
koliaro necklace, neck-badge, collar (as on dogs or horses); (natural marking of birds, and other animals) collar; perlo koliaro pearl necklace; (fig.) ring, hoop (as on a mast, on engine).
kolibirio (orni.) humming-bird (family: Trochilidae).
kolikar (intr.) to have severe pain in the bowels; koliko colic, griping, stomach-ache.
kolimatoro* (opt. instr.) collimator.
kolimbo (orni.) diver (family Colymbidae).
kolino hill; kolineto hillock, knoll, ridge. Ex.: Roma esis konstruktata sur sep kolini.
kolirio* (pharm.) colyrium: eye-slave, wash.
kolizionar (intr.) to collide (kun); koliziono collision: mutual striking of two bodies; (fig.) conflict, encounter.
kolkotaro (chem.) colcothar.
kolmo highest part, top (of a building or any elevation); ridge (of a roof); kolmotrabo ridge-piece, -pole; kolmotegulo ridge-tile.
kolodiono collodion.
kolofono colophony: rosin.
koloida, koloido colloid.
kolokar (tr., fin.) to invest (money, funds); kolokajo money invested.
kolombo dove, pigeon (family: Columbidae); kolombea dove-colored; kolombyuno young pigeon; kolombeyo, kolomboturmo dove-cot, pigeon-house (tower).
kolono (anat.) colon; (arch., fig. in anat.) column, pillar; (of troops) column; vertebrala kolono (spino) verterbral column; densa kolono di trupi close column of troops; kolonbolto tie-bolt.
kolonelo (milit.) colonel.
kolonio colony; koloniala colonial, koloniisto colonist: one who colonizes; koloniano colonist: member of a c.; koloniigar, koloniizar to colonize.
koloquinto (bot.) colocynth (Citrullus colocynthis).

koloro color (N.B. not pigment); kolorajo something colored; kolormaterio coloring material; kolorizar to color: koloraro, izo, kolorizeso: izuro coloring, coloration; kolorizanta coloring; sen kolorigar to discolor: deprive of it's proper color; des kolorizar to discolor: stain; kolorochanjocolor-change, play of colors; kolorfairo colored fire, Bengal lights.

kolorito color(ing), hue, shade: effect which results from the mixture or use of colors; (fig.) brilliancy of style; Raphael montris profunda kompreno di kolorito Raphael showed a deep understanding of color (of the manner of applying colors to produce a desired effect); la kolorito di ca pikturo ne esas bona the coloring of this painting is not good; persiko kun bela kolorito a peach of a beautiful color.
koloso colossus.
kolportar (tr.) to hawk about, peddle: carry about wares for sale.
kolubro (genus) coluber: a common non-poisonous snake, ring or grass snake.
kolumo see kolo.
kolumbario* (antiq.) columbarium, columbaria.
kolumno column (of a page); pagino de tri kolumni three columned page.
koluro* (astron., geog.) colure.
koluteo bladder-nut tree (Colutea arborescens).
koluzionar (intr., jur.) to collude: to conspire in a fraud; koluziono collusion. Def.: (koluziono): Interkonsento sekreta por facar kune ula fraudo o nelegalajo; V
kolzo colza, rape seed (Brassica Napus oleifera); kolzoleo c. oil; kolzokaulo cole (Brassica campestris).

kom as (being), being, to be, in the capacity, character, role, quality of; egardar ulo kum neevitebla to regard something as (being) inevitable; kom exemplo: as (being) an example; me judikas kom mea devo raportar I judge it as (being) my duty to report; me konsideras il kom honesta I consider him to be honest; konsiderar la texto kom autentika to consider the text to be authentic; judikar la vino kom bona to judge that wine to be good; me agas kom sekretario I act as (in the capacity of) secretary; il skribis ad me kom elua tutelanto he wrote (in the capacity) as her guardian; aktoro X . . aparis kom Hamlet actoro X.. appeared as (assumed the role of) Hamlet; kom la maxim olda, li elektis ku dom delegito as (being) the oldest, they elected him as (to be) delegate. V. exp.: Quale, kom On devas uzar kom (e ne quale) en omna kazi, en qui kom povas remplasesar da ula formo di la verbo esar: esar, esante, e.c. Quale signifikas, ke on komparas un kozo ad altra; ol implikas sempre, ke on pensas ad-minime du kozi samtempe. Kom expresas atribuo o qualifiko: ol unionas du nomi (o epiteti, atributi) di un sola kozo (ulo esas atributo kande on atribuas ol ad ula nomo, t.e. kande on asertas explicite od implicite, ke tala qualeso apartenas a l'objekto). Ex.: Il agis kom prezidanto (esante prezidanto ed en ta qualeso). Il agis quale prezidanto (quale il esus prezidanto, ma il ne esis). Me amas il kom mea fatron (il esas mea frato). Me amas il quale mea fraton (il ne esas mea frato). Kom (esante) delegito di la granda republiko, il esis aceptata quale (E. like) rejo; (kp. IV
komo (print.) coma (,); komopunto semicolon (;).
komao* (mus.) comma: a minute interval or difference in pitch.

komandar (tr. milit, nav, tech) to command (an army, a ship), to give word of command to (ulu); komandala, komandanta, komandema, komandatra (voco, tono) commanding (voice, tone); komandita kliko catch having positive motion; V. exp.: Imperar, komandar Komandar aplikesas a l'imperado militala o navala, do extreme severa ed absoluta, qua supresas omna responsiveso che l'imperati; IV

komanditar (tr.) to finance a commercial undertaking, to become a sleeping partner in: komanditala societo a (French) limited, joint-stock company (in which some of te partners take no active part); komanditanto, komanditero sleeping-, dormant-partner; komandito (assuming) limited liability; komanditeso (assumed) limited liability.
komandoro (knight-) commander: an ordrer of knighthood.
komato (med.) coma; komatatra comatose; komatego carus.

kombatar (tr., intr.) to fight, combat, make war on: kombatema combative, pugnacious, quarrelsome; kombateskar to start a fight: (milit.) to go into action; kombatesko, kombateto (milit.) engagement; li kombatis senespera kobambato the fought a hopeless fight.
kombinar (tr.) to combine: kombino, uro combination. Ex.: On povas kombinar la quar literi a, b, c, d, en duadek e quar manieri diferanta. Kombinuro di kolori, di soni.
kombinatoriko* (math, philos.) theory of combination(s).
kombustar (tr.) to burn (esp. in chemistery); kombust(ad)o combustion, ignition: combination of a substance with oxygen, or the like usually generating heat and light. V. exp.: vid. brular.
komedio comedy; komediisto comedian.
komedono* (med.) comedo (pl. comedones); face-worm, blackhead.
komencar (tr., intr.) to begin, commence; komence, komencante in the beginning, at first; komencala initial, first; komencolitero initial.
komendar (tr., com.) to order (goods, a dinner, etc.); komendajo, komendi goods bespoken.
komentar (tr.) to comment on (by speaking or by annotation); komento, komenturo, komentaro comment, commentary. Ex. Komentar temo, Virgilius. La komentaro di Caesar.

komercar (intr.) to trade, traffic, deal (pri ulo, kun ulu); komerco commerce, trade; komercala, komercoza, komercera commercial, mercantile; komercajo good(s), article of commerce, mechandise; komercanta trading; komercanto, komercero, komercisto trader, business man, mechant; komercistachala profiteering; komerco engrosa wholesale trade; komerco endetala retail trade.
kometo (astron.) comet.
komforto comfort; komfortala, komfortoza comfortable; komfortigar to make comfortable; (cf. konsolacar).
komico comitia. Def.: Specala nomo di popul-asemblo (pricipue antiqua Romana).
komika comic, ludicrous, funny, laughable (cf. ridinda).

komisar (tr.) to commission: to charge, empower (ulu facar ulo), to appoint (ulu por ulo); komiso charge instruction, mandate; komisanto one who orders, employer, principal; komisato person commissioned: commissioner, representative; (cf. prokuraco): komisitaro commission: body of commissioners, board. Ex.: Komisar ula komision-firmo komprar o vendar acioni por su, por ulu. Komisar komisitaro studiar temo. Ca oficiro ne ja recevis sua komiso. Komisar milit-navo. Komisitaro pri la budgeto. Facar la komisi: (E. to carry out the instructions; (fig.) do the errands).
komisario commissary (di polico, di provizuro): komisarieso (function) commissaryship; komisarieyo c. office.

komisiono (com.) commission: order by which a person buys or sells goods for another: komisionisto, komisionero c; merchant, c. agent; komisiongelto, komisionpago commission-money: allowance for transacting business.
komisuro (anat.) commissure, suture.
komitato commitee, board; (cf. komisitaro).
komizo clerk; writer, copyist in an office or counting-house; salesman in a store or shop .
komocionar (tr., med. psychol.) to affect strongly, unnerve, unstring, cause to shake; la violentoza pafado -is la trupi: the hot fire unnerved the troops; san-eso konocion-ita: shattered health.

komoda (of things) convenient, commodious: adapted to its use or purpose, suitable; affording convenience, conductive to comfort; utensilo komoda a convenient utensil; ca loko ne esas komoda a ni this place is not convenient for us; ca domo ne havas komodaji this house has no conveniences.
komodo (furniture) commode, chest of drawers, bureau.
komodoro (nav.) commodore.

komono commune (in France); parish, township (the political division); komonestro mayor; komonestreso mayorality; komondomo community-house, town-hall; komonano an inhabitant, a member of the commune or parish.
kompakta compact; (cf. densa); masoa a c. mass.

kompano, kompanulo, kompanino companion, mate, one who keeps company with another person, one associated with another in an employement; kompaneso companionship; joyoza kompanulo a good fellow, boon companion; voyajo kompano fellow-traveller: fidela kompano faithful c..
kompanio (indust., com, milit.) company.

komparar (tr.) to compare (ulo, ad ulo); komparebla, komparinda comparable; (ad) kompare comparatively, in comparaison (ad, kun); komparanta gramatiko comparative grammar; komparar la originalo kun la tradukuro to compare the original with the translation .
komparativo (gram.) comparative.
kompaso (a pair of) compass(es); kompasagar to measure with c.; trasar per kompaso to line out with c.

kompatar (tr., intr.) to pity, have compassion, be compassionate, commiserate, have mercy on: (cf. simpatiar); kompatanta, kompatema, kompatoza compassionate; kompatinda worthy of compassion, pitiable, miserable, piteous; sen kompata merciless, pitiless; pro kompato for mercy's sake.
kompendio compendium.
kompensar (tr.) to compensate: to be equivalent to, to counterbalance, to make amends for, to make up for; (com.) to offset.
kompetenta competent (pri), capable, having (legal) power. Ex.: Kompetenta autoritato. Vu ne esas kompententa facar to. Kemiisto kompetenta.
kompilar (tr.) to compile (a literary work).

komplemento complement: that which it is necessary to add to make a thing complete; (trig.) the difference between an angle and 90°; (gram.) object, the added word to complete a predication; komplementa, komplementala complementary, completing, supplying a deficiency.
kompleta complete; kompletigar to c. (ulo, per); kompletigiva kazo completive case, objective case. Ex.: Vestaro kompleta. Kompleta floro. Ruino kompleta. Komplet-igar sumo, laboro.
Kompletorio* (cath. lit.) complin(e), completory.
komplexiono (med.) complexion: constitution, natural disposition of body; (cf. konstituciono); (N.B. not color of skin).

komplezar (intr.) to please, gratify, humor; to be complaisant, obliging (ad ulu); komplezo, komplezemeso complaisance, disposition to oblige; readiness to serve; komplezachema obsequious; komplezez have the goodness, kindness; nekomplezanta disobliging. Def. Konformigar su a la sentimenti, a la humoro di altru. Ex.: Esas elua studio komplezar ad sua spozulo. Montrar su komplezema ad ulu. Me facis to nur por ke me komplezez il. Mis-uzar la komplezemeso di ulu. V. exp. vid. voluntar.

komplica (jur.) party (to), privy (to); accessory (to); komplic(ul)o accomplice (in a crime, in an ill-design); kompliceso complicity. V. exp.: Indikas la neegaleso (etikal e legala) la precipua kulpanto e di lua komplico o complici.III-264
komplikar (tr.) to complicate: render complex, make intricate; ca afero komplikateskas this affair is getting complicated.
komplimentar (tr.) to compliment: to address with expressions of civility: (cf. gratular). Ex.: La generalo komplimentis la soldato pri lua kurajo. Il sendis la donacajo kun sua komplimenti.
komplotar (tr.) to complot: to plot (ulo, kontre ulu). V. exp.: Komploto esas plu generala; konspiro esas komploto politikala, kontre la stato o statestri, por revoluciono o por atento; II-646.
kompostar (tr.) to set up in type; kompostisto: (print.) compositor; kompostilo composing - stick; komposteroro printer's error, wrong letter; kompostmashino composing machine.
kompoto compote: stewed fruit; kompotuyo comport, dish for compote.

kompozar (tr.) to compose: to compound; to form (by uniting two or more things; N.B. not to set up in type; cf. kompostar); to constitute; to invent and set in order; to fashion, adjust; kompozuro, kompozajo component, compound, ingredient; kompozisto, kompozero composer (as of music); kompozita composite, composed (da); kompozito compound; kompozachar to scribble; Ex.: Omna parti qui kompozas ca mashino. La vorti esas kompozata da literi. Kompozar libro, diskurso, opero. Kompozita vizajo.
komprar (tr.) to buy, purchase.

komprenar (tr.) to comprehend: to understand, apprehend by the senses; (cf. intelektar, konceptar, konocar, savar; kontenar, inkluzar); komprenebla, kompreniva comprehensible, intelligible, conceivable; komprenende of course; mis komprenar to misunderstand.
kompresar (tr.) to compress: press or squeeze together.
kompromisar (tr.) to compromise: to imperil or injure (the reputation, credit, etc. of a person); kompromisanta, kompromisiva compromising.
kompunciono* compunction: reproach of conscience; contrition, remorse.
kompunda* (mashino) compound (-engine).
komt(ul)o (on continent) count; (England) earl.

komuna common: pertaining to, connected with, or participated in by two or more persons or things; joint, general; komuneso: community (of goods, of interests, etc.); komunigar to communize; komunismo communism; komunisto communist; komuna raciono common sense; komuna eskalero a c. staircase; interesti komuna co-interests; komuna uzo c. use; komuna nomo a common name; (gram.) a common noun; komunigar la havaji di richi to communize the property of the rich.
komuniar (intr., rel.) to communicate: to receive the sacrament; komuniigar to administer the sacrament to (ulu).

komunikar (intr.) to communicate; have communication (by intercourse), be connected by passage; (tr.) to communicate; impart, transmit, acquaint with; komuniko, komunikajo: communication; komunikigar to put (uli) into communication; to make a connection between (buildings, etc.); komunikema (tendency) communicative; komunikopordo communicating door; inter komunikar to be in mutual communication. Ex.: Komunikar kun altra personi. Ca pordo komunikas a koridoro. La magneto-petro komunikigas sua qualeso a la fero. Li komunikigas sua projeto a me.
komuniono communion: religious fellowship; a denomination. Def.: Uniono en komuna kredo (religiala); III-605. Ex.: La protestanta komunioni.
komutar (tr., elec., math.) to commute, commutate (a current); komutilo commutator.
kono (geom., bot., and fig.) cone; kona, konala, konatra conical; konotrunko frustum of a c., truncated c.; lum kono (opt.) cone of rays.

koncentrar (tr.) to concentrate: to draw or converge to or toward a common center (troops, rays of light, the mind, the affections, etc.); (chem.) to concentrate: free from extraneous matter; (cf. pludensigar).
konceptar (tr. physiol. and psychol.) to conceive (a child, an idea); (cf. gravideskar); koncept(ad)o, koncepturo comceiving, conception, concept; konceptebla conceivable.

koncernaar (tr.) to concern: relate or belong to (ulu, ulo); koncernao concern: affair: koncernaanta, koncernae concerning, relating to, regarding, (jur.) appertaining to (cf. apartenante); me parolas pri to quo koncernaas vu I am speaking about that which concerns you; to ne koncernaas vu that is not your business.
koncertar (intr., mus.) to give a concert; koncerto concert; koncertopeco concerto.
koncesar (tr.) to concede (a point in argument). Def.: Grantar ulo por obtenar konkordo; III-168.

koncesionar (tr., intr.) to grant a (public) concession to, to enter into (public) contract (with); koncesionario grantee; koncesiono perpetua concession in perpetuity. V. exp.: Koncesiono esas specala kontrato por l'exekuto di publika labori. Ol esas karakterizita per ke l'entraprezisto esas pagata ne da la koncesionanto (stato, urbo, e.c.) ma da l'uzanti dum tempo determinita. Exemple: ula urbo deziras posedar elektrala fili por la lumizado di la stradi e di la privata domi. Ol povas procedar per koncesiono, t.e. l'entraprezisto konstruktros la reto, e recevos su pago, de l'aboni dum X yari e pos tempo donos l'instaluro a la koncesioninto. Simila afero eventas pri fervoyi, pri ponti, pri distributi di gaso, aquo, e.c.; IV
konciar (tr.) to be conscious of (ulo); koncio consciousness: the knowlegde or perception of what passes in one's own mind.
koncienco conscience; konciencoze conscientiously.
koncilo council (of the church); (cf. konsilo).

konciliar (tr.) to concilliate: bring to a state of friendship, gain, win by moral influence; to reconcile: make consistent or suitable; (cf. rikonciliar); konciliebla reconcilable, consistent, accommodable, compatible; konciliema conciliatory, accommodating, compliant, easy to get along, tractable; la multeso di nia reciproka intersiti devas konciliar ni the great number of mutual interests should overcome any feeling of hostility; elua dolca manieri konciliis la favoro di elua nova familio her gentle manners gained the affection of her new family; ne esas facila konciliar la historio profana e la historio sakra it is not easy to reconcile (make consistent) profane history with sacred history.
konciza concise, succinct (style, etc.).

kondanmar (tr.) to condemn: to sentence, doom; to censure; to judge to be unfit for service. Ex.: Kondamnar ulu a morto. Kondamnar libro. Il kondamnis ca entraprezaji: (E. he has condemned (censured) these undertakings). Kondamnar navo, furnisaji. Ant. : absolvar.
kondensar (tr., phys.) to condense; kondensilo condenser. Ex.: Koldeso kondensas la aquo-vaporo. Ant.: vaporigar.
kondensatoro* (elec.) condenser.

kondicionar (tr.) to stipulate, make conditions about; (cf. stipular); kondiciono condition, stipulation, limitation, restriction; kondicionala, kondicionita conditioned: subject to conditions; kondicionizar to place conditions, restrictions on; kondicionalo (gram.) conditional, kondicione ke on condition that, provinding that; sen kondiciona, ne kondicionala unconditioned.
kondilo* (anat.) the head of humerus (upper arm).

kondimento condiment; kondimentizar to season, flavor; (fig.) to give a relish to; (cf. saporar). V. exp.: Kondimento havas senco tre generala, plu larja kam spici, pikli, e.c. Omno quo servas por kondimentizar; III-264
kondolar (tr.) to condole with (ulu): to express or feel sympathetic sorrow; kondololetro letter of c..
kondominio condominium: joint dominion or sovereignty; (Rom. law) joint ownership; kondominiar to have c. Def.: Kunposedar e komune dominacar.
kondoro (orni.) condor (Sarcorhamphus gryphus).

konduktar (tr., phys.) to conduct, transmit, convey (by tubes, wires, etc.) gas, electricity, heat, etc.; konduktivo, konduktilo conductor, conduit, transmitter; konduktiveso conductibility; gas konduktilo gas-conduit, tube.
konduktoro (on trains, trams, omnibuses, etc.) (Europe) guard; (U.S.) conductor.
kondutar (intr.) to conduct onself, behave, demean oneself; ca muliero sempre kondutas bone this women always conducts herself well.
konektar (tr.) to connect (ulo kun ulo). Def.: Juntar du organi qui servas por transmiso di energio, sive elektrala, sive mekanikal (la energio esas una); III-417.
konestablo constable: a former title of commander-in-chief of French armies.
konfectionar (tr.) to make, manufacture clothing (for); konfectionuro clothing (ready made).
konfekto confection, sugar-plum. Def.: Diversa-speca sukraji generale mola; V-722.
konferar (intr.) to confer: discourse with any one on some subject; (cf. grantar).
konfervo (bot.) conferva: any of the threadlike green algae that form in scum in ponds and ditches.

konfesar (tr.) to confess, own up, avow (ulo); konfesigar to receive the confesion of (ulu); konfeso confession; konfesanto one who c.; konfesiganto, konfesero, konfesario (father) confessor; konfeseyo confessional (cabinet): irar por konfesar to go to confession; arachar konfeso to extort a confession. Ex.: On konfesas kulpo od irga fakto celita, sekreta e desfavoroza.
konfesiono (theol.) confession: a formulary of articles of a religious creed, profession of faith; creed; konfesiono di Augsburg Augsburg Confession.
«konfetti»: confetti.

konfidar (tr.) to confide: instrust, commit, to the care of; (cf. fidar, konfidencar). Def.: Livrar ula kozo (su, ulu, ulo) a la sorgo, a la fideleso, a la habileso o la kapableso di ulu, di ulo. Ex.: Me konfidas a vu la maxim kara e maxim precosa kozi quin me posedas.
konfidencar (tr.) to tell in confidence (ulo, ad ulu); konfidenco disclosure; konfidencajo that which is confided: the information; konfidenca, konfidencala confidential; konfidence in c.

konfirmar (tr.) to confirm: assure by added proof, corroborate, verify; add firmness to, to strenghten; (jur.) to ratify, sanction; (rel.) to receive into the church by confirmation; l'experienco konfirmas ke . . esperience corroborates that; recenta informi konfirmas me en mea opiniono recent information confirms my opinion; la korto konfirmis la verdikto the court has confirmed the sentence; la sakramento di -o: the sacrament of confirmation; konfirmanta, konfirmiva evidentajo confirmatory, corroborative evidence .
konfiskar (tr.) to confiscate (ulo, de ulu).
konfitar (tr.) to preserve (fruits, in sugar); konfitajo jam, preserve, conserve.
konfliktar (intr.) to (be in) conflict (kun). Ex.: Nia interesti konfliktas. Konflikto di armei.

konforma conformable: that conforms, like, similar; konforme in conformity; konformigar to (make) conform (ulo, su, ad ulo). Ex.: Kopiuro konforma a la originalo. Vua interesti konform-esas a nii. Konformeso a la volo di altru. Konform-igar su a la manieri di vua tempo.
konfrontar (tr.) to confront. Ex.: Konfrontar la testo ad akuzato.

konfundar (tr.) to confound: to make a muddle of serveral things in not distinguishing them properly (with kun); to confuse the indentity of something with something else (with ad). V. exp.: Kunfundar kun ..., kunfundar ad ..: Se ek plura kozi on facas pelmelo per mala o nesuficanta dsitingo mentala, qua mixas iti kun ici, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas kun. Ex. : «Nun il konfundas omno en sua odio, la kulpozi kun l'inoncenti, la boni kun la mali». Se la spirito transportas erore la qualesi od individueso di ulu od ulo ad altra, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas ad. Ex.: «Vu konfundis manekino ad homo. - Ne konfundez lampiro a lanterno». En l'unesma kazo (kun) la konfundo esas reciproka; en la duesma, ol ne esas reciproka; VI-513-4; also Talmey's Test Book, p.90) Ant.: dicernar.

konfuza (physical and mental) confused: jumbled together, indistinct. Ex.: Bruiso konfuza. Nepreciza e konfuza idei. La multa intrucioni konfizigas mea mento. La konfuzeso di la tempo. Ant. klara, preciza.
konglomerato (geol.) conglomerate; pudding-stone.
kongro (ich.) conger-eel (Conger).
kongregaciono (rel.) congregation: kongregacionano member of a c.
kongresar (intr.) to hold a congress; kongresano, kongresanto, kongresero congressman, member of a c.
kongruar (intr.) to be congruous: kongrueso congruity; kongruanta congruous, congruent, proper.
konio wedge, quoin (arch. print.); koniagar to wedge; koniumar* to shape like (or, form into) an angle.
konifera, konifero (bot.) conifer(ous).
koniko (math.) conic section.
konivencar (intr.) ton connive (kun): to feign ignorranc; (fam.) to wink at
konjedar (tr.) to give leave or holiday to; to furlough. Def. : Donar tempala libreso: IV-67.
konjektar (tr.) to conjecture: to surmise, presume, guess, suppose; (cf. divinar).

konjelar (tr., intr.) to congeal; to freeze; (cf. koagular, glaciigar, forstigar). Def.: Transformar liquido a solido per la ago di koldeso. Ex.: Temperaturo di 130°K konjelas alkoholo. V. exp.: Frosto povas aplikesar nur a vetero, a la meteorologiala stando, di qua konjelo di l'aquo esas nur elemento o signo; III-330.
konjestionar (tr., med.) to congest; konjestiono congestion. Def.: Akumulo morbala di sango en parto limitizita di la korpo.
konjugar (tr., gram.) to conjugate: to inflect (a verb).
konjunciono (gram.) conjunction; konjunciona expresuro conjunctive phrase.
konjuntivo* (anat.) conjunctiva.
konjuntivito* (med.) conjunctivitis.
kunjunturo concurrence, combination of events and circumstantces, conjuncture. Ex.: Me nultempe trovis plus desfortunoca konjunturo.
konjurar (tr.) to conjure, raise, call up (spirits).
konko conch, sea-shell (of a mollusc).
konkava concave; konkaveso concaveness; konkavajo, konkaviguro concavity; konkavigar to make c., scoop or hollow out.
konklavo conclave: assembly of cardinals.

konkluzar (tr.) to conclude: to bring to a conclusion, settle, to come to a decision about; (cf. inferar); konkluziva conclusive, final, decisive; (cf. pruviva); konkluze in conclusion. Ex.: Konkluzar kontrato, pakto, mariajo, diskurso. La konkluzo di la kontrato prizentis poka desfacilaji. Konlkuziva pruvo. Konkluze me volas dicar.
konkoido (geom.) conchoid.
konkologio conchology.

konkordar (intr.) to agree, be in harmony, concord, concordance, (kun); konkordigar to bring into concord, to reconcile; konkordo kordialacordial agreeement (F. entente); ne konkordanta (moral) discordant, disagreeing. Def.: Havar sama opiniono kam altru; (ol expresas stando duriva, (eventuale) permananta); VII-97; tendencar a sama skopo; harmoniar; (kp. akordar, konsentar). Ex.: La konkordo di du gespozi. La konkordo regnas en ica familio. Lia atesturi ne konkordas.

konkordato (rel.) concordat; (com.) bankrupt's certificate; konkordatala certified (of bankrupts); konkordatario certified bankrupt. Def.: (Kormercala) Konkordo di faliinto kun sua kreditanti por pago di sua debi; II-76.
konkreciono (med.) concretion: calculus (cf. kalkolo).
konkreta concrete (number, term). Ant.: abstraktaa, ala.
konkubino concubine; konkubulo man who lives in concubinage.
konkubinato* (legal) concubinage (applies to men and women).
konkupicenco* concupiscence. Def.: Inklineso juar la bonaji di la mondo, particulare la kozi sensual.

konkurencar (tr.) to compete (in business, for personal profit); (cf. emulesar); konkurenc(ad)o competition, natural rivalry, common striving for the same object. V. exp.: Konkurenco esas la naturala, spontana e konstanta rivaleso, qua existas inter praktikanti di la sama profesiono, komerco, industrio, qui penas ecelar por sua personal profito e prospero. Konkurso esas quaze lukto institucata da autoritato, en definita kondicionni tempala ed altra, por ganar premii od adminime recevar rangi atribuata da judikanti. Konkurso similesas do samtempe exameno e judiko. La sama komercisti od industriisti, quikonkurencas sur la nacional e mondala merkato, konkursas exemple en l'universala expozi, en qui on distributas a li premii de diversa rangi. Li konkursas anke por obtenar ula lur niso, prizentante specimeni (kun inkiko di preco), quin ula experti specale komisita examenas, komparas e rangizas; III-348.
konkursar (intr.) to go into a competition, match (for prizes); konkursanto, konkurskandidato competitor. V. exp.: vid. konkurencar.
konkusionar (intr., jur.) to peculate, practice extortion, graft. Def.: (konkusiono): Prevariko o pekuniala extorso facita da publika funcionero.

konocar (tr.) to know: be aware of, be acquainted with; (through the senses); konocigar to make known (ulo da ulu); konoc(ad)o acquaintance, knowing, cognition, cognizance; konoceskar: to become acquainted; konocato acquaintance; konocebla cognizable; konocala, konociva (philos.) cognitive; rikonocar to recognize: know again; (cf. agnoskar). Ex.: Konocar ulu per la nomo, per la reputo, per la vido. Me ne konocas lua skribado. Me bone konocas omna parti di ca edifico. Me ne konocas la nomo di la strado. La autoro ne esas konocata. Konocar lo bona de lo mala. La hundo bone konocas sua mastro. Il atingis la evo di konoco (E. discretion). Havar bona konoco di aferi. La konoco di krimino. V. exp.: vid. savar.
konoido (geom.) conoid.
konosmento (com., nav.) bill lading. Def.: Dokumento signatata da kapitano o navestro, deklaranta la naturo e quanto di la vari transportata e la kondicioni di transporto; II-76.
konquasar (med.) concussion (brain, etc.).
konsakrar (tr.) to dedicate, consecrate (a church, one's life, etc.); (cf. sakrigar).
konsekracar* (tr., Cath. lit.) to consecrate: to convert the bread and wine into the proper substance of Christ.

konsentar (intr.) to consent, give consent, accede, agree, acquiesce; agar konsente kun to act in concert with; interkonsente by mutual agreement; ne konsentar to dissent. Def.: Adherar a l'opiniono, propozo di altru; implikas chanjo, mental ago e quaze movo; VII-98. Ex.: Kad vu venos kun ni? Me konsentas (t.e. me volas la samo kam vi, o me voluntas sequar vi; ico dependas nur de la volado, ne de l'intelekto). Lua gepatri ne konsentus a lua mariajo. V. exp.: vid. asentar.

konsequar (intr.) to follow, result, ensue (de ulo); konsequo: (relation) consequence; konsequantajo consequent (event, thing, issue), consequence; konseque: consistently, consequently; therefore; konsequanta consequent; konsequema consistent; to ne konsequas de that does not follow from; ica kozi esas di granda konsequo these things are of great consequence; la konsequentajo di ilua ago the consequence of his act; il ne esas konsequema en lua aserti he is not consistent in his statements.

konservar (tr.) to conserve: keep in a safe and sound state; (of fruits, etc.) to preserve; konservo conservation, preservation; konservajo thing conserved; preserve; konservema, konservemo (also polit.) conservative (person); konservemeso conservatism; konservar sua saneso to c. one's health; instinto di (su) konserv(ad)o the instinct of self-preservation.
konservatorio* (institution) conservatory (of music).

konsiderar (tr.) to consider; (cf. egardar, regardar, atencar, pensar, judikar, evaluar, reflektar, deliberar, meditar); la soldati konsideris il quale patrulo the soldiers looked upon him a father; ol esas projeto bone konsiderita it is a well-considered plan; ol meritas konsidero it merits consideration; il agas nekonsiderante he acts inconsiderately; konsiderante vua laborado in consideration (or, out of consideration) of your work; esas temo konsiderinda it is a subject worthy of consideration.
konsignar (tr.) to consign (goods); konsignajo, konsigno di komercaji, di vari consignment; konsignario consignee. Def.: Sendar vari por vendo segun posibleso; II-76.
konsilar (tr.) to advise, offer counsel to (ulo ad ulu); konsilantaro, konsilistaro council (cf. koncilo).

konsistar (intr.) to consist: have as its foundation, essence, be composed, be made up of. Ex.: Feliceso konsistas en moderemeso e vertuo. Ca armeo konsistas ek infantrio ed ek kavalrio (kp. kompozar).
konsistorio (rel.) consistory.
konskriptar (tr.) to conscript: to enlist by compulsion; konskriptito a conscript.
konsolo (arch., furnit.) console.
konsolacar (tr.) to console: comfort (a person) in grief.
konsoldo (bot.) comfrey, consound (genus: Symphytum).
konsolidar (tr., fin.) to fund; konsolidito consol.
konsomeo (soup, broth) consommé.
konsonancar (intr.) to be agreeable or uniform in sound; konsonanco consonance, accord (of sounds).
konsonanto (gram.) consonant.
konsorto (jur.) consort, associate, partner.

konspirar (intr.) to conspire: to hatch a treason against a government; li konspiris kontre la rejo they conspired against the king; pulvero konspiro gunpowder plot (Eng. Hist.). V.exp.: vid. komplotar.
