konsputar (tr.) to treat (publically) most contemptuously, scorn, spurn, flout (cf. mokegar). V. exp.: To esas nek desestimar, nek abominar, ma expresar extere, per paroli, gesti, agi, la desestimo od abomino (etimologie: kovrar per sputaji); III-203.

konstanta (all senses) constant; (cf. sencesa, permananta, persistanta); konstanto (math. phys.) a constant (quantity); konstanteso constancy; konstante constantly. Ex.: Job esis konstanta (E., steadfast) (od, ferma) en desfortuno. Konstanta en amikeso. (math.) Konstanta quanto (od, konstanto). Konstanta (od, sen-cesa) venti. Konstante bona. Konstanteso di valoro.

konstatar (tr.) to establish, substantiate (for oneself by observation or experiment), to attest, state (after investigation, to other people). (Note: This word applies to serious even scientific observation and proof, rather than to the perceptions of everyday life). La mediko konstatis la prezenteso di… the physician observed (verified, proved, established) the prescence of…; konstato establishing, authentication, verification; postular, donar, recevar (oficala) konstato to demand, give, receive an (official) acknowledgement (or, certificate) (pri ulo); konstatebla ascertainable, able to be verified or determined. Def.: Certeskar pri la vereso di ula fakto, generale per percepto, observo; VII-207. Vidar tote certe, explorar tale, ke la fakto esez por vu tote nedubebla. Mondo, XII, 226. Ex.: Fakto konstatita (E. established fact). Me verifikis la fakti per exameno di la konstati (E. statements) en la protokolo (od, me konstatis la fakti per exameno di la protokolo).
konsternar (tr.) to dismay, to strike with, or throw into consternation; ni esis konsternata da ilua vorti we were dismayed by his words.
konstipar (tr.) to constipate; render costive, bind (the intestines).

konstitucar (tr.) to constitute: to form, compose, make a thing what it is, make up; konstituco, konstituceso (also polit.) constitution; konstitucanta, konstituciva constituting: component, composing, constituent (N.B. not elector; cf. elektanto); konstitucala (polit.) constitutional (cf. konstitutionala); konstitucaleso constitutionality. Ex.: La psiko e la korpo konstitucas la homo. Ca agi ne konstitucas delikto. La konstitucanti (E. elements) di ulo. La parti konstituc-anta, -iva di korpo.
konstituciono (physiol.) constitution; konstitucionala morbo constitutional disease. Def.: Generala stando di l’organismo rezultanta del anatomiala stando e de la funcionado di omna organi; VI-210.

konstriktar (tr.) to constrict; to draw together, bind, cramp. Def.: (Konstrikto) La diminuto di ampleso di kavajo (stomako) o truo (ex. La natural aperturi di la korpo esas cirkondita da muskuli konstriktiva); II-645.
konstruktar (tr.) to construct: to put the parts of anything together in their proper order, to build.
konsulo (Roman, modern) consul; konsulala consular; konsuleso (function, time) consulate; konsuleyo (residence) consulate.

konsultar (tr.) to consult (ulu, ulo, pri ulo); (cf. konferar, deliberar); konsult(ad)o consultation (also med.). Ex.: Konsultar advokato, vortaro, historio, sua interesti. Konsultanta mediko. Havar konsultanta voco (E. to have the right of discussion without the right of voting).

konsumar (tr.) to consume, destroy, use up, wear out, expend. Ex.: La rusto konsumas la fero. La fairo konsumas la domo (kombustante ol). Maladeso konsumas la energio. On konsumas vino, karno, korbono, petrolo, papero, aquo, e energio en la vapor-mashini e mem la mashini ipsa, uzante li. kp. IV-397.

kontar (tr.) to count, reckon (money, trees, people, hours, etc.); to take a census; (cf. kalkular, enumerar); konto account, reckoning; havar privata kontoto have a private account (at a merchant’s, etc.); kalular la konto (di ulu) to make up the account; kontado di la habitantaro census of the inhabitants; kontistoaccountant; verifikar la kontadoto verify the accounts, the book-keeping; konto kuranta current account; kontar dekeduope to count by the dozens; kontilo counter (machine); (tech.) meter; kontomarko counter (as in play); kontoyaro financial year.

kontagiar (tr., lit. and fig.) to communicate a contageous disease to (ulu); kontagio contagion, pestilence. Def.: Transmisar morbo per kontakto mediata od nemediata kun ulu; (fig.) transmisar etikala malajo per frequento, per imitado nevolata. Ex.: La kontagio di morbo, di vicio. Rido kontagiiva.
kontaminar (tr.) to contaminate, defile; (cf. polutar, koruptar, sordidigar).
kontantar (of money) ready; (of payments) cash; kontanto ready cash or money; kontanta pago cash payment; kontanta kompro buying for cash.
kontemplar (tr.) to contemplate. Def.: Regardar longe, ma aktive, kun reflekto o fervoro por studiar o admirar l’objekto; V-35. Ex.: Kontemplar la belaji di naturo. Kontemplado di la boneso di Deo.

kontenar (tr.) to contain, hold; konteno, konteneso containing, capacity; kontenajo content(s); (log.) content; kontenantajo, kontenilo container; kontenema, kontenoza, konteniva comprehensive. Ex.: Ca tanko kontenas duacent litri. La kontenajo di libro. Donar kontenoza deskripto di ula afero.
kontenta content(ed), satisfied; kontentigar to content, satisfy. Ex.: Kontenta mieno. Havar kontenteso esas plu bona kam havar richaji. V. exp.: vid. saciar.
kontestar (tr.) to contest, dispute, call into question. Ex. Kontestar la yuro di ulu. Kontestar debajo, heredajo. Il havas ne-kontestebla yuro facar to.
kontigua contiguous, adjoining; meeting at the surface or border, touching; kontigua chambro adjoining room; (cf. apuda).
kontinencar (intr.) to be continent; kontinenco continence: forbearance of lawful pleasure, restraint of passion for sexual enjoyment.
kontinento (geog.) continent.

kontingenta (philos.) contingent: happening by chance, casual, accidental; kontingento (milit., fin.) contingent, share, quota; kontingenteso, kontingentajo (philos.) contingency. Ex.: Kontingent evento; Singlu de la federiti furnisos sua kontingento de trupi e pekunio. Ni agos segun la kontingentajo.

kontinua continuous: uninterrupted, unbroken, which goes on without intermittance or break; joined without intervening space; kontinuo, kontinuajo (philos.) that which is indivisible (matter, body, space); (cf. sencesa, perpetua, duranta; prolonguro, sequantajo); kontinua proporciono (math.) c. proportion; kontinua febro continuous, uninterrupted fever; la lego di kontinuo the law of continuity. Ant.: intermitanta, cesanta, neduranta.
kontoro counting-house, (business) office, (administrative) bureau; kontoristo office clerk, kontoristaro office force.
kontrabandar (tr.) to smuggle (in); kontrabandajo a contraband article.
kontrabaso contrabasso: the largest kind of bass-viol, violone, double-bass.
kontradanso contradance, country dance, old fashioned quadrille.
kontrafaktar (tr.) to counterfeit (money), to forge (a signature); kontrafakturo counterfeit, forgery (made).
kontraforto (arch.) counterfort: a buttress, spur or pillar serving to support a wall.

kontraktar (tr., phys., anat., gram.) to contract: to draw into a smaller compass, draw together or nearer; to shrink (together); (cf. konstriktar, astriktar, plukurtigar). Def.: Diminuto di longeso, di larjeso o di volumino; II-645. Ex.: La maxim multa korpi kontraktesas da la frigoro; muskolo aganta kontraktesas.
kontrakturo (med.) rigidity, stiffness of muscles. Def.: Rigideso duranta, ma nevolita, di muskolo. Ex.: Tetano efektigas grandega kontrakt-uro.
kontralto (voice or person) contralto, counter-tenor.
kontrapozar (tr., log.) to contrapose.
kontrapunto (mus.) counterpoint.
kontrastar (intr.) to contrast: stand, be in contrast; kontrastigar to (put in) contrast (ulo, ad ulo). Ex.: Kontrastigar to quon on facas a to quon on intencas facar. Kontrasto di ombro e di lumo.

kontratar (tr., intr.) to make a contract (kun); kontrato contract: agreement or covenant between two or more persons; bargain; (cf. paktar). Ex.: Kontratar facar ulo. Kontratar kun la stato facar ulo laboro. Donar vendo-kontrato (E. to give a deed of sale).
kontravencar (tr., intr.) to contravene: transgress, infringe on (regulations, orders, the law, etc.). Ex.: Kontravencar la dekalogo. V. exp.: vid. krimino.

kontre (prep.) against: in opposition to, with; in contradiction to, contrary to; in an opposite direction; opposite; (law term) versus; kontremea volo opposite my wish; marchar – la enemiko to march against the enemy; luktar – desfortuno to struggle with adversity; iritigar kontre be exasperated with; agar kontre sua koncienco to act against one’s conscience; irar – la fluo to go against the current; kontree by way of compensation, as a set off, per contra; on the contrary, on the other hand; kontreajo the contrary, opposite (object); kontreesar to be opposed (ad); kontre(ul)o adversary; kontreeso opposition; kontre ke (conj.) while (in contrast). In composition kontre has the sense of: counter, contra; (cf. anti).
kontreagar (tr.) to act contrary or in opposition to (ulu, ulo), to thwart; kontreaganta, kontreema opposing (fig.) provoking; kontreagemeso spirit of contrariety.
kontreasekurar (tr.) to insure against.
kontredemandar (tr.) to counter-question.
kontredicar (tr.) to gainsay, contradict; interkontredicanta mutually contradictory; sukontredicanta self-contradictory.
kontreetika immoral.
kontrefebra antifebrile
kontrefluo counter-flow, -current.
kontrefrapo, kontreshoko counter-blow.
kontreimpero counter-order.
kontreindiko contra-indication (chiefly med.).
kontrejuda anti-Semitic; kontreo anti-Semite.
kontreklerika anticlerical; kontreismo anticlericalism.
kontrekonstituca anti-constitutional.
kontremarchar to counter-march.
kontreminar (tr.) to countermine.
kontremonarkia anti-monarchical.
kontrenaciona anti-national.
kontrenatura unnatural.
kontrepapo antipope.
kontreparolar (tr.) to speak against, rejoin to.
kontrepezajo counter-poise, -balance, -weight.
kontrepledo counter-plea, opposition speech.
kontrepropozo counter-proposal.
kontreputra antiseptic: preventing putrefaction; (cf. asepta).
kontrereligia anti-religious.
kontrereprochar to recriminate.
kontrerevoluciono counter-revolution.
kontresenco contrary sense, meaning.
kontresignatar to countersign; kontreo, kontreuro countersign(ing).
kontresinsa in the opposite direction, backwards.
kontreskarpo (fort.) counterscarp.
kontreskorbuta anti-scorbitic, scurvy.
kontresocia anti-social.
kontrespasma anti-spasmodic.
kontretorpednavo torpedoboat destroyer.
kontreveneno counter-poison, antidote.
kontreverma, kontreo vermifuge.
kontrevola reluctant, kontree unwillingly.

kontributar (tr., intr.) to contribute (ulo, ad ulo). Ex.: Kontributar duimo di la sumo. Kontributajo a la suceso di la afero. To esos kontributiva a vua feliceso (E. that will be conducive to your happiness).
kontricar* (intr., rel.) to feel deep sorrow for sin; -o contrition, remorse, repentance; kontricanta contrite.

kontrolar (tr.) to control by checking, verification, entering into a counter-register or counter-roll; kontrolo checking, verification; kontrolisto controller, comptroller; kontroleyo comptroller’s office; kontrololibro register kept to correct another register; (milit.) muster-roll; kontrolomarko check-mark; hall-mark; kontrolmarkizar to counter-check, mark; kontrolobilieto (theat. -) check; kontrolexpertizo counter-survey; kontrolinquesto counter-inquiry; kontrolvoko second roll-call, check-roll-call.
kontroversar (tr.) to controvert, dispute, discuss. Def.: (kontroverso) Debato pri questiono, opiniono, e.c., precipue pri temi religiala, filozofiala.

kontumaca(jur.) contumacious: disobedient to a lawful summons; non-appearing; defaulting; kontumac(ul)o a c. person; kontumaceso contumacy, default; judiciar kom kontumaco to default, declare to be contumacious.
konturo contour, outline: the line that bounds a figure; konturizar to outline, give proper contour.
kontuzar (tr., med.) to contuse, bruise (by blow or fall).
konvalecar (intr.) to be convalescent.
konvektar (tr., phys.) to transfer (heat, electricity) by means of currents in liquids or gases; konvekto convection. Def.: Modo di transporto di la koloro, dil elektro; III-139.

konvenar (intr.) to suit: be suitable, be fitting, be congruous, be proper, fit in, match; (cf. decar); (impers.) to be expedient, be advisable, be convenient; konveno fitness, suitableness, pertinence; (pl.) good manners, decorum, proprieties; konvenanta suitable, proper, expedient, pertinent, convenient; ne konvenajo inconvenience; ca loko konvenas bone ad il this place will well suit him; tala laudo ne konvenas a me such praise does not suit me; konvenas facarit is advisable to be silent; ne konvenas a me dicar it does not beseem me to say; obediar la konveni to observe the rules of decorum; la konveno di mariajo the suitableness of marriage; domo kun multa nekonvenaji a house with many inconveniences.

konvencionar (intr.) to make an agreement, come to a (written) understanding; konvenciono agreement, covenant, convention, pact; konvencionala conventional: stipulated; tacitly understood, arising out of custom; konvencionala linguo (od,parolado) conventional language; parola konvenciono verbal agreement; skribita konvenciono written agreement; la historiisti ne konvencionas pri la dato the historians do not agree as to the date; la testi konvencionis dicar the witnesses agreed to say.
konvento convention, assembly; conventicle: assembly, usually secret, as of freemasons; nacionala konvento national convention.
konvergar (intr.) to converge: tend to a point. Ant.: divergar.
konversar (intr.) to converse (kun); konversetar to chat.
konversiono (milit.) a change of front, wheeling.
konvertar (tr., rel., fin.) to convert; konvertar pagani, pekanti to convert heathen, sinners (cf. transformar).
konvexa convex. Ant.: konkava.
konvolvulo (bot.) convolvulus, bind-weed, morning-glory (genus: Convolvulus).

konvoyar (tr.) to convoy: transport, convey troops, munitions, etc. (usually under armed escort); konvoyo convoy(ing), transport(ing); konvoyonavo transport (ship); konvoyal eskortnavo escort ship to a convoy. Def.: Transportar soldati, municioni, e.c. per serio de veturi o navi. V. exp.: Konvoyo esas la transporto e, per extenso, la serio de veturi (o navi) ipsa. Konvoyar ne esas sinomimo di akompanar, eskortizar: on eskortizas konvoyo; IV-12.

konvulsar (intr.) to have a violent and involuntary contraction of the muscles; konvulsigar to convulse; konvulso convulsion, fit; konvulsala, konvulsatra convulsive. V. exp.:Konvulso (konvulsi) esas general e duranta kontrakti di la muskuli, ne volita, ma pro nerval influo. Spasmo esas kontrakto lokala (di un muskulo aparta), generale bruska e neduranta. Krampo esas kontrakto partala e doloroza di un muskulo (ex. En la suro); II-646.
konyako cognac (French) brandy.
kooperar (intr.) to cooperate ( in a co-operative institution); (cf. kunlaborar, kontributar(ad); kooperala, kooperanta societo cooperative society.

kooptar (tr.) to co-opt: to choose or elect a fellow member. Def.: Adjuntar a su membro per interna elekto. Ex.: La elektita komisitaro havis la yuro di koopto, e kooptis Sro. X. pro la specala autoritato; IV-105.
koordinar (tr.) to co-ordinate: dispose, adjust; koordiniti (geom.) coordinates. Def.: Kombinar en la ordino asignita da la formo o la naturo id l’elementi. Ex.: Koordinodi la muskuli.
kopaivo copaiba, copaiva (balsam); kopaiviero c. tree (genus: Copaiba).
kopalo copal, a resin.

kopiar (tr.) to copy: write, print, engrave, or paint, alter an original; (cf. imitar); kopio copying; kopiuro a copy; kopianto, kopiero, kopiisto copyist; kopiopresilo copying-press; kopioregistro copying register (for letters, etc.); kopio atestita a certified copy; kopiinko copying ink; kopiuro korektigita, emendita corrected copy; kopio neta a clean copy.
koprolito* (paleon.) coprolite.
kopso copse, coppice.
kopulo copula.
kopulacar (intr.) to copulate: unite in sexual intercourse (kun); kopulacigar to pair (animals for breeding).

koquar (tr.) to cook (food) by baking, boiling, broiling, roasting, etc.; (cf. bakar, stufar, boliigar, grilar, rostar); koquarajo something cooked; koquaristo cook; koquarartala culinary; koquarilaro cooking utensils; koquareyestro chief cook.

koro, korkantaro choir, quire, chorus (the singers); korala choral; korkanto chorus (song); korano, kor(kant)isto chorister; korista puero choir boy; korestro choir leader; kantar kore, koratre to sing in chorus.
koralio coral; koraliala, koraliatra coralline, coralline-like.
koram (prep.) in the presence of; koramme in my presence; koramla rejo in the presence of the king.
korano Koran.
korbo basket; korbobotelo demi-john, carboy; (cf. damijano).
korbelo (arch.) corbel.

kordo line, cord, rope; (geom.) chord; (of an arch.) span, chord; kordegolarge rope, hawser (cf. kablo); kordaro cordage; kordeto small rope, string, twine; kordigar to twist, twine (like a rope); kordifar to make ropes; kordifeyo, korderio rope-walk; kord(et) izar, kordligar to cord, bind; kordodansisto rope-dancer; kordoskalo rope-ladder.

kordio (anat., fig. of affections and cards) heart; kordiala cardiac; (fig.) cordial; kordialeso cordiality; kordiika, kordiiko heart-diseased (person); kordiolaceranta poignant; heart-rending, harrowing.

kordono a short cord or ribbon; as: klosh(et) kordono bell-cord, -pull; tir kordono check-string for doors, carriages, etc.); zon kordono girdle (as of monks); shu kordono shoe-string, lachet; chapel kordono hat-band, -string; umbilikala kordono umbilical cord, navel string; (honor) kordono cord or ribbon worn as a decoration; militala, epidemiala kordono (fig.) military, sanitary cordon: a line of sentinels, guards.
koreo* (med.) chorea, St. Vitus’s dance.

korekta correct: conforming to the rules or the conventional standard, accurate, exact, right, faultless; korektigar to correct (cf. emendar, punisar); korektiguro (result) correction; korektigebla corrigible. Ex. Korekta frazo, konduto. Korektigar la mori di ula naciono. V.exp.: vid. emendar.
korelatar (intr.) to be in correlation; korelatanta, korelativa: korelativo correlative: standing in reciprocal relation; korelativa termini correlative terms.
korespondar (intr.) to correspond: to hold communication by letters, (kun ulu); to answer in character, function, etc., be adequate (ad ulo); (cf. konformesar, konkordar).
koriandro (bot.) coriander (Coriandrum sativum).
koribanto (antiq.) Corybant: a priest of Cybele.
koridoro corridor, passage-way.
korifeo(antiq.) coryphæus (ballet) coryphee; (fig.) one distinguished in his profession or in a society.
korimbo (bot.) corymb.
korinto, korinti (dried or shop) currant(s).
koriono chorion, the outside membrane of the foetus.
korko cork(-bark); korkoquerko c. tree; korkizar to cork (a bottle), to lay c. on (a floor, etc.); korkoflotacero c. float; c. belt; korkotirilo corkscrew.
kormorano (orni.) cormorant (genus: Phalacrocorax).

korno horn (of animals, as material or as used in wind instrument); korna, kornoza, kornatra corneous, horned, horny; kornizar to put horns on; kornagar to horn, gore; korneskar to become h.; kornisto, kornero horn-blower; korne anuncar, proklamar to blare out, trumpet; kornoplear to blow or wind the h.; kornobrancho antler; abundo korno horn of plenty, cornucopia; trikorna chapelo three cornered hat; kornokofio cornet: head-dress worn by sisters of charity.
kornajar (med.) to be short of breath.
kornalino (min.) cornelian, carnelian.
kornako cornac: elephant driver, mahout.
kornamuzo bagpipe; kornamuzoplear (intr.) to play the bagpipe.
korneo (anat.) cornea.
kornelo (bot.) cornel-berry, dog-berry; korneliero cornel (genus:Cornus).
korneto (instr.) horn, kind of trumpet; papera korneto paper cone (as for holding candy); valvo korneto cornet: cornet-a-pistons; (valvo) kornetisto cornetist.
kornico (arch.) cornice.
korniko (orni.) crow; (cf. korvo, frugilego).
korodar (tr.) to corrode; korodanta, korodiva corrosive. Ex.: La rusto korodas la fero.
koroido* (anat.) choroid coat of the eye.
korolo (bot.) corolla.
korolario (log., math.) corollary.

korpo body: total organised substance of a person, animal or plant; the principal part of anything; (milit.) corps; korpala corporal, corporeal, bodily; korpeskar to become body, materialize; korpexerc(ad)o bodily exercise; korpogardisto bodyguard.
korporaciono corporation (cf. gildo).
korporalo* (Cath. lit.) corporal: communion cloth.
korpulentacorpulent, stout (cf. obeza, repleta). Def.: Ta qua havas la tota korpo (anke la membri) grosa, dika; lu esas muskuloza, do generale forta e sana; VI-601.
korpuskulo corpuscle.
korso public-drive, -walk. Def.: Speco di promeneyo en urbo; III-203.
korsajo corsage, bodice.
korsar(ul)o corsair: privateer; (fig.) pirate; (cf. pirato); korsar(ul)onavo privateer.
korseto corset, stays; korsetizar to corset (ulu); korsetkovrilo corset cover.

korto (of justice, of sovereign) court: (of a house) court(-yard); kortana courtly (person); kortano courtier, member of a court; kortaneso courtliness; korto supera, eceptala highest court, court of appeals.
kortico (also anat.) cortex: bark (of trees); senkorticigar to strip trees of bark.
korundo (min.) corundum.
koruptar (tr., phys., moral) to corrupt: taint, spoil; deprave, demoralize. Ex.: La kaloro balde koruptas karno en la somero. Koruptar linguo, texto, judiciisto, la mori di ulu.
korvo (orni.) raven (Corvus corax); (astron.) Corvus.
korvear (intr.) to do corvee; to do compulsory (or, statute-) labo(u)r (on highways, etc.); (milit.) to do fatigue duty.
korveto (nav.) corvette; sloop of war.
kosekanto* (geom.) cosecant.
kosinuso* (geom.) cosine.
kosmo cosmos, kosmala cosmic.
kosmetiko (art of using) cosmetics; kosmetikajo cosmetic article; kosmetikala cosmetic.
kosmogonio cosmogony.
krecento crescent; (fig., cook.) a crescent-shaped roll.

kredar (tr.) to believe (ulu, ulo); me tote ne kredas to I do not believe it at all; kredar historio to believe (in) history; kredar ulu kom richa to believe someone to be rich; kredigar ulo da ulu (igar ulu kredar ulo) to cause someone to believe something; kredo faith, belief, believing; kredendajo, kredformulo, kredartiklo, kredi creed; kredema credulous; kredebla, kredinda credible; kredodeklaro declaration of faith; kredar rumoro to credit a rumo(u)r.
kredenco (in church) credence (-table); (in house) sideboard, buffet.

kreditar (tr., com.) to credit: to enter upon the credit side of an account; to give trust or credit to (ulu) (cf. kredar); kredito credit: reputation for solvency; delay in payment (cf. estimo); kreditajo a c. entry; kreditanto, kreditero creditor; kreditoletro letter of c.; kreditokonto a c. account; kredite vendar to sell on c.; sen kreditigar, des kreditizar to discredit; to deprive of (commercial) c.; (fig.) to bring into disrepute; (cf. kredar). Ant.: debetigar.
kremo cream; (fig.) the best part of anything; kremea, kremeo cream-color(ed); kremuyo c. holder, c. jug; kremo quirlita whipped-c.; kremjeleo blancmange.
kremacar (tr.) to cremate; kremaceyo, kremacforno crematorium.

kremono window-fastening (vertical, as in car windows). Def.: Stango qua restas vertikala, e qua, sive rotacante cirkum sua axo, sive per shovo-movo (komandata per maneto) engajas su (o sua hoki) en trui supre ed infre en la fenestro; IV-448; (kp. spanyoleto).
krenelo crenelle: loop-hole, embrasure (in a battlement); krenelizo, krenelizuro crenellation, indentation; (coins) milling.
kreola; kreolo, kreolulo, kreolino creole.
kreozoto (chem.) creosote.
krepo (crepe) crape; krepizar to cover with crape.
krepisar (tr.) to rough-cast, rough-coat, parget, give a coat of plaster to (a wall).
krepitar (intr.) to crepitate; to make a crackling sound (also surg. of noise of fractured bones).
krepono (fabris) crepon: a thick crape.
krepuskulo crepuscule: twilight (in evening or morning).
kreso (bot.) (water-)cress.

kreskar (intr.) to grow (esp. of living things; cf. augmentar, plugrandigar, divenar); kreskigar to cause (ulo, ulu) to grow; kreskeskar to start growing; kreskante (mus.) crescendo. Ex.: Herbi, hari, homi kreskas. La pluvo kreskigas la frumento.
krespo pancake.
kresto (all senses) crest, top, ridge; han(ul)o kresto cock’s comb; monto kresto top of a mountain; kresto di ondo crest of a wave; kresto di suceso crest of success.
krestomatio chrestomathy: select passages to be used in learning a language.
kreto chalk; kretoza, kretatra chalky, cretaceous; kretkrayono chalk-crayon.
kretino, kretinulo, kretinino cretin.
kretono (fabric) cretonne.
krevar (tr., intr.) to burst, break suddenly, fly open. Ex.: Se vu tro plenigus la sako, ol krevos. La abceso krevis. Krevar pro rido.
kreveto shrimp (Crangon vulgaris).

krevisar (tr., intr.) to crack, chap, chink (surface only, as in china, hands). V. exp.: Expresas surfacala fendeto, qua eventas ex. en la sulo, en la muri, en la glacio, en la pelo, e.c. To esas altro kam fendeto: nam ex. vazo krevisita nule esas fendita; III-203.
kriar (intr.) to scream, cry out: make inarticulate noise (men and animals); krietar to whine, whimper; kriachar to bawl (cf. plorachar). V. exp.: vid. klamar.
kriblo screen: a coarse sieve for separating stones from earth, dust from coals, etc.; (cf. sivo); kribloreziduo siftings.
kriko lifting-jack, screw-jack, hand-screw.
kriketo (game) cricket; kriketbatilo cricket bat; kriketagro, kriketeyo cricket ground; kriketludanto, kriketero, kriketisto cricketer.
krikkrak (onom.) crick-crack.

kriminar (intr.) to commit a crime; krimino crime (such as treason, murder, arson, etc.); kriminala criminal (law, etc.); kriminanta, krimininta, kriminoza criminal (person); kriminanto criminal, malefactor, kriminaligar to make a criminal out of (ulu); kriminalisto criminal law specialist; kriminozeso criminality; krimino morte punisebla a capital crime. V.exp.: Segun la Franca yuro, la ofensi kontre la lego, segun la grado di graveso, esas: krimino (E. crime), delikto (E. misdemeano(u)r), kontravenco (E. trespass).
krino hair (of animal’s mane or tail); krinaro (horse’s) mane; kaval krino horse-hair; krinkamizeto hair-shirt.
krinolino (fabric or dress) crinoline.
krioforo (phys.) cryophorus.
kriometro cryometer.
krioskopo cryoscope.
krioskopio (phys., med.) cryoscopy.
kripo crib: manger, feeding-trough; (cf. bersilo).

kripla maimed, crippled; (cf. infirma); kripligar to cripple, maim. Def.: Qua perdis membro, o lua uzebleso per deformo; V-157. V. exp.: On povas esar infirma sen esar kripla: multa oldi esas infirma (blinda, surda, nekapabla marchar, e.c.) nam li ankore konservas omna sua membri e korpala integreso, sen esar kripla. Ed on povas esar kripla sen esar infirma (ex. ulu a qua mankas nur un fingro o falango esas kripla, ma ne remarkeble infirma: segun la legala termino, lua labor-kapableso ne diminutesis); V-95.
kripto crypt.
kriptogamo, kriptogama (bot.) cryptogam(ous).
kriptografar (tr.) to write (ulo) in cryptogram (secret characters).
krismo (Cath. and Gr. lit.) chrism, holy-oil.
krispa (of hair) crisp: woolly (as on negroes).

Kristo Christ; Kristana, Kristano Christian; Kristanaro, Kristmondo Christendom; Kristaneso Christianity (quality); Kristanismo Christianity (doctrine); Kristoteologio Christology; ante Kristo (a K.) before Christ (B.C.); pos kristo (p. K.) after Christ, anno domini (A.D.); Kristonasko, Kristala Christmas.
kristalo crystal; kristaligar, kristaleskar to crystallize; kristala glaso cut glass; (cf. quarco).
kristalino (anat.) crystalline lens (of the eye).
kristalografio crystallography.
kristaloido* (chem.) crystalloid.
kriterio criterion.
kriticismo* critical philosophy: the metaphysical system of Kant.
kritikar (tr.) to criticise (ulu, ulo); to examine and judge critically; (cf. blamar); kritikachar to make unjust criticism of, to carp at.
krizo crisis, decisive moment, critical time, turning point; krizala critical: relating to a crisis.
krizalido (ent.) chrysalis, nymph, pupa, grub.
krizantemo (bot.) chrysanthemum (genus: Chrysanthemum).
krizokalko pinch-beck: an alloy of copper and zinc resembling gold.
kroasar (intr.) (of crows) to caw; (of frogs) to croak.
krochar (tr.) to crochet.
kroketo (game) croquet.
krokodilo crocodile.
kromo chrome, chromium.
kromatika (mus., opt.) chromatic.
kromolitografar (intr.) to make chromolithographs.
kromosomo* (biol.) chromosome.
kromotipar (tr.) to chromotype: print in colo(u)rs.
kromotipografar* to print in chromotypography.
krono crown (also fig. as of teeth); kronizar to crown; kronizo crowning, coronation; (fig.) crowning (as of a career); kronizuro (arch.) crown-piece, coping; sen kronigar, des kronizar to uncrown.
kronglaso crown glass.
kronika (med.) chronic: of long duration; kronikeso chronic state; kronikeskar to become chronic.
kroniko chronicle; kronikisto chronicler.
kronologio chronology.
kronometro chronometer.
kronometrio* chronometry: the art of measuring time.
kropo (of birds) crop; kropumo dewlap (as of oxen).
kroso (gen.) any long object with a hook-like end; (of bishop) crozier, pastoral staff; (in hockey) hockey-bat; (of a pistol or musket) butt-end. Def.: Senco generala: kurvigita extremajo; VI-116.
krotalo (zool.) rattlesnake (genus: Crotalus).
krotono (bot.) croton (genus: Croton).
krozar (intr., nav.) to cruise; kroznavo cruiser.

kruco cross; kruce crossways; krucumar (tr.) to c. (roads, etc.); krucigar to make a c. of (ulo); krucforma cruciform; krucvoyo cross-way, cross-road; krucsignizar su to c. oneself; facar krucosigno to make the sign of the c.; krucagar to crucify (ulu); krucagito crucified person; kruceto di fenestro sash-bar; krucokapocross-head (of a piston); krucomilito crusade; krucomilitanto crusader; krucoportisto cross-bearer.
krucho pitcher, jug; kruchedo pitcherful. Def.: Tera o porcelana vazo kun larja ventro e streta kolo, kun anso e kun varsilo.
krucifero, krucifera (bot.) crucifer(ous).
krucifixo crucifix.

kruda crude: not changed from its natural state; (of foods) uncooked; unwrought; (fig.) lacking finish, polish; kruda petro rough ashlar, rough building stone; kruda karno raw, uncooked meat; kruda ledro crust leather; kruda silko raw silk; kruda metalocrude metal, unwrought metal; (fig.) -a penso crude thought; kruda koloro crude colo(u)r.
kruela cruel (tyrant, law, war, etc.); kruelegajo an atrocity.
krugo (wooden or metal) mug, pot (as used for carrying or measuring liquids).

krular (intr.) to fall in, collapse, tumble down (in pieces with noise); (fig.) to sink in ruin; la domo krula the house is falling; (fig.) la tota sistemo krulas the whole system is sinking into ruin. V. exp.: To ne esas simple falar, ma falar kun bruiso, rupteskante e dispeceskante; anke rulante sur inklineso; III-326.
krumo soft part of bread; (cf. panopeceto). Def.: Parto interna e mola di pano; VI-140.
krumplar (tr.) to rumple, crumple, (rough) crease. Ex.: Krumplar robo, papero.
krupo (med.) croup.
krupiero croupier (at gaming table).
kruro thigh; krurala crural, femoral.
krusto crust (of bread, of earth, etc.); (of a sore) scab; krustizar to encrust (ulo); krustopeco crouton, piece of crust.
krustaceo crustacean.
kruzelo crucible: melting-pot; kruzelagar (tr.) to assay, refine (with a crucible).
kuafar (tr.) to dress the hair of (ulu); kuafisto hair-dresser, coiffeur. Def.: Aranjar la hararo di ulu.
kubo (geom., arith.) cube; kubigar to c.; radiko c. root; metro kubo cubic meter (metre).
kubebo cubeb (-pepper).
kubito (anat.) cubitus: ulna (bone).
kuboido* (anat.) cuboid.

kudo elbow, knee; kudigar, kudizar to make an e. out of (ulo); (fig.) to bend (ulo) in the form of an e.; kudpulsar: (od,shokar, frapar per la kudi) to elbow, jostle (with elbows); kudmezuro cubit (-measure); kudapogar to lean on the e., kudapogilo e. rest; intertushar la kudi to be e. to e.
kuglo bullet, musket-ball; kuglego cannon-ball; kugleto (small-) shot; kuglespruva bullet-proof. V. exp.: vid. balono.
kuko cake; kukajo a pastry; kuk(if)isto pastry-cook; kukvenderio a pastry-selling establishment.
kukombro cucumber.
kukulo (orni.) cuckoo (genus: Cuculus); kukulhorlojo cuckoo clock.
kukurbito (bot.) pumpkin; (chem.) cucurbit.
kukurbitaceo cucurbitaceous plant (as cucumber, melon, squash, pumpkin, gourd).
kulo bottom (of objects); arse, buttocks (of persons); kulo di botelo, di lampo bottom of a bottle, a lamp. V. exp.: vid. sedo.
kulato breech (of a cannon, musket, etc.); kulatizar to cover the breech of.
kulbutar (intr.) kulbutigar (tr.) to somersault, turn upside down; (nav.) to capsize; kulbute head over heels; (cf. renversar).
kulco (ent.) gnat, midge (Culex).
kulebrino (ancient cannon) culverin.
«kuli» coolie, cooly: cheap laborer in the Orient.
kuliero spoon; kulierego ladle; kulieredo spoonful; kafe kuliero teaspoon.

kuliso coulisse: (tech.) a groove in which something glides; (theat.) side scene, wing; (finan.) outside stock-exchange, or «curb market»; kulisisto stock-jobber, outside-broker; green-room frequenter (theat.).
kulminar (intr.) culminate: to reach its highest altitude or meridian; to reach the highest point, as of rank, number, size, glory, power, etc.

kulpar (intr.) to commit a fault, to err; kulpo fault, blunder: deviation from duty, propriety through human weakness; deviation from rule through indolence or ignorance; (cf. pekar); kulpanta, kulpinta, kulpoza culpable; sen kulpa faultless, (fig.) guiltless;kulpeto petty fault, peccadillo.
kultar (tr.) to worship; kulto cult; worship.
kultelo knife; kultelego large knife; cutlass.

kultivar (tr.) to cultivate: till (land); raise, as plant or crop, by tillage; (of arts, letters, the mind, etc.) to improve and develop by study and training; (of friendship, acquaintance, etc.) to pay assiduous attention to, to foster; kultiv(ad)o, kultiveso cultivation, tillage, husbandry; kultivebla cultivable, arable. Ex.: Kultivar agro, viti, flori. Kultivar sua spirito, sua memoro, mem sua korpo (on parolas pri korpala kultivado). Instruktisto, edukisto, anke kultivas la spirito di sua dicipuli, lia atenciveso, lia kurajo, ed altra fakultati e vertui. Individui o populi povas kultivar ca or ta cienco, arto, mestiero; ed on povas anke dicar, pri individuo o populo, ke ol esas plu o min «kultivita»; (IV-349-350). Vu devas kultivar amikeso kun ta bona homulo.

kulturo culture; kulturala, kulturema cultural; kulturoza cultured. Def.: Etikala, intelektala e sociala parto di civilizeso (kontraste a progreso en la cienci, l’arti: la civilizo). Ex.: On povus dicar, ke Rusia esis kulturlando, pro ke tanta rusa autori, muzikisti, e.c. pruvis la alta stando di la maxim progresinta Rusi, ma ke Rusia esis apene civilizita, quale aparas per la sistemo di guverno e per la nesavo di la amasi; III-561.
kumino (bot.) cumin; caraway.
«kumis» kumiss, koumiss: a fermented (or distilled) liquor made from milk.
kumpreso (surg.) compress.
kumular (tr.) to hold a plurality of (offices). V. exp: Kumular havas specala, quaze teknikal senco: to esas akumular sur su (akaparar) plura ofici, funcioni . . . e salarii; II-645.

kun (prep.) with, in company with, in connection with; kune together (with); both; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 108). Ex.: La matro arivis kun la filiino. Lu drinkas teo kun lakto. Me kompris ca domo kun la gardeno. La matro e la filiino arivas kune. La infanti dormas kune en la lito. El esas kune (E. both) bela e bona. Ant.: sen.
kunakuzato, kunito fellow-prisoner.
kunaquiranto, kuninto joint-obtainer, co-purchaser.
kunasociito co-partner.
kundebanto joint-debtor.
kundormanto bed-fellow.
kuneiforma cuneiform (writing); (anat.) cuneate (bones in the foot).
kunexistar (intr.) to co-exist.
kunfederar (tr.) to confederate; kunito an ally.
kunfluar (intr.) to be confluent.
kunfrat(ul)o colleague, brother-member.
kunfuzar to blend, fuse together.
kunhabitar, kunvivar (intr.) to live together; (quale spozulo e spozino) to cohabit; (cf. koitar).
kunheredar (intr.) to inherit conjointly; kunanto co-heir.
kuniklo rabbit.
kunkaptito fellow-prisoner.
kunlaborar (intr.) to work together, to co-operate (kun ulu; kp. kooperar).
kunlernanto school-fellow.
kunligar (tr.) to tie together.
kunmezurebla (math.) commensurable.
kunproprietero joint-owner.
kunsidar (intr.) to be seated together; to hold a sitting (meeting); kuno meeting; (fig.) recital; klozar la kunsido to close the meeting. V. exp.: vid. sesiono.
kunsubstanca consubstantial.
kuntara (pezo) gross (weight).
kuntexto context.
kuntrompo collusion (cheating).
kuntutelanto, kunero joint-guardian.
kunvenar (intr.) to meet, come together; kuno meeting, reunion.
kunvivanto one who lives with another; chum.
kunvokar (tr.) to summon (together), convoke, convene.
kunvolvar (tr.) to roll together.
kupo (wine-)glass, vase (as for prize). Def.: Vazo antiqua e ceremoniala, kun pedo, e plura larja kam profunda (on drinkas ex. champano en kupi); II-645.
kupeo (carriage) coupe, brougham.
kupelo (chem., tech.) cupel: a small dish made of bone earth used in assaying.
kuperoso (med.) rosy-drop, pimple, grog-blossom; kuperosika blotched and pimpled. Def.: Specala dermatoso di la nazala regiono; V-675.

kuplar (tr., mechan.) to couple, link together. V. exp.: Kuplar implikas fixa, konstanta ligo di la peci, exemple per skrubi, per kelo, per stango artikizita, e.c. tale ke li nultempe povas movar nedependante (tam longe kam on ne desmuntas la mashino). Ex.: on parolas pri lokomotivi kun 2 o 3 axi «kuplita»; e l’organo di la kuplo esas «kuplo-stango»; III-88.
kupleto couplet, stave, stanza (in song). Def.: Strofo di kansono; III-605.
kupolo (arch.) cupola, dome.
kupono coupon, dividend, warrant.

kupra, kupro copper; kuproza coppery: full of c.; kuprea c. colo(u)red; kuprizar to cover with c.; (fig) to copper-plate; kupra moneto a copper (money); kuprooxo copper acetate, verdigris (cf. verdigriso); kuprokloro cupreous chloride; kuprikloro cupric chloride.
kupulo (bot.) cupule, cup (of acorn).
kuracar (tr.) to treat (a patient); (cf. risanigar, remediar); kuraciva, kuracivo curative; kuracato a patient; kuracarto therapeutics; kuracisto healer (whether by medicine or not; cf. mediko).
kuracao (liquor) curaçoa.
kurajar (intr.) to be courageous, have courage; kurajigar to encourage (ulu); kuraje courageously; (interj.) buck up!
kuraro curare: arrow poison.
kuraso cuirass: breastplate; (ships) armo(u)r-plate; (turtles) carapace; kurasizar to put armo(u)r-plate on; to put a breast-plate on; kurasiero cuirassier; kurasnavo armo(u)red ship, iron-clad.
kurato (jur.) guardianship over an orphan, minor, etc.); trusteeship (of a property); kuratanto, kuratero, kuratisto curator: trustee; (cf. tutelanto).
kurbaturar (intr.) to over-fatigue, become stiff all over, be knocked up; (vet.) to founder. Def.: Indikas la specala doloro quan on sentas en la muskuli pro granda fatigeso; III-266.
kurbetar (intr., of horses) to curvet; (cf. kabrar). Def.: (kurbeto) Galopo per kurta salti en qua la kavalo levas la avana pedi e preske samtempe kontraktas la dopa gambi; VI-76.

kurear (tr., hunt. and fig.) to set (on): to precipitate in a mass on something (as dogs on a quarry); to grab one’s part while quarreling or fighting; kureajo quarry; the part of the beast given to the hounds (to encourage them). Def.: Precipitar su amase sur ulo por arachar, raptar sua parto interlukante e disputante, de qua derivos «kureo» kom ago di la chashundi, o, metafore, di homi os altra animali; VI-162-3.
kurio curia: papal court.
kuriero courier, (express) messenger.
kurioza (of persons) inquisitive, curious; (cf. vidinda, stranja, rara, remarkinda); kuriozacha prying; kuriozeso inquisitiveness; (cf. IV-322).
kurkuliono (ent.) weevil (family Curculionidae).
kurkumo (bot.) curcuma, tumeric (genus: Curcuma).
kurlio (orni.) curlew (genus: Numenius).

kurso course (of lessons, of lectures, of study, etc.); (fin.) rate (of exchange), current price, market price, ruling price; kursolisto price-list (commercial exchange); la kursi falis prices have gone down; kurso di kambio rate of exchange; komprar ye, segun la kurso to buy at the market price; lasta kurso closing price; (cf. koto; III-13, 14).
kursiva (skribado): cursive, running (writing or hand).
kursoro (instr.) cursor; (tech.) slide-weight (on scale). Def.: Indikas irga peco shovebla segun lineo, e quan on povas fixigar en ula punti (ex. Sur vekto di balanco); IV-579.
kurta short; kurtigar to shorten; kurte in short, briefly. Ex.: Kurta homo, kolo, tempo, vivo, parolado. Ant.: longa.
kurtajar (intr.) to carry on the business of a broker; kurtajo brokers’ business; kurtajisto, kurtajero broker; kurtajtaxo pecentage paid to a broker.
kurteno curtain (as of a window, a bed); (fig.) screen (as of trees); (fort.) rideau.
kurtezar (tr.) to pay court to (a king, etc.), to woo (a woman); kurtezanto suitor, wooer, lover; kurtezisto, kurtezero courtier.
kurva curved, bent, crooked, arched; kurvo curve; kurveso (condition) curvature; kurvolinea curvilineal; kurvagamba bandy-, bow-legged.
kurvimetro* curvimeter.
kuseno cushion, pillow; kuseneto pad. Def.: Stofo mola quan on pozas sur lito, divano, irga sidilo; II-647.
kushar (tr.) to put (ulu) to bed; (su) to go to bed; to lie (su) down on (the ground, etc., to sleep); (cf. jacar, sternar).
kuskuto (bot.) dodder (genus: Cuscuta).
kuspido* (geom.) point of retrogression (of a curve).

kustumar (intr.) to be accustomed to, to be in the habit of, to be wont to (followed by infinitive); kustumo custom, habit; kustumala customary, habitual; kustumata accustomed (kozo, e.c.); kustumigar to accustom (su, ulu); kustumale customarily.
kuto* long coat of a peasant; mashkuto coat of mail.
kutio (fabric) ticking (as for a bed), drilling, duck (as for tents, trousers).
kutikulo* (anat., bot.) cuticle; (cf. epidermo).
kutro (nav.) cutter: small armed vessel with one mast.
kuvo tub; kuvego vat. V. exp.: vid. tanko.
kuvento convent.
kuverto (letter-) envelope.
kuzo, kuzulo, kuzino cousin; kuzeso (relation) cousinship; kuzo primara first cousin, kuzo sekundara second cousin.
la (def. article) the; (cf. le). When the following word begins with a vowel, the «a» may be omitted; as: l’infanto. (mus.) la: sixth note diatonic scale.
labaro labarum: a Roman standard.

labio (anat. and fig.) lip; labiala relating to the lip; (gram.) labial; labioza full-lipped; (bot.) labiate; labi(ach)oza, groslabia blubber-lipped, thick-lipped; labiobarbo moustache; labiopilo whisker (of an animal).
labirinto labyrinth; (fig.) maze.
labirintodonto* (paleont.) labyrinthodon(t).

laborar (intr.) to work, labo(u)r (pri ulo); (tr.) to work (the earth, iron, wood, etc.); laborego hard work, toil; laboruro piece of work (performed); laboreso workmanship, manner in which work is executed; laboranta working; laboroza laborious (task); laborema industrious, hard-working; laboranto, laborero, laboristo worker, workman, artisan; labordio working day; laborjorno day’s work, day-labo(u)r; laborbenko work-bench; laboreskar to start work; laborista klaso, laboristaro working class; labordivido division of labo(u)r; par laborar to work through to the end, to finish a work, elaborate.
laboratorio laboratory.
labro (ich.) wrass(e), (genus: Labrus).
laco lace: a plaited string to fasten something through eyelet holes; shoelace, etc; lacagar (tr.) to lace (shoes, corsets, etc.); lacizar to put laces on (ulo); (cf. dentelo).
lacerar (tr.) to lacerate, tear, rend, to fray out (by rubbing).
lacerto lizard; lacertala, lacertatra relating to lizards; (zool.) lacertian.
laciva lascivious, libidinous, lewd, lustful, wanton, lecherous.
lado tin (-plate).
ladano la(b)danum.
lago lake; lageto pond; lagala, lagana, lagohabitanta lacustrine.
laguno lagoon.
lako lac, lacquer; gumlako gum-lac; lakverniso lac varnish, lacquer, japan; shel lako shellac.
lakeo lackey, footman, flunkey.
lakonika laconic.

lakrimo tear; lakrimala lachrymal; lakrimoza, lakrimema lachrymose, tearful; lakrimifar (intr.), lakrimigar (tr.) to produce tears, to cause to shed tears; lakrimovazo lachrymatory, tear-vase. V. exp.: Lakrimifar nule esas neutila duaplajo di plorar; ol havas per su senco kelka diversa; on ploras pro psikologiala kauzo, on lakrimifas pro fiziologial od extera kauzo (kataro, fumuro, sablo, onyono); IV-605.

laktomilk; laktoza, laktatra milky, lacteal, lactic; laktajo a m. preparation; laktea milk-colo(u)red; lakteyo, lakterio dairy; laktoportisto, laktvendisto milkman; laktifar to secrete or yield m.; (cf. melkar): laktifo lactation; laktobovino milch cow; laktopoto m. jug; laktovoyo (astron.) Milky-Way; laktumo (ich.) milt, soft roe.
laktazo* (chem.) lactase.
laktometro* lactometer.

lakuno lacuna, blank space, gap. Def.: Mi-teknikala vorto uzata en diversa faki: indikas generale manko o vakuajo en loko, qua devus esar normale plena (lakuno di texto; lakuno un ula organal texuri); III-204.
lamo thin plate, sheet (-metal); blade (of sword, knife, etc.); lamizita laminated.
lamao lama (priest); (zool.) llama (Auchenia Lama).
lamantino (zool.) lamantin: manatee, sea-cow (genus: Manatus).
lamelo lamella: flake, scale (tech., bot., anat.).

lamentar (intr.) to lament, bewail, mourn (pri); lamentala, lamentatra woeful: relating to lamenting; lamentinda lamentable: worth lamenting. V. exp.: Lamento esas expreso vocala di doloro, ne nur per paroli, ma per krii, jemi, sospiri; plendo esas expreso vortala di des-kontenteso; II-80.
laminar (tr.) to laminate: to flatten out, roll flat; lamineyo, laminerio rolling-mill; laminilo rolling instrument; laminar voyo to roll a road.
lampo lamp.
lampaso* lampas: ornamental fabric for furniture.
lampiono cup or small pot filled with tallow or oil with a wick, for illumination.
lampiro (ent.) lampyris: glow-worm.
lampredo lamprey (Petromyzon).
lanco lance, spear; lanceto small spear; (surg.) lancet.
lancinar (intr.) to shoot, dart, twinge (of pain); lancinanta shooting (pain).
lando land, country; landano a native inhabitant; dopa lando hinterland.
«landau» landau.
«landaulet» landaulet.
landgravo* (title) landgrave: a German count.
«landsturm» landsturm.
«landwehr» landwehr.

lango (anat.) tongue; lang(et)o (fig.) any object shaped like a tongue: language, speech; langeroro an error of the t.; extensar la lango to put out the t.; retenar la lango hold the t.; mea lango faliis my t. slipped, tripped; tera lang(et)o neck of land; faira lango t. of fire; lango di seruro bolt of a lock; resorto lango spring bolt.

langorar (intr.) to languish, pine away, droop (from hunger, love, etc.); to be languid. Def.: Deperisar pokope pro maladeso od afekto qua deprenas la vigoro. Esar komplete senenergia. Ex.: To esas morbo en qua on langoras longatempe ante mortar. Langorar en karcero. La ardoroza suno langorigas la flori. Depos la milito esas granda langoro en komerco. Langor-anta, -oza, -ema spirito.
langusto spring (or spiny) lobster, sea crayfish (Palinurus vulgaris); (cf. homardo).
lanio (orni.) shrike, butcher-bird (Lanius).
lanjo swaddling cloth, clout, baby’s diaper.
lanolino lanolin(e).

lansar (tr., pr. and fig.) to fling, hurl, throw out or forward, cast, lance, dart (stones, darts,etc.) to shoot (an arrow); throw, cast (a look); throw in (an epigram, a word); to send forth (a book, a pamphlet); to cast (a beam of light); to launch (a ship); (cf. jetar, spricar, impulsar, iniciar).
lantano (chem.) lanthanum; (bot.) lantana (genus: Lantana).
lanterno lantern; eklipso lanterno dark lantern.
lanugo fine soft hair or hairlike growth; down (of birds); (anat.) lanugo; (of fruit) wool; (of cloth) soft nap (cf. pilo).
lapar (tr.) to lap (up): take into the mouth with the tongue; (cf. lekar).
lapido precious stone, gem; lapidisto, lapidtaliisto lapidary.
lapislazulo (min.) lapis-lazuli.
lardo bacon, (cf. saimo); (of whales, etc.) blubber; lardofumizita smoked bacon; lardoplako rasher; lardospiso larding needle or pin; lardofilo, lardkordono strip, slice of bacon.
larico (bot.) larch (-tree) (genus: Larix).
laringo (anat.) larynx: laringala larynge-an, -al.
laringito* (med.) laryngitis.
laringoskopo* laryngoscope.
laringotomio* laryngotomy.

larja broad, wide; (N.B. not «large»; cf. grosa, granda); larjeso width, breadth, wideness, broadness; (plu) larjigar to widen, broaden; du larjesi two breadths (of cloth); longese e larjese in length and width; ica agro esas larja de duadek metri this field is 20 meters (metres) wide. Def.: Qua havas la un dimensiono de dextre a sinistre (opozita a longa). Ex.: Larja shultri, nazo, facio, rivero. Ant.: streta.
larvo (ent.) larva; (antiq.) a ghost, spector (spectre); larvo di batrako the young of the frog or other batrachians; ran larvo tadpole.

lasar (tr.) to let, give leave, permit, allow: not to hinder to have, to do; to let alone; (pos) to leave behind; lasar su to allow, suffer oneself (to), lasar ulu repozar to let someone rest, let anyone alone; me lasas vu imaginar I let you think; me lasas il parolar I let him speak. Ex.: Il volabus, se on lasabus lu agar, ke on demandas de lu permiso pri omno. Me lasis il tranquila. Ni opinionas ne vivar vane quankam nia verki apene lasas traci. Yen pomi, prenez le bone e lasez le mala.
lasho (surg.) splint; (R.R.) fish-plate; (tech.) butt joint.
laskaro* lascar: East-Indian sailor.

lasta last (in time and space); laste lastly (of time) lately (cf. recente). Ex.: La lasta horo di la dio. Lasta yaro. La lasta domo en la strado. Laste naskinta. En lasta instanco. Laste, me parolis pri.
lato lath; latizar to lath; lataro, latogreto lattice work (cf. treliso); latego batten, thin scantling.
latanio (bot.) latania (-tree), fan-palm (Latania); latanibero fruit of latania.
latenta latent. Def.: Qua ne aparas extere; II-20. Ex.: Defekto latenta (en mashino, en animalo). Latenta kaloro.
latero (geom. arch.) side; laterala lateral, side (cf. flanko, bordo).
latexo* (bot.) latex.
laticifera* (bot.) laticerous.
Latina Latin; Latin(ul)o a Latin; Latinajo a Latin idiom; Latineso Latinity; Latinisto Latinist; Latinigar to Latinize; la Latina (linguo); the Latin.
latiro (bot.) sweet-pea (Lathyrus).
latitudo latitude.
latrino water-closet, latrine, privy.
latugo (bot.) lettuce.
latuno brass; latuna filo brass wire.
laubo (green) arbor, bower.
laudar (tr.) to praise, laud, commend; laudodiskurso eulogy, panegyric. Ant.: blamar.
laudano* laudanum.
lauro (bot.) laurel (genus: Laurus); (fig.) glory, hono(u)r; laurizar to deck, crown with laurel; ceriz lauro cherry-laurel; bay-laurel; roz lauro common oleander, rose-bay.
laureato laureate.
lauso louse; lausoz(ul)o lousy person.
lauta loud (voice, sound).

lavar (tr.) to wash, wash off or up, lave; (of clothes) to launder: (fig.) cleanse (cf. netigar, skurar); lavistino washerwoman; (di linjo) laundress; lavajo laundry; (linj) laverio laundry; lavmoblo wash-stand.
lavao lava; lavaofluajo lava flow.
lavendo (bot.) lavender (Lavandula).
lazo lasso.
lazareto lazaretto: pest-, quarantine-house for sailors.
«lazarone» lazzaroni: the poor class in Naples.
le (pl. of def. article la) the: only to be used when there is no other sign of plural, e.g. «the ayes and the nayes»: le yes e le no.
lea* (frato) (R.C. Ch.) lay brother (cf. laika).
leciono (teacher’s) lesson; (professor’s) lecture.
lecitino* (chem.) lecithin.
ledro leather; -opreparisto leather-dresser, currier.

lego (natural, moral, social, parl., legislative) law (cf. yuro); legisto one skilled in law; legala, segunlega legal, lawful; legaleso, legokonformeso legality; legaligar to legalize; legifar to legislate; legaro laws (collect.), legislation; legifala legislative, relating to legislation; legifanta legislative, law-giving (body); legifantaro legislature; legifanto, legero, legisto law-maker, legislator.

legacar (tr.) to bequeath (ulo ad ulu); legacajo legacy, bequest; legacario legatee. V.exp.: Legacar diferas de testamentar, per ke ol koncernas specale la kozi, havaji donata per testamento, e konseque havas sempre ta kozi kom rekta komplemento. On povas testamentar sen legacar ulo; III-160.
legato (pope’s) legate.
legendo legend.
legiono legion; (fig.) a multitude; HonorLegiono Legion of Hono(u)r; me nomesas legiono my name is legion (Bib.).

legitima legitimate; having the sanction of law, custom or logic; (of a child) born in wedlock; (of a king) hereditary; legitimigar to legitimize; (cf. yurizar: yustigar, justifikar). Ex.: Legitima infanto, autoritato, pretendo, plendo.
legumo vegetable.
legumino (chem.) legumin.
leguminoso (bot.) leguminous plant.
lekar (tr.) to lick; (cf. lapar); lekar sua fingri to lick one’s fingers.
lektar (tr.) to read, peruse; lektajo what is read; lektebla readable: legible; lektinda readable: worth reading; ri lektar to read over again.
lektoro (university) lecturer; (eccl.) lector.
lemo (log., math.) lemma; loam (as used for founding).
lemingo* (zool.) lemming (genus: Lemmus).
lemniskato (geom.) lemniscate.
lemuriano (zool.) lemur (sub-order: Lemuroidea).
lengo (ich.) ling. (Lo ta molva).
lenio (firewood) block, log; lenieto billet, block; (cf. lignobloko).
lenso (opt.) lens; (bot.) lentil (Lentilla lens); lensatra, lensforma lenticular.

lenta slow: not acting, moving promptly, sluggish, lagging; (cf. tarda); lentacha dawdling; (plu) lentigar to cause (ulo, ulu) to slow down. Ex.: Lenta treno, mento, exekuto, veneno, morto. Ant.: rapida, ajila.
lentigino freckle; lentiginoza lentiginous, freckly.
lentisko (bot.) lentiscus: mastic-tree (Pistacia lentiscus).
leono: ulo, ino lion; (astr.) Leo; (fig.) object of interest and curiosity; yuno young lion, lion’s cub; ala leonine; ala parto (fig.) the lion’s share; dento (bot.) dandelion (Leontodon taraxacum).
leopardo (zool.) leopard (Felis Leopardus).
lepidodendro* (paleon.) lepidodendron.
lepidoptero (ent.) lepidopter(an).
leporo hare (genus: Lepus); leporraguto jugged hare; leporlabio hare lip.
lepro (med.) leprosy.
lernar (tr.) to learn (ulo); (cf. instruktar, docar, studiar, saveskar); lernolibro text-book, manual. V. exp.: La gepatri docas ulo a la infanto, a la puero. La infanto, la puero lernas ol.
lesivar (tr.) to wash (clothes, etc. in lye); (chem.) lixiviate; lesivaquo lye-water; lixiviation; lesivajo linen or object to be washed, the laundry.
letargio (med.) lethargy: morbid sleepiness; (cf. torporo).
letro (in correspendence) letter; letrokapo letter-head; letrponderilo letter-scale.
leucino* (physiol. chem.) leucine.
leucito* (min.) leucite; (bot.) leucite: leucoplast.
leukocito* (anat.) leucocite: white blood corpuscle.
leukocitoso* (physiol. and med.) leukocytosis.
leukomo* (anat.) leucoma.
leukoplasto* (bot.) leucoplast.

levar (tr.) to lift (up); to raise (from below); levar su to arise, get up; levilo lifting instrument; levoskrubo screw-jack; levar la shultri to shrug the shoulders; levponto lifting-bridge. Ex.: Levar la pedo, la manuo, la ankro. V.exp.: vid. elevar.
levero (mechan.) lever, handspike; fer levero crowbar.
leviatano (pr. and fig.) leviathan.
levito Levite.
levriero, levrierulo, levrierino greyhound.
lexiko lexicon, dictionary (esp. of Greek, Latin, Hebrew); (cf. vortaro, vortolibro).
lexikografo lexicographer.
lexikografio lexicography.
lexikologio lexicology; lexikologiisto lexicologist.
lezar (tr., physiol., jur.) to injure, hurt, wrong; lezo, lezuro (jur.) wrong, injury; (med.) lesion.
lithey (in general); (cf. il); lia, lii (adj.) their(s).
liano (bot.) liana, bind-weed, creeper; any woody, climbing and twining plant.
liaso (geol.) Lias.
libacionar (intr.) to offer up libations; libaciono libation, potation.
libelo* libella: an instrument which measures levels: (water-) level.
libelulo (ent.) libellulid: dragon-fly; (Libellula).

libera free; libere freely; libero, liberulo, liberino a free person; liberala (of books, arts, education, principles, political parties, etc.) liberal; liberalo a liberal, liberalist; liberaleso, liberismo liberalism; liberesana, liberano libertarian; liberigar to discharge, liberate, free; liberigo deliverance, liberation; liberiganta liberating, freeing, rescuing; libertempo leisure, spare time; (cf. ocio); tempal homulo a man of leisure; en libera aero in the open air; ne libera balonego a captive baloon; ne libereso captivity (cf. kaptiteso); liberkambio free-trade; liberkambiisto free-trader; liberpensado free-thinking; liberpenseso free-thought.

libertina (esp. of the imagination, mind) unrestrained, wayward, flighty (to an excessive degree); libertin(ul)o one characterized by excessive freedom in thought, manners, habits, morals; (N.B. not E. libertine: cf: debocho); libertineso libertinism (obs. sense), libertinesar to be free from restraint, to go to excess.

libro book, volume (cf. tomo); libreto booklet; (mus.) libretto; libretisto(mus.) librettist; libristo, librvendisto book seller, libraro collection of books, a library – books alone; cf. biblioteko).
libraco* (astron.) libration: an apparent oscillatory motion (as of moon).

lico (ancient) lists; (modern) track, race course. Def.: Voyo preparita specala (ed enklozita) per konkursala kuri (sive di kavali, sive di homi, sive bicikli, automobili, e.c.); IV-454. V. exp.: vid. areno.

licencar (tr.) to grant a license, give (official) permission (to sell spirits, to teach, etc.); licenco license, licensing; (poetic) license; deviation from strict fact, form or rule (by artist or writer); licentiate: a European university degree between that of bachelor and doctor; M.A. degree (= L licentia docendi ), licenciero (univ.) licentiate, an M.A.; licencoza, licencema uncurbed.
lienterio* (med.) lientery: a kind of diarrhoea.
lietnanto lieutenant; lietnanteso (rank) lieutenancy; lietnantkolonelo lieutenant-colonel.

ligar (tr.) to bind (down), tie (up), fasten, attach; lig(ad)o, ligeso, liguro (act, state, result) binding, fastening; league (association; cf. federo); (anat.) ligature; ligajo something bound together, a bundle; ligilo lash, band, strap (for tying); (fig.) bond (as of matrimony); hundligilo dog leash; kun ligar to tie together.
ligamento* (anat.) ligament.

ligno wood (the material); ligna, lignala, lignoza, lignatra woody, ligneous; lignomortinta dead wood; lignoshuo wooden shoe, sabot; lignobloko block of wood, log; lignopaneli wainscotting; lignotrepano auger; lignomartelo mallet; ligninkrustado, lignuro marquetry.
lignino* lignin.
lignito lignite.
ligustro (bot.) privet (genus: Ligustrum).
likar (tr., intr.) to leak. Def.: (1) (aquo) enirar navo; (2) (liquido o gaso) ekirar vazo, e.c.; (3) (navo) enlasar aquo tra truo, fenduro; (4) (vazo) eklasar liquido o gaso; II-76.
likantropa*, likantrop(ul)o (med.) (person) afflicted with lycanthropy; likantropeso lycanthropy.
likeno (bot.) lichen; (cf. musko); likeno Islandana Iceland moss.
likenino* lichenin: a starch derived from Icelandic moss.
likopodio (bot.) lycopod(ium), club-moss , (genus: Lycopodium).
liktoro (Rom. hist.) lictor.
lilaco (bot.) lily (genus: Syringa); lilacea lilac-colo(u)red.
lilio (bot.) lily (genus: Lillium); lilifloro lilly flower.
liliaceo* a lileaceous plant (family: Liliaceae).
Liliputala, Liliputana, Liliputatra Lilliputian.
limar (tr.) to file; (cf. raspar); limarilo triangula a three-cornered file.
limako (zool.) slug, naked snail (genus: Limax); limakala, limakatra limacine, snail-like.
limando (ich.) dab (Pleuronectes limanda).
limbo (tech.) limb; an edge or border, as of a disk.
limeto (fruit) lime; limetiero lime tree (Citrus limetta).
limfo (anat.) lymph; limfala lymphatic (duct, gland, etc.); limfoza lymphatic (temperament; of persons).
limfatismo (med.) lymphatism.

limito limit, boundary, bound; limitizar to set bounds to, to bound (a field, a country; cf. restriktar); limitiz, limituro limitation; limitizanta limiting; sen limita, ne limitizita unlimited, boundless.
limono (fruit) lemon; limoniero lemon tree (Citrus limonum).
limonado lemonade.
limpida limpid, clear (liquid, glass); limpidigar liquido per filtrado to clear water by filtering (cf. VI-528). Ant.: konfuza.
lino (bot.) flax (linum usitatissimum); linajo (fabric) flax; semino, lini flaxseed, linseed; linoleo linseed oil.
linco (zool.) lynx (Felis Lynx); lincokulo (lit., and fig.) eye of a lynx, lynx-eye.
linchar (tr.) to lynch (ulu).

lineo (telegraphic, R.R., genealogical, military, writing, printing) line; (cf. streko); lineala lineal: relating to lines; in a direct line (as line succession; cf. lineara); lineizar to rule (paper, etc.); lineizilo ruler; (cf. linealo); linee, rektolineein line, in a straight line; lineo direta a direct line, lineajo line (geneal., biol.).
linealo ruler (for drawing lines); kalkul linealo slide-rule.
lineara* (math.) linear; of the first degree; linearmezuro lineal measure.
lingoto ingot; ora lingoto bullion; gisfera lingoto iron in pigs. Def.: Pecego di neformizita fuzita metalo, precipue oro; II-76.
linguolanguage; linguala linguistic: relating to a language (cf. linguistikala); linguisto linguist; linguo matrala mother tongue; la doto di lingui the gift of languages.
linguistiko linguistics: science of language; linguistikala linguistical; relating to l.; (cf. linguala).
linimento* liniment, embrocation; (cf. embrokar).

linjo (lit. and fig.) linen: a piece of washable wearing apparel or household goods, made from flax , muslin, cotton; linjaro korpala underclothing, lingerie; linjaro domala house linen (table-cloths, sheets, etc.); linjo lavistino laundress.
«linoleum»* linoleum (as for floors).
linono lawn: a fine linen.
lintelo (carp.) lintel: head-piece of a door-frame or window-frame.
lipomo (med.) lipoma: a fatty tumor.
liquacar* (intr., metal) to liquate.

liquida (also gram.) liquid; liquido, liquidajo a liquid; liquideso liquidity; liquidigar to liquefy. V. exp.: Liquidaji referas kozi qui havas, mem instantale, la qualeso liquideskar; ex.: (liquida) metalo. Fluido nultempe asumas formo solid; aero esas fluido; (kp. fluido).
liquidacar (tr., com.) to liquidate, settle, wind up (property, debts, businesses).
liquoro liqueur, cordial; (cf. akloholaji).
liro(mus.) lyre; (astron., anat.) lyra.
lirika lyric.
listo list (of persons, of things); (parl., milit.) roll; listo di elekteri list of electors; listo di juriani panel of jurymen; listovoto vote by ticket.
listelo (arch.) listel, fillet.
lito bed ((for sleeping, also fig. as bed of river), litala kozi bedding; litoframo bedstead; litodoselo, litcielo b. canopy, litotuko b. sheet; litkovrilo b. cover; porto lito litter.
litanio litany; (fig.) endless enumeration.
litargiro (min.) litharge.

litero letter (of alphabet); litereto small letter; (cf. miniskulo, mayuskulo); literala relating to letters; literal: following the letter of exact meaning, not figurative; (cf. vortopa); literope letter by letter.

literaturo literature: the collective body of literary productions, belles-lettres; literaturisto (professional) literary man; literaturoza literary, scholarly, lettered (of persons); literaturozi the literati, literary people. Def.: La artiste skribita verki, la «bela literaturo»; II-87. V. exp.: Literaturo ne esas sinonima di verkaro qua indikas omnaspeca verki; II-87.
litio* (chem.) lithium.
litiero litter: straw, hay, etc. used for bedding of animals.
litijo litigation: suit at law; litijpunto point at issue; litijala, litijoza litigious, contentious.
litografar (tr.) to lithograph; litografuro a lithograph.
litologio lithology.
litoro littoral: coastal region, seaboard. Def.: La tota regiono plu o min larja, kontigua a la rivo; IV-426, 606; cf. plajo. Exp.: Litorala voyo o fervoyo ne sequas ne sequas sempre la rivo.
litoto (rhet.) litotes.
litotomio (surg.) lithotomy; litotomiar to lithotomize.
litotricio (surg.) lithotrity; litotriciar to perform l.
litotripsio (surg.) lithotripsy, lithority; litotripsiar to perform l.
litro liter, litre (1.0567 quarts).
liturgio liturgy.
liuto (mus.) lute.
livar (tr.) to leave or depart; to leave behind; to quit (a place or position). V.exp.: vid. abandonar.
livida livid: black and blue, leaden-colo(u)red. V.exp.: Palega tote ne esas exakta: livida esas plu juste plombo-kolora; III-20.

livrar (tr.) to deliver (goods, culprits, manuscripts, etc.); livrar su to deliver oneself up, give oneself up, surrender; livristo delivery-man. V. exp.: La furnisanto ne livras la vari, nam il havas nula livristo; II-79.
livreo livery (worn by servants).
lizo lees, dregs; grounds (of wine, beer); (fig.) dregs of the people.
lizimakio (bot.) loose-strife (genus: Lysimachia).

lo it (referring to the contents of a previous sentence, i.e. a fact, rather than a definite object; cf. ol); prenez ica pomo, me volas lo take this apple I desire it (= I desire you to do so; me volas ol would mean I desire it, i.e. the apple); nia amiko ja arivis, kad vu savas lo? … lo joyigas me our friend has already arrived, do you know it? … it affords me joy. Lo is also used with adjectives to mark an indeterminate sense: lo bona, lo vera, lo bela the good, the true, the beautiful; lo sama, lo duesma the same, the second (where it refers to an indeterminate object or statement). Def.: Pronomo ed artiklo indikanta kozo nedeterminita (antea frazo integra); VI-161, 239; Mondo, IX, 55, 102.
lobo (anat., bot.) lobe.
lobelio* (bot.) lobelia (genus: Lobelia).
locho (ich.) loach (Cobitis barbatula).
locionar (tr., med.) to wash with a lotion (ulu, ulo); lociono lotion.
logaritmo (math.) logarithm; logaritmotabelo table of logarithms.
logiko logic; logikisto logician; logikala relating to logic; logikema, logikoza logical (proposition, person); logikozeso, logikemeso logicality; ne logikala, kontre logika illogical.
logogrifo logogriph: word riddle.
logomakio logomacy: war of words.

lojar (intr.) to lodge, live, dwell for a limited time (che ulu, ulo); lojigar to lodge, put up (ulu); lojeskar to take one’s abode, settle oneself; (fig.) to lodge itself, fix itself; lojeyo lodging place, dwelling; lojanto a lodger; lojiganto lodging house keeper; lojbilieto billet (for troops). V. exp.: vid. habitar.

loko place, spot, locality; (cf. placo); lokala local; loke, lokale locally; lokaro premises, quarters, general locality; lokizar to localize; (cf. enfakigar, rangizar, situar); omnaloke everywhere; komuna loko public place.

lokacar (tr.) to hire, rent, lease (ulo, de ulu); (cf. lugar); lokacokontrato lease (document); lokacanto, lokacero one who hires, rents, lessee, tenant; lokacajo what is hired, leased (house, vehicle, etc.); lokacopreco cost of hiring; lokacokontoro box-office; domo lokacebla house to let.
lokativo(gram.) locative case.
loklo, lokleto lock of hair, curl, ringlet; lokligar, loklifar (tr., intr.) to curl (hair); lokloza curly.
lokomobilo (agri., manu.) traction engine; (portable) steam engine.
lokomoco locomotion; lokomocar (intr.) to move from place to place. Ex.: Lokomoco divenis plu rapida depos la kreo di fervoyo. Muskuli lokomocala.
lokomotivo (R.R.) locomotive.
lokusto (ent.) locust; (cf. akrido).
lolio (genus) lolium: rye-grass, darnel, tear.
lombardo pawnshop; lombardisto pawnbroker.
lombriko lumbric; earthworm, dew-worm.
loncho slice, chop (of bread, meat, etc.); pan loncho butrizita slice of bread and butter.

longa (of time, space) long; longeso length; longajo a long object; longeta longish, pretty long; longesala longitudinal; longe, longese, longesale in length, lengthwise, longitudinally; longe, longatempe (for) a long time, a great while; (plu) longigar to lengthen, elongate, prolong; longeskar to grow longer, stretch out; de longe long since, long ago; ica agro esas longa de cent metri (od, havas cent metri de longeso) this field is 100 meters (metres) long. Ant.: kurta (cf. oblonga).
longitudo longitude.

lor (prep.) at the time of (a definite event), at the same time as; lore then, at that time, by then; lora at that time (cf. dum); lore … lore now … then; til lore until then; ja lore, de lore thenceforth; since then; lor la milito at the time of the war; lor elua mariajo at the time of her marriage; la lora ministraro the then ministry, the ministry of that time. Def.: En la tempo di (samtempe kam); III-667.
«lord» (title) Lord; (cf. sinioro).
lorno (small) telescope, spy-glass; a single-barrelled field glass; lorneto small spy-glass, lorgnette; (cf. teleskopo, bilorneto); lornagar (tr.) to look through a spy-glass at (ulu, ulo).

loto lot: portion, share; (things for sale) lot; loto di komercaji a portion of goods; (in a lottery) share; (fig.) prize; ganar la granda (odla maxima) loto to win the highest prize; (N.B. not in sense of fate: destino); lotigar to divide into lots, to portion off: (cf. porcionigar: parceligar); lotizar to put a share, a lot into something; me havas (ya) bela loto I have made a good choice; lotoludo lotto; a game of chance.
lotao (ich.) lote: burbot, eel-pout (genus: Lota [vulgaris]).
lotriar (tr.) to cast lots for (ulo); to raffle for; to draw (lots, in a lottery); lotrio lottery, raffle.
lotuso (bot.) lotus.
loxodromo* (geom., nav.) loxodromic curve or line.

loyala loyal: faithful in any relation implying trust or confidence; straight-forward, fair-dealing; bearing true allegiance. Ex.: Loyala a la rejo, a sua patrio, a sua promiso, en amikeso. Ant.: nesincera; hipokrita.

lu (pron.) he, she, it (common gender form); lua his her(s), its; (when desirable to indicate gender, the forms: ilua, olua, elua are used ); V. exp.: su, lu il lavas su (E. he washes himself); il lavis lu (E. he washed him, or her, or it). Petro deziras pruntar de Karlo lua parapluvo(E. Peter desires to borrow from Charles his umbrella); lua indikas ke la parapluvo esas la proprajo di Karlo; se sua esis uzata vice lua, ol (sua) indikus ka la parapluvo esas la proprajo di Petro, qua esas la subjekto di pruntar; pluse kp. su e lu, Talmey, Text Book, p. 65-6.
lubrifikar (tr.) to lubricate: to oil; grease (part of a machinme); lubrifikisto oiler.
lucio (ich.) pike (Esox lucius).
lucida (of mind) lucid, clear, sane. Ex.: Homo di lucida mento. Instanti lucida.
luciolo (ent.) lightning-bug, fire-fly. (Luciola italica).

ludar (intr. of games, sports) to play (per); (cf. plear); ludriskar to gamble; ludo playing, game; lud(risko) gambling; ludanto, ero a player;ludera, ludema playful (child, animal); ludemo playful person; (fig.) gamester, gambler; ludilo paything, toy;ludkubo, ludaro dice; ludodisko (in games) a quoit; ludosplinto spilikin; jackstaw; peg (as for cribbage); ludsonalio toy bell; vortoludo play upon words; espritludo play of wit; ludotablo a table for play; ludo di pacienteso patience. Ex.: On ludas per kegli, per buli, per biliardo, per karti, per shako, e.c.
ludiono «ludion»; (toy) Cartesian devil, bottle-imp. Def.: Aparato fizikala uzata por studiar la diferanta efiki sur korpo plunjita en l’aquo, anke uzebla kom ludilo.
lugar (tr.) to let (out), rent (out); hire (out), lease (out) (ulo, ad ulu); (cf. lokocar); lugo letting, renting, leasing (by the proprietor); lugokontrato lease.
lugro (vessel) lugger.
luko sky-light; dormer-window; (nav.) hatchway.
lukano (ent.) stag-beetle (family: Lucanus).
luktar (intr.) to wrestle: contend by grappling (kun) and striving to throw; to scuffle, tussle; (fig.) to strive, struggle (kontre).
lular (tr.) to lull (ulu) to sleep, to soothe, compose, quiet; lulkanto lullaby (cf. bersokanto).

lumar (intr. also fig.) to shine: emit rays of light, give light; (cf. brilar); lumo light; lumeto, esko glimmer, gleam; lumala relating to light; lumoza full of light; lumigar to cause (ulo) to shine; lumifar to produce light; lumizar to light (a room, etc.) throw light upon; (fig.) to elucidate (a subject); lumizilo a light(ing instrument), luminary; lumifanta luminous: light producing; lumizataluminous (from light received); lumozeso luminosity; lumrango (theat.) foot-lights; lumtruo (nav.) porthole; (in gen.) scuttle.
lumbo, lumbi lumbar region, loin(s); lumbala lumbar; lumboza thick-backed (person); lumbopeco (di bovo); sirloin; lumboruptar to break the back of.
lumbago (med.) lumbago.
lumpo* (min.) nodule: kidney-shaped ore, lump (of sugar).
lun (abbr. accus. form of ilun, elun, olun, without gender).
luno moon; lunala lunar; lunala periodo lunation, lunar month; lunsunalaluni-solar; lunolumo moonlight; luno plena full moon; lunonova new moon; luneto (geom.) lune.
lunatika, lunatik(ul)o moon-struck, insane; fantastic, whimsical.
lundioMonday.
lunoida* (osto) semilunar bone of the wrist.

lupo (simple) magnifying glass, reading glass, pocket lens. Def.: Optikal aparato, qua servas por «grandigar» l’objekti (ye mikra raporto), e qua esas nek sempre simpla lenso, nek mikroskopo. On nomizas ol anke «mikroskopo simpla»; V-675.
lupanaro* (antiq.) lupanar, brothel.
lupio (med.) wen. Def.: Speco di tumoro sub la pelo; V-675
lupino (bot.) lupine (genus: Lupinus).
lupulo (bot.) hop (-vine) (Humulus lupulus); lupuleyo, lupulagro hop-garden, -field.
lupuso (med.) lupus.

lurar (tr.) to lure, allure, entice; (fig.) wheedle, cajole (cf. seduktar); lurilo, lurizilo a lure; decoy, bait; lurilizar to bait (a trap); lursiflilo call-whistle (for animals, birds); lurucelo decoy-bird.
lustro chandelier (cf. kandeliero); (antiq.) lustrum: space of five years.
lustracar (tr., antiq.) to lustrate: make clear or pure by propitiatory offering.
lustrino (fabric) lustring.
luto lute: a clayish cement.
Luteranismo Lutheranism; Luteranana, Luterano Lutheran.
lutro (zool.) otter (genus: Lutra).
luxo luxury; luxaji luxuries, fancy goods, articles de luxe, luxala sumptuary: relating to luxury; luxozaluxuriant; luxozeso sumptuousness, luxuriousness; (cf. abundanta, richega).
luxacar (tr., surg.) to luxate, dislocate, put out of joint (cf. dislokar).
luxurio lust, lewdness, lechery, unchastity; luxurioza lustful, lewd.
ma (conj.) but.
macedonio macedoine: a dish consisting of a medley of fruit and vegetables; (fig.) medley, hodgepodge.
macerar (tr., intr.) to macerate: soften by steeping.
«macfarlane» macfarlane: a kind of overcoat without sleeves and with a mantle.
«mackintosh» mackintosh: a watertight overcoat.
«madapolam» (fabric) madapollam.
madeleno madeline: a small rich cake.
madono madonna: a picture or statue of the Virgin Mary.
«madras» bandana handkerchief.
madreporo madrepore, stony coral (genus: Madrepora).
madrigalo madrigal: a part song or glee; a little amorous poem.
maestro, maestrulo, maestrino maestro: a teacher of eminence, or one eminently skilled in some art or science; maestrverko master-piece.
mago, magi (biblical) magian, magi.
magazino (com.) warehouse, storehouse; (nav.) storeroom; (milit.) magazine. ?DEFIR
magiar (intr.) to practise magic; magiala kanto, dicajo incantation; (cf. eskamotar, sorcar, divinar, nekromanciar).
magnato magnate: a nobleman of Poland or Hungary.
magneto magnet; magnetopetro loadstone; magnetigar to magnetize; magneta agulo magnetic needle; magneteso (property) magnetism.
magnetizar (tr.) to mesmerize (ulu); magnetiz(ad)o mesmerizing; animal magnetism; magnetizala mesmeric; (cf. hipnotar).
magnezo (chem.) magnesium.
magnezio (chem.) magnesia: magnesium oxide.
magnolio (bot.) magnolia (-tree) (genus: Magnolia).

magra lean, meager, lank, spare; (of things) poor, sorry, scant, meager; magr(ul)o a lean person; (la) magrajo the lean (of meat); magrigar, magreskar to make, become lean; magrega, magracha emaciated. Ex.: Magra Homo, vizajo, bovo, karno. (fig.) Magra burso, repasto, sulo, amuzo. Ant.: grasa.
mahagono (wood) mahogany; mahagoniero m. tree; (Swietenia mahagoni); mahagona litoframo m. bedstead.
maifloro (bot.) lily of the valley (Convallaria majalis).
maizo maize: (U.S.) corn; (England) Indian corn; (Zea mays).
majesto majesty, supreme grandeur, august dignity, stateliness; (cf. Sinioro, la rejo, e.c.); majestoza majestic; majestolezo lesé majeste.
majora of full age; (mus.) major; majoro, majorulo, majorino one who has attained his majority; (mus. and logic) major; majoreso majority: legal age. Ant.:minora.
majorano (bot.) (sweet) marjoram (Origanum Majorana).
majorato majorat; (in France) landed property attached to a title and descending with it; entailed estate.
majordomo majordomo, head steward.
majoritatomajority: more than half of a given number or group; (cf. plumulto).
makadamo macadam; makadamizar to macadamize: cover a road with small broken stones.
makako (zool.) macaque: a genus (Macaca) of short-tailed monkeys.
makarono macaroon: a kind of cake.
makaronio macaroni.
makaroniko macaronic. Def.: Dicesas pri verki kompozita en Latino barbara e burleska; IV-394.
makio (zool.) maki (Lemur).
Makiavelala, Makiavelatra, Makiavelismo machiavelli-an, -ism.
maklo* (min.) macle, chiastolite.
makrelo (ich.) mackeral (genus: Scomber).
makrosporo* (bot.) macrospore, megaspore.
makrosporangio* (bot.) macrosporangium.

makulo (also fig.) macula: spot, blotch, stain; makulizar to blot, stain, daub, smear; makuloza, makulizita spotted, speckled; makuletizar to spot, speckle, fleck; sen makula spotless; makulole, fangomakulo oil-, mud-stain; kavalo kun ronda makuli dappled horse; makulo sur lua honoro, sur la bona reputo stain, blot upon his hono(u)r, reputation.
makulaturo (print.) maculature: waste or spoiled paper.

mala bad, evil, ill (quality, acts, writing, condition, weather, news, sense, etc.); male badly, wrongly, amiss, poorly; malajo (gen. sense) bad object, act, event; hardship, misfortune; mischief; plu mala worse; plumaligar to make worse; la maxima malajo, lo maxim mala the worst (thing); malagar, malfacar to act, do wrong, evil, mischief; malfacema malevolent, mischievous; malauguroza inauspicious, sinister, unlucky; mala chanco ill-luck, mischance; malchancoza unlucky, unfortunate; malefikanta malevolent, malignant; male traktar to maltreat, ill-use, abuse, bully; malfamoza ill-famed; maledukita badly brought up, ill-bred, unmannerly; malformacita malformed, gawky, ill-shaped; maldigesto indigestion; malhumoroza bad homo(u)red, ill-tempered; malintencanta, maloza evil-minded, badly-disposed; malodoro bad smell, stink; mala morto tragic death, bad end;malpektita unkempt; mala pesto! egad! plague on it! malvolanta malevolent, ill-disposed, spiteful; malvoleganta malignant. Ant.: bona.

malada sick, ill (person); maladeta, maladema poorly, sickly, somewhat unwell, ailing, indisposed; malad(ul)o a sick person; maladeso (condition) illness, sickness (cf. morbo); maladeteso indisposition; igar maladeta to indispose. V. exp.: vid. morbo. Ant.: sana.
malakito (min.) malachite.
malario (med.) malaria.

maldicensar (intr., tr.) to speak ill (pri ulo), to disparage, decry (ulu, ulo); (cf. denigrar, difamar, kalumniar). Def.: Dicar malajo pri ulu, ulo, pro mala intenco. V. exp.: La civila lego punisas la difamo, na la maldicenso; ica resortisas nur a la etikal lego.
maledikar (tr.) to curse, imprecate, damn (ulu, ulo); (cf. blasfemar, imprekar); malediko malediction, curse.
maleolo (anat.) malleolus: ankle-bone, ankle.

malgre (prep.) in spite of, despite, notwithstanding, against the will of; malgreke (conj.) notwithstanding that (followed by verb; cf. tamen); malgre sua volo against one’s will; malgreto in spite of that, nevertheless; ni iris malgre la pluvo we went notwithstanding the rain; ni iris malgre ke il interdiktis lo we went notwithstanding he forbade it; el mariajis su kun il malgre sua matro she married him contrary to her mother’s wish.
malio a mallet or mall used in play; malioludo mall (a game); malioplaco a place for playing mall.

malico malice, spite; mischievousness; smartness; malicoza, malicema malicious, spiteful, mischievous; malicajo malicious or mischievous act. N.B. The sense of this word is by no means always «malice». It is something between evil intention and keen wit with a tinge of each in it, sometimes having more of the one, sometimes more of the other.

maligno malicious, pernicious, evil, ill-disposed, malign, baleful. (N.B. Maligna is used in a somewhat less strong sense than the E. «malignant»; and properly means: disposed to take pleasure in the misfortune or suffering of others; malignega, malvoleganta); maligna muliero a malicious woman; maligna spirito an evil spirit; maligna tomoro a malignant tumo(u)r.
malto malt.
Maltakruco Maltese cross.
malvo (bot.) mallow (genus: Malva); malvea mauve-colo(u)red.
