peskar (intr.) to fish, angle (por, per, ek); (tr.) to draw (ulo) out of the water, to catch (also refers to coral fishing, pearl fishing, etc.); peskala piscatorial; peskanto, peskero, peskisto fisher; peskobatelo fishing-boat; peskajo the catch (cf. fisho); peskeyo fishing-place, -ground; peskilo a fishing instrument (rod, line, etc.); peskbastono fishing-rod; peskyuro licence, right to fish. Ex.: Peskar karpo.

pesto pestilence, pest, plague (cf. kontagio); (fig.) bane, scourge; pestala, pestoza pestiferous, pestilential; pestiko, pestika (person) infected; pestizar to infect; pestizanta pestilential, infectious, contageous; bubon pesto bubonic plague; la pesto kaptez lu may the plague take him.
petalo (bot.) petal; sen petala apetalous.
petardo (mil.) petard; petardeto firecracker.
peticionar (intr.) to petition: present a petition (ad ulu); peticiono, peticionado petition: written request; petitioning.
petiolo (bot.) petiole: leafstalk.
petonklo (zool.) scallop: a shell-fish (genus: Pectunculus).

petro stone (as a material substance; cf. roko, stono); petra stony: (made) of stone; petroza stony: full of stone; petrepoko stone age; petrotaliisto stone-cutter; petrigar to petrify; petrizar to cover with stone; petroministo quarryman; petro kruda rough stone, quarry stone; petroruptilo stone breaker; petrokonio keystone; petroplako flagstone.
petrelo (orni.) stormy petrel; Mother Carey’s chicken (Procellaria pelagica).
petrisar (tr.) to knead: work into a uniform mass (dough, etc.).
petrografio petrography.
petrolopetroleum, rock-oil; (cf. benzino, keroseno, gazolino).
petrologio petrology.
petroselo (bot.) parsley (genus: Petroselinum sativum).
petular (intr.) to be frisky, impetuous, boisterous, turbulent, unruly.
petunio (bot.) petunia (genus: Petunia).

pezar (intr.) to weigh (dek grami, e.c.) (cf. gravesar, ponderar); pezo weight; pezajo a heavy object; weight for weighing; pezanta, pezoza heavy, weighty, ponderous; pezo kuntara gross weight; pezo neta net weight; super pezo, pezeceso excess weight; pezo vivanta live weight; pezo ampla good weight; pezajo falsa a light weight (for weighing); po lua pezo ek oro at its weight in gold; (fig.) extremely dear.
«pfennig» (German money) pfennig.
«pfund» (weight) pound: one-half kilogram; 1.1 pound.
pia pious, devout, godly; pieso piety, devoutness (cf. devoco); piacho a bigot. Def.: Qua reverencas Deo.
piafar (intr., of horses) to make a piaffer, to paw the ground.
piamatro* (anat.) pia mater.
piano piano, pianoforte; pianpliar (intr.) to play the piano; piano vertikala upright piano; piano horizontala grand-piano.
piceo (bot.) silver-leaved (spruce) fir (Picea excelsa).
pichpino (wood) pitch-pine.
piedestalo pedestal (of a column, statue, vase, etc.); piedestaleto piedouche: small pedestal supporting a bust, etc.
pietismo (ch. hist.) pietism.
pietisto (ch. hist.) pietist.
pigo (orni.) magpie (genus: Pica); pigea black and white colo(u)red.
pigargo (orni.) pygarg, hen-harrier, -harm (Circus pygarus).
pigmeo pigmy, dwarf; (fig.) a person without talent, or merit, or power.

pikar (tr., lit. and fig.) to prick; prod, goad, puncture; sting; piketar to peck at; strike with the beak; pik(ad)o prick, prodding; pikuro a prick, puncture; sting (of insects); pikanta, pikema prickly, stinging, piquant, pungent; biting, piercing, sharp, nipping (of cold, liquids, words, etc.); pikilo a pricking instrument; pikbastono a goad (as for oxen). Ex.: Pikar sua fingro. Pikar bovulo, kavalo, papero. Vorti pikanta. Pikanta mustardo.
pikadoro picador.
pikeo (fabric) pique.
piketo (mil.) picket; (card game) piquet.
piklo something preserved in spice (cf. spico); piklaji pickles: vegetables, fruit or other food preserved in spice or vinegar pickle and used as a condiment; piklosauco ravigote: a sharp sauce.
piknikar (intr.) to picnic.
pikonoroko o harda materii (ex. makadamo). La (one-pointed) pick, pickaxe (cf. piocho). Def.: Instrumento por exkavar fera parto esas karakterizita per un pinto perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.
piktar (tr.) to paint (pictures in oil or water colo(u)rs); (cf. indutar, farbizar); pikt(ad)o, pikturo painting, picture; piktinda, pikturatra pictureque.
pikverdo (orni.) popinjay; green woodpecker (Picus viridis).

pilo (of animals, also bot.) hair, bristle; (of persons) hair of all parts of body except top of head; (cf. haro); (of sheep, camels, etc.) wool; (of cloth, of hats) nap; pilaro (of one object) coat; pilala relating to h.; piloza hairy, shaggy, pilose; pilobulbo h. bulb, h. root; senpiligar to depilate; senpiligivo depilatory (substance); longpila hundo long-haired dog; rezapila short-haired.
pilastro (arch.) pilaster, square column.
pilgrimar (intr.) to go on a pilgrimage.
pilio (elec.) pile, primary cell. Ex.: La pilio di volta.
pilono (Egyp. arch.) pylon.
piloro (anat.) pylorus.
pilorio pillory; piloriagar to pillory, put (ulu) in a pillory.
pilotar (tr.) to pilot.
pilulo (pharm.) pill
pimento pimento, allspice.
pimpinelo (bot.) pimpernell (genus: Pimpinella).
pino (bot.) pine-tree (genus: Pinus); pinkono, pinfrukto pine-cone.
pinaklo (arch.) pinnacle.
pinastro (bot.) Pinaster, the cluster pine (Pinus pinaster).

pinco nippers (without hinges); claw (of crabs, etc.); pinceto (surg.) forceps; tweezers; pincego (fire-) tongs; clamp; sukro pinco sugar-tongs. V. exp.: Tenalio esas utensilo kompozita de du peci ligita per charniro. Pinco esas utensilo sen charniro (la du peci o parti esas unionita per resorto o flezebla parto); III-219.
pinchar (tr.) to pinch, nip (ulu, ulo); pinchuro the mark of a pinch (as on the skin).
pineala* (glando) (anat.) pineal (gland).

pinglo pin; pinglagar to pin (ulo); pinglopikar to prick (ulo, ulu) with a pin; pingliferio pin-making establishment; pinglokuseno pin-cushion. Def.: Mikra metal–filo akutigita por unionar kozi; ornamento en formo di pinglo, kun kapo ornita.
pinguino (orni.) penguin (genus: Aptenodytes).
pinio (bot.) nut-, stone-pine (Pinus Pinea).
piniono pinion: small cog-wheel geared to a larger wheel.
pinselo (artist’s or painter’s brush; pinselstroko, pinselago a stroke of the brush.

pinto point, sharp end; pinta, pintatra pointed, sharp, peaked, tapering; pintoza barbed; pintigar, pintizar to put a point on (ulo); sen pintigar to blunt, remove the point from; pintofrapar to thrust, stab, lunge; pinto di flogilo whip-lash.
pintado (orni.) pintado: guinea-fowl, -hen (Numida meleagris).

piocho (double-ended) pickaxe; mattock; (cf. pikono); piochagar to dig (ulo) with a pickaxe. Def.: Instrumento por exkavar harda materii, di qua la fera parto havas du extremaji opozita (relate la mancho). VI-533.
piono (at chess) pawn; (at draughts) man.
pioniro (lit. and fig.) pioneer.
pipo (tobacco-) pipe; (cf. tubo).
pipeto (chem.) pipette: tube to transfer liquids; dropping tube.
pipiar (intr., of birds) to chirp.
pipro pepper (cf. papriko); pipruyo, piprbuxo pepperholder, pepper-box; piprizilo pepper-shaker;
pipsar (intr.) to have the pip; pipso pip, roup: disease of birds, poultry.
piquo (weapon) pike; (cards) spade.
piro (bot.) pear; (fig.) any pear-shaped instrument or object; e.g. an electric light bulb; piriero pear tree.
piramido (geom. monument) pyramid; piramidifar to form a pyramid, rise like a pyramid; piramidotrunko frustrum of a pyramid.
pirato pirate, buccaneer, free-booter (cf. korsaro); pirateso piracy.
piretro (bot.) pyrethrum, feverfew (genus: Pyrethrum); piretropulvero insect powder (made from p.).
piriko (Gr. antiq.) pyrrhic: a warlike dance.
pirito (min.) pyrite(s).
pirogo (Indian or savage) canoe, pirogue. Def.: Kanoto di sovajo, facita ek arboro-trunko o kortico (quale uzata da la Malayi Nord-Amerikan Indiani, e.c.).
pirogalo* (chem.) pyrogallol.
pirograbar (tr.) to engrave on wood with a hot point; pirograbo, pirograburo pyrography.
pirolo (orni.) (golden-) oriole (genus: Oriolus galbula).
pirometro pyrometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la maxim alta temperaturi.
Pironismo (antiq.) Pyrrhomism: an exaggerated skepticism.
piroso (med.) pyrosis; water-brash, heart-burn.
pirotekno pyrotechnics, fire-works.
piroxilo* pyroxylin(e): guncotton.
piruetar (intr.) to pirouette: turn, whirl on toes; (of horses) to whirl.
pistar (tr.) to pound, bruise, crush (with a pestle); (cf. triturar); pistilo pestle; (bot.) pistil; pistuyo (chemist’s, druggist’s) mortar.
pistacho pistachio-nut; pistachiero pistachio-tree (Pistacia vera).
pistolo (weapon) pistol.
pistono (tech.) piston; pistonstango piston rod.
pitio (antiq.) the Pythia: priestess of Apollo.
pitono (myth.) Python; (zool.) python (genus: Python). Def.: Serpento reala e mitologiala; III-142.
pitoniso (antiq.) pythoness, witch; pitoniso di Endor witch of Endor.
pitoreska, pitoreskeso* picturesque(ness); (cf. pikturatra).? DEFIS
pituito (med.) mucus, phlegm, pituite; pituitoza full of mucus; pituitala pituitary; (cf. muko). Def.: Humoro viskoza sekrecata da ula mukozi (di la nazo, di la bronkii) en stando morbala; IV-585.

pivoto pivot: (mechan.) pivot, journal: pin or short shaft on which anything turns: (milit.) the wing on which a troop turns; (fig.) main hinge, principal agent; turnar, rotacar sur (cirkum) pivoto to turn on a pivot; pordo pivoto door-pivot, -hinge; l’interesto esas la pivoto di multi de nia agi interest is the pivot of many of our acts.
pizo (bot.) pea (Pisum sativum); senshela pizi shelled peas; shelo pizi peas in a pod.
placo place: open public space, as a square or circu in a town (cf. loko).
placento (anat., bot.) placenta.
plado plate: small dish to eat off (cf. disho); pladedo plateful; pladego platter; pladmoblo buffet, side-board; pladetajero (otabulo) plate-shelf.
plafono (arch.) ceiling, upper surface of a room; plafonizar to put a ceiling on.

plago sore:break in soft part of body from disease; (fig.) plague, scourge (cf. pesto). Ex.: Ilua tota korpo esa kovrata da plagi. L’alkoholo esas plago di la publika saneso. Atilla nomizis su la plago di Deo.

plajo beach, (sea-) shore, strand. V. exp.: Plajo esas la bendo plu o min larja di sulo, quan la maro alterne kovras e deskovras; existas plaji de sablo e plaji de rul-stoni. La rivo esas la limito inter la maro e la tale dicita ferme (sika) tero. La litoro esas la tota regiono adjacanta la rivo. La plaji esas nur aparta ed eceptala loki en la rivi: ne omna rivo esas plajo (ex.: rivo ek klifi od ek rokaji); IV-606.
plajiar (tr., intr.) to plagiarize (words, ideas from another).

plako plate, sheet, slab: flat piece of metal, etc.; tablet, plaque; plakoizar to plate (over), sheathe, sheet over, veneer, overlay; plakoo grabita engraved plate; plakoturn plakoo (R.R.) turn-table; petro plakoo stone slab, flagstone; plakoizita ringo (of gold) plated ring.

plana plane: without elevations or depressions; level, flat (cf. plata); plano (geom.) plane (surface, figure, angle); (aeron.) plane; planajo a flat thing or place; plain: level land; alta planajo table-land; plankanto (fig.) plain-song, -chant; planigar to make (ulo) smooth, level, even; plano inklinita inclined plane.
plando (anat.) sole (of the foot).
planeto (astron.) planet; planetaro, planetosistemo planetary system.
planimetro* planimeter.
planimetrio planimetry.
planisferoplanisphere.
«plankton» (biol.) plankton.

plantacar (tr.) to plant: set in the ground for growth; plantacajo something planted, slip, set, crop, plant (cf. planto); plantacerio plantation; plantacanto, plantacisto one who plants, a planter; plantacilo planting instrument; dibble, setting stick.
plantago (bot.) plantain (genus: Plantago).
plantigrada, plantigrado (zool.) plantigrade (animal). Ant.: digitigrada.
plantono* (milit.) orderly (soldier; cf. ordonanco); esar plantono to be on orderly duty.

plaso place (for a person or thing); plasizar to place (ulu); to put (ulo, ulu) in a place (cf. pozar, lokizar); plasizanto, plasisto a person who places; usher (in a theater)(theatre). V exp.: Ta vorto esas necesa por signifikar la spaco okupata od okupebla da singla persono en irga loko (veturo, teatro, e.c.). Ol ne povas remplasesar da loko, mem min da sideyo; nam en omnibusi, tramveturi, urbala fervoyi, existas plasi sidanta e plasi stacanta. Ol povas signifikar anke la loko propra, rezervata o konvenanta por singla kozi: «Un plaso por omna kozo, ed omna kozo en sua plaso». On povas dicar exemple: «Me havas bona plaso proxim la loko ube eventis l’inauguro di la statuo X. sur la placo Y.» Restis nula plaso en la teatro, quankam esis ankore multa spaco inter la rangi e granda vakua loki avan la pordi; II-19.
plasmo* (physiol.) plasma.
plastido* (biol.) plastid.
plastidulo* (biol.) plastidule.
plastika plastic; plastikarto plastic art; plastikeso plasticity.
plastilino* modelling clay.

plata flat: having an even surface (cf. plana); (fig.) dull, insipid; platajo a flat object; plateau, upland, table-land; plata pedo a flat foot; plateso (quality) flatness; plata kalmeso a flat calm; plate flatwise; platigar to flatten (cf. planigar); platnaza, plat(ul)o flat, pug, snub-nosed (person).
platano (bot.) plane-tree, platane (genus: Platanus); platano ocidentala (N. American) sycamore (Platanus occidentalis).
plateno (print.) platen.
platformo platform; horizontal surface or structure (cf. programo).
platino (met.) platinum.
Platonala, Platonisto, Platonismo Platon-ic, -ist, -ism.
plaudar (tr., intr.) of liquids, waves: to break, beat against, splash; plaudetar to ripple.
plear (tr.) to play (a musical instrument, a role in a play; cf. ludar); pleachar (tr.) to strum, thrum (a violin). Ex.: Plear valso. Violin-plear. Plear (rolo di) Athalie.
plebeyo plebian
plebecito referendum: (hist.) plebescite, plebescitum. Def.: Voto pri ula lego o rezolvo da omna civitani di un stato (ex. en Suisa); III-142
pledar (intr., legal and gen.) to plead, argue (at the bar); to allege; pledo plea; pledanto, pledero pleader, litigant, suitor; pledachanto, pledero petifogger.
plektro (antiq. mus.) plectrum.
plena full, filled (de); pleneso fullness, plenitude; plene fully, entirely; plenigar to fill; (fig.) to fulfil, accomplish; plena luno full moon; plena de aquo filled with water. Ant.: vakua.

plendar (intr.) to complain; (jur.) lodge a complaint (che); plendo complaining, (law) accusation, charge; plendanto complainer; (law) plaintiff, complainant; plendanta complaining; plendema, plendatra plaintive, querulous. Ex.: Plendar pri kap-doloro. Il plendis, ke il esas frapita. V. exp.: vid. lamentar.
plenipotenco plenipotence, fullness or completeness of power; plenipotenciero, plenipotenciera plenipotenciary.
pleonasmo pleonasm, redundancy of words.
plesiosauro (paleon.) plesiosaur(us).
pleto tray, shallow receptacle for tea, pins, diamonds, etc.
pletoro (med. and fig.) plethora; pletorala, pletorika plethoric. Ex.: Pletoro de sango, de pekunio.
pleuronekto (ich.) brill, flounder: a flat fish of several species (Pleuronectes).
pleuronektoido* (ich.) plaice (Pleuronectidæ).? L
plevro (anat.) pleura.
plevrito (med.) pleurisy.
plexo (anat.) plexus.

pleyado, pleyadi (astron.) Pleiades; (fig.) a distinguished of authors, etc. Def.: Propra senco: ula stelaro (en signo di «Tauro»); metafora senco: grupo o skolo de autori, partikulare poeti (ex. la Franca pleyado en la 16a yarcento; III-142.

plezar (intr.) to be pleasing, be agreeable; (tr.) to please (ulu); plezar (ad) ulu to please anyone; ta libro ne plezas (a) me that book does not please me, is not to my taste, my fancy; facez to, qou plezas vu do as you like (please); on ne povas plezas omni one cannot please everybody.
plezuro pleasure: delight, joy. Ex.: Facar ulo kun plezuro. Dansar esas plezuro.
pliko (med.) plica, a disease of the hair.
plioceno* (geol.) Pliocene.? DEFIRS
plinto (arch.) plinth.
plisar (tr.) to plait; (fig.) to pucker, crease. Def.: Facar reguloza falduri en ulo; (kp. frunsar).
plombo lead; plomba (made) of lead; plombea lead-colo(u)red; plombizar to cover with lead; plombsiglar (tr.) to seal or stamp with lead; plombisto, plomblaboristo plumber; lead-worker.
ploviero (orni.) plover (genus: Charadrius).

plu (adv. of comparison) more, further; plue moreover, besides; plu afabla more amiable; plu bone, plu juste better, preferable; plu multi most (people); the generality, the majority; plumulteso (condition) plurality; plu multo (the) more (used substantively); plu male, plua worse; tante plu ke all the more that; dum plu kam during more than; sempre plu more and more; plu kam ultempe more than ever; nek plu nek min neither more nor less; quante plu granda la homothe bigger the person; quante plu me manjas, tante plu me drinkas the more I eat, the more I drink; demandar plu multo por obtenar min multo to ask for more to obtain less; plu multa vino kam aquo more wine than water; diferar per plu o min multo to differ more or less; il esas plu kompatinda kam blaminda he is more to be pitied than blamed; remediilo plu mala kam la morbo a remedy worse than the disease; Note: Plu can be used by itself before adjectives and adverbs, but with substantives and verbs multa, plue, granda, etc. should be added: lu plu multe, ofte ocias kam laboras; plu multa aquo. V exp.: Plu expresas augmento di ula quanto (qua restas o konsideresas identa a su ipsa); plus (quale la matematikal signo, quan ol tradukas) signifikas adiciono, do generale adjunto di ulo ad altro; II-666. Ant.: min.

plualtigar to make higher, taller; plualteskar to become higher. Note: Plu to such verbalized adjectives as above adds the idea of comparison: plualtigar to make higher, taller (i.e. it was high before, or relatively, to make something higher than something else).
plubeligar to embellish, beautify.
plubonigar to better, improve.
plucherigar to make dearer (in price), raise the price of; plueskar to become, grow dearer.
pludensigar to condense (a liquid): make more dense, more compact.
pludolcigar to soften, to render milder. Ex.: La pluvo pludolcigas la vetero. La vetero pludolceskas. Pludolcigar la voco.
plufermigar to make firm, stout, resolute. Ex.: Astriktivo plufermigas la pelo. Ruptita gambo plufermeskas diope. Lua autoritato plufermeskas.
plufortigar to strengthen.
plufreshigar to freshen; (fig.) to enliven, give a filip to. Ex.: La pluvo plufreshigas la aero. Plufreshigar la korpo, la trupi.
plugar (tr.) to plough; (fig.) to till; plugebla arable: fit for tillage; plugilo a plow. Def.: Sulkizar la sulo per plugilo. (fig.) Spadagar la tero por plantacar.
plugrandigar (tr.) to make greater, enlarge, aggrandize.
pluhardigar to harden: to make (ulo) harder.
plukurtigar to shorten, make (ulo) shorter; plueskar to contract, shrink.
plulentigar to slow down, abate (ulo); plueskar to slacken, flag.
plulongigar(of time) to prolong, protract, lengthen. V. exp.: vid. prolongar.

plumo (of birds) feather, plume; (for writing) quill, pen; plumaro plumage, feathers (cf. penacho); collection of pens; plumedo penful (of ink); plumfasko feather-broom, -duster; plumiero pen-holder; plumuyo pen-rack; plumizar to feather; plumvishilo pen-wiper; plumpinselo a small feather-brush; fonten plumo a fountain-pen; ganso plumo goose-quill.
plump! thump! slap! bang! Def.: Indikanta falo, precipue di ulo grava, mola, inerta; IV-511

plumpa (of things) unwieldy, unmanageable from bulk or weight; (of persons) thick-skulled, dull-witted; plumpa mashino, navo an unwieldy machine, ship; plump(ul)o a person doltish, clumsy, heavy-bodied, or heavy-witted; dullard, blockhead, dunce (cf. stult(ul)o): Def.: Expresas l’ideo di ulu, ulo grosa, pezoza e (pro to) nehabila o groteska; IV-605.

plunjar (intr.) to plunge, duck, dive, (en); plunjigar to dip, plunge (ulo, en ulo); plunjoklosho diving bell; (cf. sinkar, submersar, imersar). Ex.: Plunjar en la maro. Plunjigar krucho en la aquo, dago en la korpo, sua manuo en la flami.
plura several; pluri several people; plurala relating to several; plurala, pluralo (gram.) plural; plurfoye several times; plureso two or more of the same kind; plurkolora of several colo(u)rs.
plursenca having several senses or meanings; plureso ambiguousness.
plursilaba polysillabic.

plus(e) (adv.) further, furthermore, more, over and above, an addition; (arith.) plus; plus(e)a additional, surplus, extra; plus(e)ajo a surplus, overplus; me ne plus kantos, me ne kantos pluse I shall sing no more; me ne plus hungras I am no longer hungry; me ne plus pagos I will pay no more; ne plus lu audez tua voco no more shall he hear thy voice; pluso sequos to be continued; un glaso pluseod,un pluse glaso one glass more; nulo pluse nothing in addition; pluspagar (tr.) to overpay; plus(e)e taxar (tr.) to surtax; du plus tri minus un two plus three minus one. Ex.: Mil yari e pluse. Un tablo plus quar stuli. Un pazo pluse. Il ne plus vivas. Me dicos nulo pluse. Ne plus amoro, do ne plus joyo. Plusa pezo, taxo. Plusajo di pekunio. Plusa exempleri (E. additional copies). V. exp.: vid. plu. Ant.: minus.
plusho (fabric) plush; plushatra plush-like, shaggy. Def.: Stofo simila a veluro e kun longa pili o lanugo sur un latero.
plusquamperfekto (gram.) pluperfect (tense).
plutokratio plutacracy: rule and power of the rich.
Plutonala (geol.) Plutonic.

pluvar (intr.) to rain; pluvas (impers.) it rains; pluveskar to start raining; pluvetar to drizzle; pluvegar to rain in torrents; pluvigar to cause to rain; to shower down upon; pluvoza, pluvema rainy, wet, shower; pluvuro rain (fallen); pluvaquo rain water; pluvarko rainbow; pluvo dina a fine rain; pluvkanalo gutter; pluvtubo spout (descending to the ground); pluvtubulo spout (which drips from above); pluvmantelo rain-cloak.
pluvialo pluvial: a priest’s cope.
pluviometro pluviometer, rain-gauge.
pneumatika pneumatic (machine, pump, etc.).

po for, at the price of, in exchange for (indicates value received or given); (fin.) per (cent.) as, kin po cento (at the rate of) five percent (cf. procento); tanto po (un) semano at so much a week; komprar ulo po triadek dollari to buy something for thirty dollars (N.B. Ca kustas 1000 fr., notca kustas po 1000 fr.).
pociono medicinal draught or potion.
podagro podagra, gout in the feet; podagrika, podagriko gouty (person). Def.: Goto di pedi; IV-516.
poemo poem.
poet(ul)o poet; poetino poetess; poeteto, poetacho poetaster, rhymester.
poetiko poetics, art of poetry.
poezio (composition) poesy, poetry; poeziajo a piece of poetry, a poem; poeziala, poeziatra, poezioza poetical; poeziizar to poetize, versify.

poka few: not many; little: not much; poko a little; poki a few; pokope by degrees, little by little, bit by bit; pokafoye rarely, almost never; il parolis poke he spoke but little. Def.: Mikra nombro o quanto. Ex.: Pos poka tempo. Poka homi esas kontenta pri sua posedaji. V. exp.: vid. kelka. Ant.: multa.
polo (geom., astron., geog., magnet.) pole; polala polar; polostelo polar star.
polara polar; polaro (math.) polar; polarigar to polarize; polarigita polarized; polareso polarity.
polarimetro (opt.) polarimeter.
polemikar (intr.) to carry on a controversy (kun ulu); polemik(ad)o polemic(s); polemikala polemical.
poleno (bot.) pollen.
polexo pollex: thumb; polexuyo thumbstall; polexoligilo thumb-manacles.

polico police administration or regulation; policano, policisto policeman; policistaro (collect.) the police; policestrothe chief of police;policala relating to police regulations; policista relating to police; policanacho bobby, cop, peeler. Def.: Ensemblo di la regularo qua mantenas l’ordino e la sekureso publika.
poliedro (geom.) polyhedron.
polifiletika (biol.) polyphyletic.
polifonio polyphony. Def.: Multeso de soni diferanta ma sam-tempa.
poligama polygamous; (bot.) polygamian; poligam(ul)o polygamist; poligameso polygamy.
poliglota, poliglot(ul)o polyglot.
poligono (geom.) polygon; (bot.) polygonum: knot-grass, -weed (genus: Polygonum).
poligrafo multigraph, poylgraph: instrument for multiplying copies of a writing; poligraf(ul)o (fig.) an author who writes on several subjects.
poligrafio the art of operating a polygraph.
polikroma polychrome.
polilemo (philos.) polylemma, predicament.
polimatio polymathy, varied learning.
polimorfa polymorphous, multiform.
polinomio (alg.) polynome.
polipo (zool.) polyp; (med.) polypus: a species of tumor.
polisar (tr.) to polish (marble, wood, steel, etc.) (fig.) to polish: refine (the mind, one’s style, manners, etc.) Def.: Igar ulo glata e brilanta per friciono; brunisar.
polispermo polysperm.

polita (of manners) polite, civil, courteous; politeso politeness, civility, good breeding; politajo act of politeness; politegeso urbanity; des, ne polita discourteous, uncivil. V. exp.: vid. jentila.
politeismo polytheism.
politeisto polytheist.
politekniko polytechnics; politeknikala polytechnic: relating to arts and sciences; politeknikano (fig.) a student in a p. school; politeknikoskolo a p. school. Def.: Cienco di la mekanikal arti.

politiko politics, public policy; politikala political; politikero one who dabbles in politics; politikisto (good sense) politician; politikistacho (bad sense) politician. Def.: La cienco di guvernado; l’adminstrado di publika afero.
politropa (math.) polytropic.
polkar (intr.) to dance the polka.
polonezo polonaise, a kind of dance.
polpo octopus, devil-fish (genus: Octopus).
polutar (tr.) to pollute, defile (cf. kontaminar, profanacar); polutesar (fig.) to be polluted; to have seminal discharge or emission.

polvo dust (cf. pulvero, pudro); polvoza, polvatra dusty; polvifar to rise (of dust); to be dusty (of roads); polvigar to reduce (ulo) to d.; polveskar to become dusty; polvizar to cover (ulu, ulo) with d.; polvonubo a cloud of d.
pomo an apple; pomiero apple tree; pomiereyo orchard.
pomado pomade, pomatum; pomadizar to apply p. to (hair or exterior of the body); har pomado hair p.
pomelo pommel (of saddle); knob on the hilt of a sword or pistol. Def.: Mikra bulo ye l’extremajo di espado, di pistolo od avan solo; III-142.
pompo pomp, state, show; pompacho (bad sense) parade, display (cf. ostento); pompoza stately; pompozacha pompous (bad sense); kun granda pompo with great pomp, in great state. ?DEFIS
pompelmuso (bot.) shaddock (Citrus decumana).
pompono pompon, top-knot; tuft added to dress of a soldier, etc.

ponderar (tr.) to weigh (ulu, per ulo); (cf. pezar); (fig.) to ponder (mentally); pondero weighing; ponderebla ponderable; ponderilo scale; ponderisto, ponderero weigher; ponderresorto spring-balance, scale; ponderar ample to give good weight. Def.: Determinar la pezo di ulo per ponderilo; (fig.) explorar atencoze.
poneo pony: small horse.
poniardo poniard, dagger; poniardagar, poniarde ocidar to poniard, stab (ulu) with a dagger; (cf. dago).
ponsa poppy-colo(u)red, flame colo(u)red, vivid scarlet.

ponto bridge (over a river, etc.); ponteto foot-bridge; (R.R. culvert); (nav.) gangway; (tech.) trigger-guard (of a firearm); ponto suspendita suspension b.; ponto turnebla swing b.; ponto tubatra tubular b.; batel ponto b. of boats; lev ponto lifting b.

pontifiko pontiff; (Jewish) high priest; (Roman) pontifex; (cf. papo); pontifiko suprega the sovereign pontiff; the pope; pontifikala pontifical; pontifikeso pontificate (cf. papeso); pontifike oficiar to reign as pontiff.
pontono pontoon, boat used as bridge; pontonisto military pontonier.
popo (Russian, Grecian) priest, (village) pope. Def.: Rusa (greka) sacerdoto; III-594.
poplo (bot.) poplar (tree) (genus: Populus).
poplino (fabric) poplin.
poplito (anat.) ham, region back of the knee joint; (in quadrupeds).

populo people, population (of a town, city, country; cf. habitantaro); populala relating to the people (cf. populara); populoza populous; populizar to people, populate: furnish with inhabitants; populizado, populizuro peopling; populacho the mob, rabble, riffraff (cf. plebeyaro); populacha low, vulgar.
populara popular: prevailing among and liked by the people; populareso popularity; popularigar to make (ulo) popular, to popularize.
popurito potpourri, medley, hotch-potch.

por (prep. indicating aim) for, in view of, in favo(u)r of; por ke (conj., followed by imperative) in order that, so that; por quo for what?; por ne lest; omni por unu, unu por omni all for one, one for all; pregar, votar por ulu to pray, to vote for someone; kombatar por la patrio to fight for the country; ol esas por vu it is for you; por la formofor the sake of form; por la venjo for (the sake of) vengeance; le por e la kontre the pros and the cons; dek franki por un semano ten francs a week; me dicas tu a vu nun, por ke vu esez preparita I tell you now, (in order) that you may be prepared.
poro (anat. and fig.) pore; oza porous; porozeso porosity.
porcelana, porcelano porcelain, (fine) china (ware); (cf. fayenco).

porciono portion, ration, share, allowance; porcioneto, porcionacho pittance; porcionizar to put (ulu) on (short) allowance; porcionizo rationing; porcionigar to portion out (ulo). Def.: Parto de un toto; partikulare ula provizuro de pano, de karno, esanta dividita inter uli.

pordo door, doorway; gate; pordego large door, portal (cf. portalo); (city-) gate; pord(ogard)isto door-keeper; pordotapeto door-curtain, portiere; pordalo leaf of a folding d.; pordfrapilo d. knocker;pordoframo, pordkadro d. frame; pordoveino portal vein.
porelo (bot.) leek (Allium Porrum).
porfiro (min.) porphyry.
porismo (geom.) porism.

porko pig, hog, swine, porker; porkokarno (fresha, salizita, fumigita) pork, pig meat (fresh, salted, smoked); porkkarnajo piece of pork; porkino sow; porkulo boar; porkopilohog;s bristle; porkogardistoswineheard;porkeyo, porkostablo pig-sty; porkala porcine; porkopelo rind (of bacon); porkofelo pigskin.
porkespino (zool.) porcupine (European genus: Hystrix; N. American genus: Erethizon).
pornografa porngraphic; pornograf(ul)o a person who occupies himself with pornography.
pornografio pornography: art or literature of an obscene nature.

portar (tr.) to carry, bear, bring, take: convey in vehicles, by ship, hand, or person, also of wind, water, etc. (as agent) to wear (clothes, a sword, etc.); port(ad)o; (act.) carrying, carriage, conveyance, porterage; portajo that which is carried; load, burden; portanto, portero, portisto carrier, bearer, porter; portebla portable; portar la vestaro to wear clothes; for portar to carry away; (cf. transportar). V. exp.: vid. suportar.
porta veino (anat.) portal vein, gate-vein.
portalo portal; grand and imposing door (as of a church, etc.).
porteorange, reach of a shot, bullet, of a voice, etc.
portfolioportfolio, a case in which to keep loose papers.
portiko portico, porch, covered space enclosed by columns at entrance of building.

portreto (pr. and fig.) portrait, personal representation by painting, drawing, photography; portret(pikt)isto portrait painter; facio, profil, staturportreto face, profile, full-length portrait; facar la portreto di to depict, make a portrait of.
portuo (sea-) port, harbo(u)r, haven; portuo komercala commercial port; portuo militala naval harbor or station; portuo dopa inner harbor; salveo portuo a saluting port; portupilotisto harbor pilot.
portulako (bot.) portulaca, purslane (genus: Portulaca).

pos (prep.) after (in time; cf. dop); pose afterwards, next, later; poske after that; posa subsequent, later; poseso posteriority; pos quar kloki after four o’clock; pos quar hori after four hours. Ex.: Pagenda pos triadek dii. Unesme on devas lernar e pose on darfas ludar. Pos ke vu esos parolinta, il parolos. (E. after you have (or, shall have) spoken, he will speak. To eventis pos ke ne venis. Ant.: ante.
posdatizar to postdate (a letter, etc.).
posdimeze, poso (in) the afternoon.
posdinee after dinner; poso time after dinner (afternoon or evening, as the dinner is early or late).

posedar (tr.) possess, be in possession of, own, have the faculty or quality (cf. havar, proprietar); posedeskar to become possessor of, take possession of; posedajo object (possessed); posedanto possessor; posedala (gram.) possessive; posedalo possessive case; a possessive. Ex.: Posedar pekunio, domo, ula furio posedis il. Me pagos vu kande me posedos plu multa pekunio. Ka vu esas la posedanto di ta agro? Posedal pronomi.

posibla possible; posiblajo, posibleso possibility; posibligar to render (ulo) p., to enable; maxim multe posible, tam multe kam posible as much as p.; maxim bona posible as good as p.; minim posible bruiso least possible noise; vua helpo posibligis a me facaryour help made it possible for me to do it.
posmorge (on) the day after tomorrow. Ex.: Se me ne venos morge, takaze me venos posmorge.
posnaskar (intr.) to be born after (ulu); posinta younger.
posskribajo postscript.
possupee after supper.

posto mail, post, postal service, public conveyance and delivery, esp. of letters, packages; poste by post; postala karto, postokartopostal-card;postopakajo a postal package; (fig.) parcel-post; postala uniono postal union; postokontoro post office;postestro postmaster; postisto employee of postal service; letter-carrier; postman; postotreno mail train; poste restante till called for; postomarko postage stamp; postostampo post mark; postomandato money order; postoveturo post-chaise; poste voyajar to travel by post.

posteno post, a place to guard; beat (of a policeman, etc.); honor posteno (fig.) post of hono(u)r; postenizar to post, station (uli, ulu, su) (cf. facionar); Ex.: Stacar en posteno. Gardar posteno. Livar, desertar posteno.
posterno (fort.) postern; small gate under a rampart.
postigo small casement in a door or window; blind (of a carriage). Def.: (Mikra) parto (ordinare, vitro-plako) di la fenestro o pordo qua esas apertebla.
postiliono postilion.
postpoziciono postposition, a word or particle placed after or at the end of a word.
postular (tr.) to demand, exact, require (ulo, de ulu); postulo, postulemeso demand, requirement, exigency; postulajo what is demanded, claimed; postulema exacting. V.exp.: vid. demandar.
postulato (philos.) postulate.
postuma posthumous; postumo p. child; postumajo p. work.

posturar (intr., lit. and fig.) to assume an attitude, to pose (as for a statue, a picture); to sit (for one’s picture); posturo posture, attitude, pose; posturo koaktata constrained attitude; posturo di la guvernerio attitude of the government.

poto pot, kettle, jug: earthenware or metal vessel used for cooking or merely holding something; potedo potful; potifeyo a pottery; potifisto potter; lakto poto milk jug or can; floro poto flower p.; -o fera iron p.; terakota poto earthen p.
potaso potash.
potenco (math.) power; sis potenco quara six to the fourth power (64). Def.: Produkto qua rezultas de multiplikado di nombro per su.
potenciala, potencialo (all senses) potential, possible.
potenta powerful, potent, mighty; potent(ul)o potentate; potenteso potency, might (cf. povo, forteso, autoritato).
«pound» (pl. «pound»i) pound (sterling).

povar (tr., intr.) to be able (to do), can (do), could, have the power to; povo power, ability, force, means, might; (polit.) a power, powerful country. Ex.: Ni facas to quon ni povas. Me ne povis venar hiere. Me povabus manjar ol, ma me ne hungris. La povo di la mento. V. exp.: vid. darfar.

povra poor, needy; povro, povrulo, povrino poor person (cf. indijanto); povreso poverty; povrajo a sorry thing (cf. meskinajo); povrigar to impoverish; la mente povri the poor in mind (in spirit). Ant.: richa.
poziciono (milit., or strategical) position.
pozolano pozzolana, a mortar made from volcanic ashes.
pragmato (philos.) matter-of-fact, reality; «fait accompli»; pragmatalapragmatical: dealing with practical values or consequences; pragmatismo pragmatism; pragmatisto pragmatist.
pragmatiko* (hist.) pragmatic sanction.

praktikar (tr.) to practice, put into practice, exercise; to observe (a rule, etc.); praktikala pertaining to practice or action, practical (matter); praktikema pratical, experienced (person); praktikebla practicable, feasible, possible; (of roads) passable; -isto practitioner; praktikanta practising. Ex.: On praktikas la medicino, l’agro-kultivado. Esas necesa praktikar longatempe, ante ke on povas divenar habila. Praktikebla ideo, voyo.
pralino praline, burnt almond.
pramo (nav.) pram(e): flat-bottomed boat used in the Baltic. Def.: Speco di navo (barko) kun plata fundo, nur un ponto, kun segli e remili; IV-462.
pratomeadow.
prearanjar (tr.) to prearange, to provide (for or against).
preavino great grandmother; preavulo great grandfather.
prebendo prebend, stipend granted to a prebendary; prebendiero prebendary.

preco (lit. and fig.) price, charge; (fig.) expense; kustopreco cost price; precoza costly, expensive, valuable, precious (in money value); precoza lapido precious stone; precozeso preciousness;precozajo a precious thing; fabrik preco cost of making, manufacturing cost; kozo super omna preco a priceless thing; pro irga preco at any price; (fig.) cost what it will.

precedar (tr.) to have, to take precedence of, to go before in rank, importance, etc.; (cf. preirar); precedo precedence: right or fact of precedency, priority; precedanto one who has or takes precedence; predecessor (in office); (pl.) predecessors, forefathers; precedanta antecedant, (cf. antea, antecedento). Def.: Esir en plaso, ofico nemediate avan; precede pasar avan altru segun lego, regulo; VI-418. Ex.: Grava aferi precedas la neimportanta.
precedento a precedent, authoritative case, example or instance.
precepto precept, authoritative rule of action.
preceptoro preceptor, tutor, instructor.
precesiono(astron.) precession (of the equinoxes).
precipiso precipice; (fig.) calamity.

precipitar (tr., pr. and fig.) to precipitate, cause to fall, hurry along, throw down, hurl headlong, dash down, plunge; (chem.) to throw to the bottom of a vessel; precipitar su to rush (upon); precipitajo (chem.) precipitate. Ex.: Il precipitis su ek la fenestro. Precipitar naciono en milito.

precipua principal, main, leading, capital; precipue above all, especially; precipuajo the chief thing, essential part, main point; e precipue, esez prudenta and above all be prudent. Def.: Qua esas maxim konsiderinda, importanta.
precitar (tr.) to previously cite; precitita above mentioned, aforesaid.

preciza precise, having fixed limitation, not loose, vague or uncertain; definite, distinct, exact, formal, terse; (N.B. not used of persons); precize precisely, just so; precizeso precision; precizigar to state precisely, to specify; precizigo, preciziguro specification. Def.: Qua esas strikte definita o determinita; IV-102. Ex.: Dio preciza. Horo preciza. Ordino preciza. V. exp.: vid. akurata, exakta.
predatizar to antedate.
predestinar (tr.) to predestine, foredoom, preordain.
predeterminar (tr.) to predetermine.
predicar (tr.) to predict, prophesy, foretell (cf. augurar); preanta prophetic.
predikar (tr., intr., lit. and fig.) to preach (ulo, ad ulu); (cf. exhortar); predikanto, predikero, predikisto preacher; predikar per sua exemplo to set an example, to practise what one preaches.
predikato (log., gram.) predicate.
predispozar (tr., gen. and med.) to prepossess, predispose (cf. inklinar); preeso predisposition, presumption, prejudice; preita prepossessed, biassed.
predominacar (intr.) to predominate (cf. preponderar); preo predominance, prevalence.
preestablisar (tr.) to preestablish, establish beforehand.
preexistar (intr.) to pre-exist.
prefaco preface (of a book); prefacizar to insert, write a preface (for).
prefekto (Rom. antiq. and chief administrator of each department in France) prefect.

preferar (tr.) to prefer, like better: give preference in mind to (ulo, kam); preferesar to be preferred; prefero preference, predilection; preferajo what is preferred, choice; prefere (kam) preferably (to), in preference (to), rather (than); preferinda preferable. Ex.: Preferar mortar kam vivar. Preferar la honoro kam la pekunio.
prefixo (gram.) prefix; prefixizar, prefixigar to put at the beginning of a word.
prefoliaciono (bot.) prefoliation.

pregar (tr.) to pray (to) (God); to beg, entreat, beseech (ulu, pri, por); (cf. suplikar); pregostulo praying-chair, -desk; pregolibro prayer-book; facar (oddicar) prego say a prayer; me pregas I pray, I beg; if you please.
prehiere (on the) day before yesterday, two days ago.
prehistorio pre-history, history prior to written history; prea prehistoric. Def.: Ensemblo di la konocata fakti pri la epoko antea a la tempi historiala.
preintencar (tr.) to premeditate (cf. premeditar).
preirar (tr.) to precede, go before, go first or in front of (cf. precedar).
prejudicia (jur.) interlocutory, not final or definative (judgement).
prejudikar (tr.) to prejudge; preo prejudgement, presumption, prejudice; prea prejudicial, preconceived.
prekara (tr.) precarious, depending upon the will or pleasure of another; uncertain, unsettled.
prekomprar (tr.) to buy (ulo) beforehand; (fig.) to preempt.
prekonceptita preconceived.
prekonoco (savo) foreknowledge, prescience.
prekursoro precursor, forerunner.
prelasta next to the last, last but one; (gram.) penultimate; prea silabo penult.
prelato prelate.
preliminara preliminary; preliminari (the) preliminaries.
preludar (intr., mus.) to play a prelude.
prematura premature.
premeditar (tr., intr.) to premeditate; preo premeditation; (jur.) malice aforethought, malice prepense; pree designedly, wilfully; with malice aforethought.
premio (com., fin., insurance) premium, bounty, bonus; (in competitions) a prize; premiizar to give a premium or prize to.
premico, premici first-fruits; (fig.) first mass (of a newly ordained priest).
premiso (log.) premise.

prenar to take: lay hold of, by hand, etc.); preno taking, prehension; (at cards) trick; preniva prehensile; prenar per la dento to take hold of with the teeth; prenar ulu ye la brakio to take someone by the arm; prenar kozi inverse (odreverse) to take things the wrong way, amiss; de, for prenar to take from, remove.
prenomo first name, Christian name; preizar to christen, give a first name to (ulu).
preonklulo great uncle.
preopiniono prepossession, presumption.
prepagar (tr.) to prepay.

preparar (tr., intr.) to prepare (su, ulu, ulo, por, kontre); prepar(ad)o preparation, preparing; preparajo (also chem.) preparation (made); preparanta, prepariva, preparala preparatory, preparative. Def.: Aranjar antee; predispozar. Ex.: preparar dineo, diskurso, la mento, por voyajar.
preponderar (intr.) to preponderate, have a superiority in weight or influence; prepondero preponderance, sway; preponderanta preponderant, prevailing; convincing (reason).
prepoziciono (gram.) preposition.
prepuco (anat.) prepuce, foreskin.
prerogativeo prerogative, exclusive pivilege or right.
presar (tr.) to press, bear upon with force or weight; preseso alta, basa high, low pressure; kun presar la denti to clinch (clench) the teeth.
presaporo foretaste.
presavo foreknowledge, prescience.
presbita, presbit(ul)o far-sighted (person), presbyte, presbyopic.
presbiterismo Presbyterianism; presbiterista, presbiteristo presbyterian.
presbiterio council of parish trustees; vestry council, presbytery (church elders); presbiteriano church warden.
presentar (tr.) to have a presentiment of (ulo). Def.: Havar sentimento nepreciza, instintatra pri ulo qua forsan eventos.
presigno presage, omen.
preske (adv.) almost, nearly, all but, scarcely. Ex.: Me vendis preske omno. Preske nulo restas. Laboro preske parfinita. Me preske nultempe vidis il. V. exp.: vid. quaze.
preskisar (tr.) to make a preliminary sketch of.
preskriptar (tr.) to prescribe, to set down authoritatively, to direct, order; (med.) to direct as a remedy; preskripto (gen.) precept, direction; (med.) prescription (cf. recepto).
presktirar (tr., jur.) to bar or be lost by statute of limitation. Def.: Preskrito perdo od aboliso di yuro pos definita tempo; III-410.
presorgar (tr., intr.) to take precautions, be cautious (pri, kontre); preante, preema precautionary, cautious, wary; preo precaution.
prestar (tr.) to lend, loan (ulo ad ulu); presto lending, loan (act); prestajo that which is loaned, a loan; prestisto (po gajo) pawnbroker; prestar po interesto to loan at interest.
prestaciono (feudal law) prestation. Def.: Speco di kontributo per laboro o pekunio por la manteno di la publika voyi, e.c.; IV-447.
prestijo prestige. Def.: Speco di autoritato od influo, qua venas de l’extera aspekto ed efikas per l’opiniono ed imaginado; IV-447.
presupozar (tr.) to presuppose; preo, preajo presupposition.
pretendar (tr.) to lay claim to (ulo); be a pretender to (a throne, etc.); pretendo pretension, claim; pretendema pretentious; (cf. pretextar).

preter (prep.) passing, past (by): indicates motion from one side to the other past a certain object; preterirar (tr., intr.) to pass (by), go beyond; (fig.) to overreach (cf. devancar); la kavaliero ne haltis apud la kirko ma kavalkadis preter ol the knight did not stop at the church but rode past it; departinte ante ni, la amiki arivis pos ni; nam ni rajuntis li e preteriris li having departed before us, our friends arrived after us; for we overtook them and passed them by.
preterito (gram.) preterit(e): a past tense.
preterpasar (tr.) to pass by (ulu, ulo)

pretextar (tr.) to allege (as a pretext), pretend, feign, sham (ulo); pretexto pretext, pretence: ostensible reason; pretexto falsa, versemblanta fake, specious, pretended; il pretextas nesavo he pretends ignorance; pretextar ula afero urjanta to allege pressing business; kun pretexto di maladesounder pretence of illness.
pretoro (Rom. antiq.) pretor, prætor; pretoreyo pretorium; pretorano a pretorian soldier.
preurbo suburb (= F. faubourg: district which is or was formerly outside the city walls; cf. suburbo); preala suburban; preano suburbanite.
prevalorar (tr.) to prevail (cf. preponderar, vinkar). Ex.: Favoro ofte prevaloras super merito.

prevarikar (intr.) to betray one’s trust (N.B. not «to lie»; cf. mentiar); prevariko breach of trust (esp. in public office). Def.: Faliar sua devo pro interesto o ne-sincereso. Ex.: Ministro, judiciisto, qua prevarikas en sua ofico.
preventar (tr.) to prevent, ward off, forestall; preventiva, preventivo preventive. Def.: Impedar o remediar ula evento (mala) ante lua aparo; II-20.
previdar (tr.) to foresee, anticipate; preo foresight, prevision; preema provident, prudent, careful; preante in anticipation of (ulo).
prevosto provost. Def.: Titulo uzata en diversa faki: eklezio, militistaro, polico, etc. (La epiteti o la kuntexto specialigos olu); V-89.

prezenta (in space) present: not absent; (in time) present: not past or future (cf. nuna); prezente at present, now; prezento (the) present (time); (gram.) present tense; prezenteso presence: existence in a place. V. exp.: On parolas pri persono prezenta same kam evento prezenta; VI-163. Ant.: absenta, pasinta.
prezervar (tr.) to preserve, save: keep from injury (ulu, ulo, de, kontre); (cf. konfitar, konservar); prezerviva, prezervivo, prezervilo peservative. Ex.: Preservar ulu de grande danjero.

prezidar (tr., intr.) to preside over; to take the chair, be chairman; prezido presiding; prezidanto, prezidero, prezidisto president, chairman; prezidanteso (function, duration) presidency; chairmanship; prezidantala presidential.

prezuntar (intr.) presumptuous, presuming; to have undue confidence in oneself; prezunto presumption, excess of self-confidence; prezuntema, prezuntoza presuming, too confident, self-conceited; without proper basis in reason. V. exp.: vid. superba. Ex.: Yuneso esas prezuntoza.

pri (prep.) about, concerning, relating to, in regard to, in reference to, as regards, re, apropos of; joyoza pri la bona informo glad about the good news; diskurso pri ekonomio lecture on economy; pri quo ve pensas nun?what are you thinking about now? me pensas pri mea gepatri I am thinking about my parents; me ne savas pri to I do not know about that.
priklar (tr., intr.; of sensation) to prickle, tingle; sentar prikleso di la gambi to feel one’s legs asleep.

prima primary: first in order of development, of time; not derived; primtipo archetype; primavi (nia) (our) first parents; prima nombri, kolori prime numbers, colo(u)rs; primo (fig., fencing) prime; (R.C. Lit.) prime.
primadono primadonna.
primara primary, elementary, first or lowest in order; primara skolo primary school; primara tereni (geol.) strata earliest deposited.
primato (eccl.) primate.
primitiva primitive; primitivo (hist. gram.) a primitive. Ex.: Primitiva naturo, eklezio, linguo.
primordiala primordial.
primrozo (bot.) primrose (Primula grandiflora).
primulo (bot.) cowslip (Primula officinalis).

princ(ul)o prince (cf. rejido); princino princess; princala, princatra princely; princeso (dignity, rank) princedom; princo lando, princio (territory) principality; princospozulo prince consort; princo salika Salic prince; princetacho a petty prince, princeling.
principo principle; supozo di principo (log.) petitio principii, begging the question. Ex.: Extablisar principo. La principo di movo. Homo sen-principa.
printempo spring (-time); (fig.) prime, bloom of youth; printempoala spring, vernal.
priora prior, before (cf. antea); (jur.) priority. Def.: Qua pasas avan irgu pri ula kozo; VI-382. Ex.: La parento havas la yuro di prioreso (pro anteeso) dum un yaro.
prior(ul)o prior (in a convent); priorino prioress; prioreyo priory, religious house.
prismato prism; prismata, prismatatra prismatic; triangula prismato triangular prism.
pritaneo (Gr. antiq.) prytaneum.
privata private; privateso privacy. Ant.: publika.
privilejo privilege: peculiar advantage or benefit; privilejizar to grant a privilege to a (ulu); privilejizita, privilejito privileged (person).
prizar (tr.) to appreciate, like, prize, value. Ex.: Prizar la bona qualesi, la meriti, la servado, la judiko, la opiniono, du ulu.

prizentar (tr.) to present: set or place before; (milit.) to present (arms); to introduce; (cf. ofrar, montrar, expozar). Ex.: Prizentar buketo. Prizentar akredito-letro ad ulu. Ca afero prizentas granda avantaji. Prizentar ulu a la rejo.

pro (prep.) because of, on account of, out of, owing to, in consequence of; pro ke (conj.) because, since, on the ground that, (cf. nam); pro quo? why?pro to that is why; pro quo ne? why not? trista pro la desfortuno sad because of misfortune; pro jaluzeso out of jealousy; malada pro diabeto sick with diabetes; sufrar pro dursto to suffer from thirst; dispensita de ulo pro infirmajo (odpro ke il esis infirma) exempt from something on account of infirmity (or because he was too infirm). Ex.: El ne povis venar, pro ke el esis malada. Pro quo vu amas il? Pro ke il esas mea amiko. Pro quo vu ne volas venar kun me? Pro ke me ne havas sata tempo. Pro quo vu ne prestas la pekunio ad il? Me ne konocas il; pro to me ne prestos la pekunio.

probar (tr.) to test, make trial of, put to test, prove by experiment; (cf. esforcar); (of ore metals) to assay; probemetar to try on (clothing); probotempiero probationer; probero, probisto tester, assayer; probostono touchstone; probar chanco, risko to run a chance, to take a risk. Ex.: Probar paf-armo. Probar sua forteso. La febla ucelo probas sua ali. Probo di la oro.

probabla probable, likely, having more evidence than the contrary; which is likely to happen; probable probably; probablajo probability: thing probable; probableso (quality) likelihood, probability; probablismo (theol.) probabilism; kalkulo(od teorio)di la probablesi (math.) theory of probabilities, doctrine of chances. Ex.: La aventajo semblas apene probabla (od, semblas neprobabla). Existas nula probableso ke il venos.
problemo problem; problematra problematical, doubtful. Ex.: Geometriala problemo. Ol esas problem solvenda. Pozar ulo kom problemo.

procedar (intr.) to proceed, go on (ad ulo); to act, behave in a certain way; procedo proceeding, way of acting, behaviour, process. Ex.: Procedar a la exameno di kandidato. Procedar lente, cirkonspekte. Simpligar la procedo. Procedo kemiala.
proceduro (jur.) procedure, manner of proceeding; practice; proceedings: measures taken in the prosecution of an action; procedurema litigious. Ex.: Kodexo di civila proceduro. Spenso di proceduro.

procento percentage (N.B. does not refer to interest or rent of capital; cf. po and Talmey’s Text Book, p. 82). Def.: Raporto di la du nombri; V-681. Ex.: Il postulas kin po cento kom procento. Me kolokis 1000 fr. ye la procento di quar po cento. La procento di la naski, di la morti, di la mariaji en ula populo o habitantaro.
procesar (intr., jur.) to bring action, go to law, institute proceedings, prosecute, proceed (kontre ulu); (law-) suit, action; trial; procesema litigious; procesanto litigant.
procesionar (intr.) to walk in procession, to make a procession (in the streets, in the church, etc.); procesione, procesionatre in procession.
procido (theol.) spiration.
proda, prod(ul)o valiant, gallant, doughty (person); prodeso prowess, valo(u)r; prodajo a feat of valor, exploit.

prodigar (tr.) to lavish, be prodigal of, be unsparing of; prodigachar to squander waste; prodigado, prodigemeso prodigality, lavishness, extravagance; prodigema filiulo prodigal son. Def.: Spensar abundante ed ecese (en un sama okaziono); IV-102. V. exp.: Prodigar povas havar laudanta senco. On prodigas sua havajo, sua sorgi, sua bonfaci a un o poka personi. «Deo prodigas sua graco a la pekanto»; kp. disipar.
prodomo (med.) prodrome, premonitory symptom of disease.

produktar (tr.) to produce, engender, bring forth, bear, yield; (cf. genitar); produkturo, produktajo product; produktanto, produktero producer; produktanta, produktiva, produktema producing, productive. Ex.: Ca lando produktas multa oro. La arbori produktas frukti. La autoro produktas verki. La milito produktas granda malaji. La produktaji di naturo. Sulo produktiva.

profana profane, not sacred; related to secular affairs; proceeding from contempt of sacred things; profan(ul)o person uninitiated into any mystery or rite; person not conversant with any art or science; an outsider; profanajo a profane thing or act (cf. profanacar); Ex.: Profana parolado, historio, konduto, ago, naturo. Mixar la profanaji kun la sakraji.

profanacar (tr.) to profane: treat sacred things with abuse, irreverence, contempt; to desecrate; (tr.) to degrade, debase; profanac(ad)o profanation. Ex.: Profanacar templo. Profanado di sua talenti.
profesar (tr.) to profess, make a profession of; profeso profession. Def.: Deklarar publike. Ex.: On profesas religio, kredo, doktrino, fido pri ulu od ulo.
profesiono (occupation) profession; profesionala professional; profesionano member of a profession; profesione professionally, by profession. Ant.: amatoro.
profesoro professor (in a university, college, seminary); profesorala professorial; profesoreso professorship.
profeto prophet, seer; profetala prophetic, relating to a prophet. (cf. predicanta).

profilo profile, side-face, -view; profilizar to draw or show (ulu, ulo); in profile; profiligar su to appear, stand out in profile; profile posturar (intr.) to pose in profile; mi profile (photog.) a pose between back and profile.
profilaxio (med.) prophylaxis.

profitar (tr., intr.) to profit (pecuniarily or otherwise); (cf. ganar); profitigar to cause profit to (ulu). Def.: Avantajizar per ulo; ganar per ulo. Ex.: Profitar (ulo) per komercaji vendita, konsilo donita.

profunda deep, profound: extending far below the surface; (fig.) abstruse, sagacious; profundeso (quality) depth, profundity; profundajo depth (a place); profundigar to deepen; lago profunda de kin metri a lake five meters (metres) deep; des, ne profunda shallow; min, ne profundajo shoal; min, plu profundeskar to shelve. Def.: Qua relatas la triesma dimensiono (generale vertikala) ed aplikesas a l’interna dimensiono di objekto kava. (Vazo esas alta, regardata de extere; ol esas profunda, se on konsideras lua kavajo.) IV-596-7. Ex.: Profunda puteo, vunduro. Profunda dormo, doloro, nul-savo. Cienco, pensero, raskalo profunda. Studiar profunda.
prognozar (tr., med.) to prognosticate: foretell (ulo) from present symptoms; to make a prognosis.
programo program, written outline of entertainment or ceremony; (of a theater) playbill; (of a political party) platform; (in a university) syllabus; (fig.) plan, project.

progresar (intr.) to progress, make progress; progres(ad)o progressing, advancement; progresanta, progresiva, progresema progressive; progresemo a progressive person; (fig.) a liberal, radical. Ex.: La atako kontre l’enemiko progresas. La progreso di incendio, di inundado, di studiado, di morbo. Ant.: retroirar, regresar.
progresiono (math., biol.) progression.

projektar (tr., geom. opt.) to project; projekto, projekturo projection; projektajo that which is projected; projektaparato a projector. Ex.: Korpo qua projektas sua ombro sur altra. Projekto di Mercator.
projektilo (mechan., artil.) projectile.
projektoro beam-thrower, projector (as of a searchlight).

projetar (tr.) to plan, scheme, purpose, to form a project; projeto project; projetata, projetita projected, contemplated. Ex.: Projetar longa voyajo. Projetar facar ulo. Ca homo sen-cese projetas, ma ultempe parfinas ulo.? DEFIRS
proklamar (tr.) to proclaim, cry out, give out; proklamo, proklamajo, proklamuro proclamation. Ex.: Proklamar ulu kom rejo. Proklamar la bona agi di uli. Publikigar proklamajo.
proklitiko (gram.) proclitic.
prokonsulo (Roman. antiq.) proconsul.
prokurar (tr.) to procure, get, obtain; prokuristo di employi keeper of an employment office. Ex.: Prokurar employeso por ulu. Prokurar manjajo por ulu.
prokuratoro (Rom. antiq.) procurator.
prolegomeno prolegomenon.
prolepso (rhet., biol., medic.) prolepsis.

proletario proletarian, labo(u)rer, worker; proletaria, proletariala proletarian; proletarieso (state, condition) proletariat; proletariaro (collect.) proletariat, laboring class, non-possessing class.
proliferar* (tr.) to proliferate.
prolixa prolix, verbose, diffuse (style, discourse, narrative, etc.); prolixeso prolixity. Ant.: lakonika, kurta.
prologo prologue. Ant.: epilogo.

prolongar (tr.) to lengthen, extend (by addition, in space); prolongo, prolonguro prolongation. Def.: Adjuntar ad ula kozo ulo suplementala, qua konstitucas integrajo kun ol, e qua nomesas prolonguro; IV-138. V. exp.: Plulongigar relatas tempo, durado. On prolongas kayo, muro; ma on plulongigas vivo, voyajo, milito.
promenar (intr.) to go for a walk, promenade, walk, stroll (for pleasure); promenigar to take (ulu) out walking; promen(ad)o (act) walk(ing); promeneyo place for walking, promenade.

promisar (tr.) to promise (ulu, ad ulu; facar ulo); (fig., of weather, etc.) to forebode; promisolando land of promise; promisar per sua honoro to give his word (cf. honorpromiso); exekutar (odsatisfacar) sua promiso to keep one’s promise; be as good as one’s word; violacar (odfaliar) sua promiso violate one’s promise, break his word.
promocar (tr.) to promote: raise, advance (someone to a higher rank, grade); promoco promotion, preferment (of officers, learners, etc.).
promontorio (geog.) promontory, headland.
promulgar (tr.) to promulgate (laws, etc.)

pronar (intr., R.C. ch.) «to pronate». V. exp.: Prono esas nek prediko nek solena diskurso. Ol kontenas diversa prego-formuli, rekomendi, konsili, avizi e fine instrukto-diskurso familiara facata por la parokiani dum la meso. Dec. 1538, M.XI 67.
pronacar (tr.) to pronate: turn the palm of the hand downward or backward; pronacanto, pronacanta muskulo pronator muscle.
pronomo pronoun; pronomala pronominal. ?DEFIS
pronukleo (biol.) pronucleus.
pronuncar (tr.) to pronounce (words; cf. artikular); pronuncarodefekto impediment of speech.

propagar to propagate: multiply or continue by generation; (fig.) to spread abroad, diffuse; to make propaganda; propagesar to be propagated; propaganto, propagero, propagemo propagator; propagandist; propagemeso proslelytism. Ex.: Esas necesa propagar la animali e la vejetantaro utila. Propagar lumo, la evangeligo, lo vera.

proporciono (also arith.) proportion: relation, ratio; proporcionigar, proporcionizar (tr.) to proportion: adjust relatively; proporcionala proportional; proporcionalo meza mean proportional; proporcionaleso proportionality; proporcione, proporcionale in proportion (ad), pro rata, proportionately; proporcionigita bone well proportioned; sen proporciona disproportionate. Ex.: Proporcionigar la spensi a la recevaji. Proporcionigar la puniso a la kulpo.

propozar (tr.) to propose: to offer (ulo) for consideration; to propound; to move (a resolution or amendment); propozo (act) proposal, offer; (parl.) motion; propozajo what is proposed, proposition; V. exp.: vid. ofrar.
propoziciono (log., gram., geom., theol.) proposition.

propra own, belonging to, proper, peculiar to; proprajo something which belongs to someone or something, peculiarity, characteristic, attribute, property, one’s own; (cf. singularajo, partikularajo); propreso quality of being somebody’s own; propre properly, strictly; propra dicita properly so-called; propre parolante strictly speaking; proprigar to appropriate: consign to a particular person; proprigar a su to appropriate: to one’s own use, make (ulo) one’s own; propramo self-love, -esteem, -respect, conceit; «amour-propre»; raciono esas propra (odesas proprajo) di la homo reason is peculiar to man; propra nomo proper name or noun; la propra signifiko di vorto the proper meaning of a word; me facis omno per mea propra manui I did it all with my own hands; persono havas karakterizivi propra a person has his own (or peculiar) characterisics; la proprajo di magneto the property of a magnet; lua propra filiulo his own son.? EFIS
propretoro (Rom. hist.) propretor.

proprietar (tr.) to own: have legitimate possesion of (cf. posedar); proprieto ownership; proprietajo that which is owned, property; proprietanto, proprietero owner, proprietor; proprieto literaturala copyright; proprieto nuda bare ownership; (jur.) property without usufruct of it, revisionary interest.
propulsar (tr.) to propel, drive forward; propulsilo propeller (cf. helico).
prorogar (tr.) to prorogue (parliament).
prosektoro prosector: assistant disector or professor of anatomy.
prosenkimo (bot.) prosenchyma.
prosilogismo (log.) prosyllogism.
proskribar (tr.) to proscribe, outlaw. V.exp.: vid. exilar.
prospekto prospectus: preliminary statement of a plan, scheme, or literary work.
prosperar (intr.) to prosper, be successful, thrive; prosperema propitious; havar prosperala mieno have an air of prosperity, look successful.
prostato (anat.) prostate gland.
prostatito (med.) prostatis.

prosternar (intr.) to prostrate oneself (cf. prostracar); prosternigar to cause someone to prostrate himself. Def.: Jetar su avan ulu, ulo, kom signo di adoro o humila respekto (ago o gesto ceremoniala).
prostezo (gram.) prosthesis.
prostitucar (tr.) to prostitute, make a prostitute of (ulu); (fig.) to degrade (su); put (ulu, ulo) to a base use; prostituceyo house of prostitution; prostitucatino a prostitute.

prostracar (intr.) to be in a stare of prostration (extreme physical weakness) be prostrated; prostraco (med. and gen.) prostration (cf. prosterno). Def.: Esar en stando di extrema depreso, mentala o korpala.
protagonisto protagonist: (theater) chief actor; (fig.) one who takes the lead in any great matter.
protalo (bot.) prothallium.
protandra (zool.) protandric.
proteo (myth.) Proteus; (fig.) a man who frequently changes his opinions; (zool.) proteida; proteala protean.
protecionismo (polit. econ.) protectionism; protecionisto protectionist.
proteino protein.

protektar (tr.) to protect, defend; protektanta, protektiva, protektema protecting, protective, fostering; protektato person protected; (fig.) protégé. Ex.: Protektar lo febla, la inocenti, la urbo. Protektata kontre la koldeso.? DEFIRS
protektorato protectorate. Def.: Autoritato asumita da plu-forta stato super inferiora o dependata stato, partikulare pri la relati exterlanda.

protestar (intr.) to protest (publicly); (tr., com.) to protest (payment on a bill). Def.: Asertar forte, solene, publike. Ex.: Protestar kontre abrogo. Il protestas ke omno esis facata kontre lua volo. Protestar pago.
protestanta, protestant(ul)o protestant; protestanteso, protestantismo protestantism.
protezo (surg.) prosthesis. Def.: Adjunto di artificala parto por remplas-igar parte o tote korpala defekto (ex.: artificala gambo).
protisto (biol.) protist.
protogina (bot.) protogynous; protogineso protogyny.
protokolo (parl.) written minutes (of proceedings); (diplom.) protocol; «proces verbal», official report (by functionary, as of a crime).
protoplasmo protoplasm.
prototipo prototype.
protozoo (zool.) protozoan.

proverbo proverb, adage (cf. sentenco); proverba, proverbatra proverbial; proverbeskar to become a proverb; become proverbial; proverbokomedio short dramatic composition. Def.: Kurta, populara precepto o dicajo.
providenco providence (of God); providencala providential.

provinco province; (fig.) shire, country district or region outside of a capital city; provincala provincial; provincatra countrylike;provincano a provincial, a country person; provincestro (rel.) a monastic superior; provincalajo a provincialism; a provincial idiom; provincalismo provincialism (system).

provizar (tr.) to provide, supply, furnish (ulu, per ulo); to victual; provizo, provizuro providing, supply, stock, store; provizanto, provizero, provizisto provider, supplier, caterer, purveyor; (milit.) sutler, canteen-worker. Ex.: Provizar armeo per municioni. Provizar ulu per omna necesaji. V exp.: vid. furnisar.
provizora provisional, temporary, transitory; provizore provisionally, temporarily; provizorajo provisional measure, arangement.

provokar (tr.) to provoke: call forth; incite, incense; provokanta, provokiva, provokema provoking, provocative; provokar a kombato to call forth to combat. Def.: Agar segun maniero por produktar reprezalo.
proxeneto panderer, pimp, go-between; proxenetino procuress; proxeneteso business, position of being a pimp. Def.: Persono qua agas kom mediacero en shaminda afero.

proxim (prep.) near, by, close to, nigh to; (of time and space; for quantities cf. cirkum; cf. apud); li esis proxim la urbo they were near the city; proxim la instanto decidiganta near the decisive moment; proxime (adv.) near, nigh, close; il lojas proxime he lives close by; proxima near, next, bordering upon; ka vu akompanos me a la proxima strado? will you accompany me to the next street? printempo esas proxima spring is near; la maxim proxima urbo the nearest city; ta urbo esas plu proxima that city is nearer; proximeso proximity, nearness; proximigar to bring, draw (ulo, ulu) near; il proximigas la hundo he made the dog come near him; proximeskar to draw nigh, approach, to approximate; la hundo proximeskasthe dog came near; la tempo proximeskas; the time draws nigh; to esas nur proxime justa that is only approximately right; proximigo ad la vereso approximation to the truth.
prozo prose; prozaltra prosaic, dull, matter of fact; -atreso prosiness; prozajo piece of prose.
prozelito proselyte.
prozodio (gram.) prosody.
prozopopeo (rhet.) prosopopœia, personification.
pruo (nav.) bow, prow. Def.: L’avana parto di navo o batelo.
pruda prudish; prudino a prude; prudeso (quality, characteristic prudishness); prudajo a prudish act. Def.: Afektacante pudoroza.

prudenta prudent, cautious, politic, discreet, wary; prudent(ul)o a prudent person; prudenteso prudence; prudente with prudence, discreetly; ne prudenta imprudent, rash. Def.: Saja e cirkonspekta en agado e konduto. V. exp.: vid. cirkonspekta.
pruinar, pruinas (impers.) there is (or, we are having) a hoar frost (or, white frost); pruino hoar-frost, rime; pruinoza, pruinizita white with frost, rimy, frost-covered.
pruno plum: prune; pruniero plum-, prune-tree (genus: Prunus); pruniereyo plum-orchard; sika pruno (dried) prune.
prunelo (bot.) sloe: fruit of the blackthorn; prunelierosloe-tree, blackthorn-tree (Prunus spinosa).
pruritar (intr.) to itch; prurit(ad)o itching; (med.) pruritis. Ex.: La skalpajo pruritas.
pruvar (tr.) to prove, demonstrate by experiment or argument (ulo, per ulu); pruvo proving, proof, evidence; pruvanta, pruviva convincing, decisive, conclusive (arguments); (cf. konkluziva).
psalmo psalm; psalmisto psalmist; psalmlibro, psalmaro book of psalms; psalter; psalms (collect.); psalmo penitencala penitential psalm.

psalmodiar (intr.) to psalmodize, to sing psalms; (tr.) to drone out, recite (ulo) in a sing-song manner; psalmodio psalmody, psalm-singing. (fig.) sing-song. Def.: Psalmodio: maniero kantar la psalmi (aplikebla ad altro kam psalmi); IV-515.
psalterio psaltery, a stringed musical instrument.
pseudo* a prefix signifying false, counterfeit.
pseudonima pseudonymous; pseudonimo pseudonym, nom de plume, alias. Def.: Aganta o skribanta kun falsa nomo.
pseudosfero (geom.) pseudosphere.
psiko the conscious, knowing mind; psikala psychical. Def.: La koncio fenomenala, la objekto di la «psikologio» (tale psiko esas plu generala kam anmo); V-32. Ex.: Psikala kauzi, qualesi, dolori.
psikiatrio psyschiatry. Def.: Kuracado di mentala morbi.
psikologo psychologist.
psikologio psychology. Def.: Ta parto di filozofio qua traktas la mentala fakultati ed agado di la psiko.
psikometro psychrometer, hygrometer.
psoaso* (anat.) psoas, lumbar muscle.
pterigoida* (anat.) pterigoid, wing-shaped.
pteropodo pteropod.
ptomaino* (chem.) ptomaine.
pubera pubescent, arrived at puberty; pubereso puberty.
pubio* (anat.) pubic bone; pubiala pubic.
publicano (Rom. hist.) publican. Def.: Recevisto dil imposto o censo por la Romani (e pro to odiata e desestimata da la Judi); VII-281.
publicisto publicist. Def.: Persono qua skribis od esas erudita pri la yuri di nacioni, nacional ekonomiko, e.c.

publika public (opp. to private); publiko (fig.) the public, the people (indefinately); publike publicly, in public; publikeso (quality) publicity, notoriety; publikigar to make (ulo) public (cf. editar); publikig(ad)o (act) publication: publikigajo publication: that which is published; publika deklaro manifesto; publika saneso public health; la publika prospero the public welfare. Ant.: privata.
pudelo poodle (-dog).
«puding» (cook.) pudding.
pudingo (geol.) pudding-stone, conglomerate.
pudlar (tr. metal.) to puddle; pudlisto puddler; pudloforno puddling-furnace. Def. : Konvertar feraji a forjita fero per fuzado.

pudorar (intr., esp. of women) to feel a natural shame, modesty; be modest; pudoro native bashfulness, modesty, pudency, pudicity; pudoroza, pudorema ashamed, bashful, chaste, modest, coy; pudoracho pretended modesty; sen pudora without shame, immodest. Def.: Pudoro: la sexuala modesteso quan la muliero specale sentas.
pudro powder (for the toilet; cf. pulvero); pudrizar to powder (the face, etc.); riz pudro rice powder.
puero child (of over seven years); puerino girl; puerulo boy; puerala, pueratra juvenile, childish, puerile; pueraleso, pueratreso (quality) childishness; pueralajo childish act or object.
pufo large stuffed footstool; round ottoman seat. Def.: Sidilo (ped-apog-ilo) polsterizita (sen ula dors-apogilo): II-647.
pugno fist, pugnofrapar (tr.) to strike with the fist; pugnofrapo a punch; pugnofrapeto a cuff; pugnofrapilo (brass-) knuckle; pugnokombato fistfight; pugnoforteso gripping power.
pulo* (billiard game) pool.
pulco (ent.) flea; pulcokolora puce-colo(u)red.
pulchinelo punchinello, Punch, buffoon; (fig.) puppet.
pulio pulley; (nav.) block; (tech.) sheave; puliaro bock and tackle, hoisting gear, compound pulley.
pulikario (bot.) fleabane (genus:Pulicaria).
pulmono (anat.) lung; pulmonala pulmonary. ?EFIS
pulmonario* (bot.) lungwort, pulmonary (genus: Pulmonaria).
pulmonito (med.) pneumonia, inflammation of the lungs.

pulsar (tr., intr.) to push, thrust, drive (by force or violence); to impel (by pressure); to displace (by effort); to throb, pulsate, beat (as heart); (cf. shovar); puls(ad)o pushing, thrusting; pulse, pulsation, throbbing. Ex.: Pulsar veturo. Pulsar ulu ek chambro. Pulsar per la manuo. Pulsado di l’arterii. Palpar la pulsado di ulo. La vento pulsas la navo.

pulular (intr.) to pullulate: gow or germinate abundantly (cf. multeskar; formikumar); pulul(ad)o pullulation: rapid increase, swarm. Def.: Multeskar abundege e rapide. Ex.: La pululado di mikrobi esas tre rapida.

pulvero powder, any dry stuff composed of small particles, as used in guns, pharmacy (cf. polvo, pudro); pulvera of powder; pulveroza, pulveratra powdery; pulverigar to reduce (ulo) to powder, to pulverize; pulverigita pulverized; pulverizar to cover with p.; pulverifar to make, produce p.; pulveriferio p.-making establishment; pulvermagazino p.-magazine; pulveruyo p.-holder, -horn; chas pulvero p. for hunting purposes; min pulvero p. for mining, blasting;karbon pulvero coal-dust; fek pulvero dried night-soil.
pumao (zool.) puma, cougar (Felis concolor).
pumico pumice (-stone); pumicagar (tr.) to rub (ulo) with pumice.
pumpar (tr.) to pump; pumpilo a pump; pumpisto pumper; (fig.) fireman; aer pumpilo air pump; incendio pumpilo fire-engine.

puncar (tr.) to punch: indent with pump or die; puncuro (result) stamp (as of coins, medals, etc.); puncilo punch. V. exp.: Puncar diferas de la stampo per ke stampar esas nur imprimar sur surfaco, kontre ke puncar esas penetrar o mem borar ula korpo; II-357.
puncho (beverage) punch.
puncionar (tr. surg.) to puncture, tap (a tumor, etc.).

punisar (tr.) to punish, chastise (ulu, por, per); puniso (act) punishment; punisuro penalty; puniseso punishment: state of being punished; punisala penal; punisanto, punisero punisher, chastiser; punisinda punishable; punisesar to be punished (da, pro); puniso per amendo punishment by fine; punistasko extra task (as at school); punislaboro hard labo(u)r; punisdomo house of correction.
punsar (tr.) to pounce (a design). Def.: Kopiar desegno per pulvero, quan on pasigas tra la trui di papero perforita segun la linei di la desegno; VI-116.

punto (geom., astron., typo., play) point; dot; position; period; small hole (as made by a needle or awl); puntizar to dot, prick, mark (ulo) with a point; to punctuate; puntizado, punturo punctuation; dotting; puntizosigno stop; puntizar le «i» to dot the i’s; puntokomo semi-colon (;); klamo punto exclamation mark (!); bipunto colon (:); question punto question mark (?); suto punto stitch; kontakto punto p. of contact; depart punto p. of departure; seko punto p. of intersection; incido punto p. of incidence;halto punto stop; vid punto viewpoint; morto punto p. of death; kardinala punto (geog.) cardinal p.; krizala punto critical p.; repoz punto (mus.) pause.
pupo poop, stern (of a ship, boat). Def.: Dopa parto di navo, di batelo; III-594.
pupeo doll, puppet; ludar per pupeo to play with a doll; pupeatra doll-like.
pupilo (anat.) pupil (of eye).
pupitro desk for reading, writing, drawing, etc. (N.B. not pulpit; cf. katedro); muzik pupitro music-stand.

pura pure (air, water, blood, wine, race, life, style, intentions, mathematics, etc.); genuine, unmingled, unalloyed; plain, mere, sheer; downright; pureso purity, pureness; -e purely, genuinely, merely; purigar to make (ulo) pure, purify; puriganta, purema purifying; purismo (rhet.) excessive nicety, esp. in choice of words; purista, puristo purist(ic) (in choice of words); pursanga pure-blooded; pursangulo, purino thoroughbred. Def.: sen intermixuro; ne alterita, ne-viciizita, ne-koruptita.
pureo purée, a thick soup, as of vegetables, boiled and strained.

purgar (tr. lit. and fig.) to purge (the body, soul, mind, etc.); purgiva, purgivo purgative; purgilo a purging instrument. V. exp.: Purgarkuracar per purgivo (quale purgar intestini); liberigar de nepurajo e stranjeraji (quale purgar metalo); liberigar de kulpi etikal, intelektala (quale purgar de prejudiko, misopiniono).
purgatorio purgatory.
puritan(ul)o a puritan; puritanismo Puritanism.
purpuro purple (colored); purpuro purple, (the colo(u)r, dye); purpuratra purplish; purpurizar to empurple (ulo).
puso (med.) pus, purulent matter; pusifar to produce pus; suppurate; pusoza, pusifanta purulent, suppurative; pusozeso purulence.
pustulo pustule; (bot.) blister; pustuleto small pustule; pimple (filled with matter). V. exp.: vid. papulo.
putativa* putatative, reputed, supposed. Def.: Quan on supozas havar legal existo. Ex.: Putativa mariajo.
puteo well: shaft sunk in the ground for water, oil; puteokordo well-rope; puteoarteza Artesian well.
putoro (zool.) polecat (Putorius).

qua (relative and interrogative pronoun; acc. quan) who, what, which (person) (Note: qua used as an interrogative adjective has the same form in the plural as in singular; ex.: qua membri ne pagis ankore which members have not paid yet?; used substantively it takes the form qui; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 26); qua esas ibe who is there; qua viro venis which man came? qua kloko esas what time is it? (or, what is the hour?); la pluvo qua falis the rain which fell; la libro quan me donis a vu the book which I gave you; la puerino quan me amas the girl whom I love; qua iras hike (milit.) who goes there? quo (acc. quon): what, which (thing, fact); (Note: The forms quo, quon are also used adjectively when referring to othr pronouns ending in quao; as, to quo, co quo, omno quo, nulo quo cf. Talmey ibid. p. 95); quo used as an interrogative refers to something indefinite; as, quo eventis? what happened; quo esas plu bona which (thing) is better? quon il dicis? what did he say? quo, ka vera? what! is it true? quon (me devas) facar? what is to be done? (used adjectively) prenez to quon vu volas take what you will. Qui (acc. quin) (pl. form of qua and quo) who, what, which; qui parolis who (plural) spoke? la personi qui parolis the persons who spoke; ti quin me amas those whom I love.
quadro freestone, ashlar, hewn or squared stone; opp. of kruda stono.
quadranto (instrument) quadrant; (geom.) quadrant: quarter of a circumference of a circle; (cf. VI-322).
quadraturo (astron.) quadrature, quartile (aspect or relation of 90 degrees).
quadriangula quadrangular, four-cornered, four-square, four-angled; quadrio (geom. and bldg.) quadrangle.
quadrigo (antiq.) quadriga.
quadrika, quadriko* (math.) quadric.
quadrilo quadrille (dance and music); troop of horsemen (at a tournament); a game of cards played by four persons.
quadrilatero, quadri(al)a quadrilateral.
quadriliono quadrillion (1,000,0004).
quadrimanua quadrumanous.
quadripeda, quadrio quadruped.
quadriremo (antiq.) quadrireme: galley with four banks of oars.
quadriyara quadrennial.
quak! quack!
quakero (rel.) quaker.
qualio (orni.) quail (Tetrao coturnix).

qualifikar (tr.) to qualify: to ascribe the quality of; (gram.) to express a quality; to style, term; qualifiko qualification: attribution of a quality or title; qualifikanta qualifying; qualifikilo (gram.) a qualificative; qualifikanto (R.C. rel.) a qualificator. Def.: Expresar la qualeso di, atribuar qualeso ad ulu, ulo. Ex.: L’adjektivo qualifikas la nomo. Qualifikar ulu kom fripono. La verko esas qualifikita kom herezioza.
quankam (conj.) although, though. Ex.: Il esas jeneroza, quankam il ne esas richa. Quankam il esas mea amiko.
quaranteno quarantine; impozar quaranteno ad ulu to q. (ulu).
quarco (min.) quartz.
quartana quartan: occurring every fourth day; quartana febro q. fever.
quartero quarter, district, ward, section of a city.
quartermastro (milit.) quartermaster, one who provides quarters, provisions, etc.; (nav.) quartermaster, a petty officer rating.
quarterona, quarteron(ul)o quadroon. Def.: Genitito da blanko e da mulato; V-25.
quarteto (mus.) quartet.
quartiko* (math.) quartic.
quasio (kortico) (pharm.) quassia; iero (bot.) q. tree (Quassia amara).
quaternara (math., geol.) quaternary.
quaterniono (math.) quaternion.
quatreno quatrain. Def.: Poemeto di quar versi; III-143.

quaze, quaza as it were, so to speak; (jur.) quasi; quaza diftongo a quasi-diphthong. Def.: En ula grado simila, ma ne tote tala; III-153.
