V. exp.: Quaze indikas nur semblo o simileso e ke esas poka difero inter du objekti. Preske indikas stando o grado proxima e esas termino di mezuro indikanta proximeso, kurta disto, tempo, grado. Ex.: quaze nigra; preske parfinita; il esis preske mortinta (il esis tre grave malada, vindita, e.c.); il esis quaze mortinta (il esis senmova, o simulis mortinto, ma esis forsan tote sana).
quazedelikto (jur.) injury caused involuntarily.
quazekontrato (jur.) quasi-contract, implied contract.
quecho* damson (plum); (Prunus domestica); quechiero d. tree.
querar (tr.) to fetch; querigar to casue (ulu) to fetch (ulu, ulo); querigez la mediko send for the doctor. Ex.: Irar por querar ulu, ulo. Sendar ulu por querar ulu, ulo. Venar por querar ulu, ulo.
quercitrono (bot.) quercitron, dyer’s oak (Quercus tinctoria).
querko oak-tree (genus: Quercus); (cf. rovro); querkoligna tablo oaken table; querko sempreverda evergreen oak, holm oak (Quercus Ilex).
questoro (Rom. antiq.) quæstor, questor.
qui see qua.
quin see qua.
quino quinquina, cinchona, Peruvian bark; (cf. quinino); quiniero cinchona tree (Cinchona).
quinara* quinary, consisting of five.
quingo (fruit) quince; quingiero q. tree (Cydonia vulgaris).
quinino (chem.) quinine, quinia. Def.: Alkaloido extrakta di quino.
quinkunco quincunx. Def.: Kinopa dispozo di kozi (un en omna angulo e un meze di quadrato).
quinquagezimo* Quinquagesima (Sunday).
quinto (mus.) quint: interval of five consecutive notes; (fig.) a tenor violin; (piquet) quint, a sequence of five cards; (fencing) quinte, fifth guard.
quintalo (metrala) quintal: 100 kg (about 200 lbs.).
quintana* (febro) quintana, five-day fever.
quintesenco (lit. and fig.) quintessence, essential thing, pith (of a matter).
quinteto* (mus.) quintet.
quintiko* (math.) quintic.
quintiliono quintillion (1,000,0005).
quiproquo quid pro quo, mistake, blunder. Def.: Intermixo di du personi o kozi; V-25.
quirito quirite, a citizen of ancient Rome in his civil capacity.
quirlar (tr.) to twirl, querl; turn or wind (ulo) around. V. exp.: Agitar liquido, ex. kremo, per quirl-ilo.
quo see qua.
quociento (arith.) quotient.
quodlibeto pun, quibble, sorry joke, jest.
quoto quota, portion, share, contribution. Def.: Parto quan on devas pagar o recevar, en repartiso di ula sumo totala.

rabatar (tr.) to make a reduction in (value or price); (cf. diskontar); rabato reduction, diminution, rebate, abatement (in price); rabate vendar to sell at a reduced price; rabate komprar to buy at a discount; esas granda rabato en la preco di ca vari there is a great reduction in the price of these goods. Def.: Rabato: diminuto di preco grantita da la vendisto a la kompranto.
rabio rabies, canine madness (cf. hidrofobio); rabiala relating to rabies; rabiika, rabiiko rabid (person or animal).
rabino (Jewish) rabbi, rabbin; rabinala rabbinical; rabinismo rabbinism;rabinisto rabbinist, one who adheres to the tradition of the rabbins.
raboto (carp.) plane; rabotagar (tr.) to plane; rabotospano shaving; rabotmashino a planer; listel raboto rabbet plane.
racemo* (bot.) raceme.

raciono (faculty) reason, power of understanding, intellect; (cf. motivo, expliko, kauzo, rezonar); racionala rational (act, thing); racionoza rational (person); racionaleso rationality; racionalismo rationalism; racionalisto rationalist; evo di raciono age of reason; des, ne, sen, kontreraciona unreasonable, irrational. Def.: La fakultato per qua on konocas e judikas.
rado (nav.) roads, roadstead; enirar (la) rado to go into the road.

radiar (tr., intr.) to radiate, irradiate: to emit rays or beams; radio ray, beam, gleam; (geom.) radius; (of a wheel) spoke; (ich.) ray, skate; radiado radiation, radiance; radianta, radioza beaming, radiant, radiated; radiozo (zool.) radiary (pl.) radiata; radiala radial; radiizar to cover (ulo) with rays; sun radii sun rays; kalor radio ray of heat; (fig.) lua vizajo radias (pro) joyo his countenance beams with joy. Ex.: Lumo radias. Radiar kaloro. La radii di Roentgen; La suno radiizas la agri, t.e. kovras li per sua radii (o radiado).

radiatoro* radiator (of heat); cooling apparatus. Def.: Aparato destinita cedar kaloro a l’aero cirkondanta (quale l’aparati, qui varmigas nia domi, e l’aparati, qui koldigas l’aquo en la motori di automobilo); V-626-7.

radiko(of plants, etc., also gram., math.) root; (gram.) root, stem, radix, radical, primitive word or syllable; (fig.) beginning, origin; radikala radical: relating to the root; radikifar to produce roots, take root (en); radikizar to plant: fix (ulo) in earth by roots; radikosproso (bot.) sucker, runner; radiketo (bot.) radicle; radikalo (math. chem.) radical; radikal(ul)o (politics) radical: an advocate of radicalism; radikalismo (polit.) radicalism; kina radiko di mil fifth root of a thousand (5&radic1000).
radiografar (tr.) to photograph (ulu, ulo) by means of x-rays; radiografuro (photo.) radiograph.
radiometro (instr.) radiometer.
radioskopar (tr.) to view an opaque object by means of Röntgen rays; radioskop(ad)oradioscopy; radioskopilo radioscope; (cf. radiografar).
radiotelefonar (tr.) to phone (ulo) by wireless; radioo, radiouro wireless telephoning, radiophone; radioilo a wireless telephone.
radiotelegrafar (tr.) to telegraph (ulo) by radio; radio(ad)o, radiouro radio-telegraphing, radiogram; radioilo radio-telegraphic apparatus.
radiumo* (chem.) radium.
radiuso (anat.) radius (-bone).
radotar (intr.) to be in his (or her) dotage, to talk drivel; nonsense; radoteso (state) dotage; radotanto, radotero, radotemo dotard, driveler.
rafano (bot.) radish (Raphanus radicula); rafaneto radish (Raphanus sativus); rafaneyo radish bed.
raflo rape, grape-stalk.
rafto raft, plank or log float; raftoponto a bridge-raft; arbor rafto a raft of trees.
rago tatter: cloth torn and hanging (cf. shifono); ragizar to clothe (ulu) in rags, tatters; ragoza, ragizita ragged, tattered; ragozeso raggedness.
raguto (cook.) ragout: a highly seasoned dish; a stew; hash.
raitro reiter: ancient German trooper.
rajuntar (tr.) to overtake, catch up to. Def.: Atinger ulu, ulo, sequinte lu kun plu granda rapideso; III-470. Ex.: Il jus departis, ma me esperas balde rajuntar il.

rakar (tr.) to draw, rack off (wine, etc.) (fig.) to extract, worm out (secrets, money, etc.) V. exp.: To ne esas transvarsar (varsar ek un vazo en altra per la suprajo), ma pasigar (liquido) de un vazo en altra, cherpante sube (per robineto o sifono); III-77.
rakahuto racahaut: an Arabian food.
raketo racket (as for tennis).
rakito (med.) rachitis, rickets; rakitiko, rakitika (person) suffering from r.

rakontar (tr.) to recount, tell (a made up story, fiction, something which never happened, is not true); rakonto story, tale, fib, fiction, gossip; rakonto imaginala, fantaziala fantastic yarn, improbable story; old wife’s tale; rakontanto, rakontero story-teller; rakontachar to tittle-tattle. V. exp.: vid. naracar.
ralo (orni.) rail (-bird) (Rallus).

raliar* (tr., intr., milit. and fig.) to rally (troops). Def.: Kunvenigar hazarde soldati dispersita, ne segun individuala ordino; metafore signifikas adhero (plu or min bonvoloza) a partiso, a persono, e.c.; V-742.
ramo small bough, twig, small branch (of a tree); (fig.) a subdivision or branch artery, vein; branch of family, etc.; ram(et)oza branchy, ramous, ramified.
ramio (bot.) ramie (Bœhmeria); ramiostofo ramie fabric.
ramno (bot.) buckthorn (genus: Rhamnus).
rampo (upward) slope, gradient, incline, ramp. V. exp.: vid. pento.
rano frog; ranlarvo tadpole.
ranca rancid, rank; ranceso rancidity; ranceskar to turn, become rancid; odorar rance to smell rancid.

rango row, file, tier, range; (degree, station) rank, order; rangizar to place (ulo) in rows, put (uli) in ranks; to class (persons, things) (cf. lokizar); en la sama rango in the same row; samranga of the same rank; altaranga of high rank; recevar rango (milit.) to take rank. Def.: Ordino, aranjo di kozi sama o simila, personi sur lineo o segun digneso o merito. Ex.: Rango di soldati. Revolucioni konfuzas omna rangi.
rankorar (intr.) to have a grudge, a ranco(u)r, spite; to feel resentment, animosity (kontre ulu, pri, pro, ulo).
ransono ransom; postular ransono to demand a ransom (de, po, ulu). Def.: Preco postulata po la liberigo di kaptito (militala o ne); V-676.
ranunkulo (bot.) buttercup (genus: Ranunculus).
ranuro groove: a long, square-cut, sunken channel in wood or metal; (firearms) rifling; (cf. kanelo).
rapo (bot.) a variety of turnip (Brassica rapa rapifera).
rapecar (tr., of clothing) to piece, put a piece in, patch; (of shoes) to cobble; (cf. reparar).

rapida (in space and time) rapid, swift, quick, prompt, fleet, speedy, fast (cf. ajila, hastema, alert); rapideso quickness, celerity, rapidity, velocity; rapidajo a rapid (in a river); rapida treno, rapido a fast train, express; rapidagema expeditious. Ant.: lenta.
rapiero rapier, long, straight sword.

raportar (tr.) to make a report on, to report (ulo, ad ulu); raporto report; (fig. math.) ratio, relation; raportanto, raportero, raportisto reporter. Def.: Facar raporto, t.e., plu o min longa naraco o deskripto pri kozo od evento, specale a chefo od autoritato kompetenta, od a societo, kongreso, quan o devas o volas informar; VI-79; matematikala raporto equivalas fraciono, kp. relatar. Ex.: Historio reportas remarkinda fakti. Komercala raporti; La raportisto raportas la novaji od facas raporto pri ula proceso. La reporto di 2 ad 3 esas la fraciono 2/3.
rapsodo (antiq.) rhapsodist: reciter of poems.
rapsodio rhapsody: poem recited by a rhapsodist; (fig.) rambling composition.

raptar (tr.) to sieze and carry away by violence, pillage, kidnap, ravish; rapto rapine, pillage, kidnapping, highway robbery; raptanto, raptero, raptisto robber, brigand, bandit, highwayman; raptajo booty, plunder; raptema rapacious; raptemeso rapacity (cf. avideso); raptocido murder (attended) with robbery. V. exp.: vid. furtar, extorsar.

rara rare, seldom occuring, not frequent, infrequent, unusual; (cf. skarsa); rare rarely, seldom, not often; rarega very rare; rareso rareness; rarajo a rarity, curiosity. Def.: Desofta, desfrequa; V-595. Ant.: ofta, frequa, cf.skarsa.

raso (human, animal) race, stock, breed; (fig.) family, line, ancestry, blood; (agri.) variety; rasala ethnic; (la) rasi futura future races, generations. Def.: Ensemblo di la ancestri e decendanti di una familio, di un populo. Ex.: La raso di Abraham. Homala raso. Di pura raso. Hundo chasas segun sua raso.

raskalo rascal, rogue, knave, scamp, blackguard; raskalala, raskalatra rascally, scoundrelly; raskaleso (quality) knavery; raskalajo (act.) knavish trick, rascality; raskalarorabble, riffraff (cf. populacho).
rastar (tr.) to rake: clean (ulo) with a rake; rastilo a rake; rastiloedo a rakeful.
rastaquero* a foreigner or stranger travelling without known means of existence; a fashionably dressed swindler.
rasteliero rack, wooden frame of open work, as for fodder, for arms, etc.
rato rat; ratchasanta, ratera rat-hunting; ratkaptilo rat-trap; ratveneno rat poison.
ratifio (liquor) ratafia.
ratifikar (tr.) to ratify, confirm (a treaty, an act, etc.). Def.: Autentigar ulo ja facita o promisita.
rateno (fabric) rat(t)een.
ratono (zool.) raccoon, coon (Procyon lotor).
rauka hoarse, raucous, husky; raukeso hoarseness; raukigar, raukeskar to make, become hoarse.
raupo caterpillar.
rautorout, a fashionable assembly, a large evening party.
ravelino (fort.) ravelin, lunette.
ravino ravine, gully; ravinizar to gully out (by torrent), to cross (a land) with ravines. Def.: Longa, profunda e streta exkavuro formacita da torento.

ravisar (tr.) to ravish: enrapture, charm; raviso, raviseso (act, state) transport, rapture; ravisanta, ravisiva ravishing, delightful, charming; ravisante admirably, wonderfully well. Ex.: Vua kantado ravises me. Me esis en raviseso (od, ravisata). Il kantas ravisante.
rayo (ich.) ray, skate (genus: Raia).
razar (tr.) to shave (su, ulu); razilo razor; raziloledro razor-strop; razero, razisto barber. Def.: Tranchar raze la pili.
re (mus.) re, D, the second note of the diatonic scale.
reaktar (intr.) to react (ad, kontre); reakto (all senses) reaction; reaktiva, reaktema reactive; reaktivo (chem.) a reagent; reaktemo (polit.) reactionary.

reala real: actually existing, not imaginary, not fictitious; realajo, lo reala a reality, what is real; realeso (quality) reality; reale in reality, indeed; realigar to realize: make real, bring (ulo) into being; (fin.) to convert into money; realeskar to become or be realized; be converted into money; (fig.) to come to pass; realig(ad)o, realiguro realization; realigebla realizeable; realismo (philos., art) realism; realismala, realistala realistic; realisto realist. Ant.: imaginala, realita; nevera, falsa.
realgaro (min.) realgar. Def.: (Reda) arsen-sulfo; IV-580.

rebela rebellious, refractory; rebel(ul)o a rebel, insurgent; rebeleskar, rebelesar to rebel, rise in rebellion (cf. revoltar); -esko, rebeleso rebellion; rebelaro (collect.) rebels. Def.: Qua violente refuzas obediar autoritato yurizita. Ex.: La rebela anjelo. Rebelo kontre rejo. Ant.: obedianta, rebelema. ? DEFIS

rebordo a raised edge; brim, rim; rebordizar to put a raised edge on (ulo). V. exp.: Flanjo existas nur en tubi. Rebordo ne esas simpla bordo, ma bordo salianta ofte perpendikla a la chefa parto (quale rebordo di chapelo); IV-642.
rebuso rebus.
recensar (tr.) to review (a book).
recenta recent; recente recently, lately; tote recente very recent, new, fresh; til recente until recently. Ex.: Recenta eventi. Tote recenta memoro. Ant.: anciena.
recepcionar (tr., tech.) to take over. V. exp.: Examenar la qualesi di furnisajo e pose decidar pri lua acepto o refuzo. VII-480.
recepto (med., cook) recipe, receipt (cf. preskripto). Def.: Formulo qua indikas la kompozuro di ula medikamento o la ingrediento di ulo.
receptaklo* (bot.) receptacle.

recevar (tr.) to receive, accept (something offered, given, sent); recevo (act.) accepting, receipt; recevajo that which is received; la libro esas recevebla de la imprimeriothe book is to be had from the printer’s; recevuyo receptacle; recevilo receiver (instr.); recevatesto acknowledgement of receipt. V. Exp.: On recevas simple to, quo donesis o sendesis, mem ne demandita o ne expektata. On recevas donacajo, pensiono. On aceptas kande on voluntas recevar (gasto, e.c.). Obtenar esas recevar kozo, quan on deziras, demandas, por qua on konkursis (premio) od irge penis; II-647.

recidivar (intr., jur.) to repeat the same offence, to commit the same crime again; (med.) to reappear (said of a former illness);recidivo recidivism: relapse into crime or illness, second offense; recidivanto, recidivinto, recidivero previously convicted felon, old offender.
recipiento (chem., phys.) recipient: receiving vessel for gases or liquids.

reciproka (also log., gram.) reciprocal, mutual; reciproko (log.) converse: reciprocal proposition; reciprokeso reciprocity, mutuality; agar reciproke to return the like, to give like for like (ad ulu). V. exp.: vid. mutuala.
recitar (tr.) to recite: repeat out loud something learned (a lesson, etc.)
recitativo (mus.) recitative: sort of a musical declamation used in operas, etc.

reda red (colo(u)red); redo, reda koloro red (the color); blush; redeso redness; redigar, redizar to make red (ulu, ulo); to cause to blush; redatra reddish, ruddy; redvanga red-cheeked, rubicund; (la) redi (fig.) the reds, republicans, socialists.

redaktar (tr.) to draw up, word (a document); to edit (a newspaper, journal) (cf. editar); redakt(ad)o, redakturo drawing up (deeds, etc.); editing periodicals; redaction; redakteso manner , style of wording, editing; redaktanto, redaktero, redaktisto writer (of a deed); editor; redaktistala artiklo an editorial.
redano* (fort.) redan.
redemtar (tr.) to redeem.
redingoto frock coat: double-breasted garment for men, with long skirts before and behind.
redkaudo (orni.) redstart, red-tail (Rubicilla phoenicura).
redpektoro (orni.) robin redbreast (Erithacus rubeculus).
reduito (fort.) reduit, inner fortification; (fig.) retreat, refuge. Def.: La senco vulgara e la senco militala esas identa: «loko, angulo en qua on povas retretar, refujar, celar su»; IV-706.

reduktar (tr., intr.; also surg., math.) to reduce (to proper, suitable proportions; cf. diminutar); (jur.) to commute (a sentence); reduktebla reducible. Ex.: Reduktar (la dimensioni di) mapo, tablo. Reduktar ulu a taco. Reduktar ulo a pulvero. Reduktar frumento a farino. Reduktar rupturo. Reduktar du fracioni a la sama denominatoro.
reduto (fort.) redoubt.
refo reef (in a sail); refagar to reef; desrefagar to let out the reefs in (a sail).

referar (tr., intr.) to refer (to): to direct, send to another; to attribute, ascribe; refero reference; referolibro book of reference. Ex.: Me referas l’afero a vu. Me referas Sro. A. a Sro. B. Me referas mea debileso a la morbo. Ica komizo havas bona referi. On referas ad autoro o libro, e.c. kande on indikas la loko, en qua on trovos ulo aludata o bezonata (k.p. citar). V. exp.: Referar, verbo transitiva, havas senco vicina a relatigar, ma plu preciza. Ol signifikas: establisar relato logikala od intelektala inter un kozo ed altra, qua esas exemple lua kauzo, origino, expliko, e.c. Exemple, on referas la marei a la luno; on referas monumento a lua epoko, autoro, stilo. Per extenso di ta senco, on referas su a persono, qua povas atestar o garantiar ulo, ad autoritato, qua povas konfirmar aserto o protektar ulu; VI-79.

referendario referendary, (in France) a former title of certain public officers; (in Germany) young barrister attending the courts and qualifying for the post of «Assessor»; referendaria konsilisto (France) a magistrate in audit office.

reflektar (tr., phys. sense) to reflect (back), mirror back (ulo); to turn something back; (intr., fig. mental sense) to reflect, consider, meditate especially on something past (pri): reflektesar to be reflected (en, sur); reflektita reflected (of objects); reflektanta reflecting; reflektiva (gram.) reflective verb etc.; reflektema (fig.) reflective, meditative, thoughtful; reflektilo reflector (cf. reflektoro); reflektangulo angle of relexion; sen reflekta (of character) thoughtless, giddy, heedless. Ex.: Speguli reflektas la imaji di objekti. Reflektez ante ke vu agos. Il reflektis pri sua pasinta peki. Agar senreflekte.
reflektoro* reflector. Also reflecting telescope.
reflexa, reflexo (physiol.) reflex.
refluxar (intr.) to ebb (of tides); refluxo ebb, reflux. Ant. fluxar.

reformar (tr.) to reform: amend for the better (laws, customs, morals, etc.); reformo (also church hist.) reform(ing); reformation; reformema, reformemo; reformista, isto reformer, reformist; reformita reformed (person, church, etc.); reformito a reformed person; (fig.) a protestant; reformebla reformable.
refraktar(tr., phys.) to refract; refraktesar to be refracted; refraktiveso refractive power; refraktebla refrangible. Ex.: La prismato refraktas la lumo-radii.

refraktara (of substances) refractory, not easily melted, wrought or acted upon; refraktar(ul)o a refractory person, contumacious person;(milit.) rebellious recruit (who refuses to join his regiment).
refraktoro* refractor. Also refracting telescope.
refreno refrain, burden of a song; (fig.) constant theme, topic.

refujar (intr.) to take refuge, seek shelter (che ulu, ad ulo). (fig.) to have recourse (to); refujeyo place of refuge; lair (of beasts); refujtrotuaro a place of reuge (for pedestrians); refujanto, refujinto refugee.

refutar (tr.) to refute, confute, disprove. Def.: Kombatar aserto od opiniono per argumenti, qui nuligas ol o qui pruvas la kontreajo. (En proceso, en diskuto, singla partiso penas refutar la aserto o pretendo di l’altra); III-222.

refuzar (tr.) to decline, refuse; refuzo refusal; refuzajo what is refused. V. exp.: Vu refuzas, sive kozo quan on ofras a vu, sive kozo, quan on demandas de vu, sive irga propozo quan on facas a vu. Do refuzar = ne aceptar, o ne koncesar (ne volar donar), o ne admisar, o ne konsentar; III-222.

regalar (tr., also fig.) to regale, treat, entertain, feast; il regalis sua amiki he entertained his friends; il regalas ni per charmanta rakonto he told us (treated us with) a charming tale (to amuse us).
regalio «regale»: royal prerogative.

regardar (tr.) to pay regard to: to look at something attentively, cast the eye on; regardeskar, regardetar to glance at; regardo, regardado look(ing), gaze, stare, Ex.: Regardar la homi pasanta. El lansis regardi furioza. Regardar super muro. La regardi expresas la pensi. V. exp.: Vidar esas nur perceptar ulo per l’okulo, vole o nevole. Regardar esas esforcar por vidar, implikas sempre intenco ed atenco, mem se on fakte ne sucesas vidar: ofte on dicas: «me regardas, e me vidas nulo»; V-35; kp. spektar, kontemplar.
regato regatta, boat-race.
regenerar (tr.) to regenerate: to generate anew; (theol.) to make to be born again; (fig.) to reform, amend. Ex.: La sapto regeneras la aboro-tisui. Bapto esas regenero. Regenerar naciono dekadanta.
regento regent; regenteso regency.
regio regie, direct administration, management of government properties (as opposed to contract administration), esp. the excise administration; a government monopoly.
regimento (milit.) regiment.
regiono (all senses) region, part of a country, of space, of the body, of a science; regionala regional.

registro register, record (of persons); account (of acts and proceedings); (com.) account book; registragar (tr.) to register, record; registrag(ad)o registration; registreyo registration office; registristo registrar; en registrigar to keep a register of, make a record of, enrol.

regnar (tr., intr.) to reign: to rule as king or sovereign, to hold sway over (ulu, ulo); regno reign; (nat. hist.) kingdom; regnanta reigning; regnato a subject; animal regno animal kingdom. Ex.: Louis XIV regnis la lando de 1643 ad 1715. (fig.) La regno di yusteso, di ula modo. La teroro regnis. V. exp.: La rejo di Anglia regnis ma ne guvernas.
regolo (orni.) wren (Troglodytides parvulus).
regoliso (bot.) liquorice, licorice; regolispasto l. paste; regolisaquo l. water.
regresar (intr.) to regress, recede; to recoil; regres(ad)o regression, retro-gression; regresanta, regresiva, regresema (lit. and fig.) regressive, retrograde. Ant.: avancar.
regretar (tr.) to regret, be sorry about (ulu, ulo); regretinda regrettable. Ex.: Regretar la pekunio spensita, amiko mortinta.

regular (tr., tech. and fig.) to regulate (machines, clocks, etc.); regulo rule (to follow; cf. normo); regulado regulating; regularo rules (collect.); regulala relating to regulating; reguloza regular: conformed to rule or law, uniform, constant; regulozeso regularity; regulozigar to regularize, make regular, put in order, set right; regulanta, reguliva regulating, regulative; reguloze regularly; regulizar to make, establish regulations for, impose regulations on; regulizuro regulation (prescribed); reguliero (rel.) regular, a monk; reguliereskar to become a monk, nun; regulierino nun. Ex. Segun la regulo. Konformigar su a la reguli. La regulado di la posh-horlojo. Regular su segun ulu. Regulizar itinerario. Regul-oz-igar nia aferi, nia dokumenti. On preskriptas regulizuri por soldati, por karceri. V. exp.: On regulas mashino, fixigante lua repideso o lua povo ad ula valoro konstanta. Regular ne esas ajustar. On ajustas peci, on regulas fenomeno. On regulas horlojo, ajustante lua pendulo. V-67.
regulatoro* (mechan.) regulator, governor. Def.: Ula parto di mashino qua regulas la movado.

rehabilitar (tr.) to rehabilitate, reinstate; rehabilito rehabilitation, vindication. Def.: Riestablisar en lua olima stando, partikulare en yuri. Ex.: Rehabilitar la memoro di kondamnito. Rehabilitar ulu ad lua olima rango, ulu en l’estimo di la populo.
reino (bridle-) rein.

rej(ul)o (also cards and chess) sovereign king; rejala regal, royal; rejido royal prince; rejprinculo crown prince; rejeso royalty: state of being king, kingship; rejino queen; rejio, rejlando, rejstato kingdom; rejocido; rejocidanto, rejinto (act, person) regicide; rejala aquo aqua regia, nitro-hydrochloric acid.

rejimo (polit. social, medic.) regime, regimen; mode or system of rule or management. Def.: Senco politikala: formo o maniero di guvernado. Senco teknikala: maniero plu o min reguloza segun qua ula fenomeno (duranta) eventas. Senco medicinala: maniero (metodoza) di vivar e di nutrar su (to ne esas dieto, nek higieno); IV-580. Ex.: Anciena rejimo. Monarkiala rejimo. Rejimo di karceri.

rekalkar (tr., tech.) to upset (metals); to ram (a gun); rekalk(ad)o compression (endways); rekalkilo rammer (of a firearm). Def.: Facar preso sur materio cilindroforma (liquida o solida) sur un de lua bazi en la sinso di l’axo, tale ke on kurtigas ol; IV-581.
rekamar (tr.) to figure or work a fabric with gold, silver, silk, etc.; rekamita per oro gold-figured, -worked.
rekapitular (tr.) to recapitulate; sum up the principal points. Def.: Rezumar, kurte repetar o rimemorigar per enumero preciza e kompleta di omna punti, parti, o chapitri; III-206.
reklamar (tr., intr.) to advertise (loudly), to boom; (cf. avertar); reklam(ad)o advertisement, puffing up.

reklamacar (tr.) to (re-)claim, put in a claim for (compensation, a reward, what is due, one’s rights, etc.) (cf. postular); reklamaco claim, (jur.) complaint; reklamacanto claimant. Ex.: Reklamacar objekti pruntita o perdita. Reklamacar sumo debata, salario, honorario (cf. III-409).
rekolecar (rel.) to commune with one’s own heart, to turn one’s mind from earthly affairs and piously meditate; rekoleco self-communing, pious meditation; rekolecanta wrapped in pious meditation.
rekoliar (tr.) to gather in, in order to save from loss. Def.: Prenar o gardar ulo od ulu abandonita, perdita o falinta; VI-115. Ex.: Rekoliar fragmenti de la naufrajo. Rekoliar la perdita infanti.
rekoltar (tr., also fig.) to harvest, reap, get in (crops), gather in (the fruits of the earth); rekolt(ad)o harvesting, reaping; rekoltajo harvest, crop, vintage.
rekomendar (tr.) to recommend (ulu, ulo, ad ulu)(cf. konsilar, exhortar); rekomendo (act) recommendation; rekomendinda worthy of r.; rekomendoletro letter of r.
rekompensar (tr.) to recompense, reward, require, remunerate (ulu, per ulo).
rekordo record (in sports). Def.: Sportala prodajo, oficale konstatita, e qua ecelas super omna agi di sama genero entee facita.

rekortar (tr.) to cut, clip; curtail, (the outside, the edge, the end), to pare, crop, prune, lop (the nails, a garment, a coin) (cf. tondar); rekort(ad)o, rekorturo clipping, paring. Def.: Detranchar la bordo, la extremajo di ulo.
rekrutar (tr., milit. and fig.) to recruit, enlist (ulu, ad); rekrutar su to enlist; rekrutito a recruit; rekrutachar to entice (ulu) into enlisting, to crimp.

rekta (geom.) straight; not crooked or curved; upright, plumb, erect; rekte in a straight line;rekto a straight line; rekteso straightness, directness; uprightness; rektigar straighten, align, lay out in line; (milit.) to dress the ranks. Ex.: Stacar rekte. Irar segun rekto. Rekta kolumo. Rektigar la trupi. V. exp.: vid. direta, erektar. Ant.: kurva, tordita, sinuoza.
rektangulo rectangle; rektangula, rektangulatra rectangular.
rektifikar (tr., chem, and fig.) to rectify (spirits, errors, etc.). Def.: Purigar per distilado; igar exakta; korekt-igar.
rektoro rector: headmaster of an acedemy, of a university, of a Jesuit college; (cf. paroko).
rektumo* (anat.) rectum.

rekuperar to recover, regain, retrieve, get back the possession or use of, to recoup; rekupero recovery, regaining, recuperation; rekuperebla (also fin.) recoverable. Def. Ri-aquirar, ri-posedar ulo. ex.: Rekuperar kaloro, sua havaji, spensi, forteso, parol-povo, vid-povo, bon-san-eso. DeFIS
rekurenta* (anat., math.) recurrent (cf. riaparanta).

rekursar (intr.) to have recourse to (ad ulu, ulo), to appeal, to resort (ad); rekurso recourse; application for assistance or protection; resort (to a source of aid); rekurso ad indulgo petition for pardon; rekursar a la klementeso di la rejo to solicit the clemency of the sovereign; rekurso a kasaco petition or lodgement of appeal; lakrimi esis elua nura rekurso tears were her only recourse. Def.: Demandar la helpo, la sokurso. Ex.: On rekursas a helpo, a helpanto, a moyeno, a metodo, a procedo.

rekuzar (tr., jur. and fig.) to challenge (a witness, juror); to take exception to (testimony, statements); rekuzar su (of judges, jurors) to decline judging or voting, to beg to be excused; rekuzo challenge, exception, denial; rekuzebla exceptionable, challengeable, doubtful. V. exp.: Rekuzar esas teknikal termino di la yurocienco; on rekuzas judikanto o testo (t.e. on ne aceptas lu, ed on exkluzas lu), en ula kondicioni determinita da la legi, ex. kande la senpartiseso di la judikanto o testo esas suspektebla (pro lua relati kun la judikoti, pro lua personal interesti, e.c.). Judikanto povas rekuzar su ipsa spontane pro simila motivi, to esas, refuzas funcionar. Komprenebla, ca vorto povas uzesar kun metafora senco en la komuna vivo; III-222.
relo (railway-) rail; relvoyo railroad.

relatar (tr., intr.) to have reference to, stand in some relation to, to be related, to relate to; (of persons) to be connected (by business, etc.; N.B. not family; cf. parenta); relato relation (di ulo ad ulo, ulu kun ulu); relate relatively, comparatively (not absolutely); in reference to, with regard; relatanta, relativa pertaining, relating to; relative to; (jur.) appertaining to; relativeso relativity; relatigar to put (ulu, ulo) into relation or connection (ad, kun ulu, ulo); relatata correlative. Ex.: «A relatas B» signifikas ke existas «relato» inter A e B. On povas anke «relatigar» A ad (od, kun) B. V. exp.: Relato (matematikala senco): On povas dicar 2 relatas 3, quale 4 relatas 6, od on darfas parolar pri «relato» di 2 a 3. La nociono relato esas multe plu general ed ampla kam la nociono raporto. On bezonas sempre parolar pri relati inter diversa grandaji, e ca relati esas tante generala, ke ne omni povas expresesar per equacioni. La relato di a ad b povas esar irga funciono; la reporto di a ad b esas simple e nur la fraciono a/b; VI-296.
relayo (also elec., teleg.) relay, fresh supply of horses, etc.

relegar (tr., pr. and fig.) to relegate, send off, shut up, consign, seclude (ulu, ulo) in a fixed place; relego, relegeso regulation, banishment. Def.: Enternar en loko determinita. Ex.: Relegar recidivinto ad kolonio. Relegar ulu a chambro, portreto ad kelero, ulu ad ruro. V. exp.: vid. exilar.
relevar (tr.) to survey, map out, make a plan of; (nav.) take a bearing of (coasts, shores).
reliefo (paint., sculp., arts) relief, relievo, embossment; reliefa mapo map in r.; reliefo alta, basa high-, base r.; reliefizar to emboss (paper, etc.).
religio religion; religiala religious (war, etc.); religioza religious (person); religiozeso religiousness; religiano believer in a religion; faithful, true believer.
reliquio relic (of saints, etc.); (pl.) mortal remains, relics; reliquiuyo, reliquikesto reliquary.
remar, remadar (tr., intr.) to row, pull on an oar; remilo oar; rembatelo rowboat.

remarkar (tr.) to remark, to notice, observe; remarkigar to cause (ulu) to remark, to attract notice to; (fig.) to state, to say; remarko notice, observation; remarkinda worthy of note, remarkable, curious, notable; remarkar la beleso di ulo to notice the beauty of something; elua beleso remarkigis su da me her beauty attracted my attention; remarkar ulu en turbo to observe someone in a crowd; facar remarki pri pass remarks upon; me remarkigis, ke pluvas I remarked (pointed out) that it was raining. (cf. VII-206-7); remarkinda evento a remarkable event; verko plena de remarki a work full of comments. V. exp.: turnar o portar sua atenco sur ulo od ulu. M. XI-226.

remediar (tr.) to remedy (a disease, a sickness); (fig.) to redress, repair, set to rights; remediilo a remedy, cure, specific; remediebla remediable (disease); (fig.) remediar malajo to remedy an evil; remediilo plu mala kam la morbo a remedy worse than the disease; tempo remedias omno time is a cure for all things. Def.: Supresar, cesigar la maladeso; V-157. V.exp.:Remediiloesaskuracivo. Medikamento esas nur ulo donata por kuracar. Quankam morbo esas neremediebla, ni ankore aplikas medikamenti. On risanigas malado, e remedias maladeso.

reminicar* (tr.) to reproduce or imitate (consciously or not) from memory some literary or musical piece. V. exp.: Reminico ne esas simpla rimemoro: o esas rimemoro di ula literatural o muzikal peco, quan on imitas nevole o nekoncie: to esas esence imito o kopio di artala verko en altra, do tote altra kozo kam la simpla memoro, qua esas nur la kauzo od okaziono di la reminico. On povas havar rimemoro sen pro to facar reminico; V-627.

remisar (tr.) to remit (debts, sins, etc.); (med.) to abate (symptoms); remiso remission; diminution (of a disease); remisebla remissable: that may be remitted or forgiven, pardonable; remisanta febro remittent fever. Def.: (senco ordinara) Dispensar ulu de (parto di) debajo, puniso, peki, e.c.; (senco medikala) Ceso o diminuto (tempala) di la simptomi di maladeso; IV-605, VI-210.

remonstrar (intr.) to remonstrate. Def.: Expozar polite (mem a superioro) la nejusteso di la ago; V-25. Ex.: En l’anciena monarkio, la parlamenti havis la yuro facar remonstri al rejo . . . qua generale ne egardis oli.
remonto (milit.) remount(ing): purchase or supply of fresh horses; remonteyo, remonterio remounting depot.
remoro* (ich.) remora, sucker-fish (Echeneidis Remora).

remorkar (tr., nav. and gen.) to tow, take in tow, tug, haul, drag (a boat, a movable object; cf. tuvar); remorko towing; remorkokablo tow-rope; remorkobatelo, remorknavo towing-vessel, tow-boat, tug; remorkveturo (hand) street-cart (as for selling fruit, etc.).
remorsar (intr.) to feel remorse (pri).
remparo rampart, bulwark; (fig.) any means of defence.

remplasar (tr., intr.) to replace: take the place of, be in the place of (ulu, ulo); remplasigar to replace (ulu da ulu, ulo per ulo); remplaso, remplasigo replacing, replacement; remplasanto substitute: one who replaces another; remplas(ig)ebla replaceable. Ex.: Il remplasis me dum mea absenteso. On remplasigas la patro da la filio. Remplasigar la anciena moblaro per nova. V. exp.: vid. substitucar, suplantar.
remulado (cook.) remo(u)lade, a French salad dressing somewhat resembling mayonnaise.
reno (anat.) kidney; renala renal.
rendevuo rendezvous: a meeting appointed, appointment; fixigar rendevuo to make an appointment (kun ulu); il arivis unesme ye la rendevuo he arrived first at the rendezvous.
rendimento* (tech.) output, efficiency (of machines). Def.: Elekto utila (di mashini).

renegar (tr.) to deny (untruly), to disown, disavow; renego denying, denial; reneganto (rel. and gen.) renegade: apostate from the faith; backslider. Ex.: St. Petro trifoye renegis Jesu. Renegar sua familio, sua religio.Def.: Deklarar nevere ke on ne konocas ulu, ulo; abjurar (ne-vere); des-agnoskar (ne-vere). V. exp.: vid. renuncar.
renesanco (epoch, style, etc.) renaissance.
renetpomo rennet-apple: a kind of pippin.
renkontrar (tr.) to meet: meet with accidentally when in motion, to fall in with, encounter (ulu, ulo); renkontro meeting, encounter.

rento (yearly) income, rent, annuity; rentizar to allow a yearly income to (ulu), to endow (public institutions); rentifar to bring in revenue, yield an income; rentifanta income producing; rentiero fundholder, stockholder, annuitant, person of independent means; sulo rento ground rent; monatala, yarala rento monthly, yearly rent; rento dumviva life annuity; lasar rento (od, interesti) akumulesar to allow arrears to accumulate (rent, interest, dividends). Def.: Revenuo (yarala), ordinare personala, derivita de sulhavaji, domi lugata, o de kapitalo statala o privata.
rentiro reindeer (Cervus tarandus).

renuncar (tr.) to renounce, give up, relinquish, resign (a position, office). Def.: Cesar dezirar o demandar ulo. Ex.: Me renuncas voyajo, quan me intencas facar; on renuncas yuro, quan on posedas; e.c. Rejido renuncas la trono o la krono, kande, nultempe regninte, il refuzas regnor; IV-100. V exp.: Ni renuncas yuro, precepti o kustumi; ni renegas mastro o nia religio; ni abjuras eroro, od imaginita eroro. Philip V renuncis la krono di Francia; St. Petro renegis sua mastro; Henry IV abjuris la Kalvanismo.

renversar (tr., intr.) to overthrow, throw down, upset (cf. subversar, inversigar); renverse backward; renversebla that may be overthrown. Def.: Faligar ulo, ulu ad tero. Ex.: Renversar muro, tablo, inkuyo, veturo, persono, (fig.) esperi. La muro renversis.
reostato* (elec.) rheostat.

reparar (tr.) to repair, restore, mend a road, a house, a machine, a picture; to refit (a ship); (cf. rapecar); repar(ad)o, reparurirepairing, mending, repairs; repardoko graving-dock, dock for repairs; reparpeci spare parts (for repairs); reparetar to slightly repair; reparachar to botch repairs (cf. fushar).

repartisar (tr.) to divide into due proportion, portion out, distribute (ulo inter uli); repartis(ad)o apportionment, repartition; repartisanto, repartisero, repartisisto distributer. Def.: Dividar segun proporciono oportuna o yusta; VI-79. V. exp.: Se publika prunto esas suskriptita dekople, on repartisas ol inter la suskriptinti en la proporciono di 1/10, t.e. on atribuas a singlu 1/10 de la sumo, quan lu suskriptas. Simile on repartisas kargajo inter plura porteri o porto-bestii, inter la axi di veturo o vagono, e.c.; VI-79; kp. disdonar, distributar.

repastar (intr.) to take one’s meal, have a meal (che, kun); repasto meal, repast; (ship’s) mess; repastetar to lunch; repasteto luncheon, light repast. Def.: Manjar ye fixa horo, apud tablo (generale kune); II-74. Ex.: Li repastis che me. La repast-horo. Il manjas quar repasti omnadie.
repentar (tr., intr.) to repent, rue, feel contrition; sen repenta impenitent. Def.: Havar reala regreto. Ex.: Il repentas sua kulpi. Me igos il repentar to.

reperar (tr.) to put a guiding mark on; reperilo, reperpunto guidemark (as made on a piece of machinery so as to assemble easily and accurately; mark on a wall, a measuring-rod, on the ground, in order to indicate alignment, a level, a height, etc.

reperkutar (tr.) to repercuss: to drive or beat back; (of sound) to reverberate; reperkutado di l’ondi surf; reperkuto repercussion, reverberation, rebound (cf. risalto). Def.: Reperkuto: l’ago di korpo shokata, qua shokas sua-vice altra; IV-138. Ex.: Reperkuto di (pafita) kanono.
repertorio a table, index, register by which things can be readily located; (theat.) repertoire; stock-pieces, -plays; alfabetala, repertorio alphabetical index.

repetar (tr.) to repeat: reiterate, tell or say again (what has been told before or what another has said); repetachar to repeat tediously. V. exp.: On repetas nur paroli; on iteras omna-speca ago; II-80.

repleta (of living beings) chubby, plump, stout, firm-fleshed, replete (from food); repleteso plumpness; repleteskar to become plump, chubby; (cf. korpulenta, obeza, grasa, plena, ronda). Def.: Qua havas formi ronda e karno ferma, do la pelo kelke tensita. (Lu povas tote ne esar korpulenta, ex. infanto. La repleteso esas signo di saneso); VI-601.

replikar (tr., intr.) to rejoin, retort: to answer to a reply; repliko answer, reply: (jur.) replication: the reply of the plaintiff to the defendant’s plea; rejoinder: the defendant’s answer to the plaintiff’s replication; repliko: (quika, rapida) repartee, retort. V. exp.: Replikar ne esas simple respondar, ma respondar a respondo. En la teknikal terminaro di la diskutado, on nomizas dupliko, tripliko . . . la duesma, triesma repliko; II-520.

reportar (intr., stock exchange) to allow a contango; reporto contango, premium or interest paid by a buyer to a seller to be allowed to defer payment until a future settlement; cf. VI-603, VII-354. Ant.: diporto.

repozar (intr.) to rest (repose); (cf. dormar, jacar, apogar, haltar); repozigar to (cause to) rest; repozo rest, respite, reposing; (cf. intervalo); repozodio day of rest; repozanta resting; repozeyo resting place; repozaltaro (fig.) temporary altar (in the street). Ex.: Lua korpo repozas sub la stono. Il ne dormas, il ne nur repozas. Il repozigas sua kapo sur kuseno. Havar repozo di koncienco.

represar (tr.) to repress, check, restrain, put down, suppress (a revolt, abuses, pride, one’s desires, etc.); represo repression, coercion; represiva repressive. Def.: Haltigar l’efekto, la progreso di ulo.

reprezelar (intr.) to retaliate, to make reprisals (kontre); (fig.) to give tit for tat; reprezelo reprisal, retaliation; reprezelletri letter of marque and reprisal. V. exp.: Reprezalar esas plu proxima a venjo kam a revancho. To konsistas (precipue en milito) facar a l’enemiko exakte la sama domajo, quan on subisis de lu. To facesas partikulare pri la agi nekorekta e kruela, qui ecesas la «yuri di la milito», exemplo masakro di nekombatanti, incendio di domi e vilaji, destrukto di monumenti, e.c. Reprezalo nule implikas revancho, nam ol facesas ofte de la vinkiti, precipue kande li vinkesas per nekorekta procedi; VI-143; kp. revanchar, venjar.

reprezentar (tr.) to represent, exhibit by resemblance or action; depict; be the representative of; reprezento (aslo theat., polit.) representation, exhibition; reprezentanta, reprezentiva, reprezentala; reprezentanto, reprezentero representative. Ex.: La ceno reprezentas palaco. Ambasadisto reprezentas sua stato. Reprezento di kombato. Il esas reprezentanto di la populo. Guvernado reprezentiva.

reprimandar (tr.) to reprimand, admonish, rebuke, reprove, chide, lecture (ulu pri, pro ulo) (cf. exhortar); reprimandinda reprehensible, reprovable (cf. blaminda); reprimandachar, reprimandar harde to scold, nag. V. exp.: Reprimandar e reprochar esas «speci» di la generala ideo blamar. Ma reprocho vizas kozo od ago; reprimando vizas persono: On reprochas ulo ad ulu; on reprimandas ulu pri ulo. La nuanco ne esas gravas, ma ol esas reala ed utila psikologiale; IV-237.

reprochar (tr.) to reproach, upbraid, taunt, twit (ulo, ad ulu); reprochar ad ulu lua vicii to upbraid a person for his vices (N.B. not: -ar ulu pri lua vicii, as in E.; cf. V. exp.: under reprimandar); mea koncienco reprochas nulo a me my conscience is quite clear; il reprochis ad il lua negratitudo he reproached him with his ingratitiude; il reprochis ad il abandonir lua amiko he reproached him for having left his friend. Def.: Dicar ad ulu ulo qua devas shamigar lu. V. exp.: vid. reprimandar.
repso (fabric) rep. Def.: Stofo ek silko o lano tre forta; III-143.
reptar (intr.) to crawl (as a serpent), to creep (as a child); (fig.) to crawl before one (in an abject manner); reptanta crawling, creeping, reptant; reptero reptile.
republiko republic; republikala republican (government, etc.); republikismo republicanism; republikisto believer in, partisan of a republic.

repudiar (tr.) to repudiate; to put away (one’s wife). Ex.: Philippe Auguste repudiis sua spozino Ingleburge. V. exp.: Propre, repudiar esas forsendar spozino, «desspozinigar» el segun legal formi. Figure, renegar opiniono, kredo. La repudio diferas de la divorco per ke ol ne bezonas ago di judiciisto o di extera autoritato; III-206.

repugnar (tr.) to have or inspire a repugnance to, to hava an aversion to, to disgust (cf. antipatiar, nauzeigar); repugnexo disgust, repugnance, dislike; repugnegeso loathing; repugnanta, repugniva repugnant, repulsive, disgusting. Ex.: Repugnar facar ulo. Ulo repugnis il. Il repugnesis da ulu, da ulo. Repugneso kontre ulu, ulo; To esas repugnanta a mea raciono.

repulsar (tr.) to repel, repulse, rebuff, beat back (cf. retropulsar); repulsanta, repulsiva (phys. and fig.) repellent, repulsive. Ex.: Repulsar l’asalto di enemiko. Repulsar tenteso, ula propozajo. La repulso di elektroza korpi. Repuls-anta, -iva korpo, vizajo.

reputar (tr.) to repute, deem; reputesar to be held (to be so and so); reputo, reputeso reputation, character, repute (good or bad). Ex.: Reputar ulu kom richa, kom saja. Reputesar kapabla. Havar bona reputeso. Esar reputata kom bona.
«requiem» requiem.
requizitar (tr.) to requisition, make demand in the name of the public or of the law for (persons, animals, thigs, services); requizit(ad)o requisition(ing); requizitajo something requisitioned.
resekar* (tr., surg.) to resect, cut off.
recipicenco* (rel.) resipiscence, change of mind; repentence.
reskripto (all senses) rescript.

resonar* (intr., lit. and fig.) to resound: send back sound, (re-)echo; reson(ad)o resounding, resonance; resonanta resonant; resonigar to cause to resound; resonilo resonator. Ex.: Ica audeyo resonas perfekte. Voco klara e resonanta. (fig.) Omna loko resonis pro lua prodajo.
resorbar (tr.) to resorb, reabsorb (a tumor, etc.).

resorto (instr. elastic) spring; (fig.) activity. Energy; resorto granda main s.; resorto laxigita relaxed s.; resortmatraco s. mattress; (cf. elastika). Ex.: Resorto di horlojo, di veturo. (fig.) Donar resorto a la spirito.

resortisar (intr. jur.) to be under the jurisdiction (of), belong to the department, to be the province (of), be under the cognizance; resortiso (legal) jurisdiction, resort; (general) province, department, competence, power; resortisanta amenable (to), dependant (on); ica afero resortisas ad al korto di Paris this affair is cognizable in the court of Paris; to ne esas mea resortisothat is not within my province.

respektar (tr.) to respect: regard with a degree of reverence or esteem; respektaro respect; respektaroza, respektarema respectful, deferential; respektarinda respectable; respektarindeso respectability, dignity; respektarata respected; respektaremacha obsequious; respektarosigno sign of respect; respektarego profound respect; respektaregala, respektaroza reverential; des respektaro irreverence, disrespect; sen respektara disrespectful. Ex.: On devas respektar la oldi, la legi.

respirar (tr., intr.) to respire, breathe (cf. aspirar, expirar); respir(ad)o respiration, breathing; respirajo what is respired: air, breath; respirala respiratory; respirebla breathable. Def.: Aspirar l’aero por regenerar la sango e lore expirar ol.

respondar (tr., intr.) to answer, reply, respond (ulo ad ulu); respondizar to respond to (ulo); respondar en la meso to make the responses in the mass; respondanto (co-)respondent, answerer; (cf. replikar); respondar kurajiganta paroli to answer encouraging words; respondizar kurajiganta paroli, respondar a kurajiganta paroli to answer encouraging words, i.e. to give an answer to encouraging words. Def.: Parolar o skribar en repliko a questiono, argumento od adreso. Ex.: Quon vu respondis? Me respondis nur du vorti. Il respondis tale a mea objeciono, ma me ne replikis ad il. Respondar ulo a persono, a remarko, a letro. Respondez quik. Me expektas vua balda respondo. Respondante a vua letro, me informas vu… V. exp.: Esas regulo en Ido, ke verbo ne povas havar (mem alterne) du rekta komplementi (ex. on ne povas «instrukar infanti» ed «instruktar geometrio»). Or la verbo respondar havas necese kom direta komplimento la paroli, per qui on respondas, do ol ne povas havar kom direta komplemento la paroli, a qui on respondas. Do on devos sempre dicar: «respondar a la letro di ulu», o, «respondizar letro», t.e. donar respondo ad ol, «honorizar» ol per respondo (quale dicas la komercisti); III-30; VI-297; Talmey’s Text Book, p. 109.

responsar (intr.) to be responsible, be answerable, be accountable (pri ulu, ulo); responso (a particular) responsibility; liability, responsanta, responsiva responsible, accountable; responsiveso (general state of being responsible) responsibility; responsanto one who is responsible; a bondsman; asumar responso assume responsibility (pri, di ulo); me ne responsas (od, esas responsanta) pri la kulpi di altri I am not responsible for the faults of others.
responsorio (R.C. lit.) responsory.

restar (intr.) to remain: to be left, to be left remaining; to stay, sojourn, tarry (N.B. not lie at rest, repose; cf. repozar); resto rest, remaining; restajo that which remains: rest, remainder (of a quantity or sum); leavings, vestige, scraps (cf. reziduo); restanta remaining; resteyo place of sojourn. Ex.: Nulo restis de nia pekunio. Triadek hoteli restas. Il restis en Roma pos nia departo. Multi restis sur la kombat-agro. Me haltis en la urbo e restis ibe dum du monati. Me brulos to quo restas (od, la rest-ajo). V.exp.: Restar: esar dum kelka tempo en la sama loko o stando, ma ne definitive, t.e. mine kam habitar, ma pluse kam haltar; III-103.
restaurar (tr.) to restore. Ex.: Restaurar domo, pikturo, dinastio, arto, lego.
restitucar (tr.) to make restitution of, refund (ulo). V.exp.: Ne simple ridonar, ma ridonar to quon on prenis o gardis sen yuro, a la legitima proprietero; IV-81.
restorar (su) to take refreshments, food; eyo, erio restaurant, eating-house; isto dining-room keeper; acheyo cheap eating-house.

restriktar (tr.) to restrict, restrain; restriktar su to limit, confine oneself (ad); restrikto, restrikturo restriction, restraint; restriktanta, restriktiva limiting, restraining, restrictive. Ex.: Restriktar la signifiko di vorto. Restriktar sua pasioni. Restriktar su a kozi tote necesa. Li submisis su senrestrikte a la konvenciono (t.e. sen kondicioni expresita o tacita).

reto net, mesh: object formed by threads or lines interlaced, network; (anat.) plexus (of nerves etc.); (geom.) chain (of triangles); (arch.) tracery (of windows); retala, retatra reticular; haro reto hair-net.
retablo (arch.) reredos, altar screen.

retenar (tr.) to retain, keep, withhold, keep back, detain (cf. ditenar); (arith.) to carry; retenar su to restrain, check oneself (per, de); reten(ad)o retaining, retention; retenajo anything retained; reteneso (state of ) retention; reteniva, retenema retentive. Ex.: Me deziras retenar la pekunio quan me pruntis. On ne povas retenar amo per koakto. Retenar sua lakrimi. Retenar lojio en teatro. Retenar memore ulo, od, retenar en memoro ulo. Retenar ulu en karcero. (arith.) Pozar sep e retenar du. Reteniva memoro.
retiario (Rom. antiq.) retiarius, net-fighter.
retikulo* reticle (of a telescope).
retino (anat.) retina (of the eye).
retoro (antiq.) rhetor, rhetorician, (orator); retoracho one who speaks elegantly but uselessly, word-spinner.
retoriko rhetoric; retorikisto rhetorician, one skilled in rhetoric.
retorto (chem.) retort.
retraktar (tr., lit. and fig.) to retract, withdraw, draw back; retraktamendo forfeit. Ex.: La limako retraktas sua korni. Retraktar sua promiso, sua erori.

retretar (intr., milit., rel., and gen.) to retire, retreat, seclude, draw off, draw back (from active work, duty, the world); retreto retreat, retiring, retirement; (milit.) tattoo, taps; retretopensiono retirement pension; retreteyo religiala religious retreat (place); sonigar la retreto to sound the retreat, tattoo, taps; (hunt.) to call off the hounds; retretoficiro retired or «half-pay» officer. V. exp.: vid. abandonar.
retro (adv.) backwards.
retroagar (intr.) to retroact; retroago retroaction; retroagiva retroactive.
retrocedar (tr.) to give, cede back again, return, restore.
retroduktar (tr.) to lead back.
retrofluar (intr.) to flow back, ebb.
retroirar, retromarchar (intr.) to go back, to retrograde, fall back (as of troops), retreat, to back (of carriages); (cf. retretar, regresar); retroirigar, retroiro retrogression.
retrojetar (tr.) to throw back, reject.
retrospektar (intr.) to look back; retroanta, retroiva retrospective.
retrotirar (tr.) to draw back; retroebla, retroiva retractile.
retushar (tr.) to retouch, touch up (a picture, etc.).
reumatismo (med.) rheumatism; reumatismala rheumatic: relating to r.: reumatismika, reumatismiko rheumatic (person).

revar (intr.) to day-dream, muse: to see or fancy as if in a dream; (cf. sonjar); rev(ad)o reverie, musing; revajo a fancy; revacho vain fancy, conceit; revema, revachema dreamy. Ex.: Il revis pri la povreso e grandeso di Roma. Me klozas mea okuli e revas pri feliceso. Ulfoye me vere meditas, ulfoye nur revas. La projeto esas nur revo (od, revacho).

revanchar (intr., in good or bad sense) to retaliate, give like for like, get even, requite (su, pri ulu, kontre ulu); to avenge, revenge, take one’s revenge (in return for an injury); (cf. venjar, reprezalar); revancho retaliation, revenge, avenging. Def.: Retrodonar similajo a similajo, sive bona o mala, ma ofte en mala senco. V. exp.: Revanchar dicesas pri ulu, qua esas vinkata (en milito, konkurso o ludo) e qua inverse vinkas sua vinkinto. Revancho nule implikas ideo di venjo nek sentimento di rankoro, ma admaxime satisfaco propramo. En ludo, jentila ludero, qua vinkis, (ganis), ofras a sua partenero la revancho, o plu exakte la posibleso revanchar; nam ica povas vinkesar en la du foyi; VI-143.

revelar (tr., also theol.) to reveal; (photog.) to develop; revel(ad)o, reveluro revelation; revelajo that which is revealed; revelanto, revelero revealer; revelilo (photog.) developing bath. Def.: Konocigar ulo da ulu, quo esis olim nekonocata, sekreta o celita. Ex.: Revelar la statala sekretaji. Revelar lua komplico. La latenta imajo esas revelata sur la klishuro. La revelado di Santa Ioannes.

revendikar (tr., jur. and fig.) to claim (as one’s own), to demand back (ulo); revendikajo object claimed; (cf. reklamacar). Def.: Reklamacar ulo quo apartenas a me, e qua esas en la povo di altru. Ex.: Revendikar sua yuri, ulo perdita, domeno.
revenuo revenue; income.
reverberar (tr., intr.) to send back, radiate (heat); reverberforno reverberatory furnace. Def.: Absorbar la kaloro e retrosendar ol radiifante; V-67.
reverencear (intr.) to make a bow, on obeisance; (of women) to courtsey (ad ulu, ulo); reverenceo profunda deep bow. Ex.: Kande il pasis, me reverencis ad il. Reverencar a l’altaro.

reverso the reverse: back side of anything; reverse inside out, wrong side to; metar sua kalzi reverse, e pose metar oli averse to put on one’s stocking wrong side outwards and afterwards put them on right side to. Def.: Dorsa latero di stofo, moneto, medalio. Specale, la parto aparanta di la reverso di frako, di redingoto, di boto, e.c.; Ant.: averso, facio.
reversionar (intr., jur.) to revert (ad); reversiono reversion (of an estate); reversionebleso revertibility.
revizar (tr.) to revise (a book, a judgement, the constitution, etc.); Def.: Emendar; ri-examinar por modifikar.
revokar (tr.) to revoke, repeal (an edict, privileges, a law); to recall (an ambassador); to dismiss (a clerk, officer, official).

revoltar (intr.) to rise in revolt, to rebel (kontre ulu, ulo); revolto (pr. and fig.) revolt, insurrection; revoltanto, revoltinto revolter (cf. rebelo, revolucionero); revoltigar to cause to revolt or rebel; (fig.) to stir up, rouse. Ex.: La populo revoltis kontre sua suvereno. (fig.) La raciono revoltas kontre tala absurdeso.

revolucionar (tr.) to revolutionize, to change thoroughly (opinions, an art, a country; (cf. perturbar, subversar); revoluciono (political, social, scientific) revolution (cf. revolto, rotaco); revolucionala, revolucionema, revolucionana revolutionary; revolucionerorevolutionist; revolucionano member of a r. party.
revolvero revolver: pistol with revolving chamber.
revuar* (tr.) to review, inspect, carefully examine (troops, books, one’s life, etc.); revuo review, inspection (of troops); review (magazine, book); (fig.) survey, examination.

revulsar* (tr., med.) to allay a morbid condition by counter-irritation or the like; revulso revulsion. Def.: Lokale iritar por cesigar konjestioneso od inflameso existanta en altra parto di la korpo.

reza, reze even, level (with); close to (a line, the surface); (of hair, etc.) shorn; (of a destroyed city, etc.) razed; rezapila; rezahara short-haired; reza barbo a close shaven beard; reze dil bordoup to the brim, even with or close to the border; reze dil sulo close to or on a level with the soil; (fig.) reza tabulo a smoothed tablet, tablet without inscription, tabula rasa; facar tabula reza (fig.) to sweep away, reject all previous notions; rezigar to cut (ulo) close to or even with a surface; to raze, level (ulo) to the ground; (nav.) to razee: cut down; to hug, keep close to (a coast); rezigar hari to cut the hair close; rezigar domo to raze a house; rezigar navo to cut down a ship; kuglo rezigis lua vizajo a shot passed close to his face (cf. frolar); la navo rezigis la litoro the ship hugged the coast.
rezedo (bot.) reseda: mignonette (Reseda odorata); dyer’s weed (Reseda luteola); rezedala resedaceous.

rezervar (tr.) to reserve, save, set apart, lay by or up; rezervema (mental, moral) reserved; rezervemeso (quality) reserve; rezervajo something reserved; stock, store; rezervano (milit.) reservist. Ex.: Rezervar kelka pekunio por bezoni futura o neprevidebla. Rezervar ula yuro. Rezervo-armeo. Facar mentala rezervo. Mieno rezervema.

rezidar (intr.) to reside, dwell, live, abide (cf. habitar, lojar); rezid(ad)o (act) residence, residing; rezideyo residence: place of abode; rezidanto resident. Ex.: Il rezidas en Paris che me. Establisar rezido en ula loko. Ta domo esas lua rezideyo.
rezidento* resident: diplomatic agent; rezidenteyo residency; rezidenteso dignity, function of a resident.

reziduo that which remains: (chem.) residium; settlement (of liquids); (geol.) debris, detritus; (com.) residue, arrear: that which remains (due); (arith.) remainder; (cf. restajo); reziduachi scraps, odds and ends.

rezignar (tr., intr.) to resign (ulo): to be resigned, feel resignation (pri); rezignanta, rezignema resigned. Ex.: Rezignar sua anmo a Deo. Me esas rezignanta (od, rezignas) pri la perdo di mea yuri. Subisar exilo kun rezignemeso. V. exp.: Rezignar esas aceptar volunte desfeliceso, domajo, perdo, quan on «subisis» e generale ne povis evitar. La rezigno esas pasiva, dum ke l’abnego esas spontana. On rezignas pri la morto di ulu kara, pri la perdo di sua havajo, pri maladeso neremediebla; IV-101; kp. II-135, abnego, renuncar.
rezino resin, rozen; rezinala, rezinoza, rezinatra resinous.

rezistar (tr.) to resist, withstand the shock of something; to defend (oneself), strive against (ulu, ulo); to hold against, oppose; not to succumb to (fatigue, etc.); rezist(ad)o resistance, opposition; rezistanta, rezistema, rezistiva resistant; rezistivo (mechan., phys.) resistance; rezistemeso (tendency) hindrance, opposition; rezistiveso resistivity, resisting power. Ex. La kolda fero rezistas la martelagado. Rezistar shoko, impreso. Rezisto al enemiko. Rezisto a tenteso. Mahagono esas rezistanta ligno. Ant.: cedar, sukombar.

rezolvar (tr.) to resolve: take or come to a decision (to do something); rezolvo, rezolvuro resolution, decision; rezolvema resolute; rezolvemeso (of character) resoluteness, determination; rezolvoze resolutely, stoutly. Ex.: Rezolvar parolar ad ulu. Rezolvar facar ulo. Ne facez rezolvi dum la unesma ataki di vua iraco. Homo rezolvema. V. exp.: vid. decidar.

rezonar, rezonadar (intr.) to reason (pri); rezonar (tr.) to appply one’s reason to (ulo), to study (ulo); rezon(ad)o reasoning, ratiocination (cf. raciono); rezonanta reasoning; rezonanto, rezonero reasoner, logician; mis rezonar to reason wrongly; (fig.) talk nonsense, rave, wander in mind.

rezultar (intr.) to result (from certain premises, conditions); to follow (from); be the consequence (of); rezulto result, effect, consequence; rezultajo (objective) result; rezultanto (mechan.) resultant (force). Ex.: La deskonkordo rezultis en civitanala milito. La rezulto esas nekalkulebla. Ica (objekto) esas la rezultajo.

rezumar (tr.) to recapitulate, sum up, to summarize; rezumo recapitulation, summary, resume; rezume to sum up, upon the whole, in substance; rezuma summary, compendious. Ex.: La peroraciono rezumas la tota diskurso. Rezumo di la historio di Francia.
ri Note: many common verbal roots compounded with ri (again, anew) are omitted.
riabonar to resubscribe (jurnalo); riigar to renew the subscription of (ulu).
riacendar (tr.) to relight, rekindle.
riaceso, riatako (med.) relapse; (cf. recidivo).
riagrafagar (tr.) to reclasp, hook (ulo) again.
riajustigar to readjust.
rianimar (tr.) to revive, reanimate.
riaparar (intr.) to reappear; rianta recurrent.
riapertar (tr., lit. and fig.) to re-open, open again (a door, wound, theater (theatre), etc.).
riaranjar to rearrange.
riarmizar to rearm.
riasemblar, riigar to reassemble.
ribo (bot.) currant; ribiero currant bush (Ribes rubrum).
ributonagar (tr.) to rebutton.

richa (lit. and fig.) rich (esp. in money, land, goods); richega very rich, opulent; rich(ulo) a rich person; richeso (condition) wealthy, richness; richeteso in comfortable circumstances; richajo wealth (considered objectively); richigar to enrich (ulu); richeskar to become, grow rich. Ant.: povra.
ricino (bot.) castor-oil plant (Ricinus communis); ricinoleo castor oil.
«rictus» (wide) grin, grinning. Def.: Kontrakto muskulala qua deskovras la denti e donas a la boko ridanta aspekto.

ridar (intr.) to laugh (ye); ridetar to smile; rideto smile, short l.; ridegar to l. much; rideskar to burst out laughing, commence to l.; ridar kontrevole to l. against one’s will; ridinda laughable, comical, ridiculous; ridind(ul)o ridiculous person; ridindajo a ridiculous thing; ridema, ridiva tendency to l., giggly, risible; ridindeso ridiculousness; ridindigar to ridicule, make (ulu) ridiculous; ridachar to snigger, giggle; ridachetar to titter.
ridebizar to put (su, ulu) in debt again; rieskar to run again into debt.
ridelo side pole, rack or board placed on a cart to help hold the load; cart-rack.
ridonar (tr.) to give back; rio restitution.
rielektar (tr.) to re-elect; riebla re-eligible.
rienirar (tr., intr.) to re-enter.
rienkorpigar to reincorporate.
riestablisar (tr.) to re-establish, reinstate (su, ulu, ulo, en, sur).
riexportacar (tr.) to re-export.
rifo reef; ledge of rocks standing above the level of the water. V. exp. vid. brizanto.
rifacar (tr.) to do (ulo) over again, remake.
rifaldar (tr.) to turn in or up, take in, make a pleat, tuck; riuro pleat, tuck.
rifortigar (tr.) rieskar (intr.) to (re-)strengthen.
rifreshigar to freshen; rieskar to become refreshed.
rigo, rigaro (nav.) rigging, tackle; rigizar to rig (a ship).
riganar (tr.) to regain, recover (sin.: riaquirar, riobtenar, rihavar).

rigida (lit. and fig.) rigid, stiff, not easily bent, not pliant; (of persons) inflexible, unyielding; rigideso stiffness, rigidity; (fig.) severity; rigidigar to stiffen, render inflexible. Ex.: Fera stango esas rigida. Stacar rigida. Koldeso rigidas la fingri. Il esas rigida homo. Ant.: laxa, flexebla, mola.
riglo bolt; riglagar; rigle klozar (tr.) to bolt.

rigoro rigor; extreme exactness or strictness; rigoroza rigorous, strict; strict (cf. severa); rigoristo rigorist, a person rigid or exact to excess; rigorismo rigorism, strictness, austerity; rigoroza, segun rigoro rigorously, with rigour. Ex.: La rigoro di la legi, di la reguli. Rigoroza judiciisto. Rigoroza demonstro.
riimprimar (tr.) to reprint; riuro a reprint
rijuntar, riunionar (tr.) to join again, reunite.
rikaptar (tr.) to recapture, retake, get hold of again.
rikochar (intr.) to ricochet, rebound.
rikolokar (tr., fin.) to reinvest.
ri, retrokomprar to buy again, buy back; rio repurchase; riebla repurchaseable, redeemable.
rikonciliar (tr.) to reconcile (again), to conciliate (anew), make friends again.
rikonocar to recognize, know again, indentify; riebla recognizable. Ex.: Rikonocar ulu per lua traiti, lua voco.
rikonstitucar (tr.) to reconstitute, reorganize.
rikonstruktar (tr.) to reconstruct, build anew.
rikopiar (tr.) to recopy.
rikustumigar to reaccustom (ulu); rieskar to reaccustom, get used to again.
rilernar (tr.) to learn (ulo) anew.
rimariajar (tr.) to marry again; rio a second marriage. Ex.: Nepoleon rimariajas su kun Marie-Louise.
rimborsar (tr.) to reimburse, repay, refund (in money). Ex.: Pagez por me, me rimborsos a vu.
rimemorar (tr.) to remember again, to recollect; rio recollection, reminiscence; riigar to remind (ulo da ulu).
rimeno (leather) strap, belt; sen fina rimeno endless belt; sub ventra rimeno belly-band (as for horses); tir rimeno trace (of a harness); ligo rimeno tether, thong.
rinaskar (intr.) to be born again; (fig.) to spring up again, to reappear; rio new birth, revival; riigar to regenerate.
rinforcar (tr., milit.) to reinforce (a garrison, etc.); rinforco, rinforcuro reinforcement.

ringo ring, circlet of metal or other substance; (tech.) ferrule, bushing; har ringo ringlet (cf. loklo); (astron.) ring; ringa, ringatra, ringforma ring (-shaped), annular; ringoza having rings; (nat. hist.) annulated; ringego large ring, hoop; ringizar to place a ring on (ulu, ulo), to hoop, ferrule, bush; katen ringo link; ringfingro the third finger.
rinocero (zool.) rhinoceros (family: Rhinocerotidæ).
rinovigar to renew, make new again, renovate.
rinoplastiko* rhinoplasty, plastic surgery on the nose.
rinsar (tr.) to rinse (a glass, clothes, etc.); rinsaquo rinse-water.
riokupar (tr.) to reoccupy.
riorganizar to reorganize.

ripar (tr., mechan., automobiles and other vehicles) to skid: slide sideways (cf. slipo). V. exp.: Ripar esas glitar skrapante, o kun forta friciono, qua impedas e fine haltas la funciono di mashino (teknikal vorto): II-648.
ripasar (tr., intr.) to repass, pass by again.
ripavizar to repave.
ripopulizar to repopulate, repeople.
ri, retroportar (tr.) to bring again, to bring back.
riproduktar (tr., gen. sense) to reproduce.
risaltar (intr.) to rebound, spring back.

risanigar to cure, make well, heal, (ulu); rieskar to get well; riigebla curable (of persons; cf. remediebla); riigiva curative. V. exp.: On risanigas malado. On remedias maladeso. On povas kuracar ulu sen ri-san-igar lu.
risidar (intr.) to take one’s seat again; reseat; riigar to reseat (ulu).

riskar (tr.) to risk, hazard, venture (cf. aventurar, pariar); risko risk, hazard; riskajo something risked, a venture, stake; riskoza risky, hazardous; riskema venturesome, adventurous, bold (person); riskar pekunio to risk money; riskar su to risk, expose oneself to danger. V.exp.: Ta qua riskas sua pekunio en hazardal ludo tote ne audacoza il esas simple … dessajo; II-137.
rismo ream (of paper: Eng.: 480 sheets; foreign: 500 sheets).
risolar (intr.); risoligar (tr.) (cook.) to brown, to fry or roast brown.
risonigar to resound: sound again (cf. resonar).
rispektiva respective: belonging to each; rispektive respectively. Ex.: La rispektiva yuri di du kunheredanti. Li iris a sua rispektiva hemi. Konsiderar rispektive la avantaji e des-avantaji di ulo.
ristornar (tr., com.) to cancel (an insurance policy, esp. maritime); ristorno cancelling; partial refund (of an insurance).
risuolizar to resole, (shoes, stockings).
risurpozar (tr.) to reaffix, put on again.
risutar (tr.) to resew.
ritmo rhythm (cf. kadenco); ritmala, ritmoza rhythmical.
ritornelo (mus.) ritornello. Def.: Ario quaze preliminara qua anuncas ulo; IV-14.
ritrairar (tr.) to recross, traverse again.
rituo rite; rituala ritual: relating to rites; rituaro, ritulibro (collect.) rites, ritual (-book); ritualisto ritualist.
riunionar (tr.) to reunite.
rivo shore, beach, strand; bank (of a river); (fig.) skirt (of a wood); rivnavigar to coast; rivana, rivo, habitanto river- or coast-side (resident). V. exp.: vid. plajo.
rivala, rivalo, rivalulo, rivalino rival; rivaleso rivalry; rivalesar to be a rival; to vie (kun) (cf. konkursar, konkurencar).
ri, retrovenar (intr.) to return, come back.
rivendar (tr.) to resell, sell again.
rivero river, stream; rivereto brook, streamlet, rivulet.
riverdeskar to become green again.
rivestizar to dress again, clothe anew.
riveto rivet; rivetagar, rivetizar to rivet (ulo).
rividar (tr.) to see again; (fig.) to meet (ulu) again; til rio until we meet again.

rivivigar (lit. and fig.) to revive, reanimate, resuscitate, bring (ulu) to life again (cf. rinaskar, rifreshigar, rinovigar); rieskar to become revived, rise from the dead; riigo, riesko revivication.
ri, retrovokar (tr.) to call again, call back, recall.
riyunigar to make (look) young, rejuvenate; rieskar to grow young again, become restored to youth; riigo, riesko rejuvenescence.
rizo rice: rizkultiveyo rice plantation; rizpudro rice powder.
rizopodo (zool.) rhizopod(a).
robo robe:long, loose garment for man or woman; robo dekoltita low-necked, -cut gown; chambro robodressing gown, morning gown; robo kun trenajo gown with train.
robineto cock, tap (for draining off liquids).
robinio* (bot. genus) robinia; (black) locust; (false) acacia (cf. akacio).
robro rubber (of card games as in whist).
robusta robust, hardy, sturdy; robusto, robustulo, robustino a robust person; robusteso robustness. Def.: Qua posedas forteso, vigoro. Ant.: febla, debila.
rocheto* rochet, a kind of surplice.

(de)rodar (tr.) to gnaw, eat by bits; erode; (fig.) to champ (of horses); (cf. mordar); (deanta, (deema gnawing; (deetar to nibble; (deero (animal) rodent. La hundo rodas osto. La puero rodis sua ungli.
rodio* (chem.) rhodium.
rodinalo* (photog.) rodinal
rododendro (bot. genus) rhododendron.
rodomonto rodomont, blusterer, vain boaster, braggart; rodomontoajo empty blustering, bravado, hectoring. Def.: Fanfaronemo pri milital agi; falsa brav(ul)o; III-204.
rogo funeral pile, pyre: stack of wood for burning the dead or a person at the stake. Def.: Lign-amaso por brular ulu od ulo; III-206.
rogacioni* (R.C. rel.) public prayers and processions held on rogation days.

roko a (large) rock, boulder (cf. petro, stono); rokego a very large rock; rokajo rocky mass high, steep and rising or jutting out to a point, as seen in the sea; rocky cliff, crag; rokozarocky: full of rocks; rokatra kordio a hard stony heart. Def.: Granda amaso de petro. Ex.: On povas ruptar roko e tale facar stoni. Ferma quale roko. Gibraltar esas konstruktita sur rokajo.
rokambolo* (bot.) rocambole (Allium sativum, var. Ophioscorodon).
rokoka, rokoko rococo (style); (fig.) antiquated (style).
rolo (theat. and gen.) rôle: part, character, impersonation; plear rolo to play a part; roleto minor rôle.
rolero* (tech.) roller (cf. rulilo, rolerbloko).
Romano Roman citizen; Romana balanco Roman balance, a steelyard; la Romana lingui the Romance languages.
romano a novel, book of fiction; romanisto, autoro novelist, romance writer; romanala relating to a novel; romanatra, romanema fanciful, romantic; romanprotagonisto hero of romance; (cf. novelo).
romanco ballas, romantic song.
romantika romamtic.
rombo (geom.) rhomb(us); rombala rhombic.
romboedro* (geom.) rhombohedron, parallelepipedon.
romboido* (geom.) rhomboid.

ronda round, rotund; rondo, rondajo any round figure or object (cf. cirklo, disko, ringo); rondeta, atra roundish, rotund, round-like; rondeso roundness, rotundity; rondigar, rondeskar (tr., intr.) to make, become round; rondirar (intr.) to go around, circulate; rondiro round, circuit; (of a policeman, etc.) beat.
rondelo (poetry) rondeau, roundelay; (mus.) rondo.
ronkar (intr.) to snore.
ronronar* (intr., of cats) to purr.
roquar (intr.) to rook, castle (at chess).
roso dew; rosoza covered with dew; bedewed.
rosbifo roast-beef.
rosmaro* walrus (genus: Rosmarus).
rosmarino* (bot.) rosemary (genus: Rosmarinus).
rospo toad.
rostar (tr., intr.) to roast (meat); to toast (bread); rostajo, rostkarno a roast; rostopano toast.

rostro (in gen.) any beak-like extension; (nat. hist.) bill, beak (of an insect); trunk, proboscis (as of an elephant); (bot) prolonged rigid process; (Roman antiq.) beak of a ship; rostrum in a forum.

roto wheel; rotaro wheels (collect.), wheel-works, -movement; rotosulkorut;quarrota veturo four-wheeled vehicle; rotonabo hub, nave; rotofelgo felloe, felly, rim; rototormentar to break (on a wheel); rotatre marchar to go heels over head; roteskarto (R.R.) gauge: distance between the wheels.

rotacar (intr.) to rotate, revolve: turn on axis; rotac(ad)o rotating, rotation; rotaca, rotacala rotary; rotacokubo teetotum, spinning top. Ex.: La planeti rotacas cirkum sua axi; li jiras cirkum la suno. Rotacado di roto. V. exp.: vid. jirar.
rotano (bot.) rattan (Calamus rotang); rotana stulo rattan chair.
rotifero (zool.) rotifer.

rotolar (intr.) to rumble, roll (with noise). Ex.: Veturo rotolas kande ol rulas alonge la strado. La rotolado di tondro, di tamburo. V. exp.: L’ideo expresenda esas ta di bruiso produktata per frapi rapide sucedanta; V-493.
rotondo (arch.) rotunda; (clothing) a round cloak.
rotulo (mechan.) ball and socket joint.
rovo (bot.) bramble, brier, thorn-bush; roveyo brake, brier-patch; rovbero a brier berry; blackberry.
rovro (bot.) English oak (Quercus robur); (cf. querko).
royalismo royalism: attachment to the cause of royalty; royalista, royalo royalist.

rozo rose; rozoza full of roses; rozatrajo rosette; roziero r. bush; roziereyo r. garden; rozea r. colo(u)red; rozkoloro r. colo(u)r; rozaquo r. water; rozbuketo bouquet of r.s; rozburjono r. bud; rozfenestro (arch.) r. window; rozligno rosewood; rozmielo honey of r.s; vento rozo (mariner’s) compass-card.
rozario (rel.) rosary.
rozeolo (med.) roseola, a rose colo(u)red rash; scarlet rash, rose rash; (cf. morbilo).
rozlauro (bot.) oleander, rose-bay (Nerium Oleander).
rubando ribbon; tape; rubandizar to trim with ribbons.
rubarbo (bot.) rhubarb (genus: Rheum).
rubio (bot.) madder (Rubia tinctorum). ?ISL
rubido* (chem.) rubidium.
rubino (stone) ruby; rubinea ruby-colo(u)red; balas rubino balas-ruby.
rubriko rubric. V. exp.: Rubriko esas generala titulo. Ex. en Progreso esas: la Lingual questioni, Kroniko, Bibliografio, Diversaji, sub qui singla artiklo havas sua titulo; VII-412.

ruda rude, (of things) rough, unformed by art; (of persons) rough, uncultured, uneducated; (of manners) coarse, unpolished; rudeso roughness, rudeness; traktar rude to use roughly, harshly, to ill-treat.
rudimenta rudiment-al, -ary: little developed; rudimento rudiment, element. Ex.: Rudimenta organo. Rudimenti di gramatiko. La rudimenti di planti.

rufarusset, sandy, reddish-brown, -yellow; ginger-colo(u)red; ruf(ul)ored-haired, sandy-haired person; rufeso russet-colo(u)r; rufatra reddish, russet; rufigar, rufeskar (tr., intr.) to make, become russet-colo(u)red, brown. Ex.: La tro varma glatigilo povas rufigar la linjo.
rugo wrinkle (on the face); ripple (on the water); rugoza wrinkled, full of wrinkles; corrugated; (bot.) rugose; rugizar to wrinkle; rugizeskar to be wrinkled; rugozeskar to become wrinkled. ?FIS

ruinar (tr.) to ruin; ruino, ruineso, ruinajo (act, state, object) ruination; a ruin; ruinanta, ruiniva falling to ruin; ruinous; par ruinar to ruin completely. Ex.: Ruinar ulu, viti. Esar ruinita da ludo-pasiono. Ruino di la stato, di lua bona reputo. La domo falis en ruineso, e tale esis ruinajo.
ruko rock: distaff.
ruktar (intr.) to belch (gas from stomach), eruct(ate).
rukular (intr., of pigeons) to coo.

rular (tr., intr.) to roll (by turning over, as a wheel, also from side to side, as a ship), roll along, wheel along; rular su to roll one’s body, wallow, welter; rulachar su to sprawl; rulaplastar (tr.) to crush with a roller; rulfalar to tumble, topple down; rulilo, rulbloko (instr.) roller; rulkurteno roller blind; rulsketar to skate (on rollers). Ex.: Rular bulo, roko, okuli. La lakrimi rulis adinfre sur la vangi. La ondi di la rivero rulas vers la maro.
rulado* (mus.) roulade.
ruleto* (game) roulette.
rumo rum.
rumbo (nav.) rhumb.
ruminar (tr., intr.) to ruminate: chew over again, chew the cud (cf. meditar); ruminanto, ruminero (zool.) ruminant.
rumoro rumo(u)r, popular report.
rumpo (anat.) rump; (vulg.) backsides; (cf. sedo, gluteo).
rumsteko rumpsteak.
runo, runi rune(s), Runic character(s) or letter(s); runala Runic.
«rupie» (money) rupee.

ruptar (tr.) to break (asunder, up, open, by violence, or stress), to snap, rupture, shatter; rupto, rupturo break(ing), rupture, fracture; ruptajo what is broken; ruptebla breakable (cf. frajila); ruptesar to be broken; ruptopeco piece broken off, fragment.
rusho ruce (for neck or cuff).
rusko (bot.) butchers broom, knee-holly, -holm (Ruscus [aculeatus]).
rusto (of metals) rust; rustoza, rustizita rusted; blighted; rustizar, rustigar to rust (metals); rustozeso, rustizeso, rustozajo rustiness.
rustika, rustik(ul)o rustic; rustikeso rusticity; rustikacho clodhopper.
ruto (bot.) rue (Ruta [graveolens]).
ruteno* (metal) ruthenium.
rutino routine, rote, habit; rutinacho red-tape, rut; rutine by routine; rutinema, rutinemo (one) who acts by routine; red-tapist. Def.: Kustumo sequata sen judiko; kustumal ago facita sen reflektar.
sabato Sabbath: seventh day of the week among the Jews (Saturday); (fig.) the first day of the week as observed by Christians (Sunday) (cf. sundio, saturdio).
sabeliko savoy (cabbage. Brassica sabanda).

sablo sand; sabloza sandy: full of s.; sabla plajo s. beach; sableto fine s.; scouring s.; sablograno grain of s.; sabluyo s. holder, s. box; sableyo; sablomineyosandy spot, sandpit; sablo movanta shifting s.; sablizar to s.: cover with s.; sablohorlojo hour-glass; sablostratos. bar.
sabordo* (square) porthole; gunport.

sabro saber (sabre), broadsword; sabreto; sabro por abordar cutlass; sabruyo; sabrogaino s. scabbard; sabrfrapar, sabragar to s. (ulu); sabrfrapo, sabrvunduro blow with a s., s. wound; sabroposho sabretache. Def.: Speco di espado kun tranchanta lamo larja.
sacerdot(ul)o priest; sacerdotino priestess; sacerdotala sacerdotal, priestly; sacerdoteso (dignity, office) priesthood; sacerdotaro (collect.) priesthood.

saciar (tr.) to give a bare sufficiency to, give a minimum to (ulu); saciesar to content oneself; put up with; saciesar da poko to put up with a little. V. exp.: Saturar esas furnisar la maximo, e saciar esas furnisar la minimo suficanta por kalmigar o cesigar irga bezono. On povas saciar sua hungro per pano-peco, sua dirsto per glasedo de aquo; ma kande on saturas su per manjaji o drinkaji, on riskas, sive mala digesto sive ebrieso. Simile pri omna bezoni e deziri. Existas ofte granda difero o neegaleso inter la minimo strikte necesa por saciar e la maximo qua saturas. Me tre deziras salario de dek franki; me saciesus da ok franki, ma me ne esas kontenta, nam generale, por esar vere kontenta, on bezonas plu kam la minimo necesa. Do saciarne esas kontentigar, nek saciesar esas kontentesar, sacieskar. Saciar expresas esence sentimento; do saciar povas havar nur persono kom objekto, kontre kesuficar povas havar omnaspeca objekti; kp. VI-488.
safena* (veini) (anat.) saphenous (veins).
safiro (min.) sapphire.
safrano (bot. and colo(u)ring material) saffron (Crocus [sativus]); safranea s. colo(u)red; safranizar, safranagar (tr.) to s.: tinge with yellow.
sagaca sagacious, perspicacious, shrewd; sagaceso sagacity, acumen, acuteness, discernment; sagac(ul)o a s. person. Ex.: Sagaco dicernas multa diferi ube altri vidas nur kozi uniforma.
sagitario (bot.) arrrow-head (genus: Sagittaria).
saguino (zool.) sagoin: squirrel-monkey, marmoset of genus: Callithrix.
saguto sago (cf. tapiokao); sagutiero s. tree or palm (Cycas Metrocylon).
saimo lard (cf.lardo). Def.: Porko-graso fuzita, sen salo; IV-581.

saja wise, knowing, enlightened, sage, sensible, reasonable; sajesowisdom; saj(ul)o a wise person, a sage; sajigar, sajeskar to make, to become wise; ne saja unwise, ill-advised. Ex.: Saja lego, politikisto, konduto, judiciisto. La sajeso di la Egiptiani. Il montris granda sajeso en ta cirkonstanci. Ant.: stulta, absurda.

sako (also anat. and bot.) sack: bag, pouch; sakedo sackful, bagful; sako papera a paper bag; sakoreto net bag; drag net, trawl; sako de frumento s. of wheat; ledor sako leather pouch; manu sako handbag, satchel; sablo sako sandbag: bag for sand; sako de sablo sandbag: bag of sand; sakostrado blind alley, cul-de-sac.
sakarimetro* saccharimeter.
sakarimetro* saccharimetry.
sakarino* saccharin(e).
