sakramento sacrament. Ex.: Donar la lasta sakramenti ad uli. Sakramentala vino. La katolikismo havas sep sakramenti: sakramento di bapto, di konfirmo, di la extrema unciono, e.c.

sakrifikar (tr., intr.: lit. and fig.) to sacrifice (ulu, ulo); to make offerings; sakrifiko, sakrifikajo sacrifice, offering; sakrifikala sacrificial;hom sakrifiko human s. Ex.: Sakrifikar viktimi, sua interesti, sua havaji, sua tempo. La sakrifiko di la meso, di la honoro. La sakrifiko di Izaak da Abraham.

sakrilejar (intr.) to commit a sacrilege; sakrilejanta, sakrilejinta sacrilegious. Def.: Profanacar ulu, ulo veneracinda o sakra. Ex.: Sakrilejar kontre sacerdoto, kontre vestalo. (fig.) Esus sakrilejo abatar ica belega arboro.
sakristo sexton; sacristan; sakristio sacristy.
sakrumo (anat.) sacrum.

salo salt; (chem.) sodium chloride; salifar to salify: to produce salt; saligar to salify: to form a salt with; to impregnate (ulo) with salt; salizar to cover (ulo) with salt; sala kolono a column (made) of salt; salala legi laws relating to s.; saloza fisho a salty fish; salizita porkokarno salt pork; salifisto a salt-maker (producer); salizisto a salter, curer; salatra (tendency)salty; brackish; saluyo, salizuyo salt-shaker, salting-box; salozeso saltness; salaquo salt water; salmineyo salt-mine; salo grosa coarse salt; salgrano grain of salt; salmarsho a salt marsh; amoniaksalo sal ammoniac.
salado salad; saladuyo s. dish, s. bowl.
salamandro (zool.) salamander (Salamandra).
salariar (tr.) to pay a stipend, wages, a salary to (ulu); salario, salariajo salary, wages stipend; salariato a salaried person; salariatacho hireling.

saldar (tr.) to settle with: pay the balance due on an account current; saldo, salduro settlement, payment; saldajo balance due: difference between debits and credits of a running account; (cf. bilanco). Ex.: Saldar trupi, employati.
salepo (esp. pharm.) salep: dried roots of various orchids.

saliar (intr.) to be protuberant, to jut out, project. (N.B. refers to form not movement; cf.spricar); saliigar to cause to jut out, to bring into prominence; (of fluids) throw up; salio, saliajo jutting forth; protuberance, prominence, projection; (fort.) salient; salianta projecting, prominent, salient.
salinco* (chem.) salicin.
salika Salic; salika lego S. law. V. exp.: Ideo di heredado nur da e tra la maskuli; IV-581.
saliko (bot.) willow-tree (genus: Salix); saliko ploranta weeping w.
salikario (bot.) spiked purple loose-strife; willow-weed (Lythrum salicaria).
salivo saliva, spittle; salivala salivary; salivifar to salivate (cf. sputar). V. exp.: vid. bavar.
salmono (ich.) salmon; salmonyuno young s.; salmonea s. colo(u)red.
salono saloon: drawing-room, parlo(u)r; (cf. artala expozeyo). Def.: Chambro en apartamento destinita por aceptar vizitanti.
salpetro saltpeter.
salsifio (bot.) salsify, oyster-plant (Tragopogon porrifolius).

saltar (intr.) to leap, jump, bound, hop (upward or forward), vault (ad, sur, trans, retro, adavane);saltigar to bounce (ulo) cause to leap or jump; saltetar to hop, skip, caper; saltope by leaps and bounds; saltanta, saltetanta leaping, skipping; ri saltar to rebound; dorso salto (game) leapfrog; laterala salto side jump; turno salto summersault; transsaltar (tr.) to jump across; vento salto (nav.) a shift of wind. Ex.: Saltar trans (od, trans-saltar) fosato. Irar super ulo per un salto. Saltar al guturo di ulu.

salubra (of places, things) salubrious, wholesome, healthy; salubreso salubrity; salubrigar, salubreskar to render, become s. V. exp.: Salubra tote ne esas sana; sana koncernas la personi o vivanti; salubra koncernas la kozi (klimato, lando, domo). Anke salubreso tote ne esas la saneso, ma la extera, fizikal kondicioni di la saneso. Ol anke ne esas la higieno, qua esas l’arto konservar la saneso. On povas (e devas) sequar la higieno precipue en nesalubra lando; II-711, anke sana.

salutar (tr.) to greet, salute (cf. salvear, reverencar); salutego a very low bow, salaam; hearty salute; inter salutar to salute each other; salutar per espado, per manuo, per salveo to salute with the sword, with the hand, by firing a salute; salutar per voco to cheer. Def.: Donar ad ulu extera signo di respekto, politeso.
salutara salutary, wholesome, beneficial. Def.: Qua risanigas o salvas; IV- 138. Ex.: Salutara legi, kura-civi manjaji. V. exp.: vid. sana.

salvar (tr., also theol.) to save (from danger, peril, sickness), to deliver, rescue; to salvage (goods); salv(ad)o saving, salvation, salvaging; salveso safety, salvation: state of being saved; salvanta saving, rescuing; salvanto, salvinto, salvonto saver, deliverer; (theol.) Saviour; salvita saved, safe (cf. sekura, integra); salvoletro safe-conduct; salvogardar (tr.) to safeguard; salvogardilo (instr.) safeguard; salvboyo life-buoy. Ex.: Salvar urbo, vivo, sua honoro.
salvear (intr., milit.) to fire a salute, a volley (cf. salutar); salveo, salveopafado salute, volley, salvo; aplaud salveo (fig.) a round of applause.
salvio (bot.) sage (-plant) (genus: Salvia).

sama same (cf. identa); samo the s. thing; sameso sameness; same also, likewise, ditto; samgentano, samcivitano, samstatano, samurbano fellow citizen; samgenera congenerous, of the same genus; samspeca of the same species; samideanofellow thinker; partisan of the same idea; saminstanta happening at the same moment, simultaneous (cf. samtempa); samlandano compatriot, fellow countryman; sammatra of the same mother; sampatr(ul)a consanguine; sampatriano compatriot, fellow counrtyman; (cf. samlandano); samreligiano coreligionist; samspecano a kindred or cognate species; samsubstanceso consubstantiality; samtempa contemporaneous, simultaneous (cf. saminstanta); samtempano contemporary; samcentra concentric. Ex.: Il ne plus esas la sama homo. To esas la sama (od, to esas equivalanta). La sameso di la peizaji. Il pensas same kam me. La sama rezultajo. Me lektis la sama libro kam vu ( la sama verko, ma en altra exemplero). La mediko probis desparigar samtempe la febro e la dursto.
sambuko (bot.) elder (-tree) (genus: Sambucus).
samovaro samovar: Russian tea-urn.

sana (pr. of persons; fig. of things) healthy, well, hearty, hale, sound in health; (fig.) sound, wholesome; sana mente sane; saneso healthiness, good health; sanesar to be well, to be all right, be in good health; sanesala sanitary, sanigar to make healthy, well; saneskar to recover one’s health; sanigiva wholesome, hearty; korpe e mente sana sound in body and mind; sana e sekura well (or, safe) and sound; sana opiniono, kritiko sane opinion, sound criticism; sana arboro healthy tree. Def.: Qua havas konstituciono (od figurale, konstituceso) sen-defekta o koruptita (partikulare da morbo). V. exp.: Lo sana ne povas nocar; lo salubra reale bonfacas; lo salutara salvas de danjero, malajo. La ri-sanigeyo devas esar en salubra loko ube la kuracati povas recevar salubra (E. wholesome) manjaji e salutararemediili kande malada; kp. salubra.
sanatorio sanatorium.
sancionar (tr.) to sanction: give validity to. Ex.: Sancionar lego. Ica vorto ne havas la sanciono di kustumo.
sandalo sandal: kind of shoe.
sandarako sandarac(-gum) (Callitris quadrivalvis).
«sandwich» sandwich.

sango blood; sangala relating to b.: sangoza sanguinary: bloody, blood-stained; sangea blood-colo(u)red; sangatra b.-like; sangifar to bleed; sangotirar (tr.) to bleed (ulu); sangosputar to spit b.; sangplena full-blooded; sangamanta, sangodurstanta (fig.) bloodthirsty; sangifar de la nazo to have nose bleed; sangifo, sangoformaco sanguification; sangekfluo hemorrhage; sen sanga bloodless.
sanguina (of temperament) sanguine; sanguin(ul)o a s. person.
sanguisugo (worm) leech (Hirudo medicinalis); (fig.) bloodsucker, extortioner.
sanio* (med.) sanies. Def.: Materio sangoza e fetida, qua fluas de ula ulceri. V-349.
sanskrita (linguo) (la) Sanscrit.

santa holy, saintly; (of titles) saint; (cf. sakra); sant(ul)o a saint; santeso holiness, sanctity, saintliness, saintship; santigar to sanctify, make holy; santigo sanctification; santeyo a holy place; Santa Spirito Holy Ghost; Santa Paulo Saint Paul; santa patrulo holy father; santa tribunalo holy office (Inquisition); santa semano holy week; santa vivo a holy life; santaquuyo holy-water basin, font.
santalo sandalwood.
santolino (bot.) lavender-cotton ground-cypress (Santolina).

santuario sanctuary: that part of a church where the altar is placed; chancel; altar; (Jewish) holy of holies. (fig.) asylum, sacred refuge. Def.: Parto di kirko, di templo interdiktata a la profani; IV-582.

sapar (tr., lit. and fig.) to sap, undermine; sap(ad)o, sapuro undermining, (milit.) sap(ping); sapisto (milit.) sapper. Ex.: Sapar la fundamenti di basiono, di edifico. (fig.) Ta sistemo sapas la fundamenti di la Kristana religio.
sapajuo (zool.) sapajou (monkey) (genus: Cebus).

sapono soap; saponala, saponoza, saponatra; soapy, saponaceous; saponagar, saponizar to use s., put s. on, lather; saponigar (tr.), saponifar (intr.) to saponify, make or produce soap; saponiferio s.works; saponbulo, saponpeco a piece of soap.
saponario (bot.) soapwort (genus: Saponaria).
saponino* (chem.) saponin
saponito* (min.) saponite.

saporar (intr.) to have a certain flavo(u)r (taste) (cf.gustar, savurar); saporo flavo(u)r, taste: (fig.) zest; saporoza tasty; succulent, palatable; sen sapora tasteless; (fig. of things) insipid, flat, vapid; posa saporo after-taste. Ex.: La biro saporas bitre. Ta karno esas sen-sapora. Ca vino havas pikema saporo. (fig.) Lua poemo havas nula saporo.
saprofito (bot.) saprophyte.
sapto (of plants) sap. Def.: Suko quan la planti tiras ek la tero, e qua acensante en li nutras oli; II-705.
sarabando saraband. Def.: Anciena danso, origine Hispana; IV-582.
saraceno (bot.) buckwheat (Polygonum fagopyrum).
sarcelo (orni.) teal (-duck) (genus: Querquedula).
sardino (ich.) sardine (Sardinella pilchardus).
sardonika sardonic (laughter, etc.).
sardonixo (min.) sardonyx.
sargaso sargass-o, -um, gulfweed (genus: Sargassum).
sarigo (zool.) opossum (Didelphys virginiana).
sarko coffin, bier; sarkokapelo mortuary chapel; sarkoveturo hearse.
sarkasmosarcasm;sarkasma, sarkasmatra, sarkasmema sarcastic; sarkasmem(ul)o a sarcastic person.
sarkofago sarcophagus: stone coffin.
sarkomo (med.) sarcoma.
sarmento (bot.) sarmentum: a running stem (as the strawberry plant); sarmentoza sarmentose: having slender prostrate branches or runners.
sarsaparelo (bot.) sarsaparilla (genus: Smilax).

sat(e) (adv.) enough, sufficiently (de);sat(e)o a sufficiency; me havas sata(od, sat multa; sato de; suficanta)pekunio I have enough money; vu parolis sate you have spoken enough; savar sat multeto know enough; sat bone good enough. V.exp.: Sat, suficante Me manjis sat multapano, me ne suficante granda quanto por saturigar mea hungro. Ofte sat havas preske la signifiko di pasable, ma existas tamen kelka nuanco. «Homo, pasable granda, esas sat granda por esar vertuoza, ma ne suficante granda por atingar ula pomo pendanta de arboro.»
Satano Satan; Satanala, Satanatra satanic.
satelito (astron. and fig.) satellite. Ex.: La luno esas satelito di ica planeto.
satino (fabric) satin; satinatra pelo a satin-like skin; satinumar to glaze: give to fabrics, paper, etc., a satin-like gloss; koton satino satinet.
satiro satire; satirala, satiratra, satirema satirical; satire mokar to satirize (ulo), lampoon (ulu).
satiruso (myth. and fig.) satyr.

satisfacar (tr.) to satisfy: to answer, fulfil (expectation, promise), to discharge (an obligation); to make amends, atone for (an offense, sin); satisfaco fulfilment, satisfaction (given), amends; satisfacanta satisfactory: making amends. V.exp.: On adoptas satisfacar en la sequanta uzo: «satisfacar devo, obligo, kontrato, promiso, kondiciono», ne en la senco di kontentigar; III-666.
«satisfecit» certificate of satisfaction, of good conduct. Def.: Atesto-letreto donata (quale da skolestro a lua skolano).
satrapo satrap; satrapio (domain) satrapy.

saturar (tr.) to fill completely; to satiate, glut, saturate, surfeit; (chem.) to unite or dilute until no more can be received. Ex.: Saturar acido. Saturar sua kuriozeso. La saturo-punto varias segun la tempuraturo. Saturita per manjajo, per aquo, per doloro. V.exp.: vid. saciar.
saturdio Saturday.
saturnali (lit. and fig.) Saturnalia.
sauco (cook.) sauce; saucuyo s. holder, s. tureen; saucizar to put sauce on.
saurio saurian; (cf. lacerto).

savar (tr.) to know (by learning), to have a knowledge of; to be versed in; be aware of; to know how (to do); savigar to cause (ulu) to know (ulo), to apprise, inform, instruct; saveskar to become informed, apprised (pri); (ad)o knowing, learning; savajo knowledge: what is known; savema (of persons) desirous of learning, curious (cf. kurioza); savar lektar e skribar to know how to read and write; savar plezar, facar to know how to please, to make; savar la intenci to be sensible, be aware of the intentions. Ex.: Savar ulo, multo (pri). Me ne savas quon me devas dicar. Savar gramatiko, lingui, matematiko. V. exp. (1): Savar, konocar Konocar esas havar l’ideo, la nociono pri ulu, ulo per sensi; savar esas pure mental ago. On konocas ulu per la nomo, la vizajo; on savas gramatiko. V. exp. (2): Savigar, informar, instruktar, avizar, notifikar, instruciono Savigar esas la maxim generala vorto. Informaresas konocigar fakti; instruktar, konocigar teoriala o ciencala veraji; avizar donar ula praktikal informo, konsilo od impero; notifikar konocigar fakto per oficiala formo. Instruciono esas indiko di la metodo o maniero por uzar juste ed utile ula kozo, instrumento, kuracilo, e.c.; II-646.
savano savanna: treeless plain or meadow; U.S.: prarie.

savurar (tr.) to savo(u)r, relish (a dish); (fig.) to enjoy, delight in; savuro savo(u)r, relish. Def.: Gustar lente, kun atenco e plezuro. Ex.: Savurar ula vino, tasedo de kafeo. (fig.) Savurar ula plezuro, la honori.
saxhorno* (mus.) saxhorn.
saxifrago (bot.) saxifrage (genus: Saxifraga).
saxofono (mus.) saxophone.
sbiro* sbirro: a former member of Italian Police.

se (conj.) if (followed frequently, but not necessarily by conditional); sene if not or else, otherwise; senur if only, provided that. Ex.: Se me povus, me venus. To esas importanta, se vera. Obediez; se ne, gardez! Me facos to, se nur il venos.

sebo tallow or tallow-like substance, suet; (cf. stearino); seboza tallowy; sebifanta sebaceous; seboglando sebaceous gland; sebgrano, sebpustulo (med.) black pimple (on skin); okul sebo eye mucus, -rheum.

seciono (geom.) section (cf. segmento). V. exp.: Seciono signifikas la figuro (plana) obtenita «sekante» objekto per plano (ex. la koniki esas konala secioni); kun ta senco ol uzesas tre ofte en geometrio e cetera matematika cienci; IV-351; V-660.

sedo bottom, backside: hinder part or seat of body; (cf. gropo, rumpo, lumbo); sedobalno sitz-bath. V. exp.: Sedo esas la ordinara vorto quan on uzas exemple en gimnastiko: «la sedo maxim posible adsupre!» kulo povas semblar shokanta; gluteo esas anatomiala.
sedentaria sedentary (life, profession). Def.: Qua restas konstante sidanta, pro mestiero; per extenso, la mestiero anke dicesas «sedentaria»; III-207.

sediciar (intr.) to (cause a) mutiny, to riot (cf. rebeleskar, revoltar); populacho sedicioza a riotous mob; sediciema soldati seditious (riotous) soldiers; sediciema mento seditious mind. Def.: Facar mikra revolto.
sedimento sediment, grounds, dregs, lees; sedimentala, sedimentatra sedimentary; sedimentoza feculent, turbid, muddy.

seduktar (tr.) to seduce (chastity); to lead astray (from the path of rectitude, duty); to beguile, entice (cf. lurar, trompar, facinar, misduktar, koruptar, subornar); sedukto, sedukteso seduction; seduktanta, seduktiva enticing, seductive, captivating, engaging, winning; seduktanto, seduktero seducer (cf. atraktiva). Ex.: Seduktar puerino. La charmo di lua manieri seduktas me.

segar (tr.) to (cut with a) saw: segilo a saw; segillamo blade of a s.; trapar segar to s. through (ulo); cirklo segilo circular s.; rubando segilo ribbon-, band-s.; segerio sawmill; segisto sawyer; segpulvero sawdust.
seglo sail (of a ship); seglaro sails (of a ship); set of s.s.; seglirar to s.: go sailing before the wind; seglonavo sailing vessel; seglifisto sailmaker; hisar la segli to set, make sails.

segmento section, segment; segmentigar to segment: divide into sections; segmentigado, segmenturo segmentation; cirklosegmento segment of a circle; (cf. seciono). V. exp.: Segmento signifikas ula determinita parto di objekto longa, lineatra, quan on «sekas» o dividas segun lua longeso: segmento di voyo, di fervoyo (ex. inter du stacioni), di rivero, di kanalo (inter du sluzi), di filo telegrafala (inter du stacioni o posteni); IV-351; V-660.
segregacar (tr.) to segregate.

segun (prep.) according to, agreeably to, in conformity with; pursuant to, after; segun ke (conj.) according to whether; segunquante as far as, in so far; segunvola optional; segunvole at will. Ex.: Segun vua deskripto, vua rekomendo, mea opiniono. Traktar ulu segun lua merito. Evangelio segun St. Johano. Ni diskutos to, nur segun quante ol povas kontributar a nia projeto. Segun ke vu esos richo o mizeroza, la homi judikos vu kom bona o kom mala.
seido fanatical partisan, zealot. Def.: Fanatiko volunte kriminas pro religiala zelo, e.c.
sejornar (intr.) sojourn, remain for some time at a place (cf. restar).
sekar (tr.) to make a surface cut in; cut partially through; divide into sections; sekuro (surg.) section; sekanto (geom.) secant; sekvunduro gash, cut, slash. V. exp.: vid. tranchar.
sekalo (bot.) rye (Secale cereale); sekalgrano a grain of rye; sekalpano rye-bread.
sekino*(coin) sequin.
sekondar (tr.) to second, back (up) support (a motion, proposition); sekondanto seconder, backer.
sekrecar (tr., biol.) to secrete; sekrec(ad)o: sekrecuro secretion; sekrecanta, sekrecala secreting, secretory.
sekreta secret, not made known, not revealed, clandestine (cf. celita, privata); sekretajo a secret (cf. misterio); sekreteso secrecy; sekrete secretly, in secret. V.exp.: vid. arkana.
sekretario (person) secretary.
sekto sect; sektano member of a s., sectarian.
sektoro (geom., milit.) sector.
sekulara secular, worldly; (cf. laika); sekular(ul)o a secular priest (not a regular); sekulara klerikaro secular clergy: clergy not bound by monastic vows; sekularigar to secularize.
sekundo second: 60th of a minute of time or of an arc.
sekundara secondary: indicates relationship as used in geology, electricity, public school, medicine, etc., compared with primara, terciara; (cf. acesora: duesmagrada; min grava).

sekura safe, secure: out of danger, without danger; sekuresosafety, security; sekuresar to be s., sekurigar to make safe, secure (cf. certigar); sekurespolico detective police; sekuresvalvo valve; Ex.: Pozar ulo en sekura loko. Voyajar sekure (od, en sekureso). Sekurigar sua havajo.

selo saddle; seleto, selkuseneto s.-pad (as for cart-horse); selizar to s., seliferio saddlery (where saddles are made; cf. harnesiferio); selkavalo s.-horse; hominselo side-s., lady’s s.; selarko s. bow; senseligarto unsaddle.
selakto whey.

selektar (tr.) to select, choose, pick out (cf. elektar, preferar, asortar); selekto selection, option; selektajo what is chosen, choice. Ex.: Selektar sua amiki. Selektar la maxim bona cerizi. Naturala selektado.
selenio* (chem.) selenium.
selenografio selenography.
«selfmademan» self-made man.
semar (tr., lit. and fig.) to sow, strew, scatter (seed for growth); semajo what is sown; seed.
semaforo semaphore.
semano week; omna semane, singla semane every w., each w., weekly; ca semane this week; santa semano Holy Week; mi semana twice a w., every half w.; du semana bi-weekly, every two weeks.
semantiko semantics, semasiology. Def.: Cienco di la signifiki (di vorti), di lia evoluciono (parto di la linguistiko); IV-81.

semblar (intr.) to seem, appear (to be), look (like) (cf. aspektar, simular); semblo appearance, semblance, external aspect, outward show; semblanta seeming; semblo falsa false show, pretence; semblante apparently (cf. kredebla). Ex.: Ca vino semblas a me esar mala. Il semblas dormar. Semblo di amikeso.
semestro semester: six months period (of study) (cf. trimestro).
Semido Semite; Semidala Semitic.
semino, semini seed (cf. spermo, grano); seminizar to sow (a field, etc.).
seminario (ecclesiastical) seminary; seminariano seminarist, theological student.
semolo semolina.
sempervivo (bot.) houseleek (Sempervivum [tectorum]).

sen (prep.) without, not with, free from: indicates absence, privation, exclusion, destitution; (Note: Sen is often compounded with verbs in place of des, neto signify deprivation, absence: desesperar to despair; senesperigar to deprive (ulu) of hope; neesperanta unhopeful; senesperahopeless. Note that in the adjective form the suffix senais used, not senala, senoza, etc. senespera, not senesperoza, senviva korpo a lifeless body; senfaliowithout fail, unfailingly; sen to without that, otherwise; sen ke (conj.) without (that), unless: me ne povas parolar, sen ke il interruptas me I cannot speak without his interrupting me. Ant.: kun.
senato senate; senatano senator; senatala, senatanala senatorial.
senatuskonsulto* senatys-consultum: decree of the (Roman) senate.
senbrach(ul)o (lit.: person without breeches) (French hist.) sans-culotte.

senco sense, meaning; dusenceso, sencajo double meaning; plursenca vorto a word with various significations; nejusta senco improper sense; sensenca senseless; sensencajo a senseless thing or act; nonsense. V.exp.: Senco, signifiko La senco di ula vorto konsistas en la diversa idei, quin ol expresas od implikas; lua signifiko konsistas en la diversa objekti, a qui ol esas aplikebla. Ex.: La vorti «Blanka Monto» havas senco aplikebla a omna blanka monti; ma lua signifiko restriktesas ad un monto. Simile la Glacial Oceano, la Nigra e la Reda Maro, e.c. La vorti «la maxim granda de la nombri» havas senco komprenebla e mem klara, ma korespondas a nula objekto; ol «signifikas nulo;» (Further discussion of these synonyms may be found in VI-80-81).
senceremonia unceremonious; seneso bluntness, off-handedness.
sencesa continual, incessant: constantly renewed or recurring (cf. kontinua).
sendar (tr.) to send: cause to go, dispatch, forward; sendajo what is sent; parcel (of goods); sendato person sent; messenger, emissary; sendato diplomacala envoy.
sendefekta faultless.
sendomaja undamaged, intact, in good condition (cf. netushita, nelezita).
senduba, sene undoubted(ly), assuredly (cf. certe).
senecio(bot.) groundsel (genus: Senecio).
seneshalo (title) seneschal.
senfloreskar to lose, shed its blossom.
senhara (of persons) bald: completely without hair; (cf. kalva).
senharnesigar (= desharnesizar) to unharness.
senheredanteso (jur.) escheat: failure of heritable heirs by which property reverts to the State.
senhonora unhono(u)red: without hono(u)r: senigar to dishono(u)r, deprive (ulu) of hono(u)r.
senila (med.) senile; senileso senility.
senintence unintentionally.
seniora; o, ulo, ino senior, elder, eldest; eso seniority, eldership; yuro birthright; (jur.) primogeniture.
senjena unconstrained; free and easy.
senkapa headless, acephalus; senigar to lop the head from, decapitate.
senkarnigar to strip the meat from.
senkernigar to stone (peaches, etc.); to core (apples, etc.).
senkorticigar to peel, strip (of its bark).
senkulpa guiltless, faultless (cf. inocenta).
senkuraja timid; senigar to dishearten, discourage, demoralize.
senmakula unblemished, unspotted, spotless, immaculate.
senmobligar to strip of furniture; senigita unfurnished.
senmova motionless.
«senna» (bot., pharm.) senna.
senpaga gratuitous (cf. gratuita); sene gratis, free of charge.
senpartisa impartial; seneso impartiality.
senpiligar (tr.) to flay, skin (cf. exkoriar).
senpena, sene without difficulty.
senplumigar to pluck feathers from.
senpolvigar to dust; senigiloduster (cf. plumfasko).
senpudora immodest, wanton: without (womanly) modesty; senajo immodest act (cf. sordidajo, lacivajo).
senreflekta thoughtless, heedless, giddy.
senreligia irreligious (cf. kontrereligia; despia).

senso sense: one of the five physical senses or faculties; sensala (physiol.) sensorial, sensory; sensala plezuri pleasures of the senses; sensalismo (philos.) sensualism: sensationalism, the doctrine that all knowledge originates in sensation (cf. sensualismo).
sensheligar to shell, peel, hull, husk.
sensenca senseless, meaningless; senajo nonsense.
sensitivo (bot.) sensitive plant.
sensorga careless.

sensuala sensual: devoted to the gratification of the senses; voluptuous; sensual(ul)o, sensualisto s. person; sensualist; sensualismo sensualism: sensuality (cf. sensalismo). Def.: Devota a sensala plezuri; agreabla a la sensi.
sensucia free from care or concern.

sentar (tr.) to feel (a sensation) (cf. konciar, perceptar, flarar, odorar, saporar); sent(ad)o feeling, sensation; sentebla sensible: which is felt; senteble sensibly: perceptibly; sentiva, sentema sensitive, impressionable, susceptible; sentiveso, sentemeso sensitiveness, sensibility, susceptibility; senteyo, sentocentro sensorium, place of sensation; sentivigar to make sensitive; me sentas me varma (od, kom varma) I feel warm (cf. IV-691). Ex.: Sentar koldeso, hungro, dursto, doloro.
sentare, sena net (weight).

sentenco sentence: maxim: short saying containing an axiom, saw (cf. proverbo). (N.B. This is not the E. grammatical «sentence» cf. frazo); sentencema, sentencatra sententious, terse, pithy. Ex.: Sentenco da Seneca. Stilo, maniero sentencala.

sentimento sentiment, mental feeling, emotion (opp. to physical sensation), sentimentala (of things) sentimental; sentimentema; sentimentemo sentimental (person); sentimentemeso sentimentality. Ex.: La sentimento di lo bela. Me havas nula sentimento ecepte la tristeso. Sentimento di odio. Sentimentala tono, diskurso. Yunino sentimentema.
sentima fearless, without dread.
sentinelo (milit.) sentinel, sentry; sentinelesarto be on s. watch (cf. facionar); sentineligar to post (ulu) as a s.
senvalora worthless; senigar to render worthless; (of money) to demonetize.
senviva lifeless.
senvoca (in phonetics) surd, mute.
sep seven; sepesma seventh; sepimo one-seventh; sepyara septennial; sepadek seventy; sepadekyara, sep(ul)o septuagenar-y, -ian; (for other derivative forms, cf. du).
sepalo (bot.) sepal.

separar (tr.) to separate, part, divide, (ulo, de ulo); (su) to secede, withdraw; separo, separeso separation, severing, partition; secession; separilo anything which separates: a partition; separajo that which is separated, a s. part; separanta, separiva separating, seceding, separative: separate separately; separanto, separemo secessionist, separatist; separeblaseparable; separolineo line of demarcation. Ex.: Separar la kapo de la korpo. Ta rivero separas ca du provinci. Separar su de ula societo. Lia diversa interesti separas li. Ni judikos separate la du kozi.
sepio (ich.) sepia, cuttlefish (genus: Sepia); sepiajo sepia (pigment); sepidesegno, sepiuro s. drawing.
septa (med.) septic: causing putrifaction; septeso sepsis.
septembro September.
septeto (mus.) septet (voices or instruments).
septiliono* septillion.
septimo* (mus.) seventh chord.

sepultar (tr.) to entomb, bury (a dead body) (cf. enterigar); sepulteskar to prepare for burial, lay out (a body); sepulto, sepulturo sepulture, burial (cf. tombo); sepulteyo place of burial; sepultotuko shroud, winding sheet.

sequar (tr.) to follow, go or come after, go next, to be or come next; sequo sequence, continuation; sequanto a follower; sequanta next, subsequent; sequantaro retinue, train, attendants, suite; sequantajo sequel, continuation: that which follows; sequante in pursuance, in conformity; seque then, (here)after; sequinda worth following; sequenda which must be followed. Ex.: Il marchis adavane e la altri sequis il. Sequar ulu per la okulo. Sequar voyo, metodo. La sequantaro venis dop (od, sequante) il. Sequo di lud-karti. Il remarkis sua eroro erste ye la sequante matino. Exemplo sequinda. Voyo sequenda.
sequencio* (R.C. liturgy) sequence: a certain hymn sung during mass.
sequestrar (tr., jur.) to sequester; sequestr(ad)o, sequestreso sequestration; sequestrajo what is sequestered. Ex.: Sequestrar la havajo di ulu.
sequoyo (bot.) sequoia: red-wood tree (Sequoia gigantea; Sequoia sempervirens).
sero (physiol.) serum: thin, transparent part of blood (cf. serumo); seroza serous: (fig.) watery; lakto sero whey: thin part of milk (cf. selakto).
serafo seraph; serafi seraphim; serafala seraphic.
serayo seraglio.
serbatano air-cane; pea-shooter. Def.: Longa tubo uzata por lansar, per suflado, mikra projektili.

serchar (tr.) to seek, look for, search for, be in quest of; serch(ad)o search(ing); serchanto, serchero, serchemo seeker, searcher; tra serchar to s. through, to rummage. Ex.: Serchar oro. Serchar vorto en vorto-libro. Serchar lojeyo. Il serchas oportunajo por ganar la pekunio.
serena (phys., mental) serene, placid; sereneso serenity. Ex.: Mieno, fronto, tempo serena.
serenado serenade; serenadar, donar serenado to serenade (ulu).
«serenissimus» (title) His Serene Highness.
serfo, serfoulo, serfoino serfdom.
serio series, row, file; continued succession, order or course (cf. intersequo, sucedo); serie in s., in rows. Ex.: Serio di personi, di objekti, di questioni, di soni.
serino (orni.) serin: canary (-finch).
seringo (bot.) syringa (genus: Philadelphus).

serioza serious, sedate, grave; not lively or amusing; serioz(ul)o a s. person; seriozeso seriousness. Ex.: Serioza karaktero, konverso, morbo. Parolar serioze. Konsiderar ulu, ulo kom serioza. V. exp.: vid. grava. Ant.: vivaca, gaya, amuzanta, ridiganta, komika, jokema.
serjo (fabric) serge.
serjento sergeant.
serono (com.) seroon: a bale of tea, indigo, etc. wrapped in hide.
serpo bill-hook, pruning-bill; serpeto pruning-, garden-knife. Def.: Speco di kultelo larja kun pinto kurvigita (en la sama plano), qua servas por taliar la arbori, tranchar la branchi; VI-539.

serpento serpent, snake; serpentala relating to s.; serpentatra, serpentoforma serpentine; serpentofuzeo Pharaoh’s serpent: a species of fireworks; serpentokorno serpent: a former musical instrument; serpentotubo a winding tube.
serpentino (min.) serpentine.
serpolo (bot.) serpolet: wild thyme (Thymus Serpillum).
serumo (medicinal, artificial) serum (cf. sero); serumkuraco s. therapy.
seruro lock; serur(if)isto locksmith; serurhoko l. catch; resort seruro spring l.; sekures seruro safety l. Ex.: Klef-agar la seruro do pordo.

servar (tr., intr.) to be of service to, to serve (as an assistant or domestic); to be in the service (of), to serve (customers), to tend (a machine); serv(ad)o serving, service (cf. servico); servanto, servisto servant, servitor; servistino maid servant; servistaro (collect.) domestics, servants; servema obliging, willing to serve; servemeso obligingness; servo tablo serving table; vua servanto (polite phrase) your servant; servacharto dance attendance on (ulu), servemacha servile. Ex.: Servar ulu. Esar servisto di ulu. Facar servo ad ulu. Me esas pronta servar vu. Administrala servado. Servar ulu kom sekretario. Servar kliento, mashino.
servalo (zool.) serval: African wildcat (Felis serval).
servico (table dishes) service; servico kristala, arjenta, porcelana crystal, silver, china service (cf. disho).
servitudo (jur.) servitude: liability of property to rights of other persons, as a right of way over it. Def.: Obligo pri domeno relate altra domeno; III-606.
sesgar (tr.) to cut (ulo) in the form of a crescent; (of dresses) to cut low; (cf. dekoltar). Ex.: Sesgar korsajo.

sesiono session, sittings (of a deliberative body, as a court, legislature, etc.). V. exp.: Duro dum qua deliberanta korporaciono kunsidas kontinue. To ne esas kunsido, qua indikas la duro di singla kunveno; III-332.
setono (surg., vet.) seton.

severa severe, hard, stern, harsh, strict (cf. austera); severeso, severajo (quality, act) severity; (of weather) inclemency. Def.: Rigoroza; ne-indulgema. Ex.: Severa judiciisto, lego, morbo, klimato. Ant.: indulgema.
sexagesimo* (rel.) Sexagesima (Sunday).
sexto (mus.) sixth: an interval of six diatonic degrees.
sextanto sextant.
sexteto (mus.) sextet.
sextiliono* sextillion.
sextiko* (math.) sextic.
sexuo sex; sexuala sexual; sexualeso sexuality: state of being distinguished by s.; sen sexua sexless. Ex.: La sexuo maskala, femina. Personi di la du sexui. Sexuala diferi, orgami.
sezamo (bot.) sesame (Sesamum).

sezono season (of the year; cf. okaziono, oportunajo); sezonala seasonable (weather, etc.); -lugumi vegetables in s.; pluv sezono rainy s.; stagno sezono dull, dead s.; posa sezono latter part of the s.; (fig.) autumn.
sfacelo* (med.) sphacelus: gangrene.
sfenoido (geom., anat.) sphenoid(al); sfenoido, sfenoidosto s. bone).
sfero (geom.) sphere, globe; sfera, sferala, sferatra spherical. V. exp.: vid. balono.
sferoido* (geom.) spheroid.
sferometro spherometer.
sfintero (anat.) sphincter (muscle).
sfinxo (also fig.) sphinx.
«sha» (title) shah.
shablono pattern (cf. modelo); (fig.) routine (cf. rutino). Def.: Plana figuro, qua indikas la konturi sugun qui on devas taliar stofo; anke utila metafore (por expresar sklavatra kopiado); IV-447
shabrako shabrak: ornamented saddle cloth, caparison. Def.: Tegilo ornita di kavalo; VI-75.
shafto shaft, staff: long handle, as of a lance; stock (of a gun); shank (of a tool); (cf. shakto).
shagrino shagreen (leather).

shako chessman; shakludochess (the game); shakludar to play c.; shakplanko chess board; shakar to give a check (to the king). V. exp.: Por la shako-ludo on adoptas: damo, episkopo, kavalo, turmo, e la expresuri: soldati, oficeri, roquar, shakar la rejo; VI-116; for other descriptive terms, cf. VI-299.
shakalo (zool.) jackal (Canis aureus).
shakto shaft, pit (of a mine or quarry).
shalo shawl.
shalmo pipe or tube of straw, reed, glass, or metal (as used for sucking up liquids); (chemist’s) blowpipe; shawm: an acient reed instrument; shepherd’s pipe; (bot.) hollow sterm (of a plant).
shaloto (bot.) shallot: an onion-like plant (Allium ascalonicum).
shalupo (sailing-) launch, long boat or cutter propelled by sails or oars; shallop; vapor shalupo steam launch.

shamar (intr.) to be ashamed (pri ulo); shamigar to s. (ulu), to make (ulu) feel ashamed, to humiliate, mortify; (cf. pudoro); shamo shame, disgrace; shaminda, shamiganta shameful, disgraceful, foul, dirty (word, act); shamindajo act of vileness; shamindeso turpitude, baseness, vileness, shamefulness; sen shama shameless; sen shameso shamelessness, effrontery. Def.: Shamo: perturbo di la koncienco, igita da deshonoro, ridindajo, e.c. Ex.: Il devos balde shamar pri sua mala agado. Vua diligenteso shamigas me. Il esas shamoza pri sua ofenso. Shaminda (od, sham-iganta) konduto, vorti, agi.
shamoto* fire-clay.
shampunar (tr.) to shampoo.
shancelar (intr.) to stagger, totter, waver, reel, be unstready, shake; shanceligar to cause something to totter; (fig.) to shake (an opinion, decision, etc.); shancelo reeling, tottering.
shapko fur cap. Def.: Furizita kap-vesto.
sharado charade.
sharko (ich.) shark. V. exp.: Sharko esas la nomo vulgara di Squalus carcharius; squalo esas la nomo di la genero Squalus.
sharlatano charlatan, quack-doctor, mountebank; sharlataneso charlatanism, quackery. Def.: Venderacho di drogi, dent-extirpero, e.c. en publika loki; (fig.) ne-savanta mediko qua explotas la publiko.
sharpo scarf (for shoulders); sash (as insignia or ornament); (surg.) sling; (cf. zono); havar la brakio en sharpo to have the arm in a sling; dentala sharpo lace scarf.
sharpio (surg.) lint.
sheiko sheik. Def.: Chefo di Araba tribuo; III-603.
sheklo (tech.) shackle. Def.: Masho di kateno qua havas altra formo kam la cetera mashi e servas por specala skopo (fixigo di la hoko, di siteli en dragilo, e.c.); III-85-6.
shelo shell, peel, rind, hull: hard outer case of eggs, nuts, etc.; (cf. skalio, bruo); ovo shelo egg-shell; senshela pizi shelled peas; sensheligar to shell, peel: onyonshelo onion skin.

shibro (tech.) slide-valve (in steam engine); sluice-gate (for water). Def.: Valvo-pordo qua agas glitante en sua plano tale ke ol obstruktas (parte o tote) vaporo en la vapor-mashino, aqua en kanalo, tubo, e.c.; III-293.

shikanar (intr.) to chicane: to pettifog, quibble, prolong a contest by shifts, subterfuges; (tr.) to quibble over something or with somebody about something; to wrangle (without motive); shikano, shikanemeso chicanery, sharp practice, pettifogging, quibbling.
shildo shield, buckler (defensive armo(u)r) (cf. skudo).
shindolo (wooden-) shingle; (cf. tegulo).
shinko ham: thigh of a hog prepared for food; shinketo small h.; knuckle of h.

shirmar (tr.) to shelter, shield, screen: shirmar su to take shelter; shirmanta, shirmiva sheltering; shirmilo, shirmivo shelter, cover; (fig.) refuge; shirmtekto penthouse, lean-to (cf. hangaro). Ex.: Parasuno shirmas el. Shirmata da la foliaro kontre la vento e suno.
«shirting» (com.) shirting: cloth suitable for making shirts.

shokar (tr., intr.) to shock: (physical) to strike on or against, dash against; give a shock to, clash with; (mental) to offend, be offensive to; (cf. kolizionar); shoko shock, clashing, concussion; shokanta shocking, clashing; shokar glasi to hobnob; touch glasses; retro shoko counter-shock, -blow; shokopulsar (tr.) to hustle, jostle (ulu). Ex.: La navo shokas rifo. Du inter-shokanta korpi produktas sono. Nulo quon vu dicas povas shokar me. La shoko renversis il. Vorto, konduto shokanta.
shovar (tr.) to shove or push (ulu, ulo) along; (cf. pulsar, glitar). Ex.: Shovar ulu sur glacio. Shovar su tra turbo. Shovar botelo sur tablo, batelo al aquo.
shovelo shovel; shovelagar (tr.) to s.; shoveledo shovelful.
shovinismo chauvinism; jingoism; shovinista, shovinisto chauvinist(ic); jingo(istic).
shrapnelo shrapnel.

shuo (low-) shoe for the human feet); shuo alta high s. (which extends above tha ankles; cf. boteto); shutalono heel of a s.; shureparar to cobble; shuiferio manufactory; shuvendeyo s.-selling shop; shumetilo s.-horn; shuformizilo s.-tree; senshuigar to pull off shoes; shunetigisto s.-cleaner, -black. V. exp.: Shuo ne esas boto shuo esas basa pedvesto, sub la maleoli; IV-101.

shultro shoulder; shultri larja broad s.s; shultropozar (fusilo) to shoulder (a gun); shultropulsar, shultrshovar to push or shove with the s.s.; levar la shultri lift, shrug the s.s; shultropeco s.piece (cf. epoleto).
shunto (elec.) shunt.
shutro blind, shutter (as for window); shutro faldebla folding s.
si (mus.) si: seventh note of diatonic scale.
sibarita sybaritic.
sibilo sibyl; sibilala, sibilatra sibylline.

sidar (intr.) to sit , be seated (of persons, assemblies, courts); (fig.) to lie, reside (of things); sidigar to seat (ulu); sideskar to take one’s seat, sit down; sidilo (furniture) seat; bisidilo seat for two persons; sideyo place where one sits; seat, bench (as of a court); see (of a bishop); (fig.) residence; santa eyo Holy See; sidobalno hip-bath; sidoposturo manner of sitting; kunsidar to sit together, meet (of several persons). Ex.: Me sideskas an la tablo. Me sidigas gasti an mea tablo, pose me sideskas. La korto di kasaco sidas en Paris. Paris esas la sideyo di la guvernerio. (fig.) La sideyo di morbo.
siejar (tr.) to besiege, lay s. to, invest (ulu, ulo); siejostando condition of s.; cesar la siejo to raise the s.
Sienatero (earth, pigment) (terra) sienna.
siestar (intr.) to have a nap; siesto siesta, midday or afternoon nap.
sifiliso (med.) syphilis; sifilisala syphilitic: relating to s.; sifilisika, sifilisiko syphilitic (person).

siflar (tr., intr.) to whistle: make a shrill sound ordinarily musical; (fig., med.) to wheeze; to whiz; siflilo a whistle; siflanto, siflero a whistler, one who whistles. Def.: Facar la sono (ordinare) muzikala, kun alteso definita, quan produktas sifl-ilo, t.e. orgen-tubo kurta e konseque akuta, o la sifilo di lokomotivo; VII-207. Ex.: Siflar a hundo. Siflar ario. La respirado di asmatiko siflas. (fig.) La vento, flecho, paf-kuglo (ulfoye) siflas. V. exp.: vid. sisar.
sifono siphon; sifonagar to s.
sigaro cigar; sigareto cigarette; sigarifisto c. maker; sigaruyo c. holder; sigartranchilo c. cutter.
sigilario* sigillaria: a genus of fossil trees.

sigiar (tr.) to seal, affix a s., as a mark of authenticity, to a document, letter, bottle, etc.; (fig.) to seal up: close for security, as a closing a letter by means of gum or wafer; (cf. masonar); sigi(ad)o (act) sealing; sigiuro (imprint) seal; sigiilo (instr.) seal; sigianto, sigiisto sealer: sigiovaxo sealing wax; sigioringo signet ring.

signo (natural or artificial) sign, mark (cf. indikajo, indico); signizar to put a s. on (ulo, ulu); signifar to make signs; tempo signo sign of the times; facar kruco signo to make the s. of the cross; krucosignizar su to cross oneself; puntizo signo s. of punctuation; kapo signonod or shake of the head; zodiakala signo s. of the zodiac. Ex.: Vorti esas signi di idea. Muti parolas (od, signalifas) per signi. Signi aparis en la cielo.
signalar (tr.) to signal: convey (ulo) by s.; signalizar to hoist signals on (a mast,etc.), to cover with signals; to write or put a s. (on a tree, etc.); signalifar to make signals.

signatar (tr.) to sign, subscribe (one’s name), put signature to (cf. subskribar); signato signing (by name); signaturo signature; signaturo blanka signature in blank; signatajo what is signed, the document; stereotipa (odklishita) signaturo stamped facsimile of a signature. Def.: Skribar sua nomo por certigar od autentikigar dokumento; V-494.

signifikar (tr.) to signify, mean; signifiko signification, meaning; signifikanta, signifikiva significant, significative; sen signifika insignificant (cf. senvalora, neimportanta). Ex.: Quon signifikas ta vorto? Bona defini establisas la signifiki di la vorti. V. exp.: vid. senco.
sikar dry, dried: free from moisture; sikeso dryness, drought: sikigar, sikeskar to dry (up), desiccate; sikigiva desiccative, siccative, drying. Ant.: humida.
sikio sickle. Def.: «Falchileto», t.e. longa streta lameno kun mi-cirklatra formo, quan on uzas (od uzis) por tranchar ex. la frumento; VI-538.
sikomoro (bot.) sycamore (-tree) genus: Ficus Sycamorus.
silo silo: pit for ensilage.
silabo syllable; silabala syllabic; silabigar to separate into s.s.; to spell by s.s.; du silab silaba vorto a word of two s.s.

silencar (intr.) to be silent: not to make noise; silencigar to silence (a machine etc.); silenco silence, stillness; silencanta, silencoza, silencema silent, still; silencez stop that noise! Ex.: La mashino silencis. Dum la silenco di la nokto. Foresto silencoza. V. exp.: Taco esas absenteso di parolado; silenco absenteso di bruiso. Ant.: bruisar.
silepso* (gram.) syllepsis.
silexo silex: pure quartz, flint; silexatra flintlike; pafilala silexo gun-flint. Ex.: La primitiva homi facis sua hakili ek silexo.
silfo, silfino, silfulo sylph.
silico (chem.) silica.
siliko (chem.) silicon; silikato silicate; silikatacido silicic acid. Def.: La kemiala elemento Si; V-159.
siliquo (bot.) silique; siliqueto silicle.
silko silk; silka (made of) silk; silkajo, silka stofo s. goods; silkofilo s. thread; silkokulturado s. culture; silkoraupo silkworm.
silogismo syllogism; silogismala syllogistic(al).
silogistiko* syllogistic: a department of logic.
silueto silhouette, profile in black.
siluro (ich.) silurid, silure, sheat-fish, cat-fish (genus: Silurus).
siluriana* (geol.) Silurian.
silvo forest of fully-grown lofty trees.
silvano (myth.) sylvan: god, Sylvanus: wood deity.
silvio (orni.) garden warbler, white-throat (species of Sylvia).
simaro simar: (of priests) cassock; (cf. sutano); (justice’s) robe; a former long gown worn by women.
simbioso* (biol.) symbiosis.

simbolo symbol, emblem, sign; simbola, simbolala, simbolatra symbolic(al), typical, emblematic; simbolismo (philos.) symbolism; simbolizar to symbolize; simbolesar to be symbolized (da ulo). Ex.: La balanco esas la simbolo dil yusteso. La glavo simbolizas la lego.
simboliko* symbolics, symbolism.

simetra symmetrical: which corresponds in proportion, position; simetreso symmetry; simetresoza symmetrical: full of symmetry; simetrigar to symmetrize: reduce to symmetry; ne simetreso asymmetry. Ex.: Simetra aranjo di vazi. Simetreso di diskurso. Simetra arkitekturo.
simfizo* (anat., zool.) symphysis.
simfonio symphony.
simio (general term) simian: ape, monkey, baboon, etc.; simialajo an ape-like trick.

simila similar, like; (plural) alike (ad);simil(ul)o a like person; a fellow creature; simileso similarity, similitude; similajo (objective) a s. thing, a similarity; similigar to render s., to assimilate (cf. asimilar); similesar to be s., be alike, resemble; simile in like manner; ne simila unlike, dissimilar; sen simila matchless (cf. sen similegala). Ex.: Vizaji, kozi, anguli simila. Ebriemeso similigas la homo a la bruto.
simoniar (intr.) to practice simony; simonio simony. Def.: Simonio komerco kontre-etika di la sakra kozi: III-332.

simpatiar (tr., moral and physical) to sympathize with, have sympathy for (ulu); (phys.) be in sympathy with; simpatiala sympathetic: relating to s.; simpatioza sympathetic: full of s., congenial; simpatiinda which inspires sympathy; inter simpatiar to mutually sympathize; Ex.: Simpatiala vibri, soni. Simpatioza sentimento, amiko. Simpatiinda povrulo. Merkurio simpatias la oro. Me simpatias vu pro vua desfortuno. Ant.: antipatiar.
simpatikar* (phisiol.) sympathetic (nerve).

simpla simple: not complex or complicated; easy; (of dress) plain, common; simpleso simplicity; plainness; simple simply, with simplicity; (plu) simpligar to simplify; simpleskar to become simplified; simpla soldato common soldier, private; Ex.: L’oro, l’arjento, la fero esas simpla korpi. Mekanismo, metodo nekomplikita esas simpla. Simpla stilo, gusti. Simpleso di mori, di vestaro. Vestizar simple. Plu-simpl-igar problemo. Ant.: komplexa, kompozita, komplikita.
simptomo (med. and fig.) symptom: simptoma, simptomatra symptomatic. Ex.: Simptomo di anemio. (fig.) Simptomo di revolto.
simular (tr.) to simulate (cf. fingar, imitar); simulachar to ape; simulita paco fictitious peace. Def.: Aparigar kom reala ulo quo ne esas tala. Ex.: Simular kombato, maladeso.
simultana common, co-existing, co-equal, simultaneous. V. exp.: Qua valoras egale e kune, solidare, ex.: equacioni simultana. Konseque simultana ne esas sinonimo di samtempe. Dec. 1212, VII-66

sino intimate place, internal part, close or secret receptacle: (fig. senses of) bosom, heart (midst), womb. Ex.: En la sino dil eklezio. En la sino di la tero. La sino di Deo. En la sino di sua familio.
sinagogo synagogue.
sinapo (bot.) mustard (-plant) (genus: Sinapis).
sinapismo sinapism: mustard-plaster, -poultice.
sinartroso* (anat.) synarthrosis.
sincera sincere, frank, honest; sincereso sincerity; ne sincera insincere. Ex.: Homo, amikeso, regreti, laudo sincera. Sincereso esas valoroza qualeso. Ant.: hipokrita.
sindiko syndic: a municipal officer; manager, business agent (of corporation, company); administrative assignee (of an insolvent’s estate).

sindikato (industrial, finan.) syndicate; sindikatismo syndicalism; sindikatisto (partisan) syndicalist; sindikatano member of a s.; sindikatigar, sindikatifar to s. Def.: Grupo formacita por la defenso di sua ekonomikala interesti komuna.
sinekdoko (rhet.) synecdoche.
sinektika* synectic.
sinekuro sinecure. Def.: Ofico sen responsiveso o devi.

singla each (= every single individual); singlu each one, every single one; single singly; singla karti single cards; li venis single they came singly (one by one); dek centimi po singla a penny apiece. Ex.: A singla dio lua tasko. Singla spozulo havas spozino. Ica libro kustas single kin franki. Singla soldato havas fusilo, od, singla soldati havas fusilo (o mem fusili) signifikas: un fusilo ad un soldato. V. exp.: Omna, singla: Omna havas senco kolektiva; singla havas senco distributiva. Ex.: Omnu parolis, singlu en sua linguo (E. everyone spoke, each in his own language). Omna testo juris dicar la verajo, e singlu naracis la evento diverse (E. every witness swore to tell the truth, and each one related the event differently); Generale, singla (quale L. singulus) signifikas: un po un, unope (pro to ta pronomo dicesas «distributiva»; kp. II-665. Note: «Omna singla» is a pleonasm, singla being sufficient to translate «every single». The E. «single» in the sense of alone, is to be translated by sola, izolita, unika, separita. Both omnaandsingla may be used with the singular and the plural with the same sense. «Every soldier is brave» may be trnaslated: Omna soldato esas brava. Omna soldati esas brava. Singla soldati esas brava.
singlutar (intr.) to sob.

singulara singular: pertaining to one (cf. stranja); singularo (gram.) s. number; singulareso (quality), singularajo (something pertaining to one) singularity, peculiarity. Ex.: Verbo en la singulara nombro (od, en la singularo). Singulara propoziciono, ideo, kazo. Singulareso di opiniono. Singularajo en la manieri di ulu.

sinior(ul)o lord, highness, seignior, sire (of rulers); sir (of lords); (cf. sioro); siniorino noble lady, Lady; sinioreso seigniory, lordship; siniorala seignioral, lordly; Nia Sinioro (rel.) our lord; mea sinioro your lordship; sinioro rejido his royal highness; sinioro episkopo his eminence, the bishop; sinioro prezidanto his excellency, the president.
sinistra left; (nav.) port; sinistra latero left side; sinistruzero left-handed person; turnez (ad) sinistre turn to the left. Ant.: dextra.
sinkopar (intr., med.) to swoon; sinkopigar (gram., mus.) to syncopate; sinkopo (gram., mus., med.) syncope.
sinkretismo, sinkretisto (philos.) syncret-ism, -ist.
sinkrona* (phys.) synchron-al, -ous (cf. samtempa, kronologiala); sinkroneso synchronism; sinkronigar to synchronize.
sinodo (eccl.) synod.
sinodika* (astron.) synodic.
sinonima synonymous: sinonimo synonym; sinonimeso synonymy: quality of being a s. Ant.: antonimo.
sinoptika synoptic(al). Ex.: Sinoptika tabelo di cienci. La sinoptika evangelio.
sinovio (anat.) synovia.

sinso direction (one way); (math.) sense: one of two opposite directions; sam, kontresinsa, sinse same, contrary direction. V. exp.: Direciono, sinso Konsiderez rekto delinita per du punti A e B. La rekto infinita reprezentas un direciono, qua esas komuna ad ol e ad omna rekti paralela; ma ol havas du sinsi, en qui on povas imaginar la movo di punto sur olu: la sinso de A ad B, e la sinso (inverso o kontrea) de B ad A. Sur mapo on kustumas indikar la sinsi per flechi. On direktas automobilo en ula direciono per la direktilo. E sen tushar la direktilo, sen chanjar do la direciono, on povas movar ol en du sinsi: ad-avane e ad-dope; V-264
sintaxo (gram.) syntax.
sintezo (log., math., chem.) synthesis; –ala, ema synthetic; sintezar to synthesize. V. exp.: Sintezo esas l’ago inversa di analizo. Kemiala sintezo, metodo sintezala. Sintezar albumino.
sinuo sinuosity, winding, bend; sinuoza sinuous, winding, meandering, serpentine, tortuous; sinuifar to wind about, meander. Ex.: La sinui di litoro, di rivero.
sinuso* (geom.) sine; (anat.) sinus: a cavity, channel.
sioro sir or madam; siorulo sir, Mr., gentleman; siorino Mrs., Miss, madam, lady (married or not); (cf. sinioro, damzelo, damo); gesiori ladies and gentlemen.

sireno siren: powerful whistle; (acoustics) a measuring instrument for air vibrations; (myth.) sea-nymph, mermaid; (fig.) a seductive woman; sirenala, sirenatra voco, kanto (fig.) a siren (bewitching, fascinating) voice, song.
siringo syringe, squirt; siringagar to syringe, squirt (with a s.).
siroko (wind) sirocco.
siropo syrup; siropala, siropatra syrupy; rib siropocurrant s.
sis six; sisadek sixty; siso a half dozen (Note: For other derivative forms cf. du).

sisar (intr.) to hiss; to siss, sizzle; sisanta, sisanto sibilant. Def.: Produktas la sono sss…od fff…, t.e. bruiso ne-muzikala, qua esas fonetike konsonanto; VII-207. Ex.: Serpenti, gansi sisas. V. exp: Lokomotivo siflas per sua siflilo, e samtempe sisas emisante vaporo ek la kaldiero o la cilindri, tra robineti, ma ne siflante.
sismo* earthquake, vibration of the earth; sisma, sismala seismic.
sismografo seismograph. Def.: Instrumento por enskribar la ter-tremi; VI-135.
sismologio seismology.
sismometroseismometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la ter-tremi.
sismoskopo* seismoscope.

sistemo system; sistemala (tendency) sistemema systematic, methodical (cf. metodala, sistemoza); sistemigar to systematize. Ex.: La sistemo di Descartes. Planetala sistemo, od planetosistemo, od planetaro. Il esas persono tre sistemema. Sistemigar sua idei, sua dokumenti.
sistematiko* systematizing: scientific (or efficient) disposition; labo(u)r saving arrangements.
sistolo* (anat., gram.) systole. Ant.: diastolo.
sistro* sistrum: Egyptian musical instrument.
sitelo pail, bucket; siteledo bucketful.

situar (tr.) to place, seat, locate (ulo, ulu) (cf. jacar, pozar, plasizar, lokizar); -o, situeso situation, site location; situita situate(d). Ex.: Domo, urbo bone situita (o kun bona situeso). Dramatatra situeso. Situeso bona, mala, embarasiva. V. exp.: Situeso, relate personi, esas generale acidentala, tempala; la stando esas kustumale permananta. On trovas sua aferi en neagreabla situeso, qua forsan developos a permananta mala stando.
sivo sieve, sifter (for flour, etc.); strainer (for liquids) (cf. kriblo, filtrar); sivagar (tr.) to sift, bolt, strain; (fig.) to examine minutely, separate the good from the bad; to winnow.

sive (1) whether; (2) either; (1) sive ... sive (alternative and condition) whether … or whether; sive vu parolas, sive vu tacos, vu esos blamota whether you speak, or whether you are silent, you will be blamed; (2) me drinkos, sive biro, sive vino I shall drink beer or wine (N.B. In the last example it is to be noted that sive is equivalent to od…od). V. exp.: Sive, od Sive implikas sempre (segun etimologio origino: L. sive = si-ve = od se) supozo, kondiciono, konseque ne-certeso o questiono. Sive vu parolos, sive vu tacos, t.e. se vu parolos, o se vu tacos. Od expresas simpla alternativo; III-689, VIII-409.

sizar (tr.) to sieze, gripe, catch or lay hold of; (fig.) to take, grasp quickly, apprehend (arrest); to distrain (property); sizilo griping. Def.: prenar o manukaptar vivace e vigoroze ulu, ulo. ex.: Sizar l’espado per la pinto. Sizar la brakio di ulu. Sizar la havajo di ulu. Sizar oportuna instanto (o tempo). Sizar pretexto. Teroro sizis la menti. La febro sizas me.
sizigio* (astron) syzygy.
skabelo (wooden-) stool, foot-stool (cf.tabureto). Def.: Moblo por la pedi, o por acensar sur olu; II-647.
skabio (med.) scabies, itch; (of animals) mange; skabiala, skabiatra, skabioza scabious; skabiika, skabiiko (person, animal) infected with itch; (N.B. A scab on a sore is to be translated by krusto).
skabino alderman; ( F. echevin).
skabioso (bot.) scabious (genus: Scabiosa).
skafandro diving suit (with helmet, etc.); skafandriero, skafandristo diver. Def.: Plunj-vestaro kompleta kontenanta homo tota; III-267.

skalo ladder; scale: instrument of measurement; (math., mus.) scale; skalatre ladder-like; in gradation; skalogrado round rung (of a ladder); skalatre dispozar to arrange in gradations; (milit.) to draw up in echelon; kordo skalo rope ladder; helpar ulu kom skalo to act as a ladder for someone to mount; skalacensar to climb a ladder; skalo aritmetikala arithmetic scale; skalo socialasocial scale; laborar ye granda skalo to work on a large scale; skaloplako dial-face (for dials other than those with numbers; cf. cifroplako).
skalaro* (math.) scalar.
skalena* (geom.) scalene.
skalpar (tr.) to scalp: deprive of s.; skalpo scalping; skalpajo s.: skin on top of the head.
skalpelo (surg.) scalpel.
skamoneo (bot.) scammony (Convolvulus scammonia).
skandar (tr.) to scan (verse); skandovergo, skandobastoneto orchestra leader’s baton.

skandalar (tr.) to scandalize, shock, offend (ulu); skandalesar to be scandalized (da, pri); skandalo scandal(izing); skandalanta, skandaloza, skandaliva scandalous. Ex.: Lua konduto skandalis la tota urbo.
skapulo (anat.) scapula, omoplate; skapulparto shoulder-blade.
skapulario* (rel.) scapular(y).
skarabeo (ent.) scarab, horn-beetle (genus: Scarabæus).
skaramucho scaramouch; (fig.) cowardly buffoon. Def.: Persono di la komedio Italiana; IV-583.
skarifikar (tr., surg.) to scarify (the skin of someone). V.exp.: tranchar.
skarlata, skarlato scarlet (colo(u)r).
skarlatino (med.) scarlatina: scarlet fever.
skarmuchar (intr.) to skirmish, to have a brush with the enemy.
skarsa scarce: not plentiful; scanty (cf. rara, desdensa); skarseso scarcity. Def.: Desabundanta; V-595. Ant.: densa, abundanta.
«skat» (card game) skat.
skeleto (anat.) skeleton.

skemo schema, scheme: systematic plan; outline or demonstration of a system, showing relations and functions; (N.B. not «scheme» project); skemala, skematra schematic; skemifar, skemizar to schematize.
skeno hank, skein; skenuno one of the threads of a skein.
skeptika, skeptik(ul)o sceptic(al); (cf. nekredema); skeptikeso (spirit of) scepticism; skeptikismo scepticism: doctrine of the sceptics.
skerco (mus.) scherzo.
skermar (intr.) to fence: pracrtise sword-play; skermartoart of f.; skermodocanto; skermomaestro fencing-master, a master of fencing.
sketar (intr.) to skate; sketilo a skate.
skio skee, ski; skikurar, skiglitar to skate on skees. Def.: Speco de sketilo longa, ligna, por kurar e glitar sur la nivo; IV-707.
skiro* (med.) scirrhus: a hard tumo(u)r.

skisar (tr.) to sketch, outline, make a rough draft of; (fig.) to delineate: give the plan or idea of; skiso, skisuro sketch, outline; (rough) drawing. Ex.: Skisar peizajo, portreto, (fig.) poemo. Skisar demarsho. Skisuro di romano. V. exp.: vid. esbosar.
skismo schism; skismano, skismana schismatic(al).
skisto (min.) schist, slate (cf. ardezo).

sklavo, sklavulo, sklavino slave; sklavala, sklavatra, sklavema slave, slavish, servile; -eso, sklavatreso, sklavigo, sklavesko slavery, servility, servitude, bondage; sklavesar to be a s., be in slavery; sklavigar to enslave, enthrall (ulu); sklavisto partisan of slavery; sklavigisto slaver.
sklerotiko* (anat.) sclerotic.

skolo school: a place or establishment where instruction is given, usually elementary; disciples or followers of some teacher or doctrine in art, philosophy, -etc.; skolala school, academic; skolo komuna common s.; skolo di kavalko arto riding school; skolo militala military academy, school; skolo yurocienco law s.; skolo di Platon s. of Plato; skolano schoolchild, pupil, scholar (cf. erudito, ciencisto, lernanto, stipendiero, dicipulo); skolestro schoolmaster; aplik skolo technical school or college, polytechnic, trade s.; aplikoskolo di artilrio artillery s.
skolastika, skolastik(ul)o scholastic, schoolman; skolastikismo scholasticism.
skolio (lit., geom.) scholium. Def.: Komento od expliko di texto; matematikal expliko di teoremo; IV-583.
skoliasto scholiast, annotator.
skolopendro (ent.) scolopendra, the genus of centipedes.

skopo that at which one aims; aim, scope, objective, intent(ion), purpose, view, goal, butt, object to attack; skopoplako target; skopopunto bull’s eye. Ex.: Vizar skopo per flecho. Frapar la skopo per kuglo. Atingar sua skopo di vivo. Mariajar su esis la skopo di elua esforci. Pafar a la skopo-plako.
skopso (orni.) scops, eared owl (Scops Aldrovandi).
skorbuto (med.) scurvy; skorbutala, skorbutatra scorbutic: relating to the disease; skorbutika, skorbutiko (person) affected with s.
skorio (metal) scoria, dross, slag; skoriigar to scorify: reduce to s.
skorpiono (ent., also astron.) scorpion.
skorzonero (bot.) viper’s grass (genus: Scorzonera).
skotisho (dance) schottish.
skovelo* cannon-sponge, -swab; skovelagar to sponge (a cannon).

skrachar (tr.) to scratch, claw, graze, gall; (of ropes) to chafe; (of clothing) to make a rent in; (cf. lacerar, gratar, skrapar, exkoriar). Def.: Facar sek(et)o en la pelo (od altra surfaco), do vundeto; IV-656. V. exp.: La ungli di kato skrachas bonege, ma nule exkorias. Me tante gratis me, ke me fine skrachis me.

skrapar: (tr.) to scrape (with a tool), scrape off, abrade; (of chimneys) to sweep; to scale off; skrapuri scrapings. Def.: Deprenar gratante per instrumento ula parti de la surfaco di korpo. Ex.: Skrapar anciena pergameno. La stono skrapis la pelo. Skrapar kraso de la pelo, o fango de la vestaro.
skreno screen; fairo –o fire-screen.

skribar (tr.) to write (ulo, ad ulu); skrib(ad)o, skriburo (act, result) writing; skriburo santa Holy Scriptures; skribformo, skribmaniero form or manner of writing; skriba being written, being in writing; skribajo what is written: written paper, document; skribala relating to the writing; skribe in writing; skribita written; skribanto, skribinto writer; skribisto professional writer, scribe (N.B. not author; cf. autoro); skribilo a writing instrument, pen, etc.; skribilaro stand for ink and pens; collection of writing instruments, pens; enskribar to inscribe; enskriburo inscription; skribachar to scrawl, scribble; skribkuseno a pad to write upon; skribmashino typewriter; mashinskribar to typewrite; skribtablo writing-table, -desk.
skrofulo (med.) scrofula, king’s evil; skrofulala, skrofulatra scrofulous: relating to the disease; skrofulika, skrofuliko scrofulous (person).
skroto* (anat.) scrotum.
skrupulo (moral) scruple, qualm; skrupuloza, skrupulema scrupulous. Ex.: Havar skrupulo pri ulo. Homo sen-skrupula.

skudo (e)scutcheon; (Italian money) scudo; skudoforma scutiform: shield-shaped. Def.: Speco di shildo, mikra, portanta la blazono di ulu; e konseque, irga planko shild-forma e portanta blazono, imajo o sur-skriburo; V-432.

skultar (tr.) to sculpture, carve (ulo, en, ek); skult(ad)o; skultarto; skulturo sculpture; skultisto, skultero sculptor, carver. Def.: Produktar statuo en korpala naturaleso od en vera reliefo; VII-414. V. exp.: On povas ex. cizelar kapo (vizajo) homala segun la perspektivo, ma on skultas ol donante ad ol la reala formo. On cizelas perspektiva figuro sur bloko, on gliptas reala figuro sur bloko, ma on skultas figuro de bloko, t.e. on transformas la bloko a ta figuro korpala; VII-414.
skunero (nav.) schooner; skunero kinmasta a five-masted s. Def.: Navo kun seglo-rigaro ne transversa ma longesala.
skurar (tr.) to scour, furbish: to cleanse by scrubbing; skuristo scourer; scullion. Def.: Destruktar e forprenar partikli o despuraji de la surfaco di ula korpo per friciono; III-163.
skurelo (zool.) squirrel (genus: Sciurus).
slamo slimo, mire, ooze, silt; slameyo miry place, slough, mudhole, quagmire (cf. marsheto); slamizar to cover with, choke up with fine oozy mud or silt.
slango slang; slangar to speak s. (cf. jargono, galimatiaso). Def.: Linguo specala, konvencionala e plu o min sekreta, propra a profesiono od a societo klozita (studenti, raptisti); VII-158.
Slavo Slav, Slavonian; la Slava (lingui) the Slav(onian) languages.
slingo noose, sling, snare, loop (cf. glitnodo, lazo). Def.: Nodo en kordo, e.c. ne forsita per tiro; III-288.
slipo slip (of a screw-propeller); (cf. ripar).
slupo (nav.) sloop. Def.: Speco de seglo-navo kun un masto; IV-583.

sluzo lock, sluice; sluzpordo lock-, sluice-gate; sluzbaseno l. chamber; sluzisto l. keeper; sluzagar to take (a boat, ship) through a l.; to open a l. for a boat; sluzo di muelilo mill-dam, penstock.
smalto smalt: a deep-blue glass (often pulverized).
smeraldo (min.) emerald.
smerilo (min.) emery; smerilagar to polish with e.; smerilpulvero e. powder; smerilpolvo e. dust; smerilpapero e. paper.
snapar (tr.) to snap, snatch: bite or catch suddenly with the teeth ( as a dog) or with beak (as a bird). Def.: Kaptar bruske per la boko; IV-512.
snortar (intr., of horses) to snort: blow through the nose (cf. sternutar, mungar).

sobrar (also fig.) temperate: moderate in food or drink; sparing, abstemious, sober; (cf. neebria, temperema, sobrmoderema); sobreso temperance, sobriety, moderation; sobresala societo temperance society; sobre soberly, with sobriety. Ex.: La homo qua ne exajeras manjante, drinkante, qua esas moderema e su-dominacanta, esas sobra persono. Esar sobra en parolado, en laudado.

socio society (in general) community: any large body of persons or living beings living a community life; societo society (formed for a particular object), association; (com.) company, partnership (cf. firmo); sociano member of a (large) society; citizen; societano member of an association; sociala social: relating to society; societala relating to an association; sociema sociable; sociemeso sociability, good fellowship; socialismo socialism; socialista, sociala socialist. Ex.: Omnu havas devi a la socio. Abeli vivas en societi. Societi komercal, literaturala, ciencala.
sociologosociologist.
sociologio sociology.
sociso (large, long) sausage; sociseto a small s.
sodo (chem.) soda: sodium carbonate (cf. natro); sodaquo soda water.
sodomiar (intr.) to commit sodomy.
sofao sofa. V. exp.: vid. kanapeo, divano.
sofismo sophism, (conscious) fallacy; sofismala sophistical (cf. sofistala). V. exp.: vid. paralogismo.
sofisto sophist; sofistala sophistical (cf. sofismala).
sofistiko sophistry.
sofito (arch.) soffit; sofiti (theat.) flies.
soko sock: plowshare.
soklo (arch.) socle (cf. piedestalo, plinto).

sokursar (tr.) to succo(u)r: to come to the aid of when in danger; sokursarmeo relief army. Ex.: Sokursar ulu dronanta. V. exp.: Sokursar signifikas irar rapide e kurajoze helpar ulu, uli, en situeso di minacanta danjero; on helpas ulu en desfortunoza o perturbita situeso per la donaco di adicionala forci o moyeni. On sokursas amiko en batalio; on helpas la povri, falinto.
sol (mus.) sol: fifth note of diatonic scale.

sola alone; without company, sole, only (cf. nura, unika, solitara); soleso solitude; solisto (mus.) soloist; solo (mus.) solo. Def.: Qua esas ne-akompanata; izolita. Ex.: Il esas sola en la chambro. Unu sola ne povas facar to. Laborar sole. Il esas sola en solitara loko.
solano (bot.) nightshade (genus: Solanum).
soldar (tr.) to solder (metals); soldilo soldering-iron; soldostano (metal) solder; kun soldita soldered together. V. exp.: vid. weldar.
soldato soldier, trooper; soldatala, soldatatra soldierly; soldato (simpla) an ordinary s., a private.
soleo (ich.) sole (genus: Solea); soleo*, solea muskulo (anat.) soleus: a leg muscle.
solecismo solecism.
solena solemn; soleneso, solenajo (quality, art) solemnity; solenigar to solemnize. Ex.: Solena festo, vovo, dio, tono, vizajo.
solenoid solenoid.
solfejar (tr., mus.) to (sing) sol-fa: sing the notes of the scale; solfejo sol-faing; solfeggio.
solio threshhold (of a door, of a window; also fig.), door-soll. Ex.: (fig.) la solio di vivo.

solicitar (tr.) to solicit: earnestly apply for (cf. suplikar, peticionar); solicitema solicitous (cf. suciema); solicitanto, solicitero, solicitisto solicitor, canvasser. Def.: Insistoze demandar. Ex.: Solicitar audienco, employeso, ofico, favoro. Segun la solicito (di). Solicitero por voti.

solida (also geom.) solid: not liquid; (fig.) firm, substantial, sound; solido, solidajo a s. body; (geom.) a s. figure; solideso solidity, stability; solidigar (tr.) solideskar (intr.) to solidify; plu solidigar to consolidate. Ex.: Solida korpo, angulo, nutrivi, edifico. (fig.) Motivi, argumenti solida. La solideso di domo. Koldeso solidigas aquo. Ant.: liquida, fluida, frajila.

solidara (jur. and gen.) solidary: jointly and severally responsible or liable; binding upon every one; solidare conjointly, jointly and severally; solidareso solidarity, joint responsibility; (fig.) coherence, fellowship, community of interests; solidarigar to make jointly liable; to unite the interests of (cf. konsolidar). Ex.: Solidara obligaciono. La spozulo esas solidara por la debaji di sua spozino. Asociiti en komercal societo esas solidara. (fig.) La solidareso en la interesti di omna laboristi.
solipeda, solipedo (zool.) soliped(ous).

solitara (of places) solitary, lonely, deserted; (of persons) (living) alone; solitareso loneliness, solitude. V.exp.: Solitara esas ulo plu kam sola, mem kam solesema to esas: «qua restas kustume tote sola ed izolita». Exempli: Solitar querko stacas meze di la planajo. On povas anke parolar pri solitara loko; to nule esus sinonima si dezerta ex.: «ta solitara templo esas frequentata da multa pilgrimanti.» Solitareso expresas la L. solitudo. On povas vivar sola, mem en urbo; to ne esas vivar solitara od en solitareso. On anke havas la substantivo solitaro por persono; V-101.
solitero (game amd gem) solitaire.
solstico solstice; solstico vintrala winter solstice.

solvar (tr.) to solve (a problem, etc.) (cf. dissolvar); solvaruro (also physical) solution; solvarajo what is to be solved, the problem; solvarebla (also phys.) solvable; soluble, dissolvable. Ex.: Solvar problemo, desfacilajo. La rezultajo di dis-solvo di sukro per aquo esas sukroza (dis-)solvuro.
solventa (fin.) solvent; solventeso solvency; ne solventa insolvent (cf. bankrotar). Def.: Pago-kapabla; II-76.
somato* (biol.) soma.
somero summer.

somito (geom., also of trees, mountains, etc.) summit, top. V. exp.: La suprajo ne esas sempre nek necese la somito, nam ol povas esar larja e plana; on ne parolas pri la «somito» di moblo, di (plata) domo. La suprajo di la tero tote ne identesas kun la somiti di la monti; II-163.
somnambula, somnambulala; somnambul(ul)o; somnambuleso somnambulist-ic, -ism.

somnolar (intr.) to be sleepy, drowsy; somnolo somnolence; somnolanta, somnolema sleepy, drowsy; somnolegar to be overpoweringly sleepy. Def.: Sentar la bezono o tendenco (momentala) dormar; IV-463. V. exp.: Dormema indikas kustumala tendenco a dormar, ne instantala stando.

son(ad)ar (intr.) to sound: emit a sound; (of clocks) to strike; sonigar to ring (ulo); (cf. tinklar); sono sound, ring, striking: sonludilo rattle. Ex.: La horlojo sonas. Sonigar la korno. Sonigar (ulo) por la retreto, por servisto, por la dineo. EFIS
sonalio small bell (as used on the harness of horses). Def.: Instrumento sonora, en formo di bulo kava, fendita, qua sonas per la bulo agitata interne; IV-14.
sonato (mus.) sonata; sonateto sonatina.

sondar (tr., intr.) to take soundings in; (gen.) to sound: ascertain the depth of, explore the nature of the bottom; to fathom; (fig.) to try, test; (med.) to probe (with a probe), to sound (with a sound); (mining) to make a boring; sondilo (nav.) sounding-line, -lead; (surg.) probe; sound; jetar la sondilo to heave the lead. Ex.: Sondar rivero, tereno, vunduro, veziko (fig.) l’intenci di ulu.
soneto sonnet.
sonjar (intr.) to dream (while asleep; cf. revar). Ex.: Me dormis e sonjis ke me esis richa.
sonko (bot.) sow-thistle (genus: Sonchus).
sonora sonorous, resonant; sonoreso sonorousness. Ex.: Sonora voco, linguo. Ant.: matida.
soporto (mechan.) bearing.
soprano (voice, person) soprano, treble.
soquo* sock: shoe used by actors in ancient comedy.
sorbo (bot.) sorb-apple, mountain-ash berry; sorbiero sorb-tree, service tree, mountain-ash, rowan tree (genus: Sorbus).
sorbeto sherbet: a water ice.

sorcar (intr.) to practise sorcery, witchcraft; (tr.) to bewitch; (ulu, ulo) (fig.) to charm, enchant; sorc(ad)o sorcery, witchcraft; sorceso (state) bewitchment; enchantment; sorcilo charm; sorcisto sorcerer: one who is supposed to be in league with evil spirits; (fig.) wizard, conjuror, magician; sorcistino witch. Ex.: On ankore trovas kredo ad sorcado inter la populi savaja. (fig.) Ta muliero sorcas me.

sordida, sordidega, sordidacha (of things) dirty, nasty, foul, soiled, sordid, slovenly, sluttish; (fig. of persons, acts) mean, disgusting (cf. shaminda, pudora); sordideso, sordidajo (quality, object) dirtiness, filthiness: dirt, filth; sordid(ul)o, sordidacho a dirty person; sordidigar to dirty, soil. Def.: Desneta. Ex.: Sordida aquo, linji, chambro, manui, homo, avareso.
sordino (lit. and fig.) sordino: a mute or damper on trumpet, violin, piano, etc.

sorgar (tr.) to care for (by physical acts), take care of, look after (ulu, ulo); to take pains with; sorg(ad)o care, attendance; sorgema careful, painstaking, regardful (cf. diligenta). Ex.: Konfidar ad ulu la sorgo (pri). Komisar ulu por sorgar (pri). El esas la flegisto qua sorgas il. Sorga la stilo. Sorgema laboristo. (fig.) Esar sorgema pri sua honoro, sua reputo. V. exp.: vid. suciar.
sorgumo (bot.) Indian millet (Sorghum vulgare).
sorito (log.) sorites.

sorto sort, kind: brand (of goods); sortaro assortment. (Note: For idiomatic uses of the E. «sort», «kind», cf. quaza, quala, tala, ulmaniere). Ex.: Ibe esas omna sorti di bestii. Quala viro! Il esas ulsorta (o quaza, od ulspeca) giganto.
sospirar (intr.) to sigh, heave or fetch a s.; (tr., fig.) to sigh out, breathe forth. Ex.: Sospiro pro doloro. (fig.) Sospirar versi.
«sou» sou: 20th part of a franc.

sovaja (referring to living and growing persons, plants, trees, etc.) savage: wild (living in a state of nature) not domesticated, uncivilized; (fig.) unsociable; ferocious, fierce; sovaj(ul)o a s.; sovajeso savagery, wildness; (fig.) fierceness; sovajigar, sovajeskar to make, become s. Ex.: Sovaja populi, animali. Anado sovaja (E. wild). (fig.) Mieno sovaja.
sozio double, second self, counterpart. Def.: Persono qua esas perfekte simila ad altru.
spaco space; spacala spacial; spacoza spacious, roomy. Ex.: spaco havas tri dimensioni. Hike ne esas sata spaco. Spacala relati. Spacoza chambro.
spado (tool) spade; spadagar (tr.) to spade.
spadiko* (bot.) spadix.
«spahi» spahi: Algerian horse-soldier.
spano chip (of wood, metal) (cf. raboturo). Def. Reziduo dil ago limar, rabotar o di altra tranchanta instrumento. V. exp.: vid. splito.
spanielo spaniel.
spanto a timber, rib, in the frame of a ship.
spanyoleto window-sash fastening (the ordinary bolt and catch; cf. kremono). Def.: Vekto ocilanta cirkum sua mezpunto e qua ingranas od embragas en hoki supre ed infre di la fenestro; IV-448.

sparar (tr.) to economize, save, put by, husband; (intr.) to be economical, frugal; sparegar, sparachar to be stingy, parsimonious, niggardly; sparo, sparemeso economy, thrift; sparajo what is saved, savings; sparala, spariva saving, economizing; sparema thrifty, frugal; sparkaso savings bank; sparbuxo money-box. Ex.: Sparar la revenui di la heredajo. On povas sparar tempo, kredito, forteso. Me sparis mil franki por futura uzo. Spariva procedo. Sparema mento.
sparadrapo* (pharm. Med.) cerecloth, sparadrap. Def.: Kataplasmo aglutinanta extensita sur linjo o papero. Ex.: Kovrar vunduro per sparadrapo.
sparviero (orni.) sparrow-hawk (Falco Nisus).
spasmo spasm; spasmala, spasmatra spasmodic. V. exp.: vid. konvulso.
spato (min.) spar.
spatulo (pharm.) spatula; spatulucelo spoonbill (genus: Platalea).

speco species (fig.) kind (cf. genero, sorto, qualeso); specala special: relating to s.; particular, (e)special; specvari omnaspeca all sorts of wares; specaleso (quality) peculiarity; specalajo something special, a specialty; specalisto specialist; specaligar to specialize: adopt a specialty (su, ulu); specigar to specify: designate particularly, particularize; speciganta, speciva specifying, particularizing; specific (specifika). Ex.: Homala speco. Speci esas dividata en varietati. Il esas stranja speco di homo. Specala studio. To esas specale dezirenda. La specalesi di diferanta kozi. Existas multa specalaji en la medicinala praktikado. La lego specigas to quon on darfas facar. Speciganta nomo. Specigiva (od, partikulara) instrucioni.
specifika (med., physics) specific (cf. speciganta, specifikigiva); specifiko a specific. Ex.: Graveso specifika. Esas specifika mikrobo en tuberkloso. Quinino esas specifiko kontre ula febro.
specimeno specimen, sample. Ex.: Montrar specimeno di frumento, di drapo, di vino, di insekto.
spegulo mirror, looking-glass; spegulo brulanta burning-m.; regardar su en spegulo to look at oneself in the glass; kirurgiala spegulo speculum.

spektarar (tr.) to look at or on, be a spectator of, witness; (cf. regardar, vidar, kontemplar); spektaranto spectator; spektarajo spectacle, sight, view (cf. spektaklo). Def.: Regardar longe, pasive, ma kun atenco ed intereso, quale en teatro od altra spektaklo; V-35. Ex.: Il spektis ta eventi. La aktori e la spektanti. La spektajo (od, vidajo) de ta vidpunto esis bela. Ta veneracinda viro esas spektindajo.
spektaklo (theat., etc.) spectacle, pageant, performance.
spektro (physics) spectrum.
spektroskopo spectroscope.
spektroskopiospectroscopy.
spekular (intr.) to speculate: (philos.) to theorize; (finan.) to make (financial) speculations. Ex.: Spekular pri metafizikala problemi, pri frumento.
spelto (bot.) spelt (Triticum Spelta).
spencero spencer: a short jacket.

spensar (tr.) to spend, expend; spens(ad)o spending, expenditure; spensi, spensajo expenses: sum(s) spent; spensema extravagant, spendthrift; vivar per la spensi di ulu to live at the expense of someone; asumar la spensi to finance (ulo). Ex.: Spensar pekunio, sua vigoro. Ta esas povra di qua la spensi transpasas la recevaji.
spergulo (bot.) spurry (genus: Spergula).
spermo (physiol.) sperm: animal seed; spermala spermatic, seminal (cf. seminala).
spermaceto spermaceti (used for candles, cosmetics, etc.).
spermatocito* (biol.) spermatocyte.
spermatoforo* (zool.) spermatophore.
spermatogenezo* (biol.) spermatogenesis.
spermatogonio* (biol.) spermatogonium.
spermatoreo* (med.) spermatorrhea.
spermatozoido* (bot.) spermatozoid; (zool.) spermatozoon.
spermino* (physiol. chem.) spermine.

spico spice: pepper, nutmeg, ginger, etc; (cf. kondimento, piklo); spicaro spices (collect); (fig.) groceries; spicizar to spice; spicokomerco, spicovenderio (fig.) grocery business; spic(ovend)isto grocer.
spiko (bot.) ear: spike or head of corn, grain; spikifar to ear; haro spiko tuft of hair.
spino spine, backbone; chine; spinala spinal; ruptar la spino to break the back.
spinato (bot.) spinach (Spinacia).
spindelo spindle: piece of wood used for twisting and winding thread (cf. fuzelo; bobino, ruko); spindelatra s.-shaped, s.-like.
spinelo* (min.) a spinel ruby.
spionar (tr.) to spy on (ulu, ulo); (intr.) to act as a spy; spion(ad)o spying, espionage:spionanto, spionero, spionisto spy.
spiro (geom.) a winding line like the threads of a screw, helix.
spiralo (geom.) spiral; (of a watch) hair spring; (in gen.) a spiral spring; spirala, spiralatra spiral: winding like the turns of a screw.
spireo (bot. genus) spiræa.
spiremo* (biol.) spireme.

spirito spirit: incorporeal being; spiritala spiritual; spiritisto spiritist, spiritualist: one who professes to hold intercourse with departed spirits or believes such intercourse possible; spiritismo spiritism, spiritualism: doctrine or beliefs of spiritists; spiritista, spiritala spiritistic; spiritalismo (philos.) spiritualism: a system opposed to materialism; spiritalisto spiritualist (opp. to materialist); spiritaleso spirituality; spiritaligar to spiritualize: render spiritual; Santa Spirito Holy Spirit. Def.: Pensanta ento senkorpa. Ex.: On dicas ke deo, la anjeli, la mortinta anmi esas spiriti, anke same pri imaginala enti quale fantomi, fei, e.c.
spiso spit (for roasting); spiseto skewer; spisagar to spit (meat for cooking); spisoturnilo turnspit; spisego spear (cf. lanco).
spieno (anat.) spleen (cf. splino).
splenalgio* (med.) splenalgia: stitch in side.
splendida splendid; splendideso splendo(u)r. Def.: Brilanta; belega; luxoza. Ex.: Palaco splendida. Splendideso di la suno, di la trono.
splenito* (med.) splenitis.
splinar (intr.) to be splenetic, be in low spirits; splinigar to give the blue devils to (ulu); splino spleen: hypochondriasis: morbid depression of mind; (cf. spleno).
splinto (tech.) small metal pin (used to fasten parts); (cf. stifto); fendita splinto split-pin; splintoludo (game) spilikins.
splisar (tr., nav.) to splice; splisilo splicing-fid, marlingspike. Def.: Specala maniero juntar du kordi per desplekto di l’extremaji e posa riplekto; III-86.
