splito splinter, sliver, shiver, (of metal, glass, wood, etc.); splitoza splintery; splitigar to splinter: cause to fly into splinters. V. exp.: Splito esas spano di tote nereguloza formo, dum ke spano havas formo dependanta de la materio e de l’instrumento per qua on laboras ulo; III-488.

spoliar (tr.) to spoliate, (des)spoil, rob, pillage, sack, plunder. Def.: Desposedigar ulu, ulo de ulu per fraudo, o violento; for-portar violentoze. Ex.: Spoliar orfano de lua heredajo. Spoliado di urbo. Domo spoliita.
spondeo (pros.) spondee.
sponjo sponge; sponjagar (tr.) to sponge (a garment, etc.); sponjala, sponjatra spongy.
spontana spontaneous: voluntary, self-acting, -moving. Ex.: spontana genitado. La movi di la kordio esas spontana. Spontaneso di ula ago.
sporo (bot.) spore.
sporadika sporadic; scattered; (med.) not epidemic. Ex.: Dum ta yaro aparis sporadika kazi di kolero.
sporangio* (bot.) sporangium.
sporno (natural, artificial) spur; spornoza, spornizita spurred; spornagar to spur (a horse, etc.); spornizar to put spurs on.
sporto sport; sportala, ema sporting, sportive; sportist(ul)o sportsman; sportar to take part in sport.
spoto (natural) beauty-spot, mole (on skin) (cf. plastreto); variol spoto pock-mark.

spozo spouse: either one of a married couple; spozala marital, conjugal, connubial; spozulo husband; spozino wife; spozigar to make (ulu) one’s spouse, to espouse, wed (ulu); spozuligar to wed (a husband); spozinigar (tr.), spozineskar (intr.) to wed (a wife); spoziganto person marrying, suitor; ge spozi husband and wife; grantar ulu kom spozo to give in marriage. V. exp.: vid. mariajar.
sprato* (ich.) sprat (Clupea spratus).
spricar (intr.) to spout (out), gush (forth); spricigar to cause (ulo) to spout, to throw up, dash (liquids); makulo a dash, splash (of liquid).
springar (intr.) to spring: rise upward and go forward with impetuosity; springo spring, dash, rush, leap, bound; (cf. precipitar). Ex.: Il springis e saltis super la fenco.
sproso (bot.) shoot, sprout (of a plant).
spular (tr.) to reel: wind on a spool (thread, wire, etc.).

spumo foam, froth, spume: spumacho scum (bad sense); spumifar to foam, froth; spumoza, spumatra, spumifanta frothy, seething, foaming; spumkuliero skimmer; blanka spumo white foam; maro spumo meerschaum; senspumigar to skim off foam.
sputar (tr.) to spit, spit out; sputajo spit(tle), sputum; sputuyo, sputvazo spittoon; sango sputo spitting of blood. V.exp.: vid. expektorar, salivifar, bavar.
squadro (set) square: instrument for determining right angles; T squadro T-square.
squalo (ich.) shark (genus: Squalus). V. exp.: vid. sharko.
squamo scale (of skin, fish, serpents); squamoza, squamatra scaly, squamous. Def.: La lameneti qui dependas de la pelo (di fishi, serpenti, e.c.); VI-603.
squatar (intr.) to squat down (on one’s hams or heels); (cf. blotisar).
«squatter» squatter (on land).
squilo* (bot.) squill, sea-onion (Scilla maritima).
st! hist! sh!
stabo staff (army, etc.); staboficiro s. officer.

stabila stable; stabileso stability, consistence, steadiness; stabiligar(tr.), stabileskar (intr.) to stabilize. Def.: Qua esas en stando, en situeso ferma, solida. Ex.: Stabila equilibro. Stabileso di edifico.
stablo stable (for beasts); stablofako stall (in s.); bovo stablo cattle s.; lojigar kavalo en stablo to stable a horse.

stacar (intr.) to stand (upright), be standing; stac(ad)o standing (up); being on one’s feet; stacanta, stace standing, upright, on end; stacigar to cause (ulu, ulo) to stand; staceskez stand up; stacigilo stand (as for camera, telescope, etc.). Ex.: La monumento ankore stacas. Ol stacas vertikale. V.exp.: vid. erektar.
staciono (building and place) station; R.R. depot; (R.C. rel.) station; (cf. gareyo); stacionnavo s. ship. Ex.: Fervoyala staciono. Katoliko facas sua stacioni en la kirko.

stacionara steady, stationary: not moving or changing at the time; stacionareso steadiness. Ex.: La temperaturo povas esas stacionara, anke la stando di morbi, di arti. V. exp.: Stacionara ne esas la sama ideo kam fixa ol esas plu proxima ad konstanta, ma indikas konstanteso en movo, per quaza equilibro sempre ruptebla; konstanteso di ulo, qua povas variar en omna momento, o fixeso nur semblanta e rezultanta (stacionara ondi); III-268.
stadio (Gr. measure and place for gymnastic contests) stadium.
stafilo* (bot.) bladder-nut (pod); stafiliero b.n. tree (genus: Staphylea).
stafisagro (bot.) stavesacre (Delphinium Staphisagria).
stagnar (intr.) to stagnate (of liquids); be at a standstill; stagnanta stagnant. Ex.: Stagno di aquo od stagnanta aquo. (fig.) Mea aferi, komerco stagnas.
stakiso (bot.) hedge-nettle, wound-wort (genus: Stachys; cf. vulnerario).
stalo steel; stala of steel; stalala steely; relating to s.; stalatra s.-like; stalifar (intr.), staligar (tr.) to make, convert into s.; staliferio s.works; stalaji s.wares.
stalagmito (min.) stalagmite.
stalaktito (min.) stalactite.
stamino (bot.) stamen.
stano tin; stana (made) of tin; stanoza tinny, stannic; stanizar to cover (ulo) with tin; stanfolio tin-foil; stanvazo a tin pot, pewter; kupro stano pewter. (N.B. Not tin-plate; cf. lado).
stanco stanza.

standar (intr.) to be in a certain state, relative condition; to be in good or bad health; stando state, stand, condition: state of being, manner of existing; quale vu standas? La stando di mea saneso esas bona How are you? I am well; quale vu aferi standas?How is your business? Plubonigar la stando di aferi to better the condition of a business (or of affairs). V. exp.: vid. situar.

standardo (milit.) standard, ensign, flag; standardportisto; standardiero s.-bearer (cf. flago, banero). Def.: La nacional insigno, fixigita per un vertikal latero, sive a stango (teral armeo), sive a kordo (naval armeo): III-31.

stango bar (of wood or metal), rod, pole; leg (of a table); stem (of a candlestick, etc); stock (of a key, nail, anchor); piston stango piston-rod; vito stango vine-pole; stangizar to pole (vines, etc.).
stapelio (bot.) genus: Stapelia.
staplo distributing point for goods, as a seaport or large inland city, staple-mart or entrepot.
starchar (tr.) to (stiffen with) starch; (fig.) to stiffen; starchita starched; (fig. of style) stiff, formal; starchivo starch (for linen). Def.:Rigidigar per amilo.
«starost» (title) starost.

startar (tr., intr.) to start: set going, cause to act (as a machine, train, sport). Ex.: Me startas la motoro. La motoro startas facile. On povas startar la motoro di automobilo sen departigar la veturo. Starto di konkurso.
startero starter (of a race). Def.: Ta qua direktas, imperas la departo; IV-338.
stato (political) state; statala aferi state affairs; statostroko a stroke of state policy.
statiko (phys.) statics; statikala static(al).
statistiko statistic(s); statistikala statistical; statistikisto statistician.
statuo statue; statueto statuette; marmora statuo marble s.; kavalkala statuo equestrian s.
staturo stature; staturmezurilo instrument to measure height. Def.: Alteso naturala di persono od animalo. Ex.: Alta-statura homo, od, homo di alta staturo.
statuto statute, written decree or law; by-law; article (of association; cf. lego); statutala statutory.
stearino (chem.) stearin(e).
steatito* (min.) steatite: soapstone.

stebar (tr.) to quilt, to (pad and) stitch; to stitch (with a machine); stebmashino sewing machine. V.exp.: Stebar esas sutar per mashino, quo ne esas propre sutado, nam mashino uzas generale du fili, e la sutado nur un; II-646.

stekar (tr.) to stick: thrust point in, drive in (by point); (hort.) to propagate by cuttings or slips (cf. sprosifar); stekajo (hort.) slip, cutting. Def.: Enirigar ulo en ulo per la pinto. Ex.: Stekar paliso en la sulo.

stelo (also fig. and theat.) (fixed) star; steleto small star; (print.) asterisk; stelala stellar; steloza (natural) starry: full of stars; stelizita (artificial) studded or covered with stars; spangled; stelatra, steloforma starlike, star-shaped; stelliform; stelolumo starlight; stelizar to star: stud, cover (ulo) with stars; stelaro constellation; matin stelo morning star; polo stelo polar star. V. exp.: vid. astro.
stelario* (bot.) starwort (genus: Stellaria).
steleo (archeol.) stele: a graved stone.
stelionato (jur.) stellionate: fraud in selling.
stelto, stelti stilt(s); steltirar (intr.) to walk on stilts; steltucelo, steltiero (orni.) stilt-bird (order Grallæ).
stenogfrafar (tr.) to take down (ulo) in short-hand; stenogfrafado, stenogfrafarto, stenogfrafuro (act, art, result) stenography.
stentoro (antiq.) Stentor: a person with a powerful voice; stentorala stentorian: extremely loud. Ex.: Stentorala voco.
stepo steppe: treeless (Russian) plain.
stero stere, cubic meter (metre): 35.3174 cu.ft.
stereografio stereography.
stereokamero* stereotrope; stereopticon.
steriometrio (geom.) stereometry.
stereoskopo stereoscope.
stereotipar (tr.) to stereotype; (fig.) to fix firmly or unchangeably; (cf. klishar); stereotipuro, stereotipajo stereo(plate).
stereotomio stereotomy.

sterila sterile, barren, unfruitful; (fig.) fruitless, vain; (cf. arida); sterileso sterility; steriligar to sterilize; steriligilo sterilizer; sterila roko barren rock. Ex.: Sterila persono, arboro, tereno, autoro, diskuto. Steriligar aquo, filtro, vazo. Ant.: fekunda, fertila.

sterko dung (-litter), muck (cf. dungo); sterkizar to manure, dung; sterkamaso dung-heap; sterkaquo liquid manure; sterkskarabeo (ent.) coprophagan; dung-beetle. Def.: La dungo formacita ek la exkrementi di animali (mixita kun palio); VI-248.
sterleto (ich.) sterlet (Acipenser Ruthenus).
sternar (tr.) to lay (ulu, su) down at full length.
sternumo (anat.) sternum, breastbone.
sternutar (intr.) to sneeze; (cf. snortar); sternut(ad)o sneez(e)ing, sternutation.
stertorar (intr.) to have a death rattle; to have a rattle in the throat (from respiratory trouble).
stetoskopo* (med.) stethoscope.

stifa (relationship) step-; stifa filiino step-daughter (cf. bofiliino); stifa matro step-mother (cf. bomatro); stifa fratino step-sister. V. exp.: Stifa signifikas la parenteso, qua rezultas de duesma mariajo di un de la gepatri. Mea stifa frato esas la filio de la (duesma) spozo di mea patro; do lu esas nek mea frato nek mea mifrato, nam lu havas nula patro komuna kun me. La spozo ipsa di mea patro esas mea stifa patro (patruloopatrino); lu esas tote diversa de mea bopatro (uloodstifino), qua esas patro di mea spozo (uloodstifino); VI-489.

stifto peg: small pin of wood or metal used for fastening hinges, frames, clocks, etc.; stiftagar, stiftunionar, stiftstopar to peg, fasten with pegs (ulo); stopo stifto spigot, bung-stopper (as for casks).

stigmato brand (of a hot iron); (bot.) stigma; scar of a wound (cf. cikatro); (pl. theol.) stigmata (of Christ); (entom.) stigmati (on the tracheæ); (fig.) stigma: mark of infamy; stigmatizar to mark with a brand or with scars; (fig.) to set a mark of disgrace on (ulu, ulo). Ex.: La stigmato di puniso, di la variolo, di vicio, sur la korpo di Francisko di Assisi. Variolo (e metafore, krapulado) stigmatizas la vizajo. Me stigmatizas ta aserto kom mentio.

stilo (lit., artist) style, tone, manner; diction: selection of words (cf. diciono); (bot. and antiq.) style; stileto (fig.)(surg. probe) stylet; stilisto stylist: master of style; stiloida (anat.) styloid. Ex.: Moblaro segun la stilo di Louis XIV. Stilo moderna, historiala. Ta auturo havas bona stilo.
stileto stiletto: short pointed dagger.
stilistiko stylistics. Def.: Cienco o teorio di stilo; IV-707.
stilobato (arch.) stylobate.

stimular (tr.) to stimulate, rouse, excite; to spur on, incite; to goad (oxen); (cf. ecitar); stimularivo, stimularilo stimulant, stimulus; (fig.) goad, spur. Ex.: Intereso stimulas la mento. Lua indolenteso bezonas stimulivo. Porciono stimulanta. Stimul-ilo por bovuli. Stimulita da hungro. Ant.: stuporigar.
stipo (bot.) stem, stalk (of plant); stipeto blade (of grass).

stipendio (in public schools or colleges) exhibition, scholarship, bursary (in Scotland): a sum of money granted to pay, wholly or in part, the expenses of a pupil’s education; stipendiiero a foundation scholar.
stipito* (bot.) stipe.
stiptika* styptic: stopping bleeding; (cf. astriktiva).
stipular (tr.) to stipulate; stipulo, stipuluro stipulation. Ex.: Stipular garantio. Stipuluro di kontrato.
stipulo (bot.) stipule.
stivar (tr., nav.) to stow (a cargo), trim (a hold); stivisto stevedore.
stofo stuff, fabric, tissue, cloth: any woven fabric; lana stofo woollen stuff, woollen cloth.

stoika (philos. and fig.) stoic(al): unaffected by passion; stoik(ul)o a stoic; stoikala stoical; stoikeso, stoikismo (quality, doctrine) stoicism. Ex.: Stoika vertuo. Zeno esis stoiko e docis stoikismo. Ica homo manifestas stoikeso. Stoikala doktrino.
stoko (com.) stock. Def.: Quanto de komercaji o pekunio disponebla da vendisto. Ex.: Stoko de frumento. Stoko en magazino. Stoko de oro en banko.
stolo (R.C. rel.) stole.

stono pebble, small stone, loose rock (cf. petro, roko); stonoza full of (small) stones, pebbly, flinty (of roads, etc.); stonizar to macadamize, gravel, ballast: cover with small stones; stonagar, stonasomar, stonmortigar to stone (kill); sen stonigar to clear (ulo) of stones; (fig.) stone mortinta, surda, blinda. e.c. stone dead, deaf, blind; kruda stono uncut stone, rough ashlar (opp. of quadro).
stopar (tr.) to stop up, choke up, stuff up (a hole, bottle, etc.; cf. obstruktar, obturar); stopilo stopper; stop-gap; korka stopilo cork; stopilego bung; des stopar to unstop.
storo roller-blind, spring-blind or curtain (cf. jelozio, persieno).
storaxo (bot., pharm.) storax. Def.: Speco di balzamio; IV-707.

stoterar (tr., intr.) to stammer, stutter, lisp from natural defect). V. exp.: Balbutado eventas che l’infanti, pro ne-habileso, o che l’adulti pro pavoro od altra emoco; kontre ke stoteradoesas konstanta defekto di pronuncado; IV-518.
straba squint-, cross-eyed; strab(ul)o squint-eyed person; strabeso squinting (condition), strabismus; strabesar to squint.

strado street; stradeto small s.; lane (in town); alley, court; stradangulos. corner; strado transversa cross-street; stradobubo a s. urchin; stradovendisto s. peddler; vagar tra la stradi to rove about the streets.
strandar (intr., also fig.) to strand: run aground or on shore: strandigar to run (a ship, boat) aground, to beach.

strangular (tr.) to strangle, choke, stifle, throttle (ulu); (cf. asfixiar, sufokar, garotagar); Def.: Mortigar per presar la trakeo; perdigar, haltar la respirado. Ex.: Li strangulis per kordo. Il mortis pro stranguleso. (fig.) strangular ula cienco, ula arto.

stranja strange, unusual, uncommon, odd, singular, queer (cf. baroka); stranjeso strangeness, oddness, queerness; stranjajo a strange thing, oddity, curiosity. Def.: Qua esas kontre kustumo, ordinara experienco, kustumala ordino, la komuna raciono. Ex.: Stranja dicajo, bruiso, aranjo, vivo. Esas stranja ke il ne ja advenas. La stranjeso di lua vestaro, di lua konduto.

stranjera foreign, not native; (fig.) extraneous (jur.) irrelevant; stranjer(ulo) a foreigner; stranjerajo an extraneous body; (chem., surg.) a foreign substance. Def.: Qua esas de altra naciono; qua ne apartenas ad korpo. Ex.: Stranjera lando; linguo, milito, aferi, relati. Trovar ulo stranjera (kontre-natura) en korpo. Argumento stranjera (ne-apartenanta, ne aplikebla) a la kazo, proceso, temo. Note: The E. word «stranger» is ordinarily to be translated by nekonocato He is a stranger to me: me tote ne konocas il: il esas nekonocata da me.
strapadar (tr.) to inflict strappado on (ulu).
straso strass: a brilliant glass used for artificial gems; a paste (diamond).
stratego* (antiq.) strategus: a general.
strategio strategy; strategiala strategical; strategiisto strategist. Ex.: Napoleon esis maestro do strategio. Jomini esis strategiisto. Strategiala pozicino.

streko stroke, dash (as of a pen); (print.) dash; (geom.) a straight line; streketo, juntostreko short dash; (print.) hyphen; tra strekizar to draw a line through, strike out. Ex.: On formacas ta litero per du plumo-streki. Note: The use of the streko in printing does not, as in E., indicate merely an interruption, but a change of subject or speaker; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 104; IV-533).
strenar (tr., tech.) to strain (materials).

streta narrow, strait; (fig.) limited, scanty; strete narrowly; streteso narrowness; stretigar to narrow; streteskar to become narrower, shrink; trostretigarto scant (cf. meskinigar); streta mento a narrow mind; marala stretajo a strait. Ex.: Streta voyo, rubando, enireyo. Ant.: larja.

strio stripe, stria; striizar to streak, stripe; strioza (natural), striizita (artificial) streaked, striped; strirolerorowell (of a bit). Def.: Lineo trasita o grabita sur surfaco per akutajo; lineo o tre dina kanelo (ne bendo); IV-463. Ex.: Vitro o spegulo, sur qua on frotis diamanto o silexo, havas strii. Glacierala strii. La kapo di ula skrubi esas striizita, por ke on povas manuagar li plu facile.
stridar (intr.) to produce a strident noise, to creak; stridanta strident, shrill, creaking, grating. Def.: Produktar sono akra e penetranta. Ex.: Cikadi, gondo-bendi stridas. Voco stridanta.
strigo barn-, white-, screech-owl (genus: Strix flammea). Def.: Noktala raptema ucelo di qua la facio esas ornita per plumoza koliaro kompleta; IV-296.
strigio curry-comb; strigiagar to curry (a horse).
strikar (intr., of workmen) to strike, to go on strike, quit work: strikanto striker.
striknino (med.) strychnine.
strikta strict, precise, rigorous; strikte strictly; strikteso strictness. Def.: Des-ampla; IV-434. Ex.: Strikta senco, obligo, devo, en aferi. To esas strikte vera. Strikte parolanta.
stringero (nav.) stringer.
stripo trouser-strap (under the foot).
strofo strophe.
strofoido* (geom.) strophoid.

stroko indicates a single movement, an elementary, sudden act: stroke, coup, feat; (in game) move; (fencing) thrust; (of dice) throw; (rowing) stroke; (of whips) smack; alo stroko wing-beat; (fig.) brilanta stroko striking act, brilliant feat; cizo stroko single cut with scissors; fortunoza stroko happy move, thrust, hit, etc.; piston stroko stroke of piston; perfida stroko treacherous act; preparita stroko got-up affair; probo stroko trial, first attempt; plum stroko stroke of the pen; pinsel stroko dash, stroke of brush; fola stroko foolish trick, move, act; lim(ilo) stroko stroke of a file; reto stroko cast of net; stroko di statostroke of state, violent or quick exercise of state authority; il facis la stroko he has done the deed; stroko di teatro theatrical effect; clap-trap; yunesala stroko juvenile trick; youthful act of folly; strokar to do the act called for by the ideas above defined; vu strokos pos me it is your turn after mine.
stroncio* (chem.) strontium.
stropo (nav.) strop, strap, sling (for a block, or piece of cargo); stropizar, stropligar to strop (a block); to sling (casks, etc.).
strucho ostrich (genus: Struthio [camelus]); struchovo ostrich egg.
strukturo structure: manner of building, construction, form; (fig.) disposition, arrangement. Ex.: Ta edifico havas stabila strukturo. La strukturo di la vivanta korpo, di poemo.
strumo* goitre, wen in the throat; strumoza, strumika; strumozo, strumiko goitrous (person).
studento, studentulo, studentino student; undergraduate; (cf. lernanto). Ex.: Studento pri lego. Medicin-studento.

studiar (tr., intr.) to study (ulo, pri ulo); (cf. lernar); studi(ad)o (act) study(ing); studiuro (result) a study; (paint.) sketch; studieyo place for study; studieyo di artisto studio, «atelier»; studiema studious; studiokapo a head for study (by artist); pre studiar to make a preliminary study of; par studiar to make a complete study of. Ex.: Studiar piktado, portreto, matematiko, leciono. Kurso di studii.
stufar (tr., cook) to stew; stufovazo stewing-pot; stufita bovyuno stewed veal. V. exp.: vid. stuvo.
stuko stucco; stukajo s. work; stukizar to cover with s.

stulta foolish, silly, senseless; (cf. frivola); stult(ul)o fool, booby, simpleton; (cf. naiv(ul)o); stulteso silliness, folly; stultajo silly thing; foolish act; absurdity. V. exp.: Stulta expresas ideo min forta kam stupida. Stupidesoesas kompleta manko di inteligenteso. Stulteso esas plu juste manko di sagaceso, di judikado; II-711. Ant.: saja. I
stumpo stump (of tree, limb, column, cabbage, etc.); core (of an apple); stumpigar to truncate; stumpa pedo club-foot.
stuntar (tr.) to stunt (growth of); stuntesar to be stunted; stuntita stunted. Def.: Impedar la kresko e developo di ulu, ulo; IV-512.

stupo tow; (tech.) packing (of a piston, etc.); gudrizita stupo, gudrostupo oakum; stupizar to stop or cover with tow or oakum; (nav.) to calk (caulk); (tech.) to pack (a piston, etc.); stupobuxo stuffing-box. V. exp.: vid. filaso.

stupida stupid: without intelligence; stupid(ul)o a s. person; stupidajo s. act; stupidigar to make (ulu) s.; stultify, besot, dull. Ex.: Homi obtuza e stupida. Mieno stupida. Mala traktado stupidigas infanto. V. exp.: vid. stulta. Ant.: inteligenta.
stuporo (med.) stupor; stuporigar to stupefy; stuporigiva, stuporivo stupefacient. Ex.: La stuporo de ebrieso. Opiumo stuporigas. (fig.) La mala informo stuporigas lu.
sturgo (ich.) (common) sturgeon (Acipenser Sturio); (cf. esturjono).

sturmo storm, with thunder and lightning, thunderstorm; (fig.) tumult. V. exp.: Sturmo; mala vetero konsistanta ek fulmini, tondri, akompanata o sequata generale da pluvo o grelo. Tempesto mala vetero konsistanta ek granda vento, qua sur la maro efektigas ondegi danjeroza por la navigado, e qua ofte akompanesas da pluvo. L’unesma fenomeno povas eventar sen vento; la duesma konsistas esence en vento, e povas eventar, sive sen pluvo o grelo, sive sen ula elektrala fenomeno; VIII-198.
sturno (orni.) starling (genus: Sturnus).

stuvo a stove or room used to produce hot air for drying, or hot vapo(u)r for sweating; sweating room; hot-air bath; vapo(u)r-bath; drying-room; stuvagarto dry or heat in a slow, moist heat; (med.) to foment (a wound); (cf. furnelo). V. exp.: On stufas koquajo en irga vazo klozita, e ne en stuvo. Existas stuvi humida e sika, t.e. kun o sen aquo-vaporo; II-648.

su (reflex. Pronoun, 3rd person, singular or plural; acc.: sun) self, oneself, himself, herself, itself, themselves; sua (pl.: sui) his, hers, its, their; sudicantaself-styled, so called. Ex.: Li ne konkordas inter su. Il amas sua patrino. Il ri-trovis elua libri, ma il ne povis ritrovar sui (pl.). La soldati defensis su brave. Egoisto sorgas nur por su (ipsa). Note: Su is used in the third person only and refers directly to the subject: il lavas su he washes himself; li lavas su they wash themselves; singlu por su each one for himself. But, me lavas me I wash myself; vu lavas vu you wash tourself. Su, lu: Petro pregis Karlo defensar su Peter asked Charles to defend him (su relates to Karlo who is the subject of defensar); (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 65-6).

sub (prep.) under, below, beneath; lower in place or rank; denoting subordination, dependence; sube (there) under, underneath, below; subaunder, subordinate; suba busharo underbrush. Ex.: sub la tablo. Servar sub ulu. Il havas cent soldati sub sua komando. Il esas nur suba oficiro. Suba etajo. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: super.
subadmiralo rear-admiral.
subalterna, subaltern(ul)o (milit. and fig.) subaltern (officer); (cf. subordinito).
subchefo chief-assistant.
subdelegar (tr.) to subdelegate. Def.: Donar ad altru la povo agar vice su.
subdestruktar (tr., fig.) to undermine: to injure or destroy by clandestine means (cf. minar).
subdiakono subdeacon.
subdirektanto, subero, subisto sub-manager, -director.
subdividar (tr.) to subdivide; subo, suburo subdivision.
subdocisto assistant teacher.
subcherpar (tr.) to draw off (liquors, etc., from the bottom; vid. rakar).
subemendo, suburo additional amendment, amendment to an amendment.
subentraprezisto sub-contractor; jobber.
subfarmar (tr.) to farm (land, taxes) as an under-lessee.
subgenero sub-genus.
subgrupo sub-group.
subhelpanto, subisto under-assistant.

subisar (tr.) to undergo, endure, bear; subisar tormento to undergo tortures; subisar yugo to bear a yoke; subisar destino to submit to one’s destiny. Def.: Recevar force o kontrevole; III-207. Ex.: Ica korpo subisas kompreso.
subita sudden, unexpected; subite suddenly, all of a sudden; subiteso suddenness. Def.: qua esas tote ne-previdita. Ex.: Subita morto, chanjo di la vetero.
subjacar (intr.) to lie under; subanta subjacent, underlying.
subjuntivo (gram.) subjunctive.
subjupo petticoat, (short) underskirt.
subklaso sub-class, subdivision of a class.
subkomitato subcommittee.
sublanga (anat.) sublingual.
sublietnanto sub-lieutenant; second-lieutenant; ensign.
sublima sublime; sublimeso sublimity; sublimajo sublime object. Ex.: Sublima abnego, genio.
sublimar (tr., chem.) to sublime, sublimate; sublim(ad)o sublimation; sublimato a sublimate. Def.: Vaporigar ulo e lore rikondensar ol a stando solida.
sublokacar (tr.) to under-hire, sub-rent, sublet (by tenant) (ulo, de ulu); (cf. sublugar).
sublugar (tr.) to under-lease, sub-rent (by the proprietor) (ulo ad ulu); (cf. sublokacar).
subluna sublunar(y).
submara submarine: undersea; submersed.

submisar (tr.) to reduce (ulu) to a state of submission, dependence, to subdue, subjugate; submisar su to submit, yield, succumb (cf. vinkar, domptar, cedar, subisar, prizentar, submisionar); submiso subjection (act); submiseso submission, submissiveness, compliance (cf. obediemeso); submisita subdued, subjugated. Ex.: Submisar la rebeli, sua pasioni. Me submisas me a vua decido. La submiso di la urbo. Ica populo submisesas (facis sua submiso) ed esas nun en (stando di) perfekta submiseso.

submisionar* (intr.) to (make a) tender (por, pri) (a contract, loan); submisiono tender; submisionanto, submisioninto party making tender, contract. V. exp.: Submisionar esas: propozar su por entraprezar ula laboro (generale publika), aceptante la kondicioni anuncita da la labor-donanto, e demandante ula preco. Generale, plura entraprezisti esas invitata submisionar samtempe per letri siglita e sekreta, ed on adjudikas l’entraprezo a ta qua demandas la minima preco. To esas speco di auciono, o prefere, inversajo di auciono: vice vendar a la maxim-ofranto, on «kompras» de la minim-demandanto; VI-385.
suboficiro non-commissioned officer, petty officer.

subordinar* (tr.) to (make) subordinate, subject (ulu, ulo, ad ulu, ulo); subordin(ad)o, subordineso subordination; subordinita subordinate(d); subordinito a subordinate; inferior; subordinite subordinately. Ex.: La guvernerio subordinas la civitani a la judiciisti. La legi subordinas la civitani a la judiciala oficisti. Subordinar sua volo ad altru. Mantenar subordineso en la armeo. Propoziciono subordinita. La chefo fidas a lua subordinati (od inferiori, od imperati).

subornar (tr.) to suborn: induce or instigate (ulu, uli) to do an evil deed, by bribes or the like; to bribe, tamper with; (cf. seduktar, koruptar); suborno, suborneso subornation, bribery; subornar testi to bribe witnesses; subornebla venal; subornebleso venality.
subpela subcutaneous.
subrekargo (com., nav.) supercargo.
subreptar (tr.) to obtain surreptiously; subrepto subreption; subreptala surreptitious.
subreto (theat.) soubrette, abigail.
subrogar (tr., jur.) to surrogate, subrogate, substitute.
subsidiar (tr.) to subsidize: grant a subsidy to (ulu); subsidio subsidizing, subsidy; sum granted. Ex.: Subsidiar paketboto. La subsidiajo esis 50 mili, ma mem ca subsidio ne esis suficanta.

subskribar (tr., intr.) to write below, underneath (cf. signatar); suburo what is written below; (cf. surskriburo). Ex.: Noto skribita sub texto o letro esas subskribita, quankam la subskriburo ne esas signatita da la skribinto.

substanco substance; substancala substantial (cf. esenco). Exd.: Substanci korpala, metala, liquida. Esis multa vorti ma nula substanco en la diskurso. Indemno substancala. Griza substanco di la cerebro.
substantivo (gram.) substantive, noun; substantivigar to substantivize: to convert into, or use as, a substantive.

substitucar (tr.) to substitute: put in place of another (ulu ad ulu, ulo ad ulo) (jur.) to entail (an estate); substitucato a substitute. V. exp.: A remplasas (E.: takes the place of) B = A okupas (provizore o definitive) la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di B. A remplaseskas = A prenas (komencas okupar la loko di B, pozas su od aparas en la loko di B. C remplasigas B per A = C pozas (o produktas) A en la loko antee okupita da B. En la sama kazo, C substitucas A a B, od, C remplasigas B per A (E. puts A in place of B). Praktikal regulo: Omnafoye kande la propoziciono kontenas tri termini, on devas uzar remplasigar o substitucar, ne remplasar. Uzez la prepoziciono «ad» kun substitucar, ne «per». Uzez «per» kun remplas-igar. (Substitucar un kozo ad ultra; remplas-igar un kozo per altra; do, en la pasivo: remplasata da … remplasigata per … e substitucata a ….. ); III-102. V-283; kp. suplantar, suplear.
substituto (jur.) deputy magistrate, surrogate. V. exp.: Substituto esas la nomo di ofico di persono; por la kozi ni havas surogato; IV-583.
subsumar* (tr., log.) to subsume.
substrekizar to underline.
subtaso saucer; subego salver.
subtenar (tr.) to support (by holding underneath; cf. sustenar, apogar). Ex.: Ta trabo subtenas la konstrukturo.
subtera subterranean; subajo subsoil.
subteretajo basement (below ground), underground floor or chamber.
subterfujo subterfuge (cf. pretexto, ruzo).

subtila (physical) subtile: not dense or gross; (mental) subtile, subtle: keen, sharp, acute; subtileso, subtilajo (quality, objective) subtleness, subtility; subtilachajo subtlety (in bad sense), quibble, hair-splitting distinction; subtiligar to subtilize: render fine or ethereal; to draw subtle distinctions in, refine into niceties. Ex.: Subtila veneno, polvo. Subtila intelekto, mento. La subtilaji di metafiziko. Troa subtileso nocas argumento.
subtitulo (print.) sub-heading, second title.
suburbo suburb, outskirts (of a town, city; cf. preurbo); subala suburban; subano suburbanite.
subvencionar (tr.) to grant a subvention to, subsidize; subvenciono subvention: government aid or bounty; (cf. subsidiar). Ex.: Subvenciono di teatro di la stato.

subversar (tr.) to subvert: overturn from the foundation: bring to ruin or destrucion, as by moral or political force; (cf. renversar); subverso, subverseso (act, state) subversion, ruin; subversanta, subversiva, subversema subversive. Ex.: Ta doktrino subversas la principi di etiko. Subverso di la stato per anarkio. Doktrino subversiva.
subvesto undergarment; subaro underwear.

sucedar (tr., intr.) to succeed: came after, follow in order, (cf. sequar; sucesar); sucedo, sucedado succession; sucedanto, sucedinto (di) successor; sucedanta successive subsequent; sucede, sucedante successively, in succession, inturn; sucedar (od, intersequar) l’una l’altra to succeed, follow one another. Ex.: Jorno sucedas la nokto. La sucedado di nia idei. Louis XII esis la sucedanto di Charles VIII. Chapitri sucedanta.

sucesar (intr.) to succeed: accomplish one’s purpose, be successful; suceso success; sucesanta, sucesoza successful; mi suceso indifferent success. Ex.: Lu sucesas en sua entraprezajo. La suceso di teatrajo. La verko ne esis tre sucesoza.

suciar (tr.) to care about: be concerned, solicitous, anxious about (ulu, ulo); sucio: suciego (mental) care, solicitude, anxiety; sucianta, sucioza, suciema solicitous, anxious, careworn; sen sucia careless, thoughtless; me ne sucias I do not care. Def.: Havar sua spirito okupata pri o por la bona stando di persono o kozo amata; VI-345. V. exp.: Suciar, sorgar, flegar: Sorg(ad)o esas ago, kontre sucio esas mentala stando. Exempli: Matro povas suciar sua infanto, ma konfidas a la nutristino la sorgo pri lu. On flegas malado, infanto. On ne povas dicar, ke ta matro ne suciassua filieto, nam elua paroli klare montras, ke sempre el pensas a lua stando e deziras ke ol esez bona; ma fakte el sorgas lu nultempe, nam el abandonas a lua nutristino omna sorgi, quin el devus ipse facar a l’infanto. Mea tutelanto ne nur suciis mea saneso e feliceso, ma il sorgis li omnamaniere, ed il esis quik extreme nequieta, kande me sentis irga sufreto. Yes, nun me esas nequieta pri la mala stando di vua aferi; ma li ne esus tante desesperiganta, se olim vu esabus plu sucioza o suciema pri oli; VI-345.
sucino (yellow) amber; sucinea amber colo(u)red.
sudo south; sudala southern, southerly; sude southward; sudesto south-east; sudano a southerner.
sudario* sudarium; shroud (cf. sepultotuko).

sudoro sweat, perspiration; sudorifar to perspire, be in a sweat; sudorifanta sweating, sudoriferous; sudorifigar to cause (ulu) to sweat; sudorifegar to perspire profusely; sudorifigiva, sudorivo (med.) sudorific.

suficar (intr.) to suffice, be sufficient (ad, por); suficas (impers.) it is sufficient; that is enough; that will do; sufico, suficajo sufficing; sufficiency, adequacy, competency; suficanta sufficient (cf. sat); suficante sufficiently. Ex.: Cent franki suficos a me. Suficajo de frumento.Kapaceso suficanta. Esar suficante klara. To suficas a me, equivalas: me konsideras, aceptas to kom suficanta. V. exp: vid. saciar, sat.
sufixo (gram.) suffix; sufixigar to suffix: annex at the end of a word.

suflar (intr.) to blow (wind, etc.); (tr.) to blow: force wind or breathe upon; (theat.) to prompt (a speaker); (chess, checkers) to huff; sufl(ad)o blow(ing), puffing, breath, breathing (cf. respiro, anhelo); sufleto, suflego, suflajo (the air) puff, gust, blast, whiff; forjosuflilo blacksmith’s bellows. Ex.: La vento suflas. Suflar (ad) sua fingri. Suflar fairo, vitro, orgeno. Suflar aktoro. Suflar piono. Ne esis mem vento-sufleto. Extingar buijio per sufl(et)o di la respirajo.

sufokar (tr., intr.) to suffocate, stifle, smother, choke; (fig.) to check, subdue; (cf. strangular); sufokanta, sufokiva suffocating, stifling. Ex.: La nutristino sufokas la dormanta infanto. Sufokar la karbonfairo. Sufokar sua singluti. Me sufokis pro irocego, pro la varmegeso. Astmo donas la sento di sufoko. Aero sufokanta. V. exp.: vid. asfixiar.

sufrar (tr., intr.) to suffer (from), be afflicted with; (cf. dolorar, subisar, tolerar); il sufras en la hepato his liver is out of order. Ex.: Sufrar (de, pro) la hungro, la dursto, la doloro, lo morto. Persono infirma e sufranta.
sufragana, sufragano suffragan (bishop).
sufrajio* (R.C. rel.) suffrage: a short prayer.
sufuziono (med.) suffusion: extravasation of some humour.

sugar (tr.) to suck (candy, etc., ulo de ulo); suganta sucking; (zool.) suctorial; sugilo sucker (as of an insect); mamsugarto suckle (cf. alaktar). Ex.: Sugar la suko de oranjo. V. exp.: On povas aspirar, ne nur aero od altra gaso, ma anke liquido. Do on povas e devas dicar, ke pumpilo aspiras, e distingar teknikale la pumpili aspirantee presanta. (Pumpilo aspiras unesme l’aero, e per la sama procedo, kande ol esas amorcita, ol duras aspirar l’aquo. Sugar expresas ago di la boko, labii, lango, qua ne implikas necese aspiro. Exemple, on sugas bonbono en la boko; on nule aspiras ol; V-156.

sugestar (tr.) to suggest, intimate (ulo ad ulu); sugestetar to hint; sugest(ad)o suggestion; sugestajo what is suggested, suggestion, intimation; sugestanta, sugestiva suggestive. Ex.: To sugestis ideo a me. Sugesto hipnotala. Sugestiva penso. Lu mem ne sugestetis la ago a me.
suko juice: sap (of vegetables) the water (of fruit); sukoza juicy; suko stomakala gastric juice. Ex.: La suko di oranjo.
sukombar (intr.) to succumb (ad), to yield, get worsted. Ex.: Sukombar a tento, a doloro, sub la pezajo.
sukontredicanta self-contradictory (cf. interkontredicanta).

sukro sugar; sukrala relating to s.; sukratra s.-like; sukroza sugary: naturally sweet; sukrizita sugered: covered with s.; sweetened; sukrizar to s.; put s. in or on; to sweeten; sukrajo a sweet(meat);sukrajerio confectioner’s shop; sukrifisto s. maker; sukriferio s.-works, s. refinery; sukrolumpo, sukrobloko s. loaf; sukropulvero powdered, ground s.; sukrokano s. cane.
sukubo succubus.

sukusar (tr.) to cause violent vibrations in, to shake, shake off, jerk, jog, jostle, jolt; (cf. agitar, ocilar, shanceligar, tremar); sukusope by shakes, jerks. Ex.: Sukusar arboro, tablo, sua kapo. Sukusado la polvo de la vesto. Sukusado di veturo sur voyo aspera.
sulo soil (cf. tero, tereno); sub sulo subsoil. Def.: La supra strato di la tero, konsiderata pri lua produktive qualesi; Ex.: sulo fertila, sterila, e.c.

sulfo* sulphur, brimstone; sulfoza, sulfatra sulphurous; sulfopulvero flowers of s.; sulfizar, sulfagar to sulphurize; sulfeyo, sulfjaceyo, mineyo s. mine; sulfatacido sulphuric acid (H2SO­­­4); sulfido sulphuret; sulfito sulphite; sulfitoacido sulphurous acid (H2SO3).
sultan(ul)o sultan; sultanino sultana.

sumo (math.) sum, amount, total; (cf. toto, agregajo); sumo totala s. total; sume (fig.) finally, on the whole, after all; sumigar to sum up, cast up, totalize; sumigo summing up. Def.: Rezultajo di la adiciono di plura nombri o quanti. Ex.: La sumo di la unaji. Sumigar du nombri.
sumako (bot.) sumac (-tree) (genus: Rhus).
sumaria (adj.) summary. Def.: Dic-esas pri agi facita rapide, sen tempo-perdo o neutila formulaji. V-623. Ex.: Sumaria judiko.
sumnar (tr.) to summon, call authoritatively upon; sumno summons, Def.: Demandar impereme o postular segun yuro e legala formi; III-417. Ex.: Sumnar debanto pagar. Sumnar fortreso kapitulacar.
suno sun; (fig.) sunlight; sunala solar; sunoza sunny; sunfrapo sunstroke; sunfloro (bot.) sunflower (genus: Helianthus); sunhorlojo sun-dial; para suno parasol; sunbrulita sunburned.
sundio Sunday (cf. sabato); palmo sundio Palm Sunday.
suocidar (tr.) to commit suicide; suo suicide; suinto a suicide.
supo soup; porridge; supuyo s. holder, s. tureen; legum ovegetable s.; lakto supo milk porridge.

supear (intr.) to sup, take a (midnight) supper; (noktomezala) -o (midnight) supper; supeo santa Holy Supper; (cf. dejunar, dinear). Def.: La repasto quan on facas cirkum o pos noktomezo ti qui vigilas, pos teatro, balo, festo, e.c.; V-278; kp. VI-162. Ex.: Supear delikate (od, supeetar) pos l’opero.

super (prep., elevation) over, above (but not in contact with; cf. sur); (of degree) over, more than, greater than, superior to; supere over, above (that); supera higher, upper (cf. superiora); ucelo flugis super la domo a bird flew over the house; super la suprajo over the top; dekekin gradi super zero fifteen degrees above freezing point; il stacis supere he stood above; supere dicita aforesaid; supere nomita above named; supera etaji upper floors, stories above (cf. supra etajo); supera klaso upper class; supera genio superior genius; superesar to be over, overtop, surpass, have a superiority; supereso highness, superiority (cf. superioreso); ica vino superesas ta this wine is superior to (better than) that; la monto superesas (od, dominacas) la urbo the mountain is above the city; supereso di kurajo superiority of courage. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: sub.
superaucionar (tr.) to outbid, bid higher than.
superavancar (tr.) to advance over; to overhang; (cf. saliar, superpendar). Ex.: La muro super-avancas.

superba conceited, supercilious (cf. aroganta); superbeso conceitedness: excessive self-esteem; superbigar to make (ulu) c., to puff up; superbesar, superbeskar to be, become c. V. exp.: Superbeso produktas ecesiva su-estimo; vanitateso produktas deziro por l’aplaudo di altri; prezunto esas sufidego pri la imaginita posedo di ulo quon on fakte ne posedas; kp. fiera. Ant.: humila.
supercharjar (tr., also fig.) to overload, overburden. Ex.: Supercharjar kavalo, veturo, sua stomako, sua employati.
superfetaciono* (physiol.) superfetation.

superflua superfluous; superogatory; superflueso (quality) superfluousness; superfluajo (object) superfluity; overplus, (work of) superogation. Def.: Qua esas troa. Ex.: Ornivi, regreti superflua. Superflueso de vorti. Esas superfluaji en ta verko.
superfluar (intr.) to overflow; supero overflowing; superantajo the overflow, waste; superotubo waste pipe.
superhoma superhuman; super(ul)o superman.

superiora (social, hierarchical) superior; superior(ul)o superior; superioreso superiority. Ex.: La arki-episkopo esas la superioro di (od esas superiora ad) la episkopo, e do havas superioreso. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: inferiora.

superirar (tr.) to go over, to rise above; (fig.) to surpass; superar su to surpass, outdo oneself. Ex.: Superirar la monto. Ca lernanto superiras (od, superesas) omna kunlernanti. Me superiris mea tasko.
superlativa superlative (degree, etc.); superlativo (gram.) a superlative; (cf. extrema).
supernatura supernatural; superajo s. event.
supernombra supernumerary (cf. supernumerario). Ex.: Havar fingro supernombra.
supernumerario a supernumerary; supernumerarieso s. service or time; state of being a s. Def.: Employato quan on admisas exter rango, por vartar ordinara employo; IV-584.
superpasar (tr.) to rise above, surmount.
superpendar (tr.) to hang over. Ex.: La roko superpendas la ravino.
superpozar to superpoze: to lay upon (ulo ad, sur ulo).
superpreco higher price; (in selling) overcharge.
supersensa supersensible.
supersigno diacritic(al) mark; written or printed sign of accent (cf. acento); superizar to mark with, add diacritics.
superstico superstition; supersticoza, supersticoz(ul)o superstitious (person).
supertaxar (tr.) to overtax (cf. plusetaxar).
supervarmigar to overheat.
supervido (rapid) survey, view; me havis nur supervido di la loko, di la afero I had but a summary view of the place, but a faint knowledge of the matter.
supino (gram.) supine: verbal noun, similar to the English verbals in -ing.

suplantar (tr.) to supplant (a rival, etc.). V. exp.: B supleas A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado. B suplantas A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por remplasar lu permanante; kp. Substitucar.

suplear (tr.) to supply: make up, make good (the defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the duty of (temporarily); supleanto substitute, assistant, deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di) talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. suplantar.

suplemento (also math.) supplement; suplementa, suplementala supplementary, additional, extra; suplemente in addition, by way of s.; suplemento di angulo s. of an angle: the quantity by which an arc or an angle falls short of 180º. Ex.: Suplemento di (ad) libro. Suplementala pago, preco, kusto.
suplikar (tr.) to supplicate, humbly beseech, entreat, beg (ulu pri, por ulo). Def.: Pregar ulu kun insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. implorar.

suportar (tr., lit. and fig.) to support: bear the weight of; (cf. sustenar, tolerar); suportilo a support, prop; suportanto (person) supporter, upholder. Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. bear) la koldeso, la doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la guvernerio. V. exp.: Suportar esas portar kozo sen movo, tale ke ol ne falez; ma portar uzesas generale kun movo. Metafore, suportar uzesas en senco vicina di tolerar; IV-162

supozar (tr.) to suppose, assume (ulo, pri ulo); supozo (act) supposition; supozajo supposition, assumption; supozebla supposable; supozite ke on the supposition that; supozez ke let us suppose that; en omna supozo however it may be. Def.: Admisar kom hipotezo; imaginar ulo kontre la vereso. Ex.: Supozar ulo neposibla. To esas riskema supozajo.
supozitorio (med.) suppository.

supre on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards, upstairs (cf. supere); supra top, of or relating to what is highest up in space or degree; suprajo highest part, top (cf. somito); il esas ibe suprehe is up there; irar adsupre to go to the top, to go up; supra etajo top or highest floor; supr(eg)a povo, autoritato supreme power, authority; la supro (geometrical sense, or, suprajo material part) di la monto the top of the mountain. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: infre.

supresar (tr.) to suppress, do away with; supreso (act) suppression; supresajo what is suppressed. Def.: Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio, libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.

sur (prep.) on, upon: above and in contact with the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. super, an); (arith.) divided by; sura upper (cf. supera); adsur onto (with motion); sur la tablo on the table; navo sur la maro ship on the sea; sur la rivero, la strado on the river (itself) on the street (itself; N.B. not on the bank of the river or the side of the street, an); saltar ad sur la lito to jump onto the bed; sura etajo the floor (just) above; non sur tri facas tri 9:3 = 3. Def.: Plu alta kam ula objekto e kontaktanta; III-228. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: sub.
supervido (rapid) survey, view; me havis nur supervido di la loko, di la afero I had but a summary view of the place, but a faint knowledge of the matter.
supino (gram.) supine: verbal noun, similar to the English verbals in -ing.

suplantar (tr.) to supplant (a rival, etc.). V. exp.: B supleas A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado. B suplantas A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por remplasar lu permanante; kp. Substitucar.

suplear (tr.) to supply: make up, make good (the defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the duty of (temporarily); supleanto substitute, assistant, deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di) talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. suplantar.

suplemento (also math.) supplement; suplementa, suplementala supplementary, additional, extra; suplemente in addition, by way of s.; suplemento di angulo s. of an angle: the quantity by which an arc or an angle falls short of 180º. Ex.: Suplemento di (ad) libro. Suplementala pago, preco, kusto.
suplikar (tr.) to supplicate, humbly beseech, entreat, beg (ulu pri, por ulo). Def.: Pregar ulu kun insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. implorar.

suportar (tr., lit. and fig.) to support: bear the weight of; (cf. sustenar, tolerar); suportilo a support, prop; suportanto (person) supporter, upholder. Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. bear) la koldeso, la doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la guvernerio. V. exp.: Suportar esas portar kozo sen movo, tale ke ol ne falez; ma portar uzesas generale kun movo. Metafore, suportar uzesas en senco vicina di tolerar; IV-162

supozar (tr.) to suppose, assume (ulo, pri ulo); supozo (act) supposition; supozajo supposition, assumption; supozebla supposable; supozite ke on the supposition that; supozez ke let us suppose that; en omna supozo however it may be. Def.: Admisar kom hipotezo; imaginar ulo kontre la vereso. Ex.: Supozar ulo neposibla. To esas riskema supozajo.
supozitorio (med.) suppository.

supre on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards, upstairs (cf. supere); supra top, of or relating to what is highest up in space or degree; suprajo highest part, top (cf. somito); il esas ibe suprehe is up there; irar adsupre to go to the top, to go up; supra etajo top or highest floor; supr(eg)a povo, autoritato supreme power, authority; la supro (geometrical sense, or, suprajo material part) di la monto the top of the mountain. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: infre.

supresar (tr.) to suppress, do away with; supreso (act) suppression; supresajo what is suppressed. Def.: Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio, libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.

sur (prep.) on, upon: above and in contact with the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. super, an); (arith.) divided by; sura upper (cf. supera); adsur onto (with motion); sur la tablo on the table; navo sur la maro ship on the sea; sur la rivero, la strado on the river (itself) on the street (itself; N.B. not on the bank of the river or the side of the street, an); saltar ad sur la lito to jump onto the bed; sura etajo the floor (just) above; non sur tri facas tri 9:3 = 3. Def.: Plu alta kam ula objekto e kontaktanta; III-228. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: sub.
suro calf (of the leg).

surda deaf; surd(ul)o a d. person; surdeso deafness; surdigar to deafen (ulu); (fig.) stun (with noise); surdeskar to become d.; surdamuta, surd(ul)o deaf and dumb (person); simular surdo to make-believe to be d., to turn a d. ear to; surdega, stone surda stone-deaf, deaf as a post.
surdento tooth grown over another, projecting tooth.

surfaco surface, outside; (fig.) appearance; (cf. areo); surfacalasuperficial: relating to the s.; (fig.) specious (plan, judgement, reasoning; cf. neprofunda, neserioza); surfacale judikar to judge superficially, by appearance; suface flotacar to float upon the s. Def.: La suprajo, la exterajo di ula korpo. Ex.: La surfaco di la tero. Vunduro surfacala.
surjeto* (of seams) whip-stitch, over-cast(ing).
surkalzo over-stocking, -hose.
surkreskajo outgrowth, excrescence, proturberance.
surkruto sauerkraut. Def.: Kaulo fermentacinta; II-711.
surmaniko over-sleeve.
surmenar (tr.) to overdrive, drive beyond one’s strength, overtax, overstrain (supercharjar, fatigar). Ex.: Surmenar kavalo. Surmenar sua forteso per laborado, sua mento per studiado.
surmuleto (ich.) surmullet, red mullet (Mullus Surmuletus).
surnomo surname, family name; suracho nickname, sobriquet; surizar to surname. Ex.: Il surnomizis Simon kom Peter, t.e. kom Simon Peter.
surogato (of things) substitute: that which is put in place of another thing; (med.) succedaneum; surogata substitute. V. exp.: vid. substituto.
surpliso (priest’s) surplice.
surpozar (tr.) to put (ulo) on (ulo).

suprizar (tr.) to surprise, take by s., take unawares, to come or fall upon suddenly and unexpectedly, overtake suddenly; (cf. astonar, kaptacar); suprizo, suprizeso (act, state) surprisal, surprise; unawareness; suprize by s.; suprizanta surprising. Ex.: Surprizar furtero, la enemiko. Mi-voye la pluvo surprizis ni. Li timas surpriz-atako da la enemiko. Donar surpriz-buxo a la puero.
surrena (anat.) suprarenal.
surshuo overshoe.
surskribo, sururo superscription, inscription.
surtuto (long) overcoat, greatcoat, surtout.

surveyar to keep an eye on, superintend, look after, watch over, inspect; survey(ad)o supervision, superintendence, oversight, surveillance; surveyanta, surveyema superintending, watchful, vigilant; surveyanto, surveyero, surveyisto inspector, overseer, superintendent. Def.: Sorgar afero, tasko, ulo, kun partikulareso e autoritato. Ex.: Generalo devas surveyar omno. Surveyar la afero e la laboristi en fabrikerio. Surveyar la konduto di ulu. Surveyo di lernanti o karcerani.

suskriptar (tr., intr.) to subscribe: contribute a definite sum to an undertaking; (cf. signatar, subskribar); suskripto subscription: act of contributing (N.B. not to a newspaper, cf. abono); the consent in writing; suskriptajo subscription: amount contributed. Ex.: Me suskriptas cent franki kom yarala kontributo ad ca entraprezo. Me abonas ta revuo ed anke suskriptas pekunio por la mantenokaso.

suspektar (tr.) to suspect: hold in suspicion, to distrust; doubt the hono(u)r, fidelity or sincerity of; to imagine guilty; (cf. desfidar, konjektar); suspekto suspicion; suspekteskar to grow suspicious; igar ulu suspektinda, suspektigar ulu to cause (ulu) to be suspected, to cast suspicion on (ulu); suspektema (tendency) suspicious, mistrustful; suspektebla, suspektinda suspicious; suspektindo a suspect. Ex.: Suspektar ulu pri krimino, pri herezio. Ta suspekto esas male fondita. Lu mem suspektas sua amiki.

suspendar (tr., phys. sense) to suspend, hang up: fix (ulo) on high and leave hanging; (cf. pendar, akrochar); suspendo, suspendeso suspending, suspension; suspendanta hanging; (med. etc.) suspensory; ponto suspendita suspension bridge. Ex.: Suspendar (od, pend-igar) lampo de la plafono. Pulvero suspendita en liquido.
suspensar (tr.) to suspend (functionaries, judgement, privileges, work) (cf. suspendar, haltigar, interruptar). Def.: Revokar dum tempo; VI-163.
suspensorio* (surg.) suspensory (bandage).

sustenar (tr., phys. and fig.) to sustain, bear, uphold; prevent from falling (cf. subtenar, suportar, mantenar, helpar, defensar); sustenilo stay, prop; sustenomuro retaining wall; sustenostango sustaining rod, prop. Ex.: La fundamento sustenas la edifico. Sustenar sua reputo, entraprezo.
sustracionar (tr., arith.) to subtract, deduct (ulo, de ulo). Ant.: adicionar.

susurar (tr., intr.) to whisper, murmur or mutter (words); (fig.) to whisper, sough (of the wind); susur(ad)o whisper(ing), speaking under the breath; susuranta, susurema; susuranto, susuremo whisper-ing, -er. Def.: Parolar nelaute; (fig.) facar duranta nelauta bruiso, ex, «la vento susuras en l’arbori;» IV-600.
sutar (tr.) to sew, stitch; sut(ad)o, suturo sewing; seam; (surg.) suture; sutomashino sewing machine; sutistino seamstress; sutokorbo sewing-basket. V. exp.: vid. stebar.
sutano (R.C.) soutane, cassock.
suteno carriage (of the body).
suverena, suveren(ul)o sovereign; (cf. suprega); suvereneso sovereignty. Ex.: Autoritato suverena. En demokratio, la populo havas la suvereneso.
suzerena, suzeren(ul)o suzerain, lord paramount.
ta (pl. ti) abbreviation of ita, iti.
tabako tobacco; tabakuyo, tabakbuxo, tabaksako, tabakpoto t. holder; tabakvendeyo t. dealer; sniflar tabako to take snuff; sniflo tabakosnuff; tobakosnifledo, tabakajoa pinch of snuff.
tabano (ent.) ox-fly, gad-fly, breeze (Tabanus).

tabelo a flat surface for writing, painting, drawing, etc., hence that which is thereon: table (of contents), list; tabelo di kontenajotable of contents; tabelo logaritmala logarithmic table; kronologiala tabelo chronological table; nigra tabeloblackboard; tabelo vakua «tabula rasa» a blank tablet; la lego tabeli tables of the law; honor tabelo roll of hono(u)r; tabeleto tablet, V. exp.: Tabelo esas omna plata surfaco, qua expozesas a la vido e montras ulo; ne nur la tabelo di materii di libro, ma omna kadro, en qua on expozas nomi od irgaspeca objekti; la nigra tabelo, sur qua la matematikisti skribas; do anke la pikturi, segun quante li esas movebla (ne adheranta a muro, ma pendita e kadrizita). Tabulo esas surfaco plana e horizontala, qua dividas armoro, biblioteko, e.c. e servas por suportar kozi. Ol esas generala ek ligno; ma quale sempre, lua skopo multe plu importas kam lua materio. Tablo anke esas plano horizontala, ma suportata da la sulo, kontre ke tabuloesas parto di moblo, e generale diplasebla vertikale; VI-604.
tabernaklo (Hebrew hist.) tabernacle, tent for ark of covenant (R.C. rel.) receptacle of the consecrated vessels; (fig.) holy place; tabernaklofesto feast of the tabernacles.

tablo (furniture) table; tablotuko t. cloth; garnisar la tablo to lay, set the t.; sidar an tabloto sit or be at the t.; labor tablo work t.; ludo tablo play-(card-) t.; komuna(od, gasto) tablo «table d’hôte». V. exp.: vid. tabelo.
tablero* dashboard, dash (of motor car).
«tabu»taboo, tabu.
tabulo shelf (for books, etc.); tabularo shelving; marmorao marble slab; tabuleto de chokolado cake (slab) of chocolate, V.exp: vid. tabelo.
tabureto stool: small seat without back (cf stulo); tabureto planala music s.; pedo tabureto foot s.

tacar (tr., of persons) to say nothing about, pass (ulo) over in silence, not to say (ulo); (intr.) to be silent: not to speak, to hold one’s tongue; tacigar to silence, hush (ulu), to reduce (ulu) to silence; taco silence, hush; tacata, tacita tacit, implied; tacera taciturn, silent (person); tacereso taciturnity; tacez be silent; hush! Ex.: Uli parolis, uli tacis. Tacigar la pueri. Lu tacis (pri) lua aferi. Tacar la vereso (E.: to preserve silence concerning the (whole) truth, the full facts). V. exp.: vid. silencar.
tafto (fabric) taffeta; gum tafto adhesive (sticking) plaster.
tago tag: a metallic point at the end of string; tag (of lace); tagizar to tag (lace, etc.) i.e. fit with a point; tagokordonoaiguilette (as worn by the military, on livery of servants).
tako (nav.) cleat. Def.:korpo T-forma, fixigita per la bazo di la T: ol utilesas ex. por ligar la navi per kordo (amari); VI-603
takigenezo* (biol.) tachygenesis.
takigrafar* (tr.) to tachygraph: write in shorthand; takigrafo tachygraphy: stenography (especially of the ancient Greeks and Romans).
takimetro* tachymeter, tachometer: instrument for measuring velocity, speed-indicator, -meter.
takimetrio* tachymetry.
takto (phys.) sense of touch, feeling; (fig.) tact: nice discernment of what is fit, proper; taktozatactful.
taktiko tactics, generalship; taktikala tactical; taktikisto tactician.
taktismo* (biol.) influence exerted by certain substances upon development of unicellular organisms.

tala such, like: of that kind; tale so, in such a manner; e ke (conj.) so that, in such a way that; talmaniere thus, so, in such a way; tala quala such as; quala patro, tala filio like father, like child; il esas tala, quala il esas olimhe is as he always was; e tale pluse and so on; metar la shui tala quala li esis to put on the shoes (in the condition) as they were (then). Ex.: Tala konduto esas netolerebla. Viro tala kam me. Lu parolis tal-maniere ke me kredis lu.
talo* (bot.) thallus.
talento talent; talentoza, talent(ul)otalented (person).

taliar (tr.) to cut (out), carve, trim, prune (so as to give a certain form to), to shape (cloth, wood, metal, ivory, etc.); tali(ad)o, taliuro shaping, cut. Def.: Donar ad objekto specala, defiinita formo segun ula reguli o por ula skopo; III-11.
talio* (chem.) thallium.
taliono* (jur.) retaliation (cf. reprezalo); lego di taliono law of retaliation (lex talionis).
talioro tailor; talioro por mulieri a woman’s t.; taliorino tailoress.
talismano talisman; lucky piece; talismanpersono mascot (person).
talko (min.) talc.
talono heel (of foot, of shoe); (fig.) anything heel-shaped; as, heel of a keel, of a pipe, etc.; talonalo h.-piece; talonecitar to urge (a horse) with the h.s.
talpo (zool.) mole (genus: Talpa); talpchasisto m.catcher; talptumuletom.-hill.

talvego* (physiog.) thalweg: a line following the lowest part of a valley, whether underwater or not; a line of continuous maximum descent from any point on a land surface, or that cutting all contours at right angles (Webster), (gen.) river bed.

tam (adv.) as (much, etc.; comparative sense; followed by adjective, adverb, or kam); tam…kamas….as; tam richa kam as rich as; tam longe kam as long as (followed by a verb); tam ofte kam as often as (followed by verb). Ex.: Lu havas tam multa libri kam vu; Me savas to tam bone kam vu. Li esas tam simila kam du pizi. Tam longe kam il vivas. Tam fore kam on povas vidar.
tamarindo (fruit) tamarind; tamarindiero t. tree (genus: Tamarindus indica).
tamarisko (bot.) tamarisk (genus: Tamarix).

tamburo drum; tamburego a big d.; tamburagar, tamburplear (tr., intr.) to d., beat the drum; tambur(ag)isto drummer; tamburestrodrum-major; mi tamburo tambourine: shallow drum with bells (cf. tamburino).
tamburino tambour: a small and long snare drum. V. exp.: mitamburo.
tamen (conj.) yet, however, nevertheless, still. Ex.: Lu ne esas bona, tamen me helpos lu. Quankam la pueri ne esas sempre jentila, tamen omna bon-kordia homo esas atraktata a li.
tampar (tr.) to tamp (as with a hammer), to ram (as with a pile-driver, rammer).
tampono stopper, tampon: plug of cotton, wood, metal, etc.; (artil.) tampion; (cf. stopilo); tamponizar to plug (ulo) with a tampon, to stopper.
tamtamo tam-tam, tom-tom; gong.
tano tan: tanner’s bark; tanagar (tr.) to tan; tanageriotannery.
tandeme in tandem: in single line (not abreast): tandemveturo carriage with horses in tandem; tandembiciklo tandem bicycle.
tangar (intr., nav.) to heave, pitch: rising and falling of bow and stern of ship or boat; tang(ad)o pitch(ing).
tangenta (geom.) tangential; tangento tangent (line); tangenteso tangency (cf. kontaktopunto).
tanino (chem.) tannin, tannic acid.
tanko tank; (fig., milit.) tank. Def.: Vazo metala klozita o klozebla hermetike (ne kuvo qua esas apertita a l’aero); III-491.

tanta, tantae so (great, much, good, etc.); indicates an indefinite or great quantity, degree, number; pl: so many; (cf. quanta, tam); tantae ke (conj.) so much that (N.B. Note the use of ke, not kam after tante); tantaesma proportional; tantaimo proportional part; tanto po persono so much per head, per person); tantae plu bone ke all the better because; tantae ofte so often; tantae multa soldati so many soldiers; tantae longe ke so long that; tantae ofte ke so often that; tantae plu…ke the more so as; tantae plu…quante plu so much more as; me esas tante malada ke I am so sick that; tantae min…quante min… so much less than. (kp. VII-153, 291, 474). Ex.: Nultempe me vidis tanta homi. Tanta galanteso, tanta esprito esas bona signi. Me tante amis el ke…Ne kurez tante rapide. Ube vu restis tante longe hiere vespere?
tantalo* (chem.) tantalum.
Tantalvazo Tantalus cup.
tapar (tr., tech.) to (screw-) tap (for insertion of screw or making thread for putting on a nut), to worm; tapilo tap-borer, screw-tap.
tapeto tapestry: woven hangings for walls; tapetizar to hang (ulo) with t.; tapetifar to make t.; tapetpapero t. paper; tapetledro leather t.
tapiokao tapioca.
tapiro(zool.) tapir (genus: Tapirus).
tapiso carpet; cover for billiard table; tapiseto small c.; rug; cloth for table, etc.; tapisisto upholsterer; tablo tapiso (fancy) table-cover (cf. tablotuko); lito tapiso bedspread; tapisizarto c.
tapotar (tr., tech., med.) to percuss (as in massage); (gen. sense) to tap.
taro (com.) tare: an allowance made for the weight of the container of goods; tarmezurar(tr.) to tare: ascertain the amount of tare in (ulo); sen tara, tarenet (weight).
tarantelo (Italian dance) tarantella.
tarantulo (ent.) tarantula (genus: Tarantula).

tarda, tardae late, tardy, belated, behindhand; tardaesma (tendency) tardy; tardaesar to be late, be behindhand; tardaigar to retard, delay, put off, protract, spin out; tardaeskar to become belated; get behindhand; tardaeskinta in arrears; plu tarda, tardae later; tardaigar horlojo to put back a clock; Ex.: Plu bona tarde kam nultempe. Tardesma frukto. La puero esis tarda. Me venos plu tarde. La horlojo tardesas (per kin minuti). Me kushas me tre tarde. La treno esas tardigita. Tardigar la pago (E. to get in arrears). Ant.: frua.
tardigrada, tardigrado* tardigrade (animal): slow pacing. (Tardigrada).
tarifo tariff; customs duty; tarifizar to put a t. on (ulo).
tarino (orni.) tarin: siskin, aberdevine (genus: Fringilla spinus).
tarjo targe(t): species of shield or buckler.
tarlatano (fabric) tarlatan.
taroko (card game) taroc, tarot.
tarso (anat., zool.) tarsus; tarsala tarsal.
tarto (cook.) tart (cf. torto); krem tarto cream t. Def.: Ronda, plata kukajo kovrita per kremo o frukto; IV- 642.
tartannavo tartan.
tartanstofo (fabric) tartan, plaid (as worn by the Scots).
Tartaro (myth.) Tartarus.
tartaro (chem.) tartar; tarter (of teeth); tartaracido tartaric acid.
taso cup; tasedo de kafeo cup(ful) of coffee; kafetaso coffee-cup.
tasko task, job; taskolaboristo jobber: worker by the job; laborar segun tasko to work by the job, by the piece.
tastar (intr.) to feel one’s way, grope, fumble; tast(ad)o groping; taste, tastante gropingly, tentatively. Ex.: On tastas en l’obskureso. Ciencisto qua tastas, en sua explori.
tatuar (tr.) to tattoo (the skin).
taumaturgo thaumaturgist.
taumaturgio thaumaturgy.
tauro (also atron.) bull; taurokombato b.fight.
tautokrona* tautochronous; (cf. izokrona); tautokrono täutochrone.
tautologio tautology. Def.: Ne simpla repeto, ma vana repeto di la sama ideo sub diversa formi; V-90.
taverno tavern, public-house, wine-shop, pot-house, bar; tavernestro t.-keeper, publican.

taxar (tr.) to tax; assess (ulu, ulo); tax(ad)o, taxuro tax(ation), toll, rate, assessment; taxanto, taxisto assessor. Def.: Fixigar la quanto de imposto o kontributo quan on debas pri ulo; V-221. Ex.: Taxar lux-objekti. On evaluas la revenuo di ta sioro a 10,000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki, segun la proporciono di 4 po 100. V. exp.: vid. impostar, evaluar.
taximetro taximeter.
taxuso (bot.) yew(-tree) (genus: Taxus).
tayo waist: trunk of the body above the hips; tayo tenua slender w.
teo (leaves and infusion) tea; teiero t. bush; teuyo t. holder, t. caddy; tekrucho t.pot; teasemblo, tepartiot. party.
teatro theater; theatre; teatrala theatrical; teatrajo play (at t.); teatrostroko unforseen event (in a play); (fig.) striking event.
tebaido desert, lonely solitude. V. exp.: Nomo (Thebaid) propra (geografiala) diveninta komuna per metaforo.

tedar (tr.) to bore; (fig.) tire, weary (the spirit); tedanto, tedero tedious person, bore. Def.: Esar desagreabla ad ulu per neoportuna o tro longa agado od asisto (vizitanto tedis me); fatigar per repeto o per neinteresanta kozo (la koncerto, la spektaklo tedis me). (On povas esar jenanta e mem tedanta nevole e nekoncie); III-35.
tegar (tr.) to cover (a bed, a piece of furniture, etc.); to caparison; tegilo cover (for bed, etc.), horse-cloth, caparison; tegtelo cloth cover; tarpaulin.
tegulo (roof-) tile; tegulizar to cover (ulo) with t.s.
tegumento (anat., bot., and gen.) (in) tegument.
teismo theism.
teisto theist.
teko (bot.) teak-tree (genus: Tectona); teklignot. wood.
tekniko technic(s); teknikala technical. Ex.: La tekniko di la pikt-arto. Teknikala termini.
teknologio technology.
tekto roof; (of carriages, autom.) top; tektajo, tektero roofing; tektizar to roof (a house, etc.); tektokanalo (eaves-) gutter.
telo linen cloth or fabric; tela tuko linen sheet(ing); telizarto mount, paste, sew, put (ulo) on cloth; gudro telo tarpaulin; metal telo wire-gauze; araneo telo spiderweb.
telefonar (tr.) to telephone (ulo ad ulu); (cf. telegrafar).
telegonio* (biol.) telegony.

telegrafar (tr.) to telegraph; (ulo ad ulu) (cf. radiotelegrafar); telegraf(ad)o telegraphing; telegrafuro (= telegramo) a telegram; telegrafilo telegraph; telegrafeyo, telegrafkontoro t. office; telegrafala telegraphic; telegrafisto telegrapher.
telegramo telegram: telegraphic message (cf. telegrafuro).
teleologio (philos.) teleology.
telepatio telepathy.
teleskopo telescope; teleskopala telescopic; teleskopumar to drive together trains, etc., so that one or both slides over the other.
teluro* (chem.) tellurium.
temo topic, subject, theme (treated of); traktar temo to treat a subject; temo Latina Latin exercise or theme; kompozar temo to write a theme; temo de la konverso subject of the conversation.
temato (gram., mus.) theme; tematala thematic.
temerara, temerar(ul)o rash, reckless, foolhardy (person); temerareso temerity; temerarajo rash, venturesome act.

tempo time: part of duration (cf. foyo); (gram.) tense (of a verb); (mus.) tempo, time; tempe for the time, temporarily; tempala temporal, temporary, transient; tempope from time to time, now and then, at times; tatempe at that time; nuntempe meanwhile; justatempe at the proper time; on time; samtempe at the same time, at once; irgatempe at any time (whatever); kelketempe sometimes; nultempe never; pasar la tempo ociante to kill time; signo di tempo sign of the times; qua tempo esas? what time is it? (cf. kloko). Ex.: Havar tempo (libera) por facar ulo. Selektar oportuna tempo. Pasar gaye la tempo. En la anciena tempo. Esar nun-tempa (od, moderna).

temperar (tr., also mus.) to temper: moderate, allay, mollify; (cf. hardigar); tempereskar to become temperate, moderate; tempero tempering, moderating; temperemeso temperance, moderation. Ex.: La kolda aero temperas la varmeso. Temperar la acideso per sukro. Temperar (E. cool) la sango, la pasioni. Temperar la legi segun la tempo.
temperamento (of persons) temperament; temperamento partikulara, singulara idiosyncrasy. Def.: Stando fiziologiala, konstitucionala partikulare di la korpo.
temperaturo temperatureL degree of heat.

tempestar (intr. of weather and fig.) to storm: blow with violence, blow a gale; (fig.) to make a great noise, rage, bluster (cf. furiar, bruisar); tempesto tempest, gale, violent storm (with noise of elements) (cf. sturmo, uragano); tempestoza tempestuous; (fig.) boisterous. Ex.: La vento tempestas. (fig.) Lu tempestis pri la konduto di sua pueri. Navo batita da la tempesto. Tempesti di pasiono. V. ex.: vid. sturmo.
templo temple; templano member of a t.; (fig.) knight templar.
temporar (anat.) temple; temporala osto, temporalo temporal bone.

temporisar (intr.) to temporize; temporisema, temporisera; temporisemo, temporisero procrastinating, temporizing (person). V. exp.: La senco ne esas simple ajornar o vartar, ma plu komplexa: ajornar o tardigar ago, vartante okaziono oportuna. La tipo di temporisero esas Fabius Cunctator; V-676.
temprar (tr.) to (paint in) distemper.

tenar (tr.) to hold, have hold of, hold on; to keep in a given situation or position; tenilo handle; tenar ulu per la manuo to hold someone by the hand; tenar ulu ye la brakio to hold someone by (at) the shoulder; tenar libro en la manuo to hold a book in the hand; tenar ridante sua la kosti to hold one’s sides laughing; tenar su per la pasamano to hold (support) oneself by the railing; tenar su rekta to hold oneself erect, stand straight; suteno bearing, carriage, appearance (of a person).
tenaca (tech.) tenacious: strongly adhering or cohering; tough; (cf. persistema); tenaceso toughness, tenacity. Ex.: Pecho, metalo, e.c. esas tenaca.
tenalio (hinged) pincers, pliers, nippers; tenaliagar (tr.) to use p. on (ulo); to hold (ulo) with p. V. exp.: vid. pinco.
tenaro (anat.) thenar: ball of hand or foot.
tencho (ich.) tench (genus: Tinca vulgaris).
tendo tent; (of carriage) hood; tendetosmall tent, awning, canopy, screen; erektar, establisar, stacigar tendo to put up, pitch a tent; tendaro (collect.) camp.

tendencar (intr.) to tend: be directed to an object or purpose; be inclined, lead to; (cf. vizar); tendenco (of motion) tendency; (mental) leaning, inclination; tendencanta, tendencoza, tendencema tending, inclined, biassed, prone, disposed. Ex.: La fairo tendencas adsupre, la stono adinfre. Ca malado tendencas a morto. Tendenco ad egoismo.
tendino (anat.) tendon, sinew; (cf. ligamento); Akil tendino t. of Achilles.
tendro tender (of a locomotive).

tenebro darkness, gloom: (pl., R.C. rel.) tenebræ; tenebroza tenebrous: dark, gloomy; tenebroepoko dark ages. Def.: Manko di lumo; obskureso profunda; (fig.) nul-savo, nul-certeso. Ex.: tenebro di la nokto. Tenebro di nulsavo. Princo di tenebro.
tenera tender, susceptible to love or kindness, loving (person, heart); tenereso tenderness (of heart).
tenio tænia: tapeworm.
teniso (lawn-) tennis; tenis(lud)ero, tenisisto t. player; ludar teniso to play t.
tenono (carp.) tenon. Def.: Extremajo di peco ek ligno, metalo, e.c., qua eniras mortezo.
tenoro (voice and person) tenor.

tensar (tr.) to stretch: draw in length; to strain, tense; (a gun) to cock; tensar su to strain, stiffen oneself; tenso, tenseso(act, state) stretching, strain, tension, tenseness (physical, mental, social); tensata: tensita tense, strained; tensanto one who stretches; (anat.) tensor (muscle); tensilo stretching instrument. Ex.: Tensar kordo, la fingri. Tenso di la muskuli, di la mento. Elektrala tenso. (fig.) To tensas la situeso.
tensoro* (math.) tensor.

tentar (tr.) to tempt, entice; tentesar to be tempted (facar, da); tento, tenteso temptation; tentanta, tentivatempting; tentanto, tentero temptor; tentantino temptress. Ex.: Deo tentis Abraham. Me lasis me tentesar da glorio. Rezistar tento. Tenteso ridar.
tentakulo (zool.) feeler (of insects), tentacle.

tenua tenuous, thin, spare, fine: thin and long; tenueso tenuity; tenuigarto thin, make spare (cf. mingrosigar); tenuigo attenuation. Def.: Desgrosa; qua havas mikra periferio; qua havas nur la du dimensioni: dina e longa. Ex.: Tenua filo, vaporo, kolono, gambi, voco. V. exp.: vid. dika. Ant.: grosa.
teodiceo (philos.) theodicy.
teodolito (measuring instrument) theodolite.
teogonio theogony.
teokrato theocrat. V. exp.: Ne partisano di la teokratio, ma chefo di teokratio; (cf. teokratio); IV-643.
teokratio theocracy; teokratiala theocratic.
teologala divine (virtue). Ex.: Fido, espero, karitato esas la tri teologala vertui.
teologio theology, divinity (doctrine); (cf.deigo); teologiala theological: teologiisto theologian, divine.
teorbo (mus.) theorbo, archlute.
teoremo theorem.
teorio theory; (cf. spekular); teoria, teoriala theoretic(al); teorie theoretically; teoriisto theorist; teoriemo (tendency) theorizer.
teozofiotheosophy; teozofiisto theosophist.
tepalo* (bot.) tepal.

tepida tepid, lukewarm; (fig.) indifferent; tepidajo something t. (as a tepid drink); tepideso lukewarmness; tepideskar to become t. V. Exp.: La radiko tepida esas necesa por indikar to quo ne esas kolda: varmeta e koldeta esas nejusta od neklara. La metaforal uzado di la vorti esas utila en etiko teologio; II-712.
teplico (for plants) hothouse, greenhouse conservatory.

tero earth (as a planet and as ground; cf. sulo, tereno); tera vazo earthen vessel; terala earthly, terrestrial; terglobo terrestrial globe; teroza earthy; terajo, amasopiece of e., object made from e., earhtwork; terajisto, terlaboristo e. worker; terano inhabitant of e.; (fig.) landholder; terizar, terplenigar to cover, to fill (ulo) with e.; terplenajo (fort.) terreplein; terocilo, tertremo e. shake, earthquake (cf. sismo); tertruo burrow; teretajo ground floor (of a house); terpomo potato; terhavajo real estate; enterigar to inter, put in the e.; tervenar to (come to) land.
terakoto terra-cotta: baked clay; terakotajo a piece of earthenware.
terapio (med.) therapeutics, therapy.
terario* terrarium.
teraso terrace: raised bank; terastekto flat roof (of a house); terasigar, terasizar to t., to arrange in t.s.
teratogenezo*(med.) teratogeny.
terco (astron., math.) 1/60 of a second; (mus., cards, fencing) tierce.
teratologio teratology.
terceto mus., poetry) terzetto, trio; terza-rima.
terciana(febro) tertain (fever).
terciara (geol., med.) tertiary.
terebinto:* (bot.) terebinth, turpentine tree (genus: Pistacia Terebinthus).
tereno terrain: small piece of ground, viewed as to its fitness for some purpose, as for a building, a battle, etc.
teriako (pharm.) theriac(a). Def.: Anciena medikamento kontre veneno.
teriero terrier (dog).
terino deep, earthen dish, tureen.
teritorio territory; teritorialano (fig.) territorial: militiaman.
termo, termi thermal (or, hot) spring or spa; termala thermal; termalesoquality, character of thermal waters.

termino (gram., math., log.) term (cf. periodo); boundary), boundary mark, landmark; (of R.R.) terminus; (gen.) the farthermost point; terminaro terminology; bounds (to which one may go); terminala terminal; terminizar to bound, set bounds, set landmarks; komparo termini terms of comparison. Ex.: Teknikala, ciencala termini. Expresar su per justa termini. Esas interdikta forprenar la termini di ula domeno. Pagar debajo ante la termino. V. exp.: Termino ne esas limito (o frontiero), ma ulo (stono, stango, e.c.) qua indikas la limito. Ol ne esas extremajo, nam la termini esas sur omna lateri, e ne nur ye l’extremaji. La primitiva senco di la vorto esas la L. terminus, de qua venas la cetera, metafora senci (gramatikal, logikal, matematikal termino). L’antiqui deigis la Termini, e pro to la vorto restis en arkitekturo, por indikar mi-korpa statuo sur pilastro. Fine, la vorto terminus esas EF for indikar extremaji di fervoyal lineo; II-712.
termodinamiko* thermodynamics.
termoelektro* thermoelectricity.
termografo thermograph.
termokemio* thermochemistry.
termologio* thermology: science or theory of heat.
termometro thermometer.
termometrio* thermometry.
termoskopo* thermoscope.
termotaktismo* thermotaxis.
termoterapio* thermotherapy.
termotropismo* thermotropism.
ternara* (math.) ternary.
terniono* (math.) ternion, ternary: a form having three variables.

terorar (intr.) to be terrified, be frightened (cf. trepidar); teroro terror, fright; terorigar to terrify, scare, terrorize, dismay; terorigo terrorizing; teroriganta, teroriva terrible, dreadful, awful, terrifying; terorismo terrorism; teroristo: terrorist. V.exp.: vid. pavorar.
terpentino* abietine (resin); terpentinoleo oil of turpentine; (cf. terebinto).
terpomo potato; tero en shelo p. with jacket on.
testo a witness; la testo donis sua atesto the witness gave his testimony; prenar ulu kom testo to take a person to (or, call a person as) witness; testesar to be a witness (cf. atestar).
testaca testaceous: covered with hard shell; testaco t. animal.

testamentar (intr.) to make one’s will; testamento testament, will; testamentala testamentary; testamentanto, testamentinto testator; testamentala exekutero executor of a will; mortar sen testamente to die intestate (cf. intestata). V. exp.: vid. legacar.
testiero* head-stall (of a bridle).
testikulo (anat.) testicle.
tetanar (intr., med.) to have tetanus, lockjaw; tetano tetanus; (cf. trismo).
tetraedro (geom.) tetrahedron.
tetragona*, tetragono (geom.) tetragon(al).
tetralogio tetralogy.
tetrarko tetrarch; tetrarkio (domain) tetrarchy; tetrarkeso (office) tetrarchate.
tetraso (orni.) grouse (Tetrao tetrix).
teurgio theurgy.
texar (tr.) to weave (cotton, wool, etc.); tex(ad)o weaving; texuro texture; texuro lana wool fabric; texisto weaver; texala textile; texilo, mashino loom.
texto text; textala, segun texta textual, word for word; segun texte verbatim; (cf. vortope).
tezo thesis; proposition, theme supported by argument; undergraduate’s essay.
tiaro tiara.
tibio (anat.) tibia, shin-bone.
tifo (med.) typhus (fever); tifala t. (relating to the disease); tifika, tifiko (person) sick with t.
tifoido, tifoida febrotyphoid, enteric fever.
tigr(ul)otiger (Felis tigris); tigrino tigress.

tikar (intr.) to have a local and habitual convulsive movement of the muscles (especially the facial muscles); (fig.) to have a bad habit, an ugly knack; (of a horse) to be vicious; tiko wry motion; bad habit. Ex.: Il tikas (od, havas la tiko) rodar sua ungli.
tiktakar (intr.) to go tic-tac, to tick (as a clock); tiktak(ad)o tick(ing).

til (prep.) (of time) till, until; (in space) (un) to, as far as; til nun until now; tilnuna hitherto prevailing; til la fino unto the end; til nova od, altra) imperi until further (or, other) orders; til ke (conj.) until (followed by verb); til la rivido au revoir, until we meet again, goodbye for the present; il iris til Paris he went as far as Paris (N.B. Il iris a Paris might signify that he went in the direction toward Paris). Ex.: De la matino til la nokto. Til la fino di januaro. Me restos til ke vu retrovenos. Til nun la vetero esis sempre bela. Lu lektis til la fino di la libro. Lu akompanis me til la proxima strado. Siori X e Y intencas irar vers la sudo (od ad-sude). Sioro X iros til Paris e Sioro Y a (od, til) Rom(a). V. exp.: Til indikas fakto, qua duras kontinue ante la momento koncernata ed ankore en ta momento. Ex.: «Il promisis venor ante dimezo, do me vartos il til dimezo.» Til (en la tempo same kam en la spaco) indikas, ke on atingas la limit-punto indikata. Pro to: «me iris ad Paris» diferas de «me iras til Paris;» IV-525.
«tilburi» (carriage) tilbury.
tilio (bot.) lime(-tree), linden(-tree) (genus: Tilia).

timar (tr.) to fear (or, to be afraid that) (or, lest) something may happen; to dread, be apprehensive; timigar to cause to dread, make afraid; timo fear, apprehension, misgiving, dread, awe; time ke for fear that; timanta, timoza timid, timorous, fearful, apprehensive, cowardly; timinda, timenda to be feared, dangerous, redoubtable, formidable; timante ke for fear that, lest; sentima with assurance, confidence; la timo a la puniso the dread of punishment; pro timo ad for fear of; me pavoris pro timo ad morto I was frightened by the fear of death. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.
timbalo timbal, kettledrum.
