timbro (of a clock) clock-bell; a hand bell (such as used on tables, without a loose clapper but struck by a hammer as in a clock).
timiano (bot.) thyme (genus: Thymus).
timida timid: not bold; bashful, shy; timideso timidity; timidigar intimidate. Ex.: Timida mulieri, infanto. Ant.: audacoza, brava.
timono (single) pole, shaft (of a cart). V. exp.: vid. brankardo.
timpano (anat.) tympanum: drum of ear; (arch.) tympanum; (mus.) dulcimer.
timuso (anat.) thymus (gland); timusbov(yun)o (calf’s sweet-bread).
tino tub, water-cask; firkin (for butter). Def.: Speco de vazo konstruktita quale barelo, ma apertita; IV-643.
tindro tinder, punk, amadou; tindrfungo agaric, touch-wood.
tineo (ent.) moth (family Tinea).
tinio (med) ringworm, especially of the scalp; scald-head; favus; tinea capitis.
tinklar (intr.) tinkligar (tr.) (lente) to toll: sound a bell slowly; tinkletar, tinklar dolce to tinke, jingle, clink (as small bells, money); to patter (as feet, sleet against the window, etc.).
tinlauro (bot.) laurestine (Viburnum tinus).

tintar (tr.) to dye; (fig.) tint, tinge, stain (cf. kolorizar); tint(ad)o dying; tinturodye, colo(u)ring, tint; tintivo (substance) dye;tintisto dyer; netintita untinted, of natural colo(u)r. Tintar rede la tuko. La cielo tintas blua la maro. Tintar la manui per sango.

tipo (print., med., nat. hist.) type; (of measures, weights) standard, model; symbol; tipa, tipala, tipatra typical. Ex.: Lu esas homo segun la Angla tipo. La paskala agnelo esas la tipo di Jesu Kristo. La tipala traiti di la flava raso.
tipulo (ent.) tipula: crane-fly, daddy-long-legs (genus: Tipula).

tirar (tr.) to draw, pull, tug; (of chimneys) to draw; (cf. tranar, haular, vindar, tensar, cherpar, extraktar); tiretar to twitch; tir(ad)o pulling, drawing, towing; draught (of chimneys); tiresforco drawing power, traction; tirkordono draw-string; tirkordo tow-rope; tirkesto drawer; tirkestaro chest of drawers; ektirar to put out, pluck out; tirkavalo draught horse: korktirilo corkscrew. Ex.: Kavali tiras veturi. Ektirar l’espado, sua horlojeto.
tirado (lit. and fig.) tirade. Def.: Teknikal termino di teatro: longa peco (generale brilanta od eloquenta), quan un persono dicas sen interrupto; III-268.
tiran(ul)o (also fig.) tyrant.
tiritano (fabric) linsey-woolsey.
tiroida(glando, kartilago) thyroid.
tirso (bot. and antiq.) thyrsus.
tisuo* (anat., biol.) tissue.
titano (myth.) Titan; (titanmetalo) (chem.) titanium.
titilar (tr.) to tickle, titillate; titileso t. sensation; titilsentema ticklish.
titrar* (tr., chem.) to titrate: determine the standard, the dosage of (a solution, a substance); titruro standard of fineness (of coins, etc.).

titulo title (of a book, article, person); titulizar to entitle: give a title to (cf. nomizar); tituliera, titulo titular; nobeleso titulo t. of nobility; titulpagino t. page; li titulizis il kom profesoro they gave him the t. of profesor. V. exp.: vid. rubriko.
tizano (med.) tisane: diet-drink, infusion, decoction (of herbs).
to (abbr. for ito) that.
tofo (min.) tufa, tuff.
togo toga.
«toise» (an ancient F. measure) 6.39 ft.
toko toque: a flat cap; a close fitting bonnet; toko velura velvet t.; chas toko hunting cap, jockey cap.
tolo sheet-metal; tolifisto sheet-metal worker; fer tolo sheet-iron; stal tolo sheet-steel.
tolerar (tr.) to tolerate, put up with, suffer, allow, bear, endure (ulo, de ulu); tolerebla tolerable, supportable; middling, passable (cf. pasabla); tolerema tolerant.
«tolle» outcry, hue and cry.
tomo volume, tome; (cf. libro); tomonumerizar to number (into volumes); tomonumero number of a volume.
tomato (fruit) tomato; tomatiero t. plant; tomatsauco t. sauce.

tombo tomb, grave, sepulcher (sepulchre); tombala sepulchral; tombala petro tombstone; familio tombo family tomb or vault; tombeyo place of burial; graveyard, cemetry; tombisto grave-digger, sexton; tombo masonita vault (for dead).
tombako (metal.) tombac.
tombolo tombola: a kind of lottery.

tono tone, pitch (of voice) (mus.) tone; degree, pitch of sound; (med.) tone: condition of an organ; tonala tonal; (mus.) tonic; tonala noto (mus.) key-note; tonizar (med.) to give tone to; (photog.) to tone: bring as a print, to a required color (colour); tonizivo (med.) tonic; (photog.) toning solution or reagent. Ex.: Altigar, basigar, chanjar la tono. Tono kordiala, iracoza. Ica medikamento agas kom tonizivo por la stomako, o donas tono a la stomako. On dicas, ke ula melodio, o muzik-peco esas skribita o kompozita en ca o ta tono. On kustumas indikar singla tono per lua fundamental sono. V. exp.: Muzikal tono ne esas un sono, ma esemblo de soni qui kompozas o povas kompozar melodio; IV-467.

tondar (tr.) to shear: clip from surface with shears, etc. (cf. rekortar); tond(ad)o shearing, clipping; tondajo shearings, clipping(s), flock; tondotemposhearing time; tondero, tondisto shearer; tondilo clipper, shears.
tondrar (intr.) to thunder; (fig.) to inveigh (against); (cf. sturmo); tondras (impers.) it thunders; tondrostroko clap, peal of t.
tonika(acento) (gram.) tonic (accent); toniko (mus.) tonic: keynote.
«tonneau» (autom.) tonneau: rear seat.
tonoplasto*(biol.) tonoplast.
tonsilo (anat.) tonsil.
tonsilito* (med.) tonsilitis.
tonsuro tonsure; tonsurizar to give the t. to (ulu).
tontino tontine. Def.: Sistemo di mutuala asekuro, inventita da Tonti (1653); IV-643.
topo (nav.) top; topo granda main. t.; topmasto t.mast; topseglo t.sail; topisto topman.
topazo (min.) topaz.

topika, topiko (medicine or treatment) applied to, or used for, a particular spot; (rhet., log.) general head; argument drawn from the several circumstances and places of a fact. Ex.: Remedio topika. Topiki da Aristoteles.
topinamburo (bot.) Jerusalem artichoke (Helianthus tuberosus).
topografio topography.
topologio* (geom.) topology.
toro (arch., geom.) tore, torus.
torako* (anat.) thorax: the chest; torakala thoracic.
torcho torch, link.

tordar (tr.) to twist, wring, contort; (med.) to strain, sprain; (of wood) to warp; tord(ad)o twisting, wringing, torsion, sprain; tordita twisted, wry, crooked; tordita gesto, posturo contortion; tordar sua pedo to sprain one’s foot, or, to twist one’s foot.
toreadoro toreador; bull-fighter.
torefaktar (tr.) to torrefy: to dry, parch, roast (by exposure to heat). Ex.: Torefaktar la kafeo-grani.
torento torrent: rushing stream (of water, words, people, etc.); torentala, atra torrential; lakrim torento flood of tears.
torfo turf; peat; torfeyo peat-bog.
torio* (chem.) thorium.
torida (geog.) torrid; (cf. tropikala, varmega). Ex.: Torida zono.
tormentar (tr. also fig.) to torment: torture.
tormentilo* (bot.) tormentil (Potentilla tormentilla).
tornar (tr.) to turn (in a lathe); tornilo lathe.
tornasola (bot.) turnsole -papero litmus paper.
torporar (intr.) to be benumbed, or in a state of torpor (as from cold); torporo torpidity, numbness; (fig.) dullness, inaction; (cf. letargio); torporigar to make (ulu) t.
torso torso: trunk, chest, bust (of a person or statue).
torsado twisted fringe or cord; bullion (as of epaulets).
torto pie (English sense) (cf. tarto); tortuyo p. dish; kolombo torto pigeon p. Def.: Alta, cilindrata kukajo plenigita per diversa (karnatra) manjaji kun sauco; IV-642.
tortikolo (med.) torticollis: rheumatic pain causing wry-neck; (fig.) stiff-neck, crick in the neck.
tortugo tortoise, turtle (Chelonia); tortugskalio t.shell.
tostar (intr.) to give a toast (ad ulu), to drink a friend’s health; tostotoast(ing): drinking (ad ulu) the health, the prosperity.

tota entire; whole (of one thing; cf. omna); tote wholly, entirely; toto, toteso totality, entirety, whole; totajo (objective) entity, entire thing; entote on the whole, in the main; dum la tota nokto during the whole night, throughout the night; me es tote vua I am totally yours; tote sola entirely alone; la toto esas plu granda kam una de la parti the whole is larger than one of its parts; plura totaji tote distingata la una de la altra several entire things quite distinct from one another; ne tote not entirely (not quite); tote ne not at all.
toxika (med.) toxic, poisonous; toxikoa poison (cf. veneno); toxikeso poisonousness.
toxikoligio toxicology.
toxino* toxin(e).

tra (adv. trae) through, across (noting passage or motion in crossing); irar tra la urbo, tra la pordo to go through the city, through the door. V. exp.: tra, trans, transversaTrans-irante la urbo, ni tra-iris turbo di la habitanti ante ke ni povis tra-irar la urbo-pordo qua jacis quale barilo transversa a ni voyo. E.: Crossing (to the other side of )the city, we had to pass through a crowd of the inhabitants before we could get through the gate of the city which lay like a barrier across our path.
trabo beam, girder; (trabeto) joist, rafter; trabizar to line (ulo) with b.s; trabapogar to shore, to prop up; trabaro framework (of a building, ship).
traborar (tr.) to bore through (as with a gimlet).
traco trace: mark left by foot of man or beast; track; footprint; (hunt.) trail; sequar (ulu)per la tracito follow by the track; hike esas lua pedotracihere are his footprints.
traciono* (R.R.) traction: locomotive power.

tradicionar (tr.) to transmit, hand down (ulo) by tradition; tradiciono tradition; tradicionala, ata, tradicionita traditional; tradicionalismotraditionalism; tradicionalisto traditionalist; tradicionar ula fakti to hand down certain facts. Ex.: Ci esas la fakti traditionat a ni. Legi tradicionita. Tradicionala expozado di la santa skriburo.

tradukar (tr.) to translate (ulo, de...ad); traduko, tradukuro (act, result) translation; tradukanto, tradukinto, tradukero, tradukistotranslator; tradukebla translatable; tradukendo article, exercise to be translated; mis tradukar to translate wrongly. Ex.: Tradukar artiklo de la Angla a la Franca.
traduktar (tr.) to lead across, through; (an animal, a person).
tragakanto (bot.) tragacanth (Astragalus); (cf. adraganto).

tragedio (dramatic and fig.) tragedy; tragediala, tragediatra tragic; tragediisto tragedian; tro tragediatre konsiderar ulo to take a thing too seriously. Ex.: La tragedii da Cornielle. La milito esis tragedio.
tragikomedio tragi-comedy.

trahizar (tr.) to betray, be false to; trahizo betraying, treason; trahizanto, trahizinto, trahizero, trahizemo betrayer, traitor; trahizema treacherous, perfidious; trahizajo act of treason; stato trahizo high treason; trahize, trahizante treacherously. Ex.: Trahizar sua patrio, la fido di ulu.
traino* train (of army).
trairar (tr.) to go, travel through (cf. transirar). Ex.: Trairar torento, lando, urbo, pordo.

traito feature (of the face), lineament; trait, characteristic; el havas mikra traiti she has small features; to esas la traito karakteriziva di ta epoko that was a characteristic (trait) of that age.
trajektorio (ballistics) trajectory.
trajetar (tr.) to traject (light); to throw (ulo) through or across.

trakar (tr.)(hunt.) to drive game, to beat up (a wood); (fig.) to ferret out, close in on; hem in; cut off on all sides; trako hunting out; trakanto, trakero a game driver, a beater; trakar la furterito hunt out, or close in on the thieves. V. exp.: Trakar indikas specala modo di chaso: on ne nur cirkondas e forpulsas la vildo, ma on kontinue diminutas la cirklo en qua ol esas enklozita, tale ke ol ne povas eskapar. Ica vorto esas tre expresiva ed energioza en mataforal uzo; IV-512.
trakeo (anat.) trachea, windpipe.
trakeito* (med.) trachitis.
trakeotomio (surg.) tracheotomy.
trakito trachyte: a volcanic rock.
traktato* treatise; traktato pri kemio t. on chemistry.
traktoro tractor.
traktrico (geom.) tractrix.
tramo tram-, street-car-rail; tramvoyo tramway, street railway; tramveturo tramcar, street-car.

tramplar (intr.) to stamp (the feet); (of horses) to paw (the ground). Def.: Frapar la sulo per la pedi, sen avancar; VI-115. Agitar la pedi pro nervozeso od altra sentimento: nepacienteso, iraco, e.c.; IV-587.
trampolino spring-, leaping-board.

tranar (tr.) to draw, drag along, trail (ulo, dop su); su to creep along, crawl; tranajo anything which drags; trail, train (of a dress); tranata voco (fig.) dragging voice. Ex.: Elua robo tranesas. Du kavali tranis la glit-veturo. Tranado di la pedi. La chasero tranis su alonge la sulo por proximigar su ad la vildo.
trancar (intr., hypnotic, epilep.) to be in a trance or in a hypnotic state; tranceskar to go into a t. Def.: Esar en stando nekoncianta dum epilepsio, hipnoto, e.c.
trancendenta transcendent; trancendentala (philos.) transcendental; trancendenteso transcendency. Ant.: imananta.

tranchar (tr.) to cut (completely) through, cut off, carve (meat); (cf. detranchar); tranch(ad)o cut(ting); tranchiva, tranchema tranchant; cutting, decisive (tone); tranchilo a cutting instrument, as a knife, etc.; tranchilvendisto edged-tool seller; tranchantajo edge of a knife, etc.; tranchar la pako (at play) to cut the cards; tranchar la ligno, la pano to cut wood, bread. V. exp.: Tranchar esas trasekar, separar en du o plura peci. Sekar esas agar per kultelo o simila instrumento, plu o min profunde; esas granda difero inter: me sekis….e me tranchis mea lingro. Incizar esas facar mikra e nur surfacala seko (precipio kirurgiala). Skarifikar (teknikal vorto) esas incizar la pelo por l’apliko di ventuzi; II-646.
trancheo (milit., tech.) trench; (drain-) ditch.

tranquila (physical and mental) tranquil, quiet, still, not in motion; tranquileso tranquility; tranquiligar to (make) still. Def.: Qua esas sen agitado. Ex.: Tranquila vicino, strado, infanto. Restez tranquila. V. exp. vid. kalma.

trans (prep.) on the other side of, beyond, across, over (with or without motion); (cf. tra); transe beyond; transa which is on the other side; transajo object beyond or on other side; the hereafter; trans la rivero, la monto, la muro on the other side of the river, the mountain, the wall; transoceana lando land across the ocean; ni irez trans la rivero let us go to the other side of the river. Ant.: cis.

transaktar (intr.) to come to terms, to compound, compromise (kun ulu, pri ulo); transaktocompromise, adjustment; transaktema inclined to compromise. Def.: Konciliar deskonkordo per reciproka konceso. Ex.: Esas plu bona transaktar kam procesar. On devas ne transaktar kun sua honoro.
transatlantika transatlantic.
transbordar* (tr., nav.) to transship; transbordo, transbordajo (act, object) transshipment. Def.: (Trans-)portar personi od kozi de un navo (od, altra moyeni di transporto) ad altra.
transepto (arch.) transept.
transferar (tr.) to transfer (ulo ad ulu); (cf. transportar). Transfero di ula yuro ad altru.
transfigurar (tr., esp. rel.) to transfigure (cf. transformar).
transfinita (math.) transfinite.
transformar (tr.) to transform (ulo ad ulo) to change the form of; transformesar to be transformed; transform(ad)o, transformeso (act, state) transformation; transformismo (biol.) transformism.
transformatoro* (elec.) transformer, converter.
transfugar (intr.) to desert (to the enemy); transanto, transinto deserter, turncoat, transfuge.

transirar (tr., intr.) to go across (to the other side), to traverse (cf. trairar);transar rivero to cross a river; streta voyo transiras la foresto a narrow path lies across (or, crosses) the forest.

transitar (intr.) to be or pass in transit; transitotransit(ion); transitala transient: relating to transit (cf.provizora, tempala); transitiva (gram.) transitive. Ex.: Komercaji transitas de una urbo ad altra. La transito de monarkio a republiko. Transitala komercajo. Verbo transitiva.

translacar (tr., intr., mechan. and fig.) to move, shift (ulo) from one place to another; translaco translation: (mechan.) motion in which all points of the moving body have at any instant the same velocity and direction of motion. (Webster).
translojar (tr., intr.) to move (from one house or apartment to another).
translucida translucent: transmitting light imperfectly, semi-transparent. Ex.: Vitro despolisita esas translucida. Ant.: opaka.
transmigrar (intr.) to transmigrate: migrate from one country to another; (of souls) to undergo transmigration: the passing of a soul into another body.
transmisar (tr.) to transmit. Ex.: la nervi transmisas la impresi. Transmisar impero. Transmiso di lua vertui a lua filii.
transmutar (tr.) to transmute (ulo ad ulo). Ex.: L’alkemiisti probis transmutar matali ad oro.
transoceana transoceanic.

transparar (intr.) to shine (through), glimmer, be visible (tra, sub ulo); (cf. lumar); transparanta transparent; (cf. diafana). Ex.: Brilanta objekti transparas tra la vitro. Sun-radii transparas tra l’aquo. Roki sub l’aquo esas transparanta per la sun-radii (pro ke l’aquo esas diafana).
transparento (picture) transparency.
transpasar (tr.) to go by or beyond (a place); to exceed (one’s strength, etc.).

transpirar (intr.) to transude, transpire, ooze out, exhale; (cf. exudar, sudorifar); (fig. of news) to transpire: be divulged, become known, leak out. Ex.: La humori transpiras tra la pelo. Gasi transpiras de korpi mortinta. Pos la recevo di ta telegramo, nula informo nova transpiris.
transplantacar (tr.) to transplant.
transportar (tr.) to transport, convey; transportnavo t. ship; transportar su to betake oneself , to proceed, repair (to a place). Def.: Portar komercaji, e.c. de un loko ad altra.
transpozar (tr.) to put (ulo) in another place (further on), to displace; (mus.) to transpose.
transsendar (tr.) to send (ulo) across, to forward (cf. transmisar). Ex.: transsendar letro de Francia ad Usa.
transskribar (tr.) to rewrite (otherwise), to transcribe (as, from shorthand to longhand); (mus.) to write out; transo, transuro (act, result) transcription.
transvarsar (tr.) to decant: pour from one vessel to another; to pour off: (surg.) to transfuse (blood). V. exp.: vid. rakar.

transversa transverse; transversal athwart, running or lying across; transverse crosswise; transverso transversal (line, object), breadth; transversa kuseno bolster, long round pillow. Ex.: Transversa lineo, arterio, strado.
transvivar (tr.) to survive, outlive (ulu, ulo).
trapo trap-door; (of gallows) drop; pitfall.
trapezo (gymnastics) trapeze; (geom.) trapezium; trapezala osto trapezium; trapezala muskulo trapezius.
trapezoedro* trapezohedron.
trapezoido* (geom., anat.) trapezoid.
trapikar (tr.) to pierce, run through (as with a sword; cf. traborar). Ex.: La tunelo trapikas la monto. La pluvo ne povas trapikar la nepermeebla vesto.
trasar (tr.) to trace, draw: mark out, delineate, chalk out; traso, trasuro (act, result) tracing; laying out (of grounds, etc.); outline, sketch.

tratar (tr., com.) to draw (a bill of exchange) on; trato draft, bill; tratanto; drawer; tratato drawee; alonjo trato allonge: rider to a bill of exchange; ni tratos vi per bilieto pos tri monati diskontenda da la diskontisti we will draw on you a three months’ bill to be discounted by the bill-brokers.
traumato (surg.) traumatism.
traurar (intr.) to be in mourning; trauro mourning (cf. chagreno); traurala vesto m. dress; portar granda trauro to be in full or deep m.; portar trauro pri ulu to be (dressed) in m. for a person.
travo trave: a frame to confine an unruly horse or ox while shoeing.
travadar (tr.) to ford, wade across.
traveo truss (of a bridge); (arch.) bay (of joists); (of a church) triforium. Def.: Intervalo di du trabi, fosti, koloni, pilasti. (N.B. ne esas sempre apertita quale pordo o fenestro); IV-644.

traverso cross-bar, -piece, -beam, girder; (R.R.) sleeper; (fort.) traverse; traverseto bracket. V. exp.: Travers-eto esas stango horizontala, qua suportas tabuli di armoro, di biblioteko, e.c.; IV-644.

travestiar (tr.) to disguise (by assuming the dress of a person of another sex or condition in life); (fig. burleske) to travesty; travestiita, travestiito disguised (person); (cf. maskar, deformar, pariodar). Travestiar viro quale muliero, ula soldati quale rurano.
travidar (tr.) to see, look through at; traebla visible through (N.B. not transparent: diafana). Ex.: Me travidas la stoni di fundo, en l’aquo = me vidas la stoni di la fundo tra l’aquo.
travivar (tr.) to live through (a period, events); to live to see (something happen).
tre (adv.) very; tre multa very many, very much; tre granda very great or large; tre forta very strong. Ex.: Ca lando esas tre agreabla. To eventas tre rare.
trefo (at cards) club(s).
treko trail: footpath, unfinished road; (of race-course) track; trekojiro winding of a trail.
trelicho coarse sacking, sackcloth; denim, dungaree cloth. Def.: Speco de grosa tolo, qua uzesas nur por facar saki, ma anke (laborala) vesti; IV-644.
trelisotrellis-,lattice-work (of wood or metal) plaited wire-work; trelisigar, trelisizar to trellis, to lattice.

trem(ad)ar (intr.) to tremble, shake, shiver, quake (de, pro); (of wings) to flutter; (cf. fremisar, trepidar); tremetar to quiver, shiver; (of music) to quaver; (of light) to flicker; trem(ad)o trembling, trepidation, tremor; tremigar to cause (ulu, ulo) to tremble; ter tremo earth tremor (cf. terocilo, sismo). Ex.: La tero trem(ad)is dufoye. Me trem(et)adis pro koldeso. Tremado di la manui, di la nervi.
tremao diæresis.
tremolo (mus.) tremolo.
trempar (tr.) to soak, steep, drench, wet (thoroughly) (ulo en ulo). Ex.: Trempar la pano en la vino. Trempar la linjaro. Trempado di la sulo per la pluvo.
tremulo (bot.) aspen-tree, trembling poplar (Populus tremula).
treno (R.R.) train.

trepano (surg., instr.) trepan; (gen.) any boring instrument; –agar to trepan; to bore; ligno trepano auger; sul trepano soil-borer. Def.: Omna instrumenti por borar o perforar (partkulare kirurgiala); III-165.
trepidar (intr.) to shake, quiver, tremble; (cf. tremar). Ex.: La trepidado di korpo-membri, di la nervi. Vapornavo trepidadas pro la movado di sua mashinaro e la ondi.
treso tress, braid, twist; tresigar to braid, plait (cf. plektar); hartreso tress of hair.
tresayar (intr.) to give a start, be startled, (feel a) thrill (de, pro); tresayo thrill, tremor, start; tresayar pro joyo to feel a thrill of joy. Ex.: La tondro-stroko donis tresayo a me.
tresto trestle, wooden horse: a horizontal piece with four legs serving as a support; easel; ponto tresto trestlework bridge.

trezoro treasure; trezoreyo treasury: place where t. is found; (R.C. rel.) place for relics and ornaments: (cf. kaserio); trezorifar (intr.), trezorigar (tr.) to treasure up, hoard up. Ex.: La trezori di la tero. Ca infanto esas trezoro.

tri three (for derivatives cf. du); trio any three things or persons united; trio, triade, triplet, trey; triadek thirty; triedro (triedraangulo) (geom.) trihedral; triyara triennial; triesma lasta antepenultimate; triuno, uneso trinity; triopla krono triple crown; triseko trisection; triangulo (geom., mus.) triangle; triangulizo, triuro triangulation.
triaso* (geol.) Trias, Triassic period.
tribono tribune: a Roman magistrate. Ex.: La tribono acensis sur la tribuno.
tribuo tribe.
tribular (tr.) to cause tribulation to, to distress, afflict. Ta tempo tribulas nia psiki. La tribuli di autoro.
tribuno (rostrum); grandstand (at races, etc.); orgeno tribuno organ loft.
tribunalo tribunal, court (of justice), bench, judgement seat; tribunalo kriminala criminal court, assize court.
tributar (intr.) to pay tribute (ad ulu); tributo t.; tributanta(ad), tributanto, tributero tributary. Ex.: Tributar a Caesar. Ta lando esas tributanta ad Anglia.
tricepso* (anat.) triceps.
triciklo tricycle.
tridento trident: a three-pronged fork.
«triduum» (R.C. rel.) prayers continuing for three days.
trifolio (bot.) trefoil, clover, shamrock.
triftongo (gram.) triphthong. Def.: Grupo di tri vokali formacanta un silabo; V-486.
triglifo (arch.) triglyph.
trigonometrio trigonometry.
trigramo trigram, trigraph. Def.: Grupo di tri literi reprezentanta un sono; V-487.
trikino trichina, thread-worm (Trichinella spiralis).
trikinoso (med.) thrichinosis.
triklina (cryst.) triclinic.
trikogino* (bot.) trichogyne.
trikolora tricolo(u)red.
trikorna three-horned; three-cornered; tria chapelo (od, trikorno); three-cornered hat, shovel-hat.
trikotar (tr.) to knit (a fabric) (cf. krochar); trikotilo knitting needle or machine.
triktrako tricktrac: a kind of backgammon,
trilar (tr., mus.) to trill.
trilatera, trio trilateral.
trilemo* (log.) trilemma.
triliono trillion (1,000,000³).
trilobito* (biol.) trilobite.
trilingua trilingual.
trilogio trilogy.
trimasto (od trimasta navo) (nav.) a three-master (ship).
trimestro trimester: three months’ period; (cf. semestro).
trinomio* (math.) trinomial.
trioleto (poet.) triolet; (mus.) triplet.
tripo, tripi tripe(s); tripvendeyo tripeshop; tripsociso chitterling (of pigs); tripkordo catgut.
tripedo tripod, trivet.
tripliko* (jur.) sub-rejoinder.
triplikato triplicate: a third copy.
tripolio tripoli, rotten-stone (for polishing metals).
triptiko (paint.) triptych.
triremo (antiq.) trireme.
trisilaba trisyllabic; trio trisyllable.
trismo* (med.) trismus: lockjaw; (cf. tetanar).

trista (of persons or things) sad, sorrowful, mournful, cheerless, dispirited, doleful, gloomy; tristega lugubrious; tristeso sadness, dreariness; tristigar to sadden, throw gloom over. Ex.: Trista informo, vizajo, adio. La morto di mia amiko tristigas me. Ant.: Gaya, joyoza, kontenta.
tritono (myth.) Triton; (mollusc) triton.
triturar (tr.) to triturate (cf. pistar).

triumfar (intr.) to triumph, be triumphant (pri); triumfe in t.; triumfala procesiono triumphant procession; persono triumfanta triumphant person; triumfarko arch of t.; triumfar pri sua enemiki to t. over one’s enemies.
triumviro triumvir; triumviraro, triumvireso (collect., office) triumvirate.
triuno, trieso (also theol.) trinity.
triviala trivial, trite, commonplace, stale; trivialeso triteness; trivialajo triviality, banality; triviala verajo truism; trivialigar to make banal. Ex.: Trivial expresuro, stilo.

tro(e) (adv.) too, too much (Note: Tro may be used by itself before verbs, adjectives and adverbs, but with substantives, multa etc. is added: el tro amas il; tro multa homi); tro(e)multa, granda, plena, frua too many, great, full, early; il drinkas troe he drinks too much; lu tro(multa) mentias he lies too much; tro(e)a too, over-great, excessive; troa bruiso, od, tro granda bruiso too much noise; un glaso troa (od, tro multe) one glass too much.
trofeo trophy.
trogo trough (as for animals); hod, tray (as for carrying mortar); (cf. vazo), trogoroto bucket (of a water-wheel); trogedo hodful, troughful.
troglodito (man or animal) troglodyte: cave dweller.
«troika» (Russian) troika.
trokantero* (anat., zool., ent.) trochanter.
trokaro (surg.) trocar.
trokeo (poet.) trochee.
trokoido* (math.) trochoid.
troleo trolley; troleroto t. wheel; troleveturo t. car.
trombo (phys.) water-spout.
trombono (mus.) trombone.

trompar (tr.) to deceive, impose upon, delude (denotes intention; cf. erorigar, deceptar, dupigar); tromp(ad)o deception, imposition, cheating; trompuro imposture; trompanta, trompiva, ema deceitful; trompiva fallacious. Ex.: Trompar la fido di ulu per ulo.
trono throne; tronsidar to sit enthroned; (fig.) to lord it over; diskurso de la trono speech from the t.; entronigar to enthrone.
tropo (rhet.) trope: word(s) used figuratively.
tropiko tropics, torrid-zone.
tropismo* (biol.) tropism.
trotar (intr.) to trot (along); trotetar to go at a jog-trot; (of children) to toddle; troteskar to fall into a trot; trotigar to cause to trot, to trot (a horse).
trotuaro sidewalk, pavement: footway of stone, asphalt, etc.
trouzar (tr., intr.) to use to excess, abuse.
trovar (tr.) to find, discover, come across; trovajo thing found; (treasure-) trove; (fig.) godsend, windfall. Ex.: Trovar trezoro, kulpo, voyo, amiko.

truo hole, gap (cf. aperturo, kavo, brecho); truifar to produce holes; truozafull of holes; truizar to cover (ulo) with holes; truizita bored with holes; mus truo mousehole; hom truo manhole; truifilo, truizilo punch, hole-punching press; trusegilo (key-)hole saw.

trublar (tr.) to trouble, disturb, muddle: throw into disorder; (of liquids) to make turbid or muddy; (cf. konfuzigar, perturbar); trublar l’aquo to disturb or muddy the water; trublar la vino to make the wine turbid; trublar la digestado to disorder or disturb the digestion; trublar la raciono (di ulu) to disorder or disturb the reason; mento trublita disordered, disturbed mind.
truflo (bot.) truffle (genus: Tuber); truflizar to stuff, or cover with t.s.
truismo truism. Def.: Verajo evidenta, triviala, di aqua l’enunco esas neutila, do ridinda; V-487.
truko (R.R.) flat-car (cf. varvagono). Def.: Fervoyala, platformatra var-vagono neklozita.
trulo trowel.
trumpo trump (at cards); ludar trumpo to play, or lead with a t.
trunko (also geom.) trunk of a tree; trunkigar (geom.) to truncate; trunka kono truncate a cone.
trunkono (tech.) shell ring (of a boiler).

trupo troop, band: company of persons having same occupation; (theat.) company, troop; (of animals) band, herd, flock; trupachogang; trupala, trupatra, trupema gregarious; navo trupo ship’s crew; truponavo t. ship; kavalrio trupo cavalry t.; muton trupo flock of sheep; trupe marchar to walk in a group.

trusar (tr.) to tuck up, put a tuck in; turn up, pin up, tie up. V. exp.: Trusar esas nek levar, nek faldar on trusas robo, mantelo, maniki, pantalono, bordi di chapelo, mustacho; mem figurale nazo esas trusita; III-471.
trusto (com.) trust.
truto (icth.) trout.
truvero trouvère, trouveur. V. exp.: vid. trubaduro.

tu (acc.: tun;pl.: tui ) thou: familiar form of 2nd person singular: you; used in speaking to a child or an intimate friend; tua your; thy, thine; tuajo e meajo thine and mine; tudicar to say thee and thou (ad ulu). Ex.: Tu ne sat respektas tua olda patrulo.
tualetar (intr.) to make one’s toilet: wash and dress; careful adjustment of dress, etc.; tualeto toilet; tualeteyo dressing room; tualettablo dressing table; tualettuko towel.
tubo tube, pipe (of lead, iron, etc.); tubizar, tubagarto tube, pipe: put tubes in (ulo); tubala, tubatra, tuboza tubular; vitra –oglass t.; kamen tubo chimney-flue, shaft.
tubero (anat., bot.) tuberosity; node; (of wood) knot; tuberoza tuberous, nodose; knotty, gnarled; (cf. tuberkulo).
tuberkloso (med.) tuberculosis, consumption; tuberklosala, tuberklosoza tubercular, tuberculous: relating to the disease; tuberklosika, tuberklosik(ul)o tubercular person).
tuberkulo (bot.) tubercle; (physiol.) a small tumor (tumour), or tumorlike elevation; (cf. tubero).
tuberoso (bot.) tuberose (Polyanthes tuberosa).
tubulo (chem.) tubule (as of a retort).
tuerta, tuert(ul)o one-eyed (person): blind in one eye.

tufo tuft, bunch, cluster, clump, wisp (of straw: assemblage of things of the same nature: threads, feathers, hair, etc. (cf. penacho); har tufo tuft of hair; arbor tufoclump of trees; herbo tufo bunch of herbs; tufnodo knot (of ribbons), favor (favour); pudro tufo powder-puff; tufizar, tufifar to form into t.s.
tuko (a piece of) cloth; (cf. drapo, stofo); naz tuko handkerchief: vish tuko (dish-) wiper, duster (of cloth).
tukano (orni.) toucan (genus: Rhamphastus).
tulo (fabric) tulle.
tulipo (plant, flower) tulip; tuliparborot. tree, whitewood, white poplar: liriodendron (Liriodendron Tulipifera).
tumefaktar (tr., med.) to tumefy, cause to swell; tumefakto, tumefakturo tumefaction.
tumoro tumor (tumour):morbid swelling.
tumulo (antiq.) tumulus, barrow, cairn, burial mound.

tumultar (intr.) to raise a tumult, disturbance, uproar, hubbub, to (cause a) row, a riot; tumulto tumult, riot; tumulteto row, squabble, brawl; bustle; tumulte disorderly and noisy, tumultuously; tumultala, tumultoza, tumultema, tumultatra tumultuous, turbulent, riotous.
tuno ton: 1000kg.; about 2205 lbs, avd.; tunaro, tunkonteno (nav.) tonnage.
«tundra» (Russian) tundra.
tunelo tunnel; (city R.R.) tube, subeway.
tuniko (coat of soldiers, pupils) tunic, an antique undergarment; (anat.) coat, film, tunic (of the eye); wall (of the stomach); (bot.) coat, integument; tunikiero (zool.) tunicate.
tupio (spinning-, peg-) top; ludar per tupii to spin tops.
turo tour; turisto tourist; mondo turo world tour; inspekto turo tour, round of inspection. Ex.: Facar turo di la mondo, di urbo, di lando, di domeno.
turbo (of persons) crowd, throng, multitude; turbacho mob; turbe in crowds.
turbano turban.
turbino (mechan.) turbine; turbinnavo t. ship; vapor turbino steam t.
turboto (ich.) turbot (Rhombus maximus).
«turco» turco: Algerian soldier.
turdo (orni.) thrush (genus: Turdus).
turgecar (intr., med.) to be turgescent.
turkezo (min.) turquoise; turkezblua t. blue.
turmo tower; (at chess) castle; (nav.) turret; Babel turmo tower of Babel; turmonavo turret-ship.
turmalino (min.) t(o)urmaline.

turnar (tr., intr.) to turn (from right to left), turn around, to (cause to) move circularly), twist, whirl, wheel around; (cf. jirar, rotacar, renversar, volvar, tornar); turno turn; turnar la kapo, la klefo to turn the head, the key; roto turno a turn of a wheel; klefklozar duturne(od, per di turni) la pordo to double lock the door; miturno half turn; riturno turn about, face about, change of side; turnanta dervisho whirling dervish; turnoplako, turntablo turntable; turnorgeno hand-organ; turnohoko swivel; turnokesto revolving box (as for foundlings in a convent); turnopordo, turnbarilo turnstile; turnokruco, turnbarilo tourniquet; turnomorbo (vet.) staggers; skrubturnilo turn-screw; screwdriver; turnokontilorevolution counter (on an engine). V. exp.: vid. jirar.
turnirar (intr.) to hold a tournament, to joust, to take part in a tourney.
turtooil-cake (for feed of beasts); lin turto linseed.
turturo (orni.) turtle-dove (genus: Turtur).
tusar (intr.) to cough; tusetar to cough: clear one’s throat, to hem; tusaceso fit of coughing.

tushar (tr., intr.) to touch, be in contact with.. (N.B. not concern); to put one’s hand, foot, etc. (on); (cf. palpar, kontaktar, kontigua); tushosenso sense of touch; tushala, iva tactile; tushebla tangible (cf. palpebla). Ex.: Tushar ulo per la fingri. Lua pedi tushis la sulo. Regardez ol, ma ne tushez.
tusilajo (bot.) coltsfoot (genus: Tusilago).

tuvar (tr., nav.) to warp: move a ship or boat by a rope or cable attached to some fixed object; tuvokablo stream-line, warping-hawser. V. exp.: Tuvar ne esas sinonima di remorkar. Navo tuvas (su ed altri) per kateno fixa en rivero o kanalo; IV-645.
tuyo (bot.) thuja (-tree), arbor vitæ (genus: Thuja).
ubiqua ubiquitous; ubiqueso ubiquity. Def.: Qua esas omnaloke; IV-270.
uf* (interj.) ugh! uff! oof!
ukazo ukase: edict of (Russian) emperor.

ula some, any: indicates a certain, but only partly defined person or object; (semi-indefinite article) a, an (used only where it is desired to emphasize indefiniteness); ulo something; ulu someone, somebody, anyone; uli some, any (persons or things); uldie some day; ulloke, ulube somewhere; ulmaniere (od, ule) in some manner or way; ulu altra someone else; ula altra some other; ulfoye once, one time; ultempeever, sometime(s). V. exp.: Ula ne indikas kompleta nedetermineso (quan irga expresus plu juste), ma mi-determineso. Ula povas anke ludar la rolo di la nedfinita artiklo, se (o kande) on trovas ica necesa. Ex.: Me stacas avan la biblioteko di amiko (me ne dicas: di ula amiko, nam me pensas (pri) nula amiko partikulare o predere); me dicas a lu: «Me deziras libro». To signifikas: «Me deziras lektar, donez a me (irga) libro». Ma se me dicas: «Me deziras ula libro», to signifikas: «Me deziras lektar partikulara libro (konocata da me, o ja lektita),» quan me ne povas indikar plu exacte, pro ke me obliviis l’autoro, o la titulo: ma me tamen havas l’ideo plu o min konfuza di ta libro, e ne di altra: adminime, di libro apartenanta ad «ula» speco o relatanta «ula» temo, quan me povas definar; III-28. Note: Ula, irga: Ula is used in a semi-indefinite sense, irga emphasizes complete indefiniteness. Ex.: ula maniero some manner or way; irga maniero any manner or way whatever; ula dio en la lasta monato one day (= a certain day, but date not specified; irga dio would signify any day whatever); ula viro decensis de Ierusalem a Ierico a certain man (name not specified) went down from J. to J.; irga viro would signify any man whatever.
ulano uhlan: a German lancer.
ulcero ulcer; -ala, ulceratra ulcerous; ulcerifar (intr.), ulcerizar (tr.): to ulcerate; ulcerifo, ulcerizo ulceration; ulcerigar to cause (ulo) to ulcerate.
ulmo (bot.) elm (-tree) (genus: Ulmus).
ulno:ell 45 or 46.5 inches.
ultimato ultimatum.

ultra ultra: beyond due limit; further, additional; ultra zelo extreme, exaggerated zeal; ultra, ultre royalisto ultra-royalist, royalist in an excessive degree; ultre (prep., adv.) besides, further, moreover, in addition (to this); ultre ke (conj.) besides (that) (followed by verb). Ex.: Ultre, me volas dicar Ultre la prezenta infinitivo, Ido havas pasinta e futura infinitivo. Ultre ke, el esas richa, el esas bela e saja. Ultre mea patrala linguo, me savas plura altri. V. exp.: Ultre, pluse: Ultre esas prepoziciono, qua qua signifikas: adjunte ad Exemple: «Ultre mea repasto me prenis kafeo.» Do ultre grande diferas de plus, qua indikas la kozo adjuntata. Advere de la matematikal vidpunto la difero ne esas grava, pro ke A + B = B + A. Ma en la komuna vivo l’ordino ne esas indiferanta, sive pro la tempo, sive pro l’importo relativa e tre neegala di l’adicionendi. Exemple, l’antea frazo equivalas: « Me prenis mea repasto plus kafeo». Esus ridinda dicar: «Me prenis kafeo plus mea repasto», kontre ke on povas dicar tre bone: «Me prenis kafe ultre mea repasto.» De to konsequas, ke on nultempe bezonas adverbigar ultre la adverbo uzenda esas sempre pluse, qua anuncas l’adjunto di altra kozo a l’unesma o predicita; VII-481.
ultramaro, ultramara, ultramarea ultramarine.
ultramikroskopio ultramicroscope.
ultramontana, ultramontan(ul)o ultramontan-e, ist; ultramontanismo ultramontanism.
ulular (intr.) to ululate: (of owls) to hoot; (of dogs, wolves, etc.) to howl.
umbelo (bot.) umbel.
umbelifera, umbelifero (bot.) umbeliferous (plant).
umbiliko (anat., bot., geom.) navel, umbilicus.
umbro (pigment) umber.
unanima unanimous; unanimeso unanimity.
unco (zool.) ounce (Felis unce).
unciala, uncialo uncial (letter).
uncionar (tr.) to anoint (ulu, per ulo); extrema unciono (R.C. rel.) extreme unction; (cf. unguento).
unglo (anat.) nail, claw, talon; ungloza unguiculated; emundar (od, taliar) sua ungli to trim, cut one’s nails; la kato unglotenas su ye l’arboro the cat clings to the tree.
unguento ointment, salve, unguent.
unhufa solipedous, solidungulate, whole hoofed (animal).

uniforma uniform; (of movement) regular; uniformo (regimentals) uniform; uniformeso uniformity (cf. monotoneso); uniformigar to make (ulo) u.; soldat uniformo soldier’s u.; granda uniformo full dress u. Def.: Qua havas la sama formo; simila. Ex.: Uniforma domi, stilo, vesto. Uniformeso di opiniono.
unikorno (also astron.) unicorn: a fabulous animal.
unikursala (geom.) unicursal.

unionar (tr., immaterial sense) to unite (cf. juntar, ligar); uniono, unionuro union, conjuction (cf. konkordo); uniono postala postal u. Ex.: Unionar la plezuri a l’aferi. Unionar la gefianciti. Uniono laboristala. La spirito di unioneso.
unipola unipolar.
unisono (mus. and fig.) unison.
unitara, unitar(ul)o Unitarian; unitarismo (rel. sect., doctrine) Unitarianism.
univalva* (of shells) univalvular.
universo universe; universala universal; universaleso universality; universigar to make (ulo) universal; universalisti (rel.) universalists.
universitato university; universitatano member of u.; an (under)graduate.
unlatera unilateral; (jur.) binding on one party only.
unsenca having but one meaning, signification.
unsexua (bot.) unisexual.
unto coom: old cart-grease.
unvalva (bot., conch.) univalvular.
upupo (orni.) hoopoe (genus: Upupa).
uragano hurricane, violent gale.
urano* (chem.) uranium; uranoxo proto-oxide of u., pitchblende.
uranografio uranography.
urato* (chem.) urate.
urbo city, large town; (cf. civito); urbego a large c.: (cf. metropolo); urbala urban; urbodomo city-hall; urbestro mayor.
urdar (tr., of weaving) to warp (cloth).
ureo* (chem.) urea.
uremio* (med.) ur(a)eia.
uretero* (anat.) ureter (duct).
uretro (anat.) urethra.
uretrito* (med.) urethritis.
uretroskopo* urethroscope.
uretrotomio* (surg.) urethrotomy.
urino urine; urinala urinary; urinifar to urinate, make water (cf. miktar); urinvazo urinal, pot; urinifeyo (public) urinal.
urno urn; urno elektala ballot-box.
urogalo capercailzie: the largest European grouse (Tetrao urogallus).
uroxo (zool.) aurochs: European bison (Bos urus).
urso, ursulo, ursino (zool.) bear (genus: Ursus); ursyuno young b.; granda, mikra urso (astron.) Great, Little Bear; ursala ursine.
urtiko (stinging-)nettle (genus: Urtica); urtikago (med.) urtication: whipping or stinging with nettles.
urtikario urticaria, nettle-rash.
ushero usher (judicial courts, etc.). Def.: Ta qua komisesas oficale por konocigar ed exekutigar la judiciala decidi.
utardo (orni.) bustard (Otis tarda).
utensilo utensil, tool, instrument, implement; utensili koqu(ey)ala kitchen u.; utensili kultivala farming tools.
utero uterus, womb.
utopio utopia; utopia, utopiala, utopiatra utopian; (cf. kimera); utopiisto utopist.
utrikulo utricle.
uveo (anat.) uvea.
uverturo (mus.) overture.
uvulo (anat.) uvula.
uzufruktar (tr., jur.) to have the usufruct of (ulo).
uzukaptar (tr., jur.) to have the usucaption of (ulo).
uzurar (intr.) to practice usury.
uzurpar (tr.) to usurp (ulo de ulu); to encroach upon, trench upon, infringe; uzurpo usurpation, encroachment. Ex.: Uzurpar la trono, ula yuro, povo, domeno.
vabo honey-comb. Def.: Konstrukturo ek vaxo, quan la abeli facas en la abeluyo IV-398.

vacilar (intr.) to vacillate: be unsteady, waver, reel, stagger; to fluctuate, waver in mind or opinion; (of light) to flicker; (in speaking) to falter; vacil(ad)o vacillation; vacilar sur la gambi to shake in or be unsteady on the legs. Ex.: La tablo vacilas. Ta homo havis vacilanta marcho (-maniero). Lumo qua vacilas.
vacino (disease) cow-pox; vacinserumo vaccine (matter); vacinizar to vaccinate (ulu); vaciniz(ad)o vaccination; vacinifar to produce cow-pox.
vacinio (bot.) red whortleberry (or billberry), cowberry (Vaccinium).
(tra) vadar (tr.) to ford, wade across (a river, etc.); eyo ford; ebla fordable.
«vademecum» vade mecum.
vaflo waffle: thin cake; vaflmuldilo w. iron.
vagar (intr.) to wander, rove about, stroll, stray, straggle; vagado roaming, vagrancy; vagema; vagemacho vagrant, vagabond; vaganta mendikero strolling beggar; vaganta mento (fig.) wandering mind.
vagino (anat.) vagina.
vagono railway-carriage, car; vagono unesmaklasa first class c.; lit, dormo vagono sleeper; restor vagono dining-car.
vajisar (intr., of infants) to wail, cry. V. exp.: La specala krio di nove naskinta o yuna infanto; IV-578.
vakar (intr.) to be vacant; vako vacancy; vakanta vacant. Ex.: La trono, la ofico vakas. Vakigar la trono, lo ofico. Vakanta aprtamento, episkopeso.
vakancar (intr.) to have a (or, be on a) vacation, holiday; vakancdio a day's holiday. Ex.: Pasar la vakanco en la ruro. Ni vakancas dufoye dum la yaro: la paskala e la somerala vakanco.

vakua empty, void, blank, vacuous (de); vakuo vacuum, blank; vakueso vacuity, emptiness; vakuajo gap, chasm, hole; vakuigar to empty, vacate; to draw (poultry), to gut (fish); to drain (a ditch, etc.); vakueskar to become empty; vakuifar to make a void, produce a vacuum (as by air-pump); vakua chambro, stomako, spaco empty room, stomach, space; vakua muro blank wall; vakua tempo unoccupied time; aer vakuo air-vacuum, -hole; latrin vakuigo emptying of cess-pools or water-closets; vakuigar botelo to empty a bottle; la botelo vakueskas lente the bottle becomes slowly empty. Ant.: plena.
vakuolo* (biol.) vacuole.
vakuometro vacuum gauge.
valo vale, valley, dale; (cf. advale); valeto small valley, dell; tra monti e vali up hill and down dale; valo lakrimoza (fig.) vale of tears.
valenta* (chem.) having valence; valenteso valence.
valeriano (bot.) valerian (genus: Valerians); valerianacido valer(ian) acid.
valerianelo (bot.) valerianella, corn-salad, lamb's lettuce (Valerianella olitoria).
valida (jur.) valid: having legal force, good; valideso validity; healthfulness; validigar to validate; valida mariajo a legal marriage; ne validigar to invalidate.
valizo valise, portmanteau.

valorar (intr.) to be worth, be equal to in value, be as good as; be fit, be useful or good (for something); (of laws) to be in force; valorigar to make (ulo) of worth, of value, make useful for; valoro value, worth; valoranta worth; valoroza valuable; valorajo valuable object; valorpaperi (com.) valuable papers: stocks, securities, etc.; valorigar lego to put a law in force; sen valorigar to deprive (ulo) of value, to demonetize (money); sen valora valueless; min valorigar, valoreskar to depreciate; pen valorar to be worth the trouble, be worth while; plu valoro superior, increased value; min valoro less, inferior value; ica stofo valoras kin franki po metro this fabric is worth five francs a meter; to valoras nulo that is good for, worth nothing; valorar sua pezo de oro to be worth its weight in gold; quante co valoras how much is this worth; ica medikamento valoras kontre febro this medicine is good for fever; ica plumo neplus valoras por skribar this pen is no longer fit to write with; to valoras la peno (od, penvaloras) askoltar that worth listening to; valorigar sua talento to turn one's talent to account.
valsar (intr.), valsigar (tr.) to waltz.
valvo (tech., zool., bot.) valve.
vampiro (also fig.) vampire.
vamso doublet, jerkin.

vana vain: fruitless, ieffectual; (cf. vanitatoza, frivola); vane in vain, to no purpose; no use! vaneso vanity (N.B. not of person), emptiness, vainness (of a project, etc.); vanigar to thwart, baffle, foil; vanajo a v. act, wish. Def.: Sen-efikiva; sen-rezulta; sen reala fundmaneto. Ex.: Vana esforci, esperi. Vaneso di homala grandaji. Vaneso di la vanaji, omno esas vanajo.
vanado* (chem.) vanadium.
vandala, vandal(ul)o vandal; vandaleso, vandalajo (spirit, act) vandalism.
vanelo (orni.) lapwing, peewit, plover (genus: Vanellus).
vanilo vanilla; vaniliero v. plant (genus: Vanilla).
vanitato vanity, self-conceit; vanitatoza, vanitatoz(ul)o self-admiring, vain (person). Ex.: Lua vanitato esas netolerabla. V. exp.: vid. superba. Ant.: modesteso.
vanto, vanti (nav.) shroud(s); vanti granda main s.

vaporo steam (from boiling water); vapor (from liquids or fluid floating in the atmosphere); (of wine) fume (affecting the head); vaporoza, vaporatra vapor-ous, ish; vaporigar to vaporize, volatalize; vaporeskar to evaporate; turn into vapor; vaporigilo evaporating machine; vaporagar (tr.) to steam (ulo), give a steam bath to; vaporbalno vapor-, steam-bath; vapormashino steam engine; vapornavo steam boat; incens vaporo cloud of incense; arseno vapori fumes of arsenic.
varo, vari ware(s), commodit-y, -ies; merchandize (cf. komercajo). Def.: Kozo vendebla, granda o mikra; II-76.
varango (nav.) floor-timber (of a ship).

vari(ad)ar (tr., intr.) to vary, change; (cf. chanjar, diversigar); variigar to cause (ulo) to vary; varianta, variiva, variebla, variema variable, versatile, unsteady, fickle, flighty; varianto a variant (reading, interpretation, spelling. etc.); variebleso; variemeso variableness; variability; versatility; variar la frazo to say the same things in other words. Ex.: Mori varias segun la nacioni. La vetero varias perpetue. V. exp.: Chanjar ne esas exakta sinonimo di variar: variar esas chanjar segun quanteso od inteseso; III-103.
varicelo (med.) varicella: chicken-pox.
varietato (zool., bot.) variety.
variko (med.) varix: varicose vein.
variolo (med.) variola: smallpox; variolala variolous: relating to v.; varioliko, variolika (person) suffering from v.; variolmarkizita pock-marked.
varsar (tr.) to pour (out) (as liquids); to spill (accidentally); shed (blood); to empty (solid things); varsero (astron.) Aquarius. V. exp.: vid. rakar.

vartar (tr.) to await, wait for (ulu, ulo); vartigar to keep (ulu) waiting; vartanta waiting, expectant; vartante while waiting, in the interim (cf. dume); varteyo waiting-place, -room. Def.: Restar en la ula loko o stando, til ke ulo eventas; III-423. Ex.: Me vartas nepaciente la decido. V. exp.: vid. expektar.
vasala, vasal(ul)o vassal; vasaleso vassalage.
vasko basin (as of a fountain).
vaskulo (anat., biol.) blood vessel, tube, canal; vaskulala, vaskuloza vascular; vaskularo vascular system.

vasta vast, extensive (in all directions); vasteso vastness, vast extent, spaciousness; pluvastigar to spread (ulo), to make more extensive. Def.: Granda segun omna sua dimensioni; III-42. Ex.: Vasta agro esas agro same longa e larja; vasta salono esas salono same proporcione longa, larja ed alta. Figurale, on pluvastigas ula ideo od opiniono (donar ad ol plu granda areo). Vasta eruditeso.
vato wadding, padding: soft stuff of loose texture; prepared sheets of carded cotton (as used to thicken dresses, quilts, etc.); vatizar to wad, pad, stuff (with wadding).
vaxo wax (of any kind, nat. or artific.); vaxizar to (smear, rub with) wax; vaxotelo oil-cloth; siglo vaxo sealing w.; modlo vaxo modeling w.; parquet vaxo floor w.
vazo vessel (for holding liquids); vase (as for flowers, etc.); vazaro arjenta silver service; stana vazo tin-pot, -vessel.
vazelino vaseline.
(ho) ve alas! oh dear!
vecho (bot.) vetch (genus: Vicia).
vedeto* vedette: (mounted) sentinel; vedetbatelo scout-boat.
vegro (nav.) plank (for ceiling).

vehar (intr.) to go about in any sort of vehicle: ride, drive, sail; vehigar to convey, carry, cart, transport (in a vehicle); veh(ad)o riding, driving, sailing; vehilo vehicle: any means of transport by land, air or water; (fig.) any means of transmitting; (med.) excipient; menstruum; aero esas vehilo di sono air is v. of sound; imprimarto esas vehilo por instrukto the art of printing is a v. of instruction.

veino (anat., also of marble, wood) vein; (geol., min.) vein, seam; veinala venous: relating to v.s; veinizita marked with v.s; veinaro venous system; veinizar to v.: mark wit v.s; veinoseko phlebotomy.

vejet(ad)ar (intr.) to vegetate: grow as or like a plant; (fig.) to lead a dull life; vejet(ad)o vegetating; vejetala vegetable; vejetanta (of persons) vegetating; vejetiva vegetative; vejetantaro vegetation; vejetanto, vejetivo vegetable, plant (cf. legumo).
vejetarar (intr.) to be a vegetarian; vejetaro, vejetarismo vegetarianism; vejetaranto, vejetarano vegetarian.
vekar (intr., also fig.) to awaken, wake up; vekigar to wake, rouse (ulu); veko, vekigo awakening; vekigilo alarm.
vekto beam (of scales); tiro vekto swingle-tree, -bar (of a carriage).
vektoro* (geom.) vector.

velo veil; a piece of stuff used to conceal something; (fig.) cover, screen, shade; veleto small v.; lady's v.; velego awning; velizar to veil; cover, hide; velo gaza gauze v.; nubo velo v. of clouds; palat velo (anat.) velum. Ex.: Eskartar, levar la vel(et)o de la vizajo. La velo di la templo. La veli (E. shades) di la nokto. La nubi velizas la suno.
velino vellum; velinpapero v. paper.
velito (Rom. antiq.) velite: a light-armed soldier.
velkar (intr.) to fade away, wither, lose freshness; (of flowers) to droop; velkigar to cause (ulo) to wither. Ex.: La suno velkigis la folii di la planti.
velocipedo velociped.
velodromo* velodrome.
veluro velvet; velura made of v.; veluratrajo imitation v.; velous.
venar (intr.) to come (ad, de); parvear to arrive; parveninto an arrival.
«vendetta» vendetta.
venerala venereal (relating to the disease); veneriko, venerika (person) afflicted with v. disease; venerala monto (anat.) pubes, mons veneris.
veneracar (tr.) to venerate, reverence; veneracinda venerable; veneracema reverent. Def.: Veneraco: projunda respekto religioza o religiatra; III-328.
venerdio Friday.
veniala venial: that may be forgiven; excusable; veniala peko v. sin.

venjar (tr.) to avenge, revenge; venjar su to revenge oneself (su, ulu, kontre ulu, pri ulo); venjo revenge, vengeance; venjema revengeful, vindicative; venjemeso vindictiveness; venjanto, venjero avenger. V. exp.: Venjar ulu esas punisar, pro rankoro, altru qua facis domajo od ofenso ad «ulu». Venjar esas tranzitiva; on povaos venjar su od altru; on povas anke venjar ulo (ex. l’ocido di sua patro). Pluse la venjo aplikesas, ne nur al autoro di la domajo od ofeso, ma anke a lua familio o havajo. Exemple, en Korsika, la venjo (vendetta) praktikesas inter du familii: se A ocidis B, la filio di B ocidas A; pose la filo di A ocidas la filio di B, . . . e tale senfine, o ti la destrukto di la du familii; VI-143; kp. revanchar, reprezalar.

ventar (intr.) to blow, be windy; ventas (impers.) it is windy, the wind is blowing, there is a (high) wind; vento wind; ventego strong wind, gale; ventstroko squall, gust of wind; ventoza windy; ventizar to give wind to; ventizilo fan or fan-like instrument; para vento w. screen; ventomuelilo w. mill; ventoflecho, ventflago weathervane; ventorozo (nav.) compass card.
ventilar (tr.) to ventilate, air.
ventilatoro* ventilator; kanvas ventilatoro (nav.) windsail.

ventro belly, paunch, stomach; (of bottles, etc.) belly, body; (cf. abdomeno, stomako); ventrala ventral: relating to the b.; ventroza paunchy, big bellied; ventredo bellyful; ventrzono b. band; girth (of a horse); ventrdoloro b. ache.
ventrikulo (anat.) ventricle.
ventroparolar (intr.) to ventriloquize; ventroado, ventroiveso ventriloquism; ventroanto, ventroero ventriloquist.
ventuzo (surg.) cupping-glass; ventuzagar to cup (ulu).

vera true, veritable; (cf. reala, autentika); vereso (quality) truth; verajo a truth; la vera (abstract) the truth; vere verily, truly (cf. advere); versimila likely, plausible, true seeming; versimilajo, vereso likelihood, versimilitude (cf. probablajo); versemblanta ostensible, apparent; versembleso speciousness; verigar to make (ulo) true; (math.) to prove; neverajo, vereso falsehood, falseness. Ex.: Vera diamanto. Vu ne dicas la verajo. Esas nula vereso en to quon vu dicas. Matematikala verajo. Fato vere tragediala. Ulfoye la verso povas semblar tre neversimila. La deskovro di lo vera ofte dependas de la komparo di versimilaji. Lu esas verdicanta homo. La verdicemeso di historiisto.
verando veranda.
verbo (gram.) verb; verbala verbal: relating to v.s.
verbasko (bot.) mullein (genus: Verbascum).
verbeno (bot.) verbena, vervain (genus: Verbena).
verdigriso verdigris.
verdikto (jur.) verdict; finding; facar verdikto to render a v.
verdrono (orni.) greenfinch, greenlinnet (Fringilla chloris).

vergo rod, wand; ferule or birch (used for punishment); vergeto small rod, switch; vergagar (tr.) to flog (with a birch), to cane; vergomarko mark of a rod. Ex.: La vergo di Moses, di magiisto. Frapar ulu per vergeto.
verjuso verjuice: the sour juice of unripe or green fruits; (fig.) acid liquor. V. exp.: Dicesas metafore pri vino tro yuna od acida; IV-646.

verko (lit., artist., moral, social) work; verketo essay, pamphlet; small deed; verkaro literature (= books in general; cf. literaturo); verkaro ciencala scientific works (books). Ex.: Verki da Molière. La merito di bona verki. On opinionis ne vivar vane quankam lua verki apene lasas traci.

vermo worm: any small creeping animal; maggot, grub Z(cf. larvo, lombriko, silkoraupo, tenio); vermoza wormy; vermorodita w. eaten; vermoforma w. shaped; (anat.) vermiform; vermetoza (arch.) vermicular.
vermicelo vermicelli.
vermuto (liqueur) verm(o)uth.
verniero* vernier: a sliding rule.
verniso varnish; vernisizar to v.
veroniko (bot.) veronica: speedwell (genus: Veronica).

vers (prep., physical sense) toward(s): in the direction of (cf. ad); vers la nordo t. the north; levar la manui vers la cielo to hold up the hands to heaven; lu turnis sua kapo vers me he turned hes head toward me. Def.: Directiono en la spaco; VI-144.
verso verse (in poetry; also of Bible); versajo, versaro a piece of poetry, verse(s), poem; verso senrima blank v.; versifar to write v.; versigar to versify (ulo).
versiono version: manner of relating a fact (cf. tradukuro). Ex.: Existas plura versioni pri l’acidento.
versoro* (math.) versor.
vertebro vertebra: joint or bone of spine; vertebrala kolono vertebral column; vertebroza, vertebrozo vertebrate animal; sen vertebra, vertebro invertebrate (animal).
vertico vertex: top, crow (of head), sinciput.
vertigo* (vet.) staggers.
vertikala vertical, perpendicular, plumb; vertikalo v. line; vertikaleso verticalness (cf. perpendikleso).

vertuo vrtue; (cf. chasteso); vertuoza virtuous; esar vertuoza pro neceseso to make a virtue of necessity. Def.: Etikala tendenco facar lo bona ed evitar lo mala. Ex.: Vertui kardinala. Vertuoza homo, ago. Ant.: vicio.
veruko (med.) wart.

vervo verve: animation, spirit, go; vervoza animated, spirited, racy; vervoza stilo animated style; vervo poeziala poetic spirit. Def.: Ardoro di imaginado, di la spirito, qua anmizas la poeto, l’oratoro, la konversanto, e.c. V. exp.: vid. entuziasmo.
vespo (ent.) wasp; vespeyo, vesponesto w. nest.
vespertilio (zool.) bat (genus: Vespertilio).
vespro, vespri (R.C. rel.) vesper(s).

vesto garment: article of clothing, vestment; vestaro clothes, attire, dress, toilet, garb, habiliment; raiment, wearing apparel; vesteyo, vestizeyo dressing-place, -room; vestizar to clothe, dress, array (ulu, per ulo) (cf. metar); vestizita dressed, clad; vestizachar to rig out in, bedizen (ridiculously); vestodono regulierala taking the habit or veil (friars or nuns); vestovendisto clothier; sub vesto undergarment; trauro vesto mourning garment.
vestalo vestal-virgin; (fig.) chaste woman.
vestio round jackets (without tails, as for waiters, fencing, etc.).
vestibulo vestibule: front hall of an edifice, anteroom, lobby.
vestono jacket: short coat for men (cf. jaketo).
vetar (tr.) to veto, negative (ulo); vetoyuro right of veto.
vetero weather; vetero nuboza cloudy w.
veterano veteran: old soldier; (fig.) any one of long practice.
veterinaro veterinary (-surgeon).
vetivero (bot.) vetiver (genus: Andropogon).
vetrino glass case (for showing objects, as in museums, shops, etc.), show-case.

vexar (tr.) to vex, provoke, irritate; (cf. despitar, molestar); vexetar to tease, plague, tantalize; vexetema teasing (person); la deskomforto jenas me; me esas vexata pro to the inconvenience annoys me; I am vexed because of it; la pueruli vexetas la puerini the boys tease the girls.
veziko (anat., zool.) bladder; veziketo small b.; (of skin) vesicle; vezikigar to vesicate: blister; vezikigiva vesicatory.
vezikatorio (med.) vesicatory: blistering application.
vi you (plural, see vu); via your (plural).
viadukto viaduct.
viatiko money or provisions given for a journey; (R.C. rel.) viaticum, last sacrament. V. exp.: La primitiva senco esas voyajo-subvenciono, de qua venas la religiala senco; IV-646.
vibr(ad)ar (intr.) to vibrate. Ex.: Vibrado di la violin-kordi, di la aero, di pendulo.
vibriono (bacteriol.) vibrio (genus: Vibrio).
viburno viburnum, snow-ball tree (genus: Viburnum).
vice() (prep. and prefix) vice, instead of; vice( ke (conj.) instead that. Ex.: Vice Iphigenia cervino sakrifikesis ad Artemis. Vice laborar, vu dormis..
viceparolanto, viceero spokesman.
viceprezidanto vice-president.
vicero (anat.) viscus; viceri, viceraro viscera; vicerala visceral. V. exp.: Vicero havas senco diferanta de intestino, e plu vasta: ex. la kordio esas vicero; IV-81.
vicerejo viceroy.

vicio vice: fault of character (cf. defekto, manko); viciozeso viciousness, depravity; vicioza vicious (cf. perversa); vicioza cirklo (fig.) vicious circle; viciizar to vitiate: taint, contaminate; to sully (the character of); (jur.) to render defective or void. Ex.: Ebriemeso esas vicio. Vici-zar legal akto. Ant.: vertuo.

vicina (esp. of people) neighboring, bordering, contiguous, adjacent (cf. proxima, apuda, kontigua); vicin(ul)o neighbor; vicinaro neighborhood: neighbors; vicineso (state) neighborhood: nearness, vicinity (of); vicinajo vicinity: (place); something neighboring (cf. cirkumajo); vicinesar to be contiguous.
vidamo (feudalism) vidame.
vidva widowed; vidvulo widower; vidvino widow; vidveso widowhood; vidveskar to become a widow(er).
vielo vielle: a stringed instrument played upon with a wheel; (cf. turnorgeno). Def.: Instrumento muzkala kun kordi, quan on pleas per manivelo e klavi.

vigilar (intr.) to abstain from sleep; to watch; to sit up; (cf. vekar); vigil(ad)o vigil: being awake; on the alert; watching; (act.) vigilance; vigilanta wide-awake, vigilant (act); vigilema (tendency) watchful, vigilant; vigilemeso vigilance; vigilanto, vigilero, vigilisto watcher; armo vigilo armed watch; vigilar por malado to sit up for (with) a sick person; vigilar til jorno (lumo) to sit up, stay up, keep awake until daylight; vigilanta patrulo di la familio a watchful father fo the family; vigilanta sorgo vigilant care.
vigilio vigil; eve of a feast pf R.C. church. V. exp.: La dio ante la dio, quan on konsideras. Necesa ed internaciona en la religial uzo; IV-646.
vigoro vigor; vigoroza, vigoroze vigorous (ly). Ex.: Vigoro di yuneso, di la mento. Agar vigoroze.
vikario vicar: substitue in office; curate; vikarieso vicariate; curacy; la vikario di Iesu Kristo the v. of Jesus Christ, the pope; grand vikario (od, vikariogeneralo) v. general.
viktimo victim: person or animal sacrificed; (fig.) sufferer, dupe; viktimigar to victimize (ulu); viktimohoma human v.
viktualio victuals, provisions; (nav.) stores. Def.: Provizuri por manjar; IV-646.
vikuno (zool.) vicuna, vicugna (Auchenia vicunna); vikunlano v. cloth.
vilo (bot., anat.) villosity: coating of hairs; viloza villous; (cf. vilozito).
vilajo village; vilajeto small v., hamlet; vilajano villager.
vilanelo villanelle: a kind of rustic ballad or dance.
vilejar (intr.) to rusticate; vilej(ad)o sojourn in the country.
«villa» villa.
vilozito, viloziti (of intestines) villosity; (cf. vilo).
vimplo wimple (as of nuns).
vino wine; vinala, vinoza, vinatra vinous; vinea w. colored; vinifado vnification, w. making; vinvendeyo, vinerio w. shop; vino nefermentacinta unfermented w., sweet w.; vino sensukra dry w.
vinagro vinegar; vinagrifar to make v.; vinagrizar to put v. on; vinagruyo v. cruet; -holder.
vindar (tr.) to reel up; to wind or hoist (as with a windlass; cf. spular, hisar, envolvar); vindilo windlass, winch.

vinkar (tr.) to overcome, vanquish, conquer, master, defeat, get the bette of; (intr.) to win; be victorious; vinko victory; vinkanto, vinkero conquerer, victor; vinkanta, vinkema, vinkoza victorious; vinkala kanto song of vicory.
vintro winter; vintrala windtry; vintre in w.; en meza vintro in the depth of w.
vinyeto (engraved) vignette (of books, papers); vinyetoza papero paper with ornamented borders.
violo (bot.) violet; violea, violkolora v. colored, purple; violatra v. like; purplish.

violentar (tr.) to violate: do or use violence to, to ill use, force (ulu, ulo); violent(ad)o violating, violence; (jur.) force; violentala morto violent death; violentoza, violentema violent: (persons, winds, passions, etc.); violentesar to suffer violence (da). Ex.: Violentar la koncienco.
violino violin, fiddle; violinplear to play the v.; violinagar to play (ulo) on the v.; violin(ple)ero, violinisto v. player.
violoncelo violoncello, ’cello.
vipero viper: venemous reptile, as adder; (fig.) malignant person; viperala, viperatra viperine; viperlango (fig.) an evil tongue.

viro a (grown) man, a manly person: male adult possessing masculine qualities, as a soldier, etc.; virala, viratra virile, manly (of voice, sexual organs, etc.); vireso virility, manliness, manhood, man's estate, vigor; viraro crew (of a ship), squad of men, etc.; viratra muliero virago; virizar to man, provide men for.

virga virgin(al: entirely chaste, also in fig. sense; virga tero v. soil; virga foresto untrodden forest; virga metalo native, v. metal; virgulo a chaste man or male; virgino virgin; virgala, virginala virginal, maidenly; virgeso, virgineso virginity, maidenhood.
Virgiliala Virgilian, of Virgil.

virtuala (philos., opt., mechan.) virtual, potental; virtuale virtually; virtualeso, virtualajo virtuality, potentiality; virtuala rapideso v. velocity; virtuala foko v. focus. Def.: Qua esas en potencialo, ma ne en efekto aktuala. Ex.: Armeo virtuale vinkita.
virtuoza (highly) skilled, artistic, masterly; virtuoz(ul)o virtuoso; virtuozeso virtuosity, virtuosoship: professional or consummate skill, artistic perfection, masterly style or play.
virulenta virulent; virulenteso virulence.
viruso (med.) virus; virusoza poisonous.

visar (tr., intr.) to screw in: turn in a screw; vis(ad)o screwing (of screws); visilo screw-driver; visilo ajustebla a spanner, stillson or monkey wrench. V. exp.: On visas skrubi. On skrubagas, skrubligas ulo, quale kesto, buxo, e.c.
vishar (tr.) to wipe (off), wipe dry by rubbing; (cf. sikigar); manu vishilo towel; plum ilo pen-wiper.
viskomto (title) viscount.
viskoza viscous, viscid; (cf. glutiniva); viskozeso viscosity.
vistar (tr.) to visé: to endorse, countersign; visto visé: official signature. Def.: Oficale signatar o autentikigar dokumento od akto. Ex.: La visto di konsulo sur pasporto.

vito (bot.) vine; viteyo, vitagro vineyard; vitfolio leaf of the v.; vitkultivado v. culture; (fig.) wine-growing; vitbero grape; sika vitbero raisin; vitograpo bunch of grapes; vitrekoltar to gather the vintage; vito Virginiana Virginia creeper.
vitalismo vitalism: a biological doctrine; vitalisto vitalist.
vitelo vitellus: yolk of egg; vitelala vitelline.
vitralio (fenestro)stained-glass window (as in churches). Def.: Vitro artala, kolorizita, dekoriva, qua klozas fenestro (quale en kelka kirki e laika edifici); IV-646.
vitriolo vitriol.
viulo (mus.) viol; name for instruments of violin family; bas viulo bass-viol (cf. violoncelo). Def.: Anciena formo d grosa violino de qua developesis la moderna speci di violini).

vivar (intr., tr.) to live: be living, be alive (cf. habitar, kondutar); vivo life; vivala vital (cf. esenca, nekareebla); vivanto living person; vivanta alive, living; vivoza, vivema full of life, animated, lively, vivacious; vivozeso vitality; vivemeso vivacity (cf. vivaca); vivetar, vivachar to make shift to live, live from hand to mouth; vivigar to vivify, quicken, give life to, animate (cf. anmizar); viviva, vivkapabla likely to live, capable of living; vivez! viv klamo vive! long live! hurrah, cheer; trans vivar to survive: remain alive; bonvivanto bon-vivant, high-liver; gaya vivanto lively, good-humored person; dumviva (od, vivduranta) rento life annuity. Ex.: Fishi povas vivar nur en l’aquo. Lu vivas mizerosa vivo. Lasar ulu vivar. Vivar sua vivo. Qua vivos vidos. La tempo dum qua lu vivis. Vivar quale ermito. Dum la vivo di. Vivala povo, principo. Vivozeso di forta viro. Vivemeso di pueri. La mediko dicas, ke ica infanto esas viviva. La mento vivigas la korpo. Ant.: mortar.

vivaca lively, nimble, vivacious, sprightly, brisk; vivaceso vivacity: liveliness; ta infanto esas tre vivaca that child is very lively; il vivacigas omno quon il agas he puts life into whatever he does.
vivdissekar (tr.) to vivisect: to dissect living beings.
vivipara viviparous.

vizar (tr., intr.) to aim at, to take aim (cf. intencar, tendencar, ambiciar); vizo aim: direction of the sight toward an object; vizar (vers) ucelo to aim at a bird; vizograno sight (of a gun); vizlineo line of aim.
vizajo visage: face of a person. Def.: L’avana parto di la homala kapo, konsiderata de extere ed en lua expresiveso; V-679.
vizelo (zool.) weasel (Mustela vulgaris).
viziero visor (of a helmet, a cap); okul viziero eye-shade (for the head).
viziono vision, apparition; vizionera, vizionema; vizionero, emo visionary (person). Ex.: Imaginar sua vizioni esar realaji. La vizioni di la profeti. Unesme la populo nomizis Columbus kom vizionero.
viziro vizier; granda viziro g. v.
vizitar (tr.) to visit, pay a v. to, call upon (ulu, ulo); vizitkarto visiting card; vizitfesto (rel.) visitation.

voco (also gram.) voice; (fig.) expression of opinion; voco alta, basa, klara, obskura, ruptosona high, low clear, unclear, broken v.; mi voce in an undertone; voce by word of mouth; voca voto viva voce vote; vocala vocal, verbal, oral, uttered or relating to the v.; vocokonduktilo v. conductor (cf. paroltubo); la voco publika (fig.) public opinion; la voco di koncienco (fig.) the v. of conscience; elektita per 7 voci ek 12 elected by 7 out of 12 (viva voce) votes; vocoreflektilo sounding board (as for pulpit); senvoceso loss of voice, aphonia.
vodevilo (theat.) vaudeville.

(ad)vokar (tr., intr., also fig.) to call (to) (ulu), ask to come, summons; (ad)vokeso vocation. Ex.: (Ad-)vokar la hundo per lua nomo. (Ad-)vokar la guardo. Vokar por helpo. Kun-vokar la rezervo-trupi a la militala servado. Vokar (a) Deo por helpo. Mea patrio esas en danjero, la honoro vokas. V. exp.: vid. klamar.
vocalo (gram.) vowel.
vokalizar (intr., tr., mus.) to vocalize: to sing a vowel sound without uttering words.
vokativo (gram.) vocative (case).

volar (tr.) to will: determine in the mind, to decide, resolve, exercise volition (cf. dezirar, voluntar); volo (act) will, volition; volado (faculty) the will, volition; voleto, volesko low degree of will, fancy, mind, slight degree of inclination, caprice, humor; volala willful: relating to will; volata, volita willed, willful, intended, voluntary (cf. voluntar); vole willfully; -anta: voluntary: proceeding from free-will; senvola involuntary; segunvola optional; segunvole at pleasure, at will; segunvola pafado firing at will; bon, mal volvolo good, ill will; me volas vidar il I will (am determined) to see him; me volas facar ol I mean to (will) do it; me ne volas I won’t, I do not mean to; volo neflexebla inflexible will; la reflexi esas nedependanta de la volado the reflexes are independent of the will (volition); me havas voleto refuzar I have a mind to refuse; volala(od, volanta) ago, movo voluntary act, motion; volita eroro willful error.
volatila volatile; volatileso volatility. Def.: Vaporeskema ye l’ordinara temperaturo; IV-4.
volfo, volfulo, volfino wolf; (astron.) Wolf, Lupus; volfohomo (mythol.) were-wolf.
volkano volcano; volkanala, volkanatra volcanic (stone, etc.); volkanoza volcanic: full of v.s; volkano extingita extinct v.
volontario (esp. military) volunteer.
voltar (intr.) to volt: make a sudden turn or leap aside (as in fencing); (cf. voltijar).
volto (elec.) volt.

voltijar (intr.) to vault (on a horse, on a slack rope, etc.); voltij(ad)o vaulting, leaping, tumbling; voltijanto, voltijisto leaper, vaulter, tumbler; voltijero (fig.) voltigeur: F. light-infantry soldier.
voltmetro voltmeter.
volumino (geom.) volume: space occupied; (cf. maso, tomo); voluminoza voluminous, bulky.

voluntar (tr., intr.) to be willing (to); to have no objection (to); (in polite phrases) to be so kind as, be pleased to; volunto willingness, good-will; volunta, voluntala, voluntanta voluntary, willingly; voluntez please; volunte gladly, readily, willingly. Ex.: Me voluntas facar to. Voluntez enirar, sioro. Voluntez dicar a me. Me akompanos vu tre volunte. On volunte (E. readily) kredas to quon on deziras kredar. V. exp.: Voluntez esas vicina a komplezez, degnez, ma min forta; VI-213. La tri vorti: voluntar, komplezar, degnar formacas gradaro: komplezo esas ulo plu kam volunto; degno esas komplezo o favoro di altranga persono; II-648.
volupto voluptuousness; voluptoza voluptuous (sensation, etc.); voluptema, voluptemo voluptuous (person). Def.: Granda plezuro sensala.
voluto (arch.) volute, spiral scroll.

(en)volvar (tr.) to roll up, wrap around; to coil (a rope); (enar su to wrap up oneself; (cf. spular). Ex.: (En-)volvar standardo cirkum lua shafto. Volvar kordo cirkum la korpo. (En-)volvar peco de stofo. V. exp.: vid. envelopar.
vomar(tr., intr.) to vomit, throw up, belch out (wind, gas, etc.); vomajo vomit: what is thrown up; vomigiva, vomigivo vomitive, emetic. Ex.: Vomar sango. La volkano vomas flamo.
vomero* (anat.) vomer: nostril bone.
vomiko* (med.) vomica: abscess cavity in the lungs.
vomiknuco nux-vomica, vomic-nut; vomiknuciero n. v. tree (Strychnos Nux-vomica).
vomitorio (anc. arch.) vomitory. Def.: Arkeologiala termino: enireyo ed ekireyo en la teatri ed amfi-teatri; IV-647.
vorticar (intr.) to whirl, rotate rapidly; vortico whirling, vortex; aer vortico whirlwind; aquo vortico whirlpool; vortico di aferi rush of business; polvo vortico cloud of dust.
vovar (tr., intr.) to vow, make a v. (of); vovo vow; vovajo votive offering; vovala votive. Ex.: Vovar absteno. Vovar templo a deo.
vulgato Vulgate: Latin version of the Bible.
Vulkanala (geol.) Vulcanian.
vulkanizar (tr.) to vulcanize.
vulnerario (bot.) kidney-vetch, wound-wort (Vulneraria rustica).
vulto (arch.) vault; (cf. masonita tombo, kelero); vultatra v. like, archlike; vultizar to cover with a v.; vultigar to arch; vultizita, vultigita vaulted, arched.
vulturo (orni.) vulture; (fig.) a rapacious person.
vulvo (anat.) vulva.
vundar (tr.) to wound; (cf. lezar, kontuzar, ofensar); vundo, vunduro wound(ing); vundebla (also fig.) vulnerable.
«wampum» wampum: Indian currency.
waranto (jur.) warrant; (dogan) waranto (com.) dock-warrant. Def.: (com.) Recev-atesto pri vari pozata en dogan-depozeyo; II-77.
warfo wharf, jetty; warfeto landing-stage, gang-way. V. exp.: Warfo esas nek digo, nek kayo, nam ol ne esas masiva, ma speco de eshafodo formacita ek ligna o fera trabi; II-712.
warpo (in weaving) warp; (cf. urdar).
wato (elec.) watt.
wefto* (weaving, etc.) woof.

weldar (tr.) to weld, forge together (iron, steel); weldo, welduro a weld, welding. V. exp.: La F. S. havas nur un vorto por soldar e weldar, a la I. usas ofte la sama por la du diferanta juntamieri. La soldo e la brazo esas fakte du speci di glutino di du metalspeci per konvenanta metal, qua esas en la soldo soldostano, en la brazo kupro. Pro la tre diferanta fuz-temperaturo di stano e kupro, on soldas ye cirkume 300° C. ed on brazas ye cirkume 1000° C. On povas soldar e brazar omna metali, anke du diversa. Ma on povas weldar nur tre poka de li, ex. loro, la fero (se ol ne kontenas troa karbo), e.c., e nur du peci di la sama metalo. La weldo konsistas en varmigo til komencanta fuzo e posa kunbato per marteli, de quo rezultas junturo preske tam forta kam la solida metalo; III-87.
westo west; westa, westala westerly: of or relating to the w.; weste (direction) westward, in, to the w.; ad weste (with motion) westward.
wiskio (spirit) whisky.
wisto (card game) whist.
wistitio (zool.) ouistiti,marmoset (monkey).
wolframo* (min.) wolfram: tungsten.
xantino* (chem.) xanthine.
xantofilo* (chem., bot.) xanthophyl.
xenio* satirical epigram (first introduced by Goethe and Schiller); (biol.) xenia.
xenono* (chem.) xenon.
xerofito* (bot.) xerophyte.
xifoida* (anat.) xiphoid, ensiform.
xilofaga, xilofago xylophagous (insect, bivalve). Def.: Una de la multa speci de insekti, qui rodas la ligno; IV-647.
xilofono (mus.) xylophone.
xilografar (tr., intr.) to engrave on wood or print from wood engravings.
ya indeed, most certainly, truly (used in a sentence to lend emphasis, to confirm a statement); esis ya mea kulpa it was truly my fault; me ya facis to it was I indeed who did it.
yakto yacht.
yardo (nav.) yard (for a sail), yardarm; yardo granda main y.
yatagano yataghan; long Turkish dagger.

ye preposition of indefinite meaning to be used when no other preposition covers the meaning; especially denoting position, place, precise situation, time: ye la fino di la libro at the end of the book; il prenis il ye la manuo he took him by the hand; ye ca vorti at these words; ye la dimezo at midday; ye dek metri de me at (or, within) ten meters of me.
yes yes, aye, yea. Ant.: no.
yiterbo* (min.) ytterbium.
yitro* (chem.) yttrium.
yodlar (tr., intr.) to yodel (in singing).
yolo jolly-boat; a ships boat of medium size; yawl.
yufto Russian leather.
yugo yoke; (fig.) bondage.
yuko (bot.) yucca (genus: Yucca).
zagayo assagai: S. African spear.
zebro (zool.) zebra; zebrea, zebrobunta striped like a z.
zebuo (zool.) zebu (Bos indicus).
zefiro* zephyr, gentle breeze.
zeko (ent.) tick (Ixodes).
zelar (intr.) to be zealous; zelo zeal; zelanta, zeloza zealous, sedulous; zelanto, zelozo zealot; ne zeloza lukewarm.
zenito (astron. and fig.) zenith.
zeolito (min.) zeolite.
zero (temperature) zero; (arith.) cipher, nought; super, sub zero above, below z.
zesto the woody skin quartering the kernel of a walnut.
zezear (intr.) to lisp. Def.: Pronunciar j quale z e sh quale s; IV-647.
zibelino (fur, animal) sable.
zigomato (anat.) zygoma: cheek bone.
zigomorfa* (bot., zool.) zygomorphic.
zigosporo* zygospore.
zigoto* (bot.) zygote.
zigzagar (intr.) to zigzag.
zimazo* (chem.) zymase.
zimologio zymology.
zimosimetro zymosimeter.
zimotekniko zymotechnics: technology of ferments.
zinko zinc; zinka (made of) z.; zinklaboristo z. worker; zinkizar to cover with z.
zinkografio zincography.
zirkono* (min.) zircon.
zodiako zodiac; zodiakosigno sign of z.
zoofito (zool.) zoöphyte.
zoografio zoögraphy.
zoologio zoology; zoologiisto zoölogist.
zoospermo* (biol.) zoösperm.
zoosporo* (bot., zool.) zoöspore.
zuavo (soldier) zouave.
zumar (intr.) to buzz (as flying insects), to drone: make a humming or buzzing noise.
